The paper also highlights the potential roles of technologies like single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and artificial intelligence in advancing diagnosis, prognosis, and treatment.

title: Limitations of cell embedding metrics assessed using drifting islands.
main_goals: The paper aims to demonstrate limitations of current cell embedding metrics, introduce a new embedding method (Islander) that performs well on existing metrics but distorts biological structures, and present a new metric (scGraph) to detect such distortions.

title: Spatial organization, chromatin accessibility and gene-regulatory programs defining mouse sensory neurons.
main_goals: Present an integrated atlas of mouse sensory neurons using scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics (MERSCOPE), and chromatin accessibility data. Confirm cell types and spatial organization. Elucidate gene regulatory programs defining sensory neuron diversity.

title: Triggering Mechanisms of Hepatocyte Repopulation during liver Regeneration.
main_goals: This review summarizes current findings on the cellular and molecular mechanisms triggering hepatocyte repopulation during liver regeneration, focusing on the origins of new hepatocytes and contributing signaling pathways. It discusses techniques like lineage tracing and spatial transcriptomics used in the field.

title: Cell states and neighborhoods in distinct clinical stages of primary and metastatic esophageal adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: To decipher EAC disease progression and therapeutic response through multiomic analysis including snRNA-seq, chromatin accessibility sequencing, and spatial profiling of primary and metastatic tumors. Identify malignant cell states, their epigenetic plasticity, regulons, and spatial interactions with microenvironmental cell types to understand EAC heterogeneity and progression. Validate findings using external datasets.

title: Multivariate and Machine Learning-Derived Virtual Staining and Biochemical Quantification of Cancer Cells through Raman Hyperspectral Imaging.
biological_context: Cancer cells / different cancer cell lines
main_goals: Develop a novel algorithm using Raman hyperspectral imaging, multivariate analysis (PCA, MCR-ALS), and machine learning (ANN) for label-free virtual staining, biochemical quantification (collagen, lipids, glycogen, nucleic acids), and classification of cancer cells with high accuracy. The aim is to enable detailed visualization and understanding of molecular variations and tumor heterogeneity.

title: SOAR elucidates biological insights and empowers drug discovery through spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment, Ulcerative colitis, various tissues and species
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Introduce SOAR, a comprehensive spatial transcriptomics platform with curated data across diverse species, tissues, and technologies. Use SOAR to facilitate biological discovery, including immune cell polarity insights, and empower drug discovery by identifying potential therapeutic targets.

title: Identification and Mapping of Human Lymph Node Stromal Cell Subsets by Combining Single-Cell RNA Sequencing with Spatial Transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To identify and characterize human lymph node stromal cell (LNSC) subtypes using scRNA-seq, validate these subtypes across multiple donors, and map their spatial locations within the lymph node using spatial transcriptomics integration to understand their potential interactions with lymphocytes.

title: Polyamine Metabolism in Optic Nerve: Spatial Metabolomics with AP/MALDI Mass Spectrometry Imaging.
biological_context: Mouse optic nerve, polyamine metabolism, ocular neurodegenerative disorders
main_goals: To provide a detailed protocol for spatial metabolomics and lipidomics imaging of polyamine pathway-related metabolites and lipids in mouse optic nerve using atmospheric pressure MALDI-MSI.

title: Application of a Multiomics Imaging Workflow to Explore Asparlas Treatment in Solid Tumors.
main_goals: This study introduces a multiomics imaging workflow applicable to solid tumor specimens for comprehensive molecular profiling. It integrates MALDI-MSI, LC-MS, and histology on consecutive sections to detect metabolites, lipids, and proteins. The workflow aims to characterize tumors, assess metabolic alterations, and map protein distribution to explore the effects of treatments like Asparlas.

title: Novel GABAAR antagonists target networked gene hubs at the leading-edge in high-grade gliomas.
biological_context: High-grade gliomas (HGG), Diffuse midline glioma (DMG), Glioblastoma
main_goals: Identify networked ion channel gene hubs in high-grade gliomas using WGCNA. Validate the expression and location of key hubs using scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics, and IHC. Test the efficacy of drugs targeting identified hubs on tumor growth and invasion.

title: The human placenta and its role in reproductive outcomes revisited.
biological_context: Human placenta, pregnancy, fetal growth restriction, preeclampsia
main_goals: To review the current understanding of human placental function and dysfunction, discuss limitations of current assessment methods and animal models, and highlight promising future research directions including omics methods, spatial omics, and human cell models for improving diagnosis and therapy of placentally-related complications.

title: Pollination niche shifts in sympatric globular cacti Eriosyce: Consequences on reproductive isolation and species formation.
data_modalities_used: ['Pollination niche analysis', 'pollinator color perception studies', 'reproductive output assessments', 'molecular phylogenetics', 'gene flow analyses', 'species distribution modeling']
main_goals: Investigate pollination niche shifts among four sympatric Eriosyce cacti using a comprehensive approach including pollination ecology, genetics, and modeling. Reveal a pollination niche displacement in E. chilensis leading to reproductive isolation from its sister species and convergence towards a co-occurring species, highlighting the role of pollinators in speciation.

title: Filtering for Highly Variable Genes and High-Quality Spots Improves Phylogenetic Analysis of Cancer Spatial Transcriptomics Visium Data.
main_goals: Explore data preprocessing and modeling approaches for phylogenetic analysis of Visium spatial transcriptomics data. Conclude that using highly variable genes and accounting for heterogeneous RNA capture improves reconstructed topological relationships and estimated branch lengths.

title: spaMGCN: a graph convolutional network with autoencoder for spatial domain identification using multi-scale adaptation.
biological_context: Mouse spleen, Human lymph node, Discrete tissue distributions, Capsule structures
main_goals: Present spaMGCN, a graph convolutional network with autoencoder, for spatial domain identification, particularly in discrete tissue distributions. Integrate spatial transcriptomics and epigenomics data. Demonstrate its effectiveness on mouse spleen and human lymph node data, including identifying discrete T cell zones, follicular cells, and capsule structures.

title: Tumor-specific MHC-II guides anthracycline exemption and immunotherapy benefit in breast cancer.
biological_context: Breast cancer (early-stage triple-negative breast cancer, HER2+ breast cancer)
main_goals: To identify and validate tumor-specific MHC-II (tsMHC-II) as a biomarker in early-stage breast cancer (TNBC and HER2+). The study investigates its role in predicting benefit from anthracycline exemption and response to immunotherapy, using multi-cohort spatial-omics and clinical data. It also explores the underlying epigenetic mechanisms.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Unveils the Blueprint of Mammalian Lung Development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: To create a comprehensive spatial transcriptomic atlas of mouse lung development, uncover spatial TF regulation and cell-cell communication networks by integrating spatial epigenome, and delineate alveolar cell trajectories to understand the cellular and molecular orchestration of lung development.

title: Validation of single-cell transcriptomic profiles from Illumina and MGI Tech sequencing platforms.
main_goals: Validate the performance of MGI Tech sequencing platform for single-cell RNA-seq compared to Illumina. Assess their accuracy, sensitivity, reproducibility, and impact on downstream analyses like clustering and gene expression using human cancer samples. Conclude that MGI Tech delivers similar transcriptomic profiles and can be confidently used.

title: A reflux linked GATA factor fulcrum dictates lineage commitment through GPRC5B during the esophageal dysplastic transition.
biological_context: Esophageal adenocarcinomas (EAC), Barrett's esophagus (BE) metaplasia-dysplasia transition, High-grade dysplasia (HGD), Gastro-esophageal reflux disease (GERD)
main_goals: This study investigates the role of GATA factors (GATA4, GATA6, TRPS1) in lineage commitment during the Barrett's esophagus to esophageal adenocarcinoma transition. It identifies a GATA 'fulcrum' mechanism and highlights GPRC5B as a key target influencing this progression, potentially serving as a functional marker and driver.

title: Tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and progression mechanisms in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma: A study based on single-cell and spatial transcriptomic sequencing.
main_goals: To investigate tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and progression mechanisms in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify markers and mechanisms related to ICC invasion and lymphatic metastasis, and explore potential therapeutic targets.

title: Decreasing protein biotinylation background in a diatom facilitates proximity labeling of the periplastidial compartment proteome.
biological_context: Diatoms, particularly the periplastidial compartment (PPC) and plastids in Phaeodactylum tricornutum
main_goals: This paper identifies and characterizes the high biotinylation background hindering proximity labeling in diatoms. It describes using a biob mutant to reduce this background, significantly improving TurboID-based proximity labeling for spatial proteomics. The improved method is applied to characterize the proteome of the periplastidial compartment (PPC) in diatoms.

title: Integrative Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveal Functional and Spatial Heterogeneity of Atrial and Ventricular Cardiomyocytes in the Heart.
biological_context: Atrial and Ventricular Cardiomyocytes in the Heart
covered_analysis_steps: ['Normalization', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study integrates scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate the spatial distribution and intercellular communication of atrial and ventricular cardiomyocyte subtypes in the heart. It aims to reveal their distinct roles in energy metabolism, pump function, and regulatory functions within their anatomical context. The ultimate goal is to enhance the understanding of cardiac function complexity and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: DeepD&Cchl: an AI tool for automated 3D single-cell chloroplast detection, counting, and cell type clustering.
main_goals: Develop an AI tool (DeepD&Cchl) for automated 3D single-cell chloroplast detection and counting. Integrate it with single-cell segmentation (Cellpose) for single-cell analysis. Enable cell-type clustering based on chloroplast number and cell size.

title: Current cutting-edge omics techniques on musculoskeletal tissues and diseases.
biological_context: Musculoskeletal tissues and diseases (osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoporosis, bone fracture, intervertebral disc degeneration, tendinopathy, myopathy)
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of cutting-edge omics technologies, particularly single-cell and spatial omics, as applied to musculoskeletal research. It discusses their potential to revolutionize understanding of disease mechanisms and identify therapeutic targets by resolving cellular heterogeneity and spatial organization. It also highlights challenges for clinical translation.

title: Single-cell transcriptome sequencing reveals new epithelial-stromal associated mesenchymal-like subsets in recurrent gliomas.
main_goals: To explore transcriptional and regulatory mechanisms driving glioma recurrence, focusing on mesenchymal-like subpopulations using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify novel MES-like subpopulations, characterize their association with prognosis and invasiveness, and identify key regulators like EGR1 and SERPINE1.

title: Integrating spatial and single-cell transcriptomics to characterize mouse long bone fracture healing process.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Cell Type Identification', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: To characterize the cellular and molecular processes involved in mouse long bone fracture healing using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to localize cell populations, identify key regulatory factors, and explore cell-cell interactions in a spatially resolved manner.

title: An EEG-based imagined speech recognition using CSP-TP feature fusion for enhanced BCI communication.
biological_context: Human brain activity for Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) communication in individuals with severe communication limitations
main_goals: Propose an EEG-based imagined speech recognition model using CSP-TP feature fusion for BCI communication. Enhance classification accuracy by capturing spatial and temporal dynamics. Demonstrate effectiveness through classification performance on collected data.

title: Spatial and genomic profiling of residual breast cancer after neoadjuvant chemotherapy unveil divergent fates for each breast cancer subtype.
main_goals: Investigate mechanisms underlying divergent fates of breast cancers with high residual cancer burden across subtypes after neoadjuvant chemotherapy using single-cell spatial transcriptomics and genomic profiling. The study aims to unveil distinct genomic and microenvironmental strategies governing BC subtype-specific outcomes.

title: sepal: identifying transcript profiles with spatial patterns by diffusion-based modeling.
main_goals: Introduce a novel diffusion-based method and software package (sepal) for identifying genes with spatial patterns in spatial transcriptomics data. Validate the method using synthetic and real datasets and provide an open-source implementation.

title: IMC-Denoise: a content aware denoising pipeline to enhance Imaging Mass Cytometry.
biological_context: Human bone marrow (healthy and diseased), patient tissue specimens from multiple pathologies
main_goals: Develop an automated content-aware pipeline, IMC-Denoise, to restore Imaging Mass Cytometry images by removing hot pixels (using DIMR algorithm) and shot noise (using DeepSNiF algorithm). The goal is to improve image quality and enhance downstream cell-scale analysis in complex tissue microenvironments.

title: MCMICRO: a scalable, modular image-processing pipeline for multiplexed tissue imaging.
main_goals: Introduce MCMICRO, a scalable, modular, open-source computational pipeline for processing highly multiplexed tissue images. The pipeline transforms whole-slide images into single-cell data, addressing challenges in reproducible analysis across multiple imaging platforms.

title: Statistical analysis of spatial expression patterns for spatially resolved transcriptomic studies.
main_goals: This paper presents SPARK, a statistical method for identifying spatial expression patterns of genes in spatially resolved transcriptomic data. SPARK models spatial count data using generalized linear spatial models and employs efficient statistical formulas for hypothesis testing. It aims to provide effective control of Type I errors, high statistical power, and scalability for large datasets.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics in Thyroid Cancer: Applications, Limitations, and Future Perspectives.
main_goals: This paper synthesizes recent applications of spatial transcriptomics in thyroid cancer research, focusing on tumor microenvironment heterogeneity, evolution, and cellular interactions. It discusses limitations and suggests future directions for advancing personalized treatment. The review highlights how spatial context aids in mapping cell types, expression patterns, invasion, metastasis, and signaling pathways.

title: Ectopic expression of GDF15 in cancer-associated fibroblasts enhances melanoma immunosuppression via the GFRAL/RET cascade.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'western blotting', 'quantitative real-time PCR', 'ELISA', 'co-immunoprecipitation', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation', 'luciferase gene reporter assays', 'lentiviral transfection', 'cell co-culture experiments', 'recombinant protein rescue experiments', 'flow cytometry', 'knockout mice', 'Cre-loxP system mice']
main_goals: This study characterizes the role of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in the melanoma immune microenvironment. It identifies a unique group of CAFs expressing high GDF15, which enhances melanoma immunosuppression via the GFRAL/RET cascade, leading to increased tumor cell stemness and immunosuppressive macrophage polarization. The findings offer new targets for melanoma immunotherapy.

title: CellBinDB: a large-scale multimodal annotated dataset for cell segmentation with benchmarking of universal models.
biological_context: Human and mouse tissues (various normal and diseased)
data_modalities_used: ["4',6-diamidino-2-phenylindole staining", 'single-stranded DNA staining', 'hematoxylin and eosin staining', 'multiplex immunofluorescence staining', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper introduces CellBinDB, a large-scale multimodal annotated dataset for cell segmentation. It aims to facilitate the training of universal cell segmentation models and evaluate various segmentation techniques. The study also benchmarks state-of-the-art methods and provides insights into factors affecting segmentation accuracy.

title: Deciphering the Regulatory Networks of the Migrasome-Associated Cell Subpopulation in Heterotopic Ossification via Multi-Omics Analysis.
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate key biomolecular networks involved in heterotopic ossification (HO) through a comprehensive multi-omics analysis. It identified mesenchymal lineage cells (MLin) as a key migrasome-associated subtype and peptidylprolyl isomerase B (Ppib) and transgelin (Tagln) as key molecules, constructing their regulatory network and spatial distribution. The findings aim to facilitate the discovery of novel biomarkers for HO.

title: Integrated transcriptomics and machine learning reveal REN as a dual regulator of tumor stemness and NK cell evasion in Wilms tumor progression.
main_goals: This study integrates transcriptomics and machine learning to identify REN as a key regulator in Wilms tumor. It investigates REN's dual role in promoting tumor stemness and facilitating NK cell evasion, aiming to uncover therapeutic strategies for high-risk WT cases.

title: Application and progress of proximity labeling technology in the study of protein-protein interactions.
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of the principles, classifications, and applications of proximity labeling technology for studying protein-protein interactions and subcellular compartment proteomics. It aims to offer researchers insights into this methodology and promote its broader application.

title: A Robust Residual Three-dimensional Convolutional Neural Networks Model for Prediction of Amyloid-β Positivity by Using FDG-PET.
main_goals: To leverage deep learning with residual 3D convolutional neural networks (3DCNN) to develop a robust model that predicts amyloid-β positivity by using FDG-PET. The model demonstrated the ability to learn complex 3D spatial patterns and robustly predict amyloid-β positivity with less reliance on site harmonization.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analyses reveal MAZ(+) NPC-like clusters as key role contributing to glioma recurrence and drug resistance.
main_goals: This study investigates the heterogeneity of gliomas associated with Temozolomide (TMZ) resistance using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies MAZ(+) NPC-like clusters as key contributors to glioma recurrence and drug resistance by enhancing stemness and DNA repair capacity, and proposes a combination therapy strategy.

title: An Efficient Organoid Cutting Method for Long-Term Culture and High-Throughput Analyses.
biological_context: Human organoid culture for developmental studies, disease modeling, and personalized medicine research.
main_goals: This study introduces an efficient organoid cutting method using 3D printed jigs to improve long-term organoid culture viability and enable high-throughput analyses. The method enhances nutrient diffusion and cell proliferation, and mold-based approaches facilitate the creation of organoid arrays for applications like single-cell spatial transcriptomics.

title: Advances in single-cell omics: Transformative applications in basic and clinical research.
biological_context: Cancer research and developmental biology, neurodevelopmental disorders
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To review the application of single-cell omics in diverse fields, including cancer research and developmental biology. It showcases how these technologies reveal insights into cellular interactions, disease mechanisms, and therapeutic responses, particularly in heterogeneous diseases. The review also emphasizes the integration of single-cell data with computational models.

title: Development of a circadian-related prognostic signature highlights RBM17 as a stemness regulator in liver cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the molecular underpinnings of how circadian dysregulation influences liver cancer progression. It develops a prognostic signature (Circadian Prognosis Scores - CPS) based on dysregulated liver circadian genes (LCGs) and identifies RBM17 as a key regulator promoting cancer stem cell phenotype and cisplatin resistance. The findings propose novel therapeutic targets for liver cancer.

title: Sparse deconvolution of cell type medleys in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces WISpR, a machine learning algorithm for sparse deconvolution of cell types in spatial transcriptomics. It aims to accurately predict cell-type distributions while preserving biological coherence, even in unmatched datasets, by integrating spot-specific hyperparameters and sparsity-driven modeling. Benchmarking demonstrates WISpR's superior performance and its utility for decoding tissue organization in both healthy and diseased states.

title: Robust self-supervised machine learning for single cell embeddings and annotations.
biological_context: single cell genomics, spatial transcriptomics, Perturb-seq
main_goals: Develop DR-GEM, a self-supervised meta-algorithm that addresses overfitting and technical noise in single-cell data analysis. DR-GEM improves embedding reliability, rare cell type recovery, noise filtering, and biological discovery by combining robust optimization and balanced consensus learning.

title: Prehabilitation during neoadjuvant chemotherapy results in an enhanced immune response in esophageal adenocarcinoma tumors: A randomized controlled trial.
data_modalities_used: ['formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tumors', 'multispectral immunohistochemistry', 'NanoString spatial transcriptomics', 'peak oxygen uptake (V̇O₂peak)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To determine whether prehabilitation exercise training during neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NAC) increases tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) in patients with locally advanced esophageal cancer. The study aimed to assess the impact of prehabilitation on tumor-immune responses and correlate changes in fitness with these immune markers.

title: Integration of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics by SEU-TCA reveals the spatial origin of early cardiac progenitors.
biological_context: mouse gastrulation and early cardiac progenitor development
main_goals: The paper introduces SEU-TCA, a novel method leveraging transfer component analysis to enhance single-cell spatial mapping accuracy. It demonstrates superior performance in spatial deconvolution and cell mapping across multiple datasets. The study applies SEU-TCA to reveal spatial gene expression and identify anterior second heart field progenitors regulated by Irx1 during mouse gastrulation.

title: Distinct molecular patterns in R6/2 HD mouse brain: Insights from spatiotemporal transcriptomics.
main_goals: To investigate distinct molecular patterns in the R6/2 HD mouse brain using spatiotemporal transcriptomics, integrating Visium and snRNA-seq. The study aimed to identify regional, temporal, and cell-type-specific regulatory pathways that contribute to Huntington's disease progression, observing synaptic dysfunction, early Tcf4 dysregulation, mitochondrial deficits, and neuropeptide Y signaling changes.

title: Spotiflow: accurate and efficient spot detection for fluorescence microscopy with deep stereographic flow regression.
main_goals: Spotiflow is a deep learning method for accurate and efficient spot detection in fluorescence microscopy images. It formulates spot detection as a multiscale heatmap and stereographic flow regression problem, supporting 2D and 3D images and generalizing across imaging conditions. The method aims to improve accuracy and efficiency compared to existing techniques.

title: CellNEST reveals cell-cell relay networks using attention mechanisms on spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human lymph nodes, lung adenocarcinoma, colorectal cancer, pancreatic cancer
main_goals: CellNEST is developed to decipher patterns of cell-cell communication using attention mechanisms on spatial transcriptomics. It introduces a new type of relay-network communication detection, identifying putative ligand-receptor-ligand-receptor communication. The tool also provides an interactive visualization method for exploring in situ communication.

title: SpotSweeper: spatially aware quality control for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Introduces SpotSweeper, a spatially aware quality control method for spatial transcriptomics. It leverages local neighborhoods to correct for spatial confounding and identify local outliers and regional artifacts unique to SRT. SpotSweeper aims to ensure data reliability across diverse experimental conditions and technologies.

title: SPaSE: Spatially resolved pathology scores using optimal transport on spatial transcriptomics data.
biological_context: Post-myocardial infarction (MI) mouse hearts, human post-MI data, traumatic brain injury, Duchenne muscular dystrophy mouse models
main_goals: Introduce SPaSE, an optimal transport-based algorithm to compute spatially resolved pathology scores for spatial transcriptomics data. SPaSE quantifies pathological impact at each spot, enabling delineation of disease zones and identification of signatures predictive of pathological severity. The method has been validated on mouse and human post-MI data, as well as data from traumatic brain injury and Duchenne muscular dystrophy models.

title: SpaLinker identifies phenotype-associated spatial tumor microenvironment features by integrating bulk and spatial sequencing data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: SpaLinker is introduced as an integrated framework to decipher spatially resolved TMEs at molecular, cellular, and tissue structure levels. It assesses the prognostic significance of spatially defined features by integrating bulk RNA sequencing data. The tool aims to identify phenotype-associated spatial TME features, enhancing the clinical utility of spatial sequencing technology.

title: Neurodegeneration Promotes Tumorigenesis in Colorectal Cancer: Insights From Single-Cell and Spatial Multiomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell communication analysis', 'Trajectory analysis', 'Spatial dependencies analysis', 'Cell neighborhood network analysis', 'Prognostic modeling']
main_goals: To investigate the role of neurodegeneration in colorectal cancer (CRC) progression. The study aims to understand the mechanisms by which neurodegeneration disrupts ENS function and facilitates tumor growth using multiomics data. The findings highlight the potential of targeting neurodegeneration in CRC treatment.

title: RBPseg: Toward a complete phage tail fiber structure atlas.
main_goals: This paper introduces RBPseg, a method for modeling complete phage tail fiber structures. It combines monomeric ESMFold predictions with structural domain identification to segment tail fiber sequences for high-confidence modeling with AlphaFold2-multimer. The method's utility is demonstrated by generating models for 67 fibers, revealing insights into their modularity and evolution.

title: Widespread and cell-type-specific transcriptomic reorganization following mild traumatic brain injury.
biological_context: Mild traumatic brain injury in mice
main_goals: This study aims to understand how mild traumatic brain injury (TBI) alters the brain by employing spatial transcriptomics in a murine closed-head impact model. It identifies generalizable TBI signatures and specific regional and cell-type dysregulations, highlighting the complexity of TBI at a molecular level.

title: MSI-Explorer: Napari-Powered Tool for Mass Spectrometry Imaging Data Analysis.
main_goals: The paper introduces MSI-Explorer, a napari plugin designed to address the lack of comprehensive open-source tools for Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) data analysis. It provides an interactive interface for MSI data processing, spectral analysis, molecular annotation, and quantification, integrating napari's visualization capabilities with MSI-specific functionalities.

title: stGuide advances label transfer in spatial transcriptomics through attention-based supervised graph representation learning.
biological_context: human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and breast cancer
main_goals: This paper presents stGuide, an attention-based supervised graph learning model for label transfer in spatial transcriptomics. It addresses challenges like batch effects and tissue heterogeneity by mapping query slices into a shared embedding space using attention. The model aims to effectively transfer spot-level labels from reference to query datasets and uncover relationships between clusters.

title: Patient-Derived Three-Dimensional Lung Tumor Models to Evaluate Response to Immunotherapy.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) immunotherapy response
data_modalities_used: ['patient-derived three-dimensional lung tumor model', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: The paper reports the development of a novel ex vivo patient-derived three-dimensional lung tumor model (3D-LTM) to evaluate rapid response to immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICI). The model recapitulates NSCLC immunotherapy response heterogeneity and identifies signatures for predicting early response. It aims to facilitate rapid testing of novel immunotherapies and biomarker development.

title: A Multimodal Spatial and Epigenomic Atlas of Human Adult Lung Topography.
main_goals: To present an integrated multimodal single-nucleus human lung atlas (snHLA) profiling 746,047 nuclei from 49 mapped lung blocks. The atlas aims to resolve molecularly distinct populations and capture accessible chromatin regions to nominate new transcriptional regulators. It serves as a foundational resource for interrogating lung pathophysiology origins.

title: Spatial transcriptomics from pancreas and local draining lymph node tissue reveals a lymphotoxin-β signature in human type 1 diabetes.
biological_context: Human type 1 diabetes (T1D) pathogenesis, specifically in pancreatic tissue and associated lymph nodes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to explore the inflammatory response in human type 1 diabetes (T1D) pancreata and draining lymph nodes. It aimed to identify transcriptional alterations across tissues and cellular scales, highlighting specific gene signatures like lymphotoxin-beta in the lymph node and inflammation-associated genes in the pancreas. The findings aim to inform future therapeutic interventions for T1D.

title: Study on Liver Sinusoidal Endothelial Cell Fenestrations Based on Cellular Omics-Structure Integration Technology and Its Application in Metabolic Diseases.
biological_context: Liver sinusoidal endothelial cells, metabolic diseases (NASH, diabetes)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper introduces the Cellular Omics-Structural Integration (COSI) technology platform, which integrates single-cell transcriptomics and super-resolution microscopy (including electron microscopy with deep learning enhancement) to simultaneously acquire gene expression profiles and high-resolution cellular structural information. The platform allows for the analysis of ultrastructural information and gene transcription data at the single-cell level, enabling the identification of genes associated with fenestration formation in liver sinusoidal endothelial cells. The study demonstrates its application in assessing disease status and drug intervention efficacy in metabolic diseases.

title: Oncogenic drivers shape the tumor microenvironment in human gliomas.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-genome sequencing', 'chromatin conformation capture (Hi-C)', 'RNA-seq', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics (Xenium)', 'histology images']
main_goals: To investigate how genomic alterations in gliomas influence the tumor microenvironment. The study aims to understand the impact of IDH mutations and EGFR amplification (ecDNA vs. linear gains) on tumor architecture and cellular composition, revealing subtype-specific cellular ecosystems.

title: Comparison of QuPath and HALO platforms for analysis of the tumor microenvironment in prostate cancer.
main_goals: This study directly compares the performance of QuPath and HALO for analyzing the tumor microenvironment in prostate cancer using multiplex immunofluorescence. It evaluates their capabilities in immune cell phenotyping, tumor infiltration analysis, and nearest neighbor analysis, and highlights QuPath's integration with CytoMap for unsupervised clustering. The findings validate QuPath as a robust and reproducible alternative to commercial platforms.

title: Site-Specific Immune and Stromal Architecture Drive Resistance to Trastuzumab Deruxtecan in HER2+ Metastatic Breast Cancer.
main_goals: To investigate mechanisms of resistance to Trastuzumab deruxtecan (T-DXd) in HER2+ metastatic breast cancer by analyzing spatial proteomic profiles of metastatic lesions. The study aimed to identify differences in immune and stromal architecture between responders and non-responders, linking spatial immune exclusion and immune suppression to resistance.

title: Multi-omics analyses reveal interactions between GREM1+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in gastric cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry staining']
main_goals: This study integrates multi-omics data (bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics) to analyze the gastric cancer microenvironment. It identifies GREM1+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages as key interacting cell types involved in immunosuppression and tumor progression, suggesting them as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Multi-omic spatial profiling reveals the unique SARS-CoV-2 lung microenvironment and collagen VI as a predictive biomarker in severe COVID-19.
data_modalities_used: ['Quantseq Bulk RNA sequencing', 'Nanostring GeoMX spatial transcriptomics', 'RNAscope', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'immunohistochemistry', 'ELISA']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To understand the pathogenic role of microenvironmental interactions and the extracellular matrix in post-mortem COVID-19 lung using an integrative multi-omic approach. The study identified an immunosuppressive virus microenvironment and highlighted collagen VI as a potential predictive biomarker for severe COVID-19.

title: Integrating morphology, ecology, and genomics: Unraveling the population genetic and evolution within the Rosa graciliflora complex.
biological_context: Rosa graciliflora complex (including R. tibetica and R. tsinlingensis)
main_goals: To investigate the population genetic and evolutionary history of the Rosa graciliflora complex by integrating morphological, ecological, and genomic approaches. The study aimed to resolve taxonomic ambiguities and understand the drivers of genetic differentiation and gene flow.

title: ScInfeR: an efficient method for annotating cell types and sub-types in single-cell RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, and spatial omics.
main_goals: ScInfeR is a graph-based method for annotating cell types and sub-types in single-cell RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, and spatial omics data. It integrates scRNA-seq references and marker sets, utilizing chromatin accessibility for scATAC-seq and spatial coordinates for spatial omics. The tool aims to provide accurate and robust cell-type annotation across diverse datasets.

title: Multi-omics exploration of CAV1<sup>+</sup> tumor epithelial subcelltype in oral squamous cell carcinoma and its impact on the immune microenvironment.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC-GB) originating from gingiva and buccal mucosa
main_goals: To reveal the characteristics of tumor epithelial cell subcelltypes and their roles in tumor progression in OSCC. The study focused on identifying specific transcription factors and analyzing their effects on cell status and function, as well as investigating interactions between a high malignancy subcelltype and immune cells.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling of Penile Squamous Cell Carcinoma Reveals Dynamics of Tumor Differentiation and Immune Microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the development trajectories and tumor microenvironment of penile squamous cell carcinoma (PSCC). It reveals PSCC cell differentiation dynamics, identifies a spatial subtype with stemness and invasiveness features, and characterizes the immune landscape, particularly in HPV-positive tumors. The findings suggest therapeutic targets like laminin-integrin interaction and immunotherapy for PSCC.

title: DiffCoRank: A Comprehensive Framework for Discovering Hub Genes and Differential Gene Co-expression in Brain Implant-Associated Tissue Responses.
covered_analysis_steps: ['RNA-Seq data preprocessing', 'gene filtering', 'correlation-based module identification', 'network analysis', 'differential coexpression analysis', 'clustering', 'hub gene ranking']
main_goals: The paper introduces DiffCoRank, an integrated framework to improve differential coexpression analysis for discovering hub genes and gene co-expression modules in brain implant-associated tissue responses. It employs novel techniques like FDR-based selection of strongly connected genes and a hybrid UMAP-DBSCAN clustering approach, along with a multicriteria hub gene ranking system. The method successfully identified important gene modules and showed superior performance compared to existing frameworks.

title: Exploring the landscape of Parkinson's disease transcriptomics: a quantitative review of research progress and future directions.
main_goals: This study provides a bibliometric analysis of Parkinson's disease transcriptomics research from 2011 to 2025. It highlights research progress, identifies key countries, institutions, and journals, and discusses current hotspots like neuroinflammation and biomarker discovery. The paper also points out challenges such as data heterogeneity and suggests future directions like multi-omics integration and linking transcriptomic signatures to clinical outcomes.

title: Comprehensive analysis of multi-omics single-cell data using the single-cell analyst.
data_modalities_used: ['scRNA-sequencing', 'scATAC-seq sequencing', 'scImmune profiling', 'single-cell copy number variation', 'cytometry by time-of-flight', 'flow cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To present single-cell analyst, a user-friendly, web-based platform for comprehensive multi-omics single-cell data analysis. It aims to democratize complex multi-omics analysis for researchers with varying computational expertise by automating critical steps and providing interactive visualizations. The platform supports various data types and offers both online and offline modes.

title: A multi-centered prospective birth cohort study in Western China.
biological_context: Maternal and child health in Western China
data_modalities_used: ['peripheral blood', 'cord blood', 'dried blood spots', 'placenta', 'umbilical cord', 'decidua', 'saliva', 'feces', 'throat swabs', 'nasal swabs', 'vaginal swabs', 'breast milk', 'genomics', 'proteomics', 'exosome profiling', 'metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'culturome', 'metagenomics', 'virosome analysis', 'medical records', 'questionnaires']
main_goals: The Western China Birth Cohort (WCBC) is a large-scale, multi-centered, prospective birth cohort study designed to address critical gaps in maternal and child health research in Western China. It has enrolled 15,093 pregnant women and collected extensive medical, questionnaire, and biological data, including various multi-omics measurements. WCBC aims to explore gene-environment interplay, early-life determinants of health, and long-term disease risks in diverse populations.

title: Metabolic reprogramming and therapeutic targeting in non-small cell lung cancer: emerging insights beyond the Warburg effect.
main_goals: This review delves into the latest discoveries in NSCLC metabolism, emphasizing novel pathways and mechanisms that contribute to tumor growth and survival. It critically assesses the interplay between cancer cell metabolism and the TME, explores the impact of metabolic heterogeneity, and discusses how metabolic adaptations confer therapeutic resistance. The paper identifies potential metabolic vulnerabilities in NSCLC and proposes innovative therapeutic strategies.

title: Multi-omics characterization of oncosis in spinal cord injury.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transmission electron microscopy', 'qRT-PCR', 'immunofluorescence']
main_goals: To provide the first spatiotemporal mapping of oncotic gene regulation following spinal cord injury (SCI) and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study characterizes the expression dynamics and cellular localization of oncosis-related genes in an SCI model.

title: Cell-specific protein expression in Alzheimer's disease prefrontal cortex.
main_goals: To analyze cell-specific protein expression in the prefrontal cortex of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and non-AD brains using the GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler (DSP) platform. The study aimed to identify proteins differentially expressed in specific cell types (neurons, astrocytes, microglia) and provide insights into AD pathophysiology.

title: Analyzing the potential targets and mechanism of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) on breast cancer by integrating network toxicology, single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and molecular simulation.
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanisms through which PFAS contribute to breast cancer development. The study integrated network toxicology, single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and molecular simulation to identify core genes involved in PFAS-induced breast cancer. The findings provide insights into how PFAS may promote breast cancer progression.

title: Local inflammation at the salmon louse (Lepeophtheirus salmonis) attachment site contributes to copepodid rejection in coho salmon (Oncorhynchus kisutch).
biological_context: Salmon louse attachment and host immune response in coho salmon and Atlantic salmon.
main_goals: This study investigates the susceptibility of different salmon species to salmon lice and characterizes the cellular response at the louse attachment site. It compares the morphology of scaly skin and the cellular response in coho salmon versus Atlantic salmon using histological, proteomic, and spatial transcriptomic analyses. The findings suggest that coho salmon mount a rapid inflammatory response against salmon lice.

title: PML1-Mediated Feedforward Loop Through PI3K and MAPK Axes Drives Endocrine Resistance.
biological_context: Estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer endocrine resistance
main_goals: This study identifies PML1 as a key therapeutic target to overcome endocrine resistance in ER+ breast cancer. It reveals a PML1-mediated feedforward loop involving PI3K and MAPK signaling that drives resistance. The study also demonstrates that arsenic trioxide can disrupt this loop, offering a potential treatment strategy.

title: Molecular pathology of acute spinal cord injury in middle-aged mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular pathology of acute spinal cord injury in middle-aged mice by comparing them to young mice. It aims to identify age-related differences in behavioral, histopathological, and transcriptional outcomes. The findings suggest that while gross recovery and histopathology are similar, age-related changes in cell subpopulations may impact repair mechanisms.

title: Cell shapes decode molecular phenotypes in image-based spatial proteomics.
biological_context: Human cell lines, general cellular processes
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study develops a framework to analyze the relationship between cell shape and molecular phenotypes using image-based spatial proteomics data. It leverages a large dataset of single cells to explore how cell and nuclear shapes correlate with organelle, pathway, and protein levels, and how these relationships can be used to understand biological processes and drug perturbations.

title: Atlas-scale metabolic activities inferred from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human organs and endometrium during the menstrual cycle, endometriosis, and endometrial carcinoma
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human transcriptomic data', 'mouse transcriptomic data']
main_goals: The paper presents scCellFie, a computational framework to infer metabolic activities from human and mouse transcriptomic data at single-cell and spatial resolutions. It was applied to approximately 30 million cell profiles to generate a comprehensive metabolic atlas across human organs, identifying organ- and cell-type-specific activities. The framework also uncovered disease-associated metabolic alterations and metabolite-mediated communication.

title: High-Resolution Spatial Profiling of Microglia Reveals Proximity Associated Immunometabolic Reprogramming in Alzheimer's Disease.
main_goals: To elucidate disease-associated microglial subtypes and their metabolic signatures in relation to amyloid plaques in Alzheimer's disease using high-resolution spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify conserved proximity-dependent metabolic shifts and explore potential cell-type specific vulnerabilities near microglia.

title: POPARI: Modeling multisample variation in spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Mouse brain (STARmap PLUS), thymus (Slide-TCR-seq), ovarian cancer (CosMx)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: Popari is introduced as a probabilistic graphical model for factor-based decomposition of multisample spatial transcriptomics data. It captures condition-specific changes in spatial organization by jointly learning spatial metagenes and their spatial affinities across samples. Key innovations include a differential prior for spatial accordance regularization and spatial downsampling for multiresolution analysis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Shows a Distinctive Tumour Microenvironment in the Invasive Versus Premalignant Portion of Early Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Early cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) progression from actinic keratosis (AK)
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the distinct gene expression patterns within the tumor microenvironment during the progression of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) from premalignant actinic keratosis (AK). Using spatial transcriptomics, the researchers compared gene expression in tumor cells, immune cells, and fibroblasts between invasive and premalignant portions of early-stage SCC samples, identifying differentially expressed genes and altered pathways.

title: DeepGFT: identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics of complex and 3D tissue using deep learning and graph Fourier transform.
biological_context: Human breast cancer, Human lymph node, 3D Drosophila development
main_goals: DeepGFT is a novel method that integrates deep learning with graph Fourier transform to identify spatial domains in complex and 3D spatial transcriptomics data. It simultaneously models spot-wise and gene-wise relationships to overcome challenges like high dropout rates and noise. The method demonstrates superior performance over existing methods in detecting tumor substructures, identifying germinal centers, and revealing developmental changes.

title: Explainable artificial intelligence with temporal convolutional networks for adverse weather condition detection in driverless vehicles.
main_goals: This paper proposes a Complex Data Analysis for Adverse Weather Detection in Autonomous Vehicles Using Explainable Artificial Intelligence (CDAAWD-AVXAI) approach. The approach utilizes median filter for image pre-processing, CapsNet for feature extraction, and Temporal Convolutional Networks (TCN) for weather detection. It also incorporates improved dung beetle optimization (IDBO) for TCN hyperparameter tuning and LIME for explainability.

title: Spatiotemporal and single-cell atlases to dissect regional specific cell types of the developing ovary.
main_goals: This study builds a spatiotemporal developmental atlas of ovaries using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It characterizes regional heterogeneity of granulosa cell subtypes, analyzes molecular distinctions between healthy and atretic follicles, and identifies specific luteal cell populations. The research aims to provide a comprehensive delineation of ovary development and regional specificity of ovarian cell types.

title: CCR2<sup>+</sup> monocytes promote memory CD8<sup>+</sup> T-cell differentiation via membrane-bound TGF-β.
biological_context: CD8+ T-cell differentiation during acute infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This study reveals a novel spatial mechanism for CD8+ T-cell fate decisions, highlighting the role of CCR2+ monocytes in promoting memory CD8+ T-cell differentiation via membrane-bound TGF-β. It integrates scRNA-seq and spatially resolved transcriptomics to understand the spatial determinants of T-cell fate during acute infection.

title: Co-occurrence feature learning for visual recognition of immature leukocytes.
data_modalities_used: ['blood smear images', 'RGB color space', 'LAB color space']
main_goals: The study proposes a densely connected co-occurrence network (DCONN) for improved classification of immature leukocytes in blood smear images. The method utilizes Yolact for detection, LAB color space transformation, and co-occurrence matrices for feature extraction, aiming to enhance accuracy with fewer parameters.

title: Spatial omics enters the microscopic realm: opportunities and challenges.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', '3D mapping', 'multi-omics integration', 'AI-driven spatial analysis']
main_goals: This review highlights recent breakthroughs in microscopic-resolution spatial transcriptomics (μST). It outlines key challenges in the field and discusses emerging experimental and computational solutions. The paper aims to provide an overview of the opportunities and challenges shaping the future of μST.

title: [Mechanism of Quanduzhong Capsules in treating knee osteoarthritis from perspective of spatial heterogeneity].
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the targeted effects of Quanduzhong Capsules on cartilage lesions in knee osteoarthritis by integrating spatial transcriptomics data mining and animal experiments. It sought to elucidate the molecular mechanisms by constructing an interaction network between drug candidate targets and spatially specific genes in cartilage lesions. The goal was to clarify the spatially specific targeted effects and protective mechanisms of the capsules.

title: Reduction of systematic errors in diffusion tensor imaging of the human brain as a prospect for increasing the precision of planning neurosurgical operations with particular emphasis on fiber tracking.
main_goals: This study evaluated the combined impact of denoising and B-matrix Spatial Distribution (BSD) correction on Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) accuracy and tractography quality. The goal was to reduce systematic errors and noise in DTI to increase the precision of planning neurosurgical operations. The findings highlight the complementary nature of denoising and BSD correction for improving DTI metrics.

title: Knowledge-enhanced protein subcellular localization prediction from 3D fluorescence microscope images.
main_goals: The paper developed KE3DLoc, a knowledge-enhanced model for protein subcellular localization prediction from 3D fluorescence microscope images using deep learning. It incorporates a novel knowledge enhancement module using Gene Ontology knowledge graphs and addresses data imbalance with asymmetric loss and confidence weights. The model demonstrates superior performance compared to existing methods.

title: Targeting myeloid cells in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma: from primary tumors to liver metastasis.
biological_context: Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) with liver metastasis
main_goals: This review explores the distinct immunosuppressive mechanisms at various stages of PDAC progression, including primary tumors, pre-metastatic niches, and metastatic sites, with a particular focus on myeloid cells. It discusses current immunotherapy strategies targeting myeloid cells and their combinations with conventional treatments, considering advancements in single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The review highlights innovative strategies targeting myeloid cells to reprogram the tumor microenvironment and enhance immunotherapy efficacy.

title: mNSF: multi-sample non-negative spatial factorization.
main_goals: This paper introduces mNSF, a multi-sample non-negative spatial factorization framework for analyzing spatial transcriptomics data. It extends single-sample factorization by incorporating sample-specific spatial correlation modeling and extracting low-dimensional representations. mNSF aims to identify true factors, shared anatomical regions, and region-specific biological functions across multiple samples.

title: Multi-omics unveils BCAA metabolism markers L-leucine and HMGCS1 as prognostic marker for immunotherapy efficacy in non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL)
main_goals: This study identifies branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) plasma metabolites and gene signatures, specifically L-leucine and HMGCS1, as prognostic markers for immunotherapy efficacy in NSCLC. It also investigates the prognostic value of HMGCS1 in DLBCL.

title: SC2Spa: a deep learning based approach to map transcriptome to spatial origins at cellular resolution.
main_goals: SC2Spa is a deep learning-based approach to accurately map cells to their spatial coordinates using spatial transcriptomics data. It enhances the resolution of low-resolution spatial transcriptomics data by mapping single-cell RNA sequencing data. The tool also identifies spatially variable genes that are not detectable by previous methods.

title: Spatial omics technology potentially promotes the progress of tumor immunotherapy.
main_goals: This perspective article provides a comprehensive overview of spatial omics technologies and their potential to advance tumor immunotherapy. It discusses the heterogeneity of the tumor microenvironment in a spatial context, applications in cancer therapies, recent advancements in cellular interactions and tertiary lymphoid structures, and challenges in clinical translation. The authors advocate for broader application of spatial omics to discover therapeutic targets and achieve precision immunotherapy.

title: Divergent combinations of enhancers encode spatial gene expression.
biological_context: Mouse embryo and brain, human melanoma and breast cancer, mouse embryonic spinal cord
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'epigenomics', 'chromatin accessibility', 'gene expression', 'VISTA', 'Allen in situ hybridization (ISH)', 'H3K27ac MERFISH']
main_goals: The study introduces eSpatial, a computational framework for deciphering spatially resolved enhancer regulation of gene expression by integrating spatial gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiles. It reveals a 'spatial enhancer code' where divergent enhancer combinations regulate the same gene in spatially segregated domains. The findings are validated and confirmed with experimental perturbation, providing insights into tissue-specific regulatory mechanisms and tumor heterogeneity.

title: Exploring Virus Protein Domains: Detection and Evolutionary Insights.
main_goals: The paper presents a framework using the HMMER suite to identify protein domains within a target protein sequence database and generate multiple sequence alignments for phylogenomic studies. It demonstrates this approach by identifying homologs of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor-binding domain (RBD). The protocol aims to provide a starting point for identifying conserved domains and exploring their evolutionary relationships.

title: The integration of single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveals the tumor microenvironment and spatial organization of testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.
biological_context: Primary testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PT-DLBCL)
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing', 'xenograft models']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Organization']
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the tumor microenvironment and spatial organization of primary testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PT-DLBCL) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies key cell populations, analyzes genetic heterogeneity, and proposes therapeutic targets by investigating the roles of E2F and CREB.

title: A Review of Probiotic Intervention Targets in Diseases: Unveiling Mechanisms and Providing Insights toward Engineering Strategies.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of the relationship between probiotics and contemporary disease targets, discusses therapeutic mechanisms, and proposes current and new engineering strategies based on genetic composition and probiotic properties. It aims to reveal the mechanisms of probiotic intervention in diseases and suggest new engineering strategies and research concepts for disease targets.

title: Artificial intelligence based malignant lymphoma type prediction using enhanced super resolution image and hybrid feature extraction algorithm.
main_goals: This paper proposes an artificial intelligence-based method for predicting malignant lymphoma types using enhanced super-resolution images and a hybrid feature extraction algorithm. The goal is to improve accuracy in predicting lymphoma types by combining texture, color, and shape features extracted from pre-processed PET images with ensemble learning classifiers. The proposed model aims to outperform existing transfer learning techniques.

title: Temporally resolved single-cell RNA sequencing reveals protective and pathological responses during herpes simplex virus CNS infection.
biological_context: Herpes Simplex Virus 1 (HSV-1) CNS infection in mice
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Communication Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to reveal temporally resolved cell-specific transcriptomic changes and cell-cell communication during HSV-1 CNS infection. It identifies protective and pathological immune responses, including a unique population of virus-activated microglia and the role of monocytes in driving pathology.

title: High-Resolution Spatial Map of the Human Facial Sebaceous Gland Reveals Marker Genes and Decodes Sebocyte Differentiation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive molecular analysis of the human sebaceous gland, focusing on cellular interactions and sebocyte differentiation. It identifies distinct stages of sebocyte differentiation characterized by unique gene signatures, enhancing understanding of sebaceous gland biology.

title: Multimodal AI framework for lung cancer diagnosis: Integrating CNN and ANN models for imaging and clinical data analysis.
biological_context: Lung cancer diagnosis and severity assessment
main_goals: This paper introduces a multimodal AI framework integrating CNNs and ANNs for lung cancer diagnosis and severity assessment. It aims to improve classification accuracy by combining imaging and clinical data, with enhanced interpretability through Grad-CAM and SHAP.

title: Lithological distribution using band ratio technique in Southern Langkawi, Kedah, Malaysia.
main_goals: This study aimed to map the lithological distribution on Dayang Bunting and Tuba Islands in Southern Langkawi, Malaysia, using the band ratio technique applied to Landsat 9 satellite data. The research compared different band ratio combinations to identify the most effective ones for distinguishing lithology types like limestone, marble, and granite. The findings demonstrate the utility of remote sensing techniques for geological surveys in challenging terrains.

title: Unravelling heart failure cellular signalling heterogeneity with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To unravel heart failure cellular signalling heterogeneity using spatial transcriptomics.

title: TSPAN4<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts coordinate metastatic niche assembly through migrasome-driven metabolic reprogramming and stromal-immune crosstalk in pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Gene enrichment', 'prognostic analyses']
main_goals: This study explored migrasome-associated fibroblasts, especially TSPAN4 and ITGA5, as key regulators of pancreatic cancer metastasis. It identified TSPAN4+ fibroblasts as crucial for metastatic niche assembly through migrasome-driven metabolic reprogramming and stromal-immune crosstalk. Targeting these fibroblasts is proposed as a promising therapeutic strategy.

title: Spatial proteomics of the tumor microenvironment in melanoma: current insights and future directions.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This review examines key spatial proteomics methods and their applications in melanoma biology. It highlights current limitations and future directions, emphasizing the potential for clinical translation to guide personalized treatment strategies and predict therapeutic response.

title: A visual-omics foundation model to bridge histopathology with spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Tissue alignment', 'Annotation', 'Cell-type decomposition', 'Image-transcriptomics retrieval', 'Spatial transcriptomics gene expression prediction']
main_goals: To develop a visual-omics foundation model (OmiCLIP) and platform (Loki) that links histopathology images with spatial transcriptomics. Loki provides functionalities for tissue alignment, annotation, cell-type decomposition, retrieval, and gene expression prediction by integrating histology and transcriptomics data.

title: Precision targeting of β-catenin induces tumor reprogramming and immunity in hepatocellular cancers.
main_goals: This paper investigates the efficacy of a novel siRNA encapsulated in lipid nanoparticles targeting CTNNB1 (LNP-CTNNB1) in CTNNB1-mutated hepatocellular carcinoma models. It demonstrates that LNP-CTNNB1 induces tumor reprogramming and immunity, and enhances responses to immune checkpoint inhibitors by preventing T cell exhaustion and forming lymphoid aggregates.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analyses reveal tumor heterogeneity and immune remodeling involved in pituitary neuroendocrine tumor progression.
biological_context: Pituitary neuroendocrine tumors (PitNETs) progression and invasion
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate tumor heterogeneity and immune remodeling during pituitary neuroendocrine tumor (PitNET) progression using integrated single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify aggressive tumor populations and characterize the tumor microenvironment, particularly focusing on the role of SPP1+ tumor-associated macrophages in invasion.

title: A hepatic zonation chip with an oxygen concentration gradient embracing the spatial distribution of metabolic function.
main_goals: The study developed a hepatic zonation chip (H-chip) that replicates the oxygen gradient of the hepatic acinus. This chip enhances physiological relevance for drug testing by enabling zone-specific hepatic functionality and spatial transcriptomic analysis. It demonstrated improved prediction of spatial hepatotoxicity for acetaminophen.

title: Intercellular communication between FAP+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in prostate cancer via multi-omics.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemical staining', 'immunofluorescence staining']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the intercellular communication between FAP+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in prostate cancer using multi-omics approaches. It identifies key signaling pathways like CSF1/CSF1R and CXCL/ACKR1 that contribute to an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment and highlights potential therapeutic targets.

title: Unraveling the immune evasion mechanisms in the tumor microenvironment of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: This review synthesizes current understanding of the HNSCC microenvironment and immune escape, focusing on emerging immunotherapies and proposing a novel 'Trinity' regulatory network of immune evasion. It also highlights the importance of spatial heterogeneity and 'lineage plasticity-driven immune adaptation' for developing precision immunotherapies.

title: Immunosuppressive Formulations for Immunological Defense against Traumatic Brain Injury.
biological_context: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) and subsequent neurodegeneration
main_goals: This paper presents a novel subcutaneous formulation based on polymer of alpha-ketoglutarate (paKG) for prophylactic immunosuppression against traumatic brain injury (TBI). The formulation, containing PFK15, alpha-ketoglutarate, and a myelin proteolipid protein peptide, aims to reduce chronic inflammation and mitigate deleterious effects of TBI by modulating immune cell populations and promoting an anti-inflammatory profile.

title: Deciphering the cellular and molecular landscape of cervical cancer progression through single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to comprehensively characterize the tumor microenvironment in cervical cancer progression using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies distinct cellular populations, particularly SPP1+ macrophages, and their interactions, highlighting the SPP1-CD44 axis as a potential therapeutic target and prognostic biomarker.

title: Accessible and accurate cytometry analysis of adherent cells using fluorescence microscopes.
biological_context: Adherent cell culture, prime editing screening
main_goals: To develop a method and a Python-based analysis tool to capture images and produce flow-cytometry-like data for adherent cells using fluorescence microscopes. The method leverages generalist algorithms for cell segmentation to quantify single-cell fluorescence signals.

title: Advancing liver metabolic zonation with single-cell and spatial omics.
main_goals: This review summarizes past and recent findings on hepatic metabolic zonation, explores the role of immune zonation and hormonal regulation, and discusses the latest technologies and future challenges in the field.

title: Multihormone-producing capabilities of normal pancreatic islet cells-spatial transcriptomics analysis using Xenium.
main_goals: This study investigates whether adult pancreatic islet cells maintain the plasticity to produce multiple pancreatic hormones simultaneously. Using spatial transcriptomics with Xenium, the researchers analyzed gene transcripts of glucagon, insulin, somatostatin, and pancreatic polypeptide in pancreatic islet cells. The findings suggest that adult islet cells can express multiple hormone gene transcripts, implying a potential for co-production.

title: Integrating multi-omics data with artificial intelligence to decipher the role of tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in tumor immunotherapy.
biological_context: Tumor immunotherapy, tumor microenvironment, various cancers
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'Immunohistochemical staining', 'single-cell sequencing', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histopathology images', 'digital pathology']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This review provides an overview of the advancements in the application of AI for assessing TILs from multiple perspectives. It focuses on AI-driven approaches for identifying, quantifying, recognizing subpopulations, and analyzing spatial distribution patterns of TILs. The review also explores the integration of AI with other technologies to enhance the study of TILs and their clinical utility.

title: Modeling habitat distribution and niche overlap of Asian horseshoe crabs: Implications for conservation.
main_goals: This study analyzes habitat distribution and niche overlap for three species of Asian horseshoe crabs using predictive modeling (MaxEnt) and niche analysis. Key environmental factors like water depth and distance to land were identified, along with species-specific influences. The research aims to highlight priority conservation areas and inform management strategies.

title: PROS1-MERTK Axis Drives Tumor Microenvironment Crosstalk and Progression in Papillary Thyroid Microcarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments']
main_goals: This study identified the PROS1-MERTK signaling interaction as pivotal in PTMC progression by analyzing intercellular communication networks using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings, confirmed through in vitro and in vivo models, highlight this axis as a critical component of the tumor microenvironment driving PTMC progression.

title: Characterization of cancer-associated fibroblasts and their spatial architecture reveals heterogeneity and survival associations in classic Hodgkin lymphoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study characterizes cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their spatial architecture in classic Hodgkin lymphoma (cHL). It investigates the association of CAFs and specific immune cell subsets with patient outcomes using multiplexed immunofluorescence imaging and spatial analysis. The findings highlight the heterogeneity of CAFs and the importance of their spatial relationships with tumor cells for survival in cHL.

title: Investigating the molecular mechanisms associated with ulcerative colitis through the application of single-cell combined spatial transcriptome sequencing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This research investigated the molecular mechanisms of ulcerative colitis (UC) by applying single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses. It identified specific monocyte subtypes and two key genes, GNG5 and TIMP1, involved in UC pathogenesis, offering insights for clinical diagnosis and treatment.

title: Arhgap29 Deficiency Directly Leads to Systemic and Craniofacial Skeletal Abnormalities.
biological_context: Skeletal abnormalities, syndromic cleft lip and palate (SCL/P)
data_modalities_used: ['micro-CT imaging', 'histological analysis', 'transcriptomic methods', 'Immunohistochemical analysis', 'in vitro studies']
main_goals: To investigate the role of Arhgap29 in skeletal development and its association with syndromic cleft lip and palate. The study characterized skeletal abnormalities in Arhgap29-deficient mice and explored the underlying molecular mechanisms.

title: Genome-Wide Identification and Expression Analysis of the YTH Domain-Containing Protein Gene Family in Salvia miltiorrhiza.
main_goals: This paper reports the genome-wide identification and expression analysis of YTH domain-containing protein genes in Salvia miltiorrhiza. It identified nineteen SmYTH genes and analyzed their phylogenetic relationships, conserved domains, and expression patterns. The study also investigated the impact of MeJA and SA treatments on YTH gene expression and phenolic acid content.

title: Leveraging Spatial Transcriptomics to Decode Craniofacial Development.
main_goals: This review summarizes key spatial transcriptomics technologies enabling unprecedented transcriptomic analyses in craniofacial development. It focuses on methods applied to study palate and tooth development to understand cellular and molecular events driving normal development. The goal is to provide insights for therapeutic targets for craniofacial disorders.

title: Lysine Carboxymethyl Cysteinate, as a Topical Glutathione Precursor, Protects Against Oxidative Stress and UVB Radiation-Induced Skin Damage.
data_modalities_used: ['primary human keratinocytes', 'skin tissue samples', 'pigmented living skin equivalent (pLSE) model']
main_goals: This study investigated the efficacy of Lysine Carboxymethyl Cysteinate (LCC) as a topical glutathione precursor. The research aimed to determine if LCC could boost endogenous GSH levels in skin and protect against oxidative stress and UVB radiation-induced damage. The findings suggest LCC has multifaceted roles in enhancing skin's antioxidant defenses and preventing environmental damage.

title: Targeting Redox Signaling Through Exosomal MicroRNA: Insights into Tumor Microenvironment and Precision Oncology.
main_goals: This review explores the ROS-miRNA-exosome axis in the tumor microenvironment and its implications for precision oncology. It discusses how oxidative stress influences exosome biogenesis and miRNA cargo sorting, modulating immune responses and therapeutic resistance. The review also highlights the therapeutic potential of natural products and emerging strategies targeting this axis.

title: Deep Learning Auto-segmentation of Diffuse Midline Glioma on Multimodal Magnetic Resonance Images.
data_modalities_used: ['T1W MR images', 'T2W MR images', 'FLAIR MR images']
main_goals: This study develops a modified CNN-based 3D-Unet tool to automatically segment Diffuse Midline Glioma (DMG) in magnetic resonance (MR) images. The proposed tool achieved an average Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) of 0.883 on a test dataset. This advancement aims to enhance the precision of diagnostic and predictive models for this pediatric cancer.

title: Interpretable niche-based cell‒cell communication inference using multi-view graph neural networks.
biological_context: Human bronchial glands, Oral squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: The paper introduces STCase, a tool for inferring niche-based cell-cell communication (CCC) from spatial transcriptomics data at the single-cell/spot level. It utilizes an interpretable multi-view graph neural network with CCC-aware attention to identify niches and uncover niche-specific CCC events, outperforming existing methods and providing insights into biological systems.

title: Artificial neural networks for magnetoencephalography: a review of an emerging field.
