main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of the state of the art in applying artificial neural networks (ANNs) to magnetoencephalography (MEG) data. It categorizes studies into 'Classification', 'Modeling', and 'Other' to summarize key findings and trends, aiming to highlight strengths and limitations of ANNs in MEG research and offer recommendations for future work.

title: Epithelial cell dynamics: Key drivers of type 2 inflammation in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis.
main_goals: This paper analyzes epithelial cell dynamics and their role in type 2 inflammation in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis (ECRS). It highlights the key drivers of ECRS pathogenesis, including epithelial cells releasing cytokines and the impact of eosinophilic mucins. The study emphasizes the need for stratified medicine approaches to develop targeted interventions by restoring epithelial integrity and immune balance.

title: Integrating AI/ML and multi-omics approaches to investigate the role of TNFRSF10A/TRAILR1 and its potential targets in pancreatic cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk genomics', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'ceRNA network analysis', 'QSAR modeling']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the role of TNFRSF10A/TRAILR1 and its potential targets in pancreatic cancer by integrating multi-omics data with AI/ML approaches. The research identified TNFRSF10A as a potential therapeutic target and used advanced deep learning and QSAR analysis to find existing drugs with potential modulatory effects.

title: Decellularised Amniotic Membrane for the Neurogenic Expression of Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Cell Adhesion', 'Cell Migration']
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the potential of decellularized amniotic membrane (DAM) to induce neurogenic differentiation in human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs) for neural regeneration in peripheral neuropathy. The research utilizes spatial transcriptomics and immunofluorescence staining to analyze gene expression and cellular responses. The findings suggest that DAM promotes stem cell adhesion, migration, and neural marker expression, indicating its utility for neural repair.

title: Chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 5 as a novel pan-cancer prognostic biomarker for tumor stemness and immunotherapy response: insights from multi-omics data, integrated machine learning, and experimental validation.
biological_context: Pan-cancer analysis of CCT5, tumor stemness, and immunotherapy response
main_goals: This study investigates the pan-cancer roles of CCT5 in tumorigenesis, stemness maintenance, and immunotherapy response using multi-omics data. It developed a novel CCT5-based signature (CCT5.Sig) to predict immunotherapy response with high accuracy. The findings highlight CCT5 as a potential pan-cancer biomarker.

title: Spatial Insights in Cardiovascular Aging.
main_goals: This review explores the contribution of spatial omics in clarifying the molecular mechanisms that influence cardiovascular aging. It highlights the importance and application of spatial omics in unraveling spatial heterogeneity within the aging cardiovascular system. The aim is to understand molecular mechanisms implicated in age-related cardiovascular diseases.

title: Integrating Dynamical Systems Modeling with Spatiotemporal scRNA-Seq Data Analysis.
main_goals: This review discusses how dynamical system approaches, such as Markov chains, stochastic differential equations, and generative models, when combined with spatiotemporal scRNA-seq data, enable the reconstruction of dynamic cellular trajectories and cell fate decisions. It aims to highlight the opportunities these approaches offer for modeling and inferring cellular dynamics from a systematic perspective.

title: Identification of Prognostic Biomarkers of Ovarian High-Grade Serous Carcinoma: A Preliminary Study Using Spatial Transcriptome Analysis and Multispectral Imaging.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'multispectral immune cell immunofluorescence (IF)', 'gene expression profiling']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify prognostic biomarkers for ovarian high-grade serous carcinoma (HGSC) recurrence following first-line treatment. It employed spatial transcriptomics and multispectral imaging to link spatial expression patterns of genes and immune cell interactions to patient outcomes, revealing potential biomarkers for predicting non-recurrence.

title: An adaptive frequency partitioning framework for epileptic seizure detection using TransseizNet.
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel TransseizNet framework for epilepsy seizure detection from electroencephalography signals. The framework utilizes adaptive frequency partitioning via Empirical Tunable Q-Wavelet Transform and a Wavelet-Graph Convolutional Network Vision Transformer for enhanced accuracy and computational efficiency.

title: Panoramic spatial enhanced resolution proteomics (PSERP) reveals tumor architecture and heterogeneity in gliomas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: Introduces Panoramic spatial enhanced resolution proteomics (PSERP), a method combining tissue expansion, automated sample segmentation, and tryptic digestion with high-throughput proteomic profiling. PSERP enables rapid quantitative profiling of proteomic spatial variability in whole tissue sections at sub-millimeter resolution. The method is demonstrated for analyzing glioma architecture and heterogeneity, including spatial peptidome identification for potential immunotherapy selection.

title: Exploiting the endothelial-immune axis to improve radiotherapy efficacy.
biological_context: Radiotherapy effects on normal and tumor tissues, focusing on the endothelial-immune axis
main_goals: This review discusses the impact of radiation on the vascular endothelium and its role in immune cell recruitment in normal tissues and tumors. It explores current research using single-cell analysis to understand these responses and highlights the potential of targeting the endothelial cell-mediated immune recruitment for improving radiotherapy efficacy.

title: Revolutionizing cancer treatment: Navigating the intricate landscape of cellular signaling networks.
main_goals: This paper seeks cutting-edge research to dissect adaptive mechanisms in cancer treatment by exploring signaling networks. It aims to integrate systems biology with computational and experimental approaches to design adaptive therapies. The focus is on leveraging innovative technologies to outmaneuver cancer's evolutionary resilience.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal correlation between RNA methylation-related miRNA risk model and immune infiltration in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['miRNA sequencing data', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'sequencing']
main_goals: The study aimed to correlate RNA methylation-related miRNA (RMRM) risk with immune infiltration in HCC. It developed a risk model based on four RMRMs and investigated its association with prognosis and immune cell infiltration using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The research identified miR-4739's role in promoting HCC cell proliferation and migration via SPP1+ macrophages.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic profiling for glomerular and tubulointerstitial gene expression in C3 glomerulopathy.
main_goals: To investigate the substructure-specific gene expression profile of C3 glomerulopathy (C3G) using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify differentially expressed genes in glomeruli and tubulointerstitial regions of C3G and validate findings in vitro. It seeks to provide insights into the pathophysiology of C3G.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals HDAC Inhibition Modulates Microglial Dynamics to Protect Against Ischemic Stroke in Mice.
main_goals: To characterize the transcriptomic profiles and spatial distribution of microglia in the stroke brain following HDAC inhibitor administration. The study aims to understand how HDAC inhibition modulates microglial activation and phenotype to promote neuronal repair in the ischemic penumbra.

title: Etiology-based Molecular Characterization of Hepatocellular Carcinoma Reveals SQLE's Contribution to Immunosuppressive Microenvironment.
data_modalities_used: ['RNA-seq', 'genetic alteration', 'copy number alteration', 'immune-related features', 'single-cell transcriptomic data', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'single-cell transcriptomic data', 'spatial transcriptomic data']
main_goals: To explore etiology-specific features of HCC and improve understanding of tumorigenesis, revealing potential therapeutic targets. The study found that HCC with different etiologies shows distinct clinical features, genetic alterations, copy number alterations, and tumor microenvironments. Specifically, SQLE was found to be overexpressed in viral hepatitis-related HCC and associated with a poor prognosis and an immunosuppressive microenvironment.

title: Investigation of the cytotoxic effects and mechanisms of the SLC39A6-targeting ADC drug BRY812 in CRC.
main_goals: This study investigates the expression of SLC39A6 in colorectal cancer (CRC) and explores the therapeutic effects and mechanisms of the SLC39A6-targeting ADC drug BRY812 on CRC cells. The research aims to identify SLC39A6 as a potential therapeutic target and establish BRY812 as a promising drug for CRC treatment.

title: Progress in single-cell sequencing of retinal vein occlusion or ischemic hypoxic retinopathy.
biological_context: Retinal vein occlusion (RVO) and ischemic hypoxic retinopathy (IHR)
main_goals: This review highlights recent progress in applying single-cell sequencing (SCS) to dissect the pathophysiology of RVO and IHR. It summarizes findings on altered gene expression in key retinal cell types under ischemic/hypoxic stress, explores integration of advanced single-cell technologies, and discusses current challenges and future directions.

title: Deep learning-based histopathologic segmentation of peritubular capillaries in kidney transplant biopsies.
main_goals: This study introduces a deep learning-based approach for the detection and segmentation of peritubular capillaries (PTCs) in PAS-stained kidney transplant biopsies. The goal is to automate the assessment of inflammation in PTCs, which is crucial for diagnosing antibody-mediated rejection. The developed U-Net model aims to improve accuracy and reproducibility in scoring peritubular capillaritis.

title: An algorithmic perspective on deciphering cell-cell interactions with spatial omics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This review outlines methods for deciphering cell-cell interactions (CCIs) with spatial omics data. It provides a high-level view of employed algorithms, how they handle spatial data, and their downstream analyses. The paper also highlights avenues for future CCI method development.

title: Dissecting PTPN7-driven aggressiveness in IDH-wildtype astrocytomas: multi-omics, clinical validation, and spatial transcriptomics for prognostic insights.
data_modalities_used: ['TCGA', 'CGGA', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', '10x Genomics Visium', 'immunohistochemistry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'Prognostic analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the role of PTPN7 in IDH-wildtype astrocytomas. It examines PTPN7's prognostic significance, spatial distribution, and immune-related functions using multi-omics and spatial transcriptomics. The goal is to elucidate PTPN7 as a potential prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target to improve patient survival.

title: Image guided construction of a common coordinate framework for spatial transcriptome data.
main_goals: The paper presents STaCker, a deep learning algorithm that unifies the coordinates of spatial transcriptomic slices using image registration. It aims to overcome challenges in comparing and integrating data from multiple slices by creating a common coordinate framework, improving spatial concordance and enabling harmonization of datasets from various platforms.

title: A Robust Kernel-Based Workflow for Niche Trajectory Analysis.
main_goals: The paper presents a novel kernel-based strategy for niche trajectory analysis in spatial transcriptomics. This approach models the tissue microenvironment as a continuous function in gene expression space, eliminating the need for cell-type annotation. Integration with cell-type deconvolution extends its applicability to various spatial resolutions, enhancing robustness and accuracy for studying tissue microenvironment changes.

title: Protocol to decipher complex spatial transcriptomics data using STMiner.
main_goals: This paper presents a protocol for deciphering complex spatial transcriptomics data using a tool called STMiner. It details steps for installation, data loading, identifying spatially variable genes, determining gene sets associated with structures, and obtaining spatial expression patterns. The protocol is designed for varying resolutions and platforms without requiring additional reference data.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal high T cell and monocyte status as predictive and prognostic markers in pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This study aimed to discover predictive or prognostic factors for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). It investigated differences between PDAC cases treated with upfront surgery versus neoadjuvant chemotherapy, and those with good versus poor responses to chemotherapy, using digital spatial profiling and immunohistochemistry. The findings identified specific cell types and molecular markers that could serve as predictive and prognostic indicators for PDAC.

title: Confronting the challenge of cell segmentation in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper confronts the challenge of cell segmentation in spatial transcriptomics. It aims to highlight the critical importance of accurate cell segmentation for downstream analyses in spatial omics data.

title: Association of DNA damage response signals and oxidative stress status with nivolumab efficacy in patients with Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: To investigate the association of DNA damage response (DDR) signals and oxidative stress status with nivolumab efficacy in HNSCC patients. The study aims to identify potential non-invasive biomarkers for predicting treatment response by analyzing peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) and spatial transcriptomics data from tumor biopsies.

title: Oligodendrocyte-astrocyte crosstalk in Parkinson's disease mediates neuronal ferroptosis via the FGF signaling pathway.
main_goals: This study investigates the crosstalk between oligodendrocytes and astrocytes in Parkinson's disease and how it mediates neuronal ferroptosis via the FGF signaling pathway. The research characterizes the intercellular communication network using single-nucleus sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, identifies key signaling molecules, and validates findings in PD mice. The study elucidates the role of glial cell dysregulation in driving DA neuron ferroptosis and inflammation in the midbrain SN region.

title: Spatial multiomics decipher fibroblast-macrophage dynamics in systemic sclerosis.
main_goals: To explore tissue organization and cell coordination in SSc skin, providing spatiotemporal insights into disease mechanisms and bridging the gap between omics discovery and precision medicine by analyzing fibroblast-macrophage dynamics.

title: Decoding the role of intratumoral microbiota in gastric cancer.
main_goals: This review synthesizes current knowledge on the origins, heterogeneity, detection, and mechanistic roles of intratumoral microbiota in gastric carcinogenesis. It discusses the impact of microbiota on gastric cancer development, including genetic and epigenetic alterations, signaling pathway modulation, metabolic reprogramming, and regulation of chronic inflammation and immune responses. The review also highlights the potential therapeutic opportunities presented by the microbiota's influence on chemotherapy resistance and immune modulation.

title: Dissecting key contributions of Th2 and Th17 cytokines to atopic dermatitis pathophysiology.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper investigates which T helper (Th)2 and Th17 cytokines drive specific epidermal hallmarks in atopic dermatitis (AD). It utilizes human epidermal equivalents stimulated with these cytokines and analyzes their effects using morphological, functional, and transcriptomic methods. The study aims to uncover the role of IL-22 in Th2-driven AD and evaluate the potential of combinatory therapies.

title: Cell-TRACTR: A transformer-based model for end-to-end segmentation and tracking of cells.
biological_context: Bacterial cells growing in a microfluidic geometry and mammalian cells growing freely in two dimensions.
main_goals: To introduce Cell-TRACTR, a transformer-based model for end-to-end cell segmentation and tracking, overcoming limitations of CNNs in handling spatial and global contextual dependencies. The paper also introduces the Cell-HOTA metric for assessing cell division accuracy. The model demonstrates strong performance compared to state-of-the-art algorithms.

title: Comprehensive single-cell RNA atlas of human laryngeal normal, preneoplastic and tumorigenic states.
biological_context: Laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) progression from vocal cord leukoplakia (VCL)
main_goals: To characterize the cellular microenvironmental differences between vocal cord leukoplakia (VCL) and laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) at single-cell resolution. The study aims to identify epithelial subclusters in VCL with malignant potential and shared immunosuppressive features with LSCC, providing insights into disease progression and potential therapeutic targets.

title: StereoMM: a graph fusion model for integrating spatial transcriptomic data and pathological images.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Patient classification']
main_goals: StereoMM is a graph-based fusion model for integrating spatial omics data (gene expression, histology images, spatial location) using cross-attention and a graph autoencoder. It enables efficient construction of spatial views of integrated multimodal features for tissue and patient characterization. The method demonstrates robustness across cancer types and platforms, outperforming competitors in identifying tumor progression regions and classifying colorectal cancer patients.

title: Microglia activation orchestrates CXCL10-mediated CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell recruitment to promote aging-related white matter degeneration.
biological_context: Aging-related white matter degeneration in mice
main_goals: To investigate microglial functions related to aging-associated changes in myelinated axons of mice using pharmacological and genetic approaches. The study reveals that maladaptive microglia activation promotes the accumulation of harmful CD8+ T cells, leading to white matter degeneration. It also identifies the CXCL10-CXCR3 axis as crucial for CD8+ T cell recruitment.

title: Cell simulation as cell segmentation.
biological_context: Renal cell carcinoma and associated tumor microenvironment
main_goals: The paper introduces Proseg, a novel computational method adopting principles from ab initio cell simulation to perform probabilistic segmentation of cells in spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to improve segmentation accuracy and computational efficiency compared to existing methods, thereby enabling better detection of challenging cell types like tumor-infiltrating immune cells and facilitating deeper biological insights.

title: CellLENS enables cross-domain information fusion for enhanced cell population delineation in single-cell spatial omics data.
biological_context: Immune cell populations in various tissue types and disease settings
main_goals: Introduces CellLENS, a self-supervised computational method that fuses information from expression, neighborhood, and image domains to enhance de novo discovery of immune cell populations in spatial omics data. It integrates individual cell molecular profiles with neighborhood context and tissue localization for fine-grained population delineation. The method is validated on diverse spatial proteomic and transcriptomic datasets across multiple tissue types and diseases.

title: Imputing single-cell protein abundance in multiplex tissue imaging.
main_goals: This paper introduces a machine learning approach to impute single-cell protein abundance in multiplex tissue imaging data. It evaluates different machine learning models, including deep learning autoencoders, and demonstrates the biological relevance of the imputed data by classifying cells based on treatment status. The study highlights the benefits of incorporating spatial context for improved imputation accuracy.

title: Deep MALDI-MS spatial omics guided by quantum cascade laser mid-infrared imaging microscopy.
biological_context: Kidney and spinal cord lesions in mice with experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE)
data_modalities_used: ['Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI)', 'Quantum Cascade Laser Mid-Infrared Imaging Microscopy (QCL-MIR imaging)', 'on-tissue tandem-MS', 'imaging parallel reaction monitoring-Parallel Accumulation-Serial Fragmentation (iprm-PASEF)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Lipid identification']
main_goals: Introduces a workflow combining QCL-MIR imaging and MSI to guide high-confidence molecular identifications in small tissue regions. This approach enables extensive spatial lipid identifications and characterization of disease-related lipid remodeling.

title: HMG Box-containing Protein 1 (HBP1) Protects Against Pancreatic Injury in Acute Pancreatitis but Promotes Neoplastic Progression.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of HMG Box-containing Protein 1 (HBP1) in acute pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer progression. The findings indicate that HBP1 protects against pancreatic injury but promotes neoplastic progression in the presence of oncogenic KRAS. HBP1 is identified as a potential therapeutic target for intervening pancreatitis and PanIN progression.

title: stDGAC: A novel identifying spatial domains method via graph attention contrastive network for spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel method named stDGAC for identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data. It utilizes a denoising autoencoder for dimensionality reduction and denoising, followed by a graph attention contrastive network to learn robust representations by aggregating neighborhood information. The method demonstrates superior performance in downstream analyses like spatial domain identification, trajectory inference, and gene expression data denoising.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Innovations to Improve Design and Representativeness in Oncology Clinical Trials.
data_modalities_used: ['radiomics', 'computational pathology', 'spatial omics', 'digital health technologies', 'wearable devices', 'electronic sensors']
main_goals: This paper reviews the use cases of AI and ML in oncology clinical trials, focusing on enhancing design, representativeness, patient recruitment, trial operations, data management, and diagnostics. It highlights the potential of these technologies to make clinical trials more adaptive, data-driven, and inclusive to improve patient outcomes, particularly in Phase II and III trials.

title: GCNLA: Inferring Cell-Cell Interactions From Spatial Transcriptomics With Long Short-Term Memory and Graph Convolutional Networks.
biological_context: Cell-cell interactions in diverse biological tissues
main_goals: Propose a network architecture (GCNLA) using GCN and LSTM for inferring cell-cell interactions from spatial transcriptomics. GCNLA captures spatial structure and distal cell interactions, enhancing feature extraction with an attention module. The method demonstrates robustness and noise immunity, enabling downstream analyses like cell clustering.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Identified Fatty Acid-Binding Proteins Controlling Endothelial Glycolytic and Arterial Programming in Pulmonary Hypertension.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'immunostaining', 'Bulk RNA sequencing (RNA-seq)', 'single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'plasma proteome analysis']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'Bulk RNA sequencing (RNA-seq)']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of endothelial fatty acid-binding proteins (FABP4/5) in the pathogenesis of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). It used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, along with other experimental techniques, to identify FABP4/5 as key regulators of endothelial glycolysis and arterial programming in PAH, demonstrating their therapeutic potential.

title: Brain-wide 3D neuron detection and mapping with deep learning.
main_goals: To introduce NeuronMapper, a brain-wide 3D neuron detection and mapping approach using deep learning. The method enables accurate detection and localization of somata at the one million level within the mouse brain, demonstrating superior performance for whole-brain 3D soma detection.

title: Insights into early acne pathogenesis: Exploring intercellular dynamics and key dysregulated genes.
main_goals: The paper aims to explore comprehensive changes and shared dysregulated signaling pathways in early-stage acne by analyzing cell communication using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies dysregulated genes related to inflammation and hyperkeratinization, proposes new markers across various skin cell types, and discusses potential FDA-approved treatments targeting key pathways.

title: A single-cell spatial chart of the airway wall reveals proinflammatory cellular ecosystems and their interactions in health and asthma.
biological_context: Airway wall in health and asthma
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To apply single-cell spatial transcriptomics to reveal the airway wall landscape in health and during asthma, identifying proinflammatory cellular ecosystems and their interactions. The study aims to provide insights into the mechanisms driving asthma and identify targets for therapeutic intervention by revealing distinct cellular ecosystems within spatial niches.

title: A self-supervised learning approach for high throughput and high content cell segmentation.
biological_context: Cell segmentation in high-throughput and high-content imaging
main_goals: Introduce a self-supervised learning (SSL) method for pixel classification to enable automated, high-throughput cell segmentation. The method trains itself on user data without parameter tuning or curated datasets, demonstrating versatility across magnifications, optical modalities, and cell types, and identifying complex cellular structures.

title: Gain-of-function PPM1D mutations attenuate ischemic stroke.
main_goals: This study identifies gain-of-function PPM1D mutations in ischemic stroke patients, revealing a protective role of PPM1D against ischemic brain injury. It elucidates the mechanism involving PPARα-mediated fatty acid metabolism and introduces a pharmacological stabilizer, T2755, as a potential therapy.

title: Optimized segmentation of overlapping cervical cells based on Mask2Former and denoising.
biological_context: Cervical cytology images for cancer screening
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel transformer-based neural network for segmenting overlapping cervical cells. The method utilizes denoising with Mask2Former and incorporates class embeddings and noised ground truth masks into the decoder for improved performance in precise mask prediction.

title: Exploring the untapped potential of single-cell and spatial omics in plant biology.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptome', 'chromatin accessibility profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiomics', 'lineage tracing', 'molecular recording', 'genetic perturbation phenotyping', 'chemical perturbation phenotyping']
main_goals: This review highlights the current applications of single-cell and spatial omics technologies in plant research and introduces emerging approaches with the potential to transform the field. It discusses the generation of cell atlases and the potential of new technologies like multiomics and lineage tracing. The review also points out the need to overcome plant-specific barriers and leverage community efforts for progress.

title: Targeting mitochondrial complex I of CD177<sup>+</sup> neutrophils alleviates lung ischemia-reperfusion injury.
biological_context: Lung ischemia-reperfusion injury and primary graft dysfunction following lung transplantation
main_goals: This study identifies CD177+ neutrophils as a key contributor to lung ischemia-reperfusion injury (IRI) and primary graft dysfunction. It demonstrates that targeting mitochondrial complex I in these neutrophils alleviates lung injury in experimental models.

title: A Spatial Metabolomics Annotation Workflow Leveraging Cyclic Ion Mobility and Machine Learning-Predicted Collision Cross Sections.
main_goals: This study introduces a spatial metabolomics annotation workflow that leverages cyclic ion mobility and machine learning-predicted collision cross sections. The workflow aims to enhance the confidence of metabolite annotations in mass spectrometry imaging data, particularly for lipids. It demonstrates the ability of high-accuracy CCS measurements to improve annotation accuracy, distinguish isobaric lipids, and aid in the annotation of unknown features.

title: Integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis reveals MDK-NCL pathway's role in shaping the immunosuppressive environment of lung adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular composition of the tumor microenvironment in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and assesses the role of the MDK-NCL signaling pathway. The findings reveal that LUAD cells utilize the MDK-NCL pathway to shape an immunosuppressive microenvironment, promoting malignancy and immune evasion, thus highlighting it as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Pyroptosis drives tumor progression and immune evasion in Hepatocellular Carcinoma: a single-cell and spatial transcriptomic study.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'bulk RNA-seq data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates pyroptosis-related gene expression in HCC, identifying CHMP4B as a key gene influencing prognosis and the tumor microenvironment. It aims to elucidate CHMP4B's role in tumor progression and immune evasion, suggesting its potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target.

title: Multimodal spatial proteomic profiling in acute myeloid leukemia.
main_goals: The study optimized a high-throughput pipeline for spatial immunofluorescence and mass cytometry imaging to profile immune, tumor, and structural components in AML. It identified tertiary lymphoid-like aggregates in bone marrow and found signatures predictive of outcomes in AML. The work opens possibilities for discovering novel structures and interactions underpinning leukemic immune response.

title: Real-time driver drowsiness detection using transformer architectures: a novel deep learning approach.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel deep learning-based framework for real-time driver drowsiness detection using transformer architectures. The framework integrates advanced data preprocessing and utilizes models like ViT and Swin Transformer to achieve high accuracy. It also includes a real-time scoring mechanism and Class Activation Mapping for interpretability, aiming to improve road safety.

title: Decoding the impact of MMP1+ malignant subsets on tumor-immune interactions: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To investigate MMP1 expression, its cellular localization, and its impact on tumor progression and immune modulation using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand MMP1's role in the tumor-immune microenvironment and explore its potential as a therapeutic target.

title: Phenotypic heterogeneity and plasticity in colorectal cancer metastasis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates phenotypic heterogeneity and plasticity in colorectal cancer metastasis. Using single-cell multiomics and spatial transcriptomics, it identifies cancer cell states resembling metastasis-initiating cells and their regulators (AP-1, NF-κB) in an immunosuppressive niche. The findings aim to reveal targets to impair metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics advances the use of canine patients in cancer research: analysis of osteosarcoma-bearing pet dogs enrolled in a clinical trial.
main_goals: This study presents the first application of the GeoMx Canine Cancer Atlas to outcome-linked samples from canine osteosarcoma patients. It analyzes gene and pathway enrichment associated with disease-free interval in these patients, aiming to validate the utility of the canine model for human cancer research.

title: High-Sensitivity PD-L1 Staining Using Clone 73-10 Antibody and Spatial Transcriptomics for Precise Expression Analysis in Non-Tumorous, Intraepithelial Neoplasia, and Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: To evaluate PD-L1 (CD274) expression using a highly sensitive clone (73-10) and spatial transcriptomics in HNSCC, intraepithelial neoplasia, and normal mucosa. The study aimed to understand the role of PD-L1 in HNSCC and potentially expand patient eligibility for immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

title: OrthologAL: a Shiny application for quality-aware humanization of non-human pre-clinical high-dimensional gene expression data.
biological_context: Preclinical research models, including patient-derived orthotopic xenografts of medulloblastoma, and mouse and rat models of spinal cord injury.
main_goals: To facilitate human orthologous conversion of non-human transcriptomes and the application of pharmacotranscriptomic databases to pre-clinical research models. OrthologAL provides an R package and Shiny GUI to convert non-human gene expression data into human orthologs, preserving data architecture and enabling use with human-derived pharmacotranscriptomic databases.

title: [New technologies serve as accelerators for breakthroughs in modern acupuncture research].
main_goals: This paper provides a systematic review of the history of modern acupuncture research. It highlights how technological advancements have validated acupuncture's effects and elucidated its mechanisms. The paper also prospects the role of emerging technologies in future acupuncture research.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal PI3K-AKT and metabolic alterations in aggressive, treatment-resistant lactotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumors.
biological_context: Aggressive, treatment-resistant lactotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumors (PitNET)
data_modalities_used: ['Visium Spatial Transcriptomics', 'whole transcriptome sequencing', 'whole exome sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Deconvolution']
main_goals: To unravel the molecular heterogeneity of lactotroph PitNET and identify biomarkers of aggressiveness and resistance to pharmacological treatment using spatial transcriptomics and other sequencing methods. The study aimed to identify molecular targets for therapeutic strategies.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell analysis elucidates the cellular and molecular dynamics of human cornea aging.
main_goals: This study elucidates the spatiotemporal cellular and molecular dynamics of human cornea aging using single-cell RNA sequencing and scStereo-seq. It identifies novel cell subpopulations, maps the spatial positioning of limbal stem cells, and delineates intercellular interactions. The findings reveal an age-related centripetal migration pattern of basal cells and differential regional characteristics of the corneal endothelium, providing a resource for understanding corneal homeostasis and advancing related research.

title: Crosstalk between kidney and bones: New perspective for modulating osteoporosis.
biological_context: Kidney-bone crosstalk in osteoporosis and chronic kidney disease
main_goals: This review synthesizes evidence from molecular biology to clinical perspectives on the interplay between kidney and bone. It aims to establish a foundation for the development of more complex and physiologically relevant in vitro models and to propose potential therapeutic strategies for osteoporosis.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis revealed cellular heterogeneity of glycosyltransferases in cervical cancer, and identified GALNT3-negative epithelial cells as a protective factor: a retrospective cohort study based on public database.
main_goals: This study explored the role of glycosyltransferases (GTs) in cervical cancer using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified GALNT3-negative epithelial cells as a protective factor, correlating with reduced tumor-associated macrophages and myeloid-derived suppressor cells, and demonstrated the impact of GALNT3 expression on cancer cell behavior in vitro.

title: Integrating Spatial and Single-Nucleus Transcriptomic Data to Assess the Effects of Intrauterine Hyperglycemia on Fetal Pancreatic Development.
biological_context: Fetal pancreatic development under maternal pregestational diabetes mellitus
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To investigate the specific impacts of maternal pregestational diabetes mellitus (PGDM) on cellular functions and intercellular communication within the fetal pancreas. The study aims to reveal cellular responses, spatial changes, and molecular mechanisms underlying fetal pancreatic response to maternal PGDM.

title: Precision Medicine in Pediatric Autoimmunity: Leniolisib Treatment of Childhood-Onset Lupus Nephritis Due to Activated PI3K-Delta Syndrome (APDS).
biological_context: Childhood-onset Lupus Nephritis (LN) in Activated PI3K-delta Syndrome type 1 (APDS1)
data_modalities_used: ['MIBI-TOF (Multiplexed Ion Beam Imaging Time-of-Flight Spectrometry)', 'flow cytometry', 'clinical parameters']
main_goals: To investigate the mechanistic underpinnings and treatment response of lupus nephritis (LN) in activated PI3K-delta syndrome type 1 (APDS1) using pathway-specific therapy and advanced spatial proteomics. The study aimed to characterize the kidney tissue immune architecture in APDS1-LN and compare it to typical childhood-onset LN and healthy controls. It also evaluated the therapeutic response to leniolisib, a selective PI3Kδ inhibitor.

title: Region- and cell type-specific changes in gene expression in the cerebellum after classical fear conditioning.
main_goals: Investigate transcriptional changes in the cerebellum associated with auditory fear conditioning using spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing. Highlight region- and cell-type-specific molecular adaptations in the cerebellum contributing to non-motor learning.

title: Paired mutation calling and spatial transcriptomics identify cellular neighbourhoods dictating the neoplastic outcome of colitis.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo lineage tracing', 'mutational profiling']
main_goals: This study investigates how the cellular environment impacts the progression from inflammatory bowel disease to cancer by combining lineage tracing, computational modeling, mutational profiling, and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify epithelial- and immune-enriched neighborhoods that facilitate tumor initiation by promoting the selection and expansion of pro-oncogenic clones.

title: Spatially Resolved Panoramic in vivo CRISPR Screen via Perturb-DBiT.
biological_context: human cancer metastatic colonization model, immune-competent syngeneic mouse model
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: Perturb-DBiT is a novel approach for simultaneous co-sequencing of spatial total RNA whole-transcriptome and sgRNAs on the same tissue section. It enables unbiased discovery of how genetic perturbations influence RNA regulation, cellular dynamics, and tissue architecture in situ. The method provides a spatially resolved comprehensive view of perturbation responses in complex tissues, including impacts on lncRNAs, microRNAs, tRNAs, clonal dynamics, and immune interactions.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Explore Purine Metabolism-Related Prognostic Risk Model and Tumor Immune Microenvironment Modulation in Ovarian Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Pseudotime analysis', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Prognostic modeling', 'Tumor microenvironment analysis', 'Immunotherapy association analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to explore purine metabolism-related prognostic risk models and their impact on the tumor immune microenvironment in ovarian cancer. It uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify key genes and cellular behaviors associated with prognosis and immunotherapy response.

title: Navigating nanotoxicity: Unraveling nanomaterial-induced effects via multi-omics integration.
biological_context: Nanomaterial toxicity in biological systems (humans and animals)
main_goals: To provide a practical roadmap for integrating omics technologies, including single-cell and spatial approaches, in the study of nanomaterial toxicity. It highlights the need for new bioinformatics tools and standardized analysis processes to address challenges in data integration and complexity.

title: Evolution trajectory and driving mechanism of the synergistic effect on construction waste and carbon reduction: Evidence from China.
main_goals: This paper analyzes the evolution trajectory and driving mechanism of the synergistic effect on construction waste (CW) and carbon emission (CE) reduction in China. It uses Coupling Coordination Degree (CCD), Exploratory Spatial Data Analysis (ESDA), and Geographically Weighted Regression (GWR) models to study the spatial correlation and driving mechanisms. The findings aim to provide insights for government policies on regional sustainability.

title: Metabolism-associated marker gene-based predictive model for prognosis, targeted therapy, and immune landscape in ovarian cancer: an integrative analysis of single-cell and bulk RNA sequencing with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to identify metabolism-associated marker genes (MRGs) to develop a prognostic model for ovarian cancer (OC). The model is used to explore targeted therapies, predict immune landscape, and understand the biological functions linked to metabolism in OC. The study also validates the prognostic ability of a specific MRG, TREM1, and identifies potential therapeutic drugs.

title: Non-destructive prediction of the moisture content of individual wheat kernels combining hyperspectral imaging and WGAN data augmentation algorithm.
biological_context: Wheat kernel quality and safety monitoring
main_goals: This study proposes a novel approach combining hyperspectral imaging with a WGAN data augmentation algorithm to accurately predict the moisture content of individual wheat kernels. It aims to improve grain quality and safety monitoring by developing optimized regression models and visualizing the spatial distribution of moisture.

title: Crosstalk of glutamine metabolism between cancer-associated fibroblasts and cancer cells.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment, Cancer cells, Cancer-associated fibroblasts
main_goals: This review highlights the key processes of glutamine uptake, transport, and catabolism, and explores the metabolic crosstalk between cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and cancer cells. It also examines the roles of major oncogenic regulators in controlling glutamine metabolism and shaping therapeutic resistance, discusses current pharmacological approaches, and underscores the importance of integrating advanced technologies like artificial intelligence and spatial omics.

title: The Role of Omics Techniques in Diabetic Wound Healing: Recent Insights into the Application of Single-Cell RNA Sequencing, Bulk RNA Sequencing, Spatial Transcriptomics, and Proteomics.
main_goals: This review outlines the latest application of omics technologies (proteomics, bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics) in diabetic wound healing research. It highlights recent findings and their potential for developing targeted therapies for Diabetic Foot Ulcers (DFUs). The paper aims to enhance understanding of DFU molecular function and mechanisms by discussing these advanced technologies.

title: Spatiotemporal dynamic changes of meningeal microenvironment influence meningeal lymphatic function following subarachnoid hemorrhage: from inflammatory response to tissue remodeling.
main_goals: To investigate the meningeal transcriptional response post-SAH and elucidate the dynamic influence of the meningeal microenvironment on meningeal lymphatic function. The study aimed to characterize spatiotemporal dynamic changes in the early meningeal microenvironment post-SAH and validate findings in a mouse model.

title: Advances in spatial transcriptomics and its application in the musculoskeletal system.
main_goals: This review summarizes recent advances in spatial transcriptomics and its application to the musculoskeletal system. It outlines data acquisition techniques, workflows, and the role of spatial transcriptomics in understanding physiological mechanisms and diseases of the musculoskeletal system. Challenges and future directions are also discussed.

title: Macrophage sensitivity to bexmarilimab-induced reprogramming is shaped by the tumor microenvironment.
data_modalities_used: ['patient-derived explant culture', 'RNA sequencing', 'multiplex cytokine profiling', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study explored the responsiveness of tumor microenvironments to bexmarilimab, a macrophage reprogramming therapy, using patient-derived explant cultures. It characterized responses via RNA sequencing and multiplex cytokine profiling, and investigated effects of Clever-1+ macrophages and TME features using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings revealed that the inflammatory state of the TME is the primary determinant of response and emphasized the need for patient selection.

title: Protocol to analyze marrow B lineage cell dynamics by in vivo three-photon microscopy in intact mouse tibia.
biological_context: Marrow B lineage cell dynamics in mouse tibia
main_goals: Presents a protocol for time-lapse 3D imaging of B lymphocytes in the tibia marrow of fluorescent reporter mice using three-photon microscopy. Details steps for microscope performance verification, tibia imaging, and cell dynamics analysis including denoising, segmentation, and tracking.

title: Deep learning techniques for detecting freezing of gait episodes in Parkinson's disease using wearable sensors.
main_goals: The paper presents a novel hybrid deep learning framework (CNNs, BiLSTM, attention) for detecting Freezing of Gait (FoG) episodes in Parkinson's Disease patients using wearable sensors. The model is designed for robustness against sensor noise, inter-subject variability, and data imbalance, and optimized for real-time deployment on edge devices.

title: Deciphering the Immunomodulatory Function of GSN<sup>+</sup> Inflammatory Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts in Renal Cell Carcinoma Immunotherapy: Insights From Pan-Cancer Single-Cell Landscape and Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis.
biological_context: Renal cell carcinoma (specifically clear cell renal cell carcinoma) and pan-cancer immunotherapy
data_modalities_used: ['pan-cancer single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments', 'real-world immunotherapy data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['machine learning', 'spatial gene expression analysis', 'cell-cell interaction analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to decipher the immunomodulatory function of GSN+ inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts (iCAFs) in renal cell carcinoma immunotherapy. It introduces the Caf.Sig model, a machine learning-based tool for predicting immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) response using CAF gene signatures. The research also investigates the mechanisms by which GSN+ iCAFs influence ICI efficacy and suggests therapeutic strategies for upregulating GSN.

title: Single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal FAS+ T cell and autophagy-related signatures predicting chemoimmunotherapy response in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma patients.
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate the prognostic effect of autophagy-related genes (ARGs) in DLBCL. It identified prognostic ARGs and constructed an autophagy-related model to divide patients into risk groups. The research also identified FAS+ T cells as a biomarker for favorable prognosis.

title: Deciphering the role of acetylation-related gene NAT10 in colon cancer progression and immune evasion: implications for overcoming drug resistance.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Survival Analysis', 'Mendelian randomization']
main_goals: This study aimed to decipher the role of acetylation-related gene NAT10 in colon cancer progression and immune evasion, investigating its implications for overcoming drug resistance. The research utilized multi-omics analyses to identify NAT10 as a factor associated with tumor progression, metastasis, and immune escape characteristics in colon cancer, suggesting it as a potential biomarker and therapeutic target.

title: Recent advances in multimodal approaches for investigating placental development and related diseases.
main_goals: This review summarizes recent advances in multimodal placental research, highlighting key technologies and contributions from Chinese research teams. It discusses challenges and future prospects in integrating multimodal data with AI and wearable technologies for precision obstetrics.

title: SagMSI: A graph convolutional network framework for precise spatial segmentation in mass spectrometry imaging.
main_goals: This paper introduces SagMSI, a novel unsupervised graph convolutional network (GCN)-based framework for precise spatial segmentation in Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI). It combines spatial-aware graph construction with a GCN module to effectively capture structural information and enable accurate segmentation of complex tissue structures. SagMSI aims to provide deeper insights into spatial omics by integrating biomolecular profiling and spatial adjacency.

title: Targeting mesenchymal monocyte-derived macrophages to enhance the sensitivity of glioblastoma to temozolomide by inhibiting TNF/CELSR2/p65/Kla-HDAC1/EPAS1 axis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'patient-derived GBM organoids', 'intracranial orthotopic GBM model', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify a subtype of monocyte-derived macrophages (MDM) that contribute to temozolomide (TMZ) resistance in glioblastoma (GBM) and to elucidate the mechanisms involved. The study aims to demonstrate that targeting these mesenchymal MDMs enhances GBM sensitivity to TMZ and to provide a potential therapeutic strategy for MES-subtype GBM.

title: A fast hyperspectral change detection algorithm for agricultural crops based on spatial reconstruction.
main_goals: The paper introduces a Fast Hyperspectral Change Detection algorithm based on Spatial Reconstruction (FHCDSR) for agricultural crops. The method aims to improve accuracy and computational efficiency in identifying subtle agricultural changes using hyperspectral imagery and bi-temporal analysis. It incorporates boundary-constrained preprocessing, Laplacian-regularized spatial reconstruction, and a novel tensor-based change detection framework.

title: Motion-based dynamic light delivery to minimize laser-related thermal damage while preserving photoacoustic image quality.
main_goals: This paper introduces a dynamic light delivery strategy for photoacoustic imaging to minimize laser-related thermal damage while preserving image quality. By displacing the light source, the energy density at the tissue surface is reduced, leading to less hemorrhage in histological samples. The method maintains comparable signal-to-noise and contrast-to-noise ratios to stationary light delivery.

title: A 4D atlas of diffusion-informed spatial smoothing windows for BOLD signal in white matter.
main_goals: This paper introduces diffusion-informed spatial smoothing (DSS) windows for fMRI data in white matter, derived from an atlas of fiber orientation distribution functions. The method aims to improve smoothing of white matter signals when diffusion MRI data is not readily available for individual subjects. The atlas-based DSS windows result in higher local functional connectivity and better agreement with diffusion MRI-based atlases.

title: Cell-type deconvolution methods for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This review describes diverse cell-type deconvolution methods for spatial transcriptomics. It contrasts their capabilities and summarizes them in an interactive table to enable efficient method selection, aiding the description of tissue architectures in health and disease.

title: Analysis of spatial effects and influencing factors of rural industrial integration in China.
main_goals: This paper analyzes the spatial effects and influencing factors of rural industrial integration in China. It uses an evaluation index system to measure integration levels, employing ArcGIS and exploratory spatial data analysis to understand spatial distribution and analyze influencing factors. The study identifies an increasing trend in integration, significant regional disparities, and polarized agglomeration, suggesting improvements to benefit linkage mechanisms and inter-regional cooperation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals human cortical layer and area specification.
main_goals: This study uses MERFISH and deep learning to spatially map human fetal cortical development. It reveals the early establishment of cortical layers and identifies distinct modes of areal specification, including an abrupt boundary between V1 and V2 visual cortices. The findings highlight the role of spatial relationships in cortical development.

title: Subcellular level spatial transcriptomics with PHOTON.
biological_context: Ovary (granulosa cells), stress granules, nucleoli, mitochondria
main_goals: PHOTON is presented as a method combining high-resolution imaging with high-throughput sequencing for subcellular spatial transcriptome profiling. It enables accurate transcriptome capture in situ at the tissue level and within subcellular compartments. The method is demonstrated to reveal functional roles of RNA modifications on RNA partitioning.

title: Sequence Diversity and Encoded Enzymatic Differences of Monocistronic L1 ORF2 mRNA Variants in the Aged Normal and Alzheimer's Disease Brain.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'PacBio HiFi long-read sequencing', 'enzymatic functional assays']
main_goals: This study assessed endogenous RT activities and L1 mRNA diversity from cerebral cortex samples of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and nondiseased (ND) brains. It identified monocistronic ORF2 transcripts and investigated their functional differences and impact on genomic mosaicism in the aged brain.

title: Sociodemographic predictors of missed and delayed health care among older Australians during the COVID-19 pandemic: Findings from the 45 and up COVID Insights study.
biological_context: Healthcare access among older Australians during the COVID-19 pandemic
main_goals: This study examines sociodemographic predictors of missed or delayed healthcare among older Australians during the COVID-19 pandemic. It identifies three temporal patterns of missed/delayed care and highlights the need for targeted policy responses to address disparities.

title: Genomic evolution reshapes cell-type diversification in the amniote brain.
biological_context: Amniote brain evolution and cell-type diversification
main_goals: The study created a single-cell atlas of over 1.3 million cells from the telencephalon and cerebellum of various amniotes using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies species-specific variations in cell types and highlights differences between birds and mammals in telencephalon excitatory neurons and cerebellar cell types. The research also identified a bird-specific Purkinje cell subtype and implicates the LSD1/KDM1A pathway in learning and circadian rhythms.

title: A novel CNN-LSTM model with attention mechanism for online monitoring of moisture content in fluidized bed granulation process based on near-infrared spectroscopy.
main_goals: This study proposes a novel deep learning model (CNN-LSTM-Attention) for online monitoring of moisture content in fluidized bed granulation processes using near-infrared spectroscopy. The model integrates CNN for spatial feature extraction, LSTM for sequence processing, and attention mechanisms for global correlation capture. It aims to improve predictive accuracy and reduce the need for elaborate preprocessing compared to traditional methods like PLS and SVM.

title: Spatial integration of multi-omics data from serial sections using the novel Multi-Omics Imaging Integration Toolset.
main_goals: The paper presents the Multi-Omics Imaging Integration Toolset (MIIT), a Python framework for integrating spatially resolved multi-omics data from serial sections. A key component is the novel non-rigid registration algorithm, GreedyFHist, validated on serial sections. MIIT aims to enable the correlation of gene signatures with metabolic measurements from different spatial omics modalities.

title: MMsurv: a multimodal multi-instance multi-cancer survival prediction model integrating pathological images, clinical information, and sequencing data.
main_goals: This study presents MMSurv, an interpretable multimodal deep learning model to predict survival in different types of cancer by integrating pathological images, clinical information, and sequencing data. It introduces a novel fusion method combining compact bilinear pooling and Transformer architecture for multimodal data integration. The model demonstrates improved predictive accuracy compared to single-modal approaches.

title: A deep neural network for adaptive spatial smoothing of task fMRI data.
main_goals: This study introduces a deep neural network (DNN) for adaptive spatial smoothing of task fMRI data. The method aims to improve spatial specificity in subject-level analysis without significantly increasing computational costs, making it suitable for ultrahigh-resolution fMRI. It incorporates brain tissue properties for more accurate brain activation characterization.

title: Altered functional connectivity strength between structurally and functionally affected brain regions in visual snow syndrome.
main_goals: To investigate the resting-state functional connectivity between structurally and functionally affected brain regions in individuals with Visual Snow Syndrome (VSS) and its relation to VSS symptoms and oculomotor measures. The study aimed to identify differences in connectivity strength between VSS patients and healthy controls, and explore correlations with symptom severity and perceived disruptiveness.

title: snPATHO-seq: A Detailed Protocol for Single Nucleus RNA Sequencing From FFPE.
biological_context: Breast cancer (mentioned as an example of diverse FFPE samples)
main_goals: The paper presents snPATHO-seq, a novel workflow for generating high-quality single-nucleus transcriptomic data from FFPE tissues. It optimizes nuclei isolation and leverages short RNA probes with the 10x Genomics Flex assay to overcome RNA degradation. The method aims to provide superior data quality compared to existing FFPE workflows, enabling high-resolution transcriptomics of archival samples.

title: Dynamic Deformation Analysis of Super High-Rise Buildings Based on GNSS and Accelerometer Fusion.
main_goals: This study proposes and validates a data fusion algorithm (NRBO-FMD optimization with ARKF) for dynamic displacement analysis of super-tall buildings using GNSS and accelerometer data. The method aims to mitigate noise and errors from individual sensors to achieve high-precision displacement reconstruction and identify structural dynamic response frequencies.

title: New Insights and Implications of Cell-Cell Interactions in Developmental Biology.
main_goals: This paper reviews the exponential increase in cell-cell interaction (CCI) works in developmental biology from 2008 to 2023. It categorizes 93 analytical tools and 39 databases, demonstrating their utility. The paper also scrutinizes challenges and limitations in the field.

title: Spatial Omics in Clinical Research: A Comprehensive Review of Technologies and Guidelines for Applications.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Omics Technologies', 'Analytical Methods', 'Validation Strategies', 'Clinical Applications', 'Multi-omics Pipelines', 'Computational Tools']
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of key spatial omics technologies, their analytical methods, validation strategies, and clinical applications. It discusses how spatial omics is transforming precision medicine, biomarker discovery, and personalized therapy. The paper highlights the need for improved standardization, reproducibility, and multimodal data integration.

title: Integrating GWAS and spatial omics.
main_goals: This paper reviews the integration of Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) with spatial omics data. It explores the methods and challenges in combining these datasets to gain deeper biological insights.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals an anti-tumor neutrophil subgroup in microwave thermochemotherapy-treated lip cancer.
biological_context: Lip squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) treated with microwave thermochemotherapy (MTC)
main_goals: This study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the role of tumor-associated neutrophils (TANs) in lip cancer treated with microwave thermochemotherapy. It identifies an anti-tumor neutrophil subgroup (N1-phenotype) characterized by specific markers and functions, and describes their interaction with fibroblasts to form a defense wall against LSCC. The study also proposes a marker (MX2) for predicting prognosis and uses deep learning to predict its expression from H&E images.

title: Combining spatial transcriptomics with tissue morphology.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This review introduces a framework for categorizing methods that combine spatial transcriptomics with tissue morphology. It focuses on translation (using morphology to predict gene expression) and integration (enriching spatial transcriptomics with morphological features). The paper also explores learning strategies and future directions in this emerging field.

title: Tissular chromatin-state cartography based on double-barcoded DNA arrays that capture unloaded PA-Tn5 transposase.
main_goals: To present a strategy for capturing chromatin histone modification signatures across tissue sections using double-barcoded DNA arrays compatible with in situ Protein A-transposase Tn5 tagmentation. This approach allows for the interrogation of active promoter signatures and reveals changes in chromatin states across tissues by integrating multiple histone modifications.

title: Spatial Multiomics Toward Understanding Neurological Systems.
biological_context: Neurological Systems, Alzheimer's disease, Autism Spectrum Disorder
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'mass spectrometry imaging', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'epigenetics', 'multimodal imaging']
main_goals: This paper reviews the advancement of spatial multiomics for understanding neurological systems. It highlights the importance of integrating various omics technologies, such as metabolomics, transcriptomics, and proteomics, to capture the complex molecular landscape of brain function and disease. Future directions are discussed, including the incorporation of epigenetics and nanoscale imaging.

title: Harmonizing TUNEL with multiplexed iterative immunofluorescence enriches spatial contextualization of cell death.
biological_context: Acetaminophen-induced hepatocyte necrosis and dexamethasone-induced adrenocortical apoptosis
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed iterative labeling by antibody neodeposition (MILAN)', 'TUNEL', 'spatial proteomics', 'immunofluorescence', 'cyclic immunofluorescence (CycIF)']
main_goals: This paper evaluates variations of the TUNEL protocol for compatibility with multiplexed iterative labeling by antibody neodeposition (MILAN) and cyclic immunofluorescence (CycIF). The goal is to harmonize TUNEL with spatial proteomics to enhance the spatial contextualization of cell death in complex tissues. The study found that antibody-based TUNEL with pressure cooker retrieval can be flexibly integrated into MILAN staining series and is compatible with CycIF.

title: Multi-omics Analysis Reveals the Propagation Mechanism of Ferroptosis in Acute Kidney Injury.
data_modalities_used: ['snRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'mouse model of bilateral renal ischemia-reperfusion injury']
main_goals: This study analyzes snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data to elucidate the propagation mechanism of ferroptosis in acute kidney injury. It identifies key genes (GPX4, FTH1, FTL) and transcription factors (KLF6) involved in ferroptosis and reveals a subpopulation of proximal tubule cells associated with this process.

title: Mass spectrometry-based metabolomic as a powerful tool to unravel the component and mechanism in TCM.
main_goals: This review comprehensively examines the applications of MS-based metabolomics in elucidating TCM efficacy, spanning chemical composition analysis, molecular target identification, mechanism-of-action studies, and syndrome differentiation. It highlights recent innovations and challenges, and presents a forward-looking perspective on clinical translation and internationalization of TCM research.

title: INHBA<sup>+</sup> macrophages and Pro-inflammatory CAFs are associated with distinctive immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment in submucous Fibrosis-Derived oral squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) derived from oral submucosal fibrosis (OSF)
main_goals: This paper investigates the distinctive tumor immunosuppressive microenvironment (TISME) in oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) derived from oral submucosal fibrosis (ODSCC) compared to OSCC without OSF history (NODSCC). It identifies INHBA+ macrophages and pro-inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts (iCAFs) as key components contributing to a more severe TISME in ODSCC, potentially impacting immunotherapy sensitivity.

title: Development of a machine learning-based predictive risk model combining fatty acid metabolism and ferroptosis for immunotherapy response and prognosis in prostate cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study developed a machine learning-based prognostic model for prostate cancer by integrating fatty acid metabolism and ferroptosis. The model stratifies patients into risk groups, predicts immunotherapy response, and identifies potential therapeutic targets, validated using multi-omics data and spatial transcriptomics.

title: High-resolution spatial transcriptomics and cell lineage analysis reveal spatiotemporal cell fate determination during craniofacial development.
main_goals: The paper reports a high-resolution spatiotemporal transcriptomic and cell-type atlas of cranial neural crest cell-derived mesenchymal lineage diversification during mouse palatogenesis. It reveals mesenchymal lineage establishment at or prior to palatogenesis initiation and identifies a heterogeneous Sox9+ mesenchymal progenitor population. The study demonstrates that distinct mesenchymal populations are established early, preceding palatal development.

title: STCC enhances spatial domain detection through consensus clustering of spatial transcriptomics data.
biological_context: Normal tissue samples and tumor samples exhibiting layered structure or scattered cell type distribution patterns
main_goals: This paper introduces STCC, a novel consensus clustering framework for spatial transcriptomics data. It aggregates outcomes from state-of-the-art tools to improve spatial domain detection accuracy and stability. The framework utilizes various consensus strategies and demonstrates improved performance on simulated and real data.

title: What single-cell RNA sequencing taught us about MGMT expression in glioblastoma.
main_goals: This study evaluated MGMT expression at the single-cell level in glioblastoma using publicly available single-cell sequencing data. It aimed to understand the relationship between MGMT expression and MGMT promoter methylation status in tumor cells, contrasting with previous bulk methods.

title: Hypoxia-induced RHCG as a key regulator in psoriasis and its modulation by secukinumab.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'bulk data analysis', 'ex vivo experiments', 'clinical specimens']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of RHCG in psoriasis pathogenesis, particularly its induction by hypoxia and its modulation by secukinumab. The authors used bioinformatics and experimental approaches to show that RHCG upregulation in psoriatic skin enhances keratinocyte proliferation markers and activates dendritic cells. Secukinumab treatment effectively reduced RHCG expression, suggesting RHCG as a target for psoriasis therapy.

title: Advances in Spatial Multi-Omics: A Review of Multi-Modal Mass Spectrometry Imaging and Laser Capture Microdissection-LCMS Integration.
main_goals: This review focuses on mass spectrometry-based spatial omics, specifically matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI). It explores how MALDI-MSI, in combination with laser capture microdissection (LCM) and traditional liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry (LC-MS) workflow, is advancing spatially resolved multi-omics research.

title: [Characterization of protective effects of Jianpi Tongluo Formula on cartilage in knee osteoarthritis from a single cell-spatial heterogeneity perspective].
data_modalities_used: ['single cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction', 'Western blot', 'immunohistochemical staining']
main_goals: To systematically characterize the protective effects of Jianpi Tongluo Formula (JTF) on cartilage in knee osteoarthritis (KOA) and elucidate the underlying molecular mechanisms. The study integrates single cell and spatial transcriptomics with animal experiments to identify key pathogenic factors and assess JTF's intervention effects.

title: Major Facilitator Superfamily transporters balance sugar metabolism in peach.
main_goals: To investigate the role of Major Facilitator Superfamily (MFS) transporters in balancing sugar metabolism during peach fruit development and ripening using a multi-omics approach. The study aims to identify key transporters and genetic loci influencing sugar accumulation and quality.

title: Spatial transcriptomics highlights B cells as key contributors to a complete and durable response to chemo-immunotherapy in a patient with resectable NSCLC.
biological_context: Resectable non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with a solitary synchronous brain metastasis treated with neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy
main_goals: This study reports a case of a patient with resectable NSCLC who achieved a complete pathologic response to neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy. Using spatial transcriptomics and other molecular profiling techniques, the paper highlights the role of B cells in mediating tumor eradication and the formation of tertiary lymphoid structures, suggesting mechanisms for a durable immune response. The findings aim to guide biomarker discovery and clinical decision-making.

title: Landscape of spatial disruption of homeostasis in the middle temporal gyrus of epileptic patients.
biological_context: Epilepsy in the middle temporal gyrus of humans
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This study investigates the middle temporal gyrus (MTG) in epileptic patients using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and spatial transcriptomics (ST) to elucidate cellular and spatial disruptions associated with epilepsy. They identified cellular and layer-specific gene expression alterations, and spatial mapping revealed significant changes in key marker genes like NPY and GFAP. The study aimed to enhance understanding of the molecular and cellular underpinnings of epilepsy and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Gas Bubbles from Biodegradable Magnesium Implants Convey Mechanical Cues and Promote Immune Cell Stimulation.
biological_context: Biodegradable magnesium implants and their effect on surrounding tissue and immune cells in rats.
main_goals: This study investigates how gas bubbles from biodegradable magnesium implants influence adjacent tissue and cell behavior in rats, focusing on their biological implications, cellular responses, and the role of mechanical cues and inflammation. The findings suggest a need for controlled gas release and monitoring of bubble evolution in such implants.

title: From Multi-Omics to Visualization and Beyond: Bridging Micro and Macro Insights in CAR-T Cell Therapy.
biological_context: CAR-T cell therapy for hematological malignancies, solid tumors, and autoimmune diseases
main_goals: This review highlights recent advances in the integration of multidimensional omics within CAR-T therapy and explores cutting-edge developments in visualization technologies and AI applications. The convergence of multi-omics, visualization tools, and AI is expected to deliver transformative insights into the mechanisms governing CAR-T cell therapy.

title: Mapping the molecular signature of ABA-regulated gene expression in germinating barley embryos.
main_goals: To map ABA-regulated gene expression in germinating barley embryos using spatial transcriptomics, transcriptomics, and metabolomics. The study aimed to understand the molecular signature of ABA's role in seed germination and phytohormonal crosstalk.

title: The co-evolution and driving mechanism analysis of ecosystem services value and tourism economic resilience from 286 cities in China.
main_goals: This study analyzes the co-evolution and driving mechanisms of ecosystem service value (ESV) and tourism economic resilience (TER) in 286 Chinese cities. It uses the Coupling Coordination Degree (CCD) model, ESDA, and GWR to evaluate their interrelation, spatial patterns, and influencing factors, aiming to optimize human-environment interactions within the tourism system.

title: Differential Localization of β-Catenin Protein in CTNNB1 Mutant Endometrial Cancers Results in Distinct Transcriptional Profiles.
biological_context: Endometrioid endometrial cancers (EECs) with CTNNB1 exon 3 mutations
main_goals: This study aimed to determine downstream gene expression based on the localization of mutant β-catenin protein (nuclear vs. non-nuclear) in CTNNB1 mutant endometrial cancers. It utilized spatial transcriptomics to identify distinct transcriptional profiles associated with these localizations, revealing pathway enrichments and a novel therapeutic target (TROP2). The findings emphasize the heterogeneity of intratumor transcriptional profiles dependent on β-catenin localization.

title: Single-cell MultiOmics and spatial transcriptomics demonstrate neuroblastoma developmental plasticity.
main_goals: This study dissects the transcriptional and epigenetic landscapes governing developmental states in neuroblastoma using single-cell MultiOmics and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies developmental intermediate states and epigenetic priming critical for malignant transitions in high-risk neuroblastomas. The research also maps enhancer gene regulatory networks and microenvironments sustaining aggressive states, suggesting therapeutic targets.

title: Signals from the extracellular matrix: Region- and sex-specificity in cardiac aging.
main_goals: This paper reviews how age-specific extracellular matrix (ECM) changes in the heart contribute to altered cellular signaling, dysregulated mechanotransduction, and pro-fibrotic signaling cascades. It highlights regional and sex differences in these ECM changes and calls for new biomaterial strategies to study these complex cellular signaling events.

title: Spatial transcriptomic applications in orthopedics.
biological_context: Musculoskeletal tissues (cartilage, joints, bone, tendon, ligament, and synovium)
main_goals: This review highlights the transformative impact of spatial transcriptomics on orthopedic research. It reviews various spatial transcriptomic methods used on musculoskeletal tissues and discusses their potential for clinical diagnostics and precision medicine.
