title: Decoding the Resistin-CAP1 Pathway in Intermediate Monocytes Mediating Liver Allograft Rejection.
main_goals: This study identifies intermediate monocytes and the Resistin-CAP1 pathway as crucial mediators of liver allograft rejection. It demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting this pathway using nanogold-siRNA technology to mitigate rejection and improve graft survival.

title: All-at-once spatial proteome profiling of complex tissue context with single-cell-type resolution by proximity proteomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces Proximity Labeling for Spatial Proteomics (PSPro), a novel method for all-at-once spatial proteome profiling of complex tissues with single-cell-type resolution. PSPro combines antibody-targeted biotinylation and affinity purification, offering improved sampling precision, throughput, and proteome coverage compared to existing methods like LMD-MS and antibody-based imaging. It was applied to tumor and spleen slices, enriching thousands of proteins from ten cell types and allowing for spatial proteome heterogeneity analysis.

title: 3D reconstruction of a human Carnegie stage 9 embryo provides a snapshot of early body plan formation.
biological_context: Human embryo development at Carnegie stage 9
main_goals: This study provides a 3D reconstruction of a human Carnegie stage 9 embryo using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies diverse cell types and provides insights into early body plan formation, including hindbrain development, the isthmic organizer, neuromesodermal progenitor cells, aorta formation, and primordial germ cells.

title: Immune and Angiogenic Profiling of Mesenchymal Stem Cell Functions in a Subcutaneous Microenvironment for Allogeneic Islet Transplantation.
main_goals: This work evaluates the proangiogenic and immunomodulatory properties of mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) to enhance vascularization and modulate early-stage immune rejection pathways in the context of islet allotransplantation. It assesses vascularization and immune regulation provided by MSCs in a NICHE platform to improve islet survival and integration in diabetic rats, considering sex as a biological variable.

title: GenDiS3 database: census on the prevalence of protein domain superfamilies of known structure in the entire sequence database.
main_goals: The GenDiS3 database is presented as a repository for the genomic distribution of protein domain superfamilies of known structure. It utilizes advanced bioinformatics tools like DELTA-BLAST and HMMSCAN to identify and validate sequence homologs against a large sequence database. The database aims to bridge the gap between protein sequence information and 3D structural data, aiding functional annotation and evolutionary studies.

title: Decoding immune cell interactions during cardiac allograft vasculopathy: insights derived from bioinformatic strategies.
main_goals: This review aims to bridge the gap in understanding CAV pathogenesis by summarizing recent findings from single-cell and multi-omic approaches, highlighting key discoveries, and discussing their implications for understanding CAV progression.

title: Tumor microenvironment-driven resistance to immunotherapy in non-small cell lung cancer: strategies for Cold-to-Hot tumor transformation.
main_goals: This review highlights mechanisms of immune resistance in the tumor microenvironment of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and proposes strategies to transform cold tumors into hot tumors. It emphasizes the role of emerging players in the TME and advocates for integrative approaches combining immunotherapy with other therapies. The review also identifies cutting-edge technologies for decoding TME heterogeneity and personalizing therapeutic interventions.

title: Unraveling Tissue Complexity Through Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper provides an overview of unraveling tissue complexity using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It likely discusses the combined power of these technologies to understand biological systems at a high resolution.

title: Unravelling tumour spatiotemporal heterogeneity using spatial multimodal data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Intra- and Inter-cellular Molecular Network Inference']
main_goals: This review highlights key technologies and computational methods that have advanced spatial domain identification and their pseudo-relations, as well as inference of intra- and inter-cellular molecular networks that drive disease progression. It discusses strategies to address major challenges including data sparsity, high-dimensionality, scalability, and heterogeneity. Furthermore, it outlines how spatial multi-omics enables novel insights into disease mechanisms, advancing precision medicine and informing targeted therapies.

title: Mapping anthropogenic pressure in the Brahmani-Baitarani River Basin: a PCA-based approach.
data_modalities_used: ['Aerosol Trend', 'Degree of Urbanization Change', 'Land Use/Land Cover Change', 'Normalized Difference Moisture Index Trend', 'Normalized Difference Vegetation Index Trend', 'Observed Minus Reanalysis Temperature', 'Nightlights Change', 'Population Count Change', 'Water Balance Trend']
main_goals: This study develops and validates an objective Principal Component Analysis (PCA)-based methodology to assess and map anthropogenic pressure in the Brahmani-Baitarani River Basin. It utilizes nine key environmental stressors to construct a composite pressure index, highlighting dominant stressors and spatial variations in human impact for sustainable management.

title: Spatial multi-omics reveals the potential involvement of SPP1<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts in determining metabolic heterogeneity and promoting metastatic growth of colorectal cancer liver metastasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial regions and molecular/metabolic basis of colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It identifies SPP1+ fibroblasts as key players in determining metabolic heterogeneity and promoting metastatic growth through interactions with tumor cells.

title: DDX24 spatiotemporally orchestrates VEGF and Wnt signaling during developmental angiogenesis.
main_goals: To investigate the role of DDX24 in the spatiotemporal regulation of developmental angiogenesis by analyzing its effects on VEGF and Wnt signaling pathways in zebrafish. The study aims to understand how DDX24 deficiency impacts vascular development and to explore potential therapeutic interventions.

title: Deep learning based semantic segmentation of leukemia effected white blood cell.
main_goals: This paper proposes a new approach for segmenting white blood cells (WBCs) from blood smear images using a combination of UNet++, marker watershed algorithm, and Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (ODE). The goal is to improve accuracy and robustness in automated blood cell analysis for leukemia diagnosis. The technique enhances clinical applications by reducing error propagation during segmentation.

title: Hepatic stellate cell heterogeneity: Functional aspects and therapeutic implications.
biological_context: Liver homeostasis and disease, including fibrosis, regeneration, immunity, and carcinogenesis.
main_goals: To review the heterogeneity of Hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) in healthy, aging, and diseased livers. It focuses on cell-cell interactions and their contributions to various liver conditions and functions. The review aims to provide an updated understanding of how HSC heterogeneity contributes to liver homeostasis and disease and can be targeted for therapeutic purposes.

title: Spatial visualization provides insight into immune modulation by an L-DBF vaccine formulation against Shigella.
biological_context: Immune modulation by L-DBF vaccine formulation against Shigella
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study investigates how a two-dose regimen of L-DBF, formulated in an oil-in-water emulsion, modulates immune responses in the lung using spatial transcriptomics. The findings highlight significant changes in the lung immune landscape, including altered expression of immune cell markers and reprogramming of fibroblasts and cardiomyocytes, demonstrating the vaccine's potential to reshape lung immune architecture.

title: PAQR5 drives the malignant progression and shapes the immunosuppressive microenvironment of hepatocellular carcinoma by activating the NF-κB signaling.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single cell-RNA seq', 'Spatial transcriptomic']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular mechanisms by which PAQR5 facilitates HCC progression and contributes to the immunosuppressive microenvironment. It found that PAQR5 activates the NF-κB signaling pathway, driving proliferation, invasion, EMT, and immune escape in HCC.

title: Oncogene aberrations drive medulloblastoma progression, not initiation.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of oncogene aberrations and copy number variations in the progression of group 3/4 medulloblastoma using single-cell technologies. It demonstrates that large-scale chromosomal aberrations are early initiating events, while single-gene oncogenic events arise later and can drive tumor progression and therapy resistance. The findings also provide insights into the cellular origin and early developmental stages of medulloblastoma.

title: Heterogeneous pericoerulear neurons tune arousal and exploratory behaviours.
biological_context: Locus coeruleus (LC) regulation of arousal and exploratory behaviors
data_modalities_used: ['viral tracing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'neural circuit approaches']
main_goals: This paper identifies diverse GABAergic neurons in the peri-LC region that modulate LC firing modes to control global arousal levels and related behaviors. It defines peri-LC anatomy and molecularly characterizes LC and peri-LC cell types using viral tracing, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics. The findings highlight the heterogeneity of LC and peri-LC neuronal populations in modulating arousal and avoidance states.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tumor microenvironment heterogeneity in EBV positive diffuse large B cell lymphoma.
biological_context: Epstein-Barr Virus-positive Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (EBV+DLBCL)
main_goals: This study integrated spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to map tumor microenvironment heterogeneity in EBV+DLBCL. It identified PD-1/PD-L1 signaling as a hallmark of the immunosuppressive TME and provided preclinical evidence for PD-1/PD-L1 blockade as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Mature tertiary lymphoid structures evoke intra-tumoral T and B cell responses via progenitor exhausted CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells in head and neck cancer.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'antigen receptor sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms by which mature tertiary lymphoid structures (mTLS) in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) promote intra-tumoral T and B cell responses. It highlights the role of progenitor exhausted CD4+ T cells in activating B cells and supporting CD8+ T cell activation within mTLS. The findings suggest that mTLS are associated with improved patient survival and response to immune checkpoint blockade.

title: Pathology of Chronic Kidney Disease and Spatial Metabolomics.
main_goals: This review discusses the potential of spatial metabolomics to characterize shared cellular programs in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD). It explores specific approaches and challenges in developing spatial metabolomics signatures for CKD pathologic features.

title: Spatial transcriptional landscape of human heart failure.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'GeoMx Whole Human Transcriptome Atlas', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'sc/snRNA-seq data', 'histology images']
main_goals: To explore cell-type- and histology-specific gene expression profiles in cardiomyopathies using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to characterize the cellular composition of ventricular myocardium, identify differentially expressed genes in failing hearts, and link them to specific histological features and cell types.

title: Entropy-driven deep learning framework for epilepsy detection using electro encephalogram signals.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel deep learning framework for epilepsy detection using EEG signals. It incorporates entropy-based measures, advanced pre-processing, and a hybrid ResNet-BiLSTM architecture to improve accuracy and robustness. The goal is to provide an effective and accurate method for automatic epilepsy identification.

title: Combining Vis-NIR and NIR hyperspectral imaging techniques with a data fusion strategy for rapid and nondestructive determination of multiple nutritional qualities in flaxseed.
main_goals: To integrate Vis-NIR and NIR hyperspectral imaging with a data fusion strategy for rapid and nondestructive determination of multiple nutritional qualities (protein, oil content, stearic acid, linolenic acid, and linoleic acid) in flaxseed. The study aimed to optimize detection methods and improve the efficiency of screening high-quality flax germplasm. It explored different data preprocessing, feature selection, and regression methods to develop predictive models and visualize nutrient distribution.

title: ABCC3 Is a Differential Marker of CYP11B2-Negative Zona Glomerulosa Cells in Human Adrenal Cortex.
biological_context: Primary aldosteronism and human adrenal cortex
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of ABCC3 in the human adrenal cortex, particularly in the context of primary aldosteronism. It identifies ABCC3 as a novel marker for CYP11B2-negative zona glomerulosa cells, providing a histopathological tool to differentiate normal adrenal zonation from aldosterone-producing lesions.

title: Novel Link Between Myeloid-Specific Adenosine Deaminase 2 and CXCL10-CXCR3 Axis in Infectious ARDS.
biological_context: COVID-19 induced Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
main_goals: This study investigates the association between the monocyte-derived enzyme adenosine deaminase 2 (ADA2) and SARS-CoV-2 induced ARDS. It reveals a link between ADA2, the chemokine CXCL10, and its receptor CXCR3, particularly highlighting ADA2's expression in inflammatory monocytes within affected lungs.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal unique subpopulations of infiltrating macrophages and dendritic cells following AKI.
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA-seq analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'CITE-seq analysis', 'Gene Ontology analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the temporal, spatial, and transcriptional characteristics of unique subpopulations of kidney infiltrating macrophages (KIMs) and kidney dendritic cells (KDCs) following ischemia-induced acute kidney injury (AKI) in mice. It utilized single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and CITE-sequencing to identify distinct cellular subpopulations and their unique microenvironments. The findings aim to inform the development of macrophage-specific therapeutics for kidney diseases.

title: Methodological Integration of Machine Learning and Geospatial Analysis for PM<sub>10</sub> Pollution Mapping.
main_goals: This study compares the performance of three machine learning algorithms (Random Forest, K-Nearest Neighbors, and Naïve Bayes) for mapping PM10 pollution. The goal is to identify the most effective algorithm for accurate spatial modeling of air quality, informing public health interventions.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data enhances differential gene expression analysis results of AD-related phenotypes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper integrates spatial transcriptomics (ST) and single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq) data to enhance differential gene expression (DGE) analysis for Alzheimer's disease (AD) related phenotypes. By leveraging the spatial information from ST and larger sample sizes from snRNA-seq, the study aims to identify spatially informed cell-type-specific DGE genes that are crucial for understanding AD pathogenesis and potential therapeutic targets. The integration resulted in the identification of significant genes that were not detectable by traditional cell-type-specific analyses alone.

title: Immune-epithelial-stromal networks define the cellular ecosystem of the small intestine in celiac disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the immune-epithelial-stromal interactions in celiac disease by performing single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals shifts in epithelial cell states, altered T cell populations, and persistent immune-epithelial changes even after treatment. The research also identifies CD-specific lymphoid aggregates and altered signaling networks with potential therapeutic targets.

title: Quasi-spatial single-cell transcriptome based on physical tissue properties defines early aging associated niche in liver.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This paper introduces FiNi-seq, a novel method that utilizes physical tissue properties to enrich specific niches for single-cell omics analysis, enabling quasi-spatial profiling. The method was applied to study early aging in mouse livers, identifying senescent mesenchymal cells and their associated epigenetic changes within a fibrotic niche. The goal is to provide a detailed analysis of initial aging microenvironments for potential therapeutic targeting.

title: Integrating SAM priors with U-Net for enhanced multiclass cell detection in digital pathology.
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel prior-guided joint attention mechanism to integrate SAM prior features with U-Net foundational features for enhanced multiclass cell detection and segmentation in digital pathology. The goal is to overcome limitations of direct SAM application and improve segmentation accuracy compared to standalone U-Net or simple input augmentation.

title: Juggler's ASR: Unpacking the principles of artifact subspace reconstruction for revision toward extreme MoBI.
main_goals: This paper proposes two new methods, ASR_DBSCAN and ASR_GEV, to improve the performance of the Artifact Subspace Reconstruction (ASR) algorithm for EEG data. These methods address limitations in identifying high-quality calibration data in the original ASR algorithm by using point-by-point amplitude evaluation. The improved methods demonstrate better artifact removal and increased usability of calibration data, particularly for processing EEG during high-intensity motor activities.

title: Oligodendroglia vulnerability in the human dorsal striatum in Parkinson's disease.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease in the human dorsal striatum
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the diversity of oligodendroglia and their alterations in Parkinson's disease by performing sn-RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics on human dorsal striatum samples. It identifies disease-associated oligodendroglia populations with specific molecular signatures and investigates their spatial distribution and impact on myelin integrity.

title: OLS4: a new Ontology Lookup Service for a growing interdisciplinary knowledge ecosystem.
main_goals: This paper introduces OLS4, a new Ontology Lookup Service designed to support the growing interdisciplinary knowledge ecosystem. OLS4 implements the complete OWL2 specification, internationalization support, and a new user interface with UX enhancements to overcome limitations of existing ontology browsing tools.

title: Heatmapper2: web-enabled heat mapping made easy.
main_goals: This paper introduces Heatmapper2, a significant upgrade to the original Heatmapper web server, aimed at improving performance and functionality for heat mapping. Key enhancements include a switch to Python, migration to Shiny Python, and the use of WebAssembly for client-side processing. Heatmapper2 also expands its capabilities to support a wider range of heat mapping options, including time-series, 3D, protein structure, molecular spatial, and spectrometric heat maps, along with an improved interface for customization and handling large datasets.

title: A visual-omics foundation model to bridge histopathology image with transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Image-transcriptomics integration', 'Tissue alignment', 'Annotation', 'Cell type decomposition', 'Image-transcriptomics retrieval', 'ST gene expression prediction from H&E images']
main_goals: Developed OmiCLIP, a visual-omics foundation model linking histopathology images and transcriptomics. The Loki platform provides five key functions for integrating these data types. Loki demonstrated consistent accuracy and robustness compared to state-of-the-art models.

title: Organoid-Guided Precision Medicine: From Bench to Bedside.
biological_context: Tissue development, drug efficacy and toxicity screening, disease pathogenesis studies, personalized healthcare, tumor heterogeneity, genomic profiles
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Drug screening', 'Patient-tailored diagnostics']
main_goals: This review systematically outlines the translational trajectory of organoids from bench to bedside, emphasizing their construction methodologies, key regulatory factors, and multifaceted applications in personalized healthcare. It covers organoid construction, regulatory factors, and applications in modeling tissue development, drug efficacy/toxicity screening, disease pathogenesis, and patient-tailored diagnostics. The paper also discusses challenges and future integrations for organoid technology in precision medicine.

title: Deconvoluting single-cell transcriptomics reveals cellular programs regulated by cell-cell communication in colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Communication Analysis', 'Gene Expression Module Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel analytical framework using hierarchical language modeling and causal discovery methods to deconvolute cell-cell communication (CCC) networks in colorectal cancer. It aims to identify gene expression modules (GEMs) regulated by ligand-receptor signaling and cross-cell-type communication, validated by spatial transcriptomics. The study provides tools for researchers to explore these complex mechanisms, potentially uncovering drug targets.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing in the study of human retinal organoids.
main_goals: This review summarizes the application of single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) on retinal organoid research. It emphasizes scRNA-seq's capacity to identify distinct cell populations, uncover developmental trajectories, and reveal molecular signatures of retinal diseases. The technology offers new insights into retinal neurogenesis, cellular diversity, and disease pathophysiology, enabling the identification of novel biomarkers and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Recent advances in omics and the integration of multi-omics in osteoarthritis research.
main_goals: This paper reviews recent advances in omics approaches applied to osteoarthritis (OA) research. It highlights the application of genomics, epigenomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics, as well as emerging high-resolution techniques like single-cell and spatial omics. The integration of multi-omics data is emphasized for uncovering OA mechanisms, identifying drug targets, and developing precision medicine approaches.

title: Self-supervised spatial-temporal contrastive network for EEG-based brain network classification.
main_goals: To introduce a Self-Supervised Spatial-Temporal Contrastive Network (SS-STCN) framework for EEG-based brain network classification. The framework uses attention-driven two-stream encoders (SGAT and TBLSTM) for spatial-temporal feature fusion to improve brain disease research.

title: SlideCNA: spatial copy number alteration detection from Slide-seq-like spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Develop SlideCNA, a computational tool to extract copy number alteration (CNA) signals from sparse spatial transcriptomics data with near single-cell resolution. The tool uses expression-aware spatial binning to overcome sparsity and recover CNA patterns. It is demonstrated on simulated and real Slide-seq data of breast cancer for spatial subclone detection.

title: Normative structural connectome constrains spreading transient brain activity in generalized epilepsy.
biological_context: Genetic generalized epilepsy with generalized tonic-clonic seizure (GGE-GTCS)
main_goals: This study investigates how the normative structural connectome constrains abnormal brain activity spread in genetic generalized epilepsy with generalized tonic-clonic seizure. It found that white matter network architecture constrains aberrant activity patterns, and molecular fingerprints are key predictors. Network-based diffusion modeling identified potential disease epicenters.

title: Decoding per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) in hepatocellular carcinoma: a multi-omics and computational toxicology approach.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential Gene Expression Analysis', 'Protein-Protein Interaction (PPI) network construction', 'Survival risk model development', 'Molecular docking simulations']
main_goals: This study aims to uncover the molecular mechanisms by which PFAS exposure drives hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using a multi-omics approach. It identifies key molecular targets and pathways involved in PFAS-induced liver carcinogenesis and proposes a survival risk model (PFASRHSig) for HCC. The findings offer potential therapeutic targets for mitigating health risks associated with PFAS exposure.

title: Multichannel convolutional transformer for detecting mental disorders using electroancephalogrpahy records.
biological_context: Mental disorders (post-traumatic stress disorder, depression, anxiety)
main_goals: To introduce a novel deep-learning architecture, the multichannel convolutional transformer, for detecting mental disorders using EEG data. The model integrates CNN and Transformer strengths and utilizes specific preprocessing steps to capture long-range temporal dependencies for improved classification accuracy. The study aims to demonstrate the model's superior performance compared to concurrent approaches.
data_links_mentioned: ['EEG Psychiatric Dataset', 'MODMA dataset', 'EEG and Psychological Assessment dataset']

title: Harnessing agent-based frameworks in CellAgentChat to unravel cell-cell interactions from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper introduces CellAgentChat, an agent-based model (ABM) framework designed to decipher cell-cell interactions (CCIs) from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It allows for animated visualizations of cell interactions and in silico perturbations, aiming to enhance the understanding of cellular signaling and facilitate the development of communication-based therapies.

title: FMO2<sup>+</sup> cancer-associated fibroblasts sensitize anti-PD-1 therapy in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptome profiling', 'cytometry by time-of-flight analysis']
main_goals: This study identifies a specific FMO2+ cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subset that is associated with a favorable response to anti-PD-1 therapy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). These CAFs promote anti-PD-1 efficacy by enhancing tertiary lymphoid structure formation and immune cell infiltration via the CCL19-CCR7 axis. The study proposes FMO2+ CAFs as a predictive biomarker and CCL19 in combination with anti-PD-1 as a potential therapeutic strategy for HCC.

title: Dissecting the immune landscape in pediatric high-grade glioma reveals cell state changes under therapeutic pressure.
main_goals: The study provides a comprehensive transcriptomic analysis of the pediatric high-grade glioma (pHGG) immune landscape using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It examines immune microenvironment distinctions after various therapeutic treatments and by age, identifying differences in myeloid subpopulations compared to adults and observing shifts towards immune-suppressive environments post-therapy. The findings aim to offer insights into immunotherapy targets and serve as a resource for understanding immune microenvironmental variations.

title: Spatiotemporal impacts of scientific and technological innovation and industry chain resilience on ecological Efficiency: Evidence from 284 Chinese cities.
main_goals: This study explores the roles of scientific and technological innovation (STI) and industrial chain resilience (ICR) in enhancing ecological efficiency (EE) in Chinese cities. It proposes a dual-driver framework integrating STI and ICR and uses ESDA and MGWR to capture multiscale spatial effects and driving mechanisms of EE determinants.

title: Unveiling the spatiotemporal strategies of plants in response to biotic and abiotic stresses:A comprehensive review.
biological_context: Plant responses to biotic and abiotic stresses
main_goals: This review provides an in-depth analysis of the development, advantages, and limitations of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in understanding plant responses to environmental stress at the cellular level. It highlights their critical role and explores challenges and future prospects of integrating these technologies in plant research.

title: Deep scSTAR: leveraging deep learning for the extraction and enhancement of phenotype-associated features from single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer, Renal cell carcinoma, Hepatocellular carcinoma
main_goals: This paper introduces Deep scSTAR (DscSTAR), a deep learning-based tool for enhancing phenotype-associated features from single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to address challenges like noise, batch effects, and irrelevant biological signals to provide more meaningful insights into cellular behavior and disease. The paper demonstrates DscSTAR's utility in identifying key cell populations and interactions in various cancers, linking them to immune dysfunction and therapy resistance.

title: Induced B cell receptor diversity predicts PD-1 blockade immunotherapy response.
biological_context: Advanced and metastatic basal cell carcinoma, glioblastoma, melanoma, and head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'high-definition spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial immunoreceptor profiling', 'RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study identifies that induced B cell receptor (BCR) clonal diversity predicts response to PD-1 blockade immunotherapy across multiple cancer types. The findings suggest that BCR diversity is a dynamic factor in immunotherapy, acting as a prognostic marker and a potential therapeutic target.

title: Calbindin 2 as a Novel Biomarker and Therapeutic Target for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm: Integrative Analysis of Human Proteomes and Genetics.
data_modalities_used: ['proteome', 'genetics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell/single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'preclinical mouse models']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify novel biomarkers and therapeutic targets for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) by integrating human proteome and genetic data, and performing multiomics and experimental validation. The study identified calbindin 2 (CALB2) as a potential causal factor and therapeutic target, with lenalidomide and genistein showing promise as treatments.

title: Primer on machine learning applications in brain immunology.
biological_context: Brain development, brain malignancies, and neurodegeneration
covered_analysis_steps: ['Dimensionality reduction', 'Data integration', 'Feature extraction', 'Gene expression programs', 'Trajectory analysis']
main_goals: This mini-review highlights recent advances in single-cell omics data analysis and discusses their applicability for brain immunology. It explores how machine learning, particularly deep learning methods, is addressing challenges in data analysis and presents opportunities for uncovering gene expression programs and predicting genetic perturbations. The paper focuses on how single-cell analyses have resolved immune cell heterogeneity, identified temporal maturation trajectories, and uncovered potential therapeutic links to various pathologies.

title: From Paper to Pixels: Evaluating the Impact of Digital Transformation on Sustainability in Nursing Education.
main_goals: This study explored if the use of an EHR in a simulated learning environment (SLE) in a Bachelor of Nursing (BN) program can lead to tangible reduction in paper consumption. It evaluated the impact of digital transformation on sustainability in nursing education. The results indicate an effective implementation of an EHR solution can decrease paper consumption within an SLE, contributing to reducing the environmental footprint of an educational institution.

title: A Spatial Multi-Omic Framework Identifies Gliomas Permissive to TIL Expansion.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'TCR sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'Xenium in situ transcriptomics', 'CODEX spatial proteomics']
main_goals: This study aims to identify genomic and spatial determinants of Tumor-Infiltrating Lymphocyte (TIL) expandability in high-grade gliomas. It leverages multimodal profiling to define molecular and spatial correlates of TIL manufacturing success, establishing a genomics-enabled selection platform for adoptive T cell therapy.

title: DSCT: a novel deep-learning framework for rapid and accurate spatial transcriptomic cell typing.
biological_context: Brain cell typing and gene-expression patterns
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Typing', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces DSCT, a deep-learning framework for rapid and accurate spatial transcriptomic cell typing. It integrates an enhanced gene-selection strategy and a lightweight deep neural network to achieve high accuracy and efficiency across diverse spatial transcriptomic datasets, enabling new insights into cellular organization and function.

title: Histology-Based Virtual RNA Inference Identifies Pathways Associated with Metastasis Risk in Colorectal Cancer.
main_goals: This study refines and implements Virtual RNA Inference (VRI) to derive spatial transcriptomics-level molecular information directly from hematoxylin and eosin (H&E)-stained tissue images. The VRI models are trained on a large CRC ST dataset to predict spot-level gene expression and infer biological pathways associated with metastasis risk. The goal is to enable TME phenotyping from standard H&E images at scale.

title: Charting the Single-Cell and Spatial Landscape of IDH-Wildtype Glioblastoma with GBmap.
main_goals: This study aimed to create a comprehensive single-cell and spatial atlas of Glioblastoma (GB) to unravel its cellular heterogeneity, spatial architecture, and clinical relevance. They constructed GBmap, a harmonized single-cell atlas, and used spatial transcriptomics to map tumor organization, developing the Tumor Structure Score (TSS). The resource reveals cellular heterogeneity and identifies hypoxia-dependent niches associated with poor prognosis.

title: Rigor and Reproducibility of Spatial Transcriptomics Performed on Clinically Sourced Human Tissues.
biological_context: Clinically sourced human kidney tissues and biopsies
data_modalities_used: ['digital spatial profiling', 'single molecular imager', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study vets the technical reproducibility, data normalization methods, and assay sensitivity of digital spatial profiling, comparing it with a single molecular imager. It aims to provide a practical foundation for incorporating spatial transcriptomics into clinical workflows by assessing performance on clinically sourced human kidney tissues.

title: Meningeal-derived retinoic acid regulates neurogenesis via suppression of Notch and Sox2.
biological_context: Mouse brain development, specifically neocortical neurogenesis
main_goals: This paper investigates how meningeal-derived retinoic acid (RA) regulates neurogenesis by suppressing Notch and Sox2. It identifies that RARα binds to the Sox2ot promoter and that meningeal RA promotes neurogenesis by suppressing Notch signaling in Foxc1-mutant embryos. The findings elucidate a mechanism for how meningeal RA coordinates neocortical development and sheds light on neurodevelopmental disorders associated with meningeal defects.

title: A deep Reinforcement learning-based robust Intrusion Detection System for securing IoMT Healthcare Networks.
main_goals: This paper proposes HCLR-IDS, an advanced Intrusion Detection System for IoMT networks. It integrates CNN, LSTM, and RL (DQN, PPO) with feature selection to enhance the detection of evolving threats and improve robustness. The system demonstrates high accuracy in binary and multi-class classification.

title: Neurogenesis drives hippocampal formation-wide spatial transcription alterations in health and Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: To investigate the spatial transcription profile of neurons and glia in the hippocampal formation in health and Alzheimer's disease using in situ sequencing. The study aims to understand how neurogenesis modulates cellular profiles and whether enhancing neurogenesis can restore neuronal profiles in Alzheimer's disease. It also provides a platform for examining cellular dynamics in the hippocampal formation.

title: The suppressive role of GLS in radiosensitivity and irradiation-induced immune response in LUAD: integrating bioinformatics and experimental insights.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'in vitro experiments', 'in vivo experiments', 'co-culture assays', 'flow cytometry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'CD8+ T cell activation and cytotoxicity']
main_goals: This study investigates the suppressive role of Glutaminase (GLS) in radiosensitivity and irradiation-induced immune responses in Lung Adenocarcinoma (LUAD). It explores GLS's impact on DSB repair, ferroptosis, and CD8+ T cell activation and cytotoxicity. The research also developed a GLS-DSBr prognostic model for LUAD patients.

title: Impact of climate change on the potential global prevalence of Macrophomina phaseolina (Tassi) Goid. under several climatological scenarios.
biological_context: Impact of climate change on the potential global prevalence of the soil-borne fungus Macrophomina phaseolina.
main_goals: To model the global prevalence of Macrophomina phaseolina under several climatological scenarios. The study used the MaxEnt model with 19 environmental covariates to predict the spatial distribution and assess the impact of climate change on its prevalence.

title: Learning tissue representation by identification of persistent local patterns in spatial omics data.
biological_context: Cancer patient stratification for disease progression and treatment response
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: Introduce Kasumi, a method for identifying spatially localized neighborhood patterns persistent across samples and conditions. This method generates tissue representations that facilitate translational tasks like cancer patient stratification. Kasumi outperforms related approaches and provides explanations of spatial coordination.

title: SGTB: A graph representation learning model combining transformer and BERT for optimizing gene expression analysis in spatial transcriptomics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Gene regulatory network construction']
main_goals: This paper proposes SGTB, a novel spatial multi-scale graph convolutional network that integrates GCN, Transformer, and BERT language models to optimize the representation of spatial transcriptomics data. The goal is to improve the accuracy of tasks such as cell type classification and gene regulatory network construction. This approach aims to capture complex spatial dependencies and global features more effectively.

title: Impaired parvalbumin interneurons in the retrosplenial cortex as the cause of sex-dependent vulnerability in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study investigates the cause of sex-dependent vulnerability in Alzheimer's disease by focusing on parvalbumin interneurons in the retrosplenial cortex. It identifies early, sex-dependent alterations in these neurons, linking their impairment to cognitive deficits and dysregulated brain connectivity, and suggests stimulating these neurons as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Spatial transcriptomics: advances and challenges in peripheral nerve sheath tumor.
main_goals: This paper aims to provide an overview of spatial transcriptomics, discussing its recent advancements and the challenges encountered in its application to peripheral nerve sheath tumors.

title: Decoding Alzheimer's Disease: Single-Cell Sequencing Uncovers Brain Cell Heterogeneity and Pathogenesis.
main_goals: This review systematically summarizes the applications of single-cell transcriptomic and epigenomic approaches in Alzheimer's disease (AD) research. It highlights key discoveries related to vulnerable cell subpopulations and transcriptional dysregulation. The review discusses how integrating different single-cell and spatial omics technologies elucidates disease trajectories and cellular communication networks, aiming to pave the way for precision medicine in AD.

title: Investigation into the Spatial Heterogeneity of Lung Composite Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Combined Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis', 'Functional Enrichment']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore spatial transcriptomic expression patterns in Lung combined large-cell neuroendocrine carcinoma (CoLCNEC) and identify crucial genes. It investigates the spatial heterogeneity of CoLCNEC and validates the role of SMC1A in cell migration, invasion, cell cycle, and apoptosis.

title: Exploring the Latent Information in Spatial Transcriptomics Data via Multi-View Graph Convolutional Network Based on Implicit Contrastive Learning.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'trajectory inference', 'Spatially Variable Genes (SVGs) recognition']
main_goals: This study introduces STMIGCL, a novel framework leveraging a multi-view graph convolutional network and implicit contrastive learning for spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to enhance spatial domain recognition precision by learning low-dimensional representations from gene expression and spatial coordinates, further refined by graph contrastive learning. The method improves accuracy and discriminative power, outperforming baselines in spatial domain recognition, trajectory inference, and SVG recognition.

title: MEA-seqX: High-Resolution Profiling of Large-Scale Electrophysiological and Transcriptional Network Dynamics.
biological_context: Mouse hippocampal model of experience-dependent plasticity
data_modalities_used: ['high-density microelectrode arrays', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'optical imaging', 'electrophysiological network activities', 'molecular network events', 'gene expression']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'predictive modeling']
main_goals: The paper introduces the MEA-seqX platform, which integrates high-density microelectrode arrays, spatial transcriptomics, optical imaging, and computational strategies to simultaneously record and analyze molecular and electrical network activities at mesoscale. It aims to reveal dynamics between transcription and function, identify cell types by their bimodal profiles, and enable prediction of electrophysiological activity from gene expression.

title: Heterogenous cancer-associated fibroblasts related tumor microenvironment marked by CD10/KLF4/TIAM1 were identified in pancreatic adenocarcinoma by integrated transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study explored the composition and proportions of CAF subtypes within the PDAC tumor microenvironment. It identified distinct CAF-related TME subtypes and characterized their gene expression profiles, prognostic correlations, and spatial distributions. The findings provide insights into the role of CAF heterogeneity in PDAC progression and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Magnetic sculpture-like tumor cell vaccines enable targeted in situ immune activation and potent antitumor effects.
main_goals: The study introduces a novel whole-cell vaccine platform called Magnetic Sculpture-like (MASK) Cells, created by treating tumor cells with FeCl3. These MASK cells retain biomolecules and architecture, lose proliferative ability, and exhibit magnetic properties. The paper demonstrates their potential for targeted delivery to tumors and enhanced in situ immune activation, leading to potent antitumor effects, especially when combined with anti-PD-1 therapy.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment related to metastatic dissemination during pancreatic cancer liver metastasis.
data_modalities_used: ['snRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence staining', 'immunohistochemistry', 'transwell assay', 'scratch wound healing assay']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Deconvolution', 'Intercellular signalling', 'Pseudotime analysis', 'Immune infiltration profiling', 'Spatial gene expression analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular heterogeneity and immune microenvironment in pancreatic cancer liver metastasis using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to elucidate the role of T_reg cells and the SPP1 pathway in fostering an immunosuppressive microenvironment and to identify CITED4 as a biomarker for liver metastasis and poor prognosis.

title: Cross-Species Multi-Omics Analysis Reveals Myeloid-Driven Endothelial Oxidative Stress in Ischemic Stroke.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'flow cytometry', 'in vitro oxygen-glucose deprivation/reperfusion']
main_goals: This study integrates multi-omics data to reveal a peripheral-central immune axis in ischemic stroke, highlighting myeloid-driven endothelial oxidative stress. It investigates the interplay between peripheral and central immune responses and the impact of myeloid cell infiltration on the blood-brain barrier. The findings suggest targeting endothelial oxidative injury and myeloid-endothelial crosstalk as a potential therapeutic strategy.

title: SpaNorm: spatially-aware normalization for spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper introduces SpaNorm, a novel spatially-aware normalization method for spatial transcriptomics data. It concurrently models library size effects and underlying biology, segregating them to remove library size effects without losing biological information. SpaNorm demonstrates superior performance compared to standard single-cell normalization approaches while preserving spatial domain information and detecting spatially variable genes.

title: Broad rim lesions are a new pathological and imaging biomarker for rapid disease progression in multiple sclerosis.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify new pathological and imaging biomarkers for rapid disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis (MS). Researchers analyzed an MS autopsy cohort using histology and spatial transcriptomics to uncover a distinct lesion type associated with rapid progression. This finding was then validated using PET imaging, identifying 'broad rim lesions' as a potential biomarker to guide future therapeutic trials.

title: Computational Approaches in Spatial Transcriptomics for the Study of Mammalian Spermatogenesis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial mapping of testicular cell types', 'Identifying spatially variable genes', 'Molecular cross-talk between testicular cell types']
main_goals: This paper reviews computational approaches used to dissect mammalian spermatogenesis in the context of spatial transcriptomics. It highlights new computational methods that can reveal novel insights into male fertility by enabling spatial mapping of cell types, identification of spatially variable genes, and understanding of molecular crosstalk.

title: Integrating Multi-omics Technologies with Traditional Chinese Medicine to Enhance Cancer Research and Treatment.
main_goals: This review explores the integration of multi-omics technologies with Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) to enhance cancer research and treatment. It aims to elucidate the molecular mechanisms of TCM's anti-cancer effects, identify therapeutic targets, and validate efficacy. The review also highlights opportunities in personalized TCM-based therapies and proposes strategies to overcome research and application barriers.

title: Disruption of DNA methylation underpins the neuroinflammation induced by targeted CNS radiotherapy.
biological_context: Neuroinflammation induced by targeted CNS radiotherapy
main_goals: This study investigates the underlying cellular and molecular mechanisms of neuroinflammation induced by targeted radiotherapy. It characterizes DNA methylation patterns in irradiated brain tissue and integrates them with gene expression analysis to identify inflammatory micro-environmental niches and regulatory neuropeptides. The findings suggest that epigenetic dysregulation, particularly DNA methylation alterations, plays a role in neurotoxicity and could be a target for reducing radiotherapy side-effects.

title: Space: reconciling multiple spatial domain identification algorithms via consensus clustering.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper proposes Space, a novel method to reconcile multiple spatial domain identification algorithms through consensus clustering. It addresses inconsistencies between different methods by measuring consistency, constructing a consensus matrix, and incorporating similarity, spatial, and low-rank losses to enhance accuracy and efficiency. The strategy resolves label inconsistencies and achieves reliable clustering outputs, with flexible interfaces for downstream analysis.

title: In situ mass spectrometry imaging reveals metabolite alterations in gray and white matter after spinal cord injury.
main_goals: This study uses ambient air flow-assisted desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging to identify the localization of metabolites in different regions of the spinal cord after transection surgery. It reveals specific metabolite increases and decreases in gray and white matter, and ventral and dorsal horns, providing insights into metabolic alterations post-injury. The findings support the development of precise treatment strategies.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics of tertiary lymphoid organ-like structures in human atherosclerotic plaques.
main_goals: This study presents a spatially resolved single-cell transcriptome atlas of human atherosclerotic plaques, identifying cell types and plaque tertiary lymphoid organs (PTLOs). It explores the association of PTLO development with specific gene expressions and the immune involvement of B cells. The findings suggest that PTLO-like structures correlate with cerebrovascular events and propose a mechanism mediated by PTLO-derived IgG antibodies.

title: Combined spatial metabolomics and 4D-DIA quantitative proteomics approaches to explore the relationship between lung cancer and the heart.
biological_context: Lung cancer and its impact on the heart in mice
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', '4D-DIA quantitative proteomics', 'spatial mass spectrometry imaging']
main_goals: This study investigates the interplay between lung cancer and cardiovascular disease by examining changes in cardiac metabolites and protein expression using spatial metabolomics and 4D-DIA quantitative proteomics in nude mice with A549 lung cancer cells. The aim is to identify altered metabolites and proteins in the heart that are crucial for cardiovascular injury in this context.

title: Integrated spatial and single cell transcriptomics identifies PRKDC as a dual prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in hepatocellular carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study integrates spatial and single-cell transcriptomics to identify PRKDC as a prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It reveals PRKDC's role in malignant cell subpopulations, its association with the tumor immune microenvironment, and its impact on immune cell infiltration. The research aims to provide new strategies for HCC treatment by targeting PRKDC.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveals a preclinical model for the most common subtype of glioblastoma.
main_goals: This paper characterizes the tumor and TME in an immunocompetent mouse model of glioblastoma using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and Visium spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies key targets related to neural integration, immunoevasion, and immunosuppression, and compares the model to human GBM subtypes, particularly TME^Med GBM. The goal is to establish a preclinical model for a common GBM subtype.

title: Investigative needle core biopsies support multimodal deep-data generation in glioblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'phosphoproteomics', 'T-cell clonotype analysis', 'MHC Class I immunopeptidomics', 'stereotactic needle core biopsies']
main_goals: This paper investigates the feasibility and utility of investigative needle core biopsies for monitoring treatment response in glioblastoma. It demonstrates the depth of data generation possible from routine biopsies through multi-omics analyses and examines spatial and genomic heterogeneity. The study also explores the use of biopsies for generating patient-derived xenograft models.

title: Unveiling fine-scale spatial structures and amplifying gene expression signals in ultra-large ST slices with HERGAST.
main_goals: HERGAST is a system for spatial structure identification and signal amplification in ultra-large-scale and ultra-high-resolution spatial transcriptomics data. It uses a Divide-Iterate-Conquer framework and a heterogeneous graph network to handle large datasets and overcome over-smoothing. The method demonstrates superior performance in simulations and reveals biological insights in real-world cancer datasets.

title: Large-Scale Metabolite Imaging Gallery of Mouse Organ Tissues to Study Spatial Metabolism.
biological_context: Mouse brain, kidney, and liver tissues
main_goals: This paper presents a large-scale metabolite imaging gallery for mouse brain, kidney, and liver tissues. The gallery captures SMMs across various metabolic pathways, enabling the study of spatial metabolism. It serves as a critical resource for the community, filling a resource gap and providing data for potential computational models.

title: Combining Spatial Transcriptomics, Pseudotime, and Machine Learning Enables Discovery of Biomarkers for Prostate Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study combined spatial transcriptomics, pseudotime analysis, and machine learning to discover novel biomarkers for prostate cancer. It aimed to identify genes correlated with malignant transformation, validate them across different data types and patient cohorts, and build predictive models for diagnosis.

title: L-DOPA Induces Spatially Discrete Changes in Gene Expression in the Forebrain of Mice with a Progressive Loss of Dopaminergic Neurons.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease model with progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons
main_goals: To analyze the spatial profile of L-DOPA-induced gene expression in the forebrain of mice with a progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons. The study aimed to identify ubiquitous and region-specific effects of L-DOPA on gene expression, particularly in areas relevant to both motor and nonmotor symptoms of Parkinson's disease.

title: Surface Defect Detection Based on Adaptive Multi-Scale Feature Fusion.
main_goals: Proposes an adaptive multi-scale feature fusion network (AMSFF-Net) for salient object detection of surface defects. The network uses adaptive weight fusion, global feature adaptive fusion, and differential feature adaptive fusion, enhanced by a spatial attention mechanism. Experiments show it outperforms existing methods.

title: AI-Enhanced Detection of Heart Murmurs: Advancing Non-Invasive Cardiovascular Diagnostics.
main_goals: This study presents a novel convolutional recurrent neural network (CRNN) model for the non-invasive classification of heart murmurs using heart sound recordings. The model utilizes pre-processing techniques like z-score normalization, band-pass filtering, and data augmentation. The CRNN aims to capture spatial and temporal features in audio data for improved cardiac diagnostics.

title: Deciphering of intra-tumoural heterogeneity and the interplay between metastasis-associated meta-program and myofibroblasts in gastric cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'patient-derived organoid models', 'clinical sample analyses']
main_goals: To decipher intra-tumoural heterogeneity in gastric cancer, understand the interplay between metastasis-associated meta-programs and myofibroblasts, and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study identified seven meta-programs (MP1-MP7) and elucidated the reciprocal interaction loop between MP7 GC cells and myofibroblasts (myCAFs), suggesting Taselisib and Lapatinib as potential inhibitors for MP7 GC cells.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the mechanism by which Xiaozhiling injection treats internal hemorrhoids.
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanism underlying the therapeutic effect of Xiaozhiling injection in treating internal hemorrhoids. The study uses single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to reveal changes in gene expression and subcellular structures in fibroblasts, identifying the activation of the Sphk1/S1P pathway as a key mechanism.

title: SPAC: a scalable, integrated enterprise platform for end-to-end single cell spatial analysis of multiplexed tissue imaging.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed imaging', 'spatial proteomics', 'cellular positional data', 'protein expression levels']
main_goals: SPAC is a scalable, web-based ecosystem designed for end-to-end single-cell spatial analysis of multiplexed tissue imaging data. It integrates modular pipelines, HPC connectivity, and interactive visualization to overcome computational and methodological challenges associated with high-dimensional datasets, aiming to democratize analysis.

title: Tff2 marks gastric corpus progenitors that give rise to pyloric metaplasia/SPEM following injury.
biological_context: Gastric metaplasia and cancer, specifically focusing on pyloric metaplasia (SPEM) and its origins in the gastric corpus.
main_goals: To identify the progenitor cells responsible for pyloric metaplasia (SPEM) in the gastric corpus following injury and to investigate their role in gastric cancer development. The study identifies Tff2+ corpus isthmus cells as these progenitors and demonstrates their direct progression to dysplasia upon Kras mutation, bypassing metaplasia.

title: Single cell spatial proteomics maps human liver zonation patterns and their vulnerability to fibrosis.
biological_context: Human liver zonation patterns and their vulnerability to fibrosis
main_goals: The study applies single-cell Deep Visual Proteomics to spatially-resolved proteome analysis of individual cells in native tissue. It introduces a novel strategic cell selection pipeline and a continuous protein gradient mapping framework for clinical cohorts, generating a comprehensive spatial map of the human hepatic proteome and demonstrating its utility in analyzing liver zonation and fibrosis.

title: Enhanced Adhesion of Mildly Positively Charged Vesicles to Endothelial Cells with Shed Glycocalyx.
main_goals: This study investigated the in vitro adhesion of giant unilamellar vesicles (GUVs) to endothelial cells with varying glycocalyx states. The goal was to understand how the endothelial glycocalyx influences vesicle adhesion and to identify potential implications for drug delivery and cellular interactions.

title: Deep neural networks and stochastic methods for cognitive modeling of rat behavioral dynamics in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>T</mi></math> -mazes.
main_goals: This study presents a cognitive model for rat decision-making behavior in T-mazes by combining stochastic methods with deep neural architectures. The model adapts Wyckoff's stochastic framework to describe probabilistic transitions between directional choices. The integration of stochastic dynamics and deep learning develops a computational basis for analyzing spatial decision-making in animal behavior.

title: Candida albicans and colorectal cancer: A paradoxical role revealed through metabolite profiling and prognostic modeling.
data_modalities_used: ['liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry', 'in vitro cell culture', 'gene expression analysis']
main_goals: This study investigated the paradoxical role of Candida albicans in colorectal cancer (CRC) by examining its metabolic profile and developing a prognostic model. The researchers aimed to determine whether C. albicans promotes or suppresses tumor development and to understand the mechanistic basis of its interaction with CRC cells.

title: Integrating multi-omics and experimental techniques to decode ubiquitinated protein modifications in hepatocellular carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to systematically explore the role of ubiquitination in shaping the tumor microenvironment (TME) of HCC, focusing on its impact on cancer progression and immune modulation. It integrates multi-omics data and experimental techniques to investigate ubiquitinated protein modifications and identify potential biomarkers like UBE2C. The findings highlight ubiquitination's multifaceted roles in HCC, supporting tumor progression and influencing immune and stromal cell activity.

title: Investigating plant morphogenesis using 3D digital organs.
main_goals: This review describes the experimental toolbox for generating and analyzing 3D digital plant organs. It highlights studies demonstrating their value for understanding plant morphogenesis and explores how comparative analysis can reveal evolutionary shifts in cellular patterns contributing to morphological diversity.

title: Transcriptomic characterization of transitioning cell types in the skin of Atlantic salmon.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the transcriptomic profiles of mesenchymal stromal cells in healthy Atlantic salmon skin and during wound healing. It investigated the transcriptional activity and potential differentiation pathways of these cells using single-nucleus sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings chart the transcriptomic activity of subclusters of differentiating stromal cells and reveal their spatial niches.

title: Spatial single-cell analysis identifies placental villi structuraland immune remodeling across gestation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses imaging mass cytometry to create a spatial map of placental villi and unravel cellular dynamics across gestation. It identifies structural and immune remodeling, comparing mid-gestation to term placentas. The findings offer insights into cellular composition changes and potential immune states relevant to pregnancy complications.

title: The janus face of astrocytes in multiple sclerosis: Balancing protection and pathology.
main_goals: This review synthesizes current evidence on astrocyte heterogeneity and their dual roles (protective and pathological) in Multiple Sclerosis (MS). It discusses how astrocytes contribute to neurotoxicity and repair, and explores the therapeutic potential of targeting astrocyte reactivity, emphasizing the need for human-centric approaches. The paper also highlights advances in spatial omics that illuminate astrocyte-microglia crosstalk and metabolic reprogramming in MS.

title: Benchmarking HEp-2 cell segmentation methods in indirect immunofluorescence images - standard models to deep learning.
biological_context: HEp-2 cells for autoimmune disease detection
main_goals: This study benchmarks 17 CNN models and 8 pretrained CNN models for HEp-2 cell segmentation on the I3A dataset, employing cross-validation and significance correction. It also investigates the impact of domain-specific pretraining and data augmentation, and explores GAN-based segmentation. The goal is to provide a robust comparison of state-of-the-art models to guide future research.

title: Emerging targets for advancing endometrial therapeutics.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'microbiome analysis', 'organoid models', 'menstrual blood analysis']
main_goals: To highlight the latest targets for advancing endometrial research, including single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, the microbiome, organoid models, analysis of menstrual blood, and endometrial ageing. The authors aim to provide insight into novel methods, highlight advancing endometrial therapeutics, and inspire future research avenues.

title: Neuroprotectin D1 and GPR37 protect against chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy and the transition from acute to chronic pain.
data_modalities_used: ['mouse dorsal root ganglia (DRG)', 'primary DRG cultures', 'hind paw skins', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human DRG']
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of Neuroprotectin D1 (NPD1) and its receptor GPR37 in protecting against chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and the transition from acute to chronic pain. The findings indicate that GPR37 deficiency drives pain chronicity in CIPN and suggest NPD1's potential in safeguarding sensory neurons through GPR37.

title: High-confidence glycosomal membrane protein inventory unveils trypanosomal peroxin PEX15.
biological_context: Trypanosomatid parasites and their glycosomes, relevant to diseases like Chagas disease and human African trypanosomiasis.
main_goals: To report a comprehensive protein inventory of glycosomal membranes in trypanosomes and identify a key protein, PEX15, essential for glycosome biogenesis. The study aims to provide a resource for characterizing glycosome biology and developing therapeutics against trypanosomal parasites.

title: Multi-Omics Technologies Applied to Improve Tick Research.
biological_context: Tick biology, including physiology, population dynamics, and disease transmission.
main_goals: This review addresses the application of multi-omics technologies to deepen knowledge on tick biology. It summarizes the use of omics data to understand tick physiological processes, population dynamics, transmitted pathogens, control strategies, and identify new vaccine targets and therapeutic perspectives using tick bioactive molecules. The paper also highlights future directions involving the integration of spatial omics and artificial intelligence.

title: Targeting Hepatic Stellate Cells for the Prevention and Treatment of Liver Cirrhosis and Hepatocellular Carcinoma: Strategies and Clinical Translation.
main_goals: This paper reviews the roles of hepatic stellate cells (HSC) in liver fibrosis and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It discusses strategies for targeting HSC for prevention and treatment, including the use of specific surface markers and receptors for drug delivery. The review also highlights the promise of recent omics advances, such as single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, for identifying new HSC targets.

title: Advances in Microfluidic Single-Cell RNA Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper surveys the current landscape of microfluidic methods in single-cell and spatial multi-omics. It assesses their relative advantages and limitations and highlights how microfluidics has been adapted to provide new insights into multi-omics over the past decade. The paper also emphasizes contributions in development, neuroscience, and disease mechanisms, and discusses perspectives for technological advances.

title: Spatial gene regulatory networks driving cell state transitions during human liver disease.
main_goals: To uncover the spatial transcriptional landscape driving human liver fibrosis using multi-modal spatial omics data. The study aims to define molecular signatures and cellular trajectories associated with disease progression in liver cirrhosis. The ultimate goal is to identify potential targets for therapeutics or early diagnostic markers.

title: The dynamic immune behavior of primary and metastatic ovarian carcinoma.
main_goals: This study used single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to identify molecular mechanisms leading to immunosuppression in high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSC). It found primary tumors had a more active immune microenvironment than omental tumors and identified dysfunctional T cells correlated with interferon pathway changes in epithelial cells, suggesting cross-communication is key to immune suppression in HGSC.

title: Adipose-derived leptin and complement factor D mediate osteoarthritis severity and pain.
main_goals: To investigate the role of fat-secreted factors, specifically leptin and complement factor D, in the development and severity of osteoarthritis. The study aims to elucidate the fat-cartilage cross-talk and its contribution to OA pathogenesis and pain using mouse models and spatial transcriptomics.

title: TissueViewer: a web-based multiplexed image viewer.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplex immunofluorescence staining', 'spatial transcriptomics profiling', 'histologic sections', 'high-resolution images']
main_goals: To overcome challenges in viewing and sharing large spatial biology datasets by developing TissueViewer, a fast and low-bandwidth web-based multiplexed image viewer. It aims to provide high-resolution image viewing over the internet and allows users to upload and share their own data.

title: Rosette Trajectory MRI Reconstruction with Vision Transformers.
main_goals: This paper proposes an efficient pipeline for rosette trajectory magnetic resonance imaging reconstruction. It combines the inverse Fourier transform with a vision transformer (ViT) network enhanced with a convolutional layer to reconstruct high-quality images from non-Cartesian data. The method aims to outperform existing deep learning techniques in image quality and runtime performance.

title: RGB and RGNIR image dataset for machine learning in plastic waste detection.
main_goals: This paper introduces a comprehensive dataset of plastic waste images captured using both standard RGB and RGNIR channels. The dataset aims to support machine learning models for plastic waste detection by providing rich spectral information in the near-infrared region, addressing a gap in publicly available resources. The authors hope this resource will advance research in plastic waste detection and sorting methods.

title: CellPhePy: A python implementation of the CellPhe toolkit for automated cell phenotyping from microscopy time-lapse videos.
main_goals: This paper introduces CellPhePy, a Python implementation of the CellPhe toolkit for automated cell phenotyping from microscopy time-lapse videos. It preserves core functionality, enhances feature identification and multiclass classification, and integrates with CellPose and TrackMate for a fully automated workflow.

title: Mapping the rapid growth of multi-omics in tumor immunotherapy: Bibliometric evidence of technology convergence and paradigm shifts.
main_goals: This study maps the evolution of omics-driven tumor immunotherapy research through bibliometrics. It highlights the rapid growth since 2019, the transition towards predictive modeling and biomarker discovery using multi-omics, and the increasing clinical translation of omics findings. Future directions include longitudinal monitoring, AI integration, and international collaboration.

title: InSituCor: exploring spatially correlated genes conditional on the cell type landscape.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Correlation Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: InSituCor is a toolkit for discovering modules of spatially correlated genes in spatial transcriptomics data. It identifies correlations not explainable by known factors like cell type landscapes and supports both unbiased and knowledge-driven exploration, including ligand-receptor pair evaluation.

title: Transcriptomics, single-cell sequencing and spatial sequencing-based studies of cerebral ischemia.
main_goals: This paper reviews the progress of research on the mechanism of cerebral ischemic injury under the analysis of comprehensive transcriptomics research methods. It aims to study the potential mechanisms and provide new, innovative therapeutic strategies for cerebral ischemia.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals that an immune cell-related signature could predict clinical outcomes for microsatellite-stable colorectal cancer patients receiving immunotherapy.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer (CRC) with microsatellite stability (MSS) receiving immunotherapy
main_goals: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining anti-PD-1 antibody with VEGFRi compared to VEGFRi alone in MSS CRC patients. It also sought to identify immune cell-related biomarkers predicting clinical outcomes by analyzing the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, leading to the development of the MCICRS signature.

title: Alternative splicing in autism spectrum disorder: Recent insights from mechanisms to therapy.
main_goals: This review focuses on aberrant alternative splicing events and key splicing regulators in autism spectrum disorders (ASD), highlighting their role in pathogenesis. It discusses how emerging technologies offer new insights into alternative splicing mechanisms in ASD and evaluates RNA splicing-based therapeutic strategies for ASD.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal the pathogenesis of chronic granulomatous disease in a natural model.
main_goals: This study establishes a natural CGD model in Ncf2-/- mice, elucidates the mechanisms of granuloma formation involving specific neutrophil and macrophage populations, and identifies potential therapeutic interventions by testing pharmacological inhibition of MIF, Morrbid deletion, and Il1r1 knockout, all of which suppressed granuloma formation.

title: Protocol for preparing fresh frozen soybean tissues for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper presents a protocol for preparing fresh frozen soybean tissues for spatial transcriptomics. It details the steps involved in tissue embedding, cryosectioning, fixation, staining, imaging, and subsequent library preparation and sequencing. The protocol aims to overcome challenges in applying spatial transcriptomics to plant tissues.

title: m2ST: dual multi-scale graph clustering for spatially resolved transcriptomics.
main_goals: Proposes m2ST, a novel dual multi-scale graph clustering method for spatial transcriptomics data. m2ST extracts multi-scale representations using a masked autoencoder and integrates scale-common and scale-specific information for more robust spatial domain annotation. It demonstrates superior performance compared to existing methods.

title: Multiple Gender Stereotype Threats in Motor Performance and Learning.
main_goals: This study investigated the effects of multiple gender stereotype threats on motor performance and learning in women performing a soccer dribbling task. The researchers compared different conditions of stereotype threat, varying the target of the threat (self or group) and the source of the stereotype (ingroup or outgroup). Results indicated that all stereotype threat conditions equally impaired performance and learning compared to a nullified-stereotype threat group.

title: Diffusion-Phys: noise-robust heart rate estimation from facial videos via diffusion models.
main_goals: This paper introduces Diffusion-Phys, a novel framework using diffusion models for robust heart rate (HR) estimation from facial videos. It employs Multi-scale Spatial-Temporal Maps (MSTmaps) and simulates real-world noise by adding Gaussian noise. The goal is to improve the reliability and generalization of non-contact physiological measurement systems.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma: tumor heterogeneity, microenvironment, resistance, and prognostic markers.
main_goals: This review summarizes key findings from scRNA-seq studies in DLBCL, deepening the understanding of tumor heterogeneity, microenvironment interactions, resistance mechanisms, and prognostic biomarkers. It highlights the contribution of scRNA-seq to precision therapeutic strategies and suggests that integrating scRNA-seq with spatial transcriptomics and multi-omics may reveal further disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets for precision medicine in DLBCL.

title: Decoding the crossroads of aging and cancer through single-cell analysis: Implications for precision oncology.
main_goals: This review explores how aging influences cancer initiation, progression, and treatment resistance within the tumor microenvironment.
