It examines recent studies using single-cell technologies to reveal the nuanced roles of aging in tumorigenesis, immune interactions, and therapeutic outcomes. The review also discusses advanced tools like spatial transcriptomics and AI for understanding aging-related heterogeneity.

title: Long-chain sulfatide enrichment is an actionable metabolic vulnerability in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm (IPMN)-associated pancreatic cancers.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN)-associated pancreatic cancers (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['MALDI-MS', 'Visium spatial transcriptomics', 'CRISPR/cas9 technology', 'small interfering RNAs', 'pharmacological inhibition']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolomic analysis', 'Functional studies', 'In vivo tumor growth suppression']
main_goals: This study aimed to uncover biochemical and molecular drivers underlying the malignant progression of IPMNs to PDAC. It identified long-chain sulfatide enrichment as an early metabolic alteration in precancerous pancreatic lesions that persists through invasive neoplasia, posing a potential actionable vulnerability in IPMN-derived PDAC.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Maize Embryo Development.
main_goals: This review describes the combined use of single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to study maize embryogenesis, highlighting the synergistic results of these two strategies. It discusses the strengths and weaknesses of each technology in the context of studying plant development.

title: Scalable image-based visualization and alignment of spatial transcriptomics datasets.
biological_context: Mouse brain tissue and human metastatic lymph node
main_goals: The paper introduces STIM, a computational framework for visualizing and aligning high-throughput spatial sequencing datasets. It leverages ImgLib2 and BigDataViewer for scalability and enables the transfer of computer vision techniques to spatial sequencing data. The framework demonstrates human-level accuracy in its simplest alignment mode.

title: Computer-Aided Diagnostics Helps Accurately Determine Different Expression Levels of Claudin-18.2 in Gastric Cancer.
main_goals: This paper describes the establishment and validation of a computer-aided analysis tool for claudin-18.2 positivity scoring in gastric cancer. The tool aims to improve diagnostic accuracy and reproducibility by automating the identification of tumor tissue, cell segmentation, and membranous staining intensity estimation. This approach is intended to help precisely determine claudin-18.2 status in patients for targeted treatment.

title: The spatial and single-cell landscape of skin: Charting the multiscale regulation of skin immune function.
main_goals: This paper reviews how technological advancements like single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics are uncovering the multiscale regulation of skin immune function. It discusses how these technologies reveal heterogeneity in the skin immune landscape from microanatomic to macroanatomic scales, leading to a deeper understanding of cell-type contributions to immune function. The review also highlights translational opportunities for these technologies in clinical settings.

title: Glial changes and gene expression in Alzheimer's disease from snRNA-Seq and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study quantifies cellular changes in the prefrontal cortex and temporal gyrus of Alzheimer's disease patients using integrated snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data. It assesses cellular proportions and gene expression, focusing on the roles of glial cells (astrocytes and microglia) in disease progression. The findings highlight astrocytic reactivity and microglial immune surveillance as key components of AD pathology.

title: Mapping immunotherapy potential: spatial transcriptomics in the unraveling of tumor-immune microenvironments in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: This review highlights the importance of spatial transcriptomics (ST) in uncovering the complexities of the tumor-immune microenvironment (TIME) in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC). It proposes strategies for leveraging these insights to develop more effective immunotherapeutic approaches. The aim is to pave the way for personalized and precision-based treatments in HNSCC.

title: Temporal and spatial omics technologies for 4D profiling.
covered_analysis_steps: ['temporal omics analyses', '2D spatial omics analyses', '3D spatial omics analyses', '4D profiling']
main_goals: This perspective delves into techniques for temporal and 2D/3D spatial omics analyses, emphasizing their fusion for insights into cell dynamics. It explores four-dimensional profiling, highlighting advancements, challenges, and strategies for technological development.

title: Multi-omics analysis constructs a novel neuroendocrine prostate cancer classifier and classification system.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a robust NEPC classifier and provide new perspectives for resolving intra-tumoral heterogeneity. They constructed a novel NEPC classifier and classification system using multi-omics analysis and machine learning. The NEP100 model and its derived classification system offer improved diagnostic and prognostic prediction for NEPC, enabling subtype-specific therapeutic strategies.

title: Advanced leukocyte classification using attention mechanisms and dual channel U-Net architecture.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel Attention-based Dual Channel U-shaped Network (ADCU-Net) for accurate leukocyte classification. The method incorporates Dung Beetle Optimization with Levy flight for improved image segmentation and uses extracted features for classification, achieving high accuracy.

title: Challenges in Spatial Metabolomics and Proteomics for Functional Tissue Unit and Single-Cell Resolution.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Multimodal analyses']
main_goals: To overview developments in spatial metabolomics and proteomics over the past decade, highlighting case studies and challenges in achieving functional tissue unit and single-cell resolution, particularly for mammalian kidneys. The paper aims to provide perspectives on paths forward and persistent challenges with adoption and application of these techniques.

title: Dissecting multilayer cell-cell communications with signaling feedback loops from spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper presents stMLnet, a method for identifying signaling feedback loops within multilayer cell-cell communications from spatial transcriptomics data. It quantifies spatially dependent ligand-receptor signaling activity and maps it to intracellular targets. The method is benchmarked and applied to diverse spatial transcriptomics techniques and biological samples, including COVID-19 infected lung tissue.

title: A cost- and time-efficient method for high-throughput cryoprocessing and tissue analysis using multiplexed tissue molds.
biological_context: Processing of various adult mouse tissues and neural organoids
data_modalities_used: ['cryosectioning', 'antibody staining', 'transcriptomic analysis', 'in situ hybridization', 'neural differentiation marker expression assessment']
main_goals: Introduces multiplexed tissue molds (MTMs) to enable high-throughput cryoprocessing, significantly reducing costs and workload for tissue analysis. The MTMs allow for the simultaneous processing of multiple tissues of various sizes and origins, demonstrating compatibility with heterogeneous tissues and neural organoids.

title: Resolving the spatial organization of fetal liver hematopoiesis by SeekSpace.
main_goals: This study utilizes the SeekSpace platform to map the spatial distribution of hematopoietic progenitor populations within the fetal liver. It provides a detailed spatial transcriptomic atlas and reveals that HSC/MPPs expansion is spatially associated with macrophages and endothelial cells, supported by specific signaling pathways.

title: Advances in tumor subclone formation and mechanisms of growth and invasion.
main_goals: This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of tumor subclone formation mechanisms, evolutionary models, analytical methods, and clinical implications. It offers insights into precision oncology and future translational research by discussing tumor heterogeneity, immune evasion, and treatment resistance.

title: Stereopy: modeling comparative and spatiotemporal cellular heterogeneity via multi-sample spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['modeling comparative and spatiotemporal cellular heterogeneity', 'multi-sample data integration', 'cell communities investigation', 'spatiotemporal gene pattern detection', 'niche-based cell-gene interaction network inference']
main_goals: Stereopy is presented as a flexible framework for modeling and dissecting comparative and spatiotemporal patterns in multi-sample spatial transcriptomics. It aims to unify multi-sample data integration and provide interactive visualization for exploring cellular heterogeneity across conditions, time, and space. The framework includes components for data storage, management, processing, and applications like investigating pathological changes, detecting spatiotemporal gene patterns, and inferring 3D niche-based cell-gene interaction networks.

title: Deconvolution of cell types and states in spatial multiomics utilizing TACIT.
biological_context: Brain, intestine, and gland tissues in health and disease (inflammatory gland diseases)
main_goals: Develop TACIT, an unsupervised algorithm for cell annotation in spatial multiomics. TACIT aims to overcome the challenges of cell type and state identification by using predefined signatures without training data and unbiased thresholding. It aims to outperform existing unsupervised methods in accuracy and scalability, and reveal new phenotypes and cell states in biological systems.

title: Transfer learning of multicellular organization via single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human cortex, mouse embryo, mouse brain, Drosophila embryo, human developmental heart, normal and atherosclerotic arteries
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper introduces iSORT, a transfer learning method to decipher spatial organization of cells by integrating scRNA-seq and ST data. iSORT trains a neural network to map gene expressions to spatial locations, enabling the identification of spatial patterns, spatial-organizing genes (SOGs), and pseudo-growth trajectories. Benchmarking across various biological systems demonstrates its accuracy and practicality, with SOGs found in atherosclerotic arteries showing strong association with vascular anomalies.

title: Integrated multi-omics analysis reveals the functional and prognostic significance of lactylation-related gene PRDX1 in breast cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) summary statistics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell Communication Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Prognostic Model Construction', 'Cox regression', 'LASSO regression']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the regulatory mechanisms and prognostic significance of the lactylation-related gene PRDX1 in breast cancer. It integrated multi-omics data to analyze PRDX1's expression, its role in cell-cell communication and spatial heterogeneity, and developed a prognostic model based on PRDX1-positive monocytes. The findings highlight PRDX1's involvement in tumor microenvironment regulation and immune escape.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic insights into glioma cellular heterogeneity and metabolic adaptations.
main_goals: This review integrates recent advancements in single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate glioblastoma's cellular heterogeneity and metabolic reprogramming. It highlights the importance of these technologies in decoding the tumor's metabolic landscape and exploring novel therapeutic strategies, emphasizing precision medicine approaches.

title: STForte: tissue context-specific encoding and consistency-aware spatial imputation for spatially resolved transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Imputation', 'Visualization']
main_goals: STForte is a novel pairwise graph autoencoder-based approach for encoding spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) data. It models spatial homogeneity and expression heterogeneity to extract interpretable latent encodings, enabling downstream analysis of various tissue contexts. STForte also facilitates spatial imputation to restore biological patterns of unobserved or low-quality locations.

title: Reversible downregulation of HLA class I in adenoid cystic carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplex immunofluorescence', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'RNA in-situ hybridization', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper investigates the immune landscape of Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma (ACC) using various omics techniques. It identifies low beta-2-microglobulin (B2M) and HLA class I expression as a key feature of ACC tumors, potentially explaining their 'cold' immune phenotype and poor response to immunotherapies. The study demonstrates that immune activators like interferon-gamma and STING agonists can restore HLA/B2M expression, suggesting a promising therapeutic avenue.

title: An organ-wide spatiotemporal transcriptomic and cellular atlas of the regenerating zebrafish heart.
main_goals: This paper generates a spatially-resolved molecular and cellular atlas of the regenerating zebrafish heart across eight stages using integrated Stereo-seq and scRNA-seq. It characterizes cardiomyocyte cell states, explores the role of tpm4a, and uncovers the activation of ifrd1 and atp6ap2 genes. The study reconstructs a 4D virtual regenerating heart as a resource for the scientific community.

title: Spatial transcriptomics study of Castleman disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study utilized spatial transcriptomics to explore Castleman Disease (CD) pathogenesis. It aimed to identify lesion cells and understand the role of mesenchymal cells and cellular communication in disease progression across different histologic types.

title: Single-cell omics technologies - Fundamentals on how to create single-cell looking glasses for reproductive health.
biological_context: Reproductive health, including pregnancy, gynecologic malignancies, and uterine and ovarian physiology and aging.
main_goals: This review discusses recent applications of single-cell technologies to study gynecologic disorders and adaptations during pregnancy and across a woman's lifespan. It details sequencing- and proteomic-based single-cell methods, spatial transcriptomics, and high-dimensional proteomic imaging, covering their mechanisms, workflows, quality control, benefits, drawbacks, and utility in reproductive medicine. The paper also considers analytical methods for the high-dimensional single-cell data and their potential for clinical translation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals regionally altered gene expression that drives retinal degeneration.
biological_context: Retinal degeneration in mice induced by photo-oxidative stress
main_goals: To investigate spatio-temporal gene expression changes in the adult mouse retina in response to photo-oxidative stress, identify regionally distinct transcriptomes and key drivers of molecular changes, and provide evidence of angiogenic changes.

title: Spatial Analysis Identifies CD147 as a Novel Marker of High-Grade Childhood Posterior Fossa Ependymoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial differences in the tumor microenvironment of childhood posterior fossa ependymoma (PFA-EPN) between World Health Organization grade 2 (G2) and grade 3 (G3). It identifies CD147 as a potential novel marker associated with higher tumor grade and explores its relationship with immune cells and tumor-proliferating cells, suggesting CD147+ microglia may play a role in promoting CD8+ T cell exclusion in aggressive PFA-EPN.

title: Fast analysis of Spatial Transcriptomics (FaST): an ultra lightweight and fast pipeline for the analysis of high resolution spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces FaST, a novel, ultra lightweight, and fast pipeline for analyzing high-resolution spatial transcriptomics datasets. It enables full reconstruction of the spatially resolved transcriptome, including cell segmentation, on standard workstations with limited RAM, processing millions of reads in about an hour. FaST is compatible with various spatial transcriptomics protocols and generates segmented datasets suitable for downstream analysis.

title: SciGeneX: enhancing transcriptional analysis through gene module detection in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: SciGeneX is an R package that enhances transcriptional analysis by implementing a neighborhood analysis and graph partitioning method to generate co-expression gene modules. These modules collectively reflect cellular heterogeneity and can highlight specific cell populations, including rare ones. The package has demonstrated effectiveness in uncovering novel cell populations in human thymus spatial transcriptomics data and outperforms existing methods.

title: Identification of Specific Biomarkers for Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma Through Spatial Transcriptomic and Immunohistochemical Profiling.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify and validate key mRNA and protein markers associated with ATC progression and dedifferentiation. The study performed spatial transcriptomic analysis on an ATC case and validated findings using immunohistochemistry in a larger cohort. The goal was to identify molecular markers that can distinguish ATC from other thyroid tumors for improved diagnosis and treatment.

title: Spatial Metabolomics and Its Application in Plant Research.
main_goals: This paper summarizes the birth and development of spatial metabolomics, explains its differences and advantages from traditional metabolomics, and summarizes its application in plant research. It also discusses limitations and technological improvements for future development.

title: Identification of a cancer stem cell-like subpopulation that promotes HCC metastasis.
main_goals: The study identifies a metastasis-promoting cancer stem cell (CSC)-like subpopulation in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) that enhances invasiveness and suppresses anti-tumor immunity via the ICAM1 signaling pathway. It aims to provide a potential perspective for CSC-targeted therapies in HCC by modulating cellular interactions between CSC-like cells and immune cells.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Landscape of Brain Metastases from Triple-Negative Breast Cancer: Comparison of Primary Tumor and Brain Metastases Using Spatial Analysis.
biological_context: Brain metastases from triple-negative breast cancer
main_goals: This study uses spatial RNA sequencing to analyze primary triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) tumors and paired brain metastases (BM) to understand the tumor microenvironment. It aims to identify mechanisms underlying BM and potential therapeutic targets by comparing gene expression and immune cell infiltration across different spatial zones in primary tumors and BM.

title: Desmosome mutations impact the tumor microenvironment to promote melanoma proliferation.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of desmosome mutations in melanoma by analyzing their impact on the tumor microenvironment. It found that desmosome mutations in keratinocytes lead to reduced desmosome gene expression, which in turn promotes melanoma cell proliferation.

title: Deep Visual Proteomics maps proteotoxicity in a genetic liver disease.
biological_context: Human liver tissue with alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency (AATD)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics by mass spectrometry', 'single-cell analysis', 'human liver tissue', 'formal-formal-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue', 'proteomics', 'image-based phenotyping']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Proteomics', 'Machine Learning', 'Single-cell analysis', 'In situ analysis', 'Proteome profiling', 'Image-based phenotyping']
main_goals: The paper introduces Deep Visual Proteomics (DVP), a method combining spatial proteomics with machine learning for high-resolution, in situ proteomic analysis of complex tissues. It applies this to map alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency (AATD) in human liver tissue, resolving molecular events during hepatocyte stress and identifying disease progression phenotypes.

title: Integrating bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics to identify and functionally validate novel targets to enhance immunotherapy in NSCLC.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro experiments', 'syngeneic cancer mouse models']
main_goals: To identify and functionally validate novel targets to enhance immunotherapy in NSCLC by integrating bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics. The study developed a multigene signature (CCDI) based on programmed cell deaths (PCDs) and identified necroptosis genes (PTGES3, MYO6, CCT6A, and CTSH) as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Benchmarking computational methods for detecting spatial domains and domain-specific spatially variable genes from spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: This paper benchmarks 19 computational methods for detecting spatial domains and domain-specific spatially variable genes (SVGs) from spatial transcriptomics data. It evaluates methods on accuracy, stability, generalizability, and scalability across 30 real-world and 27 synthetic datasets. The study provides practical guidelines for selecting appropriate methods and highlights the benefit of integrating results from different approaches.

title: Phase 2 trial of perioperative chemo-immunotherapy for gastro-esophageal adenocarcinoma: The role of M2 macrophage landscape in predicting response.
main_goals: This paper presents the clinical results of a phase 2 trial combining neoadjuvant chemotherapy and immunotherapy for locally advanced gastro-esophageal adenocarcinoma. It also investigates the role of M2 macrophage landscape in predicting treatment response by analyzing immune cell populations using multiplex immunohistochemistry and longitudinal single-cell transcriptomic profiling. The study aims to describe the treatment's effectiveness and reveal inflammatory milieu features associated with response to personalize future treatments.

title: Comprehensive Metabolite Profiling in Single-Cell Systems via Dual-Modal MALDI-Mass Spectrometry Imaging.
biological_context: Coculture of cholangiocarcinoma (CCLP1) and hepatic stellate (LX2) cells
main_goals: The study presents a novel dual-modal MALDI-MSI workflow using DAN and DAN-HCl matrices for sequential detection in positive- and negative-ion modes. This workflow enhances metabolite coverage for single-cell spatial metabolomics, enabling the study of complex cellular interactions. It was applied to a coculture of cholangiocarcinoma and hepatic stellate cells to reveal metabolic distinctions.

title: Tolerance and heteroresistance to echinocandins in Candida auris: conceptual issues, clinical implications, and outstanding questions.
biological_context: Candida auris infection and antifungal drug resistance
main_goals: This paper reviews conceptual issues and clinical implications of echinocandin tolerance and heteroresistance in Candida auris. It highlights the need for research into mechanisms, detection methods, and mitigation strategies to address drug resistance challenges.

title: Modeling reproductive and pregnancy-associated tissues using organ-on-chip platforms: challenges, limitations, and the high throughput data frontier.
data_modalities_used: ['microscopic imaging', 'immunocytochemistry', 'real-time polymerase chain reaction', 'cytokine multiplex analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'imaging cytometry by time of flight', 'exosomes analysis']
main_goals: This review describes available reproductive and pregnancy-related organ-on-chip (OOC) platforms and current methodologies for generating endpoint datasets. It discusses limitations of OOC platforms and novel approaches to overcome these challenges, highlighting the need for engineering adaptations to increase device throughput and biological advancements for data throughput to realize their full potential.

title: Unveiling purine metabolism dysregulation orchestrated immunosuppression in advanced pancreatic cancer and concentrating on the central role of NT5E.
main_goals: This study investigates purine metabolism dysregulation in pancreatic cancer, focusing on its role in orchestrating immunosuppression. It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze purine metabolism features, identify key genes like NT5E, and assess their impact on immune phenotypes and immunotherapy response. The findings suggest that targeting purine metabolism or NT5E could be a therapeutic strategy for advanced pancreatic cancer.

title: Airway Spatial Transcriptomics in Smoking.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To create a framework for predicting altered cell-cell communication in smoker lungs using single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data. The study identified specific pathways, including the collagen pathway, altered in current smokers compared to never-smokers. The findings aim to provide molecular context for future research and therapeutic interventions.

title: mcDETECT: Decoding 3D Spatial Synaptic Transcriptomes with Subcellular-Resolution Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: mcDETECT is a novel framework for analyzing spatial transcriptomics data at the subcellular level, specifically targeting synapses. It integrates machine learning and in situ ST with targeted gene panels to identify individual synapses and generate single-synapse transcriptome profiles. The framework is validated on multiple ST platforms and applied to stratify synapses and explore their dysregulation in Alzheimer's disease.

title: Evidence of off-target probe binding in the 10x Genomics Xenium v1 Human Breast Gene Expression Panel compromises accuracy of spatial transcriptomic profiling.
main_goals: This paper introduces the Off-target Probe Tracker (OPT) software to identify off-target probe binding in spatial transcriptomic data. The tool was used to analyze the 10x Genomics Xenium v1 Human Breast Gene Expression Panel, finding significant off-target binding affecting multiple genes. The study validates these findings by comparing Xenium data with orthogonal Visium and single-cell RNA-seq datasets, highlighting the impact of off-target binding on data accuracy.

title: Unified integration of spatial transcriptomics across platforms.
main_goals: Introduce L loki, a novel framework for integrating spatial transcriptomics data across diverse platforms without requiring shared gene panels. It addresses integration through feature alignment and batch alignment, using optimal transport-guided feature propagation and graph-based imputation to enable single-cell foundation models. Evaluations show L loki outperforms existing methods for cross-technology spatial gene program identification and tissue slice alignment.

title: Excitatory synaptic transmission is differentially modulated by opioid receptors along the claustro-cingulate pathway.
biological_context: Claustro-cingulate pathway in mice, focusing on pain and emotion processing
main_goals: This study investigates how opioid receptors (KOR, MOR, DOR) modulate excitatory synaptic transmission in the claustro-cingulate pathway of mice. It aims to understand the specific roles of each opioid receptor in this circuit's glutamatergic signaling. The findings highlight the unique role of KOR in monosynaptic transmission from the claustrum to the anterior cingulate cortex.

title: The tectum transversum(TTR) maintains patency of the developing coronal suture.
main_goals: To investigate the developmental process of the tectum transversum (TTR) in a mouse model and characterize its role in maintaining coronal suture patency. The study used genetic ablation and spatial transcriptomics to demonstrate TTR's essential function and suggest its interaction with BMP signaling.

title: SpaceBF: Spatial coexpression analysis using Bayesian Fused approaches in spatial omics datasets.
main_goals: Introduce SpaceBF, a Bayesian fused modeling framework for estimating molecular coexpression at local and global levels in spatial omics datasets. Demonstrate superior performance compared to existing methods and uncover novel biological insights in cancer datasets.

title: The essential role of connective-tissue cells during axolotl limb regeneration.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the role of connective tissue (CT) cells in axolotl limb regeneration. It used spatial transcriptomics to reveal that CT cells constitute a significant portion of the blastema and that their ablation delays regeneration. The paper also provides a molecular profile of CT cells via an interactive web platform.

title: Spatial transcriptomics AI agent charts hPSC-pancreas maturation in vivo.
biological_context: in vivo maturation of human stem cell-derived pancreatic cells
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper introduces the Spatial Transcriptomics AI Agent (STAgent), an autonomous multimodal AI agent designed to automate and accelerate spatial transcriptomics data analysis. STAgent integrates multimodal LLMs with computational tools to perform complex analyses, including code generation, visual reasoning, and literature retrieval, reducing analysis time from weeks to minutes. It was applied to chart the in vivo maturation of human stem cell-derived pancreatic cells, revealing insights into tissue organization and biological processes.

title: A Spatial Multi-Omic Framework Identifies Gliomas Permissive to TIL Expansion.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'TCR sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'Xenium in situ transcriptomics', 'CODEX spatial proteomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study identifies genomic and spatial determinants of TIL expandability in high-grade gliomas. It reveals associations between IL7R expression, perivascular immune clustering, and metabolic programs like ACSS3 with successful TIL expansion. The findings establish a genomics-enabled selection platform for adoptive T cell therapy, with prospective implementation in the GIANT clinical trial.

title: Mapping the spatial architecture of glioblastoma from core to edge delineates niche-specific tumor cell states and intercellular interactions.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To map the spatial architecture of the GBM ecosystem using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify niche-specific tumor cell states, multicellular niches, and intercellular interactions, particularly focusing on immune evasion mechanisms.

title: Transmembrane Serine Protease TMPRSS11B promotes an acidified tumor microenvironment and immune suppression in lung squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: To determine the impact of TMPRSS11B activity on the host immune system and the tumor microenvironment in LUSC. The study evaluated the effect of Tmprss11b depletion in a mouse model and found that TMPRSS11B promotes an acidified and immunosuppressive TME, identifying it as a therapeutic target.

title: Spatial multi-omics profiling of breast cancer oligo-recurrent lung metastasis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the spatial topology of lung-specific metastases from breast cancer and the underlying biological mechanisms using a comprehensive strategy with imaging mass cytometry, spatial proteomics, snRNA-seq, and multiplex immunofluorescence. It identifies distinct cellular compositions and spatial differences in the tumor microenvironment between primary breast cancer and lung metastases, with a focus on potential therapeutic targets like anti-angiogenic therapy and immunotherapy.

title: Spatial Metabolomics and Lipidomics in Kidney Disease.
biological_context: Kidney disease (chronic kidney disease, acute kidney injury, genetic kidney disease, and cancer)
main_goals: This review provides examples of how spatial metabolomics data can offer critical information regarding the localization of changes in various kidney disease states. It highlights that combining spatial metabolomics with other data types like pathology, transcriptomics, or proteomics can illuminate underlying disease mechanisms and provide new clinical insights.

title: Empowering integrative and collaborative exploration of single-cell and spatial multimodal data with SGS genome browser.
main_goals: Introduces SGS, a user-friendly, collaborative, and versatile browser for visualizing single-cell and spatial multimodal data. It features an innovative genome browser, flexible visualization modes, 3D SRT data visualization, and advanced comparative visualization capabilities like scCompare and scMultiView. SGS supports various data formats and integrates with existing analysis tools, enabling collaborative exploration without programming.

title: Spatially resolved multi-omics reveals the renal cortex-metabolic reprogramming of Shenhua Tablet for intervention on IgA nephropathy.
main_goals: To explore the molecular mechanism of Shenhua Tablet (SHT) intervention in IgA nephropathy (IgAN) using spatial multi-omics strategies. The study aimed to understand how SHT affects metabolites and gene expression in the renal cortex and identify its active components.

title: A multi-view graph convolutional network framework based on adaptive adjacency matrix and multi-strategy fusion mechanism for identifying spatial domains.
main_goals: This paper proposes STMGAMF, a multi-view graph convolutional network model for identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data. It utilizes an adaptive adjacency matrix to capture complex spatial structures and a multi-strategy fusion mechanism to optimize embedded features. The model demonstrates superior performance in spatial domain identification, visualization, and spatial trajectory inference.

title: Developing Transferable Fourier Transform Mid-Infrared Spectroscopy Predictive Models for Buffalo Milk: A Spatio-Temporal Application Strategy Analysis Across Dairy Farms.
main_goals: This study explores the potential of Fourier Transform Mid-Infrared Spectroscopy (FT-MIRS) for predicting buffalo milk fat, protein, and total solids. It investigates spatio-temporal application strategies for these models, aiming to provide rapid detection technology for buffalo milk composition and support production management and genetic breeding.

title: The role of transketolase in the immunotherapy and prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma: a multi-omics approach.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq analysis', 'methylation profiling', 'single-cell analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'RT-qPCR', 'siRNA transfection', 'luciferase reporter assay', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the role of transketolase (TKT) in the immunotherapy and prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using a multi-omics approach. It investigates TKT expression, its association with tumor immunity, prognostic value, and regulation by STAT3.

title: Multidimensional transcriptomics based to illuminate the mechanisms of taurine metabolism in immune resistance of pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the potential therapeutic relationship between taurine metabolism disorders and pancreatic cancer immunotherapy. The researchers identified novel tumor cell subsets and analyzed cell-cell communication to gain insights into immunotherapy strategies. They also identified LY6D as a potential therapeutic target by examining its role in regulating taurine metabolism within the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment.

title: Enhanced cell tracking using a GAN-based super-resolution video-to-video time-lapse microscopy generative model.
main_goals: The paper introduces tGAN, a GAN-based model for generating synthetic annotated time-lapse microscopy data. The goal is to enhance the quality and diversity of training data for cell tracking models, thereby reducing the reliance on manual annotations and improving tracking performance.

title: Dissection of tumoral niches using spatial transcriptomics and deep learning.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Normalization', 'Spatial Information Integration', 'Morphological Feature Extraction', 'Gene Expression Quantification', 'Single Cell Expression Characterization', 'Tumor Niche Characterization', 'Clustering', 'Profiling']
main_goals: This paper introduces TG-ME, a computational framework integrating transformer and GraphVAE models for dissecting tumoral niches using spatial transcriptomics and morphological images. TG-ME identifies and characterizes niches by integrating spatial information, morphological features, and gene expression. It aims to provide insights into tumor microenvironment organization, molecular changes along cancer progression, and guide personalized treatment strategies.

title: Extracellular vesicle-derived miRNA-mediated cell-cell communication inference for single-cell transcriptomic data with miRTalk.
main_goals: The paper presents miRTalk, a novel approach for inferring cell-cell communication mediated by extracellular vesicle-derived miRNA-target interactions using single-cell transcriptomic data. It demonstrates superior performance against benchmarks and reveals in-depth mechanisms in disease scenarios.

title: Spatial proteomics in translational and clinical research.
main_goals: This paper discusses recent advances in targeted and untargeted spatial proteomics, highlights emerging multiscale approaches for tissue profiling, and emphasizes their translational potential in clinical research. It aims to shed light on the revolution spatial proteomics is bringing to understanding cellular organization, function, and disease.

title: BDNF-GABA signaling in astrocytes: enhancing neural repair after SCI through MSC therapies.
biological_context: Spinal cord injury (SCI) recovery facilitated by Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs) and induced pluripotent stem cell-derived MSCs (iPSC-MSCs)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Denoising', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study aims to map the astrocyte landscape, explore signaling pathways, and uncover molecular mechanisms supporting SCI recovery using MSC therapies. It highlights the role of BDNF-regulated GABA signaling in astrocytes for neuronal regeneration and the potential of hUC-MSCs and iPS-derived MSCs in activating these pathways.

title: The impact of dropouts in scRNAseq dense neighborhood analysis.
main_goals: This study assesses the impact of dropouts on the homogeneity and stability of clusters in scRNA-seq data. It evaluates popular clustering pipelines (dimensionality reduction + graph-based clustering) from Seurat and Scanpy under increasing dropout rates. The findings highlight that while cluster homogeneity is maintained, cluster stability decreases, challenging current practices for identifying local neighborhoods in high-dropout scRNA-seq data.

title: FOS-driven inflammatory CAFs promote colorectal cancer liver metastasis via the SFRP1-FGFR2-HIF1 axis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro models', 'in vivo models', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study identifies an inflammatory CAF subtype (CFD+ iCAFs) associated with poor clinical outcomes in colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It reveals that FOS-mediated differentiation drives SFRP1 overexpression in these CAFs, which then promotes tumor stemness and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) via the SFRP1-FGFR2-HIF1 axis, enhancing CRLM progression. SFRP1 is highlighted as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Single Molecule Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization Using RNAscope to Study Hematopoietic and Vascular Interactions in the Zebrafish Embryo and Larva.
biological_context: Hematopoietic and vascular interactions in zebrafish embryo and larva
main_goals: This paper provides experimental details of an optimized protocol using RNAscope technology for high-sensitivity mRNA detection combined with high-resolution fluorescence confocal imaging. It aims to visualize and quantify hematopoietic stem cell precursors within their developmental and definitive niches in zebrafish embryos and larvae, enabling spatial transcriptomics.

title: A spatial transcriptomics study of MES-like and mono/macro cells in gliomas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Profiling', 'Survival Analysis', 'Cell Communication Mapping', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Drug Sensitivity Analysis', 'Immune Therapy Responsiveness Assessment']
main_goals: This study aimed to conduct a comprehensive multi-omics analysis of gliomas to identify potential therapeutic targets and prognostic markers. It investigated the roles of MES-like malignant and monocyte/macrophage cell subsets in tumor progression and immune modulation using spatial transcriptomics and other bioinformatics approaches. The research also explored drug sensitivity and immune therapy responsiveness in relation to these cell types.

title: THBS2-producing matrix CAFs promote colorectal cancer progression and link to poor prognosis via the CD47-MAPK axis.
main_goals: This study identifies matrix CAFs (mCAFs) as a critical subset in colorectal cancer (CRC) that secretes THBS2. It elucidates that THBS2 promotes CRC progression by binding to CD47 on tumor cells, activating the MAPK/ERK5 pathway. The findings highlight the THBS2-CD47 axis and CREB3L1 as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals the key role of MCAM<sup>+</sup> tip-like endothelial cells in osteosarcoma metastasis.
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the role of tip-like endothelial cells (ECs) in osteosarcoma metastasis. It used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify MCAM+ tip-like ECs and confirmed their association with angiogenesis and metastasis in osteosarcoma.

title: Computer-aided diagnosis of Haematologic disorders detection based on spatial feature learning networks using blood cell images.
main_goals: The study presents a novel Computer-Aided Diagnosis of Haematologic Disorders Detection Based on Spatial Feature Learning Networks with Hybrid Model (CADHDD-SFLNHM) approach using blood cell images. The approach aims to enhance the detection and classification of haematologic disorders using preprocessing techniques, a modified LeNet-5 model for feature extraction, a CNN-BiGRU-A model for classification, and the pelican optimization algorithm for hyperparameter tuning.

title: Multiscale transformers and multi-attention mechanism networks for pathological nuclei segmentation.
biological_context: Pathological nuclei segmentation in pathology images
main_goals: Propose a network model for pathology image segmentation based on a multi-scale Transformer multi-attention mechanism. The model addresses challenges of high cell density, complex backgrounds, and blurred cell boundaries to improve segmentation accuracy.

title: Spatial omics for accelerating plant research and crop improvement.
main_goals: This paper provides an overview of recent advancements in spatial omics technologies and their applications in plant research. It discusses scientific discoveries enabled by these technologies and outlines experimental and computational challenges, along with strategies to overcome them for advancing breeding efforts. The authors anticipate spatial omics will play a crucial role in designing future crops.

title: Spatial Metabolomics in Acute Kidney Injury.
main_goals: This review focuses on the application of mass spectrometry imaging-based spatial metabolomics in studying ischemia- and toxin-induced AKI. It highlights how spatial metabolomics provides deeper understanding of pathophysiological connections in AKI. Continued research in multimodal imaging and omics is deemed essential.

title: μGlia-Flow, an automatic workﬂow for microglia segmentation and classification.
main_goals: The paper introduces μGlia-Flow, an automatic workflow for microglia segmentation and classification. It integrates Frangi filtering for branch segmentation, edge-guided attention TransUNet (EGA-Net) for soma segmentation, and a Vision Transformer (ViT) for morphology classification. This workflow aims to improve segmentation accuracy and address parameter dependency issues in existing classification methods.

title: Combining spatial transcriptomics and ECM imaging in 3D for mapping cellular interactions in the tumor microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'ECM remodeling analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper presents a method to integrate 3D spatial transcriptomics with ECM imaging in serial sections to comprehensively profile cellular neighborhoods (CNs) within the tumor microenvironment. The aim is to systematically quantify molecular states, cell-cell interactions, and ECM remodeling to identify druggable drivers of tumor progression and inform microenvironment-directed therapies.

title: Withaferin A maintained microbiome and metabolome features in A53T transgenic mice via multi-omics integrated analysis.
data_modalities_used: ['16S rRNA sequencing', 'fecal metabolomics', 'brain spatial metabolomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'Western blot', 'ELISA', 'behavioral tests']
main_goals: This study investigated the neuroprotective mechanisms of Withaferin A (WFA) in a Parkinson's disease mouse model. It aimed to elucidate WFA's regulation of gut microbiota composition, metabolic pathways, and correlations with brain spatial metabolomics to understand its impact on the microbiota-gut-brain axis.

title: Multi-Manifolds fusing hyperbolic graph network balanced by pareto optimization for identifying spatial domains of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces MManiST, a novel computational method that fuses multi-manifolds using a hyperbolic graph network, balanced by Pareto optimization, for identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to effectively exploit deeper topological structures of inherent manifolds, outperforming existing state-of-the-art methods in extensive experiments.

title: Blind deconvolution network of encoded images in wavefront coding systems.
main_goals: This paper proposes an optical-digital imaging system that uses Jacobi-Fourier profile functions for encoding and a CNN for digital decoding. A blind deconvolution network is trained to recover high frequencies in images acquired under different defocus values without knowing the exact optical transfer function of the system.

title: Typical Crop Classification of Agricultural Multispectral Remote Sensing Images by Fusing Multi-Attention Mechanism ResNet Networks.
main_goals: This research introduces an enhanced crop classification and identification model based on a residual ResNet network integrating self-attention and coordinate attention mechanisms. The improved ResNet50 model aims to accurately classify complex crop planting structures using multispectral remote sensing images. The goal is to achieve higher classification accuracy compared to traditional methods and RGB images for precision agriculture management.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomics reveals key gene regulation for grain yield and quality in wheat.
main_goals: This study performs a spatial transcriptomics study of wheat grain development to understand gene regulation impacting grain yield and quality. It classifies grain cell types, identifies marker genes, and reveals co-expression patterns that influence development. The research identifies specific genes, including TaABI3-B1, potentially regulating wheat grain development.

title: Integrating Ambient Ionization Mass Spectrometry Imaging and Spatial Transcriptomics on the Same Cancer Tissues to Identify RNA-Metabolite Correlations.
biological_context: Human breast and lung cancer tissues
data_modalities_used: ['DESI-MSI', 'Visium spatial transcriptomics', 'mass spectrometry imaging', 'spatial metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'RNA']
main_goals: The paper presents a novel method combining DESI-MSI spatial metabolomics and Visium spatial transcriptomics on the same tissue sections. The goal is to enable more holistic insights by integrating these modalities and to identify correlations between metabolites and mRNA transcripts in cancer tissues.

title: Multi-Omics Integration in Nephrology: Advances, Challenges, and Future Directions.
main_goals: This review explores methods and challenges for integrating transcriptomic, epigenomic, and spatial data in nephrology. It highlights how multi-omics integration offers a comprehensive view of kidney biology in health and disease, advancing diagnostic and therapeutic strategies for kidney diseases like diabetic kidney disease and autosomal polycystic kidney disease.

title: Identification of the disulfidptosis-related key gene CD2AP as a potential biomarker and new therapeutic target for LUAD patients by comprehensive multi-omics analysis.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore CD2AP's function in LUAD and its potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target through multi-omics analysis. The research identified CD2AP as a key gene related to disulfidptosis, overexpressed in LUAD, and linked to poorer prognosis. It also investigated CD2AP's association with the immune microenvironment, drug sensitivity, and spatial expression patterns.

title: Multimodal glioma immunotherapy combining TLR9-targeted STAT3 antisense oligodeoxynucleotides with PD1 immune checkpoint blockade.
main_goals: To develop and evaluate a multimodal glioma immunotherapy combining TLR9-targeted STAT3 antisense oligodeoxynucleotides with PD1 immune checkpoint blockade. The study aimed to disrupt immune evasion mediated by glioma-associated myeloid cells (GAMs) and restore sensitivity to PD1 blockade, thereby facilitating T-cell-mediated anti-tumor immune responses.

title: A distinct subgroup with Schwann-like differentiation presents immune resistance and poor prognosis in plantar melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry (mIHC)', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Single-Cell Analysis', 'Transcriptome', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Neoplastic']
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal the evolutionary characteristics and communication patterns of tumor subgroups in plantar melanoma using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplex immunohistochemistry. It identified a distinct subgroup with Schwann-like differentiation, regulated by HMGA2, which is associated with immune resistance and poor prognosis. The study also elucidated the functional impact of HMGA2 inhibition on melanoma fate.

title: Unveiling the crucial role of CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell and endothelial cell interaction in rheumatoid arthritis through the integrated analysis of spatial transcriptomics and bulk/single-cell RNA-seq.
main_goals: This study aimed to unveil the crucial role of CD8+ T cell and endothelial cell interaction in rheumatoid arthritis. By integrating bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics, the researchers identified CD8+ T cell-endothelial cell interactions via chemokine signaling as critical drivers of RA progression. This interaction is proposed to promote leukocyte transendothelial migration and synovial immune infiltration.

title: Accurate and Flexible Single Cell to Spatial Transcriptome Mapping with Celloc.
main_goals: Celloc is a method developed to accurately map single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data to low-resolution spatial transcriptomics (ST) data. It uses a graph attention autoencoder and comprehensive loss functions for flexible cell-to-spot mapping, enabling either cell composition deconvolution within spots or spatial assignment for scRNA-seq cells. The method demonstrates superior accuracy and robustness compared to state-of-the-art methods on simulated and real datasets.

title: Micro-region transcriptomics profiling of cerebral organoids using a capillary-based microdissection system.
main_goals: The paper establishes a capillary-based tissue microdissection system (CMS) for high-efficiency acquisition of micro-regions of interest (mROIs) from cerebral organoids for mRNA sequencing (CMS-seq). This enables spatial transcriptomics analysis, allowing for annotation of cell types and investigation of gene expression trends across spatial locations and developmental stages in the organoids.

title: The glycolytic characteristics of hepatocellular carcinoma and its interaction with the microenvironment: a comprehensive omics study.
main_goals: To identify glycolysis-related prognostic markers and immunological abnormalities in patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) by integrating multi-omics data. The study aimed to find potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for HCC diagnosis and treatment.

title: Quantitative evaluation of flood extent detection using attention U-Net case studies from Eastern South Wales Australia in March 2021 and July 2022.
main_goals: This research proposes an innovative approach using an attention U-Net on SAR datasets for flood extent detection. The method was developed and validated using Sentinel-1 data from flooding events in Eastern South Wales, Australia. The attention U-Net approach showed promising results in identifying flood extent with high precision, recall, and F1-score.

title: Spatial multi-omics analysis of metabolic heterogeneity in zebrafish exposed to microcystin-LR and its disinfection byproducts.
biological_context: Zebrafish exposed to microcystin-LR and its disinfection byproducts
main_goals: This study introduces spatial multi-omics to investigate the disruptions caused by ingestion of MC-LR and MCLR-DBPs in zebrafish. It characterizes overall metabolic changes and provides insight into the spatial distribution of metabolites and genes in targeted organs. The approach enhances understanding of the biological effects of these pollutants.

title: MedScale-Former: Self-guided multiscale transformer for medical image segmentation.
biological_context: Skin lesion, lung organ, and multiple myeloma plasma cell segmentation
main_goals: Introduces MedScale-Former, a dual-branch transformer network for medical image segmentation. It utilizes self-supervised learning with inter-scale consistency and spatial stability losses, and incorporates a selective kernel regional attention module to enhance boundary definition. The method demonstrates superior performance compared to state-of-the-art approaches.

title: Spatial multi-omics analysis of tumor-stroma boundary cell features for predicting breast cancer progression and therapy response.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial transcriptional characteristics of the tumor boundary in breast cancer and its association with progression and therapy response. It identifies key cell-cell interactions, particularly between CAFs and M2-like TAMs, which are linked to immune exclusion and drug resistance. A novel malignant body signature (MBS) is developed for prognostic prediction and assessment of treatment response.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses revealing tumor microenvironment remodeling after neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy in non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) tumor microenvironment remodeling after neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy
main_goals: To examine the impact of chemoimmunotherapy in NSCLC patients by identifying key molecules, cell subpopulations, communication patterns, and spatial distributions that correlate with therapeutic sensitivity. The study aims to uncover dynamic spatial and transcriptional changes in the tumor microenvironment in response to combined therapy.

title: Multimodal sequencing of neoadjuvant nivolumab treatment in hepatocellular carcinoma reveals cellular and molecular immune landscape for drug response.
biological_context: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) with neoadjuvant nivolumab treatment
data_modalities_used: ['spatially-resolved transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'TCR clonotype analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'TCR clonotype analyses', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular and molecular immune landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma patients treated with neoadjuvant nivolumab. It aims to identify mechanistic determinants of therapeutic response and differentiate responders from non-responders by integrating multimodal sequencing data and exploring spatiotemporal dynamics.

title: Filtering cells with high mitochondrial content depletes viable metabolically altered malignant cell populations in cancer single-cell studies.
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of filtering cells with high mitochondrial RNA content (pctMT) in cancer single-cell studies. It challenges current quality control practices by demonstrating that malignant cells often naturally exhibit higher pctMT, which is associated with metabolic dysregulation, drug resistance, and transcriptional heterogeneity. The findings suggest that current filtering thresholds may deplete viable, metabolically altered malignant cell populations.

title: Illustrating the distribution and metabolic regulatory effects of nuciferine by mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics.
biological_context: Nervous system disorders and effects of nuciferine
main_goals: To map the distribution of nuciferine and its key metabolites in mouse brain microregions and peripheral organs using AFADESI-MSI. The study aimed to investigate the neuropharmacological effects of nuciferine by identifying metabolic alterations, specifically in purine metabolism, and their correlation with enzyme localization.

title: Prioritization strategies for non-target screening in environmental samples by chromatography - High-resolution mass spectrometry: A tutorial.
main_goals: This tutorial presents seven prioritization strategies for non-target screening (NTS) using chromatography coupled to high-resolution mass spectrometry (HRMS) in environmental samples. It aims to help identify environmentally and toxicologically relevant chemicals of emerging concern (CECs) by focusing identification efforts efficiently. The strategies covered include target/suspect screening, data quality filtering, chemistry-driven, process-driven, effect-directed analysis, prediction-based methods, and pixel/tile-based analysis.

title: Firearm Violence and Dental Health: A Neighborhood Analysis in 100 U.S. Cities, 2014-2022.
main_goals: This study examined the relationship between community-level firearm violence and dental health, focusing on dental care utilization and edentulism. Analyses revealed that increases in firearm violence were associated with lower dental care utilization and higher rates of edentulism, highlighting firearm violence as a social determinant of oral health.

title: Single-Cell Profiling and Proteomics-Based Insights Into mTORC1-Mediated Angio+TAMs Polarization in Recurrent IDH-Mutant Gliomas.
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of the mTORC1 pathway and tumor-associated macrophages in the recurrence and progression of IDH-mutant gliomas. It utilizes proteomic, phosphoproteomic, and multi-dimensional transcriptomic approaches, including single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest that mTORC1 activation and Angio-TAMs are key contributors to glioma recurrence and progression.

title: Applications of spatial transcriptomics in studying spermatogenesis.
main_goals: This review discusses how spatial transcriptomics has been used to study spermatogenesis by identifying spatially variable genes, characterizing cellular neighborhoods, delineating cell-cell communications, and detecting molecular changes in pathological conditions in the mammalian testis. It highlights the potential of spatial transcriptomics and related assays to advance the understanding of male infertility and develop new treatments.

title: Single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the evolution of glucose metabolism in hepatocellular carcinoma and identify G6PD as a potential therapeutic target.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the temporal-spatial evolution of glucose metabolism in HCC using single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies G6PD as a potential therapeutic target by examining its role in HCC cell proliferation, migration, and invasion, and its association with glutathione metabolism and ROS production.

title: Spatial transcriptomics delineates potential differences in intestinal phenotypes of cardiac and classical necrotizing enterocolitis.
biological_context: Necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) in neonatal infants, comparing cardiac and classical subtypes.
main_goals: To compare ileal spatial transcriptomes of patients with cardiac and classical necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC). The study aimed to identify differences in cell types, metabolism, and immune cell activation between NEC subtypes, differentiating their underlying pathological mechanisms.

title: Novel insights into kidney disease: the scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics approaches: a literature review.
main_goals: This literature review summarizes the application and development of scRNA-seq combined with spatial transcriptomics in kidney disease research. It highlights how these techniques have identified novel cell subpopulations and their interactions, elucidated disease mechanisms, and paved the way for targeted therapies.

title: Single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics identify brain landscape of gene regulatory networks associated with behavioral maturation in honeybees.
biological_context: Behavioral maturation in honeybees (nursing to foraging)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To identify the gene regulatory networks (GRNs) associated with behavioral maturation in honeybees using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to uncover cell-type and spatial heterogeneity in GRN organization and understand the role of specific GRNs in coordinating brain cell activity during behavioral transitions.

title: ROICellTrack: a deep learning framework for integrating cellular imaging modalities in subcellular spatial transcriptomic profiling of tumor tissues.
biological_context: Urothelial carcinoma of the bladder and upper tract urothelial carcinoma
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: ROICellTrack is a deep learning framework designed to better integrate cellular imaging with spatial transcriptomic profiling. It aims to leverage imaging data beyond just defining regions of interest to improve the downstream analysis and interpretation of spatial omics data. The framework identifies distinct cancer-immune cell mixtures with specific transcriptomic and morphological signatures, enhancing the understanding of tumor heterogeneity and its implications for targeted therapies.

title: Overview: Spatial Metabolomics Review Series.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper provides an overview of spatial metabolomics, a rapidly evolving field that combines the spatial resolution of imaging with the biochemical information of metabolomics. It aims to highlight the importance and potential applications of spatial metabolomics in understanding biological systems.

title: Incorporating spatial diffusion into models of bursty stochastic transcription.
main_goals: This paper introduces a spatial stochastic model for nuclear mRNA dynamics with two-state transcriptional dynamics. It derives analytical solutions for spatial and demographic moments and shows that mRNA counts can be approximated by a Poisson-beta distribution, enabling efficient parameter inference from static snapshot data at subcellular spatial resolution.

title: The Later Life Depression Knowledge Questionnaire (LLD-KQ): Development and Initial Validation.
main_goals: This study developed and evaluated the initial validity of the Later Life Depression Knowledge Questionnaire (LLD-KQ) as a measure of clinical knowledge of later life depression. The questionnaire aims to assess behavioral health providers' knowledge of later life depression and advance research in this area.

title: MSIght: A Modular Platform for Improved Confidence in Global, Untargeted Mass Spectrometry Imaging Annotation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration of multiple modalities', 'Coregistration of histological stains to MSI data', 'LC-MS/MS peptide identification for confirmation', 'Spatial localization and resolution enhancement', 'High-throughput data analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces MSIght, a modular platform designed to automate the integration of histological stains and LC-MS/MS peptide identifications with Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) data. This integration aims to improve the confidence in global, untargeted MSI annotation by enhancing spatial localization and confirming peptide identifications, thereby increasing throughput for clinical applications.

title: Enhanced thyroid nodule detection and diagnosis: a mobile-optimized DeepLabV3+ approach for clinical deployments.
main_goals: This paper introduces an enhanced DeepLabV3+ approach for thyroid nodule segmentation in ultrasound images. It aims to achieve a balance between a lightweight architecture for mobile deployment and high segmentation accuracy. The method incorporates MobileNetV2, Depthwise Separable Dilated Convolution, and Tversky loss functions to improve performance.

title: In Situ Graphene-Seq: Spatial Transcriptomics and Chronic Electrophysiological Characterization of Tissue Microenvironments.
biological_context: Human-induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocyte and endothelial cell co-cultures
main_goals: The study introduces in situ graphene-sequencing (graphene-seq), a platform integrating chronic electrophysiology with spatially resolved 3D transcriptomics. This platform utilizes stretchable mesh nanoelectronics and transparent graphene/PEDOT:PSS electrodes for long-term, single-cell-level interfacing. It aims to enable comprehensive multimodal, spatially resolved analysis of cell microenvironments and study the interplay between cellular function and molecular identity.

title: A factor-based analysis of individual human microglia uncovers regulators of an Alzheimer-related transcriptional signature.
main_goals: The paper presents a novel analytical framework for microglia analysis using single-cell hierarchical Poisson factorization (scHPF). This framework aims to provide a more biologically interpretable taxonomic approach for microglia and was used to identify regulators of an Alzheimer's disease-related transcriptional signature. The study also uses multiplexed MERFISH to assess microglial factors in spatial transcriptomics.

title: Integrated single-cell and spatial analysis identifies context-dependent myeloid-T cell interactions in head and neck cancer immune checkpoint blockade response.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) response
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Ligand-Receptor Interactions']
main_goals: To systematically evaluate cell interactions between immune cell types within the tumor microenvironment of HNSCC patients responding to ICB. The study integrated single-cell and spatial omics data to identify context-dependent myeloid-T cell interactions and potential biomarkers for ICB response. It aims to provide a rich data resource of cell-cell ligand-receptor interactions for the research community.

title: Automated, high-throughput in-situ hybridization of Lytechinus pictus embryos.
data_modalities_used: ['in situ hybridization', 'hybridization chain reaction (HCR)', 'whole-mount embryos', 'confocal microscopy']
main_goals: To develop a fully automated, high-throughput hybridization chain reaction (HCR) pipeline for large-scale gene expression pattern profiling in Lytechinus pictus embryos. The pipeline, termed HT-HCR, significantly reduces cost and effort, enabling the processing of 192 gene probe sets on whole-mount embryos within 32 hours. This facilitates high-quality localization data for numerous genes across developmental stages, paving the way for localization of understudied genes and sophisticated perturbation analysis.

title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Reveals Individual and Cohort Level Insights into Chromosome 9p Syndromes.
main_goals: This study presents the first large-scale whole-genome sequencing study of individuals with 9p-related syndromes, analyzing genomic architecture, identifying late replicating regions associated with structural variant breakpoints, and prioritizing genes involved in these syndromes. It also utilized spatial transcriptomics in mouse embryos to examine gene expression patterns relevant to craniofacial and brain development, and identified key genes for 9p deletion syndrome.

title: Comparative spatial transcriptomics reveals root dryland adaptation mechanism in rice and HMGB1 as a key regulator.
biological_context: Rice root adaptation to dryland conditions
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular and developmental mechanisms underlying root adaptation to dryland conditions in upland rice compared to irrigated rice. It utilizes spatial transcriptomics to identify key genes and developmental phenotypes, highlighting HMGB1 as a crucial regulator for root elongation and thickening, thereby enhancing drought resistance.

title: From Invaginating Site to Deep Lesion: Spatial Transcriptomics Unravels Ectopic Endometrial Penetration Features in Adenomyosis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'histological techniques']
main_goals: This study maps the spatial transcriptional landscape of adenomyosis from the endometrial invaginating site to ectopic lesions. It investigates molecular mechanisms of endometrial invasion and fibrosis, identifying key cell types and their roles. The work aims to provide a deeper understanding of adenomyosis pathogenesis and introduces a novel transcriptomics web resource.

title: Scale selection and machine learning based cell segmentation and tracking in time lapse microscopy.
biological_context: Cell cycle phases, disease mechanisms, cell motion, effects of treatments. Evaluated on Cell Tracking Challenge (CTC) time-lapse sequences.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell Tracking', 'Detection of cell regions', 'Track generation', 'Cell event detection']
main_goals: This paper introduces a comprehensive cell segmentation and tracking methodology for time-lapse microscopy. It employs multi-scale space-time interest point detection for automatic scale selection and a neural network with class prototype balancing for cell region detection. The method provides a structured mathematical framework using graphs for track generation and cell event detection, showing competitive performance on diverse cell types and imaging techniques.

title: Conformation-sensitive targeting of CD18 depletes M2-like tumor-associated macrophages resulting in inhibition of solid tumor progression.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer (CRC), non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['LC-MS/MS', 'surface plasmon resonance', 'peptide-protein interaction 3D modeling', 'Quantibrite PE beads in PBMCs', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To elucidate the anticancer efficacy of TB511 by identifying new target proteins that preferentially bind to M2-TAMs and clarifying the apoptosis-inducing mechanism in these cells. The study investigates activated CD18 as a target protein for cancer therapy and TB511 as a potential therapeutic agent.

title: Multi-omics analysis identifies DLX4 as a novel biomarker for diagnosis, prognosis, and immune infiltration: from pan-cancer to renal cancer.
biological_context: Pan-cancer, specifically Kidney Renal Clear Cell Carcinoma (KIRC)
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanisms of DLX4 in pan-cancer, with a focus on its role in renal cancer (KIRC). The study aims to identify DLX4 as a novel biomarker for diagnosis, prognosis, and immune infiltration, and explores its potential as a therapeutic target.

title: Flexible integration of spatial and expression information for precise spot embedding via ZINB-based graph-enhanced autoencoder.
main_goals: Spot2vector is a computational framework for flexible integration of spatial and expression information for precise spot embedding in spatially resolved transcriptomics. It uses a graph-enhanced autoencoder with ZINB modeling to extract latent embeddings, improving domain identification accuracy, reducing dimensionality, and denoising data. The framework effectively captures diverse spatial patterns across different platforms.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of the aging mouse brain reveals origins of inflammation in the white matter.
main_goals: To systematically understand age-induced molecular changes in the mouse brain using spatial transcriptomics, identifying inflammation origins in white matter fiber tracts, with pronounced effects in females. The study confirmed findings with immunofluorescence and MRI, linking previous disjointed observations.

title: RIPK2 promotes colorectal cancer metastasis by protecting YAP degradation from ITCH-mediated ubiquitination.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Receptor-Interacting Protein Kinase 2 (RIPK2) in promoting colorectal cancer (CRC) metastasis. It identifies RIPK2 as a risk factor that enhances tumor cell migration and invasion by protecting YAP from degradation. The findings suggest RIPK2 is a promising therapeutic target for CRC.

title: Deep learning in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data analysis: advances and challenges from a data science perspective.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'gene expression', 'epigenetic modifications', 'metabolite levels', 'spatial locations']
main_goals: This paper systematically reviews the strengths and weaknesses of advanced deep learning methods for single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data analysis. It evaluates the performance of 58 computational methods across 21 datasets from nine benchmarks. The goal is to provide insights for selecting appropriate approaches and highlight areas for future development in biological, medical, and clinical settings.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tryptophan metabolism restricting maturation of intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate the factors restricting the maturation of intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in hepatocellular carcinoma. It identifies a tryptophan-enriched metabolic microenvironment shaped by malignant cells as a key factor. The findings suggest that inhibiting tryptophan metabolism can promote TLS maturation and enhance anti-tumor responses.

title: Development of a Single-Cell Spatial Metabolomics Method for the Characterization of Cell-Cell Metabolic Interactions.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment (TME) and its interactions with cancer cells (H460, HT-29, A549, HUH-7) and fibroblasts.
main_goals: The paper describes the development of a single-cell spatial metabolomics method using MALDI-MSI to profile cell-specific metabolic signatures and characterize cell-cell metabolic interactions. The method was optimized and applied to cocultures of cancer cells and fibroblasts to reveal altered metabolic profiles and competition for nutrients.

title: Segmentation of dense and multi-species bacterial colonies using models trained on synthetic microscopy images.
main_goals: Develop novel experimental and image analysis techniques for high-fidelity single-cell segmentation of bacterial colonies. Train machine learning models using synthetic microscopy images translated to look realistic via cycleGAN, enabling accurate segmentation of dense and multi-species colonies under suboptimal imaging conditions. The methods aim to facilitate quantitative descriptions of bacterial infections and support diagnostic tools.

title: Spatial proteomics of ER tubules reveals CLMN, an ER-actin tether at focal adhesions that promotes cell migration.
biological_context: Human cells, Endoplasmic Reticulum, Focal Adhesions, Cell Migration
main_goals: The study maps the proteomic landscape of the human ER network using proximity labeling and CRISPR technologies. It identifies CLMN as an ER-actin tether at focal adhesions, demonstrating its role in cell migration by affecting adhesion disassembly and actin dynamics. The research also suggests CLMN influences calcium signaling at ER-actin interfaces.

title: Integrated Metabolomics and Spatial Transcriptomics of Cystic Pancreatic Cancer Precursors Reveals Dysregulated Polyamine Metabolism as a Biomarker of Progression.
