biological_context: Cystic pancreatic cancer precursors (Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasms - IPMNs)
data_modalities_used: ['cystic fluid metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'tissue metabolomics', 'cell line metabolomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Metabolomics analysis', 'Spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'Single-cell transcriptomics analysis', 'Biomarker discovery', 'Statistical analysis of omics data', 'Correlation analysis between omics and clinical data']
main_goals: To identify oncometabolites in cystic pancreatic cancer precursors (IPMNs) using integrated metabolomics and spatial transcriptomics, aiming to find biomarkers that indicate the risk of malignancy. The study specifically investigates the role of polyamine metabolism and its potential as a clinical management aid for IPMNs.

title: Human Skeletal Muscle Niche Formation and Analysis with Spatial RNA Sequencing.
biological_context: Human skeletal muscle formation and regeneration
main_goals: This paper describes procedures for obtaining high yields of human xenografted transplants and compares the use of various spatial RNA sequencing platforms to uncover stem cell niche formation in human skeletal muscle. The goal is to better understand niche interactions for improved regenerative potential.

title: Comprehensive sequencing of the lung neuroimmune landscape in response to asthmatic induction.
data_modalities_used: ['Standard RNA sequencing', 'single nucleus-RNA sequencing', 'spatial RNA sequencing', 'snRNA-seq']
main_goals: To investigate how asthmatic induction alters the pulmonary neuroimmune transcriptome in vagal ganglia and lungs. The study aimed to identify gene expression changes, their clustering in specific neuron types, and their spatial distribution.

title: Unraveling the spatial and signaling dynamics and splicing kinetics of immune infiltration in osteoarthritis synovium.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF)', 'Computational drug prediction']
main_goals: This study aims to unravel the spatial and signaling dynamics and splicing kinetics of immune infiltration in osteoarthritis (OA) synovium. It provides a comprehensive spatial and transcriptional atlas of OA synovium, identifying key genes and signaling networks driving immune cell infiltration and proposing potential therapeutic targets.

title: Scalable spatial transcriptomics through computational array reconstruction.
main_goals: To present an imaging-free approach for reconstructing spatial barcode locations in spatial transcriptomics by utilizing molecular diffusion and dimensionality reduction. This method aims to improve scalability to centimeter-sized tissues and enhance accessibility without specialized imaging equipment.

title: Integrating Metabolomics and Transcriptomics to Characterize Differential Functional Capabilities of Kidney Proximal Tubule Cell Subtypes.
biological_context: Kidney proximal tubule cell subtypes in health and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)
main_goals: This review describes insights from studies integrating metabolomics and transcriptomics to characterize differential functional capabilities of kidney proximal tubule cell subtypes. It highlights how mapping metabolites to functional pathways enables these insights and discusses findings from fatty acid metabolism analysis in CKD patients. The aim is to show how integrating these data can lead to precision medicine approaches in nephrology.

title: TissueProf: An ImageJ/Fiji Plugin for Tissue Profiling Based on Fluorescent Signals.
biological_context: Neuroscience (implied by neuroscience journal and mention of analyzing multichannel microscopy images in neuroscience)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: The paper introduces TissueProf, a user-friendly ImageJ/Fiji plugin that provides a semiautomated image analysis pipeline for tissue profiling based on fluorescent signals. It aims to address challenges in cell identification and marker coexpression analysis in dense tissues with high background signals. The plugin automates ROI identification and cell counting for various marker combinations, mitigating workload and analysis time for researchers.

title: Advancing tissue analysis: Integrating mass tags with mass spectrometry imaging and immunohistochemistry.
main_goals: This review discusses the role of different mass tags in the combined application of Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) and Immunohistochemistry (IHC). It aims to highlight how mass tags can enhance optical information for IHC and boost MS signals for MSI, thereby improving the accuracy of protein detection, localization, and quantification in tissue sections. The goal is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of biological processes and disease states.

title: SpaMask: Dual masking graph autoencoder with contrastive learning for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Propose SpaMask, a dual masking graph autoencoder with contrastive learning for spatial transcriptomics analysis. SpaMask uses node and edge masking to improve robustness and performance in the face of sparse SRT data. It combines Masked Graph Autoencoders for clustering accuracy and Masked Graph Contrastive Learning for feature similarity and spatial proximity.

title: Integrating multiple spatial transcriptomics data using community-enhanced graph contrastive learning.
main_goals: The study proposes Tacos, a community-enhanced graph contrastive learning-based method to integrate multiple spatial transcriptomics data. Tacos aims to overcome limitations of current methods by considering the heterogeneity of spatial structures within and across slices and from different platforms. The method demonstrates superior performance in integrating different slices and accurately denoises spatially resolved transcriptomics data.

title: Morphogenic, molecular and cellular adaptations for unidirectional airflow in the chicken lung.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell Type Identification']
main_goals: The study delineates the morphogenic, molecular, and cellular features of the chicken lung that facilitate unidirectional airflow. It identifies a chicken-specific alveolar cell type (luminal cells) and describes the spatial organization of cell types and vascularization. The research aims to explore avian lung evolution and provide a foundation for functional genetic analysis.

title: Correlative analysis of metallomic gene expression and metal ion content within the mouse hippocampus.
biological_context: Mouse hippocampus metallomics and gene expression
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal a molecular basis for metallomic heterogeneity across key subregions of the hippocampus by integrating elemental mapping with spatial transcriptomics. The results demonstrate associations between metal enrichment and regional expression of transcripts related to metal transport, storage, and regulation. It also provides a template for integrating transcriptomics into multimodal workflows for neurometallome investigations.

title: Enhancing cell instance segmentation in scanning electron microscopy images via a deep contour closing operator.
main_goals: The study introduces a novel AI-driven approach, COp-Net, to refine cell boundary delineation in scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images by addressing gaps in cell contours. This method aims to improve instance-based cell segmentation and reduce the need for manual corrections, particularly in regions with poor image quality. The approach effectively fills in contour gaps, leading to enhanced accuracy in cell instance segmentation and facilitating the study of tissue bioarchitecture.

title: TriDeNT : Triple deep network training for privileged knowledge distillation in histopathology.
main_goals: This paper presents TriDeNT, a novel self-supervised method for utilizing privileged data (unavailable at inference, e.g., IHC stains, spatial transcriptomics) to improve computational pathology model performance. It demonstrates significant improvements over state-of-the-art methods in downstream tasks by distilling knowledge from scarce or costly data during training.

title: Association of Obesity and Innate Immune Markers With Resistance to Biologic Therapy in Psoriasis.
main_goals: This study aimed to delineate the inflammatory microenvironmental factors that affect sustained treatment response in patients with severe psoriasis. It investigated the association of obesity and innate immune markers with resistance to biologic therapy. The findings suggest that dysregulated innate immune responses and heightened neutrophil activity may be responsible for decreased sustainability of therapeutic responses to biologics.

title: Advances in Tandem Mass Spectrometry Imaging for Next-Generation Spatial Metabolomics.
main_goals: This paper highlights recent developments in advanced MS/MS imaging strategies to achieve high-coverage spatial metabolomics. It focuses on overcoming technical challenges in conventional MS/MS analysis for metabolite identification, particularly in the context of limited sample availability per tissue pixel. The aim is to improve the resolution of molecular structures for accurate metabolite annotation and correlation with spatial distribution patterns.

title: Spatial genomics reveals cholesterol metabolism as a key factor in colorectal cancer immunotherapy resistance.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify early treatment features associated with immunotherapy (ICI) outcome in colorectal cancer by leveraging the MC38 syngeneic tumor model. Using spatial transcriptomics, the researchers identified specific tumor and stroma cell subsets and revealed that increased tumor cell cholesterol regulation, synthesis, and transport were associated with a lack of ICI response, while inflammation and T cell infiltration correlated with response.

title: STopover captures spatial colocalization and interaction in the tumor microenvironment using topological analysis in spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: STopover is a novel approach that utilizes spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) data and topological analysis to investigate the tumor microenvironment (TME). It extracts connected components based on spatial distance and persistence, quantifies their spatial overlap using Jaccard indices, and assesses statistical significance through transcriptomic profile permutations. The method aims to reveal immune and stromal cell infiltration patterns, predict cell-cell communication, and identify relevant regions within the TME.

title: Quantitative characterization of tissue states using multiomics and ecological spatial analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: Propose MESA (multiomics and ecological spatial analysis), a framework for quantitative characterization of tissue states using spatial omics data. MESA quantifies spatial diversity, identifies hot spots, and links spatial patterns to phenotypic outcomes by integrating spatial and single-cell multiomics data. It aims to provide a molecular understanding of cellular neighborhoods and spatial interactions within tissue microenvironments.

title: CellPie: a scalable spatial transcriptomics factor discovery method via joint non-negative matrix factorization.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'histological image features', 'Visium HD dataset', 'gene expression', 'morphological information']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Factor discovery', 'Spatial domain identification', 'Joint non-negative matrix factorization']
main_goals: CellPie is a fast, unsupervised factor discovery method based on joint non-negative matrix factorization of spatial RNA transcripts and histological image features. It uses an accelerated hierarchical least squares method to reduce computational time for high-dimensional spatial transcriptomics datasets. The method demonstrates good performance and computational efficiency on various human cancer types.

title: Spatial analysis of IPMNs defines a paradoxical KRT17-positive, low-grade epithelial population harboring malignant features.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMNs) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'Nanostring GeoMx', 'single cell RNA sequencing', 'immunofluorescence', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates transcriptional changes during IPMN progression using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It identifies a subpopulation of low-grade IPMN epithelial cells expressing malignant features, marked by KRT17, and validates this finding using immunofluorescence. The goal is to identify a high-risk gene signature for better clinical management of IPMNs.

title: A tissue-scale strategy for sensing threats in barrier organs.
main_goals: Discovered a tiered threat-sensing strategy at the tissue scale in the lung during influenza infection. This strategy involves spatially graded PRR expression, leading to cell-type-specific threat-sensing probabilities. The findings suggest a mechanism to tolerate threats within epithelia while enabling potent immune responses as threats invade deeper.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Identifies Immune-Stromal Niches Associated with Cancer in Adult Dermatomyositis.
biological_context: Adult-onset dermatomyositis and cutaneous lupus erythematosus
main_goals: This study provides the first comprehensive spatial mapping of immune and stromal cells in adult-onset dermatomyositis. It reveals unique immune and stromal niches associated with DM subtypes, differentiating cancer-associated from non-cancer-associated DM skin lesions. The findings highlight specific cellular infiltrates, cytokine profiles (IL1B, CXCL10, IFN-β), and stromal remodeling patterns in DM.

title: Accurate trajectory inference in time-series spatial transcriptomics with structurally-constrained optimal transport.
main_goals: Develop a novel Optimal Transport-based trajectory inference method for time-series spatial transcriptomics (SOCS) that preserves the structural integrity of contiguous biological units. SOCS aims to produce more biologically coherent trajectories than existing approaches by maintaining spatial coherence and global geometric structure alongside gene expression similarity.

title: VISTA Uncovers Missing Gene Expression and Spatial-induced Information for Spatial Transcriptomic Data Analysis.
main_goals: The paper introduces VISTA, a novel approach to predict unobserved gene expression levels for subcellular spatial transcriptomic (SST) data. VISTA jointly models scRNA-seq and SST data using variational inference and geometric deep learning, incorporating uncertainty quantification. It aims to address the limitation of SST technologies in profiling a limited number of genes, enabling various downstream applications.

title: Peripartum dapagliflozin improves late-life maternal cardiovascular outcomes in a murine model of superimposed preeclampsia.
biological_context: Superimposed preeclampsia in a murine model
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'circulating plasma protein markers', 'urine studies', 'ultrasounds', 'tissue histopathology', 'serial echocardiography']
main_goals: To test the short- and long-term obstetrical and cardiovascular effects of dapagliflozin, an SGLT2 inhibitor, in a murine model of superimposed preeclampsia. The study also aimed to identify molecular effects of SGLT2 inhibition in cardiovascular tissues during and after pregnancy. The findings suggest dapagliflozin treatment improved physiological cardiovascular parameters during gestation and cardiac function later in life.

title: Spatial proteomics of Onchocerca volvulus with pleomorphic neoplasms shows local and systemic dysregulation of protein expression.
biological_context: Onchocerca volvulus, a parasitic nematode causing river blindness, with a focus on pleomorphic neoplasms (PN) in female worms, particularly after ivermectin treatment.
main_goals: To analyze the spatial proteome of Onchocerca volvulus female worms with pleomorphic neoplasms (PN) and identify proteins associated with PN development. The study aimed to understand how PN affects protein expression in different tissues and to investigate potential links between protein dysregulation and worm mortality following ivermectin treatment.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of progression gene signature and tumor microenvironment leading to progression in mycosis fungoides.
biological_context: Mycosis fungoides (MF) progression from patch to plaque and tumor stages
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'CD3 morphology markers', 'CD4 morphology markers', 'CD30 morphology markers']
main_goals: This study investigated transcriptomic changes and the tumor microenvironment associated with Mycosis Fungoides (MF) progression. It identified genes linked to progression and found that M2 macrophages and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in the tumor microenvironment may contribute to progression in early-stage MF.

title: HISSTA: a human in situ single-cell transcriptome atlas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell type annotation', 'Spatial colocalization', 'Spatial cellular communication', 'Niche analyses', 'Visualization']
main_goals: HISSTA is a database designed for the archival and analysis of in situ transcriptome data at single-cell resolution from various human tissues. It provides advanced tools for deciphering spatial contexts and makes all datasets and annotations interactively accessible. The database aims to significantly impact cancer diagnosis, precision medicine, and digital pathology.

title: Integrated multi-omics analyses provide new insights into genomic variation landscape and regulatory network candidate genes associated with walnut endocarp.
biological_context: Walnut endocarp development and shell thickness
main_goals: This paper aims to elucidate the genomic landscape and gene regulatory networks associated with walnut shell development. It reports a high-quality genome assembly and pan-genome of Juglans species, characterizes genomic variations, and identifies loci under selection. Multi-omics analyses are used to uncover candidate genes involved in secondary cell biosynthesis and lignin accumulation, with functional validation in Arabidopsis.

title: Thor: a platform for cell-level investigation of spatial transcriptomics and histology.
biological_context: Heart failure, mouse olfactory bulb, breast cancer, immune response, bladder cancer
covered_analysis_steps: ['Infer single-cell spatial transcriptomes from spot-level data', 'Integrate cell morphology with spatial transcriptomics', 'Cell-level genomic and image analysis', 'Interactive tissue analysis', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Pathway enrichment analysis', 'Immune response analysis', 'Impute high-resolution spatial transcriptomics data']
main_goals: Thor is a comprehensive computational platform for multi-modal analysis of spatial transcriptomics and histological images. It integrates genomic and image analysis by inferring single-cell spatial transcriptomes from spot-level data using an anti-shrinking Markov diffusion method. The platform includes 10 modules for cell-level analysis and is complemented by Mjolnir for interactive tissue analysis.

title: Motion-corrected eye tracking (MoCET) improves gaze accuracy during visual fMRI experiments.
main_goals: This paper introduces Motion-Corrected Eye Tracking (MoCET), a novel approach to correct drift in eye tracking data during fMRI experiments using head motion parameters. It aims to improve gaze accuracy and precision without additional hardware, allowing retrospective application to existing datasets.

title: Multi-omic landscape of human gliomas from diagnosis to treatment and recurrence.
biological_context: Human gliomas from diagnosis to treatment and recurrence
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study applies spatial proteomics, transcriptomics, and glycomics to human gliomas to uncover therapeutic escape mechanisms and tumor microenvironment evolution. It identifies targetable antigens, characterizes recurrence drivers in IDH-mutant gliomas, and utilizes multi-omic integration for grade classification and survival prediction.

title: Sequencing-free whole genome spatial transcriptomics at molecular resolution in intact tissue.
biological_context: The study demonstrates the technology on cultured cells and tissue sections. It also mentions its application in CRISPR screens, which are often used for understanding gene function and cellular processes.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in situ hybridization', 'in situ sequencing', 'long-noncoding RNAs', 'engineered RNA species']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Subcellular localization analysis', 'Gene expression programs analysis', 'CRISPR screening readout']
main_goals: This paper introduces a new image-based spatial transcriptomics technology called Reverse-padlock Amplicon Encoding FISH (RAEFISH). RAEFISH offers whole-genome level coverage with single-molecule spatial resolution in intact tissues, enabling comprehensive transcriptomic profiling at subcellular resolution. The technology is demonstrated to target thousands of transcript species in single cells and tissue sections, and is also adapted for spatial readout of gRNAs in CRISPR screens.

title: Charting Postnatal Heart Development Using In Vivo Single-Cell Functional Genomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces PIP-seq, a high-throughput platform for in vivo functional interrogation of candidate regulators in complex biological processes at single-nucleus resolution. It aims to map postnatal heart development by integrating single-nucleus transcriptomics with image-based spatial transcriptomics, uncovering novel regulators of cardiomyocyte maturation. This establishes a framework for dissecting developmental processes and understanding the role of microenvironment and intercellular communication.

title: Segger: Fast and accurate cell segmentation of imaging-based spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: This paper introduces segger, a novel graph neural network based method for fast and accurate cell segmentation of imaging-based spatial transcriptomics data. Segger frames cell segmentation as a transcript-to-cell link prediction task and can leverage single-cell RNA-seq data to improve assignments. It offers superior sensitivity and specificity with significantly reduced compute time compared to existing methods.

title: Tumor cell villages define the co-dependency of tumor and microenvironment in liver cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study developed a deep learning-based strategy called Spatial Dynamics Network (SDN) to spatially map tumor cell states and their surrounding architecture. The method identifies distinct 'villages' of tumor cells supported by unique SDNs, revealing village-specific molecular co-dependencies between tumor cells and their microenvironment. The research aims to provide new insights into understanding the tumor spatial landscape and its impact on tumor aggressiveness.

title: Inonotus obliquus (chaga) ameliorates folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice: the crosstalk analysis among PT cells, macrophages and T cells based on single-cell sequencing.
biological_context: Folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice
data_modalities_used: ['UPLC-MS', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'H&E staining', 'Masson trichrome staining']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the therapeutic effects of Inonotus obliquus (Chaga) on folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice. It uses single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to analyze cellular responses and identify potential mechanisms of action. The findings suggest Chaga may be a promising candidate for renal fibrosis treatment.

title: Understanding psoriatic disease at single-cell resolution: an update.
main_goals: This review examines recent advancements in psoriasis research through single-cell technologies like scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. It highlights the identification of immune cell, keratinocyte, and fibroblast subtypes crucial in disease progression and discusses the role of cytokines and fibroblast-keratinocyte crosstalk. The paper also touches upon metabolic dysregulation and potential therapeutic implications.

title: SOAPy: a Python package to dissect spatial architecture, dynamics, and communication.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Expression Tendency', 'Spatiotemporal Expression Pattern', 'Cellular Co-localization', 'Multi-cellular Niches', 'Cell-Cell Communication']
main_goals: SOAPy is a comprehensive Python package designed to analyze spatial omics data. It offers a variety of methods for dissecting spatial architecture, dynamics, and communication within tissue microenvironments. The package aims to be versatile across different spatial omics technologies and biological contexts.

title: SERPINA3 predicts long-term neurological outcomes and mortality in patients with intracerebral hemorrhage.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify reliable biomarkers for predicting long-term neurological outcomes and mortality in patients with intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH). It utilized spatial transcriptomics on autopsy brain tissues and plasma analysis to identify SERPINA3 as a potential prognostic biomarker.

title: A spatially resolved transcriptome landscape during thyroid cancer progression.
main_goals: This study aimed to map the tumor microenvironment (TME) architecture across different stages of thyroid cancer progression using integrated spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It identified distinct thyrocyte subpopulations and stage-specific cell-cell interactions, providing insights into cancer progression and potential diagnostic/therapeutic targets.

title: Spatial omics strategies for investigating human carotid atherosclerotic disease.
main_goals: This review focuses on recent advancements and findings related to spatial omics in the study of extracranial carotid atherosclerotic cerebrovascular disease. It highlights how spatial omics analysis can facilitate the detection of biomarkers and offer new insights into the diagnosis of atherosclerosis and its complications.

title: DNA methylation memory of pancreatic acinar-ductal metaplasia transition state altering Kras-downstream PI3K and Rho GTPase signaling in the absence of Kras mutation.
biological_context: Pancreatic acinar-to-ductal metaplasia (ADM) transition state and pancreatic cancer
data_modalities_used: ['DNA methylome profiling', 'transcriptome profiling', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study investigates the epigenetic memory of the pancreatic acinar-to-ductal metaplasia (ADM) transition state, even in the absence of oncogenic mutations. It identifies differential DNA methylation at Kras-downstream PI3K and Rho GTPase pathway genes during ADM, which persists after gene expression normalization. The findings link epigenetic memory to cancer-related cell plasticity in the pancreas.

title: Benchmarking spatial transcriptomics technologies with the multi-sample SpatialBenchVisium dataset.
biological_context: Mouse spleen tissue responding to malaria infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Quality Control', 'Tissue preparation protocols evaluation', 'Spatially variable gene detection', 'Clustering', 'Cell deconvolution', 'Differential expression analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: The paper presents SpatialBenchVisium, a reference dataset for benchmarking spatial transcriptomics technologies, specifically focusing on the 10x Visium platform. It compares different tissue preparation protocols (fresh frozen vs. FFPE, manual vs. CytAssist) and evaluates their impact on data quality, gene detection, clustering, deconvolution, and differential expression analysis.

title: eIF3f promotes tumour malignancy by remodelling fatty acid biosynthesis in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['organoid models', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolic flux analysis', 'transmission electron microscopy', 'multi-species models', 'time-of-flight mass cytometry', 'multiplexed immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of eIF3f in promoting tumor malignancy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) by remodeling fatty acid biosynthesis. The research identified eIF3f as a key regulator that stabilizes ACSL4, thereby increasing fatty acid biosynthesis and promoting HCC malignancy. Targeting the eIF3f-ACSL4-fatty acid biosynthesis axis, potentially in combination with anti-PD-1 therapy, showed promise for decelerating HCC progression.

title: Conserved spatial subtypes and cellular neighborhoods of cancer-associated fibroblasts revealed by single-cell spatial multi-omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study discovers and characterizes four distinct spatial CAF subtypes conserved across cancer types and independent of spatial omics platforms. These subtypes exhibit unique spatial organization, neighboring cell compositions, interaction networks, and transcriptomic profiles, influencing tumor microenvironment characteristics and patient survival.

title: Quantifying Plant Biology with Fluorescent Biosensors.
main_goals: This review focuses on how fluorescent biosensors illuminate plant biology across multiple scales and the major discoveries they have contributed to. It also discusses core principles and common pitfalls affecting biosensor engineering, deployment, imaging, and analysis. The paper aims to help aspiring biosensor researchers and highlights implications for synergizing biosensor research with other approaches.

title: Protocol for spatial metabolomics and isotope tracing in the mouse brain.
covered_analysis_steps: ['tracer administration', 'tissue collection', 'cryosectioning', 'matrix application', 'ion identification', 'data analysis', 'region-specific tracing analysis']
main_goals: This paper presents a protocol for performing spatial metabolomics and isotope tracing in the mouse brain using mass spectrometry imaging. The protocol covers tracer administration, tissue handling, and data analysis steps to enable high-quality spatial metabolomics data and region-specific tracing.

title: A Flexible Spatio-Temporal Architecture Design for Artifact Removal in EEG with Arbitrary Channel-Settings.
main_goals: The paper introduces ASTI-Net, a flexible dual-branch denoising model for EEG artifact removal. It addresses limitations of existing methods by handling arbitrary channel settings and integrating spatio-temporal features. ASTI-Net utilizes deformable convolutions and channel-wise temporal processing to restore clean multi-channel EEG.

title: 3D reconstruction of neuronal allometry and neuromuscular projections in asexual planarians using expansion tiling light sheet microscopy.
biological_context: Planarian regeneration and homeostasis, neural-muscular system
main_goals: To address the challenge of imaging planarian CNS in 3D with high resolution and speed, this paper adopts a novel approach combining tissue expansion and tiling light-sheet microscopy. They developed an automatic 3D cell segmentation pipeline to quantitatively profile neurons and muscle fibers at the single-cell level in planarians, enabling detailed structural and functional investigations.

title: Spatial metabolomics to profile metabolic reprogramming of liver in Schistosoma japonicum-infected mice.
main_goals: This study aims to profile the metabolic reprogramming of the liver in mice infected with Schistosoma japonicum using spatial metabolomics. The research intends to provide insights into the spatial distribution of metabolites and their relationship with the disease progression.

title: VPS25 Promotes an Immunosuppressive Microenvironment in Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'tissue microarrays (TMAs)', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunotherapy datasets', 'cell line (CAL27)']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of VPS25 in Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC). It demonstrates that VPS25 overexpression correlates with poor clinical outcomes, promotes tumor progression by facilitating immune evasion through the PVR-TIGIT axis, and serves as a potential biomarker for immunotherapy response.

title: Multi-Omics Analysis of the Anoikis Gene CASP8 in Prostate Cancer and Biochemical Recurrence (BCR).
main_goals: This paper explores the role of the Anoikis gene CASP8 in prostate cancer and biochemical recurrence (BCR). It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze gene expression patterns and identifies CASP8 as a potential biomarker for prostate cancer, developing a predictive model for BCR.

title: Detection of mRNA Transcript Variants.
main_goals: This review article addresses the advancements in molecular techniques in detecting transcript variants. It discusses traditional methods like RT-PCR and RT-qPCR, as well as newer techniques like RNA sequencing. The goal is to help researchers develop more effective strategies for detecting mRNA transcript variants.

title: Spatial relationships and interactions of immune cell niches are linked to the pathologic response of muscle-invasive bladder cancer to neoadjuvant therapy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Tertiary Lymphoid Structure analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the spatial features of distinct cell-type niches within the tumor microenvironment (TME) of patients with varying responses to neoadjuvant therapy. It identifies CCL19/CCL21 as key drivers of tertiary lymphoid structure (TLS) formation in MIBC and highlights the role of TLS and tumor heterogeneity in therapeutic response.

title: scMalignantFinder distinguishes malignant cells in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics by leveraging cancer signatures.
main_goals: scMalignantFinder is a new machine learning tool designed to distinguish malignant cells from normal cells in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It utilizes a data- and knowledge-driven strategy, calibrating annotations with pan-cancer gene signatures and employing differentially expressed genes as features. The tool demonstrates superior performance compared to existing automated methods and can predict malignancy probability, aiding in the understanding of tumor progression and annotation of malignant regions.

title: The transcription factor LHX2 mediates and enhances oncogenic BMP signaling in medulloblastoma.
biological_context: Medulloblastoma, a common childhood brain malignancy, with a focus on cerebellar development.
data_modalities_used: ['mouse xenografts', 'immunohistochemical analysis', 'cell-based assays', 'orthotopic xenografts', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic analysis', 'in-mouse orthotopic transplantation']
main_goals: This paper explores the mechanisms of Bone Morphogenetic Protein (BMP) signaling in medulloblastoma. It identifies the transcription factor LHX2 as being transcriptionally induced by BMP signaling and, in turn, enhancing BMP signaling by upregulating the BMP type I receptor (ACVR1). The study demonstrates that LHX2 gain-of-function enriches stemness and chemoresistance in medulloblastoma cells and contributes to tumor propagation and metastasis.

title: SIMVI disentangles intrinsic and spatial-induced cellular states in spatial omics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: SIMVI is a deep learning framework that disentangles cell intrinsic and spatial-induced latent variables in spatial omics data. It enables estimation of spatial effects at a single-cell resolution and supports various downstream analyses.

title: Ginsenoside Rb1 and berberine synergistically protect against type 2 diabetes mellitus via GDF15/HAMP pathway throughout the liver lobules: Insights from spatial transcriptomics analysis.
biological_context: Type 2 diabetes mellitus in a mouse model
main_goals: This study investigates the synergistic protective effects of Ginsenoside Rb1 (Rb1) and berberine (BBR) against type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) using a mouse model. It aims to elucidate the underlying mechanisms, particularly focusing on liver metabolism modulation and the GDF15/HAMP pathway, using spatial transcriptomics to understand zone-specific effects.

title: Biophysical and Biochemical Roles of Shear Stress on Endothelium: A Revisit and New Insights.
main_goals: This review examines the biophysical and biochemical roles of shear stress on endothelium, focusing on its impact on cardiovascular pathophysiology. It summarizes critical mechanosensors, flow-sensitive effectors, and downstream cellular events, evaluates experimental models, discusses targeting strategies, and addresses emerging perspectives in hemodynamic research.

title: Organelle symphony: nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 and nuclear factor-kappa B in stroke pathobiology.
main_goals: This review discusses the mechanisms underlying the involvement of nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 (Nrf2) and nuclear factor-kappa B (NF-κB) in both ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke. It emphasizes their roles in oxidative stress, inflammation, and neuroprotection, and how their interplay influences stroke pathophysiology. The review also touches upon advancements in single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics offering new treatment opportunities.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals tumor cell heterogeneity and underlying molecular program in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This study characterizes tumor cell heterogeneity in colorectal cancer (CRC) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis. It identifies malignant cell expression programs (MCEPs), constructs crosstalk networks with immune/stromal cells, and develops a prognostic model for personalized risk prediction. The research also identifies potential therapeutic targets, such as TIMP1.

title: Dynamic Load Identification of Thin-Walled Cabin Based on CNN-LSTM-SA Neural Network.
main_goals: Proposes a CNN-LSTM-SA neural network-based method for load identification of thin-walled spacecraft models. Aims to improve accuracy and robustness compared to traditional methods by avoiding inverse model establishment and realizing response-load time-sequence mapping. The method shows good performance in simulation and experimental results.

title: Diverse Subsets of γδT Cells and Their Specific Functions Across Liver Diseases.
biological_context: Liver Diseases (viral hepatitis, NAFLD, ALD, liver fibrosis, autoimmune liver diseases, HCC)
main_goals: This paper reviews the diverse subsets of γδT cells and their specific functions across various liver diseases. It highlights recent advances in understanding their heterogeneity, functional roles (Vδ1+, Vδ2+, γδT17, IFN-γ-secreting cells), and the potential for γδT cell-based immunotherapeutic approaches in liver disease treatment. The focus is on summarizing current knowledge and proposing future research directions.

title: Decoding Liver Fibrosis: How Omics Technologies and Innovative Modeling Can Guide Precision Medicine.
biological_context: Liver fibrosis and chronic liver disease (CLD)
main_goals: This paper aims to provide an overview of innovative omics technologies revolutionizing liver fibrosis research and the current tools to model this disease. It highlights the use of spatial and single-cell resolution approaches, along with iPSC-derived liver cells and organoids, for understanding disease mechanisms and guiding precision medicine.

title: Precision Oncology Program (POP), an observational study using real-world data and imaging mass cytometry to explore decision support for the Molecular Tumor Board: study protocol.
main_goals: To evaluate the feasibility and utility of integrating real-world data (RWD) and imaging mass cytometry (IMC) to inform personalised treatment recommendations for cancer patients. The study assesses whether clinicogenomic data from a matched cohort can guide treatment decisions and explores the impact of spatial proteomics on these decisions. The ultimate goal is to support profiling-driven decision-making for Molecular Tumor Boards.

title: Benchmarking algorithms for spatially variable gene identification in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This article proposes a benchmark framework to evaluate algorithms for identifying spatially variable genes. It analyzes 30 synthesized and 74 real-world datasets to identify the best algorithms and their application scenarios, assisting scientists in selecting suitable tools and aiding in the development of new computational methods.

title: Bridging the gap between histopathology and genomics: Spotlighting spatial omics.
main_goals: To highlight the potential of spatial omics technologies to bridge the gap between histopathology and genomics in veterinary medicine. The paper discusses how these technologies can unravel the interplay between tissue architecture and cellular phenotypes, aiding in disease decipherment and therapeutic target identification.

title: Identification and characterization of human retinal stem cells capable of retinal regeneration.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell multiomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human retinal organoids', 'rd10 mouse model of retinitis pigmentosa']
main_goals: This paper identifies and characterizes human neural retinal stem-like cells (hNRSCs) from human fetal retinas and retinal organoids. It demonstrates their self-renewal and differentiation potential and their ability to regenerate all retinal cell types. Furthermore, transplanted hNRSCs showed promise in alleviating retinal degeneration and improving visual function in a mouse model.

title: Spatiotemporal profiling of adhesion G protein-coupled receptors in developing mouse and human pancreas reveals a role for GPR56 in islet development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Developmental', 'Clustering']
main_goals: To systematically characterize the expression of adhesion G protein-coupled receptors (aGPCRs) and their ligands in developing mouse and human pancreas. The study investigates the role of GPR56 in islet development by analyzing Gpr56 null mice.

title: Multi-Omics Profiling Reveals Glycerolipid Metabolism-Associated Molecular Subtypes and Identifies ALDH2 as a Prognostic Biomarker in Pancreatic Cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['lipidomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'PCR', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study characterizes glycerolipid metabolism (GLM) in pancreatic cancer (PC) using multi-omics technologies. It identifies GLM-associated molecular subtypes with distinct prognostic, biofunctional, immune microenvironmental, and drug sensitivity profiles. ALDH2 is identified as a novel prognostic biomarker for PC.

title: Deep learning image analysis for continuous single-cell imaging of dynamic processes in Plasmodium falciparum-infected erythrocytes.
main_goals: The paper presents a workflow for continuous, single-cell monitoring of live Plasmodium falciparum parasites within erythrocytes. This workflow integrates label-free imaging, deep-learning-based segmentation, and 3D rendering for time-resolved analyses. The goal is to overcome challenges in studying dynamic cellular processes in malaria parasites.

title: SOX2 commands LIM homeobox transcription factors in choroid plexus development and tumorigenesis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This work examined the role of the transcription factor SOX2 in choroid plexus (CP) development and tumorigenesis. It investigated SOX2's function in the molecular signature of tumor cells using multi-omics approaches and identified SOX2-LMX1 signaling as critical for maintaining progenitor identity in CP development and tumor formation.

title: Spatial lipidomics reveals sphingolipid metabolism as anti-fibrotic target in the liver.
biological_context: Steatotic liver disease (SLD) and liver fibrosis
data_modalities_used: ['bulk lipidomics', 'spatial lipidomics', 'transcriptomics', 'imaging mass cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)']
main_goals: This study uses a spatial multi-omics approach to investigate the mechanisms of liver fibrosis in steatotic liver disease. It identifies sphingolipid metabolism as a key dysregulated pathway and suggests its potential as an anti-fibrotic therapeutic target.

title: Single-cell and spatial analyses reveal the effect of VSIG4<sup>+</sup>S100A10<sup>+</sup>TAMs on the immunosuppression of glioblastoma and anti-PD-1 immunotherapy.
biological_context: Glioblastoma (GBM) tumor immune microenvironment (TIME) and response to anti-PD-1 immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'flow cytometry', 'multiplex immunofluorescence (mIF)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the heterogeneity of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) in glioblastoma (GBM) and their impact on tumor immunity and anti-PD-1 immunotherapy response. It identifies VSIG4+S100A10+TAMs as key players in immunosuppression and a prognostic indicator for GBM patients.

title: Systems biology of Haemonchus contortus - Advancing biotechnology for parasitic nematode control.
biological_context: Haemonchus contortus, a parasitic nematode affecting ruminants
main_goals: This review synthesizes key advances in understanding Haemonchus contortus, focusing on molecular biology, genetic diversity, and host-parasite interactions. It highlights the role of genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic technologies, alongside AI and machine learning, in identifying potential targets for novel anthelmintics. The paper emphasizes the integration of these tools with single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to dissect host-parasite interactions.

title: Time, the final frontier.
main_goals: This paper advocates for integrating temporal dynamics into cancer research due to the limitations of static snapshots. It emphasizes a shift towards data-driven, continuous approaches, highlighting the need for advanced live imaging techniques, temporal omics methodologies, and novel computational tools.

title: Advancements in Nanomaterials and Molecular Probes for Spatial Omics.
main_goals: This review summarizes the design and application of functional nanoscaffolds for spatial omics in recent years, with a particular emphasis on nanomaterials and molecular probes. It aims to inspire researchers in selecting appropriate materials and probes for high-quality spatial omics.

title: The Novel Dual GIP and GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Tirzepatide Attenuates Colon Cancer Development by Regulating Glucose Metabolism.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'in vitro cell proliferation assays', 'in vivo tumor regression models', 'patient-derived xenograft (PDX) mouse model']
main_goals: To investigate the role of tirzepatide (TZP), a GIP and GLP-1 receptor agonist, in attenuating colon cancer development by regulating glucose metabolism. The study demonstrates TZP's ability to inhibit cancer cell proliferation, promote apoptosis, and induce tumor regression in mice by downregulating glycolysis and the TCA cycle, mediated by HIF-1α and PFKFB3 inhibition.

title: TM4SF1 overexpression in tumor-associated endothelial cells promotes microvascular invasion in hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tumor-associated endothelial cells (TECs) in microvascular invasion (MVI) in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It identifies TEC subpopulations and key genes, such as TM4SF1, associated with MVI by analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. The findings suggest that TM4SF1 overexpression in TECs promotes MVI via epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT).

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals a Stereoscopic Response of Rice Leaf Cells to Magnaporthe oryzae Infection.
biological_context: Rice leaf response to Magnaporthe oryzae infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to reveal a stereoscopic immune response of rice leaf cells to Magnaporthe oryzae infection. It constructs a rice leaf atlas, identifies immune receptor expression in vascular tissues, and shows diterpene phytoalexin biosynthesis in procambium cells. The research highlights cell-specific and multi-dimensional immune responses, including longitudinal immunity towards the leaf tip.

title: Proximity proteomics reveals unique and shared pathological features between multiple system atrophy and Parkinson's disease.
biological_context: Synucleinopathies (Parkinson's disease, multiple system atrophy, dementia with Lewy bodies)
main_goals: To use in-situ proximity labeling to compare aggregated and total alpha-synuclein interactomes between Multiple System Atrophy (MSA) and Parkinson's Disease/Dementia with Lewy Bodies (PD/DLB). The study aims to reveal unique and shared pathological features and understand divergent and convergent alpha-synuclein-aggregate interactions.

title: Single-cell omics and heterogeneity of neuroglial cells.
biological_context: Neuroglial cells in the nervous system
covered_analysis_steps: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'detecting distinct cell populations', 'identifying cellular states', 'molecular transitions of cell populations', 'defining neuroglial cell subtypes', 'determining spatial relationships']
main_goals: This paper provides a primer on single-cell transcriptomic and spatial transcriptomic approaches and discusses their pivotal role in defining neuroglial cell subtypes and their spatial relationships. It highlights recent discoveries and new questions arising from these advancements regarding the origin, organization, and functional purpose of diverse neuroglial cell subtypes.

title: Spatial-temporal patterns and influencing factors of carbon emissions in different regions of China.
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial-temporal patterns and quantifies influencing factors of carbon emissions in different regions of China from 2005 to 2019. It utilizes various statistical and spatial analysis methods to understand regional disparities and the drivers of carbon emissions. The aim is to inform targeted carbon reduction strategies.

title: Integrated multi-omics profiling characterizes the crucial role of human dental epithelium during tooth development.
main_goals: This paper aims to characterize human fetal tooth development by integrating single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and secretome analysis. It seeks to identify uncharacterized epithelial subpopulations, map spatiotemporal changes, and elucidate epithelial-mesenchymal interactions. The ultimate goal is to highlight the crucial role of dental epithelium in orchestrating tooth morphogenesis.

title: Mapping molecular landscapes in triple-negative breast cancer: insights from spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial biomarker identification', 'Intratumoral heterogeneity definition', 'Molecular subtyping refinement', 'Prediction of immunotherapy responses', 'Tumor classification', 'Biomarker identification', 'Therapy prediction models']
main_goals: This review highlights the utilization of spatial transcriptomics (ST) in understanding the tumor microenvironment of triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). It discusses how ST maps tumor-stroma interactions, immune infiltration, and therapy resistance, contributing to TNBC progression insights, spatial biomarker identification, and patient stratification. The paper also touches upon advancements in AI-based spatial analysis and the need for continued development for clinical integration.

title: Mini Review: Spatial Transcriptomics to Decode the Central Nervous System.
biological_context: Central Nervous System (CNS) neurodegenerative diseases (Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, multiple sclerosis, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis)
main_goals: This mini review explores the impact of spatial transcriptomics (ST) on central nervous system (CNS) research, particularly in neurodegenerative diseases. It describes foundational ST methods, reviews key studies, and discusses the promise of ST for identifying drug targets and advancing CNS-targeting compounds.

title: B cells and energy metabolism in HER2-positive DCIS: insights into breast cancer progression from spatial-omics analyses.
biological_context: HER2-positive DCIS and invasive breast tumors
main_goals: This study investigates the associations between gene expression profiles in cancer cells and the immune microenvironment of HER2-positive DCIS and invasive breast tumors using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to understand the role of B cells and energy metabolism in breast cancer progression from DCIS to invasive cancer.

title: Spatial pattern characteristics and influencing factors of state-level sports industry bases in China.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Analysis', 'Spatial Gini coefficient', 'Imbalance index', 'Standard deviation ellipse', 'Panel negative binomial regression']
main_goals: This study examines the spatial patterns and influencing factors of state-level sports industry bases in China. It aims to understand the distribution trends and identify key drivers like economic growth and government investment.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptome atlas of developing mouse lung.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate a spatiotemporal transcriptome atlas of developing mouse lung, from branching morphogenesis to alveologenesis. The study identifies spatial domains, maps lineage trajectories, explores transcription factor regulatory networks, and characterizes alveolar niche heterogeneity. The goal is to provide a comprehensive molecular atlas to advance understanding of human lung development and regeneration.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses reveal transcriptional cell lineage heterogeneity in extracranial arteriovenous malformation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate an overview of the molecular information within eAVMs at the single-cell level by performing single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified different cell states, uncovered specific cell populations (MAFB+ nidus ECs), characterized mesenchymal activation in ECs, and identified transcriptional variation within perivascular cells. It also cataloged dysregulated cell-to-cell interactions associated with eAVMs.

title: Deep learning-assisted cellular imaging for evaluating acrylamide toxicity through phenotypic changes.
main_goals: This study developed a novel approach combining deep learning models (U-Net and ResNet34) with cell fluorescence imaging for evaluating acrylamide toxicity. It uses U-Net for cell segmentation and ResNet34 for predicting AA concentration ranges based on cell fluorescence features. The method analyzes phenotypic changes using k-means clustering and CellProfiler to provide a high-throughput, accurate solution.

title: Basal ganglia connectivity and network asymmetry in Parkinson's disease: A resting-state fMRI study.
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of basal ganglia network asymmetry on motor function in Parkinson's Disease (PD) using resting-state fMRI. The researchers analyzed functional connectivity and network asymmetry in PD patients and healthy controls, identifying significant alterations in specific basal ganglia substructures. The findings highlight the role of basal ganglia network asymmetry in PD pathophysiology and suggest potential biomarkers for diagnosis and monitoring.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Differential Inflammatory Pathways in Discoid Lupus Erythematosus and Lichen Planus.
biological_context: Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus and Lichen Planus
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate differential inflammatory pathways in discoid lupus erythematosus and lichen planus. The research aims to provide insights into the molecular mechanisms underlying these skin conditions by analyzing the spatial distribution of gene expression.

title: SPARROW reveals microenvironment-zone-specific cell states in healthy and diseased tissues.
biological_context: Human and mouse tissues, human tonsil
covered_analysis_steps: ['cell-type inference', 'cellular neighborhood identification', 'microenvironment zone delineation', 'integration of spatially resolved transcriptomics and scRNA-seq data', 'ligand-receptor interaction analysis']
main_goals: SPARROW is a computational framework that jointly learns latent embeddings and soft clusterings of cell types and cellular organization. It aims to overcome limitations of current analytical tools by enabling integrated analysis of cell type inference and cellular neighborhood identification across scales and samples. The framework achieves single-cell spatial resolution and whole-transcriptome coverage, facilitating the discovery of zone-specific cell states and interactions.

title: Toward molecular phenotyping of temporal lobe epilepsy by spatial omics.
biological_context: temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) patient subtypes (PET+ vs PET-)
data_modalities_used: ['18F-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (PET)', 'mass spectrometry imaging (MSI)', 'proteomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify differential molecular mechanisms in temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) patient subtypes (PET+ vs PET-) using a spatial omics approach. The study aimed to elucidate the molecular basis for metabolic differences observed in TLE patients by analyzing lipid and protein profiles in neocortical and hippocampal biopsies.

title: Metabolic stress and age drive inflammation and cognitive decline in mice and humans.
biological_context: Metabolic stress, inflammation, and cognitive decline, including Alzheimer's disease
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'high-fat diet model', 'post mortem tissue', 'hippocampal spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between metabolic stressors, inflammation, and cognitive decline in mice and humans. It uses a high-fat diet model in mice and examines post-mortem human brain tissue to identify gene expression changes and the role of microglia, particularly focusing on secreted phosphoprotein 1 (SPP1), in metabolically driven cognitive impairment.

title: Detection of Quality Deterioration of Packaged Raw Beef Based on Hyperspectral Technology.
biological_context: Quality deterioration of packaged raw beef during storage and transportation
main_goals: To explore the feasibility of combining hyperspectral imaging (HSI) technology with chemometrics and deep learning to detect the quality deterioration of PE-packaged raw beef, focusing on malondialdehyde (MDA) content. The study investigated the effect of packaging film interference and demonstrated visualization of MDA changes.

title: Spatial proteomics and transcriptomics characterization of tissue and multiple cancer types including decalcified marrow.
biological_context: Multicancer tissue types, including decalcified bone marrow
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'PhenoCycler', 'Xenium', 'high-plex immunohistochemistry', 'FFPE tissue slides', 'bone marrow core specimens']
main_goals: The study aimed to optimize technical methods for spatial omics by addressing preanalytical challenges and characterizing a multicancer tissue microarray and a decalcification protocol for bone marrow specimens. It demonstrated the compatibility of PhenoCycler and Xenium platforms for spatial proteomics and transcriptomics across various tumor types, including decalcified marrow, ensuring tissue quality and data reproducibility.

title: Heterozygous GAA knockout is nonconsequential on metabolism and the spatial liver transcriptome in high-fat diet-induced obese and prediabetic mice.
biological_context: High-fat diet-induced obesity and prediabetes in mice
main_goals: This study investigated the impact of heterozygous GAA knockout on liver metabolism and metabolic health in mice fed a high-fat diet. It also explored alterations in the liver transcriptome of these mice using spatial transcriptomics. The findings indicate that heterozygous GAA knockout is nonconsequential on metabolism and metabolic health in this model.

title: Spatially resolved mapping of cells associated with human complex traits.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Introduce gsMap, a method for genetically informed spatial mapping of cells for complex traits. The method integrates spatial transcriptomics with GWAS summary statistics to map cells to traits in a spatially resolved manner. It aims to provide biological insights into the spatial distribution of trait-relevant cells and related signature genes.

title: Marrying mechanics with spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to bridge the gap between mechanical forces and spatial transcriptomics by reviewing how mechanical cues can be integrated into spatial omics analyses. It discusses how mechanical properties influence cellular behavior and how this information can be leveraged to understand biological systems.

title: Spatial immune remodeling of the liver metastases: discovering the path to antimetastatic therapy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper aims to analyze liver metastases from a spatial immune perspective. It highlights the potential of spatial omics technologies to understand immune escape mechanisms and the molecular basis of immune remodeling. The goal is to identify specific spatial immune characteristics for accurate clinical predictions and to develop strategies targeting spatial immune remodeling for antimetastatic therapy.

title: Immune-featured stromal niches associate with response to neoadjuvant immunotherapy in oral squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tumor stromal cells in the tumor microenvironment of oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) and their association with response to neoadjuvant immunotherapy. It identifies specific stromal cell populations and their spatial distribution that correlate with treatment outcomes in patients receiving anti-PD-1 monotherapy or combination immunochemotherapy.

title: The IBEX Knowledge-Base: A central resource for multiplexed imaging techniques.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Denoising', 'Batch Correction', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The paper presents the IBEX Knowledge-Base as a central resource for reagents, protocols, and more to enhance knowledge sharing, optimization, and innovation of spatial proteomics techniques. This resource aims to address the complexity, expense, and labor-intensive nature of multiplexed imaging.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a tumor-associated macrophage subpopulation that mediates prostate cancer progression and metastasis.
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal the dynamics of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) in prostate cancer using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified a specific SPP1+/TREM2+ TAM subpopulation enriched in metastatic tumors and associated with poor survival, suggesting SPP1+ TAMs as a therapeutic target to enhance immune checkpoint inhibition.

title: Spatially Informed Nonnegative Matrix Trifactorization for Coclustering Mass Spectrometry Data.
main_goals: This paper introduces TRIFASE, a semi-nonnegative matrix trifactorization technique for coclustering mass spectrometry data while accounting for spatial correlation. It proposes an estimation algorithm and heuristic approximations to improve scalability and computational efficiency. The method is validated on simulations and applied to mouse brain tissue to extract spatial expression patterns and discover biologically linked protein blocks.

title: Multi-omics approach reveals the impact of prognosis model-related genes on the tumor microenvironment in medulloblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell ATAC sequencing', 'spatial RNA analyses']
main_goals: To develop a TME-associated risk score (TMErisk) model using RNA sequencing data to predict patient outcomes and elucidate biological mechanisms in medulloblastoma. The study validated findings using single-cell and spatial analyses, identifying key genes and their expression dynamics across cell types and tumor regions.

title: CD147 Mediates the Metabolic Reprogramming of Cancer Associated Fibroblasts Induced by EVs Released by Differentiating Cancer Stem Cells.
main_goals: This study demonstrates that CD147 packaged in extracellular vesicles (sEVs-CD147) activates cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in colorectal cancer. It shows that this activation reprograms CAF metabolism, leading to increased aerobic glycolysis, lactate release, and pro-tumorigenic cytokine and VEGF production. The findings indicate that sEV-packaged CD147 promotes tumor progression by modifying stroma metabolism.

title: Machine learning to dissect perturbations in complex cellular systems.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Perturbation analysis', 'Modeling perturbations', 'Decoding drug and genetic perturbation responses', 'Complex multicellular interactions', 'Network dynamics']
main_goals: This review outlines core principles underpinning perturbation analysis in complex cellular systems. It discusses methodologies and analytical frameworks used to decode drug and genetic perturbation responses, multicellular interactions, and network dynamics, while overviewing current tools. The developments hold promise for improving drug development and personalized medicine.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the heterogeneity and intercellular communication of cancer-associated fibroblasts in gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study characterizes CAF subtypes and explores intercellular communication between CAFs and malignant epithelial cells in gastric cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies CAF subpopulations and their interactions, potentially revealing therapeutic targets.

title: AI-driven framework to map the brain metabolome in three dimensions.
main_goals: The paper introduces MetaVision3D, an AI-driven pipeline for transforming serial 2D MALDI mass spectrometry imaging sections into a high-resolution 3D spatial metabolome. The framework employs computer vision algorithms for image registration, normalization, and interpolation to create a comprehensive 3D model of metabolites. It was demonstrated by generating a 3D mouse brain metabolome atlas.

title: Integrated workflow for analysis of immune enriched spatial proteomic data with IMmuneCite.
biological_context: Immune microenvironment in human and murine liver, clinical liver transplantation, and murine hepatocellular carcinoma
main_goals: Introduce IMmuneCite, a computational framework for comprehensive image pre-processing and single-cell dataset creation for spatial proteomics, focusing on defining complex immune landscapes. Demonstrate its ability to identify discrete immune cell phenotypes, reduce nonbiological cell clusters, and accommodate different antibody panels and species. Enable deep characterization of immune cell functional states in various liver conditions.

title: Stages prediction of Alzheimer's disease with shallow 2D and 3D CNNs from intelligently selected neuroimaging data.
main_goals: The study aims to detect different stages of Alzheimer's disease from MRI data using 2D and 3D CNNs. A novel preprocessing pipeline involving skull stripping, spatial normalization, smoothing, pixel count-based frame selection, cropping, and a learnable resizer is proposed. The merged CNN architectures are also compared for further analysis.

title: Downregulated STAT3 and STAT5B are prognostic biomarkers for colorectal cancer and are associated with immune infiltration.
data_modalities_used: ['TCGA data', 'GTEx database', 'clinical samples', 'single cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Immune infiltration analysis']
main_goals: This study assesses the expression, prognostic value, and immune function of the STAT family in colorectal cancer. It found that downregulated STAT3 and STAT5B are significantly associated with better patient outcomes and immune infiltration. The study proposes STAT3 and STAT5B as potential prognostic biomarkers and immunotherapy targets for colorectal cancer.

title: Reactivation of CTLA4-expressing T cells accelerates resolution of lung fibrosis in a humanized mouse model.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of CTLA4-expressing T cells in resolving lung fibrosis. It demonstrates that targeting CTLA4 with ipilimumab accelerates lung regeneration and reduces fibrosis in a mouse model. The findings suggest that immune-mediated clearance of senescent cells by T cells is crucial for tissue repair.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in the adult Drosophila brain and body.
main_goals: This paper applies spatial transcriptomics using a selected gene panel to map unknown cell clusters from the Fly Cell Atlas to their spatial locations in the adult Drosophila brain. It also investigates principles of mRNA localization and transcriptional diversity in muscle cells and presents computational tools for integrating spatial transcriptomics and single-cell datasets.

title: Determinants of Response to Sequential Pembrolizumab with Trastuzumab plus Platinum/5-FU in HER2-Positive Gastric Cancer: A Phase II Chemoimmunotherapy Trial.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-exome sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'whole-exome sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing']
main_goals: This study assessed the contributions of components in sequential pembrolizumab with trastuzumab plus platinum/5-FU in HER2-positive gastric cancer. It aimed to understand the biology of intratumoral heterogeneity and the impact of tumor and immune cell features on clinical outcomes by analyzing various omics data from patient biopsies.

title: Advances in Spatial Omics Technologies.
main_goals: This review focuses on the advancements and strategies of spatial omics technologies, summarizes their applications in biomedical research, and highlights their power in advancing the understanding of life sciences related to development and disease. It aims to provide new perspectives on key biological processes such as nervous system development, organ development, and tumor microenvironment.

title: The Role of PLIN3 in Prognosis and Tumor-Associated Macrophage Infiltration: A Pan-Cancer Analysis.
data_modalities_used: ['mRNA expression', 'protein expression', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multicolor fluorescence staining']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of PLIN3 in cancer prognosis and tumor-associated macrophage infiltration across multiple cancer types. It analyzes PLIN3 expression, its correlation with M2 macrophages, and its functional impact in LUAD cells, aiming to identify PLIN3 as a prognostic biomarker and potential immunotherapeutic target.

title: STsisal: a reference-free deconvolution pipeline for spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Introduces STsisal, a reference-free deconvolution method for spatial transcriptomics data. It integrates marker gene selection, mixing ratio decomposition, and cell type characteristic matrix analysis to identify cell types within complex tissues, adapting the SISAL algorithm. The study demonstrates its superiority through simulations and real data comparisons.

title: Integration of single-nuclei and spatial transcriptomics to decipher tumor phenotype predictive of relapse-free survival in Wilms tumor.
data_modalities_used: ['single-nuclei RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'mutation/copy number data', 'Immunohistochemistry']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrated single-nuclei and spatial transcriptomics to identify a tumor phenotype predictive of relapse-free survival in Wilms tumor. It identified a relapse-associated tumor subtype resembling nephron progenitor cells, residing in immune-desert niches through interactions with CAFs, and proposed a prognostic model. The findings suggest targeting these cells with EGFR inhibitors as a potential therapeutic strategy for high-risk patients.

title: Multi-omics analysis of the dynamic role of STAR+ cells in regulating platinum-based chemotherapy responses and tumor microenvironment in serous ovarian carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study identifies STAR+ cells as a novel cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subtype that enhances chemotherapy sensitivity in serous ovarian carcinoma. STAR+ cells potentially modulate key metabolic pathways and suppress WNT signaling, contributing to improved treatment responses. The findings position STAR+ cells as a potential biomarker for predicting chemotherapy efficacy.

title: A computational pipeline for spatial mechano-transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Develop a computational framework for joint statistical analysis of transcriptional and mechanical signals in spatial transcriptomics. Infer forces on cells, identify mechanical and gene expression signatures predictive of tissue boundaries, and use geoadditive structural equation modeling to find gene modules predicting cell mechanical behavior.

title: An atlas of early human mandibular endochondral and osteogenic paracrine signaling regions of Meckel's cartilage.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo lineage tracing mouse model']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study establishes a spatiotemporal atlas of Meckel's cartilage in human fetuses using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals distinct mechanisms of mandibular ossification mediated by anterior and intermediate Meckel's cartilage populations, highlighting the role of paracrine signaling.

title: AI-Driven Framework for Enhanced and Automated Behavioral Analysis in Morris Water Maze Studies.
biological_context: Neurodegenerative disorders, specifically Alzheimer's disease, and general animal behavior studies.
main_goals: To present a novel AI-based automated framework for processing and evaluating Morris Water Maze (MWM) test videos. The framework aims to enhance behavioral analysis through machine learning by detecting animals, tracking trajectories, and deriving detailed behavioral features from concentric and quadrant-based segmentations. It is validated for classifying younger and older animals based on these extracted features.

title: Deep Learning Based Pile-Up Correction Algorithm for Spectrometric Data Under High-Count-Rate Measurements.
main_goals: Proposes a deep learning framework using a 2D attention U-Net for pile-up correction in gamma-ray spectroscopy under high count rates. The framework embeds count rate information into an Energy-Duration matrix to enhance robustness. The goal is to accurately predict spectra and minimize distortions caused by pile-up effects.

title: Frontiers in Mass Spectrometry-Based Spatial Metabolomics: Current Applications and Challenges in the Context of Biomedical Research.
biological_context: brain and microbiota function, cancer, neurological diseases, infectious diseases
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'DESI mass spectrometry imaging', 'MALDI mass spectrometry imaging', 'secondary ion mass spectrometry']
main_goals: This paper reviews major mass spectrometry-based spatial metabolomics techniques and the biological insights they have enabled, focusing on specific diseases and biological systems. It also discusses translational utility and current challenges in the field.

title: Dynamic responses to rejection in the transplanted human heart revealed through spatial transcriptomics.
