main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to characterize transcriptional heterogeneity in human cardiac biopsies during and after allograft rejection. It identifies differences in cell abundance across rejection classes and uncovers distinct transcriptomic profiles associated with rejection resolution and persistent rejection, highlighting genes involved in inflammation and immune signaling. The findings aim to improve the stratification of immune-cardiac interactions for therapeutic strategies post-transplant.

title: SPP1 + macrophages in colorectal cancer: Markers of malignancy and promising therapeutic targets.
main_goals: This study investigated the roles and mechanisms of SPP1+ macrophages in colorectal cancer (CRC) using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics with bulk sequencing. The findings highlight SPP1+ macrophages as key players in CRC progression, metastasis, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Graph neural networks for single-cell omics data: a review of approaches and applications.
main_goals: This paper provides a systematic review of 107 applications of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) and their variants in single-cell omics data analysis. It outlines GNN principles, reviews models across different omics types, summarizes commonly used datasets, and discusses potential shortcomings and future directions.

title: Genetic insights into idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: a multi-omics approach to identify potential therapeutic targets.
data_modalities_used: ['genomic data', 'transcriptomic data', 'plasma expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) data', 'Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) summary statistics', 'RNA-seq (bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics)', 'UK Biobank data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Genome-Wide Association Study', 'Transcriptome-wide association study', 'Mendelian randomization', 'RNA-seq co-expression analysis', 'Molecular docking', 'Phenome-wide MR']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify potential therapeutic targets and evaluate safety profiles for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) using a multi-omics approach. They integrated genomic and transcriptomic data to identify key genes, explored causal relationships using Mendelian randomization, and assessed druggability and potential side effects through molecular docking and phenome-wide MR. The research identified six key genes as potential drug targets for IPF.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis reveals that Pros1<sup>+</sup> oligodendrocytes are involved in endogenous neuroprotection after brainstem stroke.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of oligodendrocytes in endogenous neuroprotection after brainstem stroke. It identifies a novel subcluster of Pros1+ oligodendrocytes (OLG8 cells) that increase after stroke and protect interneurons, with Myo1e facilitating their differentiation and alleviating ischemic injury.

title: Biology as vulnerability in follicular lymphoma: genetics, epigenetics, and immunogenetics.
main_goals: This review discusses the biology of follicular lymphoma (FL), focusing on genetic, epigenetic, and immunogenetic features. It highlights how recent advances in spatial transcriptomics and imaging technologies offer insights into FL's vulnerabilities and therapeutic targets. The paper also emphasizes the need for early targeted therapies and improved experimental models for eradicating minimal residual disease and preventing relapse.

title: Next-generation sequencing-based population genetics unravels the evolutionary history of Rhodomyrtus tomentosa in China.
biological_context: Evolutionary history and population genetics of Rhodomyrtus tomentosa in China.
main_goals: To investigate the geographic structure and evolutionary history of Rhodomyrtus tomentosa wild populations in China using genomic data. The study aimed to elucidate population differentiation, demographic history, gene flow, and the impact of Pleistocene climate change on the species' genetic distribution.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in chordoma<sup>†</sup>.
main_goals: This paper analyzes the cellular landscape of chordoma using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies an inflammatory CAF subtype (iCAF) associated with poor prognosis and tumor invasion, proposing its role in driving an invasive phenotype. The study highlights the need to integrate findings from different chordoma studies to establish a consensus on cellular heterogeneity and compare CAF populations with other tumor types.

title: A Novel Fusion Framework Combining Graph Embedding Class-Based Convolutional Recurrent Attention Network with Brown Bear Optimization Algorithm for EEG-Based Parkinson's Disease Recognition.
main_goals: The paper introduces a novel fusion framework (GECCR2ANet + BBOA) for EEG-based Parkinson's disease recognition. The framework combines graph embedding class-based convolutional recurrent attention networks with the Brown Bear Optimization Algorithm for enhanced classification accuracy. It aims to address the challenges of noise and variability in EEG signals.

title: A single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomic atlas of the COVID-19 liver reveals topological, functional, and regenerative organ disruption in patients.
main_goals: This study performs single-nucleus RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomic profiling of livers from COVID-19 decedents to understand liver dysfunction. It identifies SARS-CoV-2 RNA positive hepatocytes, a pro-fibrotic signaling network, and changes in cellular composition, revealing insights into hepatocellular injury, ductular reaction, vascular expansion, and fibrogenesis in COVID-19 cholangiopathy.

title: Metabolomics based analysis reveals the therapeutic effects of Incarvillea arguta (Royle) Royle aqueous extract against alcohol-induced liver injury.
main_goals: To investigate the chemical composition of Incarvillea arguta (Liangtoumao) aqueous extract, evaluate its therapeutic intervention effect on alcohol-induced liver injury (ALI) in rat models, and explore its mechanisms using metabolomics. The study aimed to confirm the efficacy and elucidate the mechanisms behind its use in traditional Chinese medicine for ALI.

title: Transcriptional signatures of hippocampal tau pathology in primary age-related tauopathy and Alzheimer's disease.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and primary age-related tauopathy
main_goals: This paper investigates the transcriptional signatures of hippocampal neurons with and without tau pathology in primary age-related tauopathy (PART) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). It aims to identify shared transcriptional changes associated with intraneuronal tau and their functional enrichment, providing insights into common pathogenic pathways.

title: Blocking ITGA5 potentiates the efficacy of anti-PD-1 therapy on glioblastoma by remodeling tumor-associated macrophages.
biological_context: Glioblastoma (GBM) tumor microenvironment and response to anti-PD-1 therapy
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro assays', 'in vivo assays', 'co-immunoprecipitation', 'RNA immunoprecipitation', 'pull-down assays']
main_goals: This study aimed to dissect the molecular mechanisms of specific immunosuppressive subpopulations that drive anti-PD-1 resistance in Glioblastoma. It identified a novel circular RNA (circSDHAF2) that facilitates a tumor microenvironment promoting anti-PD-1 resistance by stabilizing ITGA5, leading to the formation of SPP1+ MDMs. The findings demonstrate that ITGA5 blockade can enhance anti-PD-1 therapy efficacy in GBM.

title: Defining the pyro-thermal niche: do seed traits, ecosystem type and phylogeny influence thermal thresholds in seeds with physical dormancy?
biological_context: Australian species with physical dormancy (PY) seeds in fire-prone environments
main_goals: To assess variation in thermal thresholds between species with physically dormant seeds and whether the pyro-thermal niche is correlated with seed mass, ecosystem type or phylogenetic relatedness. The study aimed to define the pyro-thermal niche for these seeds and provide a framework for comparisons with other species.

title: Graph-Based 3-Dimensional Spatial Gene Neighborhood Networks of Single Cells in Gels and Tissues.
biological_context: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) in hydrogel, MSC-peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) coculture system, astrocyte-neuron CCC in mouse hypothalamus and cortex
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', '3D multiplexed-error-robust fluorescence in situ hybridization (MERFISH)', 'light-sheet microscopy']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Clustering']
main_goals: Develop and apply 3D-spaGNN-E to identify subcellular gene proximity relationships and key subcellular motifs for cell-cell communication. The pipeline combines 3D imaging-based spatial transcriptomics and graph-based deep learning. It was applied to cell cultures and tissue samples to distinguish different cell-cell communication patterns.

title: Arterial spin labelling perfusion MRI analysis for the Human Connectome Project Lifespan Ageing and Development studies.
main_goals: The paper describes the development and application of the HCP-ASL minimal processing pipeline. This pipeline is designed to pre-process and produce perfusion estimates from ASL MRI data for the Human Connectome Project Lifespan studies. The outputs are intended to provide a valuable resource for understanding hemodynamics across the human lifespan.

title: Spatial Metabolomics and Transcriptomics Reveal Metabolic Reprogramming and Cellular Interactions in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma with High PD-1 Expression and Therapeutic Response.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images', 'in vitro functional analyses']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Metabolic Reprogramming Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Prognostic Biomarker Identification', 'Functional Validation']
main_goals: This study utilized spatial metabolomics and transcriptomics to investigate metabolic reprogramming and cellular interactions in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) patients with varying therapeutic responses and PD-1 expression. The research identified key metabolic pathways and gene signatures associated with therapeutic sensitivity and poor prognosis, validating them with public datasets and in vitro experiments.

title: Contact Cooling-Induced ELOVL4 Enhances Skin Wound Healing by Promoting the Inflammation-to-Proliferation Phase Transition.
biological_context: Skin wound healing and the role of temperature regulation
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'skin organoids', 'in vivo functional perturbations']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanism by which adequate temperature enhances skin wound healing, identifying ELOVL4 as a key mediator. It reveals that contact cooling at 20°C upregulates ELOVL4, which promotes the transition from the inflammation to proliferation phase of wound healing by producing DHA and EPA that dampen pro-inflammatory cytokines.

title: Molecular Mechanisms of Ischemia/Reperfusion Injury and Graft Dysfunction in Liver Transplantation: Insights from Multi-Omics Studies in Rodent Animal Models.
main_goals: This review summarizes key molecules and pathways associated with reperfusion injury and prognosis in liver transplantation (LT) models using rodent animal models. It highlights the potential of multi-omics data in understanding and improving transplant outcomes. The paper also discusses current challenges and future approaches for applying omics data in rodent LT models, emphasizing cross-species validation and advanced technologies.

title: MuCST: restoring and integrating heterogeneous morphology images and spatial transcriptomics data with contrastive learning.
main_goals: MuCST is a multi-modal contrastive learning framework designed for the integration of spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) data. It aims to restore and integrate heterogeneous morphology images and spatial transcriptomics data by incorporating denoising, heterogeneity elimination, and compatible feature learning.

title: Optimizing Xenium In Situ data utility by quality assessment and best-practice analysis workflows.
biological_context: Multiple tissues and species (not specified in detail)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To explore Xenium In Situ data utility by performing quality assessment and analyzing best-practice workflows. The study compares Xenium with eight other spatial transcriptomics technologies and benchmarks open-source computational tools for Xenium datasets.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics unravels cell states and ecosystems associated with clinical response to immunotherapy.
biological_context: Vulvar high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (vHSIL) treated with immunotherapeutic peptide vaccine
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'public single-cell transcriptomic data sets']
main_goals: This study leveraged single-cell spatial transcriptomics to analyze the tumor microenvironment in response to immunotherapy in patients with vulvar high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions. It aimed to identify cellular heterogeneity and spatial interactions associated with different clinical responses (complete, partial, and non-responders). The findings highlight the importance of both cellular composition and spatial organization in predicting immunotherapy efficacy.

title: Simultaneous CRISPR screening and spatial transcriptomics reveal intracellular, intercellular, and functional transcriptional circuits.
biological_context: Lipopolysaccharide response in cultured monocytes, three-dimensional xenograft models, autism spectrum disorder risk genes in human-induced pluripotent stem cell (hIPSC) astrocytes
main_goals: This paper introduces Perturb-FISH, a novel method combining imaging spatial transcriptomics with parallel optical detection of in situ amplified guide RNAs. It enables simultaneous CRISPR screening and spatial transcriptomics to study intracellular, intercellular, and functional transcriptional circuits at single-cell resolution. The method has been validated in various biological contexts, including immune response and neurodevelopmental disorders.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies novel Pseudomonas aeruginosa virulence factors.
biological_context: Murine model of ocular infection with Pseudomonas aeruginosa
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Visualization', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study leveraged dual spatial transcriptomics to examine host-pathogen interactions during Pseudomonas aeruginosa ocular infection. It identified differential gene expression patterns, developed a predictive model for bacterial burden, and discovered a novel virulence factor, PA2590.

title: Predictive and personalized approaches for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: a Wnt-related gene set scoring framework integrating single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and machine learning for diagnosis and prognosis.
main_goals: Develop a Wnt-related gene set scoring framework integrating single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and machine learning for predictive and personalized approaches in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, aiming for improved diagnosis and prognosis.

title: Recent Neuropathology Concepts.
biological_context: Toxicologic pathology, neuropathology, preclinical drug screening
main_goals: To discuss recent neuro concepts in toxicologic pathology, including AI applications, new visualization/analysis technologies, and specific case reports. The session highlighted the impact of emerging technologies on drug screening and development.

title: Analysis of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in TNBC cell-cell interactions.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of the technical characteristics of scRNA-seq and ST and highlights their applications in exploring TNBC heterogeneity, cell spatial distribution patterns, and intercellular interactions. The aim is to enhance the comprehension of TNBC at the cellular level for the development of effective therapeutic targets.

title: Single-Cell Sequencing: Genomic and Transcriptomic Approaches in Cancer Cell Biology.
main_goals: This review discusses the impact of single-cell sequencing (SCS) on cancer biology research, highlighting its role in understanding tumor heterogeneity, clonal evolution, and the tumor microenvironment. It covers how SCS provides high-resolution profiling and its integration with multi-omics and computational tools like AI and machine learning. The review also touches upon emerging technologies and the future of SCS in personalized cancer diagnostics and therapy.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Surgical Resection Specimens of Primary Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Treated with Afatinib in a Window-of-Opportunity Study (EORTC90111-24111).
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
main_goals: This study evaluated afatinib-induced tumor and microenvironment modifications in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma using spatial transcriptomics and RNA-sequencing. The research explored tumor evolution and composition under anti-HER therapy, identifying key genes implicated in EMT, MET, and PDGF pathways that may serve as targets to prevent tumor evolution after anti-HER therapy.

title: Force Map-Enhanced Segmentation of a Lightweight Model for the Early Detection of Cervical Cancer.
main_goals: This paper introduces a lightweight and efficient deep learning model for cervical cell segmentation to aid in the early detection of cervical cancer. The model uses MobileNetV2 architecture enhanced with a novel force map approach for improved boundary delineation and extreme point supervision for refined segmentation. It aims to achieve high accuracy with significantly lower inference times, enabling real-time processing on low-power hardware for clinical applications in resource-constrained environments.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Novel Mechanisms Involved in Perineural Invasion in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinomas.
main_goals: This study used Nanostring GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler to analyze the whole transcriptome of cancer and nerve cells in PDAC. It aimed to identify mechanisms involved in perineural invasion (PNI) and its association with cancer pain and prognosis.

title: Integrative whole slide image and spatial transcriptomics analysis with QuST and QuPath.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper introduces QuST, a QuPath extension that integrates whole slide image (WSI) and spatial transcriptomics (ST) analysis at the single-cell level. It aims to bridge the gap between these modalities to enhance disease understanding. The integration highlights the power of this approach in disease biology.

title: Spotiphy enables single-cell spatial whole transcriptomics across an entire section.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and healthy mouse brains, human breast cancer microenvironment
main_goals: Spotiphy is a computational toolkit that transforms sequencing-based spatial transcriptomics data into single-cell-resolved whole-transcriptome images. It enables precise cellular proportions, revealing cellular specifications in disease and identifying spatial domains and interactions in tumor microenvironments. The toolkit bridges the information gap for visualizing cell localization and transcriptomic profiles across entire tissue sections.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of the epipharynx in long COVID identifies SARS-CoV-2 signalling pathways and the therapeutic potential of epipharyngeal abrasive therapy.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of the epipharynx in long COVID by analyzing spatial gene expression. It identifies SARS-CoV-2 signaling pathways and suggests epipharyngeal abrasive therapy (EAT) as a potential treatment by reducing viral RNA, inflammation, and improving epithelial dysfunction.

title: Oxygen-excluded nanoimaging of polymer blend films.
main_goals: This paper introduces oxygen-excluded nanoimaging, a super-resolution fluorescence microscopy-based technique, for nanoscale imaging of polymer blend films. It achieves selectivity by labeling non-oxygen domains and excluding oxygen-containing domains using sulfonate-based dye molecules. The technique provides insights into phase separation behavior and nanoscale structures.

title: High-Throughput Proteoform Imaging for Revealing Spatial-Resolved Changes in Brain Tissues Associated with Alzheimer's Disease.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and mouse brain tissues
main_goals: The paper developed a high-throughput proteoform imaging (HTPi) method by combining MALDI MSI and top-down proteomics. This method enables spatially resolved characterization of proteoforms in tissues at high throughput. HTPi was applied to study spatial proteoform changes associated with Alzheimer's disease in mouse brains.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in glomerular diseases.
biological_context: Glomerular diseases, specifically pauci-immune focal necrotizing (and crescentic) glomerulonephritis (piFNGN) and giant cells arteritis (GCA)
main_goals: This paper reviews spatial transcriptomics techniques, their opportunities, and limitations in the context of glomerular diseases. It discusses results obtained using Digital Spatial Profiling in specific conditions and highlights the power of spatial profiling for investigating disease pathways at a local level.

title: Cellular and molecular determinants mediating the dysregulated germinal center immune dynamics in systemic lupus erythematosus.
main_goals: This paper investigates the follicular immune landscaping and in situ transcriptomic profile in lymph nodes from SLE individuals using spatial transcriptomics and multiplex imaging. The study aims to highlight altered immunological landscapes and identify druggable targets by analyzing spatial molecular and cellular signatures of SLE follicular B and T follicular helper cell dynamics.

title: Improved bounding box segmentation technique for crowd anomaly detection with optimal trained convolutional neural network.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel Crowd Anomaly Detection based on Opposition Behavior Learning updated Chimp Optimization Algorithm (CAD-OBLChoA) to enhance the detection of abnormal crowd behaviors. It uses bilateral filtering for preprocessing, a CNN-LSTM-based bounding box approach for object detection, and extracts Colour, Shape, and Improved Texture features. An optimized CNN is trained using the OBLChoA scheme by tuning optimal weights to detect anomalies.

title: Alterations in PD-L1 succinylation shape anti-tumor immune responses in melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'in vitro assays', 'in vivo models']
main_goals: This study reveals a link between the metabolite succinyl-CoA and anti-tumor immunity in melanoma. It demonstrates that succinylation of PD-L1 at lysine 129 leads to its degradation, enhancing T cell-mediated tumor elimination. The study also identifies CPT1A as a succinyltransferase for PD-L1 and suggests CPT1A and PD-L1 levels as potential biomarkers for anti-PD-1 therapy response.

title: Glycogen drives tumour initiation and progression in lung adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of glycogen in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) progression. It utilizes spatial screens to identify glycogen accumulation as a driver of tumor grade and poor survival. The study also establishes a link between glycogen levels and central carbon metabolites essential for tumor growth, proposing a framework for integrating spatial metabolomics with translational models.

title: Single-cell multi-stage spatial evolutional map of esophageal carcinogenesis.
main_goals: This study presents a spatial transcriptomic map at single-cell resolution to chart the evolutionary trajectories of human esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It reveals that ESCC progression is driven by a proliferative epithelial cell subpopulation and identifies a key interaction involving JAG1-NOTCH1 signaling that leads to the formation of a 'CAF-Epi' niche, shielding the tumor from immune surveillance. This niche formation is a significant indicator of progression and patient outcomes in ESCC.

title: Expression of co-signaling molecules TIM-3/Galectin-9 at the maternal-fetal interface.
main_goals: To examine the expression and localization of Galectin-9 and TIM-3 at the maternal-fetal interface and to investigate their potential roles in maintaining immune tolerance and pregnancy maintenance. The study aimed to provide insights into recurrent pregnancy loss.

title: Spatial and single-cell transcriptomic analysis reveals fibroblasts dependent immune environment in colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Quality control', 'Dimensionality reduction', 'Visualization', 'Differential gene expression analysis', 'Immune infiltration assessment', 'Prognostic gene identification', 'Clustering', 'Survival analysis', 'Metabolic pathway analysis', 'Cell proliferation assay', 'Cell migration assay', 'Invasion assay']
main_goals: This study aimed to dissect fibroblast heterogeneity in colorectal cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified key fibroblast-associated genes with prognostic relevance and characterized distinct molecular subtypes based on these biomarkers. The research also explored the immune microenvironment and identified potential immunotherapeutic targets.

title: Protocol for single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics of bladder Ewing sarcoma.
main_goals: This paper introduces a protocol for isolating single cells and obtaining high-quality spatial transcriptomics data from bladder Ewing sarcoma tissue. It outlines steps for sample collection, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics sequencing. The detailed protocol is available in a referenced work (Mao et al.^{1}).

title: Identification of conserved gene expression changes across common glomerular diseases by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To identify conserved gene expression changes across common glomerular diseases using spatial transcriptomics, providing insights into underlying molecular mechanisms and potential therapeutic strategies.

title: PLOD3 as a novel oncogene in prognostic and immune infiltration risk model based on multi-machine learning in cervical cancer.
main_goals: To improve prognostic accuracy and therapeutic strategies for cervical cancer by developing a multi-machine learning prognostic model based on metabolic-associated genes. The study identifies PLOD3 as a novel oncogene and analyzes immune infiltration patterns related to risk categories.

title: A novel signature predicts prognosis in pancreatic cancer based on tumor membrane-associated genes.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify a novel signature predicting prognosis in pancreatic cancer by analyzing tumor membrane-associated genes. It developed a prognostic model (MaGPS) based on six specific genes and validated its predictive power, also exploring potential therapeutic targets associated with the signature.

title: Extraction of a stromal metastatic gene signature in breast cancer via spatial profiling.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic reference human breast cancer (BC) datasets', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify a stromal metastatic (Met) signature in breast cancer using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to validate this signature and discuss its potential as a prognostic tool for pinpointing metastatic breast cancer and understanding tumor-extrinsic molecular hallmarks.

title: Tumor Prognostic Risk Model Related to Monocytes/Macrophages in Hepatocellular Carcinoma Based on Machine Learning and Multi-Omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify monocyte/macrophage-associated genes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and construct a prognostic model based on these genes. The model was validated and its relationship with drug resistance and immune therapy responses was investigated. The identified single-gene prognostic model, based on UQCRH, can predict HCC patient survival and treatment outcomes.

title: In-depth and high-throughput spatial proteomics for whole-tissue slice profiling by deep learning-facilitated sparse sampling strategy.
main_goals: Developed a sparse sampling strategy for spatial proteomics (S4P) using computationally assisted image reconstruction to achieve high-throughput, in-depth proteome mapping for whole-tissue slices. This method reduces the number of samples required for centimeter-sized samples, enabling the largest spatial proteome to date for the mouse brain.

title: Cell type and region-specific transcriptional changes in the endometrium of women with RIF identify potential treatment targets.
biological_context: Recurrent implantation failure (RIF) in human endometrium
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study employed spatial transcriptomics to identify region- and cell-type-specific transcriptional differences in the endometrium of women with recurrent implantation failure (RIF) compared to fertile controls. The findings pinpoint dysregulated pathways and potential treatment targets, emphasizing the importance of analyzing endometrial regions and cell types as distinct entities.

title: Novel Cell-to-Cell Communications Between Macrophages and Fibroblasts Regulate Obesity-Induced Adipose Tissue Fibrosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates novel cell-to-cell communications between macrophages and fibroblasts in obesity-induced adipose tissue fibrosis using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It elucidates the role of the Mincle-Oncostatin M axis in this process, identifying Mincle-expressing macrophages in crown-like structures and demonstrating Oncostatin M's suppressive effect on fibroblast collagen production.

title: Learning directed acyclic graphs for ligands and receptors based on spatially resolved transcriptomic data of ovarian cancer.
main_goals: To characterize ligand-receptor interaction networks between adjacent tumor and immune/stroma cells based on spatial transcriptomic data. The paper proposes a novel statistical method, LRnetST, utilizing a directed acyclic graph model to handle zero-inflated distributions, incorporate prior knowledge, and achieve robust network estimation.

title: Leveraging a hybrid convolutional gated recursive diabetes prediction and severity grading model through a mobile app.
main_goals: The study introduces a novel deep learning mechanism called Convolutional Gated Recurrent Unit (CGRU) for accurate diabetes prediction and severity grading. It aims to overcome accuracy and data imbalance issues in existing models by extracting temporal and spatial characteristics. The research validates the CGRU model against existing approaches, demonstrating superior performance.

title: Application of Spatial Omics in the Cardiovascular System.
main_goals: This review explores the application of various spatial omics technologies in the cardiovascular system to gain insights into the molecular and cellular foundations of cardiovascular disease. It highlights the contributions of spatial omics to cardiovascular science and discusses future prospects, including technological advancements, multi-omics integration, and clinical applications.

title: Laplacian of Gaussian for Fast Cell Detection and Segmentation in Cervical Cytology to Help in Cancer Diagnosis.
main_goals: This study proposes a methodology for cervical cell segmentation and extraction based on the Laplacian of Gaussian (LoG) algorithm to improve accuracy and efficiency in cervical cytology samples. The method aims to detect and segment cells precisely, enabling real-time analysis for cancer diagnosis. It demonstrates high accuracy, recall, and F-measure, with potential for other cell segmentation applications.

title: Recurrent ERBB2 alterations are associated with esophageal adenocarcinoma brain metastases.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-genome sequencing', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell whole-genome sequencing', 'multi-region sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper investigates the molecular mechanisms underlying brain metastases in esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC) by performing multi-omics analysis. It identifies recurrent ERBB2 alterations as a key driver in EAC brain metastases and explores their association with disease progression and treatment response.

title: Geodesign in the era of artificial intelligence.
main_goals: This paper explores the evolution of Geodesign with a focus on the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI). It highlights how AI enhances Geodesign methods through automation of spatial data analysis, improved land use classification, and optimized planning for urban and environmental challenges. The paper also addresses challenges and ethical concerns related to AI in Geodesign and advocates for responsible integration.

title: LivecellX: A Scalable Deep Learning Framework for Single-Cell Object-Oriented Analysis in Live-Cell Imaging.
main_goals: This paper introduces LivecellX, a deep-learning-based, object-oriented framework for scalable analysis of live-cell dynamics. It defines a new task of segmentation correction for over- and under-segmentation errors, proposing novel metrics and machine learning techniques like the Corrective Segmentation Network (CS-Net). The framework also includes trajectory-level correction algorithms and facilitates downstream analyses like biological process detection and lineage reconstruction.

title: PLXNB1 and other signaling drives a pathologic astrocyte state contributing to cognitive decline in Alzheimer's Disease.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and aging-related cognitive decline
main_goals: This study identifies a specific astrocyte subset (Ast10) associated with Alzheimer's disease and cognitive decline. It investigates the signaling pathways driving its emergence and confirms the regulatory role of PLXNB1. The findings suggest Ast10 as a potential therapeutic target for preserving cognitive function.

title: Smoothie: Efficient Inference of Spatial Co-expression Networks from Denoised Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
main_goals: The paper introduces Smoothie, a method for efficient inference of spatial co-expression networks from denoised spatial transcriptomics data. Smoothie denoises data using Gaussian smoothing and constructs genome-wide co-expression networks. It aims to enable precise gene module detection, functional annotation, and comparisons across samples.

title: 3D spatial transcriptomics reveals the molecular structure of input and output pathways in the mouse olfactory bulb.
biological_context: Mouse olfactory bulb organization and gene expression
main_goals: This study reconstructs the anatomical and molecular organization of the mouse olfactory bulb using 3D spatial transcriptomics. It reveals symmetric organization of glomeruli and the relationship between olfactory epithelium gene expression and glomerular position. The findings suggest a reorganization from sensory input to cortical output pathways.

title: Geospatially informed representation of spatial genomics data with SpatialFeatureExperiment.
main_goals: This paper introduces SpatialFeatureExperiment, a Bioconductor package designed for analyzing spatial omics data. It leverages Simple Features and SpatialExperiment to create a versatile S4 class for various spatial omics data types and platforms. The package aims to integrate spatial operations into the SingleCellExperiment ecosystem.

title: Literature-scaled immunological gene set annotation using AI-powered immune cell knowledge graph (ICKG).
biological_context: Immunological context, general immune cell analysis
data_modalities_used: ['cytokine stimulation data', 'CRISPR gene knock-out data', 'protein-protein interaction experiments', 'single-cell omics', 'spatial omics']
main_goals: To overcome limitations in gene set annotation for immunotherapeutic contexts by constructing immune cell knowledge graphs (ICKGs) using LLMs. ICKGs enable accurate, verifiable graph-based reasoning for rich, holistic, and accurate annotation of immunological gene sets. An interactive website is provided for performing ICKG-based gene set annotations.

title: Scaling up spatial transcriptomics for large-sized tissues: uncovering cellular-level tissue architecture beyond conventional platforms with iSCALE.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper introduces iSCALE, a method designed to scale spatial transcriptomics for large-sized tissues. It enables the prediction of super-resolution gene expression and automated annotation of cellular-level tissue architecture for tissues exceeding standard capture areas. The method aims to uncover cellular characteristics not discernible by conventional platforms.

title: Altered inflammatory mucosal signatures within their spatial and cellular context during active ileal Crohn's disease.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'frozen CD surgical tissue sections', 'ileal CD mucosa']
main_goals: This study aims to deepen the understanding of distinct inflammatory signatures in Crohn's disease by combining spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It investigates overlapping pathways, identifies changes in early epithelial cells, and maps their spatial location, particularly antigen presentation in crypt bases. The research also proposes early epithelial cells as mediators of the MHC class II pathway during inflammation, potentially promoting macrophage infiltration.

title: NAD+ prevents chronic kidney disease by activating renal tubular metabolism.
biological_context: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) associated with impaired renal tubular metabolism and fatty acid oxidation (FAO).
main_goals: This paper investigates the mechanism by which NAD+ supplementation protects against chronic kidney disease (CKD) by activating renal tubular metabolism. It demonstrates that NAD+ precursor nicotinamide riboside (NR) restores fatty acid oxidation (FAO) in proximal tubule cells in a mouse model of Alport syndrome, thereby preventing CKD. The study also identifies sex differences at the transcriptional level in this model.

title: Robust Spatial Cell-Type Deconvolution with Qualitative Reference for Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: QR-SIDE is a novel method for robust spatial cell-type deconvolution using qualitative references. It provides detailed maps of spatial heterogeneity, adaptively adjusts marker gene contributions, unifies deconvolution with spatial clustering, and incorporates spatial information via a Potts model to promote spatial continuity.

title: Lactylation modification in cancer: mechanisms, functions, and therapeutic strategies.
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive summary of the mechanisms and applications of lactylation modification in cancer. It discusses its role in gene expression regulation, signal transduction, and protein synthesis. The paper also identifies key challenges, limitations, and promising research directions for future studies.

title: Bridging epigenomics and tumor immunometabolism: molecular mechanisms and therapeutic implications.
biological_context: Tumorigenesis, tumor progression, and cancer treatment
main_goals: This review systematically summarizes the characteristics of epigenomic modifications associated with tumors and their regulatory roles in tumor metabolic reprogramming and immunometabolism. It delineates classical and emerging approaches to study the crosstalk between tumor immunometabolism and epigenomics. The paper also discusses potential therapeutic strategies targeting tumor immunometabolism to modulate epigenomic modifications, highlighting the synergy between metabolic therapies and immunotherapy.

title: stAI: a deep learning-based model for missing gene imputation and cell-type annotation of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Introduce stAI, a deep learning-based model for missing gene imputation and cell-type annotation of spatial transcriptomics data. It leverages a joint embedding with reference scRNA-seq data and performs tasks in the latent space. The model shows high accuracy in predicting unmeasured genes and annotating cell types.

title: OmniClust: A versatile clustering toolkit for single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: OmniClust is a versatile clustering toolkit designed for both single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and spatial transcriptomics data. It employs deep learning for spatial transcriptomics and machine learning for scRNA-seq, demonstrating high clustering accuracy across multiple benchmark datasets. The tool is also shown to be effective in downstream analyses of breast cancer data.

title: Alzheimer's disease prediction using 3D-CNNs: Intelligent processing of neuroimaging data.
main_goals: This study proposes a novel 3D-Convolutional Neural Network (3D-CNN) and an intelligent preprocessing pipeline for Alzheimer's disease (AD) prediction using neuroimaging data. The method utilizes frame selection and 3D dilated convolutions to capture subtle brain changes visible in MRI scans. The goal is to achieve early and accurate prediction of AD.

title: Multimodal mass spectrometry imaging reveals spatial metabolic reprogramming in diabetic liver disease.
biological_context: Diabetic liver injury (DLI) in a rat model, with investigation into the therapeutic effects of ferulic acid.
data_modalities_used: ['air-flow-assisted desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging (AFADESI-MSI)', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI)', 'metabolomics']
main_goals: To comprehensively analyze spatial metabolic changes in diabetic liver injury (DLI) using multimodal mass spectrometry imaging and to evaluate the therapeutic potential of ferulic acid. The study aimed to identify metabolic reprogramming in DLI and assess ferulic acid's ability to restore metabolic homeostasis.

title: Deep Learning-Based Electrocardiogram Model (EIANet) to Predict Emergency Department Cardiac Arrest: Development and External Validation Study.
biological_context: In-hospital cardiac arrest (IHCA) in emergency departments (ED)
main_goals: To develop and validate a deep learning model (EIANet) using 12-lead ECG images from ED triage for the early prediction of ED-based cardiac arrest (EDCA). The model aims to leverage visual ECG patterns for improved prediction and seamless integration into clinical workflows.

title: ENACT: End-to-End Analysis of Visium High Definition (HD) Data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'bin-to-cell assignment', 'single-cell transcript estimates', 'infer cell types']
main_goals: ENACT is a pipeline for end-to-end analysis of Visium High Definition (HD) data. It integrates advanced cell segmentation with Visium HD transcriptomics to infer cell types across tissue sections. The pipeline enhances the accuracy of single-cell transcript estimates through novel bin-to-cell assignment methods.

title: MAEST: accurately spatial domain detection in spatial transcriptomics with graph masked autoencoder.
biological_context: Spatial domain identification in various tissues including human brain, mouse hippocampus, olfactory bulb, brain, and embryo
main_goals: Introduces MAEST, a graph neural network model leveraging graph masked autoencoders and graph contrastive learning for accurate spatial domain detection in spatial transcriptomics data. MAEST effectively captures local and global spatial relationships to improve clustering precision and can integrate multi-slice data for joint domain detection.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics and Proteomics Profiling After Ischemic Stroke Reperfusion: Insights Into Vascular Alterations.
biological_context: Ischemic stroke reperfusion in mouse brain
main_goals: To investigate cerebrovascular changes following ischemic stroke reperfusion using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The study aims to understand the molecular basis of futile reperfusion by analyzing early changes in the peri-infarct cortex.

title: Benchmarking Spatial Co-Localization Methods for Single-Cell Multiplex Imaging Data with Applications to High-Grade Serous Ovarian and Triple Negative Breast Cancer.
biological_context: High-grade serous ovarian cancer and triple negative breast cancer
main_goals: This study evaluates the performance of six frequentist metrics for spatial co-localization in single-cell multiplex imaging data. The evaluation uses simulated data to assess power and type I error, and applies these metrics to cancer studies to detect within-sample co-localization and its association with survival. The findings consistently highlight Ripley's K and pair correlation g as the most powerful indices for detecting co-localization and estimating associations with survival.

title: Development of a prognostic model for hepatocellular carcinoma based on microvascular invasion characteristic genes by spatial transcriptomics sequencing.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics sequencing', 'single nucleus RNA sequencing', 'multiple immunofluorescence images']
main_goals: The study aims to develop a new prognostic model for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) based on microvascular invasion (MVI) characteristic genes identified through spatial transcriptomics sequencing. The model aims to distinguish high-risk from low-risk patients and predict prognosis, showing superior performance compared to existing models. It also explores potential biological mechanisms involving macrophages and MIF-CD74 interactions.

title: Single-cell genomics and spatial transcriptomics in islet transplantation for diabetes treatment: advancing towards personalized therapies.
main_goals: This review synthesizes research on single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in islet transplantation for diabetes treatment. It highlights how these technologies can improve understanding of islet graft function, survival, and rejection, leading to personalized therapies. The review also discusses future directions and challenges in implementing these approaches.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome profiling reveal CTHRC1+ fibroblasts promote EMT through WNT5A signaling in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This study identifies CTHRC1+ fibroblasts and their role in promoting EMT via WNT5A signaling in colorectal cancer. It demonstrates how CTHRC1+ CAFs upregulate MSLN in malignant epithelial cells, contributing to tumor invasion and metastasis.

title: Microglial mechanisms drive amyloid-β clearance in immunized patients with Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to explore the mechanisms of amyloid-beta clearance in Alzheimer's disease patients after immunization. It identifies distinct microglial states and transcriptional pathways involved in Aβ removal, highlighting the roles of TREM2, APOE, and complement signaling. The findings aim to provide molecular targets for enhancing AD immunotherapies.

title: Author Correction: Resolving tissue complexity by multimodal spatial omics modeling with MISO.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data integration', 'Spatial domain identification', 'Spatial gene expression analysis']
main_goals: This paper describes an author correction to a previously published work. The corrected work focuses on a multimodal spatial omics modeling approach called MISO, designed to resolve tissue complexity. The MISO framework aims to integrate diverse spatial omics datasets for comprehensive tissue analysis.

title: How do the resting EEG preprocessing states affect the outcomes of postprocessing?
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of resting EEG preprocessing states (insufficiently preprocessed EEG or excessively preprocessed EEG) on postprocessing outcomes in temporal, frequency, and spatial domains. It introduces a metric, PaLOSi, to quantify spectral homogeneities and demonstrates its correlation with postprocessing deviations, aiming to improve EEG data quality control.

title: Erratum for the Research Article "Highly multiplexed spatial transcriptomics in bacteria" by A. Sarfatis et al.
main_goals: This paper is an erratum for a research article titled "Highly multiplexed spatial transcriptomics in bacteria". It corrects errors in the original publication but does not introduce new methodologies or biological findings.

title: The role of tenascin-C in tumor microenvironments and its potential as a therapeutic target.
main_goals: This review examines the multifaceted roles of tenascin-C (TNC) in different tumor microenvironments, including mechanical, immune, and metabolic aspects, as well as the radiation microenvironment. It explores TNC's potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target, proposing strategies leveraging TNC in personalized cancer therapy by integrating recent advances in single-cell sequencing and spatial omics. Future research directions focusing on TNC isoforms and their roles in radiotherapy efficacy are discussed.

title: STExplore: An Integrated Online Platform for Comprehensive Analysis and Visualization of Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
biological_context: Neurogenesis in embryonic brain development, Alzheimer's disease, and brain tissue architecture
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Integration with single-cell RNA sequencing', 'Cluster-level analyses', 'Gene-level analyses', 'Cell-cell communication studies', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Cellular spatial organizations', 'Intercellular communication patterns', 'Visualization']
main_goals: STExplore is an integrated online platform designed to address limitations in existing spatial transcriptomics analysis platforms. It supports diverse technologies and offers a complete analysis workflow from preprocessing to cell-cell communication studies with dynamic parameter adjustments and interactive visualizations. The platform aims to provide a comprehensive and user-friendly solution for spatial transcriptomics research.

title: Bystander neuronal progenitors in forebrain organoids promote protective antiviral responses.
biological_context: Forebrain organoids and neuronal antiviral responses
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of intercellular crosstalk in mediating intrinsic neuronal immunity and its contribution to limiting viral infection. The study utilizes forebrain organoids to demonstrate that bystander neural progenitors, via type I interferon signaling, promote protective antiviral responses. Spatial transcriptomics reveals distinct antiviral gene expression patterns among neuronal subtypes, highlighting the importance of interneuronal communication in brain antiviral immunity.

title: Spatial top-down proteomics for the functional characterization of human kidney.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'mass spectrometry imaging', 'laser capture microdissection', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial proteomics']
main_goals: Develop an integrated workflow for characterizing proteoforms from human tissue in a spatially resolved manner by coupling laser capture microdissection, nanoliter-scale sample preparation, and mass spectrometry imaging. Characterize proteoforms from major functional tissue units of healthy human kidney (glomeruli, tubules, medullary rays) and reveal their spatial distributions. Identify differentially abundant proteoforms between tissue compartments.

title: Identifying perturbations that boost T-cell infiltration into tumours via counterfactual learning of their spatial proteomic profiles.
main_goals: This paper describes a deep-learning model that uses spatial proteomic profiles of tumors to generate minimal tumor perturbations that boost T-cell infiltration. It integrates a counterfactual optimization strategy with a self-supervised machine learning prediction of T-cell infiltration. The model was applied to melanoma and colorectal cancer samples to discover cohort-dependent combinatorial perturbations that support T-cell infiltration.

title: Projection Image Synthesis Using Adversarial Learning Based Spatial Transformer Network For Sparse Angle Sampling CT.
main_goals: The paper proposes an adversarial learning-based spatial transformer network for projection image synthesis in sparse-angle X-ray tomography. The aim is to improve the quality of reconstructed CT images by increasing the number of projection images using existing data, thereby reducing noise and artifacts.

title: Evaluation of the coordinated development of health resources, health service utilization, and the regional economy in China and analysis of influencing factors.
main_goals: This study investigates the coupling coordination relationships and influencing factors of health resources, health service utilization, and the regional economy in China using panel data from 2016-2021. It employs methods like the entropy weight method, coupled coordinated development model, and geographic detector to analyze spatial and temporal variances and identify driving factors.

title: 30-years (1991-2021) Snow Water Equivalent Dataset in the Po River District, Italy.
data_modalities_used: ['snow water equivalent dataset', 'in-situ snow measurements', 'Earth Observation snow products', 'satellite snow cover maps']
main_goals: This paper presents a long-term snow water equivalent dataset for the Po River District, Italy, from 1991 to 2021. The dataset was generated using a hybrid modeling approach integrating the GEOtop model, meteorological data preprocessing, and assimilation of in-situ snow measurements and Earth Observation products. The dataset's quality was assessed through point and 2D validation with observed data and satellite snow cover maps.

title: Single-cell technology grows up: Leveraging high-resolution omics approaches to understand neurodevelopmental disorders.
main_goals: This paper discusses the opportunities to leverage mutant models and genomics approaches to understand neurodevelopmental disorders (NDDs) at cellular resolution. It reviews progress in applying single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to interrogate NDDs and highlights the promise of standardized application of these technologies to define etiologies and identify convergence across NDDs.

title: PERK+ Macrophages Drive Immunotherapy Resistance in Lymph Node Metastases of Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) lymph node metastases
main_goals: This study evaluates the pathologic response of lymph node metastases in OSCC patients treated with neoadjuvant anti-PD-1 immunotherapy. It identifies PERK+ macrophages in LN metastases as a key driver of immunotherapy resistance by promoting an ECM-enriched microenvironment that hinders T cell cytotoxicity. Pharmacologic inhibition of the PERK pathway showed potential to improve therapeutic outcomes.

title: Study on the Material Basis and Mechanisms of Achyrocline satureioides in the Treatment of Nonsmall Cell Lung Cancer Based on Network Pharmacology and Spatial Metabolomics.
data_modalities_used: ['high-resolution ultrahigh-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry (HR-UHPLC-MS/MS)', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI)']
main_goals: To comprehensively investigate the active components and action mechanism of Achyrocline satureioides in the treatment of nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) by combining network pharmacology and spatial metabolomics. The study aimed to identify active compounds, their targets, and elucidate metabolic mechanisms.

title: Deciphering ovarian cancer heterogeneity through spatial transcriptomics, single-cell profiling, and copy number variations.
covered_analysis_steps: ['copy number variation analysis', 'single-cell profiling', 'gene expression analysis', 'cell-cell communication analysis', 'tumor clone identification', 'evolutionary trajectories']
main_goals: To elucidate the intricate mechanisms underlying HGSOC heterogeneity by conducting a comprehensive analysis of single-cell transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomes, and copy number variations. The study aims to identify distinct tumor clones, their evolutionary trajectories, and spatial relationships, as well as uncover functional profiles of tumor cells and key communication networks.

title: EPAS1 induction drives myocardial degeneration in desmoplakin-cardiomyopathy.
main_goals: This study investigated the molecular mechanisms driving myocardial degeneration in desmoplakin-cardiomyopathy (DSP-cardiomyopathy). Using spatial transcriptomics on patient explanted hearts, they identified EPAS1 as a key regulator associated with mitochondrial dysfunction and apoptosis in stressed cardiomyocytes, suggesting EPAS1 as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Single Cell Spatial Transcriptomics of the Murine Embryonic Palate Links Pax9 to Patterning and Organization of Extracellular Matrix Components.
biological_context: Murine embryonic palate development and cleft palate formation
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'Visium HD', 'Xenium In Situ mRNA spatial profiling', 'RNAscope Multiplex assays', 'sequencing']
main_goals: To explore the genomic basis of palatal clefts using single-cell spatial RNA-sequencing in a Pax9-/- murine model. The study aims to identify perturbations in the signaling microenvironment and extracellular matrix components contributing to cleft palate defects, providing a framework for identifying therapeutic targets.

title: Randomized Spatial PCA (RASP): a computationally efficient method for dimensionality reduction of high-resolution spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: RASP is a computationally efficient, spatially-aware dimensionality reduction method for spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to be faster than existing techniques, scale to large datasets, integrate non-transcriptomic covariates, and reconstruct de-noised, spatially-smoothed gene expression values. The paper compares RASP to other methods on diverse datasets.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptome analysis in bladder cancer: Current status and future perspectives.
main_goals: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of recent advancements in using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and spatial transcriptomics (ST) for bladder cancer research. It highlights how these technologies have led to significant discoveries regarding cellular heterogeneity, treatment resistance, and gender-based molecular differences. The authors discuss the transformative potential of these methods for identifying biomarkers and therapeutic targets, while also acknowledging current challenges for clinical application.

title: From morphology to single-cell molecules: high-resolution 3D histology in biomedicine.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'microscopy imaging', 'tomographic approaches', 'single-cell omics', 'spatial omics', '3D cultures', 'spheroids']
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of high-resolution 3D histology techniques in biomedicine. It traces historical milestones, categorizes current techniques, and explores their applications in various biological fields. The review also identifies challenges and offers recommendations for future advancements.

title: Complement activation in tumor microenvironment after neoadjuvant therapy and its impact on pancreatic cancer outcomes.
biological_context: Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) after neoadjuvant therapy (NAT)
main_goals: This study investigates how neoadjuvant therapy differentially impacts pancreatic cancer cells and the tumor microenvironment. It identifies that higher complement expression in the tumor microenvironment following NAT is associated with improved patient outcomes, suggesting complement dynamics as a potential biomarker.

title: Smartphone-Based Oral Lesion Image Segmentation Using Deep Learning.
data_modalities_used: ['smartphone-captured images', 'oral lesion images', 'annotated images of oral lesions']
main_goals: To develop a deep learning-based solution for segmenting oral lesions using smartphone-captured images. The study introduces OralSegNet, a novel UNet-based model with EfficientNetV2L encoder, ASPP, and residual blocks. The model aims to provide a cost-effective and non-invasive method for early diagnosis of oral diseases.

title: Blood TCTP as a potential biomarker associated with immunosuppressive features and poor clinical outcomes in metastatic gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the prognostic and immunological relevance of plasma translationally controlled tumor protein (TCTP) in patients with advanced gastric cancer. It investigates TCTP as a potential biomarker associated with immunosuppressive features and poor clinical outcomes. The findings suggest plasma TCTP reflects clinically relevant immunosuppressive myeloid signals.

title: STFormer: Learning to Explore Spot Relationships for Spatial Transcriptomics Prediction from Histology of Colorectal Cancer.
main_goals: This paper introduces STFormer, a deep learning approach to predict spatial transcriptomics (ST) from histology images. It addresses limitations of existing methods by incorporating style transfer augmentation and a cross-WSI transformer to capture inter-spot correlations, demonstrating superior performance on internal and external datasets.

title: Motion-Compensated Interpolation in Echocardiography: A Lie Advection-Based Approach.
biological_context: Cardiac structures and dynamics via echocardiography
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel motion-compensated interpolation algorithm based on the advection equation in fluid mechanics to enhance temporal resolution in echocardiography. The algorithm uses Lie series for the advection problem and a bidirectional advection energy model to estimate optimal velocity fields. It aims to preserve cardiac topology and reduce interpolation artifacts, outperforming existing methods and achieving faster computation through neural network training.

title: Effects of Different Preprocessing Pipelines on Motor Imagery-Based Brain-Computer Interfaces.
main_goals: This study compares different preprocessing pipelines for motor imagery-based brain-computer interfaces using EEG signals. It evaluates the impact of various techniques like ICA, surface Laplacian, bandpass filtering, and baseline correction in conjunction with machine learning models. The goal is to identify optimal preprocessing strategies for both offline analysis and online BCI deployment.

title: FlexibleSleepNet:A Model for Automatic Sleep Stage Classification Based on Multi-Channel Polysomnography.
main_goals: Introduces FlexibleSleepNet, a lightweight convolutional neural network for automatic sleep stage classification using multi-channel polysomnography. It utilizes Adaptive Feature Extraction (AFE) and Scale-Varying Compression (SVC) modules for temporal-spatial feature extraction with improved computational efficiency.

title: MambaVesselNet: A Novel Approach to Blood Vessel Segmentation Based on State-Space Models.
main_goals: This paper proposes MambaVesselNet, a novel approach for 3D blood vessel segmentation based on state-space models. It aims to address challenges in capturing fine structures and accurate edge segmentation by introducing edge enhancement and feature selection modules, and utilizes nnUNet's preprocessing for spatial consistency. The method achieves state-of-the-art performance on standard benchmarks.

title: Imaging the Intestinal Transcriptome With Multiplexed Error-Robust Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (MERFISH).
main_goals: This paper outlines protocols for applying MERFISH to challenging tissue types, specifically the mammalian gastrointestinal tract. It details methods for sample preparation (fresh frozen and fixed frozen) and combining RNA imaging with immunofluorescence. The goal is to provide a resource for MERFISH application in tissues where rapid RNA degradation is a challenge.

title: Single-cell eQTL mapping reveals cell subtype-specific genetic control and mechanism in malignant transformation of colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['sc-eQTL mapping', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to understand the mechanisms underlying colorectal cancer (CRC) development at single-cell resolution by profiling transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomics, and snMultiomes. It presents a CRC sc-eQTL map, identifies cell subtype-specific genetic control, and reveals how specific genetic variants and gene expression changes (e.g., LGALS9) contribute to CRC progression and immune evasion. The study also demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting the LGALS9-TIM3 axis.

title: Toward spatial glycomics and glycoproteomics: Innovations and applications.
main_goals: This mini-review provides an overview of the challenging field of spatial glycomics/glycoproteomics. It discusses the need for sophisticated analytical methods and innovative technologies to advance the field. The review highlights glycopathology, tissue glycomic profiling using lectin-based analyses, deep visual proteomics, laser microdissection, and AI-driven visual software for cell-type assignment and automation.

title: Uncovering the Signatures of Cellular Senescence in the Human Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex.
biological_context: Human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex aging and senescence
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to build a transcriptomic atlas of aging and senescence in the human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex using Visium spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing. The researchers identified markers of aging in cortical layers and cell types, observed changes in astrocyte and inhibitory neuron populations, and characterized the heterogeneous senescence profile influenced by cell type and cortical layer. The findings highlight gene expression modules enriched with age and senescence-related genes, particularly in microglia, endothelial cells, and regional astrocytes.

title: CITEgeist: Cellular Indexing of Transcriptomes and Epitopes for Guided Exploration of Intrinsic Spatial Trends.
main_goals: The paper introduces CITEgeist, a novel tool for deconvoluting spatial transcriptomics data. It leverages antibody capture from the same slide as the reference, bypassing the need for costly scRNA-seq references. This method uses mathematical optimization with sparsity constraints to estimate cell type proportions and gene expression, offering a cost-effective and accurate alternative, especially in dense tumor microenvironments.

title: Joint imputation and deconvolution of gene expression across spatial transcriptomics platforms.
biological_context: Human breast and colon cancer tissues
main_goals: The paper introduces SIID, an algorithm for joint imputation and deconvolution of gene expression across different spatial transcriptomics platforms. It leverages spatial alignment and a joint non-negative factorization model to reconstruct latent spatial gene expression matrices, enabling the imputation of missing data and inference of cell-type-specific gene expression signatures from mixed data. SIID demonstrates superior performance compared to contemporary tools in simulations and real-world applications.

title: SpaFun: Discovering Domain-specific Spatial Expression Patterns and New Disease-Relevant Genes using Functional Principal Component Analysis.
main_goals: SpaFun is a novel method based on functional principal component analysis (fPCA) to discover domain-specific spatial expression patterns and new disease-relevant genes from spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) datasets. It aims to improve computational efficiency and statistical power compared to existing methods for identifying spatially variable genes (SVGs). The method also accounts for spatial heterogeneity and co-expression patterns among genes.

title: A comparative study of statistical methods for identifying differentially expressed genes in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper proposes a Generalized Score Test (GST) within the Generalized Estimating Equations (GEEs) framework as a robust solution for differential gene expression analysis in spatial transcriptomics. It compares the GST with existing methods like the Wilcoxon rank-sum test and GEEs with the robust Wald test. The GST demonstrates superior Type I error control and comparable power by accounting for spatial correlations.

title: Single-cell multiome and spatial profiling reveals pancreas cell type-specific gene regulatory programs driving type 1 diabetes progression.
biological_context: Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) progression in the pancreas
main_goals: This study aims to understand cell type-specific regulatory programs driving Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) in the pancreas. It reveals alterations in pancreatic cell types and niches during T1D progression, identifies epigenomic drivers and causal pathways of T1D risk, and highlights changes in cell-cell signaling affecting beta cell regulation. The findings provide a basis for therapeutic targets for disease prevention.

title: STEAM: Spatial Transcriptomics Evaluation Algorithm and Metric for clustering performance.
main_goals: Propose STEAM, a computational pipeline to evaluate clustering consistency and reliability for spatial omics data. It leverages machine learning to maintain spatial proximity and gene expression patterns within clusters, providing robust evaluation metrics and supporting multi-sample training for cross-replicate assessment.

title: Cross-tissue multi-omics analyses reveal the gut microbiota's absence impacts organ morphology, immune homeostasis, bile acid and lipid metabolism.
biological_context: Gut microbiota's absence in mice and its impact on organ morphology, immune homeostasis, and metabolism
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'targeted bile acid metabolomics', 'sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: To systematically assess how the absence of the gut microbiota affects organ morphology, immune homeostasis, bile acid, and lipid metabolism in mice using integrated multi-omics analyses. The study investigates aberrations in immune cells, altered mucosal zonation, and shifts in bile acid and lipid metabolism, highlighting key host pathways involved in lipid homeostasis in germ-free mice.

title: Multiomic spatial atlas shows deleted in malignant brain tumors 1 (DMBT1) glycoprotein is lost in colonic dysplasia.
biological_context: Colonic dysplasia and colorectal cancer development in mice and humans
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence', 'scRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'mouse organoids', 'human organoids']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential gene expression analysis', 'Ligand-receptor mapping', 'Gene expression regulation']
main_goals: This study aimed to define the molecular spatial organization of colonic dysplasia in a mouse model, investigate host-microbe interactions during colonic tumorigenesis, and identify molecular changes, specifically focusing on the DMBT1 glycoprotein. It utilized multiomic spatial approaches to show DMBT1 is lost in colonic dysplasia and implicated WNT signaling in its downregulation.

title: Explainable handcrafted features for mitotic event detection and classification.
biological_context: Cell proliferation and mitotic event detection
main_goals: This paper develops a fully automated method for mitotic event detection and classification using handcrafted features and machine learning. The goal is to reduce processing time, improve accuracy, and provide explainable features for mitotic event detection, particularly in challenging conditions like high cell densities.

title: Multilayered visual metabolomics analysis framework for enhanced exploration of functional components in wolfberry.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Metabolite identification', 'Molecular network analysis', 'Metabolic pathway mapping', 'Machine learning-based imaging', 'Spatial distribution analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study developed a novel spatial metabolomics framework for enhanced exploration of functional components in wolfberry. The framework incorporates instrumental optimization, metabolite identification, molecular network analysis, metabolic pathway mapping, and machine learning-based imaging using DESI-MSI. It enables rapid, non-destructive, in situ analysis of metabolites with enhanced sensitivity and spatial resolution, providing insights into chemical and spatial changes during ripening.

title: LETSmix: a spatially informed and learning-based domain adaptation method for cell-type deconvolution in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: LETSmix is presented as a spatially informed and learning-based domain adaptation method for cell-type deconvolution in spatial transcriptomics. It integrates spatial correlations, layer annotations, expression similarities, image texture features, and spatial coordinates to refine data, and uses mixup-augmented domain adaptation to address discrepancies between spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing data.

title: A progranulin variant causing childhood interstitial lung disease responsive to anti-TNF-α biologic therapy.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-exome sequencing', 'digital spatial mRNA profiling', 'lung biopsies', 'ELISA', 'alveolar macrophage transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper describes the identification of a pathogenic progranulin (GRN) variant causing childhood interstitial lung disease. It demonstrates the utility of convergent multiomics in evaluating aberrant TNF-α pathway activation and guiding precision therapeutics with anti-TNF-α biologic therapy, leading to dramatic patient improvement.

title: Use of metabolic imaging to monitor heterogeneity of tumour response following therapeutic mTORC1/2 pathway inhibition.
biological_context: PTEN-null renal cancer model treated with mTORC1/2 inhibitor AZD2014
main_goals: The paper developed an integrated multi-modal imaging workflow to assess the heterogeneity of AZD2014 (mTORC1/2 inhibitor) response in a PTEN-null renal cancer model. It used mass spectrometry imaging and imaging mass cytometry to analyze spatial responses of metabolite and protein biomarkers, demonstrating that MSI-based workflows provide novel insights into pharmacodynamic effects of mTORC1/2 inhibition that classical biomarkers do not resolve. The study also showed PI3K-dependent resistance mechanisms.

title: Advancing antibiotic discovery with bacterial cytological profiling: a high-throughput solution to antimicrobial resistance.
main_goals: This review presents bacterial cytological profiling (BCP) as a rapid, scalable, and cost-effective method for identifying antibiotic mechanisms of action. It discusses BCP's application across different bacteria and antibiotic classes, its advantages, limitations, and potential improvements. The review also highlights BCP's use in investigating pathogens from the Bacterial Priority Pathogens List and explores AI/deep learning techniques to enhance BCP data analysis.

title: Analysing space-time patterns of maternal mortality attributed to anaemia in Karnataka, India: a spatial epidemiological study.
biological_context: Maternal mortality attributed to anaemia in Karnataka, India
main_goals: To analyze space-time patterns of maternal mortality attributed to anaemia in Karnataka, India. The study aims to identify geographical areas at high risk and provide insights for targeted interventions. It demonstrates the utility of geospatial mapping in understanding and addressing maternal health challenges.

title: Single-cell and spatial analysis reveals the interaction between ITLN1<sup>+</sup> foam cells and SPP1<sup>+</sup> macrophages in atherosclerosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This study investigates the interaction between ITLN1+ foam cells and SPP1+ macrophages in atherosclerosis using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to elucidate their regulatory functions and intercellular communication networks, identifying the MIF-(CD74 + CD44) and SPP1-CD44 ligand-receptor axes as key mediators.

title: A novel telomere-associated genes signature for the prediction of prognosis and treatment responsiveness of hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: The study developed a prognostic risk model for HCC using 18 telomere-associated genes (TRGs). It also established a causal relationship between ASF1A and alcoholic HCC.

title: Single-cell and spatial genomic landscape of non-small cell lung cancer brain metastases.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) brain metastases
data_modalities_used: ['single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'T cell receptor sequencing', 'single-cell spatial sequencing', 'whole-genome sequencing', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence']
main_goals: This study investigates the genomic and microenvironmental landscape of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) brain metastases. It characterizes chromosomal instability and identifies neural-like transcriptional programs in cancer cells from brain metastases, which pre-exist in primary tumors but are enriched in metastases. The findings provide insights into NSCLC brain metastasis biology.

title: [Comprehensive analysis of the structural phenotypes and functional characteristics of B cells in oral lichen planus and oral lichenoid lesions through single-cell and spatial transcriptomics].
biological_context: Oral lichen planus and oral lichenoid lesions
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Denoising', 'Batch Correction', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To comprehensively characterize B-cell phenotypes and spatial distribution in oral lichen planus (OLP) and related oral lichenoid lesions (OLL) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
