The study aimed to uncover epigenetic mechanisms underlying B cell-mediated immune regulation in the oral mucosal microenvironment and observed extensive B-cell infiltration and tertiary lymphoid structure formation.

title: Decoding functional hematopoietic progenitor cells in the adult human lung.
main_goals: This study investigates the presence and characteristics of functional hematopoietic progenitor cells (HPCs) in the adult human lung. It demonstrates that these pulmonary HPCs reside in extravascular spaces, exhibit proliferation and engraftment capabilities in mice, and possess a distinct gene signature enriched for immune, megakaryocyte/platelet, and erythroid pathways. The research also spatially maps these blood progenitors to an alveolar interstitium niche and identifies HPCs with a lung signature within mobilized stem cell pools for transplantation.

title: Alterations of diffusion kurtosis measures in gait-related white matter in the "ON-OFF state" of Parkinson's disease.
data_modalities_used: ['Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'Diffusion Kurtosis Imaging', 'White Matter Tractography']
main_goals: To explore alterations in brain microstructure in Parkinson's disease patients compared to healthy controls and to identify the correlation of gait impairment in the ON and OFF states of patients with PD. The study utilizes Diffusion Kurtosis Imaging (DKI) to assess white matter integrity and its relationship with gait performance. DKI-based Tract-Based Spatial Statistics (TBSS) analysis is suggested as a potential tool for evaluating PD-related motor impairments.

title: Programs, origins and immunomodulatory functions of myeloid cells in glioma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'chromatin accessibility', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'organoid explant systems']
main_goals: This study systematically investigates the immunomodulatory phenotypes of myeloid cells in glioma by integrating multiple omics technologies. It discovered four distinct immunomodulatory programs driven by microenvironmental cues, which can predict immunotherapy response and survival. The research aims to provide a framework for understanding myeloid cell immunomodulation in glioma and to guide the development of improved immunotherapies.

title: Topic modeling analysis of the Allen Human Brain Atlas.
main_goals: The paper proposes a hierarchical Stochastic Block Modeling approach for identifying universal patterns in gene expression data from the Allen Human Brain Atlas. The method is shown to be more effective than traditional algorithms in identifying these patterns and elucidating the probabilistic associations between genes and brain regions, highlighting transcriptional and post-transcriptional pathways.

title: Ribosome phenotypes for rapid classification of antibiotic-susceptible and resistant strains of Escherichia coli.
main_goals: This paper introduces a method using the spatial distribution of fluorescently labelled ribosomes and a convolutional neural network (CNN) to rapidly classify antibiotic-susceptible and resistant strains of Escherichia coli. The CNN achieves high accuracy in identifying distinct ribosome phenotypes associated with different antibiotic mechanisms and susceptibility levels. This approach aims to eliminate lengthy culturing steps and enable rapid determination of antibiotic susceptibility.

title: Multiomics analysis unveils the cellular ecosystem with clinical relevance in aldosterone-producing adenomas with KCNJ5 mutations.
main_goals: This multiomics study aimed to analyze the cellular ecosystem of aldosterone-producing adenomas (APA) with KCNJ5 mutations, revealing cellular heterogeneity and spatial segregation. It investigated the role of lipid-associated macrophages and found correlations between intratumor cortisol synthesis, blood cortisol levels, and osteoporosis. The study provides insights into APA biology and potential clinical implications.

title: Integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals heterogeneity of human liver progenitor cells.
biological_context: Human liver progenitor cell heterogeneity in different conditions (fetal, healthy, cirrhotic, and HCC-affected livers)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Gene Co-expression Network Analysis']
main_goals: To analyze human liver progenitor cell heterogeneity using integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis. The study aimed to characterize LPC subpopulations, their spatial colocalization, and distinct cellular states across various liver conditions.

title: Considerations and recommendations from the ISMRM Diffusion Study Group for preclinical diffusion MRI: Part 3-Ex vivo imaging: Data processing, comparisons with microscopy, and tractography.
biological_context: Preclinical diffusion MRI (dMRI) for characterizing tissue microstructure and brain connectivity in ex vivo tissue.
main_goals: This paper provides recommendations and best practices for ex vivo diffusion MRI (dMRI) of preclinical tissue. It focuses on image pre-processing, data processing, and comparisons with microscopy, aiming to guide researchers in this complex area. The work also highlights areas for future research and provides guidelines on code and data sharing.

title: FHD deep learning prognosis approach: Early detection of fetal heart disease (FHD) using ultrasonography image-based IROI combined multiresolution DCNN.
main_goals: Proposes an automated hierarchical network-driven approach for detecting fetal heart disease (FHD) in ultrasonic images. The method involves pre-processing, intensified region of interest (IROI) segmentation, and multiresolution deep convolutional neural network (MDCNN) classification to identify diseased patterns.

title: Genomic and Transcriptomic Approaches Advance the Diagnosis and Prognosis of Neurodegenerative Diseases.
main_goals: This paper reviews the advancements in genomic and transcriptomic approaches for the diagnosis and prognosis of neurodegenerative diseases. It highlights how technologies like whole-genome sequencing, single-cell RNA sequencing, and CRISPR-based screens are revolutionizing the field by identifying genetic risk factors and stage-specific biomarkers. The review discusses the potential of these approaches for early diagnosis, personalized prognosis, and the development of tailored therapeutic strategies, while acknowledging challenges in clinical translation.

title: From Local to Systemic: The Journey of Tick Bite Biomarkers in Australian Patients.
biological_context: Tick bites and tick-related illnesses in Australian patients
data_modalities_used: ['skin biopsies', 'peripheral blood', 'cellular transcriptomics', 'cell-free transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolomics', 'DNA methylation', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To investigate if molecular signals from tick-bite locations in the skin can be detected systemically in peripheral blood. The study aimed to provide proof-of-concept that blood samples can capture biomarkers reflecting local tissue processes following a tick bite.

title: Batch correcting single-cell spatial transcriptomics count data with Crescendo improves visualization and detection of spatial gene patterns.
main_goals: The paper presents the Crescendo algorithm to correct batch effects in spatial transcriptomics count data. This algorithm enhances visualization and detection of spatial gene patterns across multiple samples and technologies. It improves downstream analyses such as detecting gene colocalization and ligand-receptor interactions.

title: Organoids from pluripotent stem cells and human tissues: When two cultures meet each other.
biological_context: Organoid development and function in human biology
main_goals: This review discusses the basic principles underlying organoids generated from pluripotent stem cells (PSCs) and tissue stem cells (TSCs). It considers how well PSC- and TSC-organoids mimic in vivo organs and discusses the advantages and limitations of each system for answering biological questions, including in cancer and developmental biology. The review also postulates how the two fields may move forward together by integrating their respective advantages.

title: Spatial single-cell proteomics landscape decodes the tumor microenvironmental ecosystem of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['imaging mass cytometry', 'spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'bulk proteomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to generate a comprehensive spatial atlas of iCCA to understand the tumor microenvironment (TME) ecosystem. It identifies spatial features associated with prognosis and immunotherapy response, revealing that spatial topology correlates with patient outcomes and proposing potential therapeutic options for identified subtypes.

title: Multiscale Dissection of Spatial Heterogeneity by Integrating Multi-Slice Spatial and Single-Cell Transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Alignment', 'Domain Identification', 'Cell Type Deconvolution', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: Proposes SMILE, a novel deep learning method combining graph contrastive autoencoder and multilayer perceptron with local constraints to learn multiscale and informative spot representations. Demonstrates superior performance on spatial alignment, domain identification, and cell type deconvolution compared to state-of-the-art methods. Capable of dissecting spatial variations at different scales and utilizing prior domain annotation information.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals prognostically LYZ<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts and colocalization with FN1<sup>+</sup> macrophages in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
main_goals: This study identified prognostically relevant LYZ+ fibroblasts and FN1+ macrophages in DLBCL. The hub genes associated with these subtypes represent potential biomarkers, providing insights into improving patient outcomes in DLBCL.

title: Applications of Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning to Support the Analysis of Microscopic Images of Cells and Tissues.
biological_context: Cell biology, radiology, pathology, cancer biology, immunology, cell and tissue imaging
main_goals: To examine the latest AI and DL techniques for cell analysis and data mining in microscopy images. The review aims to aid biologists with less AI/ML background and facilitate the incorporation of ML models into microscopy focus images.

title: Microglial intervention in ischemic stroke: Roles and intervention strategies.
main_goals: This review article investigates the role of microglia in ischemic stroke and explores potential intervention strategies. It discusses the dual roles of microglia, their dynamic activation states (M1/M2), and key signaling pathways involved. The paper also highlights potential therapeutic agents and emerging technologies for treating ischemic stroke.

title: Astrocyte heterogeneity reveals region-specific astrogenesis in the white matter.
biological_context: White matter and gray matter astrocyte comparison and astrogenesis in murine forebrain and cerebellum
main_goals: This paper compares astrocytes from cortical gray matter (GM) and white matter (WM)/corpus callosum (WM/CC) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics in mice. It reveals distinct molecular properties between WM and GM astrocytes, with specific hallmarks for WM astrocytes. The study also investigates region-specific astrogenesis by comparing WM astrocytes in the cortex and cerebellum, finding evidence for continued astrogenesis in the WM/CC.

title: Multi-Omics Analysis of Aberrances and Functional Implications of IRF5 in Digestive Tract Tumours.
biological_context: Digestive tract tumours, specifically oesophageal cancer (oesophageal squamous cell carcinoma and oesophageal adenocarcinoma)
main_goals: To establish and validate a reliable signature of senescence-related genes (SRGs) that aids in predicting prognosis in patients with oesophageal cancer. The study also evaluated the relationship between SRGP signatures and prognosis, immune cell infiltration, and chemotherapeutic drug responsiveness, identifying IRF5 as a potential target gene for ESCC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of Glomerulo-centric antibody mediated rejection in renal transplants.
biological_context: Glomerulo-centric antibody mediated rejection in renal transplants
main_goals: This case study used Digital Spatial Profiling to analyze spatial transcriptomics in renal transplant biopsies during antibody-mediated rejection. It identified molecular signatures of immune cells and HLA class II antigens within glomeruli and observed decreased podocyte gene expression. The findings highlight podocyte vulnerability and suggest potential gene markers for future diagnostic use.

title: Resolving the spatial and cellular architecture of intra-tumor heterogeneity by multi-region dissection of lung adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper aims to delineate the spatial heterogeneity and driving factors of cell colocalization in Lung Adenocarcinoma (LUAD) by analyzing multi-regional biopsies. It investigates the distinct spatial distributions and immune cell colocalizations of two cancer cell sub-clusters, providing insights into their roles in LUAD progression and immune evasion.

title: Human placental extract improves liver cirrhosis in mice with regulation of macrophages and senescent cells.
main_goals: This study investigated the therapeutic potential of human placental extract (HPE) for liver cirrhosis. It demonstrated that HPE administration improved liver function and reduced senescent cells in a mouse model. The study also elucidated the anti-inflammatory mechanisms involving macrophage polarization and senescent cell-derived inflammation pathways.

title: Deciphering key roles of B cells in prognostication and tailored therapeutic strategies for lung adenocarcinoma: a multi-omics and machine learning approach towards predictive, preventive, and personalized treatment strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to decipher the roles of B cells in the prognostication and tailored therapeutic strategies for lung adenocarcinoma using a multi-omics and machine learning approach. It developed a B cell-associated gene signature (SRBS) to predict prognosis and guide personalized treatment, including immunotherapy and chemotherapy.

title: Clonal Heterogeneity in Human Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma and Its Impact on Tumor Progression.
main_goals: To understand the contribution of intratumoral heterogeneity to PDAC biology by analyzing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data from primary human PDAC samples. The study revealed significant clonal heterogeneity, diverse transcriptional states, and unique interactions with the tumor microenvironment, challenging traditional PDAC classifications and highlighting the role of clonal evolution in disease progression and metastasis.

title: Molecularly-guided spatial proteomics captures single-cell identity and heterogeneity of the nervous system.
biological_context: Central nervous system and peripheral nervous system heterogeneity and response to injury
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The paper introduces and demonstrates a method combining immunostaining-guided laser capture microdissection (LCM) with LC-MS for spatial single-cell proteomics. This technique allows for the characterization of heterogeneity within the central and peripheral nervous systems, enabling the study of neuronal populations and neuroimmune changes associated with injury.

title: SpaceBar enables clone tracing in spatial transcriptomic data.
main_goals: This paper introduces SpaceBar, a cellular barcoding strategy that enables simultaneous clone tracing and spatial transcriptomics profiling. It uses synthetic barcode sequences to label cells and allows for the quantification of gene expression driven by intrinsic cellular cues or extrinsic environmental signals, distinguishing between clonal dynamics and environmentally-driven transcriptional regulation.

title: Spatially distinct cellular and molecular landscapes define prognosis in triple negative breast cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential gene expression analysis', 'Cell-type deconvolution', 'Spatial entropy', 'Functional enrichment', 'TF-target / ligand-receptor analysis', 'Convolutional neural networks']
main_goals: To delineate the spatial and molecular heterogeneity underlying differential prognosis in triple-negative breast cancer using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify distinct epithelial gene signatures that can classify samples and inform therapy, potentially transforming the clinical landscape for this aggressive subtype.

title: The "Podcast" ECoG dataset for modeling neural activity during natural language comprehension.
main_goals: This paper introduces a dataset of electrocorticography (ECoG) recordings from nine participants listening to a 30-minute podcast. The dataset includes neural data and extracted linguistic features of the stimulus. The authors also provide tutorials for data preprocessing and analysis, aiming to facilitate research in neural activity during natural language comprehension.

title: A Complete Spatial Map of Mouse Retinal Ganglion Cells Reveals Density and Gene Expression Specializations.
biological_context: Mouse retina spatial gene expression and cell distribution
main_goals: To map the spatial distribution and gene expression of all retinal ganglion cell (RGC) subtypes in mice using spatial transcriptomics and machine learning. The study investigates non-uniform distributions and gene expression variations, comparing mouse central vision specialization to primates.

title: Spatial metabolomics revealed multi-organ toxicity and visualize metabolite changes induced by borneol in zebrafish.
biological_context: Borneol toxicity in zebrafish, affecting heart, liver, kidney, and nervous system.
main_goals: This study systematically evaluated the effects of borneol (BO) on zebrafish using MALDI-MSI to understand its multi-organ toxicity and visualize metabolite changes. It aimed to provide insights into the toxicity of BO and its impact on metabolic dysregulation in aquatic organisms and potentially human health.

title: Mast Cells as a Factor in Regulation of Breast Cancer Stromal Component Associated with Breast Cancer Aggressiveness.
main_goals: To investigate the relationship between mast cell status and the features of the collagen matrix in breast cancer tissue. The study aimed to understand how mast cells influence the tumor microenvironment and potentially contribute to cancer aggressiveness by analyzing collagen expression, fiber organization, and the role of miR-155-5p.

title: Spatiotemporal Transcriptomic Profiling Reveals the Dynamic Immunological Landscape of Alveolar Echinococcosis.
main_goals: This study aims to reveal the host immune response mechanism against E. multilocularis by integrating bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics. It provides a high-resolution spatial atlas of infection foci and elucidates the roles of neutrophils, Spp1+ macrophages, and fibroblasts during disease progression. The findings suggest a transition in parasite control strategy by the host.

title: Identifying gene expression and cellular pathways involved in glomerular AL-amyloidosis and correlation with experimental data: seeking novel therapeutic interventions.
main_goals: To identify gene expression and cellular pathways involved in glomerular AL-amyloidosis using spatial transcriptomics in human kidney biopsies. The study aimed to correlate these findings with experimental data and discover novel therapeutic targets.

title: Analysis of thyroid carcinoma composition and spatial architecture in the progression of dedifferentiation, lymphatic metastasis, and gastric metastasis.
biological_context: Thyroid carcinoma progression, including dedifferentiation, lymphatic metastasis, and gastric metastasis
main_goals: To explore the spatial distribution characteristics of thyroid carcinomas and associated gastrointestinal metastatic cells using spatial transcriptomics and immunofluorescence. The study aimed to identify cell composition changes related to tumor dedifferentiation and metastasis, and to find potential markers for gastric metastasis.

title: Decoding cell-cell communication using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to provide a comprehensive overview of how spatial transcriptomics can be used to decode cell-cell communication. It likely discusses the technologies and computational approaches involved in analyzing spatial transcriptomic data to understand the complex interactions between cells within their native tissue environment.

title: Systematic inference of super-resolution cell spatial profiles from histology images.
biological_context: Cancer diagnosis and treatment, gastric malignant transformation
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell Type Prediction', 'Cell State Prediction', 'Spatial Organization Analysis', 'Deconvolution']
main_goals: The study reports HistoCell, a weakly-supervised deep-learning method to infer super-resolution cell spatial profiles (cell types, states, and spatial networks) directly from histology images. HistoCell enhances deconvolution accuracy for spatial transcriptomics data, enables annotation of cancer tissue architectures, and facilitates the discovery of prognosis and drug response biomarkers. It is also used for image-based screening of cell populations driving phenotypes of interest and identifying cell populations associated with gastric malignant transformation risk.

title: Defining the molecular identity and morphology of glia limitans superficialis astrocytes in vertebrates.
biological_context: Vertebrate CNS glia limitans superficialis astrocytes
main_goals: This paper defines the molecular identity and morphology of astrocytes forming the glia limitans superficialis. It identifies myocilin (Myoc) as a specific marker for these astrocytes and demonstrates their evolutionary conservation across vertebrates. The research aims to advance understanding of CNS homeostasis and potential therapeutic targeting.

title: Quantitative analysis of human umbilical vein endothelial cell morphology and tubulogenesis.
biological_context: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) cultured in vitro
main_goals: To develop and validate a label-free, image-based ptychography approach for quantitative analysis of HUVEC morphology and tubulogenesis. The method allows for automated, multiwell assay analysis, extracting phase-specific parameters like dry mass, optical thickness, and sphericity, alongside metrics of cell number, shape, tube formation, growth, and branching. This enables the derivation of pharmacologically relevant parameters for studies on vascular remodelling.

title: Cancer stem cells and tumor-associated macrophages as mates in tumor progression: mechanisms of crosstalk and advanced bioinformatic tools to dissect their phenotypes and interaction.
biological_context: Tumor progression, specifically the interplay between cancer stem cells (CSCs) and tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs)
covered_analysis_steps: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'trajectory analysis', 'signaling pathway analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to elucidate recent insights into cancer stem cell (CSC) biology and their complex interactions with tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) within the tumor microenvironment. It highlights the intricate crosstalk mechanisms and discusses advanced bioinformatic tools, such as single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, used to dissect their phenotypes and interactions, tracing the process from primary tumor to metastasis formation. The ultimate goal is to inform the development of innovative target therapies dampening CSC-TME interaction.

title: Advancements in single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics: transforming biomedical research.
main_goals: This review highlights single-cell sequencing approaches, recent technological developments, associated challenges, various techniques for expression data analysis, and their applications in various biomedical disciplines. It aims to characterize the dynamic nature of individual cells using single-cell sequencing tools.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in autoimmune rheumatic disease: potential clinical applications and perspectives.
biological_context: Autoimmune rheumatic diseases (rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, Sjögren's syndrome)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in situ hybridization', 'in situ sequencing', 'in situ spatial barcoding', 'microdissection-based methods', 'RNA sequencing']
main_goals: This review summarizes the development of spatial transcriptomics and current insights into the pathophysiology of autoimmune rheumatic diseases, focusing on immune cell distribution and cellular interactions within tissues. It explores the potential of spatial transcriptomics from a clinical perspective and discusses its translation to clinical practice.

title: A novel HVEM-Fc recombinant protein for lung cancer immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['organoid', 'T cell co-culture systems', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry']
main_goals: This paper evaluates the anti-tumor efficacy and underlying mechanisms of a novel recombinant fusion protein, HVEM-Fc, for lung cancer immunotherapy. It demonstrates that HVEM-Fc inhibits tumor growth and metastasis in mouse models and enhances T-cell activity in both murine and human organoid systems. The study also highlights that combining HVEM-Fc with PD-1 inhibitors yields the most potent anti-tumor outcomes.

title: STANCE: a unified statistical model to detect cell-type-specific spatially variable genes in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper proposes STANCE, a unified statistical model for detecting spatially variable genes (SVGs) and cell type-specific SVGs (ctSVGs) in spatial transcriptomics data. It uses a linear mixed-effect model to integrate gene expression, spatial location, and cell type composition. The model ensures tissue rotation-invariant results and employs a two-stage approach for detection.

title: Spatial profiling of ANO7 in prostate tissue: links to AR-signalling-associated lipid metabolism and inflammation.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of ANO7 in benign prostatic epithelium using spatial transcriptomics. It examines differences between ANO7-expressing and non-expressing regions and their corresponding stromal compartments. The findings highlight ANO7's potential role in regulating lipid metabolism associated with androgen signaling in benign luminal cells and low-grade cancer.

title: Harnessing omics data for drug discovery and development in ovarian aging.
main_goals: This review synthesizes multi-omics data related to ovarian aging, exploring how these datasets can identify novel drug targets and guide therapeutic strategies. It highlights the role of emerging omics technologies, particularly single-cell approaches, in understanding and potentially reversing ovarian aging, and emphasizes the integration of single-cell multi-omics data with AI models for predicting drug targets.

title: Comprehensive MALDI mass spectrometry imaging of tumor regions post-neoadjuvant therapy.
main_goals: Introduces an optimized workflow using conductive tape for stabilizing fragile tumor tissues, particularly necrotic regions, during sectioning and MALDI MSI analysis. This workflow aims to preserve tissue integrity and enable spatially resolved metabolic profiling of post-neoadjuvant therapy tumor regions. The study demonstrates the value of MALDI MSI for insights into chemotherapy-induced metabolic changes.

title: The principles of tactical formation identification in association football (soccer) - a survey.
main_goals: This paper reviews the principles employed to identify team tactical formations in association football based on event and tracking data. It discusses the history, importance, and technical aspects of formation identification, including data preprocessing, representation, and analysis techniques like templates and clustering. The paper also highlights limitations of current methods and suggests areas for future research.

title: Isotope Encoded Spatial Biology Identifies Amyloid Plaque-Age-Dependent Structural Maturation, Synaptic Loss, and Increased Toxicity.
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'stable isotope labeling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'hyperspectral confocal microscopy']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the processes involved in Aβ plaque formation and maturation using a knock-in Aβ mouse model. It employed mass spectrometry imaging and stable isotope labeling to timestamp Aβ plaques and track their aging spatially. The study correlated single-plaque spatial transcriptomics with time since seeding to identify gene-expression changes associated with plaque age, revealing relationships between plaque age, structural maturity, synapse loss, and toxicity.

title: SpaIM: Single-cell Spatial Transcriptomics Imputation via Style Transfer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Denoising', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: SpaIM is a style transfer learning model that utilizes scRNA-seq data to predict unmeasured gene expressions in spatial transcriptomics (ST) data. It aims to improve gene coverage and expressions by overcoming data sparsity and limited gene detection capacities inherent in ST technologies. The method is validated across diverse ST datasets and enhances downstream analyses.

title: Powerful and accurate case-control analysis of spatial molecular data with deep learning-defined tissue microniches.
biological_context: Alzheimer's dementia, ulcerative colitis, rheumatoid arthritis
main_goals: Introduce VIMA, a novel method combining deep learning and statistics to define tissue microniches and identify spatial features associated with disease. VIMA extracts numerical fingerprints to define microniches and uses statistics to correlate their abundance with case-control status. The method is shown to be well-calibrated, powerful, and accurate in simulations and applications to neurodegenerative and inflammatory diseases.

title: A Temporal and Spatial Atlas of Adaptive Immune Responses in the Lymph Node Following Viral Infection.
biological_context: Viral infection response in mouse lymph nodes
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'long-read sequencing', 'T cell receptor sequencing', 'B cell receptor sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Introduce AIR-SPACE, an integrative approach combining high-resolution spatial transcriptomics with paired, high-fidelity long-read sequencing of T and B cell receptors. Enable simultaneous analysis of cellular transcriptomes and adaptive immune receptor (AIR) repertoires within their native spatial context. Construct a comprehensive map of the developing adaptive immune response in mouse lymph nodes following viral infection.

title: Single Cell Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Immunotherapy-Driven Bone Marrow Niche Remodeling in AML.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatiotemporal interactions in the bone marrow niche of AML patients treated with pembrolizumab and decitabine. It aims to reveal how immunotherapies remodel the bone marrow niche by analyzing cell-cell distances and ligand-receptor signaling, linking these changes to clinical responses.

title: Somatic mutations distinguish melanocyte subpopulations in human skin.
biological_context: Human skin melanocyte subpopulations and their response to sun damage
main_goals: This study investigates the homeostatic mechanisms of human skin melanocytes by phenotyping clonal expansions and analyzing mutational landscapes, gene expression, and morphology. It reveals a subpopulation of melanocytes with low mutation burden, found preferentially in hair follicles, suggesting a protected niche. The findings illustrate the utility of incorporating mutational data into cell atlases.

title: NEUROMARK DFNC PATTERNS: A FULLY AUTOMATED PIPELINE TO ESTIMATE SUBJECT-SPECIFIC STATES FROM RS-FMRI DATA VIA CONSTRAINED ICA OF DFNC IN +100K SUBJECTS.
biological_context: Brain function, individual differences in functional connectivity, clinical applications of rs-fMRI
main_goals: To develop a fully automated pipeline (NeuroMark) to estimate subject-specific dynamic functional network connectivity (dFNC) states from resting-state fMRI (rs-fMRI) data. The pipeline uses constrained ICA with replicable component templates and state priors derived from a large dataset (>100k subjects). This aims to improve accuracy and comparability of individual rs-fMRI analyses for clinical applications.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of HIV and tuberculosis coinfection in a humanized mouse model reveals specific transcription patterns, immune responses and early morphological alteration signaling.
biological_context: HIV and tuberculosis coinfection in a humanized mouse model
main_goals: This study aimed to understand the early phenotypical and functional changes in immune cell infiltration in the affected organ of a humanized mouse model coinfected with HIV and Mtb. Spatial transcriptomics revealed specific transcription patterns, immune responses, and morphological alteration signaling at the early stage of infection.

title: Seq-Scope-eXpanded: Spatial Omics Beyond Optical Resolution.
biological_context: Liver, brain, and colon tissue; mouse spleen and human tonsil
main_goals: To present Seq-Scope-X, a novel spatial transcriptomics method that overcomes optical resolution limitations by integrating tissue expansion with submicrometer-resolution Seq-Scope. This method enables ultra-high-resolution whole-transcriptome and proteome profiling across various tissues, revealing fine-grained spatial patterns and cellular compartment differences.

title: SAMCell: Generalized Label-Free Biological Cell Segmentation with Segment Anything.
biological_context: Cell culture analysis, cell morphology, confluency, and growth patterns
main_goals: To present SAMCell, a modified version of Meta's Segment Anything Model (SAM), for generalized label-free biological cell segmentation. SAMCell aims to automate cell segmentation in microscopy images, reducing the need for annotated datasets and technical expertise, and improving upon previous methods.

title: scBSP: A fast and accurate tool for identifying spatially variable features from high-resolution spatial omics data.
main_goals: scBSP is introduced as a fast and accurate open-source tool for identifying spatially variable features in high-resolution spatial omics data. It leverages sparse matrix operations for computational efficiency and can handle large-scale 2D and 3D spatial omics data. The tool demonstrated superior speed and accuracy compared to existing methods in identifying spatially variable genes and peaks across various sequencing techniques and spatial resolutions.

title: Histopathologic Evaluation and Single-Cell Spatial Transcriptomics of the Colon Reveal Cellular and Molecular Abnormalities Linked to J-Pouch Failure in Patients with Inflammatory Bowel Disease.
biological_context: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) and J-Pouch failure after Total Abdominal Colectomy (TAC) with Ileal Pouch-Anal Anastomosis (IPAA)
main_goals: This study aimed to identify histopathological features in the total abdominal colectomy specimen associated with J-pouch failure in patients with inflammatory bowel disease. It also investigated the molecular mechanisms underlying this susceptibility using single-cell spatial transcriptomics to map gene expression and immune cell interactions in relation to pouch failure risk.

title: DABiG: Breath pattern classification using the hybrid deep learning with optimal feature selection.
main_goals: This paper presents DABiG, a hybrid deep learning model for breath pattern classification using gyroscope and accelerometer data. It introduces the Adaptive Chimp Optimization (AdCO) algorithm for optimal feature selection and incorporates spatial and temporal attention mechanisms into a Bidirectional Gated Recurrent Unit (BiGRU). The goal is to improve the accuracy of breath pattern classification.

title: Primed Mesenchymal Stem Cells by IFN-γ and IL-1β Ameliorate Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome through Enhancing Homing Effect and Immunomodulation.
main_goals: This study investigated the therapeutic potential of mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) primed with IFN-γ and IL-1β for treating Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS). The research aimed to understand how these primed MSCs enhance homing, modulate immune responses, and improve lung function in an ARDS mouse model, with a focus on identifying underlying molecular mechanisms through RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics.

title: Precise gene expression deconvolution in spatial transcriptomics with STged.
biological_context: Human pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, human squamous cell carcinoma, mouse kidney tissues
main_goals: STged is a computational framework for reconstructing cell-type-specific gene expression profiles from mixed spatial transcriptomics spots. It integrates graph-based spatial correlations and reference-derived gene signatures using non-negative least-squares regression to achieve precise deconvolution, outperforming existing methods in simulations and applications.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasms Reveals Divergent Indolent and Malignant States.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
main_goals: This study used Digital Spatial RNA profiling (DSP-RNA) to define and associate transcriptomic states with cancer risk in IPMN. It uncovered three distinct epithelial transcriptomic states that correlated with pathological grade and PDAC molecular subtypes, providing potential for improved risk stratification of IPMN.

title: Model Architecture Analysis and Implementation of TENET for Cell-Cell Interaction Network Reconstruction Using Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
main_goals: This paper introduces TENET, a novel triple-enhancement-based graph neural network framework for reconstructing cell-cell interaction (CCI) networks using spatial transcriptomics (ST) data. It aims to address inaccuracies in shallow neural networks when dealing with sparse connections and noise in CCI. The framework incorporates diverse CCI modalities and the downstream gene regulatory network (GRN) to enrich input information and considers global and local cellular and genetic features.

title: Integration of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals fibroblast subtypes in hepatocellular carcinoma: spatial distribution, differentiation trajectories, and therapeutic potential.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper integrates single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify and characterize fibroblast subtypes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It reveals their distinct spatial distributions, differentiation trajectories, and their role in promoting tumor progression through angiogenesis. Furthermore, it demonstrates the potential of a machine learning model based on these subtypes for predicting HCC patient prognosis and sorafenib response.

title: SpatialKNifeY (SKNY): Extending from spatial domain to surrounding area to identify microenvironment features with single-cell spatial omics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Estimation', 'Spatial Extension to the Tumor Microenvironment']
main_goals: Developed SpatialKNifeY (SKNY), an image-processing-based toolkit to identify spatial domains reflecting histology and extend them to the microenvironment. Applied SKNY to breast cancer data for tumor domain identification, clustering, and trajectory estimation, revealing vascularization and immunodeficiency. Utilized SKNY on colorectal cancer data to cluster spatial domains based on TME characteristics.

title: Towards the Next Generation of Data-Driven Therapeutics Using Spatially Resolved Single-Cell Technologies and Generative AI.
covered_analysis_steps: ['data dimensionality reduction', 'modelling biological variability', 'identifying complex patterns']
main_goals: This review explores the current landscape of single-cell and spatial multi-omics technologies and the application of generative AI in data analysis and modelling. It highlights their transformative impact on understanding autoimmune diseases and outlines future directions for AI-powered personalized medicine.

title: SpaDCN: Deciphering Spatial Functional Landscape from Spatially Resolved Transcriptomics by Aligning Cell-Cell Communications.
main_goals: SpaDCN is proposed as a framework to decipher spatial functional landscapes from spatially resolved transcriptomics by aligning cell-cell communications. It generates spatial graph representations from expression and ligand-receptor data and employs dynamic graph convolution to reveal spatial functional regions with coherent cellular organization. The method outperforms existing approaches in spatial domain identification and denoising, and identifies prognostic marker genes in cancer.

title: Analysis of fatty acid metabolism in prostate cancer and discovery of a new programmed cell death-associated luminal cell subpopulation.
main_goals: This study analyzes fatty acid metabolism in prostate cancer using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies a new programmed cell death-associated luminal cell subpopulation and proposes new therapeutic targets.

title: Exploring the cellular and molecular basis of murine cardiac development through spatiotemporal transcriptome sequencing.
main_goals: This study utilizes spatial transcriptome sequencing to construct a spatiotemporal cell atlas of early murine cardiac development. The researchers elucidated the spatial organization of cardiac cellular lineages and their interactions, identified key genes associated with the loss of myocardial regeneration ability, and found marker genes for left and right atria.

title: Spatial metabolomics in mental disorders and traditional Chinese medicine: a review.
biological_context: Mental disorders and Traditional Chinese Medicine
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of spatial metabolomics in studying the pathophysiology of mental disorders and the mechanisms of Traditional Chinese Medicine. It compares traditional metabolomics with spatial metabolomics and summarizes the latest progress and challenges in the field.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a potential role of ATF3 in brain metastasis of lung adenocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomics (ST)', 'Western blotting', 'quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: To dissect cellular components and their spatial distribution in human brain metastasis tumors of lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study identified ATF3 as a potential regulator of the mesenchymal-epithelial transition (MET) program in LUAD brain metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals regional characteristics of lupus nephritis in murine kidneys and immune response to prednisolone or Gancao Nourishing-Yin decoction therapies.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to characterize regional differences in lupus nephritis in mouse kidneys. It also investigates the immune response to prednisolone or Gancao Nourishing-Yin decoction therapies.

title: Identification and characterization of cell niches in tissue from spatial omics data at single-cell resolution.
biological_context: human triple-negative breast cancer, mouse liver
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: The paper presents scNiche, a computational framework to identify and characterize cell niches from spatial omics data at single-cell resolution. It benchmarks scNiche against existing methods using simulated and biological datasets, demonstrating its effectiveness. The framework is applied to breast cancer and liver data to reveal microenvironment influences and disease-specific niches.

title: A probabilistic modeling framework for genomic networks incorporating sample heterogeneity.
main_goals: The paper introduces GraphR, a flexible Bayesian approach for probabilistic modeling of genomic networks that incorporates sample heterogeneity. It enables sparse sample-specific network estimation, identifies effects of heterogeneity, and uses variational Bayes for computational efficiency. The method's comparative efficiency and biological applications are demonstrated.

title: Ischemic Stroke Lesion Core Segmentation from CT Perfusion Scans Using Attention ResUnet Deep Learning.
main_goals: This paper presents a deep learning-based system for automated segmentation of ischemic stroke lesions from CT perfusion datasets. The proposed approach integrates Edge Enhancing Diffusion filtering and an Attention ResUnet architecture with attention mechanisms. The system aims to improve efficiency and accuracy in clinical settings for stroke lesion segmentation.

title: Connecting the structure and function of cartilage using spatial omics.
main_goals: This review connects the structure and function of cartilage by discussing the integration of spatial omics technologies. It aims to highlight how these approaches can advance our understanding of cartilage biology and disease.

title: Cellpose as a reliable method for single-cell segmentation of autofluorescence microscopy images.
biological_context: Cancer organoids and cell lines treated with metabolic inhibitors and chemotherapies, focusing on NAD(P)H autofluorescence.
data_modalities_used: ['autofluorescence microscopy', 'multiphoton intensity images', 'fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy (FLIM)']
main_goals: This study validates Cellpose as a reliable method for segmenting single cells in autofluorescence microscopy images, particularly for NAD(P)H intensity. It introduces an autofluorescence-trained model (ATM) that improves segmentation reproducibility and accurately captures functional changes in cells cultured in 2D and 3D.

title: Matrix mechano-sensing at the invasive front induces a cytoskeletal and transcriptional memory supporting metastasis.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Ex vivo culture', 'patient samples', 'murine models']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: The study characterizes extracellular matrix (ECM) organization at the invasive front of tumors and its impact on metastasis. It identifies distinct ECM features correlated with invasive behavior and demonstrates that metastases recapitulate these features. The research also highlights a spatial cytoskeletal and transcriptional memory in cancer cells responding to the ECM, uncovering a mechano-inflammatory program linked to prognosis.

title: Comprehensive analysis of cytokine and chemokine gene expression in IgG4-related disease by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to comprehensively analyze cytokine and chemokine gene expression in IgG4-related disease using spatial transcriptomics to understand the underlying mechanisms of the disease.

title: Spatiospectral dynamics of electroencephalography patterns during propofol-induced alterations of consciousness states.
biological_context: Propofol-induced alterations of consciousness states in humans
main_goals: The study investigates the spatiospectral dynamics of EEG patterns during propofol-induced alterations of consciousness. It uses non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) to identify six dynamical patterns reflecting neural activity changes. An index, HLM(α), is developed to measure hemispheric asymmetry in alpha oscillations and predict individual variability in consciousness alterations.

title: Clonal lineage tracing and transcriptomics of cortical progenitor populations reveal maintenance of differentiation potential.
main_goals: This study uses a lineage tracing tool (pbacBarcode) and transcriptomics to investigate the contributions of individual cortical radial glial progenitors (RGPs) to the postnatal cortex. It reveals that some RGPs remain multipotent and maintain differentiation potential into different cell types as late as postnatal day 4, suggesting a population decline model for postnatal neocortical development. The study also identifies a potential pool of intermediary progenitor cells.

title: Triterpenoid saponins in tea plants: A spatial and metabolic analysis using UPLC-QTOFMS, molecular networking, and DESI-MSI.
main_goals: This study profiles triterpenoid saponins in tea plants using mass spectrometry and imaging. It characterizes their structural diversity and tissue-specific distribution, revealing cultivar-specific variations and compartmentalized root localization. The findings aim to advance understanding for bioactive compound extraction and breeding strategies.

title: Single-Nucleus RNA Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics for Squamous Cell Carcinoma Arising From Ovarian Mature Teratoma.
biological_context: Squamous cell carcinoma arising from ovarian mature teratoma (SCC-MT)
main_goals: This study performed single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics on clinical SCC-MT samples to identify novel therapeutic candidates. The researchers identified unique gene expression profiles and determined a role for KLF5 in SCC-MT development, suggesting KLF5-related factors as potential therapeutic targets.

title: A single approach, multiple insights: Harnessing spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to identify novel therapeutic targets of alcohol-associated hepatitis.
main_goals: This study aims to identify novel therapeutic targets for alcohol-associated hepatitis by applying spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The research leverages these technologies to gain multiple insights into the disease's mechanisms.

title: Unveiling the crucial role of glycosylation modification in lung adenocarcinoma metastasis through artificial neural network-based spatial multi-omics single-cell analysis and Mendelian randomization.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single-Cell Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Multiomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of glycosylation modification in lung adenocarcinoma metastasis using multi-omics approaches. It employs artificial neural networks for predictive modeling and Mendelian randomization to identify causal genes, aiming to pinpoint viable therapeutic targets.

title: Deconvolution and inference of spatial communication through optimization algorithm for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To propose a novel deconvolution method, NODE, that combines cell-type-specific information from scRNA-seq and intercellular communications in tissue. NODE incorporates spatial information to quantify intercellular communications and infers deconvolution results using optimization to reduce overfitting. It was applied to four datasets for validation and comparison with existing algorithms.

title: STMiner: Gene-centric spatial transcriptomics for deciphering tumor tissues.
main_goals: STMiner directly characterizes the spatial distribution of genes using 2D Gaussian mixture models and optimal transport theory to overcome challenges in analyzing tumor tissues. It mitigates background bias and data sparsity, revealing key gene sets and spatial structures overlooked by spot-based tools. The method aims to facilitate novel biological discoveries and has broader applications beyond spatial transcriptomics.

title: The state-of-the-art in cardiac MRI reconstruction: Results of the CMRxRecon challenge in MICCAI 2023.
main_goals: The paper presents the Cardiac MRI Reconstruction Challenge (CMRxRecon) at MICCAI 2023. It aims to foster the development of data-driven reconstruction algorithms for cardiac MRI by providing a dataset and evaluation platform. The paper summarizes the challenge design, submitted results, employed methods, and discusses effective strategies for cardiac MRI reconstruction.

title: Spatial profiling of the interplay between cell type- and vision-dependent transcriptomic programs in the visual cortex.
biological_context: Visual cortex (V1) development and organization in mice during critical periods of postnatal life, focusing on the effects of visual experience on neuronal cell types.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper aims to characterize the spatial organization of L2/3 cell types in the primary visual cortex (V1) with and without visual experience. It investigates how visual deprivation influences transcriptomic programs in a cell type- and vision-dependent manner, linking spatial zonation to gene expression continuity and identifying distinct gene programs affected by visual experience.

title: Evolutionary convergence of sensory circuits in the pallium of amniotes.
biological_context: Evolutionary convergence of sensory circuits in the pallium of amniotes
main_goals: The paper compares the development and evolution of pallial sensory circuits across birds, lizards, and mammals using birthdating, single-cell RNA, and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals developmental distinctions and functional similarities, suggesting evolutionary convergence of high-order sensory processing.

title: Protocol to recover single-cell gene expression profiles from spatial transcriptomics data using cluster computing.
main_goals: This paper presents scResolve, a computational protocol to recover single-cell gene expression profiles from low-resolution spatial transcriptomics data. It details steps for environment setup, data preparation, super-resolution inference, and cell segmentation. The protocol is designed to run in a cluster environment, leveraging parallel computing for faster processing.

title: Quinolinic acid potentially links kidney injury to brain toxicity.
biological_context: Mouse model of rapid kidney failure induced by Mdm2 conditional deletion in kidney tubules, as well as mouse models of ischemia-induced acute kidney injury and adenine-induced chronic kidney disease. Also includes analysis of patients with advanced chronic kidney disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolomics Analysis', 'Pathway Enrichment Analysis', 'Data Integration']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between kidney dysfunction and neurological impairment using metabolomics. It identifies the kynurenine pathway, specifically quinolinic acid, as a potential mediator of this connection, observed in mouse models and human patients with chronic kidney disease. The findings suggest the kynurenine pathway as a target for treating neurological issues in kidney disease.

title: Simpler Protein Domain Identification Using Spectral Clustering.
main_goals: This paper introduces SPECTRALDOM, an enhanced method for protein domain identification. It builds upon the SPECTRUS algorithm by offering simpler, high-quality partitioning from pairwise interactions without normal modes for single structures. It also incorporates a Multiple Sequence Alignment mode for homologous structures and a domain matching algorithm to handle fragmentation.

title: Effectors of the Future: Universal Chimeric Antigen Receptor.
main_goals: This review elaborates on antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity mediated by universal adapter CARs and how recent CAR engineering strides can provide a versatile cellular platform for multitargeted immunotherapies. It discusses the potential of universal CAR effector cells in cancer treatment.

title: New dimension in viral hepatitis research.
biological_context: Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection and coinfection with Hepatitis Delta Virus (HDV) and Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
main_goals: This paper demonstrates the feasibility of spatial transcriptomics in analyzing HBV infections using GeoMx DSP technology. It revealed spatially distinct transcriptomic signatures related to immune features and viral burden in liver tissues of HBV-monoinfected, HBV/HDV coinfected, and HBV/HIV coinfected patients. The study identified underinvestigated immune cells and highlights future directions for improving understanding and treatment of HBV.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics in Human Cardiac Tissue.
main_goals: This review focuses on the application of spatial transcriptomics in human cardiac tissues, exploring current technologies and highlighting key studies. It aims to address challenges and foster interdisciplinary collaboration, serving as a practical guide for researchers new to spatial transcriptomics.

title: Spatial interaction mapping of PD-1/PD-L1 in head and neck cancer reveals the role of macrophage-tumour barriers associated with immunotherapy response.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'in situ proximity ligation assay (isPLA)', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study aims to bridge the gap in understanding the tumor microenvironment by identifying distinct spatial patterns of PD-1/PD-L1 interactions and their association with immunotherapy responses in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC). It highlights the utility of isPLA in detecting distinct tumor-immune interactions within the TME, offering new cellular interaction metrics for stratifying and optimizing immunotherapy strategies.

title: SpaCcLink: exploring downstream signaling regulations with graph attention network for systematic inference of spatial cell-cell communication.
main_goals: SpaCcLink is a novel cell-cell communication analysis method that incorporates downstream signaling within cells. It systematically investigates spatial communication patterns and downstream signal networks, identifying relevant ligands, receptors, and downstream genes/pathways influenced by communication.

title: 3D Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Network with Dense U-Net-Based Discriminator for Preclinical fMRI Denoising.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel algorithm, 3D U-WGAN, for denoising preclinical fMRI data. It uses a 3D Wasserstein GAN with a dense U-Net discriminator to improve image quality and signal-to-noise ratio. The method aims to outperform existing techniques by better preserving structure while effectively removing noise.

title: Mapping Human Uterine Disorders Through Single-Cell Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human uterine disorders including endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial cancer, and fibroids
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of single-cell transcriptomics and spatial transcriptomics in mapping human uterine disorders. It highlights how these technologies reveal cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms underlying diseases like endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial cancer, and fibroids, identifying cell types, signaling pathways, and cellular dysfunctions. The review also discusses the potential of these approaches for biomarker discovery and personalized medicine in gynecological disorders.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis identifies epithelium-macrophage crosstalk in endometriotic lesions.
main_goals: To identify cell type-specific gene expression changes in endometriotic lesions and elucidate crosstalk among stroma, epithelium, and macrophages compared to eutopic endometrium. The study highlights increased signaling between lesion epithelium and macrophages, suggesting the epithelium drives lesion inflammation and promotes a pro-repair phenotype in macrophages.

title: Integrating Spatially-Resolved Transcriptomics Data Across Tissues and Individuals: Challenges and Opportunities.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration across tissues and individuals', 'Spatial alignment', 'Spatial registration']
main_goals: This paper reviews the challenges and opportunities in integrating spatially-resolved transcriptomics data across tissues and individuals. It characterizes the impact of varying spatial and biological resolutions and provides a review of spatially-aware integration methods. The authors also highlight opportunities for advancing computational algorithms for atlas-scale datasets and standardized preprocessing.

title: The trabecular and compact myocardium of adult vertebrate ventricles are transcriptionally similar despite morphological differences.
main_goals: The study investigates whether the compact and trabecular layers of adult vertebrate ventricles have intrinsically different transcriptional states despite morphological differences. Using spatial transcriptomics and analyzing existing single-cell transcriptomes, the research compares embryonic and adult hearts across species. The findings suggest that the transcriptional states of developing trabecular and compact myocardium do not persist into adulthood.

title: Single-cell and spatial-resolved profiling reveals cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in colorectal cancer metabolic subtypes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Immune Infiltration Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) heterogeneity within colorectal cancer (CRC) metabolic subtypes using single-cell and spatial profiling. It identified SFRP2+ CAFs as protumorigenic and linked their presence to chemoresistance, proposing AGMAT as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Progress in multi-omics studies of osteoarthritis.
main_goals: This review systematically analyzes and summarizes the application and recent achievements of omics technologies, particularly spatial omics, in osteoarthritis (OA) research. It aims to shed light on new potential therapeutic targets and biomarkers for OA diagnosis and treatment. The review also highlights future research directions and challenges.

title: Benchmarking the translational potential of spatial gene expression prediction from histology.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'The Cancer Genome Atlas']
main_goals: This paper conducts a comprehensive benchmarking study of eleven methods for predicting spatial gene expression from histology images. The evaluation covers performance, generalizability, translational potential, usability, and computational efficiency. The findings aim to highlight the capabilities and areas for advancement in this emerging field.

title: Importance of dataset design in developing robust U-Net models for label-free cell morphology evaluation.
biological_context: Cell quality evaluation in regenerative medicine
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of training dataset design on the robustness of U-Net models for label-free cell morphology evaluation. It demonstrates that robust segmentation can be achieved with smaller datasets than typically assumed, emphasizing the importance of dataset content and morphological diversity. The findings provide guidance for effective deep learning-based cell segmentation in manufacturing and research.

title: Quantifying multilabeled brain cells in the whole prefrontal cortex reveals reduced inhibitory and a subtype of excitatory neuronal marker expression in serotonin transporter knockout rats.
biological_context: Serotonin transporter knockout rats, prefrontal cortex function, anxiety
main_goals: The paper aims to quantify multilabeled brain cells in the whole prefrontal cortex of serotonin transporter knockout rats and investigate changes in neuronal marker expression. It also presents a novel method for automated cell counts using deep learning (StarDist) and open-source tools for analyzing a wide range of prefrontal cortex subregions.

title: Polyamine metabolism dysregulation contributes to muscle fiber vulnerability in ALS.
biological_context: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) in SOD1²ⁱ⁰ˢ mouse model
main_goals: To understand how altered innervation interferes with muscle homeostasis during ALS progression by generating a spatial transcriptomics dataset of skeletal muscle in the SOD1²ⁱ⁰ˢ mouse model. The study identified polyamine metabolism as a key altered pathway, correlating its dysregulation with muscle fiber vulnerability and demonstrating that restoring polyamine homeostasis can rescue the ALS muscle phenotype.

title: CDK16<sup>+</sup> Luminal Progenitor Cell-Like Tumor Cells Interacted with POSTN<sup>+</sup> Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts Associate with Chemo-Resistance In Breast Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: This paper characterizes dynamic changes in tumor states and cellular composition in breast cancer patients undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy. It identifies CDK16+ luminal progenitor cell-like tumor cells interacting with POSTN+ cancer-associated fibroblasts as a driver of chemo-resistance. The study proposes targeting CDK16 to enhance chemotherapy efficacy.

title: Points to Consider From the ESTP Pathology 2.0 Working Group: Overview on Spatial Omics Technologies Supporting Drug Discovery and Development.
biological_context: Toxicologic pathology, drug discovery and development
main_goals: To raise awareness about emerging spatial omics technologies and their potential applications in discovery and toxicologic pathology. The review provides an overview of commonly used, commercially available platforms for transcriptomic, proteomic, and multiomic analysis, discussing technical aspects and illustrative examples. It emphasizes the important role of pathologists in harnessing spatial omics for translational drug discovery and human safety risk assessment.

title: Single-Cell Array Enhanced Cell Damage Recognition Using Artificial Intelligence for Anticancer Drug Discovery.
biological_context: Anticancer drug discovery, cancer cell status monitoring
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: Developed a cell damage recognition method using single-cell arrays and AI. The method utilizes micropatterns to isolate cells, monitors morphological and ROS changes after drug exposure, and uses a CNN to classify cell status and damage levels. This enhances the accuracy of AI-driven analysis for anticancer drug screening.

title: Multi-modal refinement of the human heart atlas during the first gestational trimester.
biological_context: Human heart development during the first gestational trimester
main_goals: To study first-trimester human hearts to lay groundwork for studies of congenital heart defects. The study aimed to characterize cell types and their spatial organization, identifying new cardiomyocyte populations and autonomic/lymphatic endothelial transcriptomes, and a cardiomyofibroblast progenitor. It also aimed to translate molecular identity into specialized cardiac functions through anatomical-positional features.

title: Comprehensive single-cell pan-cancer atlas unveils IFI30+ macrophages as key modulators of intra-tumoral immune dynamics.
main_goals: This study elucidates IFI30's role in enhancing MHC-II antigen processing and its function within the macrophage-mediated tumor microenvironment across various cancers. It positions IFI30 as a promising immunotherapeutic target, particularly in its interaction with M2-macrophages, suggesting it as a potential intervention point in cancer immunotherapy.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal pre-metastatic subsets and therapeutic targets in penile carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'cell assays']
main_goals: This study aimed to understand tumor heterogeneity in penile carcinoma and identify pre-metastatic subsets and therapeutic targets. Using various transcriptomic and cell assay techniques, the researchers discovered an MMP3+SPP1+ pre-metastatic subset and identified CK2α as a potential therapeutic target, showing anti-tumor effects with Silmitasertib.

title: Role of TGF-β/SMAD/YAP/TAZ signaling in skeletal muscle fibrosis.
biological_context: Skeletal muscle fibrosis, specifically in the context of muscular dystrophies and acute muscle injury
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of the YAP/TAZ signaling pathway in skeletal muscle fibrosis, which is associated with the differentiation of fibro/adipogenic progenitors (FAPs) into myofibroblasts. The study found that TGF-β activates YAP/TAZ via SMAD3, promoting FAP differentiation and fibrosis. Inhibiting YAP/TAZ or mechanotransduction reduced fibrosis in vitro and in vivo, suggesting YAP/TAZ as a therapeutic target.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity in tumor cells impacts immunology in lung squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of metabolic heterogeneity on immunological functions in lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC). It analyzes spatial metabolic profiles and tumor-infiltrating T lymphocytes (TILs) to identify metabolic tumor subpopulations and their correlation with immune cell infiltration and patient survival. The findings highlight the interplay between metabolic heterogeneity and the tumor immune microenvironment, suggesting potential for tailored therapeutic strategies.

title: Deconvolution of spatial transcriptomics data via graph contrastive learning and partial least square regression.
main_goals: Introduces CLPLS, a graph contrastive learning and partial least squares regression-based method for deconvoluting spatial transcriptomics data. CLPLS integrates spatial transcriptomics with single-cell multi-omics data to explore spatially epigenomic heterogeneity. The method demonstrates superior performance in single-cell level deconvolution on simulated and real datasets.

title: Spatial‒temporal heterogeneities of liver cancer and the discovery of the invasive zone.
main_goals: This review illustrates the latest discovery of the invasive zone and systematically introduces specific macroscopic spatial heterogeneities, pathological spatial heterogeneities, and tumor microenvironment heterogeneities of liver cancer. It highlights the role of spatial heterogeneity in liver tumor development and the contribution of spatial omics to understanding these heterogeneities and developing novel therapies.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomics elucidates the pathogenesis of fulminant viral myocarditis.
biological_context: Fulminant viral myocarditis induced by Coxsackievirus B3 in mice
main_goals: To elucidate the pathogenesis of fulminant viral myocarditis (FM) using spatiotemporal transcriptomics. The study identified key cell types and molecular pathways involved in FM, including mesothelial cells, macrophages, CD8+ effector T cells, and the IFN-gamma/Spi1 axis. It also demonstrated the therapeutic potential of targeting this axis.

title: A comprehensive pan-cancer examination of transcription factor MAFF: Oncogenic potential, prognostic relevance, and immune landscape dynamics.
biological_context: Pan-cancer examination of MAFF's role in tumor progression, prognosis, and immune landscape
main_goals: To conduct a comprehensive pan-cancer analysis of the transcription factor MAFF, examining its oncogenic potential, prognostic relevance, and impact on the immune landscape. The study aims to identify MAFF as a potential prognostic marker and target for personalized cancer immunotherapy.

title: Polarity-JaM: an image analysis toolbox for cell polarity, junction and morphology quantification.
biological_context: Endothelial cells and their collective behaviour
main_goals: This paper introduces Polarity-JaM, an open-source package for reproducible exploratory image analysis of cell polarity, junction, and morphology. It provides versatile methods for single cell segmentation, feature extraction, and statistical analysis, aiming to be accessible to bench scientists.

title: Long-duration electrocardiogram classification based on Subspace Search VMD and Fourier Pooling Broad Learning System.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel method for long-duration electrocardiogram (ECG) classification. It utilizes Subspace Search Variational Mode Decomposition (SSVMD) for data preprocessing and a Fourier Pooling Broad Learning System (FPBLS) to handle high-dimensional ECG data and extract salient features. The aim is to improve the accuracy of detecting cardiovascular diseases from noisy long-duration ECG signals.

title: Spatio-temporal evolution and drivers of coupling coordination between digital infrastructure and inclusive green growth: Evidence from the Yangtze River economic belt.
main_goals: This study explores the spatio-temporal evolution and drivers of coupling coordination between digital infrastructure and inclusive green growth in China's Yangtze River Economic Belt. It aims to provide scientifically grounded policy insights for tailored development strategies.

title: Spatial proteomics identifies a CRTC-dependent viral signaling pathway that stimulates production of interleukin-11.
biological_context: Viral infection, specifically in relation to immune response and potential fibrotic complications.
main_goals: To identify signaling factors involved in viral infection response by analyzing protein relocalization on a global scale. The study identified CRTC2/3 translocation as a key pathway stimulated by viral infection, leading to IL-11 production, with potential clinical implications for fibrotic viral infections like SARS-CoV-2.

title: Machine learning models for segmentation and classification of cyanobacterial cells.
main_goals: This paper introduces Cypose, a software package employing machine learning models for the segmentation and classification of cyanobacterial cells from timelapse microscopy images. The models are based on the Cellpose framework for segmentation and a CNN named Cyclass for classification. Cypose aims to improve cell segmentation accuracy and enable high-throughput analysis of dense cyanobacterial colonies and filamentous cyanobacteria.

title: Decoding maize meristems maintenance and differentiation: integrating single-cell and spatial omics.
biological_context: Maize shoot apical meristem (SAM) and inflorescence meristems (IMs)
main_goals: This review comprehensively summarizes recent advancements in understanding maize meristem development, with a focus on the integration of single-cell and spatial technologies. It discusses mechanisms governing stem cell maintenance and differentiation in SAM and IM, emphasizing gene regulatory networks, hormonal pathways, and cellular omics insights into stress responses and adaptation. Future directions include cross-species comparisons, multi-omics integration, and the application of these technologies to precision breeding and stress adaptation research.

title: SpatialLeiden: spatially aware Leiden clustering.
main_goals: The paper introduces SpatialLeiden, a computationally performant and spatially aware clustering method that integrates spatial information into the Leiden clustering algorithm. It aims to improve the clustering of single-cell omics data by considering spatial context, comparing favorably with existing state-of-the-art spatial clustering algorithms.

title: Multiomics identify the gene expression signature of the spinal cord during aging process.
main_goals: This paper investigates the transcriptional characteristics of aging spinal cords using multiomics. It identifies key gene expression signatures related to senescence, neuroinflammation, ferroptosis, and necroptosis, highlighting the role of Spi1 and Fth1 in mediating ferroptosis resistance in senescent glial cells.

title: Cell and transcriptomic diversity of infrapatellar fat pad during knee osteoarthritis.
biological_context: Infrapatellar fat pad during knee osteoarthritis
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This study uses a multiomic approach to identify cell types and transcriptomic profiles within the infrapatellar fat pad (IFP) and to determine differences related to knee osteoarthritis (KOA), sex, and obesity. It maps cell subclusters, resolves cell distributions and communication networks using spatial transcriptomics, and defines metabolic differences in fibroblasts.

title: ITGA5<sup>+</sup> synovial fibroblasts orchestrate proinflammatory niche formation by remodelling the local immune microenvironment in rheumatoid arthritis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial gene expressions', 'Immunohistology', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'flow cytometry', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the phenotypic heterogeneity of tissue-resident synovial fibroblasts and their role in inflammatory response in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The researchers identified a novel ITGA5+ synovial fibroblast population that remodels the local immune microenvironment and exacerbates RA development by inducing TPH differentiation. Therapeutic modulation of this subpopulation is proposed as a potential treatment strategy for RA.

title: Neural stem cell quiescence and activation dynamics are regulated by feedback input from their progeny under homeostatic and regenerative conditions.
biological_context: Mouse adult subventricular neural stem cell (NSC) niche
main_goals: This study investigates the feedback mechanisms regulating neural stem cell (NSC) quiescence and activation dynamics in the mouse adult subventricular zone. It reveals that transient amplifying cells (TAPs), the progeny of NSCs, repress NSC proliferative states through ephrin signaling and calcium dynamics. The findings suggest a feedback loop that maintains stem cell pools throughout life.
