title: Enhancer Dynamics and Spatial Organization Drive Anatomically Restricted Cellular States in the Human Spinal Cord.
main_goals: This study aims to understand the cellular diversity and organization of the healthy human spinal cord by analyzing enhancer dynamics and spatial organization using spatial transcriptomics and single nuclei epigenomics. It focuses on identifying cell-type specific cryptic enhancer activity and glial cell gene regulatory networks along the rostrocaudal axis. The study also addresses the functional significance of cellular organization in the context of paracrine signaling.

title: An integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomic atlas of thyroid cancer progression identifies prognostic fibroblast subpopulations.
main_goals: This study aims to define stromal cell subpopulations and tumor-stromal cross-talk occurring across thyroid cancer using integrated single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA-sequencing. It identifies distinct inflammatory and myofibroblastic cancer-associated fibroblast populations associated with tumor cell invasion and disease progression. The study provides an integrated atlas of thyroid cancer fibroblast subtypes and spatial characterization at sites of tumor invasion and de-differentiation.

title: Deep topic modeling of spatial transcriptomics in the rheumatoid arthritis synovium identifies distinct classes of ectopic lymphoid structures.
main_goals: The paper introduces DeepTopics, a scalable reference-free deconvolution method based on a Dirichlet variational autoencoder architecture for analyzing spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to identify disease-relevant cellular communities and microenvironments. The method is applied to rheumatoid arthritis synovium samples to discover distinct cellular patterns within ectopic lymphoid structures.

title: NFE2-driven neutrophil polarization promotes pancreatic cancer liver metastasis progression.
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the role of neutrophils in pancreatic cancer liver metastasis by combining single-cell sequencing with spatial transcriptomics. It identifies NFE2-driven neutrophil polarization as a key mechanism promoting metastasis progression. The findings suggest NFE2 could be a potential target for anti-metastatic therapy.

title: Inferring single-cell and spatial microRNA activity from transcriptomics data.
biological_context: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells, Multiple Sclerosis
main_goals: This study introduces miTEA-HiRes, a method designed to facilitate the evaluation of miRNA activity at high resolution in single-cell, type-specific single-cell populations, and spatial transcriptomics data. It infers differential miRNA activity by comparing different conditions. The method is exemplified using peripheral blood mononuclear cells from Multiple Sclerosis patients and controls, revealing differential activity of miR-20a-5p and miR-519a-3p.

title: EGR1 regulates oxidative stress and aldosterone production in adrenal cells and aldosterone-producing adenomas.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the role of EGR1 in regulating oxidative stress and aldosterone production in adrenal cells and APAs. It identifies EGR1 as a key gene associated with RSL3-related oxidative stress and APAs using RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings reveal a novel mechanism linking EGR1 to oxidative stress regulation and aldosterone production, with potential implications for the pathogenesis of APAs.

title: Protocol for generating protein profiles and distance-based network analysis of murine tissue slices.
main_goals: The paper introduces a protocol for spatial proteomics using thin cryotome sections of mouse skeletal muscle tissue. It details steps for preparing muscle sections and LC-MS/MS analyses to generate spatial protein profiles along the longitudinal skeletal muscle axis. The protocol includes procedures for scanning longitudinal protein profiles and replacing missing data using a sliding window approach.

title: Unlocking the potential of spatial transcriptomics with custom microfluidic chips.
main_goals: The paper aims to unlock the potential of spatial transcriptomics by introducing a novel custom microfluidic chip. This suggests the development of a new tool or platform for spatial transcriptomics experiments.

title: A constitutive interferon-high immunophenotype defines response to immunotherapy in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: To identify an immunophenotype associated with response to immune checkpoint inhibition (ICI) in metastatic deficient mismatch repair (dMMR) colorectal cancer (CRC) patients. The study reports that an interferon-high immunophenotype locally enriched in cytotoxic lymphocytes and antigen-presenting macrophages is required for response. CD74 abundance can identify the constitutive interferon-high immunophenotype determining clinical benefit in CRC, independently of tumor mutational burden or MMR status.

title: Intratumoral Collagen Deposition Supports Angiogenesis Suggesting Anti-angiogenic Therapy in Armored and Cold Tumors.
main_goals: This study analyzes the association between immuno-collagenic subtypes and angiogenesis across diverse cancer types, focusing on armored & cold tumors. It investigates the role of collagen in driving angiogenesis and responsiveness to anti-angiogenic therapy in LUAD.

title: Single cell approaches define neural stem cell niches and identify microglial ligands that can enhance precursor-mediated oligodendrogenesis.
biological_context: Mouse forebrain neural stem cell niche under homeostatic and injury conditions
data_modalities_used: ['single cell RNA sequencing', 'single cell spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: The study characterizes the forebrain neural stem cell (NSC) niche under homeostatic and injury conditions using single cell RNA sequencing and single cell spatial transcriptomics. It identifies remyelination-associated microglial ligands that promote precursor proliferation and oligodendrogenesis. The data support a model where gliogenesis versus neurogenesis is determined by the local NSC neighborhood.

title: An atlas of neuropathic pain-associated molecular pathological characteristics in the mouse spinal cord.
biological_context: Mouse spinal cord under neuropathic pain conditions
main_goals: The study aims to characterize regional pathological heterogeneity of the spinal cord under neuropathic pain conditions by integrating spatial transcriptomics with single-nucleus RNA-sequencing and bulk RNA-sequencing. It also aims to systematically exhibit "cross-talk omics" between DRG neurons and SC dorsal horn neurons and glial cells, indicating an altered communication profile under NP conditions. Ultimately, it provides a foundation for designing therapeutic targets for neuropathic pain.

title: Label-free nanoscopy of cell metabolism by ultrasensitive reweighted visible stimulated Raman scattering.
biological_context: Virus replication in host cells, Subcellular fatty acid synthesis in engineered bacteria
main_goals: The paper presents ultrasensitive reweighted visible stimulated Raman scattering (URV-SRS), a label-free vibrational imaging technique for multiplexed nanoscopy of intracellular metabolites. It developed a visible SRS microscope with extensive pulse chirping and introduced a self-supervised multi-agent denoiser. The method is validated by Fourier ring correlation, achieving a lateral resolution of 86 nm in cell imaging.

title: Distinct myeloid-derived suppressor cell populations in human glioblastoma.
main_goals: The study identifies two distinct MDSC populations in IDT-WT glioblastoma and reveals cross-talk between E-MDSCs and metabolic stem-like tumor cells in the pseudopalisading region. This interaction is absent in IDH-mutant gliomas. The study elucidates specific MDSCs that may facilitate glioblastoma progression and mediate tumor immunosuppression.

title: Unveiling the mechanism of micro-and-nano plastic phytotoxicity on terrestrial plants: A comprehensive review of omics approaches.
main_goals: This review synthesizes current findings regarding MNPs-induced phytotoxicity, emphasizing alterations in gene expression, protein synthesis, metabolic pathways, and physiological disruptions as revealed through omics analyses. It summarizes how MNPs interact with plant cellular structures, disrupt metabolic processes, and induce oxidative stress, ultimately affecting plant growth and productivity. The review also identifies critical knowledge gaps and proposes future research directions.

title: Spatiotemporal landscape of kidney in a mouse model of hyperuricemia at single-cell level.
main_goals: The paper investigates the spatiotemporal atlas of hyperuricemic nephropathy in a urate oxidase knockout mouse model using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and spatial metabolomics. The goal is to discover emerging targets and pathways related to uric acid excretion.

title: Resolving tissue complexity by multimodal spatial omics modeling with MISO.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Feature Extraction', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The paper introduces MISO (MultI-modal Spatial Omics), a versatile algorithm for feature extraction and clustering, designed for integrating multiple modalities from diverse spatial omics experiments. MISO aims to identify biologically relevant spatial domains and provide computational efficiency to handle large-scale datasets. It outperforms existing methods in identifying biologically relevant spatial domains.

title: Deciphering functional tumor-immune crosstalk through highly multiplexed imaging and deep visual proteomics.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed imaging', 'spatial proteomics', 'mass spectrometry', 'laser capture microdissection', 'single-cell analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces mipDVP, an advanced approach integrating highly multiplexed imaging, single-cell laser microdissection, and sensitive mass spectrometry to spatially profile the proteomes of distinct cell populations. It aims to decipher the complex cellular interplay within the tumor microenvironment, offering valuable insights for identifying immunotherapy targets and predictive signatures.

title: GMmorph: dynamic spatial matching registration model for 3D medical image based on gated Mamba.
biological_context: Normal brain, brain tumor, and lung images
main_goals: The paper proposes a dual-branch interactive registration model architecture for 3D medical image registration based on gated Mamba. It introduces a dynamic matching module and a detail enhancement module to improve registration accuracy and robustness. The model achieves state-of-the-art performance across multiple datasets in single-modal and multi-modal image registration.

title: Single-cell analysis reveals Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESX-1-mediated accumulation of permissive macrophages in infected mouse lungs.
biological_context: Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in mouse lungs
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB) ESX-1 in mononuclear phagocyte (MNP) heterogeneity and response in mice and murine bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMDM) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest that MTB ESX-1 facilitates the recruitment and differentiation of MNPs, which MTB can infect and manipulate for survival. The study identifies an ESX-1-dependent transcriptional signature of immune evasion in lung macrophages and BMDM, and reveals an up-regulation of permissive features within MTB lesions.

title: Elucidating stearoyl metabolism and NCOA4-mediated ferroptosis in gastric cancer liver metastasis through multi-omics single-cell integrative mendelian analysis: advancing personalized immunotherapy strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to enhance the understanding of the relationship between stearoyl metabolism and ferroptosis in promoting liver metastasis of gastric cancer and its role in the regulation of tumor heterogeneity. It also contributes to a deeper understanding of the dynamics of the gastric cancer tumor microenvironment (TME) and provides a basis for the development of better interventions to combat cancer metastasis.

title: New Multiomic Studies Shed Light on Cellular Diversity and Neuronal Susceptibility in Parkinson's Disease.
main_goals: This review discusses how recent multiomics studies, including spatial transcriptomics, epigenomics, and proteomics, are providing new insights into the pathogenic mechanisms of Parkinson's disease. It highlights the role of these approaches in uncovering neuronal vulnerability and prioritizing disease modifiers for therapeutics development.

title: Elucidating cardiomyocyte heterogeneity and maturation dynamics through integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to create a comprehensive atlas of the transcriptional profiles of distinct cardiomyocyte subsets in neonatal mouse hearts, elucidating a continuum of maturation states and mapping these states across various cardiac regions. It also aims to identify transitional CMs characterized by a specific transcriptional signature as a potential target for therapeutic strategies.

title: The relationship between fractional amplitude of low-frequency fluctuations (fALFF) and the severity of neglect in patients with unilateral spatial neglect (USN) after stroke: A functional near-infrared spectroscopy study.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the relationship between the fractional amplitude of low-frequency fluctuations (fALFF) in the right hemisphere of patients with post-stroke USN and the severity of neglect using resting-state functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) technology. The study found significant differences in fALFF values between USN and control groups in specific channels, and correlations between fALFF values and behavioral scores.

title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveal a distinct population of APOE<sup>-</sup> cells yielding pathological lymph node metastasis in papillary thyroid cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to identify intratumoral and antimetastatic heterogeneity of advanced PTC using single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. They identified a distinct APOE- tumor cell population associated with cervical metastasis and poor prognosis and established a machine learning-based scRNA-seq data, 13-gene signature predictive of lymph node metastasis. The functions of APOE in PTC cell proliferation and invasion were confirmed through in vivo and in vitro assays.

title: Metabolically activated and highly polyfunctional intratumoral VISTA<sup>+</sup> regulatory B cells are associated with tumor recurrence in early-stage NSCLC.
main_goals: This study explores the landscape of B cell phenotypes, bioenergetics, and their interaction with T cells in NSCLC using polychromatic flow cytometry, mass cytometry, and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest a potential interaction between Bregs and T cells through the VISTA-PSGL-1 axis, that could influence NSCLC recurrence.

title: High cellular plasticity state of medulloblastoma local recurrence and distant dissemination.
main_goals: The main goal of this paper is to characterize cellular diversity and genetic features of medulloblastoma recurrence and dissemination using single-cell and spatial omics approaches. They identified distinct cellular populations and chromosomal alterations during MB progression and a subpopulation termed "high cellular plasticity (HCP)" associated with recurrence. Inhibiting HCP-associated markers suppressed MB progression in preclinical models.

title: Characterizing tertiary lymphoid structures associated single-cell atlas in breast cancer patients.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate TLS associated regions in breast cancer at the single-cell level using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. They identified cell types within the TLS associated regions and analyzed cell-cell communication. They also validated these findings in four independent breast cancer datasets.

title: Robust collection and processing for label-free single voxel proteomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces wcSOP, an integrated wet collection and processing method for label-free single voxel proteomics. It enables reproducible quantification of proteins from single voxels and reveals spatially resolved protein signatures and region-specific signaling pathways. The method is applicable for different types of human archived tissues and for small-scale 2D proteome mapping.

title: Spatial metabolomics platform combining mass spectrometry imaging and in-depth chemical characterization with capillary electrophoresis.
main_goals: The paper describes a platform for spatial metabolomics combining mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) and surface sampling capillary electrophoresis mass spectrometry (SS-CE-MS) to gain both in-depth chemical information and spatial localization from thin tissue sections. It presents the workflow, including setup and switching between techniques, compares the obtained data, and demonstrates a quantitative approach when using the platform for spatial metabolomics of ischemic stroke.

title: Protocol for the isolation of silk glands from silkworms for snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper presents a protocol for isolating silk gland nuclei from silkworms and obtaining high-quality tissue slices for spatial transcriptomics. It details procedures for rearing, dissecting, nucleus isolation, embedding, frozen section, and RNA capturing and sequencing. The protocol enables the exploration of the spatial distribution of SG cells at single-cell resolution.

title: Unveiling patterns in spatial transcriptomics data: a novel approach utilizing graph attention autoencoder and multiscale deep subspace clustering network.
biological_context: Breast cancer tissues, adult mouse brain (FFPE), and mouse embryos
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Differential Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: The paper introduces STMSGAL, a novel framework for analyzing ST data by incorporating graph attention autoencoder and multiscale deep subspace clustering. STMSGAL constructs ctaSNN, integrates expression profiles and ctaSNN to generate spot latent representations, and implements spatial clustering, differential expression analysis, and trajectory inference. The method is evaluated against several existing methods using multiple spatial transcriptomics datasets.

title: Left superior cervical ganglia lymph node mimicry and its role in rat ventricular arrhythmias following myocardial infarction.
main_goals: The study investigates the role of left superior cervical ganglia (LSCG) remodeling in ventricular arrhythmias and cardiac inflammation post-myocardial infarction (MI) in rats. It aims to identify the mechanisms through which LSCG contributes to arrhythmogenesis and cardiac dysfunction, focusing on the neuro-immune crosstalk mediated by nerve growth factor (NGF). The ultimate goal is to explore the potential of targeting LSCG modification for cardiac protection and prevention of ventricular arrhythmias after MI.

title: Spatially resolved rewiring of mitochondria-lipid droplet interactions in hepatic lipid homeostasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the differences in lipid handling in response to nutrient deficiency and excess in hepatocytes using single-cell tissue imaging and spatial proteomics. It reveals extensive remodeling of lipid droplet (LD) and mitochondrial topology in response to dietary conditions and highlights the importance of organelle interactions in lipid metabolism.

title: Acquisition of discrete immune suppressive barriers contributes to the initiation and progression of preinvasive to invasive human lung cancer.
main_goals: The main goal was to construct a high-resolution map of the composition, lineage/functional states, developmental trajectories and multicellular crosstalk networks from microdissected non-solid and solid compartments of individual part-solid lung nodules. They aimed to uncover determinants of early disease emergence and progression in lung cancer.

title: Multiscale Cell-Cell Interactive Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The paper proposes a multiscale cell-cell interactive spatial transcriptomics (MCIST) analysis method that combines topological representations of cell-cell interactions with spatial deep learning. MCIST is validated by comparing it with 14 cutting-edge methods on 37 benchmark spatial transcriptomics datasets, showing superior performance in spatial domain detection. The method also offers multiscale insights with respect to trajectory inference, differentially expressed gene detection, and signaling pathway enrichment analysis.

title: Eosinophils Enhance Granuloma-Mediated Control of Persistent Salmonella Infection.
main_goals: To identify the host-protective role of eosinophils in controlling Salmonella Typhimurium infection within the mesenteric lymph nodes using a mouse model and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand how eosinophils contribute to the control of Salmonella exploitation of granuloma macrophages at a key site of bacterial persistence.

title: Cancer Research in the Age of Spatial Omics: Lessons from IMAXT.
main_goals: The IMAXT Cancer Grand Challenges team aimed to develop the "next generation" of pathology and cancer research by creating 3D molecularly annotated maps of tumors using single-cell and spatial omics tools. The team's activities fostered a spatial revolution in biology, enabling investigations into tumor heterogeneity and the tumor microenvironment.

title: Visualizing Cancer Heterogeneity at the Molecular and Cellular Levels: Lessons from Rosetta.
main_goals: The Rosetta team addressed the Cancer Grand Challenges by using spatial-omics approaches centered around mass spectrometry imaging to map tumor heterogeneity at the cellular and molecular scales with different levels of resolution.

title: Deep learning in integrating spatial transcriptomics with other modalities.
main_goals: This study systematically reviews the applications of deep learning in integrating spatial transcriptomics data with other modalities. It delineates DL techniques, key tasks, integration strategies, and discusses challenges and future directions.

title: Investigating lung cancer microenvironment from cell segmentation of pathological image and its application in prognostic stratification.
main_goals: The study aims to improve lung adenocarcinoma prognostic stratification by analyzing cellular abundance from pathological images using Hover-Net. They investigated the clinical and biological significance of epithelial cells, lymphocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils infiltration. The research identifies FABP7 as a prognostic biomarker based on neutrophil infiltration.

title: Supervised analysis of alternative polyadenylation from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data with spvAPA.
main_goals: The paper proposes spvAPA, a supervised analytical framework for APA analysis from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It designs an iterative imputation method to recover missing APA signatures and a supervised feature selection method to identify APA features distinguishing cell types or spatial morphologies. spvAPA also improves the visualization of high-dimensional data for discovering novel cell subtypes.

title: A spatiotemporal and machine-learning platform facilitates the manufacturing of hPSC-derived esophageal mucosa.
main_goals: The study aims to generate a spatiotemporal multi-omics cell census for human esophageal development, identify cellular diversity, dynamics, and signal communications, and prioritize combinations of candidate human developmental signals for in vitro derivation of esophageal basal cells using a machine-learning algorithm called Manatee. It also aims to create a clinically compatible system for manufacturing human esophageal mucosa.

title: Spatial Genomics Identifies Heat Shock Proteins as Key Molecular Changes Associated to Adipose Periprostatic Space Invasion in Prostate Cancer.
main_goals: To identify molecular changes during PCa invasion of adipose space using Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling of PCa cells. The study focuses on the differential gene expression in PCa cells from the adipose periprostatic space.

title: Genome-Wide Identification and Expression Analysis of Amino Acid/Auxin Permease (AAAP) Genes in Grapes (Vitis vinifera L.) Under Abiotic Stress and During Development.
main_goals: The study aims to identify and analyze the Amino acid/auxin permease (AAAP) gene family in grapes, focusing on their response to abiotic stress and their expression patterns during development. The research involves genome-wide identification, phylogenetic analysis, and expression profiling of VvAAAP genes.

title: Spatial transcriptomic characterization of a Carnegie stage 7 human embryo.
main_goals: The study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze a Carnegie stage 7 human embryo at single-cell resolution. It reveals early specification of mesoderm subtypes, presence of anterior visceral endoderm, location of primordial germ cells, and haematopoietic stem cell-independent haematopoiesis. The study provides a valuable dataset for future research.

title: Combined analysis of bulk, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics reveals the expression patterns of lipid metabolism and ferroptosis in the immune microenvironment of metabolic-associated fatty liver disease.
main_goals: This study aims to identify key biomarkers associated with ferroptosis and lipid metabolism in MAFLD. It explores interactions between these biomarkers and the immune-infiltration environment and provides insights into disease mechanisms. The analyses were integrated into a risk assessment system and predictive model and validated through in vivo experiments.

title: Transcriptional determinants of goal-directed learning and representational drift in the parahippocampal cortex.
biological_context: Mouse perirhinal cortex during task learning
main_goals: The study investigates the circuit and molecular mechanisms underlying representational drift in the perirhinal cortex during task learning. They identify an IEG-defined network involved in stimulus-outcome associations and show that BDNF is crucial for task learning and IEG expression. The findings reveal cell types and molecules regulating long-term network stability permissive for task learning and memory allocation.

title: The role of histone lactylation genes in hepatocellular carcinoma prognostic models and their immune cell infiltration features: a comprehensive analysis of single-cell, spatial transcriptome, Mendelian randomization and experiment.
main_goals: The study aims to construct and validate a prognostic model for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using differentially expressed histone lysine lactylation (Kla) genes. They integrated single-cell analysis, spatial transcriptomics, Mendelian randomization, and experimental validation to explore the role of Kla-related genes in HCC prognosis and immune cell infiltration. The established model may provide new strategies and insights for the treatment and diagnosis of HCC.

title: Lessons learned from spatial transcriptomic analyses in clear-cell renal cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This review summarizes insights gained from spatial transcriptomics studies in clear-cell renal cell carcinoma, focusing on spatial interactions within the tumor microenvironment, metabolic heterogeneity, and T cell infiltration. It highlights the potential of spatial transcriptomics to reveal predictive spatial features for biomarker development.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling revealed niche interactions sustaining growth of endometriotic lesions.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying endometriosis by performing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling of ectopic lesions and eutopic endometrium. They identified distinct cell populations and signaling pathways contributing to the pathogenesis of endometriosis, offering novel targets for therapeutic intervention.

title: Brain aging and rejuvenation at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: This review summarizes the insights gained from single-cell omics studies of brain aging, focusing on cell-type-centric changes and cell-cell interactions. It highlights the use of single-cell omics for studying rejuvenation interventions and proposes new directions, including models of brain aging and neural stem cells as a target for rejuvenation.

title: Spatial metabolomics and feature-based molecular networking to unveiling in-situ quality markers landscape and reflecting geographic origins of pomegranate seeds.
data_modalities_used: ['Spectrometry, Mass, Electrospray Ionization', 'Chromatography, High Pressure Liquid']
main_goals: This research introduces a method integrating ultra performance liquid chromatography-quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry with feature-based molecular networking, and desorption electrospray ionization-mass spectrometry imaging to identify components and locate in-situ images of quality markers via spatial metabolomics analysis. The developed method screens food quality markers based on activity and spatial characteristics, providing insights into food quality evaluation.

title: Spatial omics shed light on the tumour organisation of glioblastoma.
main_goals: This review explores spatial omics technologies and how they have contributed to the development of a model outlining the architecture of the glioblastoma tumour microenvironment. Understanding this organisation is crucial for the development of new therapeutics and novel diagnostic tools that guide patient care.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals significant differences in tumor microenvironment in HPV-dependent and HPV-independent vulvar squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to explore gene expression in HPV-dependent and HPV-independent VSCC. It aims to identify differences in the tumor microenvironment between the two etiologies. The study identifies more immune cells in HPVi SCC than in HPVd SCC.

title: Tigulixostat Alleviates Hyperuricemic Nephropathy by Promoting M2 Macrophage Polarization.
biological_context: Hyperuricemic nephropathy in Uox-KO mouse model
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of Tigulixostat on uric acid levels and hyperuricemic nephropathy (HN) in a Uox-KO mouse model using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial metabolomics, plasma metabolomics, and flow cytometry. The findings suggest Tigulixostat as a promising therapeutic option for managing hyperuricemia and related kidney conditions.

title: Deciphering progressive lesion areas in breast cancer spatial transcriptomics via TGR-NMF.
main_goals: This study develops the three graph regularized non-negative matrix factorization (TGR-NMF) to decipher disease progression-related spatial domains in breast cancer spatial transcriptomics. A unitization strategy was proposed to mitigate the impact of dropout events. The progressive lesion area that can reveal the progression of breast cancer was uncovered through heterogeneity analysis.

title: Society for Immunotherapy of Cancer: updates and best practices for multiplex immunohistochemistry (IHC) and immunofluorescence (IF) image analysis and data sharing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['image acquisition', 'color deconvolution', 'spectral unmixing', 'tissue segmentation', 'cell segmentation', 'phenotyping', 'algorithm verification', 'batch correction']
main_goals: This paper provides best practice guidelines for the quantitative image analysis of multiplex immunohistochemistry and immunofluorescence (mIHC/IF) output and data management considerations. It reviews best-practice approaches for image acquisition, color deconvolution and spectral unmixing, tissue and cell segmentation, phenotyping, and algorithm verification. The guidelines aim to standardize image analysis on mIHC/IF-stained slides to contribute to more comparable results across laboratories.

title: Unraveling the specialized metabolic pathways in medicinal plant genomes: a review.
main_goals: This review highlights recent progress in omics-based research on medicinal plants, discusses available bioinformatics tools, and explores future research trends aimed at leveraging integrated multi-omics to improve the medicinal quality and sustainable utilization of plant resources.

title: PCA-based spatial domain identification with state-of-the-art performance.
main_goals: The paper introduces NichePCA, a PCA-based algorithm for unsupervised spatial domain identification in spatial transcriptomics data. It demonstrates that NichePCA rivals the performance of ten competing state-of-the-art methods across six single-cell spatial transcriptomic datasets. The algorithm is presented as intuitive, fast, robust, and scalable.

title: Metabolic Atlas of Human Eyelid Infiltrative Basal Cell Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aims to analyze metabolic differences among iBCC cell types using single-cell and spatial metabolomics analysis and to examine metabolic environment at the tumor invasive area. It establishes a metabolic microenvironment atlas of iBCC, revealing significant metabolic differences and the dominance of lipid and lysosome metabolism. It also identifies potential metabolic markers and characteristic substances in the invasive area, offering new insights for immunotherapy and the exploration of BCC's metabolic mechanisms.

title: Microscopy and spatial-metabolomics identify tissue-specific metabolic pathways uncovering salinity and drought tolerance mechanisms in Avicennia marina and Phoenix dactylifera roots.
biological_context: Avicennia marina and Phoenix dactylifera roots under salinity and drought stress
main_goals: The study aims to uncover shared and distinct adaptive metabolic features in date palm and mangrove roots under salinity and drought stress by integrating tissue imaging with spatial metabolomics (MALDI-MSI). It identifies tissue- and species-specific metabolite distributions and key metabolites involved in stress adaptation pathways.

title: Geospatial modeling of near subsurface temperatures of the contiguous United States for assessment of materials degradation.
main_goals: This study compares subsurface temperature prediction models across the contiguous United States. It evaluates linear interpolation, gradient boosting (LightGBM), neural networks, and a novel hybrid approach.

title: Multi-omics-based mapping of decidualization resistance in patients with a history of severe preeclampsia.
main_goals: The study aims to unravel the cellular and molecular characteristics of decidualization resistance (DR) in patients who have suffered severe preeclampsia (sPE) using a multi-omic strategy. It identifies shifts in cell composition, aberrant cell-cell communication, and disrupted responses to steroid hormones in the endometrium of sPE patients.

title: Antibody-based delivery of interleukin-2 modulates the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment and achieves cure in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma syngeneic mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the preclinical efficacy of L19-IL2, an innovative targeted therapy based on antibody-cytokine fusion proteins. The fusion protein demonstrated potent anti-tumor activity in mice with pancreatic tumors resistant to standard chemotherapy, enhancing immune infiltration and cytotoxicity, remodeling the tumor microenvironment. The results pave the way for novel targeted treatment strategies in PDAC.

title: Lung endothelial cell heterogeneity in health and pulmonary vascular disease.
biological_context: Lung endothelial cells in health and pulmonary vascular disease
main_goals: This mini-review explores the understanding of lung EC heterogeneity, particularly through single-cell RNA sequencing technologies. It highlights the diverse EC subpopulations, their specific roles, and their contribution to pulmonary hypertension pathogenesis. It also mentions emerging techniques like single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics and their role in discovering novel disease mediators.

title: Subthreshold repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation induces cortical layer-, brain region-, and protocol-dependent neural plasticity.
main_goals: The study aims to determine the molecular mechanisms of rTMS and the brain regions they occur in by mapping changes to gene expression across the mouse brain in response to two rTMS protocols using spatial transcriptomics. The results reveal that rTMS alters the expression of genes related to several cellular processes and neural plasticity mechanisms across the brain in a brain region- and protocol-dependent manner, especially in the cortex.

title: Enhancing Time Series Anomaly Detection: A Knowledge Distillation Approach with Image Transformation.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel framework for time series anomaly detection by bridging image anomaly detection with time series data. It converts time series into images using Gramian Angular Field (GAF) transformations and applies state-of-the-art techniques, Reverse Distillation (RD) and EfficientAD (EAD). The framework's effectiveness is validated on various datasets.

title: Self-Supervised and Zero-Shot Learning in Multi-Modal Raman Light Sheet Microscopy.
main_goals: The study offers a comparative evaluation of zero-shot and self-supervised learning methods, evaluating their effectiveness in denoising, resolution enhancement, and preserving biological structures in multi-modal Raman light sheet microscopic images. The goal is to enhance image quality without the need for labeled and large datasets. The study aims to provide a reliable solution for visualizing complex biological systems.

title: Robust and Fast Point Cloud Registration for Robot Localization Based on DBSCAN Clustering and Adaptive Segmentation.
main_goals: The paper introduces Clustering and Segmentation Normal Distribution Transform (CSNDT) for point cloud registration. It improves upon traditional Normal Distribution Transform (NDT) algorithms by incorporating a DBSCAN-based clustering mechanism and adaptive cell partitioning. The CSNDT algorithm aims to enhance robustness, precision, and efficiency in point cloud registration for robot localization.

title: Harnessing Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics for Crop Improvement.
main_goals: This review presents an update on the application of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics technologies in crop improvement. It highlights significant findings from recent studies, discusses the expanding roles of these technologies, and explores future opportunities for their application in crop improvement.

title: 6-Aza-2-Thiothymine as an Alternative Matrix for Spatial Proteomics with MALDI-MSI.
main_goals: This study evaluates the capability of 6-aza-2-thiothymine (ATT) to ionise tryptic peptides and map in situ-digested peptides from formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue sections using MALDI-MSI. Comparative analysis with CHCA demonstrates the complementary strengths of these matrices for detecting tryptic peptides, establishing ATT as a feasible alternative to CHCA in the MALDI-MSI field.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Multi-Omics Analysis Reveal That Targeting JAG1 in Epithelial Cells Reduces Periodontal Inflammation and Alveolar Bone Loss.
main_goals: This study aims to compare the cellular mechanisms involved in periodontitis between humans and mice using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and spatial proteomics. It identifies key conserved and divergent features in cellular landscapes and transcriptional profiles across the two species and reveals a novel regulatory mechanism by which epithelial cells modulate macrophage behavior and inflammation through the JAG1-Notch pathway. The study validates that JAG1 inhibition reduces inflammation in epithelial cells, mitigating periodontitis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics, Proteomics, and Epigenomics as Tools in Tissue Engineering and Regenerative Medicine.
main_goals: This review paper discusses spatial transcriptomics, proteomics, and epigenomics technologies and their applications in tissue engineering and regenerative medicine. It highlights the strengths and limitations of each technique and emphasizes the potential of combining them for a comprehensive understanding of cell function and tissue organization.

title: Genome-Wide Identification and Evolutionary Analysis of Functional BBM-like Genes in Plant Species.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the structural and functional evolutionary history of BBM genes in plants. It identifies and analyzes BBML proteins from various plant species, focusing on phylogenetic relationships, gene duplication events, and expression patterns.

title: Identification of Environmental Factors Influencing the Population of Endangered Epilobium hirsutum L. in Korea.
main_goals: The study aimed to evaluate the environmental characteristics of E. hirsutum habitats and identify key environmental factors influencing the population size using field surveys and spatial data analysis.

title: STMGraph: spatial-context-aware of transcriptomes via a dual-remasked dynamic graph attention model.
main_goals: The paper introduces STMGraph, a dual-view dynamic deep learning framework for spatial transcriptomics data analysis. It combines dual-remask with a dynamic graph attention model to improve accuracy and robustness in spatial domain clustering, batch-effects correction, and microenvironmental heterogeneity detection. Systematic benchmarking shows superior performance compared to other tools.

title: Identifying cell-type-specific spatially variable genes with ctSVG.
main_goals: The paper introduces ctSVG, a computational method for identifying cell-type-specific spatially variable genes (SVGs) in Visium HD spatial transcriptomics data. ctSVG assigns Visium squares to cells and identifies cell-type-specific SVGs that reveal important biological functions. The identified SVGs do not overlap with sample-wide SVGs or cell-type marker genes.

title: Same-Slide Spatial Multi-Omics Integration Reveals Tumor Virus-Linked Spatial Reorganization of the Tumor Microenvironment.
biological_context: Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV)-positive and EBV-negative diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Single-cell phenotyping']
main_goals: The paper introduces IN-DEPTH, a streamlined and resource-effective approach for same-slide spatial multi-omics. It also introduces k-bandlimited Spectral Graph Cross-Correlation (SGCC) for integrative spatial multi-omics analysis. The method is applied to dissect the tumor microenvironment of EBV-positive and EBV-negative DLBCL.

title: Detecting Clinically Relevant Topological Structures in Multiplexed Spatial Proteomics Imaging Using TopKAT.
main_goals: The paper introduces TopKAT, a topology-based approach that combines persistent homology with kernel testing to determine if topological structures created by cells predict clinical endpoints. The method aims to robustly characterize the geometry of the spatial arrangement of cells and yield a valid and powerful test for association with patient-level outcomes. TopKAT is demonstrated on triple negative breast cancer studies, showing its ability to recover clinically relevant topological structures in the spatial distribution of immune and tumor cells.

title: Cellular cartography reveals mouse prostate organization and determinants of castration resistance.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell RNA sequencing, single-cell multiomics, and spatial transcriptomics to define the cellular basis of cell identity and castration response in the mouse prostate. It aims to identify cellular orthologs and key determinants of ADT response and resistance by leveraging these data along with a meta-analysis of human prostates and prostate cancer. The findings reveal lobe-specific luminal epithelial cell types and androgen-insensitive stem-like epithelial populations, as well as castration-resistant luminal epithelial cells activating stress-responsive and stemness programs.

title: Interleukin-1β Drives Disease Progression in Arrhythmogenic Cardiomyopathy.
main_goals: The study aims to identify disease-associated spatial niches in ACM and investigate the role of interleukin-1β (IL-1β) in disease progression. By performing snRNAseq and spatial transcriptomics on myocardial samples, the researchers identified inflammatory-fibrotic niches and found that targeting IL-1β attenuates fibrosis, reduces inflammation, and preserves cardiac function in a mouse model of ACM. These findings suggest that targeting IL-1β may improve outcomes for patients with ACM.

title: sc-SPLASH provides ultra-efficient reference-free discovery in barcoded single-cell sequencing.
main_goals: The paper introduces sc-SPLASH, a highly efficient pipeline for reference-free discovery in barcoded scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data. It extends the SPLASH framework to barcoded single-cell sequencing (10x Chromium) and spatial transcriptomics (10x Visium). The pipeline rediscovering known biology and uncovering novel biological findings, including sequences missing from reference genomes.

title: Dendritic cells type 1 control the formation, maintenance, and function of tertiary lymphoid structures in cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and other human tumors
main_goals: The study investigates the role of dendritic cells (DC), specifically conventional DC type 1 (cDC1), in the formation, maintenance, and function of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) in solid tumors, focusing on NSCLC. It identifies cDC1's importance in antigen presentation and CD40 signaling for TLS maintenance and antitumor immunity. The findings suggest cDC1-targeting therapies as a strategy to enhance TLS function and improve anti-tumor immunity.

title: Comparison of imaging-based single-cell resolution spatial transcriptomics profiling platforms using formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor samples.
biological_context: Lung adenocarcinoma and pleural mesothelioma tumor samples
data_modalities_used: ['CosMx', 'MERFISH', 'Xenium', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler', 'hematoxylin and eosin staining', 'formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded samples']
main_goals: This study compares the performance of single cell ST platforms CosMx, MERFISH, and Xenium using formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded lung adenocarcinoma and pleural mesothelioma tumor samples. The comparison is made in reference to bulk RNA sequencing, multiplex immunofluorescence, GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler, and hematoxylin and eosin staining data. The study aims to detail the differences between the ST platforms and suggest reliable workflows for accurate spatial profiling and molecular discovery.

title: Molecular and spatial analysis of ganglion cells on retinal flatmounts: diversity, topography, and perivascularity.
main_goals: The study investigates the spatial organization of retinal ganglion cell (RGC) types in the mouse retina using MERFISH and immunohistochemistry. It identifies non-uniform distributions of RGC types and the existence of perivascular RGCs, showing preferential survival after optic nerve crush. The findings suggest a potential neuroprotective role of proximity to blood vessels for specific RGC types.

title: Randomized Spatial PCA (RASP): a computationally efficient method for dimensionality reduction of high-resolution spatial transcriptomics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Denoising', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: Introduces Randomized Spatial PCA (RASP), a novel spatially aware dimensionality reduction method for spatial transcriptomics (ST) data. RASP aims to be faster than existing techniques, scale to large ST datasets, integrate non-transcriptomic covariates, and enable reconstruction of de-noised and spatially smoothed expression values. The method is compared against other domain detection methods.

title: UCS: A Unified Approach to Cell Segmentation for Subcellular Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study proposes a unified approach to cell segmentation (UCS) specifically designed for SST data obtained from diverse platforms. UCS leverages deep learning techniques to achieve high accuracy in cell segmentation by integrating nuclei segmentation from nuclei staining and transcript data. The analysis output of UCS further supports versatile downstream analyses, such as subcellular gene classification and missing cell detection.

title: Multimodal transcriptomics reveal neurogenic aging trajectories and age-related regional inflammation in the dentate gyrus.
main_goals: Characterize transcriptomic signatures of neurogenic cells and their surrounding DG niche, identifying molecular changes associated with neurogenic aging. Identify the regional invasion of inflammatory cells into the hippocampus with age and show that early-onset neuroinflammation decreases neurogenic activity. Reveal the lifelong molecular dynamics of NSCs and their surrounding neurogenic DG niche with age.

title: Spatial transcriptomics unveils estrogen-modulated immune responses and structural alterations in the ectocervical mucosa of depot medroxyprogesterone acetate users.
biological_context: Ectocervical tissue from Kenyan sex workers
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to reveal the spatial localization of altered molecular markers in the ectocervical tissue of DMPA users. It identifies estrogen-modulated distinct ectocervical transcriptional profiles associated with DMPA usage and highlights spatially restricted activation of innate immune responses and dysregulation of barrier integrity markers.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics: Biotechnologies, Computational Tools, and Neuroscience Applications.
biological_context: Brain development, neurodegenerative diseases, neuropsychiatric disorders, brain tumors
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Cell type annotation', 'Spatial Clustering', 'Detection of spatially variable genes', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', '3D multi-slices integration']
main_goals: This review aims to elucidate advancements in spatial transcriptomics (ST) technologies, their computational tools, and their pivotal applications in neuroscience. It covers the evolution of ST techniques, computational methods for ST data analysis, and the application of ST in understanding the brain's complexity, particularly in brain atlas projects, brain development, neuroimmune dysfunctions, and neurodegenerative diseases.

title: Microglial Responses to Alzheimer's Disease Pathology: Insights From "Omics" Studies.
main_goals: This review summarizes the knowledge generated by applying omics technologies (including transcriptomics, epigenomics, spatial transcriptomics, proteomics, lipidomics, and metabolomics) to mouse models of Alzheimer's disease. It discusses the approaches and findings of these methods and provides a synthesis of the information obtained.

title: Development and Validation of the Immediate Postpartum Care Adherence Questionnaire: An Application of the Theory of Planned Behavior among Healthcare Professionals.
main_goals: The study aimed to develop and validate the Immediate Postpartum Care Adherence Questionnaire (IPCAQ) for assessing healthcare professionals' adherence to WHO guidelines. The IPCAQ was developed based on the Theory of Planned Behavior and psychometrically evaluated for reliability and validity. The goal is to provide a tool for identifying factors influencing adherence to standardized care and facilitating high-quality postpartum care.

title: Spatially-resolved analyses of muscle invasive bladder cancer microenvironment unveil a distinct fibroblast cluster associated with prognosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses imaging mass cytometry (IMC) and single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to assess the spatial heterogeneity of the MIBC microenvironment. They identified a distinct fibroblast cluster associated with poor prognosis. The study also identified potential L-R pairs involved in fibroblast-endothelial cell interactions.

title: Acquisition and transcriptomic analysis of tissue micro-regions using a capillary-based method.
main_goals: The paper introduces an efficient capillary-based microdissection system (CMS) for isolating tissue micro-regions of interest (mROIs) for spatial transcriptomics. The CMS-seq method is applied to uncover spatial heterogeneity in the cortex and hippocampus of a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease. Results demonstrate that CMS-seq can profile spatial transcriptomes in tissue sections.

title: Feasibility study of hyperspectral colposcopy as a novel tool for detecting precancerous cervical lesions.
main_goals: This study proposes the use of Hyperspectral Imaging for detecting precancerous cervical lesions. A custom-designed hyperspectral colposcope was used on 62 patients, and the gathered data underwent a PCA-based preprocessing workflow for unsupervised segmentation. Subsequent statistical analysis highlighted the ability to detect differences and alterations in the cervical tissue.

title: Exploring the Molecular Mechanisms of Fisetin in Treating Periodontitis Through Multiomics and Network Pharmacology.
main_goals: To investigate the therapeutic effects of fisetin in treating periodontitis using network pharmacology, animal models, in vitro experiments, and single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify key cell populations affected by fisetin and validate its potential as a therapeutic agent for periodontitis.

title: Inferring multi-slice spatially resolved gene expression from H&E-stained histology images with STMCL.
main_goals: This paper proposes STMCL, a multimodal contrastive learning framework for inferring spatial gene expression from H&E-stained histology images. It integrates multimodal information (histology images, gene expression features, locations) to improve accuracy. The method is tested on multi-slice spatial transcriptomics datasets and demonstrates advantages over baseline methods.

title: SMORE: spatial motifs reveal patterns in cellular architecture of complex tissues.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces SMORE, an approach to detect patterns in sequential arrangements of cells and examine their associated gene expression specializations. It identifies novel spatial motifs in retina, brain, and embryonic tissue maps. The method provides a framework for uncovering spatial complexity in tissue organization and offers insights into tissue function.

title: Downscaling of ERA5 reanalysis land surface temperature based on attention mechanism and Google Earth Engine.
main_goals: The study proposes an Attention Mechanism U-Net (AMUN) method, which combines data acquisition and preprocessing on the Google Earth Engine (GEE) cloud computing platform, to downscale the hourly monthly mean reanalysis LST data of ERA5-Land across China's territory from 0.1° to 0.01°. The method comprehensively considers the relationship between the LST and surface features, organically combining multiple deep learning modules, includes the Global Multi-Factor Cross-Attention (GMFCA) module, the Feature Fusion Residual Dense Block (FFRDB) connection module, and the U-Net module. The downscaling method proposed in this study can effectively improve the accuracy of ERA5-Land LST downscaling.

title: Sequential MALDI-HiPLEX-IHC and Untargeted Spatial Proteomics Mass Spectrometry Imaging to Detect Proteomic Alterations Associated with Tumour Infiltrating Lymphocytes.
main_goals: This study presents a novel workflow combining MALDI-HiPLEX-IHC with untargeted spatial proteomics to analyze a single FFPE tissue section. It highlights the need for an additional antigen retrieval step and demonstrates the potential of this workflow to map and characterize the molecular environment of tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes.

title: Embracing diversity: macrophage complexity in cancer.
main_goals: This review aims to examine the diversity of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) by considering both single-cell phenotypes and complex physiological signals that influence their complexity and plasticity within tumors. It highlights the longitudinal and local heterogeneity of TAM states, made possible by single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.

title: BACT: nonparametric Bayesian cell typing for single-cell spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper presents a nonparametric Bayesian model BACT for cell typing using gene expression and spatial coordinates. BACT incorporates a nonparametric Potts prior to induce spatial dependency and automatically learns the cell type number from the data. It is evaluated on single-cell spatial transcriptomic datasets and shows better performance than competing methods.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in breast cancer: providing insight into tumor heterogeneity and promoting individualized therapy.
main_goals: This article summarizes the key technical approaches, recent advances in spatial transcriptomics and its applications in breast cancer, and discusses the limitations of current spatial transcriptomics methods and the prospects for future development, with a view to advancing the application of this technology in clinical practice.

title: Spatiotemporal dynamics of early oogenesis in pigs.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to understand spatial-temporal gene expression profiles and explore the spatial organization of ovarian microenvironments during early oogenesis in pigs. The work provides insight into the spatial characteristics of early oogenesis and the regulatory role of ovarian microenvironments in germ cell fate within a spatial context. The study also highlights the utility of pigs as valuable models for studying human oogenesis in a spatial context.

title: Gait-based Parkinson's disease diagnosis and severity classification using force sensors and machine learning.
main_goals: The study proposes a dual-stage model for classifying Parkinson's disease severity using force sensors and machine learning. It utilizes a hypertuned Random Forest Tree (RFT) to classify subjects into PD and non-PD classes and a hypertuned Ensemble Regressor (ER) to predict the severity of the illness. The model's performance is evaluated using accuracy, mean absolute error, and root mean square error.

title: Molecular and spatial analysis of tertiary lymphoid structures in Sjogren's syndrome.
main_goals: The study aims to construct a cellular and spatial map of key components involved in the formation and function of tertiary lymphoid structures in Sjogren's disease by combining single-cell RNA-sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and proteomics. It identifies a fibroblast cell state and a pericyte/mural cell state with potential immunological functions, which may provide therapeutic cues for tertiary lymphoid structure-associated conditions in autoimmunity and cancer.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of healthy and fibrotic human liver at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The study aims to map the spatial organization of cells in healthy and fibrotic human livers at single-cell resolution using MERFISH and snRNA-seq. It investigates the zonal distribution of hepatocytes, subsets of macrophages and mesenchymal populations, and the relationship between hepatocyte ploidy and gene expression. The study also identifies hepatocyte populations that expand with injury and lack zonal distributions in fibrotic livers.

title: Generative adversarial synthetic neighbors-based unsupervised anomaly detection.
main_goals: The paper introduces a Generative Adversarial Synthetic Neighbors-based Unsupervised Anomaly Detection (GASN) method. It aims to enhance anomaly detection performance through a two-stage detection process that integrates generative adversarial networks and neighborhood analysis techniques. The method is tested on twelve public datasets, demonstrating improved AUC compared to other methods.

title: diaTracer enables spectrum-centric analysis of diaPASEF proteomics data.
biological_context: Triple-negative breast cancer, cerebrospinal fluid, plasma samples, phosphoproteomics, human leukocyte antigens immunopeptidomics, spatial proteomics study
main_goals: The paper introduces diaTracer, a spectrum-centric computational tool optimized for diaPASEF data. It performs three-dimensional peak tracing and feature detection to generate precursor-resolved pseudo-tandem mass spectra, facilitating direct peptide identification and quantification from diaPASEF data. diaTracer is available as a stand-alone tool and is fully integrated into the FragPipe computational platform.

title: Universal, untargeted detection of bacteria in tissues using metabolomics workflows.
biological_context: Healthy and cancerous gastrointestinal tissues as well as faecal samples
main_goals: The paper describes a biomarker-based strategy for direct detection of bacteria in complex samples using mass spectrometry. It utilizes bacterial small molecular metabolites and lipids. A spectral metabolic library of 233 bacterial species is mined for taxon-specific markers (TSMs) and applied to in situ detection of bacteria in gastrointestinal tissues and faecal samples.

title: Spatial Organization of Macrophages in CTL-Rich Hepatocellular Carcinoma Influences CTL Antitumor Activity.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed in situ staining', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial immune variations in CTL-rich HCCs to understand heterogeneous clinical outcomes. It identifies macrophage aggregation as a distinctive spatial pattern associated with an immunosuppressive microenvironment and poor prognosis. The findings suggest that the spatial distribution of macrophages is a biomarker of their functional diversities and microenvironment status.

title: Lineage Recording in Human Brain Organoids with iTracer.
main_goals: This paper provides a detailed protocol for applying iTracer, a lineage recorder, to study clonality and lineage dynamics during brain organoid development. iTracer combines reporter barcodes with inducible CRISPR-Cas9 scarring and is compatible with single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It can be adapted to any iPSC-derived culture system to dissect lineage dynamics.

title: Spatial Genomic Approaches to Investigate HOX Genes in Mouse Brain Tissues.
main_goals: The paper presents a bioinformatics protocol for whole transcriptome gene expression analysis of mouse brain tissue using Curio. Specifically, it demonstrates using computational techniques to visualize expression patterns of various HOX genes in the mouse brain.

title: Single-cell spatial proteomics.
main_goals: This review examines cutting-edge single-cell spatial proteomics technologies, focusing on mass spectrometry (MS) imaging and multiplexed immunofluorescence (mIF). It assesses current challenges associated with these methodologies and discusses potential solutions. The integration of spatial proteomics with other systems biology approaches holds great promise for enhancing our understanding of complex biological systems.

title: Aspartate signalling drives lung metastasis via alternative translation.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate how nutrients in organs where tumors metastasize confer aggressive traits to cancer cells. They found that pulmonary aspartate triggers a signaling cascade in disseminated cancer cells, leading to a translational program that increases the aggressiveness of lung metastases. The mechanism involves N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor activation, DOHH expression, eIF5A hypusination, and TGFβ signaling to promote collagen synthesis.

title: Functional diversity of cardiac macrophages in health and disease.
biological_context: Cardiac macrophages in health and disease
main_goals: This review discusses the developmental origin of cardiac macrophages, describes newly identified cell states and associated cellular neighborhoods in steady state and injury settings, and discusses various contributions and effector functions of cardiac macrophages in homeostasis and disease.

title: Genetically Engineered Mouse Models for Alzheimer Disease and Frontotemporal Dementia: New Insights from Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: This article focuses on the mouse models of Alzheimer disease and closely related frontotemporal dementia, particularly the ones that have provided most valuable knowledge, or are in a trajectory of doing so. More importantly, some of the major findings from these models are summarized, based on the recent single-cell transcriptomics, multiomics, and spatial transcriptomics studies. While no model is perfect, it is hoped that the new insights from these models and the practical use of these models will continue to help to establish a path forward.

title: Multi-omics approach reveals TGF-β signaling-driven senescence in periodontium stem cells.
biological_context: Periodontal ligament stem cells (PDLSCs) in murine jawbone tissues and human PDLSCs
main_goals: This study aims to clarify the role of TGF-β1 in PDLSC senescence and identify the underlying molecular mechanisms. The study presents the first spatially resolved transcriptomic landscape of murine jawbone tissues and uncovers DNA methylation as a crucial mechanism underlying TGF-β1-induced PDLSC senescence. These findings illuminate a previously unrecognized link between TGF-β1 signaling, ROS production, and epigenetic regulation.

title: Global organelle profiling reveals subcellular localization and remodeling at proteome scale.
biological_context: Cell-wide collection of membranous and membraneless compartments, HCoV-OC43 viral infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The paper presents a high-resolution strategy to map subcellular organization using organelle immunocapture coupled to mass spectrometry. It assigns the subcellular localization of over 7,600 proteins, defines spatial networks, and uncovers interconnections between cellular compartments. The approach is used to profile proteome remodeling during HCoV-OC43 viral infection, revealing that proteins are regulated by spatial distribution changes rather than abundance.

title: A spatially resolved multi-omic single-cell atlas of soybean development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The study created a spatially resolved single-cell atlas of gene expression and chromatin accessibility across ten soybean tissues. They identified cell types, accessible chromatin regions, and transcription factor motifs defining cell identities. They also explored gene regulatory networks underpinning legume symbiotic nitrogen fixation and identified key regulators during embryogenesis.

title: Determination and visualization of moisture content in Camellia oleifera seeds rapidly based on hyperspectral imaging combined with deep learning.
main_goals: The study investigates the feasibility of detecting moisture content (MC) in Camellia oleifera seeds using visible near-infrared hyperspectral imaging (VNIR-HSI) coupled with deep learning (DL) methods. It proposes a method utilizing particle swarm optimization (PSO) to search for the optimal hyperparameters in the convolutional neural network regression (CNNR) model. The study aims to provide a reliable and efficient approach for non-destructive detection and visualization of MC in Camellia oleifera seeds.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in bone mechanomics: Exploring the mechanoregulation of fracture healing in the era of spatial omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The paper introduces a spatial transcriptomics-based "mechanomics" platform that integrates time-lapsed in vivo micro-computed tomography, spatial transcriptomics, and micro-finite element analysis for spatially resolved analysis of molecular profiles of cells in relation to their in vivo mechanical environment. It investigates the transcriptomic responses of cells as a function of local strain magnitude by identifying differentially expressed genes in regions of high and low strain within a fracture site. The platform aims to discover mechano-responsive targets to enhance fracture healing.

title: Unraveling Alzheimer's disease: insights from single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomic.
main_goals: This review highlights recent advancements in single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, providing detailed insights into the cellular heterogeneity and neuroimmune mechanisms of Alzheimer's disease. It addresses the need for understanding complex cellular interactions to identify novel therapeutic targets and biomarkers. The review emphasizes the importance of integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics with other omics data for a comprehensive understanding of AD.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals unique metabolic profile and key oncogenic regulators of cervical squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to understand the tumor microenvironment and metabolic characteristics of cervical squamous cell carcinoma using spatial transcriptomics, single-cell RNA sequencing, and TCGA data. The research identifies potential cancer-promoting factors and offers a valuable foundation for developing more effective treatment strategies for CSCC.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma with lymph node metastases.
biological_context: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma with lymph node metastases
main_goals: This study aims to explore the spatial and molecular attributes of primary tumor samples, adjacent tissues, metastatic and non-metastatic lymph nodes in ESCC patients using single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplex immunohistochemistry. The analysis revealed specific subclusters of epithelial cells enriched in metastatic lymph nodes and implicated stromal cells in ESCC metastasis. The findings enhance our comprehension of the cellular and molecular aspects of metastatic lymph nodes in ESCC patients.

title: Tertiary Lymphoid Structures are Linked to Enhanced Antitumor Immunity and Better Prognosis in Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) and muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC). The findings indicate that elevated levels of B cells and TLS correlate with improved prognoses in patients with MIBC. A TLS-specific gene signature is developed that effectively predicts outcomes in MIBC and other cancers.

title: Spatial proteomics reveals sirtuin 1 to be a determinant of T-cell infiltration in human melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'microscopy', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption mass spectrometry imaging', 'liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: The study aims to decipher the proteomic landscape in human melanoma and identify potential therapeutic targets within the tumor microenvironment. Spatial proteomics was used to identify proteins enriched in tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TiL) compartments. Sirtuin 1 (SIRT1) was identified as a potential regulator of T-cell infiltration and a target for improving the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibition.

title: Mapping management intensity types in grasslands with synergistic use of Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 satellite images.
main_goals: This research investigates the classification of grassland management intensity in two regions of Poland by integrating data from Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 satellite imagery. The study aims to provide valuable insights for conservation agencies, agricultural stakeholders, and land managers. It also highlights the potential of Sentinel missions for grassland monitoring.

title: Multivariate stochastic modeling for transcriptional dynamics with cell-specific latent time using SDEvelo.
biological_context: Cell differentiation and state transitions, carcinogenesis
main_goals: The paper introduces SDEvelo, a generative approach to inferring RNA velocity by modeling the dynamics of unspliced and spliced RNAs via multivariate stochastic differential equations (SDE). It explicitly models inherent uncertainty in transcriptional dynamics while estimating a cell-specific latent time across genes. The method is demonstrated on simulated and real scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics datasets, showing its ability to model random dynamic patterns and detect carcinogenesis.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis drives PET imaging of tight junction protein expression in pancreatic cancer theranostics.
main_goals: The study aims to identify and validate molecular targets for PET imaging in pancreatic cancer using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics data from human surgical samples. They develop a peptide-based molecular imaging agent targeted to claudin-4. The work motivates a data-driven approach to selection of molecular targets.

title: CRP deposition in human abdominal aortic aneurysm is associated with transcriptome alterations toward aneurysmal pathogenesis: insights from in situ spatial whole transcriptomic analysis.
main_goals: Investigate the effects of C-reactive protein (CRP) deposition on vessel walls in abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) by analyzing spatially resolved changes in gene expression. The aim was to elucidate pathways contributing to disease progression by comparing high and low CRP groups using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal SPP1-CD44 signaling drives primary resistance to immune checkpoint inhibitors in RCC.
main_goals: This study aims to unravel the tumor-immune interactions and signaling pathways driving primary resistance to ICIs in RCC by integrating single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and clinical sample analysis. The findings reveal a potential mechanism by which SPP1-CD44 signaling mediates tumor-immune cell interactions leading to ICI resistance, providing a theoretical basis for targeting and disrupting this signaling to overcome primary resistance in RCC.

title: Laser-capture microdissection for spatial transcriptomics of immunohistochemically detected neurons.
biological_context: Striatal cholinergic interneurons and GnRH neurons in rat and mouse brain
main_goals: The paper introduces IHC/LCM-Seq, a method for spatial transcriptomics of immunohistochemically detected neurons collected with laser-capture microdissection. It uses aluminon and polyvinyl sulfonic acid for RNA preservation in formaldehyde-fixed brains. The method is validated by analyzing striatal cholinergic interneurons and GnRH neurons.

title: Language Dominance in Left-Handers: Unveiling Left Hemisphere Global Dominance With Specific Right Hemisphere Regional Dominance.
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial patterns of language lateralization in LH and RH individuals using high-resolution fMRI data and the Human Connectome Project (HCP) multimodal parcellation (MMP). The goal is to identify hemispheric left-lateralization dominance in brain areas associated with language processing and reveal differences in specific regions between LH and RH individuals.

title: THBS2 + cancer-associated fibroblasts promote EMT leading to oxaliplatin resistance via COL8A1-mediated PI3K/AKT activation in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the mechanisms by which specific subsets of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) contribute to oxaliplatin resistance in colorectal cancer (CRC). The study identified that THBS2 specifically derived from subsets of CAFs promotes oxaliplatin resistance by interacting with malignant cells via the collagen pathway, activating the PI3K-AKT signaling pathway and promoting EMT.

title: A3AR antagonism mitigates metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease by exploiting monocyte-derived Kupffer cell necroptosis and inflammation resolution.
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of selective A3AR antagonism for regulation of replenished MoKCs, thereby improving MASLD. It demonstrates that inhibiting A3AR via FM101 or genetic deletion alleviates MASLD by inducing mitochondrial dysfunction and subsequent necroptosis in MoKCs, establishing FM101 as a promising therapeutic strategy for MASLD.

title: Generation of super-resolution images from barcode-based spatial transcriptomics by deep image prior.
main_goals: The paper introduces SuperST, an algorithm based on deep image prior, to reconstruct high-resolution images from low-resolution spatial transcriptomics data. It addresses the resolution and zero-inflation issues. SuperST generates output images that closely resemble immunofluorescence images and can be combined with computer vision algorithms for spatial clustering of genes.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell roadmap of human skin wound healing.
main_goals: The study aims to understand cellular dynamics and coordination in human wound repair by conducting single-cell multi-omics analyses on human skin wound tissues across different healing phases. It identifies FOSL1 as a critical driver of re-epithelialization and reveals the sequential support of keratinocyte migration by pro-inflammatory macrophages and fibroblasts. The study also compares human and mouse acute wound transcriptomes and uncovers a link between failed keratinocyte migration and impaired inflammatory response in chronic wounds.

title: State-of-the-Art Deep Learning Methods for Microscopic Image Segmentation: Applications to Cells, Nuclei, and Tissues.
main_goals: This systematic literature review provides a comprehensive overview of state-of-the-art DL methods developed over the past six years for the segmentation of microscopic images. It critically analyzes key contributions, emphasizing how these methods specifically tackle challenges in cell, nucleus, and tissue segmentation. The review also evaluates the datasets and performance metrics employed in these studies and suggests directions for future research.

title: Decoding Kidney Pathophysiology: Omics-Driven Approaches in Precision Medicine.
