main_goals: This review discusses the application of multi-omics technologies in precision medicine for chronic kidney disease (CKD). It highlights the potential of these technologies to identify disease subtypes, biomarkers, and therapeutic targets for personalized treatment approaches. The review also addresses challenges in data integration, costs, and ethical considerations.

title: Skill-Learning-Based Trajectory Planning for Robotic Vertebral Plate Cutting: Personalization Through Surgeon Technique Integration and Neural Network Prediction.
biological_context: Vertebral plate cutting in laminectomy decompression
main_goals: This paper presents an advanced robotic vertebral plate-cutting system that replicates the surgeon's cutting technique through a trajectory parameter prediction model. A spatial mapping relationship between artificial and patient vertebrae is first established, enabling the robot to mimic surgeon-defined trajectories. A Backpropagation(BP) neural network is implemented, providing predictive modeling for trajectory parameters.

title: Three-dimensional single-cell transcriptome imaging of thick tissues.
main_goals: The paper presents a thick-tissue three-dimensional (3D) MERFISH imaging method, which uses confocal microscopy for optical sectioning, deep learning for increasing imaging speed and quality, and sample preparation and imaging protocol optimized for thick samples. It demonstrates 3D MERFISH on mouse brain tissue sections of up to 200 µm thickness with high detection efficiency and accuracy. The method broadens the scope of questions that can be addressed by spatial genomics.

title: DNA metabarcoding reveals diet diversity and niche partitioning by two sympatric herbivores in summer.
biological_context: Sika deer and Reeves' muntjac foraging strategies
main_goals: This study investigates the feeding habits and interspecific relationships between sika deer and Reeves' muntjac using high-throughput sequencing and DNA metabarcoding techniques. It aims to understand diet partitioning and niche overlap between the two herbivores during summer.

title: Resolving the bone - optimizing decalcification in spatial transcriptomics and molecular pathology.
main_goals: This review explores traditional and modern decalcification methods for bone tissue, offering recommendations on technical and methodological refinements for achieving molecularly robust processing of bone and calcified tissues in spatial transcriptomics and molecular pathology.

title: [Recent progress in mass spectrometry imaging using nanospray desorption electrospray ionization].
biological_context: Tissue sections, microbial communities, environmental samples
main_goals: This review aims to introduce key nano-DESI-MSI research progress reported in the past three years with the aim of better understanding and facilitating the use of this technology. It focuses on ion-source development, lipid-structure analysis, and spatial proteomics. It also discusses key challenges that need to be addressed in the field.

title: Eliminating the persistent HIV reservoir based on biomarker expression - How do we get there?
main_goals: This review discusses the factors contributing to biomarker heterogeneity in persistent HIV reservoirs, including external stimuli, tissue microenvironments, and person-to-person variation. It emphasizes the need for identifying a minimal set of cell surface proteins that define all reservoir subsets, especially considering tissue biomarkers and proteins expressed in latently infected cells of the myeloid lineage. The review also highlights the potential of novel technologies like spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to achieve this goal.

title: Deep clustering representation of spatially resolved transcriptomics data using multi-view variational graph auto-encoders with consensus clustering.
main_goals: The paper proposes STMVGAE, a novel spatial transcriptomics analysis tool that combines a multi-view variational graph autoencoder with a consensus clustering framework for spatial domain identification. It integrates histological images features with gene expression data and constructs multiple graphs to capture different spatial and transcriptional relationships. The model demonstrates competitive results compared to state-of-the-art methods across various downstream tasks.

title: Spatial metabolomics reveal metabolic alternations in the injured mice kidneys induced by triclocarban treatment.
main_goals: This study investigates the nephrotoxicity induced by long-term triclocarban (TCC) treatment in a mouse model using MALDI-MSI. It reveals the spatial distribution and abundance changes of TCC and its metabolites in the kidney, along with alterations in specific metabolic pathways associated with kidney damage.

title: Reprogramming macrophages to treat liver diseases.
main_goals: This review summarizes current knowledge on macrophage programs activated in chronic liver inflammation, cirrhosis, and HCC, and discusses potential targets to modulate macrophage behavior in liver diseases and nanoscale therapeutics targeting macrophages. It aims to provide insights for precision medicine in the treatment of liver diseases by understanding the regulatory mechanisms and diverse populations of hepatic macrophages.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Delineate the Microstructure and Immune Landscape of Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma in the Leading-Edge Area.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the tumor microenvironment, especially the leading-edge area, of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (ICC) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It investigates the interactions between tumor cells and immune cells and identifies a unique 'triad structure' that promotes tumor growth and progression.

title: Multi-omics and experimental analysis unveil the key components in Scutellaria baicalensis Georgi to alleviate hepatic fibrosis via regulating cPLA2-mediated arachidonic acid metabolism.
biological_context: Hepatic fibrosis in CCl4-induced mouse model
main_goals: This study investigates the effects and mechanisms of methanol extract of Scutellaria baicalensis Georgi (MESB) in treating hepatic fibrosis using a CCl4-induced mouse model. The study reveals that MESB is crucial in preventing hepatic fibrosis via the cPLA2-mediated arachidonic acid metabolic pathway, highlighting its key active components as potential drugs for fibrosis treatment.

title: Proteomics-Based Analysis of Laser-Capture Micro-dissected, Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded Tissue Samples.
main_goals: The paper focuses on enabling spatial resolution in proteomics studies by addressing limitations in sensitivity and throughput. It highlights recent developments in sample handling, chromatography, and mass spectrometry that allow for the establishment of proteomics in single-cell and spatial disciplines.

title: Encompassing view of spatial and single-cell RNA sequencing renews the role of the microvasculature in human atherosclerosis.
main_goals: The study aimed to generate an integrative high-resolution map of human atherosclerotic plaques by combining single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data to reveal cell-type-specific expression changes and spatially constrained alterations in cell-cell communication in atherosclerosis.

title: STCGAN: a novel cycle-consistent generative adversarial network for spatial transcriptomics cellular deconvolution.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel cycle-consistent generative adversarial network named STCGAN for cellular deconvolution in spatial transcriptomics. STCGAN pre-trains on ST data using a CGAN to capture complex spatial gene expression patterns and learns robust latent representations. It then optimizes a trainable cell-to-spot mapping matrix to integrate scRNA-seq data with ST data for accurate cellular composition estimation and spatial distribution reconstruction.

title: Machine Learning Models for Segmentation and Classification of Cyanobacterial Cells.
main_goals: The paper introduces Cypose, a software package using machine learning models for segmentation of individual cyanobacterial cells and classification of cellular phenotypes. It uses Cellpose for segmentation and a convolutional neural network (Cyclass) for classification. The models improve cell segmentation accuracy and enable high-throughput analysis of dense cyanobacterial colonies and filamentous cyanobacteria.

title: Integrative multi-omics analysis reveals a novel subtype of hepatocellular carcinoma with biological and clinical relevance.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'proteomic analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics sequencing', 'genome sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: The study aimed to construct a robust prognostic model for HCC and identify novel subgroups at the single-cell level using multi-omics data integration. This approach could potentially assist in the assessment of prognostic risk for HCC patients and facilitate personalized drug therapy. The study identifies a novel subtype, XPO1+Epithelial, associated with high-risk patients and influenced by fibroblasts.

title: Current state and future prospects of spatial biology in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This review discusses recent advances in spatial biology technologies applied to colorectal cancer research. It highlights both the methodologies and the challenges associated with their use, such as the substantial tissue heterogeneity characteristic of CRC. It also discusses the limitations of current approaches and the need for novel computational tools to manage and interpret these complex datasets.

title: Integration of Imaging-based and Sequencing-based Spatial Omics Mapping on the Same Tissue Section via DBiTplus.
biological_context: Mouse embryos, Normal human lymph nodes, Human lymphoma FFPE tissue
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Typing', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: The paper introduces DBiTplus, an integrative multi-modality spatial omics approach combining sequencing-based spatial transcriptomics and image-based spatial protein profiling on the same tissue section. It aims to enable both single-cell resolution cell typing and genome-scale interrogation of biological pathways. The workflow includes an experimental procedure and computational innovation for spatially resolved single-cell atlasing and exploration of biological pathways cell-by-cell at genome-scale.

title: A specific gene expression program underlies antigen archiving by lymphatic endothelial cells in mammalian lymph nodes.
main_goals: The study aims to understand how lymphatic endothelial cells (LECs) achieve durable antigen archiving in lymph nodes and whether LECs with high levels of antigen express unique transcriptional programs. They identify a unique transcriptional program within archiving LECs that predicts LEC archiving capacity and validate this model in mouse and human independent data sets. They also show that LEC antigen acquisition and archiving capacity can be improved over multiple exposures.

title: Precision targeting of β-catenin induces tumor reprogramming and immunity in hepatocellular cancers.
main_goals: The study investigates the efficacy of a novel siRNA encapsulated in lipid nanoparticle targeting CTNNB1 (LNP-CTNNB1) in β-catenin-mutated HCC models. It analyzes the tumor reprogramming and immune responses upon β-catenin suppression using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study also explores the synergistic effect of LNP-CTNNB1 with ICI in advanced-stage disease.

title: Spatial Proteomics towards cellular Resolution.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial genomics', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence', 'spatial metabolomics', 'spatial lipidomics', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: The report provides an overview of the untargeted, bottom-up mass spectrometry (MS)-based spatial proteomics workflow. It highlights recent progress in tissue dissection, sample processing, bioinformatics, and liquid chromatography (LC)-MS technologies that are advancing spatial proteomics toward cellular resolution. The field of untargeted MS-based spatial proteomics is rapidly evolving and holds great promise.

title: Human disease-causing missense genetic variants are enriched in the evolutionarily ancient domains of the cytosolic aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase proteins.
main_goals: The study leverages the evolutionary history of aaRS proteins to understand the distribution of disease-causing missense variants in human cytosolic aaRSs. It establishes that pathogenic missense variants are enriched in evolutionarily ancient domains while benign/unknown missense variants are enriched in modern domains. The work aims to improve the ability to diagnose patients affected by damaging genetic variants in the aaRS protein family.

title: stHGC: a self-supervised graph representation learning for spatial domain recognition with hybrid graph and spatial regularization.
main_goals: The paper introduces stHGC, a self-supervised graph representation learning framework for identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data. It constructs a hybrid neighbor graph, utilizes a graph attention mechanism, and employs a spatial regularization constraint. The method aims to effectively integrate spatial location and gene expression for accurate spatial domain identification.

title: Combination of spatial transcriptomics analysis and retrospective study reveals liver infection of SARS-COV-2 is associated with clinical outcomes of COVID-19.
main_goals: The study aims to provide clinical evidence for liver infection with SARS-CoV-2 and its impact on the liver, and to evaluate the risk of death via assessing serum ALB concentration fluctuations in patients with COVID-19.

title: Spatiotemporal characteristics and influencing factors of non-CO<sub>2</sub> greenhouse gas emission intensity from China's livestock sector.
main_goals: This study aims to analyze the spatiotemporal evolution and influencing factors of greenhouse gas emission intensity (GEIL) from China's livestock sector using the standard deviation ellipse (SDE) model, exploratory spatial data analysis (ESDA), and the geographically and temporally weighted regression (GTWR) model.

title: Untargeted Spatial Metabolomics and Spatial Proteomics on the Same Tissue Section.
main_goals: The paper presents a multiomic workflow that uses DESI-MSI to identify spatial metabolite patterns on-tissue prior to spatial proteomic analyses on the same tissue section. This allows for optimized, downstream spatial proteomics assay. The integration of multiomic information enables the correlation of ceramide localization with SMPD3 abundance and resolves metabolite isomeric ambiguity using protein abundance.

title: Protocol for high-resolution 3D spatial transcriptomics using Open-ST.
main_goals: This paper presents a protocol for efficient and high-resolution spatial transcriptomics in 2D/3D using Open-ST. It describes the steps for repurposing Illumina flow cells into spatially barcoded capture areas and preparing ST libraries. It also details the computational workflow for generating 2D/3D molecular maps aligned with histological data.

title: Mapping the gene space at single-cell resolution with gene signal pattern analysis.
main_goals: The paper introduces a gene embedding problem and presents a graph signal processing approach called gene signal pattern analysis (GSPA) to learn rich gene representations from single-cell data. GSPA enables characterization of genes based on their patterning and localization on the cellular manifold. It aims to capture gene co-expression modules, condition-specific enrichment, and perturbation-specific gene-gene interactions, with applications in cell-cell communication, spatial transcriptomics, and patient response analysis.

title: Recent advancement in the spatial immuno-oncology.
main_goals: This review summarizes the conceptual frameworks to understand spatial omics data and highlights the updated knowledge of spatial immuno-oncology.

title: NLSDeconv: an efficient cell-type deconvolution method for spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Introduces NLSDeconv, a novel cell-type deconvolution method based on non-negative least squares. It also provides an accompanying Python package. Benchmarking against 18 existing deconvolution methods demonstrates NLSDeconv's competitive statistical performance and superior computational efficiency.

title: Tracking adipose-derived stem cell exosomes applied in a mouse crush injury model: insights from fluorescent labeling and spatial transcriptomics - an experimental study.
biological_context: Mouse sciatic nerve crush injury model
main_goals: To track the effects of adipose-derived stem cell exosomes (ADSC-exos) on crushed sciatic nerves in mice using fluorescent labeling and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to reveal changes in gene expression and cell-cell interactions in response to ADSC-exo treatment, ultimately understanding the role of ADSC-exos in nerve regeneration.

title: Applications of Nanotechnology for Spatial Omics: Biological Structures and Functions at Nanoscale Resolution.
main_goals: This review describes how nanotechnologies have been applied to the development of spatial transcriptomics, proteomics, metabolomics, epigenomics, and multiomics approaches. It focuses on how nanotechnology supports improved resolution and throughput of spatial omics, surpassing traditional techniques. It also summarizes future challenges and opportunities for the application of nanotechnology to spatial omics methods.

title: Multimodal Spatial Profiling Reveals Immune Suppression and Microenvironment Remodeling in Fallopian Tube Precursors to High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma.
biological_context: Fallopian tube precursors to high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSOC)
main_goals: This study integrates high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics to analyze human tissue samples at different stages of HGSOC development. The goal is to reveal immune modulating mechanisms within precursor epithelium, characterized by chromosomal instability, persistent IFN signaling, and dysregulated innate and adaptive immunity. The study identifies potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for HGSOC interception.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in breast cancer reveals tumour microenvironment-driven drug responses and clonal therapeutic heterogeneity.
main_goals: This research utilizes spatial transcriptomics data from breast cancer patients to predict drug sensitivity, observing diverse response patterns across different tumour regions. It identifies therapeutic clusters with different drug responses and genetically identical subclones with different responses depending on their location. The study underscores the importance of considering the distance from the tumour core and microenvironment composition when identifying suitable treatments to target intratumour heterogeneity.

title: Pan-cancer single cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis deciphers the molecular landscapes of senescence related cancer-associated fibroblasts and reveals its predictive value in neuroblastoma via integrated multi-omics analysis and machine learning.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize senescence-related cancer-associated fibroblasts (senes CAFs) in neuroblastoma using pan-cancer single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis. It develops a senescence CAFs related signature (SCRS) to diagnose and predict prognosis in neuroblastoma and explores the biological function of JAK1.

title: NIS-Seq enables cell-type-agnostic optical perturbation screening.
biological_context: Eight cell types from two species, primary human macrophages, human skin tissue
main_goals: The paper introduces Nuclear In-Situ Sequencing (NIS-Seq), a method for cell-type-agnostic optical perturbation screening. It allows for high-density and high library complexity screening by generating sequencing signals directly from nuclear genomic DNA. The method is benchmarked across multiple cell types and used to identify key players in inflammation-related cellular pathways.

title: [Geographical origin authentication of Gongju at different spatial scales based on hyperspectral technology].
main_goals: The study aims to establish a hyperspectral technology-based method for the origin identification of Gongju at different geographical scales. It explores various preprocessing techniques and machine learning models (PLSDA, RF, SVM) to achieve high prediction accuracy. The feature wavelength selection algorithms (CARS, SPA, VISSA) are used to optimize the models by reducing the number of variables while maintaining comparable accuracy.

title: [Proteomics in prevention and treatment of post-myocardial infarction heart failure diseases with traditional Chinese medicine].
main_goals: This article systematically reviewed research on the intervention mechanisms of TCM compound prescriptions and their active ingredients in HF after MI, and explored related in vivo pathways. Additionally, it discussed the role of proteomics in protein biomarker discovery, post-translational modifications of proteins, protein-protein interactions, spatial proteomics, and more, with the aim of advancing the deep application of proteomic techniques in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases with TCM.

title: GAADE: identification spatially variable genes based on adaptive graph attention network.
main_goals: The paper introduces GAADE, an unsupervised neural network architecture based on graph-structured data representation learning, for identifying spatially variable genes (SVGs). GAADE integrates a self-attention mechanism to reconstruct node attributes and graph structure, effectively capturing spatial domain structures and confining the identification of SVGs within spatial domains. The method performs differential expression analysis on spots within the target spatial domain and their multi-order neighbors to detect genes with enriched expression patterns.

title: How can MSI enhance our understanding of ASO distribution?
main_goals: This review explores the potential of MSI in investigating ASOs' spatial distribution within neurological disease models. It focuses on multimodal molecular imaging to gain insights into ASO distribution, simultaneously with a better understanding of the molecular pathways affected by ASOs.

title: Multimodal autism detection: Deep hybrid model with improved feature level fusion.
main_goals: The study develops a novel autism detection model using deep learning techniques to improve prediction accuracy. It introduces an improved feature level fusion approach and a hybrid model (CNN and Bi-GRU) for diagnosis using EEG and facial image data. The suggested methodology achieves higher accuracy compared to other models like SVM, DNN, Bi-GRU, LSTM and CNN.

title: Spatiotemporal Profiling Defines Persistence and Resistance Dynamics during Targeted Treatment of Melanoma.
main_goals: This study defined state change and lineage selection during melanoma treatment with spatiotemporal resolution, elucidating how choice and timing of therapeutic agents will impact the ability to eradicate resistant clones. Tracking clonal progression during treatment uncovers conserved, global transcriptional changes and local clone-clone and spatial patterns underlying the emergence of resistance, providing insights into therapy-induced tumor evolution.

title: Exploring tumor microenvironment interactions and apoptosis pathways in NSCLC through spatial transcriptomics and machine learning.
main_goals: To explore the role of programmed cell death (PCD) in NSCLC, investigate the intrinsic mechanisms of PCD and its interaction with the tumor microenvironment using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell sequencing. The study aims to construct prognostic models and identify potential therapeutic targets related to apoptosis in NSCLC.

title: Statistical analysis supports pervasive RNA subcellular localization and alternative 3' UTR regulation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The paper introduces a new statistical framework called SPRAWL for detecting cell-type specific subcellular RNA localization regulation. It integrates SPRAWL with a new approach to measure cell-type specific regulation of alternative 3' UTR processing and detects correlations between 3' UTR length and subcellular localization. SPRAWL aims to prioritize candidate functional 3' UTRs for functional prediction and study.

title: Get to know your neighbors with a SNAQ™: A framework for single cell spatial neighborhood analysis in immunohistochemical images.
main_goals: The paper introduces SNAQ™, an R Markdown script for single-cell spatial neighborhood analysis and quantification on immunofluorescent images. SNAQ™ conducts neighborhood analysis, measures distances between cells, and visualizes cellular composition within customizable radii. The algorithm and input data are freely available online.

title: BDNF augmentation reverses cranial radiation therapy-induced cognitive decline and neurodegenerative consequences.
main_goals: This study investigates the efficacy of riluzole (RZ) in mitigating the detrimental effects of radiation therapy (RT)-induced cognitive dysfunction (RICD) in a mouse model. The study aims to demonstrate the neuroprotective effects of RZ, including preservation of synaptic integrity, reduced neuroinflammation, and elevated BDNF levels in the irradiated brain.

title: Spatial transcriptome profiling identifies DTX3L and BST2 as key biomarkers in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma tumorigenesis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'IHC', 'bulk RNA-sequencing', 'CosMx Spatial Molecular Imaging (SMI)', 'histology images']
main_goals: The study aimed to unravel transcriptional and immunologic alterations occurring during malignant transformation of ESCC and identify clinically significant biomarkers. It used digital spatial profiling, single-cell spatial transcriptomics, IHC, and public RNA-seq datasets to delineate spatial transcriptional reprogramming and dynamic cell signaling pathways that determine ESCC progression. DTX3L and BST2 were identified as potential biomarkers for ESCC progression.

title: Spatial transcriptomic clocks reveal cell proximity effects in brain ageing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This paper introduces spatial ageing clocks, machine learning models trained on spatially resolved single-cell transcriptomics data, to identify spatial and cell-type-specific transcriptomic fingerprints of ageing, rejuvenation, and disease. It identifies proximity effects of T cells and neural stem cells on neighbouring cells during ageing. The study highlights the potential of rare cell types to influence tissue ageing and the utility of spatial ageing clocks for assessing the efficacy of interventions.

title: Aging and head and neck cancer insights from single cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: The study aims to explore the expression of Aging-related genes (ARGs) in HNSCC and analyze their prognostic significance using single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analysis. It seeks to provide new theoretical support and directions for personalized treatment of HNSCC. The research also investigates the cellular characteristics of HNSCC and its interaction with the tumor microenvironment.

title: Initial regional cytoarchitectonic differences in dorsal and orbitobasal human developing frontal cortex revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper investigates regional cytoarchitectonic features in the developing human frontal lobe at the transcriptomic level using NanoString GeoMx DSP. It identifies differentially expressed genes between dorsal and orbitobasal regions at 15 PCW, a critical period for subplate formation. The study confirms early regional patterning in the prefrontal cortex.

title: Association of Synovial Innate Immune Exhaustion With Worse Pain in Knee Osteoarthritis.
main_goals: The objective was to identify synovial innate immune cell subsets and pathophysiologic mechanisms associated with worse pain in patients with knee OA. Synovial tissue biopsies were analyzed to identify associations between synovial histopathology and worse pain. Spatial transcriptomics and proteomics, followed by single-cell RNA sequencing, were used to identify synovial cell composition and cell-cell communication networks in patients with more severe OA pain.

title: Toward clinical applications of spatial-omics in cancer research.
main_goals: This paper is a review focused on the clinical applications of spatial-omics in cancer research.

title: Interpolation of Imaging Mass Spectrometry Data by a Window-Based Adversarial Autoencoder Method.
main_goals: The study develops a window-based Adversarial Autoencoder (AAE) method for high-resolution IMS data reconstruction. It aims to generate high-resolution images from down-sampled IMS data. The AAE model is compared with Bilinear and Bicubic interpolation methods, demonstrating superior performance.

title: Spatial transcriptomics and in situ immune cell profiling of the host ectocervical landscape of HIV infected Kenyan sex working women.
biological_context: HIV infection in Kenyan female sex workers
main_goals: This study investigates the ectocervical immunological landscape during chronic HIV infection in Kenyan female sex workers using spatial transcriptomics and multi-epitope ligand cartography (MELC). The study identifies HIV-associated cervical immune activity driven by T and B cell activity and a general antiviral state characterized by sustained interferon induction.

title: Single-Nucleus and Spatial Transcriptome Profiling Delineates the Multicellular Ecosystem in Hepatocellular Carcinoma After Hepatic Arterial Infusion Chemotherapy.
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the multicellular ecosystem in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) after hepatic arterial infusion chemotherapy (HAIC) treatment by integrating single-nucleus RNA sequencing with spatial transcriptomics. It identifies changes in immune cell populations and tertiary lymphoid structure formation post-HAIC treatment, highlighting the role of PD-1+CD8+ Tex-int cells in the tumor microenvironment.

title: Detection of Apple Proliferation Disease Using Hyperspectral Imaging and Machine Learning Techniques.
biological_context: Apple proliferation disease in Malus (apple trees)
main_goals: The study investigates the potential of hyperspectral imaging in combination with machine learning algorithms to detect apple proliferation disease symptoms based on the spectral signature of leaf samples. The goal is to develop a reliable method for early disease detection. The study also analyzes the relevance of spectral bands for disease detection.

title: Advances in Data Pre-Processing Methods for Distributed Fiber Optic Strain Sensing.
main_goals: The paper discusses characteristics and common remediation approaches for strain reading anomalies (SRAs), dropouts, and noise in distributed strain sensing (DSS) data. Four advanced pre-processing algorithms (geometric threshold method (GTM), outlier-specific correction procedure (OSCP), sliding modified z-score (SMZS), and the cluster filter) are presented and benchmarked. A flexible and modular pre-processing workflow is implemented and made available with the algorithms.

title: Adaptive Optimization and Dynamic Representation Method for Asynchronous Data Based on Regional Correlation Degree.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel Asynchronous Spike Dynamic Metric and Slicing algorithm (ASDMS) for adaptively segmenting event streams and an Adaptive Spatiotemporal Subject Surface Compensation algorithm (ASSSC) to compensate for missing motion information. It introduces a new evaluation metric, the Actual Performance Efficiency Discrepancy (APED), to quantify the effectiveness of the method. The goal is to improve event stream segmentation and imaging quality compared to existing methods when dealing with multiple entities moving at varying speeds.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Reveals the Effects of Dietary Capsaicin Intervention on Interscapular Adipose Tissue Metabolome in Mice.
biological_context: Interscapular adipose tissue and adjacent white adipose tissue in mice
main_goals: Investigate the effects of dietary capsaicin intervention on interscapular brown adipose tissue and adjacent white adipose tissue using spatial metabolomics. Determine metabolite alterations across brown adipose tissue regions and in adjacent white adipose tissue. Identify metabolic pathways affected by capsaicin treatment.

title: OVsignGenes: A Gene Expression-Based Neural Network Model Estimated Molecular Subtype of High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma.
main_goals: The study identifies differentially expressed genes among four HGSC subtypes and develops OVsignGenes, a neural network model for subtype prediction using gene expression data. The model is resistant to platform effects and validated on multiple cohorts, including scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data. The study also proposes a model for HGSC tumor development based on subtype analysis.

title: Neonatal Brain Injury Triggers Niche-Specific Changes to Cellular Biogeography.
biological_context: Mouse model of chronic neonatal hypoxia (newborn brain injury)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The paper constructs a brain-wide map of the regenerative response to newborn brain injury using high-resolution imaging-based spatial transcriptomics. It develops a new method for inferring condition-associated differences in cell type spatial proximity. The study identifies mechanisms underlying reparative neurogenesis and gliogenesis and nominates pathways that may impede circuit rewiring following neonatal hypoxia.

title: scPAS: single-cell phenotype-associated subpopulation identifier.
biological_context: Breast carcinoma, ovarian cancer, and atherosclerosis
main_goals: The paper introduces scPAS, a bioinformatics tool to identify phenotype-associated cell subpopulations within single-cell data by integrating bulk data. scPAS employs a network-regularized sparse regression model to quantify the association between each cell and a phenotype and estimates the significance of these associations. The tool's accuracy, flexibility, and efficiency are demonstrated using simulated data and single-cell datasets.

title: SpatialCVGAE: Consensus Clustering Improves Spatial Domain Identification of Spatial Transcriptomics Using VGAE.
main_goals: The paper proposes SpatialCVGAE, a consensus clustering framework for spatial transcriptomics data analysis. It aims to mitigate the instability of spatial clustering methods caused by data sparsity and noise. SpatialCVGAE leverages multiple latent representations learned by variational graph autoencoders (VGAEs) and integrates them using a consensus clustering approach to improve stability and accuracy.

title: Cell-specific priors rescue differential gene expression in spatial spot-based technologies.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Differentially expressed genes (DEGs) identification']
main_goals: This paper investigates the performance of classic DEG algorithms on spatial transcriptomics data and reveals their limitations due to cellular heterogeneity within spots. It proposes a gene-selection scheme based on cell-type specificity to improve DEG recovery. The approach outperforms existing data-driven methods and can be applied upstream of any DEG algorithm.

title: Identifying retinal pigment epithelium cells in adaptive optics-optical coherence tomography images with partial annotations and superhuman accuracy.
main_goals: This paper presents a deep learning-based method with partial annotation training for detecting RPE cells in AO-OCT images with accuracy better than human performance. The method aims to automate cell segmentation for rapid, cost-efficient, and objective quantification of the RPE mosaic's structural properties. The code, imaging datasets, and the manual expert labels are available online.

title: iMIRACLE: an Iterative Multi-View Graph Neural Network to Model Intercellular Gene Regulation from Spatial Transcriptomic Data.
main_goals: The paper introduces iMiracle, an iterative multi-view graph neural network for modeling intercellular gene regulation from spatial transcriptomic data. iMiracle integrates inter- and intra-cellular networks, employs iterative learning to overcome sparsity, and infers cell-specific ligand-gene regulatory scores. It outperforms existing methods in gene expression imputation and regulatory score inference.

title: Machine learning approaches for spatial omics data analysis in digital pathology: tools and applications in genitourinary oncology.
main_goals: This review surveys current trends in the development of computational methods for spatially mapped omics data analysis using digitized histopathology slides and supplementary materials, with an emphasis on tools and applications relevant to genitourinary oncological research. It contains three sections: 1) an overview of image processing approaches for histopathology slide analysis; 2) machine learning integration with spatially resolved omics data analysis; 3) a discussion of current limitations and future directions for integration of machine learning in the clinical decision-making process.

title: Gradient boosting reveals spatially diverse cholesterol gene signatures in colon cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to identify cholesterol metabolism-related genes that are prognostic in colon cancer, using machine learning models and spatial transcriptomics to reveal their spatial distribution and interaction with the tumor microenvironment. They demonstrate that using cholesterol metabolism genes with XGBoost models improves stratification of CC patients. They also identified ADCY5 and SLC2A1 as significant prognostic genes.

title: Tackling the Complexity of Spatial Transcriptomics Data Interpretation with Large Language Models.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study explores the potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) to assist in the analysis and interpretation of spatial transcriptomic data. The study benchmarks LLM performance, develops a systematic workflow for analyzing the tumor immune landscape using the best performing model, and identifies coordinated immunosuppressive mechanisms in tumor regions. The study highlights the potential of LLMs as assistive tools in spatial transcriptomics analysis.

title: High resolution imaging and interpretation of three-dimensional RPE sheet structure.
main_goals: The paper uses 3D confocal imaging and analysis to investigate the structure of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) and the phenomenon of multinucleation in damaged RPE cells. It aims to demonstrate the importance of 3D analysis in correctly interpreting cell structures and avoid misinterpreting multinucleation.

title: Induced B-Cell Receptor Diversity Predicts PD-1 Blockade Immunotherapy Response.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of B-cell receptor (BCR) diversity in predicting response to PD-1 blockade immunotherapy. The authors use spatial omics techniques to analyze tumor and draining lymph node samples from cancer patients undergoing aPD-1 therapy. The findings suggest that induced BCR clonal diversity is a predictor of clinical response across multiple cancer types.

title: MerQuaCo: a computational tool for quality control in image-based spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces MerQuaCo, an open-source tool to detect and quantify imperfections in image-based spatial transcriptomics data. This facilitates objective assessment of data quality and improves the selection of sections for downstream analysis. The tool aims to address limitations in existing quality control methods.

title: Constructions, Purifications and Applications of DNA-Antibody Conjugates: A Review.
main_goals: This review paper discusses the construction, purification, and applications of DNA-antibody conjugates. It highlights their use in immuno-PCR, proximity ligation assays, and tissue imaging. The paper aims to provide an overview of the applications of these conjugates in research, diagnosis, and potential therapy.

title: Spatial patterns and MRI-based radiomic prediction of high peritumoral tertiary lymphoid structure density in hepatocellular carcinoma: a multicenter study.
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate biological differences related to peritumoral tertiary lymphoid structure (pTLS) density in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and develop a radiomic classifier for predicting pTLS density in HCC. The classifier's performance was evaluated using the area under the curve (AUC), with prognostic and predictive value assessed across four independent cohorts and in a dual-center outcome cohort of 41 patients who received immunotherapy. The paper identified key regulators of pTLS density in patients with HCC and proposed a non-invasive radiomic classifier capable of assisting in stratification for prognosis and treatment.

title: DCA-Enhanced Alzheimer's detection with shearlet and deep learning integration.
main_goals: This study introduces a novel pipeline for Alzheimer's disease detection. It integrates deep learning models with shearlet transforms and discriminant correlation analysis to extract and classify features from MRI data, aiming for early and accurate diagnosis.

title: Inferring single-cell resolution spatial gene expression via fusing spot-based spatial transcriptomics, location, and histology using GCN.
main_goals: This paper introduces scstGCN, a multimodal information fusion method using Vision Transformer and Graph Convolutional Network. The method integrates histological images, spot-based ST data, and spatial location information to infer super-resolution gene expression profiles at single-cell level. The goal is to improve accuracy in gene expression analysis, identify spatial patterns, and aid in tissue annotation.

title: Cardiac Reprogramming and Gata4 Overexpression Reduce Fibrosis and Improve Diastolic Dysfunction in Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction.
biological_context: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF)
main_goals: The paper examines the effects of cardiac reprogramming in HFpEF using transgenic mice. It uses bulk RNA-sequencing, single-cell RNA-sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to determine fibrotic mechanisms and the efficacy of cardiac reprogramming. It aims to find a therapeutic approach for HFpEF by suppressing fibrosis and improving diastolic dysfunction.

title: Trends and Challenges of the Modern Pathology Laboratory for Biopharmaceutical Research Excellence.
main_goals: This manuscript provides an overview of the current state and future vision for excellence in research pathology practice and shared perspectives on how to optimally leverage the expertise of pathologists to provide effective spatial, molecular, and digital pathology data to support modern drug discovery.

title: How to build the virtual cell with artificial intelligence: Priorities and opportunities.
main_goals: This Perspective proposes the creation of an AI virtual cell (AIVC) using AI and omics data to model and simulate cellular behavior. It aims to transform biological research through high-fidelity simulations, accelerating discoveries and guiding experimental studies.

title: Study of association between embryo growth arrest (EGA) and atmospheric fine particulate matter pollution (PM<sub>2.5</sub>) and spatial metabolomics of villi derived from pregnant women.
main_goals: This study investigated the association between fine particulate matter (PM2.5) and embryo growth arrest (EGA) in pregnant women. It employed spatial metabolomics to analyze villi samples, identifying metabolic alterations related to EGA and PM2.5 exposure. The study aimed to elucidate the impact of PM2.5 on pregnancy outcomes using a case-control study design.

title: Dongting Lake algal bloom forecasting: Robustness and accuracy analysis of deep learning models.
main_goals: This paper develops an early warning system for harmful algal blooms (HABs) using water quality data. It employs a deep learning approach integrating time series analysis with the iTransformer model. The study identifies key factors influencing algal density and underscores the model's robustness.

title: Cancer specific up-regulated lactate genes associated with immunotherapy resistance in a pan-cancer analysis.
main_goals: The study defines a pan-cancer up-lactate signature in malignant cells associated with immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) resistance. It investigates the association between the up-lactate score, overall survival, and response to anti-PD(L)1 antibody in multiple cancer types, as well as its correlation with mTOR signaling.

title: CACs Recognition of FISH Images Based on Adaptive Mean Teacher Semi-supervised Learning with Domain-Knowledge Pseudo Label.
main_goals: This paper introduces a semi-supervised learning algorithm based on Adaptive Mean Teacher and Domain-Knowledge Pseudo Label for detecting Circulating genetically abnormal cells (CACs) in FISH images. It aims to improve the performance of CACs detection by reducing the reliance on labeled data through semi-supervised training in cell segmentation and signal point detection tasks.

title: scTrends: A living review of commercial single-cell and spatial 'omic technologies.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of commercial single-cell and spatial omic technologies, highlighting key methodologies and trends. It aims to serve as a resource for navigating the commercialization and application of these technologies in research.

title: Mass-Guided Single-Cell MALDI Imaging of Low-Mass Metabolites Reveals Cellular Activation Markers.
biological_context: Lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-stimulated microglial cells and human-induced pluripotent stem cell-derived microglia
main_goals: The paper introduces PRISM-MS, a mass-guided single-cell MALDI mass spectrometry imaging workflow for the analysis of low-mass metabolites. This method enables space-efficient single cell lipid and metabolite analysis. The study demonstrates the utility of PRISM-MS in characterizing complex metabolome changes in stimulated microglia.

title: Computational analysis of the functional impact of MHC-II-expressing triple-negative breast cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of MHC-II-expressing tumor cells in triple-negative breast cancer. The authors analyze multi-omics data (bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics) to understand how this subpopulation interacts with the immune system and influences patient outcomes. They identify a prognostic signature for patient survival.

title: Omics based technology application in poultry meat research.
main_goals: This symposium paper provides an overview of how omics technologies are used in poultry meat research. It aims to highlight how omics and bioinformatics improve understanding of poultry meat quality problems. The paper discusses several applications of omics techniques to address complex traits in poultry.

title: Lipidomics and spatial metabolomics reveal the heterogeneity in lipid distribution within pecan kernels.
main_goals: This study employed lipidomics and spatial metabolomics techniques to profile lipids in developing pecan embryos. The research identified 401 lipid molecules, provided the spatial distribution of lipids within the embryos, and offered insights into lipid metabolism regulation.

title: Chemotherapy induces myeloid-driven spatially confined T cell exhaustion in ovarian cancer.
main_goals: The paper investigates the anti-tumor immunity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSC) before and after chemotherapy. It conducts spatial and molecular characterization of HGSC samples to analyze immune cell states and their interactions within the tumor microenvironment. The study identifies myeloid-driven spatial T cell exhaustion and explores the role of NECTIN2-TIGIT signaling in predicting responses to immune checkpoint blockade.

title: Integration of lipidomics with targeted, single cell, and spatial transcriptomics defines an unresolved pro-inflammatory state in colon cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of lipid dysregulation in colorectal cancers (CRCs) and its relation to inflammation resolution. The study uses lipidomics, transcriptomics, and spatial transcriptomics to characterize gene expression and cellular localization of lipid mediators. The goal is to pave the way for 'resolution medicine' in cancer treatment.

title: SuperSpot: coarse graining spatial transcriptomics data into metaspots.
main_goals: The paper introduces SuperSpot, a workflow to aggregate adjacent and transcriptomically similar spots into metaspots. It reduces the size and sparsity of spatial transcriptomic data. It facilitates the analysis of large datasets.

title: Domainator, a flexible software suite for domain-based annotation and neighborhood analysis, identifies proteins involved in antiviral systems.
main_goals: The paper introduces Domainator, a flexible software suite for domain-based gene neighborhood and protein analysis. The tool facilitates gene annotation, protein search, extraction, and clustering. It demonstrates its utility through examples related to bacterial defense systems, including identifying and classifying proteins and their functions.

title: A prognostic molecular signature of hepatic steatosis is spatially heterogeneous and dynamic in human liver.
main_goals: The paper identifies dynamic, functional biomarkers of hepatic steatosis using a translational approach integrating clinical phenotyping and outcomes, circulating proteomics, and tissue transcriptomics. It aims to discover a prognostic, functional, dynamic "liquid biopsy" of human liver, relevant to biomarker discovery and mechanistic research.

title: Identify critical genes of breast cancer and corresponding leading natural product compounds of potential therapeutic targets.
main_goals: This paper aims to identify hub genes, therapeutic targets, and potential natural product-based therapies for breast cancer using a multi-omics approach. It utilizes WGCNA, differential gene expression analysis, ChIP-seq data, scRNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics. The ultimate goal is to pave the way for more effective clinical treatments.

title: Integrated Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptome Reveal Metabolic Gene SLC16A3 as a Key Regulator of Immune Suppression in Hepatocellular Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of metabolic reprogramming in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), specifically focusing on the gene SLC16A3. The researchers used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify SLC16A3 as a key regulator of immune suppression in HCC. The study suggests SLC16A3 as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Leveraging environmental microbial indicators in wastewater for data-driven disease diagnostics.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the relationships between environmental factors and the incidence of SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater. It uses clustering algorithms to categorize data and reveal patterns of viral positivity and environmental conditions, aiming to enhance public health surveillance.

title: A comparison of super-resolution microscopy techniques for imaging tightly packed microcolonies of an obligate intracellular bacterium.
main_goals: This paper compares the ability of five different fluorescence microscopy techniques (confocal, Airyscan confocal, iSIM, 3D-SIM, and STED) to resolve bacterial cells in intracellular clumps and detect outer membrane vesicles. It uses a custom 3D cell segmentation and analysis pipeline with Cellpose and Imaris to analyze bacterial shape and size. The study demonstrates differences in bacterial shape when grown in different mammalian cell lines.

title: OrthologAL: A Shiny application for quality-aware humanization of non-human pre-clinical high-dimensional gene expression data.
main_goals: OrthologAL is a Shiny application designed to facilitate human orthologous conversion of non-human transcriptomes. It leverages the BioMart database to convert high-dimensional gene expression data from any species into a human ortholog-converted dataset. The application aims to enable the application of pre-clinical transcriptomics data in functional small molecule predictions using existing human-annotated databases.

title: Fate (or state) of CA2 neurons in a mineralocorticoid receptor knockout.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial transcriptomics to understand the effect of mineralocorticoid receptor (MR) knockout on CA2 neurons in the hippocampus. The findings suggest that without MRs, CA2 neurons adopt a CA1-like molecular phenotype and size/density.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies RBM39 as a gene associated with Gleason score progression in prostate cancer.
main_goals: This study utilized spatial transcriptomics to explore transcriptome patterns in prostate cancer regions with varying Gleason scores. The study aimed to identify genes associated with Gleason score progression. The differential expression of RBM39 was confirmed.

title: Holliday junction recognition protein (HJURP) could reflect the clinical outcomes of lung adenocarcinoma patients, and impact the choice of precision therapy.
main_goals: The paper investigates the role of HJURP expression in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) using data from multiple cohorts. It aims to identify HJURP as a prognostic biomarker, explore its correlation with genetic alterations and immune profiles, and assess its potential as a therapeutic target. The study also evaluates the impact of HJURP on the choice of precision therapy.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing in stroke and traumatic brain injury: Current achievements, challenges, and future perspectives on transcriptomic profiling.
biological_context: stroke and acute traumatic brain injury
main_goals: The paper provides an overview of scRNA-seq workflow, data analysis methods, and its pros and cons. It also summarizes the latest achievements of scRNA-seq in stroke and acute traumatic brain injury. It describes future applications of scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics.

title: Prenatal exposure on nanoplastics: A study of spatial transcriptomics in hippocampal offspring.
main_goals: The study investigates the impact of maternal exposure to nanoplastics on the developing hippocampus of offspring using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify changes in gene expression profiles, cell type composition, and intercellular communication pathways to understand the mechanisms of neurotoxicity and potential memory impairment.

title: Predicting Protein Pathways Associated to Tumor Heterogeneity by Correlating Spatial Lipidomics and Proteomics: The Dry Proteomic Concept.
main_goals: The paper introduces "dry proteomics", using MALDI MSI to validate spatial localization of identified clusters. This method aims to predict proteins and associated biological pathways from lipid analyses. The study also develops a classification model based on protein data for cases lacking lipid imaging data.

title: Statistical and computational methods for enabling the clinical and translational application of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper focuses on statistical and computational methods for spatial transcriptomics, likely introducing new tools or approaches. It aims to enable the clinical and translational application of spatial transcriptomics.

title: Method of the Year 2024: spatial proteomics.
main_goals: This paper, 'Method of the Year 2024: spatial proteomics,' likely focuses on introducing and highlighting advancements in spatial proteomics methods. It likely details the development and validation of new tools or significantly improves existing ones in the field of spatial proteomics.

title: Revolutionizing cancer research with spatial proteomics and visual intelligence.
main_goals: This paper likely introduces novel computational methods or algorithms for analyzing spatial proteomics data, with a focus on visual intelligence. The primary goal is likely to revolutionize cancer research by providing new tools for analyzing spatial proteomics data.

title: Subcellular spatial proteomics.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel method for subcellular spatial proteomics analysis. The exact methodology is not clear from the abstract, but it is likely to be a novel approach to analyze spatial proteomics data at a subcellular level.

title: Cell type census in cerebral cortex reveals species-specific brain function and connectivity.
main_goals: This review highlights recent research on the molecular mechanisms that govern the formation of specific cell types in the rodent primary somatosensory cortex. It explores how these conserved molecular mechanisms are observed across different brain regions in various species. The findings offer new insights into the diversity and evolutionary background of neural circuit formation in the mammalian cortex.

title: Integrating scRNA-seq and Visium HD for the analysis of the tumor microenvironment in the progression of colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer progression using scRNA-seq and Visium HD. The study aims to identify key cellular changes and interactions during different stages of the disease, focusing on plasma cells, neutrophils, fibroblasts, and epithelial cells. The research also seeks to predict potential therapeutic agents for specific cell populations.

title: Fhl1, a new spatially specific protein, regulates vein graft neointimal hyperplasia.
main_goals: The study investigates the role of Fhl1 in vein graft neointimal hyperplasia (NIH) using a rat model and human saphenous veins. It uses spatial transcriptomics to identify Fhl1's expression in the neointima and explores its impact on inflammation and cell proliferation, suggesting it as a therapeutic target for mitigating vein graft failure.

title: Increased spatial coupling of integrin and collagen IV in the immunoresistant clear-cell renal-cell carcinoma tumor microenvironment.
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial relationship between integrin and collagen IV in the tumor microenvironment of immunotherapy-resistant clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC). It uses spatial transcriptomics and multiplexed immunofluorescence to analyze gene expression and protein localization in tumors. The study aims to understand the mechanisms of immunotherapy resistance and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Metabolism and spatial transcription resolved heterogeneity of glutamine metabolism in cervical carcinoma.
main_goals: This paper investigates the metabolic and transcriptional profiles of cervical squamous cell carcinoma (CSCC) and normal tissues using AFADESI-MSI and Spatial Transcriptomics. It aims to identify the role of glutamine metabolism and the heterogeneity in its regulation within CSCC tissues. The findings suggest that the differential expression of ASCT2 plays a pivotal role in causing this heterogeneity.

title: NiCo identifies extrinsic drivers of cell state modulation by niche covariation analysis.
biological_context: Mouse embryogenesis, adult small intestine and liver
main_goals: NiCo is a computational framework for integrating single-cell resolution spatial transcriptomics with matched single-cell RNA-sequencing reference data to infer the influence of the spatial niche on the cell state. It predicts novel niche interactions that govern cell state variation underlying tissue development and homeostasis. It provides a powerful tool to elucidate tissue architecture and to identify drivers of cellular states in local niches.

title: Entering the spatial age of parasite genomics.
main_goals: This paper discusses the application of spatial transcriptomics to study the spatial organization of gene expression in Fasciola hepatica. It provides new insights into the parasite's biology and identifies potential targets for control.

title: Automatic classification of HEp-2 specimens by explainable deep learning and Jensen-Shannon reliability index.
main_goals: This paper introduces a new platform for automatic classification of HEp-2 specimens. It combines transfer learning with pre-trained deep learning models, a novel feature selection approach for unbalanced datasets, and a sample quality index based on Jensen-Shannon divergence. The goal is to improve the accuracy and reliability of ANA pattern recognition.

title: spatialGE Is a User-Friendly Web Application That Facilitates Spatial Transcriptomics Data Analysis.
main_goals: The paper introduces spatialGE, a user-friendly web application designed to simplify spatial transcriptomics (ST) data analysis for researchers without programming expertise. spatialGE provides a point-and-click interface to guide users through various ST analysis pipelines, including quality control, normalization, and spatial analysis. The application aims to democratize ST data analysis, facilitating hypothesis generation and discovery of spatial patterns.

title: Human Pancreatic Cancer Single-Cell Atlas Reveals Association of CXCL10+ Fibroblasts and Basal Subtype Tumor Cells.
main_goals: This paper uses a single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) atlas of the human pancreas to study pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The study aims to identify novel targets in a statistically rigorous manner and uncover a novel signaling niche marked by CXCL10+ cancer-associated fibroblasts and basal tumor cells.

title: Autofluorescence Virtual Staining System for H&E Histology and Multiplex Immunofluorescence Applied to Immuno-Oncology Biomarkers in Lung Cancer.
main_goals: This paper introduces a virtual staining system that generates virtual stains for H&E and a multiplex immunofluorescence panel from autofluorescence images. The system enables the reproduction of key morphologic features and protein biomarker expressions and allows for cell segmentation-based measurements in non-small cell lung cancer. The study aims to improve efficiency, reliability, and conserve tissue samples for spatial biology research.

title: A Robust Malaria Cell Detection Framework Using Adaptive and Atrous Convolution-Based Recurrent Mobilenetv2 with Trans-MobileUNet + + -Based Abnormality Segmentation.
main_goals: The paper introduces a deep learning-based method for malaria cell detection using medical images. It proposes the Trans-MobileUNet++ network for abnormality segmentation and the Adaptive and Atrous Convolution-based Recurrent MobilenetV2 (AA-CRMV2) model for malaria cell recognition. The efficiency of the model is enhanced by optimizing the parameters from the AA-CRMV2 network with the help of the Updated Random Parameter-based Fennec Fox Optimization (URP-FFO) algorithm.

title: Interpreting single-cell and spatial omics data using deep neural network training dynamics.
main_goals: The paper introduces Annotatability, a framework for identifying annotation mismatches and characterizing biological data structure by monitoring deep neural network training dynamics. It aims to address challenges in genomic data interpretation, including identifying erroneous annotations and delineating cellular trajectories. The framework uses a signal-aware graph embedding method for downstream analysis.

title: Hypoxia regulates small extracellular vesicle biogenesis and cargo sorting through HIF-1α/HRS signaling pathway in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: This study investigates how hypoxia influences small extracellular vesicle (sEV) biogenesis and cargo sorting in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) cells. The researchers found that hypoxia upregulates HRS, which activates the endosomal system and impacts the packaging of protein cargoes into sEVs. They also demonstrated that HRS is transcriptionally activated by HIF-1α.

title: Deciphering the effects of radiopharmaceutical therapy in the tumor microenvironment of prostate cancer: an in-silico exploration with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper investigates the effects of radiopharmaceutical therapy (RPT) in the tumor microenvironment of prostate cancer using spatial transcriptomics and computational modeling. It aims to determine dosimetry and cell survival probability of RPT to identify optimal personalized RPT strategies.  The study compares the efficacy of different RPT strategies targeting PSMA, FAP, and GRPR labeled with different radioisotopes.

title: Gut microbiota depletion and FXR inhibition exacerbates zonal hepatotoxicity of sunitinib.
biological_context: Liver injury in mice induced by Sunitinib
main_goals: The study investigates the zonated hepatotoxicity of sunitinib. It examines the impact of gut microbiota depletion and FXR inhibition on liver injury induced by the drug. The research aims to identify potential therapeutic targets to mitigate sunitinib-induced hepatotoxicity.

title: Spatial omics-based machine learning algorithms for the early detection of hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: The paper aims to identify new biomarkers for the early detection of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using a spatial omics N-glycan imaging method. It identifies altered glycosylation in cancer tissue and serum, leading to the development of machine learning algorithms for differentiating early-stage and all HCC from cirrhosis.

title: Detecting global and local hierarchical structures in cell-cell communication using CrossChat.
biological_context: COVID-19 patients and mouse embryonic skin; mouse embryo and mouse wounded skin
main_goals: The paper introduces CrossChat, a novel computational framework. It aims to infer and analyze hierarchical cell-cell communication structures. The framework employs a multi-resolution clustering method for global structure and a tree detection method for local structures.

title: Enhancing immuno-oncology investigations through multidimensional decoding of tumor microenvironment with IOBR 2.0.
main_goals: This paper introduces IOBR 2.0, an upgraded package for analyzing the tumor microenvironment (TME) based on multi-omics data. IOBR 2.0 provides six modules for TME analysis, including data preprocessing, TME estimation, and feature visualization. The pipeline aims to provide comprehensive insights into tumor-immune interactions.

title: Geometric preprocessing for measurements of comet 67P acquired by Rosetta's Visible and InfraRed Thermal Imaging Spectrometer, Mapping channel (VIRTIS-M).
main_goals: The paper focuses on improving the wavelength-dependent co-registration and spatial consistency of radiometric calibration for hyperspectral images of comet 67P. This is achieved by applying a feature-based image matching method and addressing geometric distortions and errors within the instrument.

title: Defects in the H3t Gene Cause an Increase in Leydig Cells With Impaired Spermatogenesis in Mice.
main_goals: The study investigates somatic cell dynamics in testicular tissue lacking spermatogenesis in mice with deletion of the H3t gene. The research aims to understand the role of Leydig cells in spermatogenesis and their response to changes in germ cell development. The findings suggest that Leydig cells monitor the progress of spermatogenesis and potentially promote functional germ cell formation.

title: Quantifying residents' exposure to agricultural pesticides using new geospatial approaches.
main_goals: The study aimed to develop a geospatial approach for mapping agricultural pesticide exposure in Wallonia, Belgium. It utilized pesticide application rates, crop distribution data, and population data to estimate exposure metrics. The study's goal was to provide a valuable basis for research and environmental health actions, and help policy-makers to control and reduce the load of agricultural pesticides.

title: SMART: spatial transcriptomics deconvolution using marker-gene-assisted topic model.
main_goals: The paper introduces SMART, a marker gene-assisted deconvolution method for spatial transcriptomics. It aims to infer cell type-specific gene expression profiles and cellular composition at each spot. The method's performance is validated using multiple datasets and enhanced for cell subtypes.

title: Desorption Electrospray Ionization-Mass Spectrometry Imaging-Based Spatial Metabolomics for Visualizing and Comparing Ginsenosides and Lipids among Multiple Parts and Positions of the Panax ginseng Root.
main_goals: This study develops desorption electrospray ionization-mass spectrometry imaging approaches and spatial metabolomics strategies to visualize and differentiate different parts of Panax ginseng root. The study identifies potential chemical markers (ginsenosides and lipids) for these different parts and positions within the root. The results aim to enhance understanding of bioactive molecule accumulation and benefit quality control and rational use.

title: Application of metabolomics in quality control of traditional Chinese medicines: a review.
main_goals: This article reviews the application of metabolomics in the quality control of traditional Chinese medicines. It discusses the factors affecting the chemical characteristics and quality traits of TCM and the current challenges of integrating metabolomics with other omics technologies. The paper highlights future development trends and prospects.

title: ATP2A3 in Primary Aldosteronism: Machine Learning-Based Discovery and Functional Validation.
main_goals: This paper uses machine learning to identify ATP2A3 as a key gene in aldosterone-producing adenomas (APAs). It validates the findings through spatial transcriptomics and in vitro/in vivo experiments, demonstrating ATP2A3's role in regulating CYP11B2 expression and aldosterone production.

title: Spatial transcriptomics deciphers the immunosuppressive microenvironment in colorectal cancer with tumour thrombus.
main_goals: This paper investigates the immunosuppressive microenvironment in colorectal cancer with tumour thrombus using spatial transcriptomics. The study likely aims to identify key genes, cell types, and spatial relationships involved in the immune response within the tumor.

title: Microarray integrated spatial transcriptomics (MIST) for affordable and robust digital pathology.
main_goals: This paper introduces Microarray Integrated Spatial Transcriptomics (MIST) as a cost-effective alternative to 10X Visium, using tissue microarray (TMA) with Visium. The design allows for independent replication and customization. It also presents 'AnnotateMap', a novel computational tool for efficient analysis of multiple ROIs processed through MIST.

title: Systemic coordination of whole-body tissue remodeling during local regeneration in sea anemones.
main_goals: The paper investigates the systemic response and coordination of whole-body remodeling during local regeneration in sea anemones. It uses spatial transcriptomics, protein tagging, and live imaging to dissect the systemic response at the organismal scale. The study identifies proteolysis, driven by metalloproteases, as a critical process that scales with tissue loss and drives long-range tissue and extracellular matrix movement, contributing to shape homeostasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in focal cortical dysplasia type IIb.
main_goals: The paper investigates transcriptional changes in the regions of dysmorphic neurons (DNs) and balloon cells (BCs) in focal cortical dysplasia type IIb using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify gene enrichment networks and functional modules related to the DNs and BCs, providing a spatial map of their potential effects. The study also generates publicly available data to facilitate future research on human epileptogenesis.

title: Deciphering spatial domains from spatially resolved transcriptomics through spatially regularized deep graph networks.
main_goals: This paper introduces SR-DGN, a novel framework for spatial domain identification in spatial transcriptomics. It integrates gene expression profiles with spatial information using graph attention networks and spatial regularization to learn spatially-consistent and informative spot representations, mitigating the effects of gene dropouts.

title: Granzyme K<sup>+</sup>CD8<sup>+</sup> T cells interact with fibroblasts to promote neutrophilic inflammation in nasal polyps.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of Granzyme K+ CD8+ T cells in promoting neutrophilic inflammation in nasal polyps. The study identifies a specific interaction between these T cells and fibroblasts, leading to the production of neutrophil chemoattractants. The research aims to understand the mechanisms of therapy resistance in chronic rhinosinusitis.

title: Spatial profiling of the mouse colonic immune landscape associated with colitis and sex.
main_goals: This paper uses multiplex immunofluorescence to profile the infiltration of immune cell populations in the mouse colon with spatial context. It aims to characterize the colonic immune landscape, quantify cell-cell interactions, and reveal sex differences in the context of colitis.

title: ATR inhibition potentiates FOLFIRINOX cytotoxic effect in models of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma by remodelling the tumour microenvironment.
main_goals: The study investigates the synergistic effect of FOLFIRINOX and VE-822 combination in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) models to overcome drug resistance. It aims to assess tumor growth, immune, and fibrotic microenvironment changes using various techniques, including immunohistochemistry, single-cell analysis, and spatial proteomics in PDX and KPC mouse models. The combination strategy is evaluated as a promising approach to enhance FOLFIRINOX efficacy and overcome drug resistance in PDAC.

title: Spatiotemporal analysis of lung immune dynamics in lethal Coccidioides posadasii infection.
biological_context: lung disease caused by inhalation of Coccidioides fungi
main_goals: The paper characterizes lung responses during Coccidioides infection using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies monocyte-derived Spp1-expressing macrophages involved in tissue remodeling and fibrosis and observes neutrophil infiltration and defective lymphocyte responses. These findings aim to improve understanding of Coccidioides infection and suggest new therapeutic targets.

title: Multi-omics analysis unveils the role of inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts in chordoma progression.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts (iCAFs) in chordoma progression. It uses multi-omics approaches to determine the heterogeneity, spatial distribution, and clinical significance of CAFs in chordoma. The findings suggest iCAFs promote malignant progression and could inform new therapeutic strategies.

title: Single Cell Deletion of the Transcription Factors Trps1 and Sox9 in Astrocytes Reveals Novel Functions in the Adult Cerebral Cortex.
main_goals: This study investigates the function of Trps1 and Sox9 transcription factors in adult astrocytes within the cerebral cortex. The authors use Cas9-mediated deletion and single-cell/spatial transcriptomics to analyze the impact of the deletions on astrocytes and their interaction with other glial and immune cells. The study reveals TF-specific functions, specifically related to synapse maintenance and immune response.

title: Spatio-temporal transcriptomics of chromothriptic SHH-medulloblastoma identifies multiple genetic clones that resist treatment and drive relapse.
main_goals: The study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze chromothriptic medulloblastomas, revealing increased spatial heterogeneity, clone-specific features, and treatment resistance. It identifies multiple genetic clones that contribute to relapse and highlights tumor microtubes as potential targets for intervention.

title: Synovial tissue myeloid dendritic cell subsets exhibit distinct tissue-niche localization and function in health and rheumatoid arthritis.
main_goals: The study investigates dendritic cell (DC) populations in human synovial tissue (ST) to identify pathways for restoring immune tolerance in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). Using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, the researchers identified condition- and niche-specific DC clusters with distinct functions. The aim is to target pathogenic DC3s or restore tolerogenic DC2s to restore immune homeostasis in RA joints.

title: Genetic and therapeutic heterogeneity shape the baseline and longitudinal immune ecosystem of ovarian clear cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the immune landscape of ovarian clear cell carcinoma (OCCC) using multi-omics approaches. It aims to identify the role of ARID1A mutations and tumor microenvironment remodeling in immune activation and progression. The research also explores the therapeutic potential of anti-VEGF and anti-PD-1 combination therapy.

title: A Multi-task learning U-Net model for end-to-end HEp-2 cell image analysis.
main_goals: The paper proposes a Multi-Task Learning (MTL) U-Net model to address three tasks in the diagnosis of autoimmune diseases: HEp-2 cell specimen intensity classification, specimen segmentation, and pattern classification. The model aims to provide an end-to-end approach to tackle these tasks simultaneously. The results show that the proposed approach outperforms state-of-the-art methods.

title: stMMR: accurate and robust spatial domain identification from spatially resolved transcriptomics with multimodal feature representation.
biological_context: Chicken heart development, breast cancer, and lung cancer
main_goals: The paper introduces stMMR, a multimodal geometric deep learning method for accurate spatial domain identification from spatially resolved transcriptomics data. It integrates gene expression, spatial location, and histological information. Comprehensive benchmark analysis on various types of spatial data shows superior performance.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data enhances differential gene expression analysis results of AD-related phenotypes.
main_goals: This study integrates spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data to enhance the power of spatially-informed cell-type specific differential gene expression analysis of Alzheimer's disease-related phenotypes. The study aims to identify genes and pathways associated with AD-related phenotypes that are not detectable by traditional methods, and potentially provide CLS-CTS targets for developing AD therapeutics.
