It performs multiple spatial analysis tasks including cell-type deconvolution, identification of spatial expression patterns, and inference of intercellular interactions. The model aims to provide better accuracy and explainability in analyzing spatial transcriptomes.

title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals IRF7 regulation of the tumor microenvironment in isocitrate dehydrogenase wild-type glioma.
main_goals: To analyze the gene expression regulatory network (GRN) in IDH wild-type gliomas using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified IRF7 as a key transcription factor enriched in microglia/macrophages within the tumor microenvironment and validated its role in glioma progression. A transcriptional regulatory activity map for IDH wild-type gliomas is presented.

title: Highly Multiplexed Immunofluorescence PhenoCycler Panel for Murine Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded Tissues Yields Insight Into Tumor Microenvironment Immunoengineering.
main_goals: Introduce and validate a novel 28-antibody PhenoCycler panel and workflow for murine FFPE tissues. Detail an analysis pipeline for the resulting spatial proteomics data. Apply the panel and analysis to study the effects of gene delivery therapies on the tumor immune microenvironment.

title: Feasibility and potential of terahertz spectral and imaging technology for Apple Valsa canker detection: A preliminary investigation.
biological_context: Apple Valsa canker (AVC) in apple tree branches
main_goals: To investigate the feasibility and potential of Terahertz Spectral and Imaging technology for detecting Apple Valsa canker (AVC) at an early stage. The study applied spectral and imaging analysis with machine learning to differentiate healthy and infected samples and demonstrate the approach's feasibility.

title: Unsupervised cervical cell instance segmentation method integrating cellular characteristics.
main_goals: Propose an unsupervised method for cervical cell instance segmentation. The method integrates cellular characteristics (nucleus-cytoplasm structure, self-similarity, color, shape) to generate high-quality pseudo-labels for training. The goal is to overcome the dependency on large manually annotated datasets.

title: Super Resolved Single-Cell Spatial Metabolomics from Multimodal Mass Spectrometry Imaging guided by Imaging Mass Cytometry.
main_goals: Propose a guided super-resolution (GSR) approach using high-resolution IMC images to enhance the spatial resolution of low-resolution MSI data. Create high-resolution metabolite maps to facilitate more precise analysis of cellular structures and tissue architectures, enabling super-resolved spatial metabolomics at the single-cell level.

title: Spatiotemporal lineage tracing reveals the dynamic spatial architecture of tumor growth and metastasis.
biological_context: Lung adenocarcinoma in Kras;p53 mouse model, tumor progression, metastasis
main_goals: To elucidate how tumor expansion, plasticity, and metastasis co-evolve with microenvironmental remodeling using integrated high-resolution spatial transcriptomics and lineage tracing in a mouse model of lung adenocarcinoma. The study aims to reveal how changes in cancer cell state and microenvironmental structures cooperate to promote tumor progression and metastasis.

title: Computational Identification of Migrating T cells in Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment (TME), T cell migration, Antitumor immunity
main_goals: Develop ReMiTT, a computational method to identify T cell migration patterns (trails) in spatial transcriptomics data from tumors. Characterize the molecular and cellular features of these trails to gain insights into tumor-immune dynamics.

title: Live cell fluorescence microscopy-an end-to-end workflow for high-throughput image and data analysis.
biological_context: Cell-walled cells (yeast, fungi, plants, bacteria), yeast
main_goals: Introduce a gentle live cell immobilization method for cell-walled cells. Present an automated workflow for fluorescence microscopy image and data analysis using Cellpose and Fiji macros. Enable unbiased, high-throughput analysis of parameters like protein localization, intensity, and morphology.

title: Exploring Cellular Heterogeneity: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics of Alzheimer Disease Brains and iPSC-Derived Microglia.
main_goals: To create a comprehensive atlas of microglial states by integrating single-cell and spatially resolved transcriptomics data from human and experimental AD brains. The study aims to reveal the heterogeneity, enrichment, and spatial localization of specific microglial states, particularly activated microglia, in relation to amyloid plaques and cortical layers in AD.

title: HIV persists in late coronary atheroma and is associated with increased local inflammation and disease progression.
biological_context: Coronary atherosclerosis in people living with HIV
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between HIV persistence, inflammation, and atherosclerosis progression in coronary arteries and aortas of PLWH. It uses spatial transcriptomics, DNA/RNA assays, and mass spectrometry to identify local inflammatory changes in late atheroma. Key findings are validated in a larger clinical cohort.

title: Revealing molecular mechanisms of early-onset tongue cancer by spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Early-onset tongue cancer compared to older-onset tongue cancer
main_goals: To reveal molecular mechanisms of early-onset tongue cancer in young adults compared with older patients using spatial transcriptomics and other omics data. The study aims to identify distinct transcriptomic features and pathways in early-onset disease, including oxidative stress, vascular mimicry, MAPK/JAK-STAT, and changes in the tumor microenvironment.

title: GraphCVAE: Uncovering cell heterogeneity and therapeutic target discovery through residual and contrastive learning.
biological_context: Dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, Glioblastoma, Colorectal cancer
main_goals: Introduce GraphCVAE, a novel model integrating spatial and morphological information with residual and contrastive learning for spatial domain identification. The model aims to correct batch effects and manage heterogeneous data. It demonstrates improved performance and provides biological insights in various spatial transcriptomics datasets.

title: Reprogramming of epidermal keratinocytes by PITX1 transforms the cutaneous cellular landscape and promotes wound healing.
biological_context: Wound healing in murine skin and oral mucosa, focusing on epidermal keratinocytes and PITX1 transcription factor
main_goals: To investigate the role of PITX1 transcription factor in reprogramming epidermal keratinocytes, altering the cutaneous cellular landscape, and promoting wound healing in mice. The study uses single-cell RNA-Seq and spatial transcriptomics to compare engineered skin with oral mucosa.

title: Long-term exposure to triclocarban induces splenic injuries in mice: Insights from spatial metabolomics and lipidomics.
main_goals: Investigate the effects of long-term triclocarban (TCC) exposure on the mouse spleen using spatial metabolomics and lipidomics. Determine the spatial distribution of TCC and its metabolites within the spleen and identify region-specific metabolic disruptions. Provide insights into the potential risks of TCC exposure to immune function by highlighting biochemical impact.

title: Multiresolution Analysis of HRRR Meteorological Parameters and GOES-R AOD for Hourly PM<sub>2.5</sub> Prediction.
main_goals: To develop a machine learning model for predicting hourly PM2.5 at 1 km spatial resolution. This involves filling gaps in satellite AOD data and using wavelet analysis for preprocessing meteorological data before integrating them into the model.

title: Dynamic Evolution of Fibroblasts Revealed by Single-Cell RNA Sequencing of Human Pancreatic Cancer.
main_goals: To study the dynamics of fibroblasts in human pancreatic cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify temporal and spatial trajectories of fibroblast differentiation and explore complex intercellular communication networks in the tumor microenvironment to find new therapeutic targets.

title: Lifetime mapping using femtosecond time-resolved photoemission electron microscopy.
main_goals: The paper describes a detailed data pre-processing procedure and an algorithm for performing time-trace fittings of each pixel in time-resolved photoemission electron microscopy (PEEM) data. By imposing an energy cutoff and integrating, the method improves statistics and accuracy of decay time constants. The main goal is to enable reliable construction of PEEM-based lifetime maps to study material ultrafast processes.

title: Seq-Scope: repurposing Illumina sequencing flow cells for high-resolution spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: Introduce Seq-Scope, a novel method repurposing Illumina flow cells for high-resolution spatial transcriptomics. Provide a detailed protocol for tissue processing, library preparation, and computational analysis, including a segmentation-free method. Offer a scalable, cost-effective solution compared to commercial alternatives.

title: Comprehensive analysis of lactylation-related gene sets and mitochondrial functions in gastric adenocarcinoma: implications for prognosis and therapeutic strategies.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the prognostic significance of lactylation-related gene sets and mitochondrial functions in gastric adenocarcinoma using multi-omics data including spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. The goals were to delineate the tumor microenvironment, identify prognostic molecular subtypes, build predictive models, and analyze immune landscapes to inform therapeutic strategies.

title: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D space.
biological_context: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions across 6 cancer types
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To study spatial tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D using Visium ST, snRNA-seq, and CODEX. To define tumour microregions and spatial subclones, analyze their characteristics and immune cell infiltration, and reconstruct 3D tumour structures.

title: Consensus tissue domain detection in spatial omics data using multiplex image labeling with regional morphology (MILWRM).
biological_context: Diverse human and mouse tissues (colonic polyps, lymph nodes, kidney, brain)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial omics data', 'multiplexed imaging', 'histology images', 'transcriptomic data', 'proteomic data']
main_goals: Present MILWRM (multiplex image labeling with regional morphology), a Python package for rapid, multi-scale tissue domain detection and annotation in spatial omics data. Demonstrate MILWRM's utility in identifying histologically distinct compartments and exploring molecular profiles in various human and mouse tissues across different spatial data modalities.

title: Differential chromatin accessibility and transcriptional dynamics define breast cancer subtypes and their lineages.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk sequencing', 'single-cell analysis', 'single-nucleus analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed imaging', 'chromatin accessibility']
main_goals: To analyze breast cancer subtypes and their lineages by applying bulk, single-cell, single-nucleus multi-omic techniques, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplex imaging. The study aimed to link gene expression and chromatin accessibility between BC subtypes and putative cells of origin, identify key regulatory networks and lineage-defining genes, and characterize the immune environment.

title: Detecting significant expression patterns in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics with a flexible computational approach.
main_goals: Introduce SPIRAL, a flexible computational algorithm based on Gaussian statistics to detect statistically significant biological processes in single cell, bulk, and spatial transcriptomics data. The algorithm identifies structures defined by subsets of genes and cells showing consistent differential expression, offering visualizations and pathway enrichment.

title: Spatial proteomics of single cells and organelles on tissue slides using filter-aided expansion proteomics.
biological_context: Human colorectal tissue, single cells and organelles
main_goals: Introduce filter-aided expansion proteomics (FAXP), a new strategy for spatial proteomics of FFPE tissues and single cells/organelles. Demonstrate FAXP's improved performance (resolution, yield, identifications, speed) compared to previous methods. Apply FAXP to human colorectal tissue and achieve single-subcellular proteomics.

title: Challenges and Opportunities in the Clinical Translation of High-Resolution Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper reviews high-resolution spatial transcriptomics technologies, explaining their function and potential for identifying disease mechanisms and guiding personalized therapies. It provides guidance for clinical study design and discusses challenges to clinical translation, highlighting the role of multimodal integration and deep learning.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of meningeal inflammation reveals inflammatory gene signatures in adjacent brain parenchyma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis']
main_goals: To use MRI-guided spatial transcriptomics in a mouse model of meningeal inflammation to characterize spatial transcriptional signatures in inflammatory sites and adjacent brain. The goal was to identify inflammatory pathways, their spatial distribution, and understand the link between meningeal inflammation and gray matter pathology.

title: Recent advances in basic research on prostate cancer: Where we are heading?
main_goals: This review provides an overview of recent basic research in prostate cancer (PCa), focusing on PCa cells and their tumor microenvironments. It discusses AR signaling, genomic alterations, liquid biopsy, the tumor microenvironment, and advanced techniques like scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics for insights into heterogeneity and interactions, aiming to inform future research and personalized medicine.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome characterize coinhibitory cell-cell communications during histological progression of lung adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: Characterize cell-cell communications, specifically coinhibitory interactions, during the histological progression of lung adenocarcinoma using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified key interactions (PD1-PDL1, PVR-TIGIT, TIGIT-NECTIN2) linked to immunosuppression, low immune infiltration, and poor patient outcomes.

title: Integrative spatial and genomic analysis of tumor heterogeneity with Tumoroscope.
data_modalities_used: ['pathological images', 'whole exome sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics data', 'Genomics', 'Exome Sequencing', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Transcriptome', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clone Inference', 'Deconvolution', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To propose Tumoroscope, a probabilistic model integrating pathological images, whole exome sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to infer cancer clones and their spatial localization. The method deconvolutes clone proportions in spatial spots and infers clone-specific gene expression levels. It enables integrated spatial, genomic, and phenotypic analysis of tumors.

title: Multiparameter imaging reveals clinically relevant cancer cell-stroma interaction dynamics in head and neck cancer.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Phenotype analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Correlation Analysis']
main_goals: Identify clinically relevant tumor phenotypes and signatures in HNSCC using multiparameter imaging and single-cell analysis. Investigate the interplay between stromal and epithelial compartments, specifically the CAF-pEMT axis, using spatial transcriptomics and other methods to understand mechanisms driving cancer aggression and discover prognostic/predictive signatures.

title: Multimodal contrastive learning for spatial gene expression prediction using histology images.
biological_context: Breast cancer, Skin squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: Propose mclSTExp, a multimodal contrastive learning method using Transformer and Densenet-121, to predict spatial gene expression from histology images. Integrate image features and spatial context via contrastive learning and self-attention. Evaluate performance and demonstrate interpretability on cancer datasets.

title: The co-location of MARCO+ tumor-associated macrophages and CTSE+ tumor cells determined the poor prognosis in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze immune infiltration patterns in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (ICC) using combined spatial and single-cell transcriptomic data. It sought to identify distinct immune patterns, assess their prognostic impact, characterize specific cell types (MARCO+ TAMs, CTSE+ tumor cells), analyze their spatial co-location, and identify associated pathways and cell-cell interactions contributing to prognosis and the tumor microenvironment.

title: LnCeCell 2.0: an updated resource for lncRNA-associated ceRNA networks and web tools based on single-cell and spatial transcriptomics sequencing data.
biological_context: Broad range of human normal tissues, diseases, and cancers (specifically focused on lncRNA-ceRNA networks)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Regulatory Networks', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Visualization']
main_goals: LnCeCell 2.0 is an updated online resource and suite of web tools for analyzing lncRNA-associated ceRNA networks. It integrates large datasets from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to provide cell-specific and spatial spot-specific network analysis, aiming to facilitate the study of regulatory mechanisms at high resolution.

title: BayeSMART: Bayesian clustering of multi-sample spatially resolved transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Introduce BayeSMART, a Bayesian statistical method for identifying spatial domains across multiple spatially resolved transcriptomics samples. The method incorporates AI-reconstructed single-cell information from histology images and considers spatial context. The paper validates BayeSMART against existing methods across diverse datasets.

title: Bayesian inference for group-level cortical surface image-on-scalar regression with Gaussian process priors.
data_modalities_used: ['Neuroimaging', 'Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'functional magnetic resonance imaging', 'cortical surface image']
main_goals: To contribute a Bayesian spatial regression model for group-level neuroimaging analyses. The model uses Gaussian process priors for spatial regularization and a Vecchia-type approximation for computational tractability. It aims to provide more powerful and data-adaptive smoothing compared to standard methods.

title: Effects of neighbourhood characteristics on the distribution of vacant houses in Toda city, a satellite city of Tokyo metropolis of japan.
main_goals: Investigate the relationship between vacant house distribution and neighbourhood characteristics in Toda City. Compare traditional statistical data analysis with spatial data analysis (using Moran's I and multiscale geographically weighted regression) to evaluate their effectiveness and identify factors associated with vacancy rates.

title: Seeing or believing in hyperplexed spatial proteomics via antibodies: New and old biases for an image-based technology.
main_goals: This paper re-evaluates steps in hyperplexed spatial proteomics via antibody immunodetection, highlighting biases from human visual evaluation and traditional methods. It introduces BRAQUE, a tool designed to extract granular information from low signal-to-noise markers. The study uses a public human lymph node dataset to demonstrate the tool's capabilities and identify issues with antibody specificity in this context.

title: Rigor and Reproducibility of Digital Spatial Profiling on Clinically Sourced Human Tissues.
main_goals: To vet technical reproducibility, data normalization methods, and assay sensitivity of digital spatial profiling (DSP) on clinically sourced human tissues. The study aims to understand the performance of DSP under real-world conditions to lay the foundation for its incorporation into clinical workflows.

title: The influence of climate change on the potential distribution of Ageratum conyzoides in China.
main_goals: To predict the potential suitable distribution of Ageratum conyzoides in China under current and future climate conditions using ensemble ecological modeling, identify key environmental variables influencing its distribution, and analyze its climate niche dynamics.

title: Cystic fibrosis-related diabetes is associated with reduced islet protein expression of GLP-1 receptor and perturbation of cell-specific transcriptional programs.
main_goals: To investigate pancreatic pathology in cystic fibrosis-related diabetes (CFRD) by analyzing GLP-1/GLP-1 receptor expression and cell-specific transcriptional programs using immunohistochemistry and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand mechanisms behind impaired insulin secretion in CFRD and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Glial 'omics in ischemia: Acute stroke and chronic cerebral small vessel disease.
biological_context: Ischemic stroke and cerebral small vessel disease
data_modalities_used: ['Transcriptome', 'single cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'translatome analysis', 'multimodal profiling']
main_goals: Review glial 'omics findings, particularly from transcriptional profiling, single cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics, in the context of acute ischemic stroke and chronic cerebral small vessel disease. Discuss methodological advances and future potential for multi-omics approaches.

title: Multiple cell types including melanocytes contribute to elastogenesis in the developing murine aortic valve.
main_goals: To characterize elastin expression timing and spatial distribution in the developing murine aortic valve and identify the cell types, including melanocytes, involved in elastogenesis using spatial transcriptomics and other methods. The study highlights the complex phenotypes of VICs and their role in elastic fiber regulation.

title: STGAT: Graph attention networks for deconvolving spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Propose STGAT, a novel deconvolution method for spatial transcriptomics data using graph attention networks. The method integrates single-cell RNA sequencing data and constructs a comprehensive graph to improve cell-type composition predictions. Extensive experiments demonstrate its superior performance.

title: The mTOR Pathway: A Common Link Between Alzheimer's Disease and Down Syndrome.
main_goals: This paper reviews the potential link between Alzheimer's Disease and Down Syndrome through the mTOR pathway. It highlights the current limitations in understanding the mechanisms of pathology in human DS-related AD and suggests that novel omics platforms, including spatial transcriptomics, could provide valuable insights.

title: Spatially resolved metabolomics: From metabolite mapping to function visualising.
biological_context: Disease context, drug development, translational medicine
main_goals: This paper is a comprehensive review of spatially resolved metabolomics based on Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI). It highlights recent advancements in MSI instrumentation, preprocessing methods, and functional visualization techniques. The review also discusses the potential applications of this technology in translational medicine and drug development.

title: [Spatio-temporal Situation, Regional Differences, and Dynamic Evolution of the Distribution of Ecological Compensation in the Yellow River Basin].
main_goals: The paper aims to measure the ecological compensation amount for cities in the Yellow River Basin from 2007-2021 using an emergy ecological footprint model. It analyzes the spatiotemporal pattern, regional differences, and dynamic evolution of this compensation using spatial data analysis techniques like Dagum Gini coefficient, kernel density estimation, and spatial Markov chains. The study identifies issues with current compensation distribution and suggests ways to improve it.

title: Standalone single- and bi-layered human skin 3D models supported by recombinant silk feature native spatial organization.
main_goals: The paper investigates the potential of recombinant functionalized spider silk protein (FN-silk) to construct dermal, epidermal, and bilayered human skin equivalent models. It evaluates these models using immunofluorescence and spatially resolved transcriptomics to demonstrate native spatial organization, ECM secretion, microvascular-like structures, stratification, and barrier formation. The goal is to propose these FN-silk-based models as physiologically relevant standalone or combined skin equivalents.

title: Protocol for whole-slide image analysis of human multiplexed tumor tissues using QuPath and R.
main_goals: Present a detailed protocol/workflow for analyzing whole-slide spatial proteomics images of human tumor tissues. The protocol covers steps such as cell segmentation, cell phenotyping, intercellular distance calculation, and data visualization using tools like QuPath and R.

title: StereoSiTE: a framework to spatially and quantitatively profile the cellular neighborhood organized iTME.
main_goals: Introduce StereoSiTE, an analytical framework to spatially and quantitatively profile cellular neighborhoods and infer spatial cell interaction intensity (SCII) in the tumor microenvironment. Apply StereoSiTE to spatial transcriptomics data from xenograft models to gain insights into cellular interactions and treatment response mechanisms.

title: Convolutional Neural Network Incorporating Multiple Attention Mechanisms for MRI Classification of Lumbar Spinal Stenosis.
main_goals: Develop a convolutional neural network integrated with multiple attention mechanisms for automated classification of Lumbar Spinal Stenosis using MRI images. Improve diagnosis accuracy and robustness and demonstrate the impact of attention mechanisms on performance.

title: A robust statistical approach for finding informative spatially associated pathways.
main_goals: Introduce a novel statistical framework, STpathway, to identify biological pathways associated with spatial variability in spatial transcriptomics data. The method adapts the Brownian distance covariance test and aims to be free of gene/parameter selection, allowing for complex dependencies. It facilitates understanding functional heterogeneity and coordination across spatial domains.

title: Redefining the tumor microenvironment with emerging therapeutic strategies.
main_goals: Review the role of the tumor microenvironment (TME) in cancer progression and treatment response. Discuss emerging therapeutic strategies targeting the TME, including extracellular vesicles, immune checkpoint inhibitors, and adoptive cell transfer therapies. Highlight how technologies like single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics contribute to understanding the TME and developing precision oncology approaches.

title: UBL3 Interacts with PolyQ-Expanded Huntingtin Fragments and Modifies Their Intracellular Sorting.
main_goals: This study investigates the interaction between UBL3 and polyQ-expanded mutant huntingtin fragments (mHTT) in Huntington's disease using postmortem brain tissue and cellular assays. The goal is to understand how UBL3 influences mHTT sorting and its potential role in pathogenesis. Findings show UBL3 colocalizes and interacts with mHTT and modifies its intracellular sorting.

title: MALDI MSI Protocol for Spatial Bottom-Up Proteomics at Single-Cell Resolution.
main_goals: This study presents an optimized MALDI-MSI protocol for spatial bottom-up proteomics at single-cell resolution. The protocol aims to achieve high spatial resolution and improve sample preparation for single-cell measurements. It demonstrates the method's feasibility by applying it to breast cancer cells and identifying peptides/proteins.

title: Single-Cell Meta-Analysis Uncovers the Pancreatic Endothelial Cell Transcriptomic Signature and Reveals a Key Role for NKX2-3 in PLVAP Expression.
main_goals: Define a validated transcriptomic signature of pancreatic ECs, uncover intratissue transcriptomic heterogeneity, and show that NKX2-3 acts upstream of PLVAP. Provide an online resource for the community.

title: SPOT: spatial proteomics through on-site tissue-protein-labeling.
main_goals: Introduce and validate SPOT (Spatial Proteomics through On-site Tissue-protein-labeling), a novel method for spatially-resolved proteomics. SPOT combines direct protein labeling on tissue slides with quantitative mass spectrometry. The method's efficacy and versatility were demonstrated on different tissue types and biological systems (mouse brain, human prostate cancer).

title: Spatial Transcriptomics: A New Frontier in Atherosclerosis Research?
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomics', 'single-cell gene expression analysis', 'sequence analysis, RNA']
main_goals: To discuss the potential and applications of spatial transcriptomics as a new frontier in atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease research.

title: CellSAM: Advancing Pathologic Image Cell Segmentation via Asymmetric Large-Scale Vision Model Feature Distillation Aggregation Network.
main_goals: Introduce an innovative cell segmentation algorithm, CellSAM, based on the Segment Anything Model (SAM) for precise cell nucleus segmentation in challenging pathologic images. Utilize techniques like knowledge distillation and mask fusion to enhance effectiveness, precision, and adaptability. Demonstrate superior performance compared to existing methods and show potential for clinical applications.

title: Single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics of paediatric ovary: Molecular insights into the dysregulated signalling pathways underlying premature ovarian insufficiency in classic galactosemia.
biological_context: Paediatric ovary, Classic Galactosemia (CG), Premature Ovarian Insufficiency (POI)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To investigate dynamic changes in gene expression and altered signalling pathways in paediatric ovary tissue from girls with classic galactosemia (CG) using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The goal is to identify molecular mechanisms underlying premature ovarian insufficiency (POI) in CG.

title: Senescent Syncytiotrophoblast Secretion During Early Onset Preeclampsia.
main_goals: To identify novel markers and signaling pathways for early onset preeclampsia using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. Identified elevated syncytiotrophoblast senescence markers (PAI-1, activin A) weeks before clinical diagnosis, suggesting their potential as early diagnostic tools.

title: Spatial transcriptomics: a new frontier in accurate localization of breast cancer diagnosis and treatment.
main_goals: This review summarizes the latest findings on the use of spatial transcriptomics for breast cancer diagnosis and treatment. It focuses on how spatial transcriptomics reveals the tumor microenvironment, tumor heterogeneity, identifies therapeutic targets, enhances diagnostic accuracy, aids understanding of progression/metastasis, assesses drug responses, and supports clinical decision-making, particularly regarding immunotherapy and clinical outcomes.

title: STASCAN deciphers fine-resolution cell distribution maps in spatial transcriptomics by deep learning.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'gene expression profiles', 'histology images', 'sequencing', 'multimodal data integration']
main_goals: Develops STASCAN, a deep-learning approach integrating gene expression and histology images to predict fine-resolution spatial cell distribution maps. Aims to overcome resolution limitations in spatial transcriptomics and is shown to improve cellular distribution deciphering and organizational structure resolution.

title: METASPACE-ML: Context-specific metabolite annotation for imaging mass spectrometry using machine learning.
main_goals: Develop a machine learning-based approach (METASPACE-ML) for context-specific metabolite annotation in imaging mass spectrometry. Improve performance (precision, throughput, identification of low-intensity metabolites) compared to the previous rule-based method.

title: Attenuated kidney oxidative metabolism in young adults with type 1 diabetes.
biological_context: Diabetic kidney disease in young adults with type 1 diabetes
main_goals: To investigate the relationship between impaired insulin sensitivity and kidney oxidative metabolism in young adults with type 1 diabetes using multi-omics approaches. The study aimed to identify early structural and metabolic changes potentially preceding clinical diabetic kidney disease. Key analyses involved single-cell RNA-Seq and spatial metabolomics.

title: Towards generative digital twins in biomedical research.
biological_context: Multiple biomedical fields (computational pathology, oncology, cardiology), cells, organs, organisms
main_goals: This paper reviews advancements in generative digital twins (GDT) for biomedical research. It discusses how generative AI and spatial technologies enable high-fidelity spatial representations for *in silico* modeling and simulated interventions. The paper outlines applications in fields like pathology, oncology, and cardiology and discusses challenges and future directions.

title: RUNX2 as a novel biomarker for early identification of patients progressing to advanced-stage mycosis fungoides.
main_goals: The main goal was to identify biomarkers for predicting progression to advanced-stage mycosis fungoides (MF) using spatial transcriptomics and scRNA-seq on patient samples. They found RUNX2, SHMT2, and MCM7 were upregulated in malignant T-cells of progressing patients, highlighting RUNX2 as a potential novel biomarker. The study also aimed to show the power of integrating spatial and single-cell omics for such discoveries.

title: Guiding treatment decisions in renal cell carcinoma: the role of biomarkers and clinical factors.
biological_context: Renal cell carcinoma (RCC), metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC)
main_goals: Review biomarkers and clinical factors for guiding treatment decisions in renal cell carcinoma. Highlight the urgent need for reliable predictive biomarkers for ICI response/resistance. Discuss emerging areas like spatial transcriptomics and the role of clinical factors.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal apelin/APJ pathway's role in microvessel formation and tumour progression in hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of the apelin/APJ pathway in hepatocellular carcinoma using multi-omics, including spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It aims to localize pathway components, analyze their function in tumour progression and angiogenesis, and identify prognostic biomarkers and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Spatial-transcriptomic profiling: a new lens for understanding myelofibrosis pathophysiology.
main_goals: This paper reviews how spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) can be used to understand the pathophysiology of Myelofibrosis (MF). It discusses how SRT provides insights into cellular heterogeneity, spatial gene regulation, and microenvironmental interactions in the bone marrow and spleen, potentially identifying novel therapeutic targets and biomarkers for MF.

title: An integrated three-stream network model for discriminating fish feeding intensity using multi-feature analysis and deep learning.
biological_context: Pearl gentian grouper feeding behavior in aquaculture
main_goals: To propose an integrated three-stream network model combining computer vision and CNN for discriminating fish feeding intensity (none, weak, strong). The method uses temporal, spatial, and statistical features extracted from feeding images. The goal is to provide a scientific basis for intelligent fish feeding in aquaculture to reduce waste.

title: CXC chemokine receptor 4 - mediated immune modulation and tumor microenvironment heterogeneity in gastric cancer: Utilizing multi-omics approaches to identify potential therapeutic targets.
main_goals: Explore the immune regulatory functions of CXCR4 and the heterogeneity of the tumor microenvironment in gastric cancer using multi-omics approaches including spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. The study investigated CXCR4's role in T cell immune exhaustion and identified it as a potential therapeutic target by reducing Tregs-mediated immune exhaustion and TME heterogeneity.

title: Integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal microenvironment disruptions by androgen in mouse ovary.
main_goals: To examine subpopulation and function alterations in the mouse ovary in an androgen-induced PCOS-like model using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study reveals specific cell subset expansions and functional shifts (inflammation, lipid metabolism) in granulosa and thecal cells, along with altered intercellular signaling, characterizing the ovarian microenvironment disruption.

title: Statistical analysis of multiple regions-of-interest in multiplexed spatial proteomics data.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer, colorectal cancer, triple negative breast cancer
main_goals: Evaluate existing and propose novel statistical methods (ensemble testing) for associating spatial summary statistics derived from multiple regions-of-interest in spatial proteomics data with clinical outcomes. Evaluate performance via simulation and real data applications.

title: Perioperative chemoimmunotherapy induces strong immune responses and long-term survival in patients with HLA class I-deficient non-small cell lung cancer.
main_goals: To analyze the efficacy and response mechanisms of perioperative chemoimmunotherapy in NSCLC patients, focusing on the impact of HLA class I deficiency. The study integrates various molecular and spatial data modalities to understand how treatment affects the tumor microenvironment and patient outcomes, particularly in HLA-deficient tumors.

title: A two-front nutrient supply environment fuels small intestinal physiology through differential regulation of nutrient absorption and host defense.
biological_context: Small intestine physiology in mice and humans
main_goals: The study aims to understand how the small intestine's two-front nutrient supply (luminal and systemic) differentially contributes to its physiology, nutrient absorption, and host defense. Using spatial metabolomics and in vivo tracing, they map this environment and reveal specific roles for enteral and serosal nutrients in processes like mucus production and epithelial barrier function. The research also highlights the impact of disorganized feeding patterns on epithelial memory of lipid absorption and metabolic health risk.

title: Integrative multi-omics analysis reveals the role of tumor-associated endothelial cells and their signature in prognosis of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study aims to reveal the role of tumor-associated endothelial cells (TECs) in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (ICC) prognosis and their interaction with the tumor microenvironment using multi-omics data. It identifies TEC signatures (TEC.Sig), calculates TEC scores, and investigates their correlation with genetic mutations, immune infiltration, and immunotherapy response. The study highlights the CXCL12/CXCR4 axis as a potential therapeutic target and proposes the TEC score as a prognostic biomarker.

title: A comprehensive review of approaches for spatial domain recognition of spatial transcriptomes.
main_goals: This paper reviews the current status and progress of spatial domain recognition research in spatial transcriptomics. It explores the advantages and limitations of existing methods and provides suggestions for future tool development.

title: Combined spatially resolved metabolomics and spatial transcriptomics reveal the mechanism of RACK1-mediated fatty acid synthesis.
main_goals: This paper used integrated spatially resolved metabolomics and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the role of RACK1 in cervical cancer. It found that RACK1 is overexpressed in CC samples and promotes fatty acid synthesis. The study identified the AKT/mTOR/SREBP1 pathway as the mechanism by which RACK1 enhances lipid synthesis and promotes CC cell growth.

title: Single Cell VDJ Sequencing of Normal and Malignant B and T Cells.
biological_context: Normal and malignant B and T cells, including lymphomas, leukemia, and tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in cancer
main_goals: Present detailed methods for performing and analyzing single-cell B and T cell receptor repertoire sequencing using 10x Genomics and BD Rhapsody systems, highlighting their importance in tumor research.

title: Graph attention automatic encoder based on contrastive learning for domain recognition of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper introduces GAAEST, a deep learning method for spatial domain recognition in spatial transcriptomics. It integrates spatial and gene expression data using graph attention networks and contrastive learning. The method aims to outperform existing approaches for identifying spatial domains by clustering optimized embeddings.

title: Unraveling aging from transcriptomics.
main_goals: This review surveys recent breakthroughs in understanding aging by analyzing different types of transcripts (mRNA, lncRNA, tRNA, miRNA) using various transcriptomic technologies, including bulk RNA-seq, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics. It highlights key findings and discusses their implications for future aging research.

title: Multidimensional analysis of matched primary and recurrent glioblastoma identifies contributors to tumor recurrence influencing time to relapse.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize longitudinal tumor changes in matched primary and recurrent glioblastoma using multi-omics (transcriptomics, proteomics, spatial transcriptomics) to identify contributors to tumor recurrence. It found changes in synapse development, myelination, immune cell composition (activated microglia/macrophages, B/T cells), and oligodendrocyte enrichment in recurrent tumors, correlating findings with time to relapse.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA-seq revealed the specific inhibitory effects of TGF-β on intramuscular fat deposition.
biological_context: Intramuscular fat deposition in skeletal muscle of pigs and mice
main_goals: The paper uses spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA-seq to study intramuscular fat (IMF) deposition in skeletal muscle. It identifies the spatial heterogeneity of IMF and reveals the specific role of the TGF-β signaling pathway in this process. The findings suggest TGF-β as a potential therapeutic target for muscle atrophy and IMF deposition.

title: Single-cell characterization of differentiation trajectories and drug resistance features in gastric cancer with peritoneal metastasis.
main_goals: To characterize cellular differentiation trajectories and drug resistance features within the peritoneal microenvironment of gastric cancer patients with peritoneal metastasis using multi-modal spatial and single-cell technologies. The study aims to unveil key cellular components and interactions driving resistance and suggest potential therapeutic targets.

title: Attention-Guided Residual U-Net with SE Connection and ASPP for Watershed-Based Cell Segmentation in Microscopy Images.
main_goals: Develop a novel deep learning framework (RA-SE-ASPP-Net) for robust and precise automated cell segmentation in microscopy images, addressing challenges like touching cells and low SNR. Evaluate the framework on an induced pluripotent stem cell reprogramming dataset and compare its performance against baseline models.

title: MFLUnet: multi-scale fusion lightweight Unet for medical image segmentation.
main_goals: Propose MFLUnet, a lightweight CNN for medical image segmentation suitable for point-of-care devices. Develop novel modules (MSBDCB, EF) for efficient multi-scale feature fusion with low computational complexity. Validate the network on skin lesion, cell, and ultrasound segmentation tasks.

title: Single-shot quantitative phase microscopy: a multi-functional tool for cell analysis.
main_goals: This study introduces a single-shot quantitative phase microscopy (QPM) system for comprehensive cell analysis. It demonstrates the system's ability to capture images and, combined with computational algorithms, perform tasks like cell segmentation, confluence measurement, and mass estimation for routine biological workflows.

title: Decoding the mosaic of inflammatory bowel disease: Illuminating insights with single-cell RNA technology.
biological_context: Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), Ulcerative Colitis (UC), Crohn's disease (CD)
data_modalities_used: ['Single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell proteomics', 'T-cell receptor repertoire analysis', 'epigenetic profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'CyTOF', 'ATAC-seq', 'Single-cell TCR/BCR']
main_goals: This review summarizes advancements in single-cell sequencing technologies for enhancing the understanding of Inflammatory Bowel Diseases (IBD), covering pathogenesis, diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis. It also discusses challenges, including the need for longitudinal studies, integration of multiple single-cell and spatial transcriptomics technologies, and microbial single-cell RNA-seq.

title: MAPbrain: a multi-omics atlas of the primate brain.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data Integration', 'Normalization', 'Visualization', 'Cell Type Analysis', 'Differential Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To introduce MAPbrain, a multi-omics atlas and interactive platform integrating transcriptomics, epigenomics, and spatial transcriptomics data from primate brains across development. The platform facilitates exploration of cell type- and time point-specific markers, gene expression comparisons, cross-omics analyses, and navigation of cell types across species, regions, and stages. It also allows users to integrate their own data.

title: A multi-modality and multi-granularity collaborative learning framework for identifying spatial domains and spatially variable genes.
main_goals: Propose spaMMCL, a multi-modality and multi-granularity collaborative learning framework. It aims to identify spatial domains by integrating gene expression and image data while mitigating modality bias and dealing with noise. It also detects spatially variable genes related to these domains.

title: SpatialRef: a reference of spatial omics with known spot annotation.
biological_context: Diverse Human, Mouse, and Drosophila tissues
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differentially Expressed Genes', 'Spatially Variable Genes', 'Gene Ontology Annotation', 'KEGG Annotation', 'Spatial Communication', 'Spatial Trajectories', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To develop a manually curated spatial omics database (SpatialRef) with known spot labels across multiple species and tissue types. To provide a comprehensive resource for spatial omics data and facilitate various downstream analyses such as DEG, SVG, GO/KEGG, spatial communication, and trajectory analysis, with a user-friendly interface.

title: Decoding Spatial Tissue Architecture: A Scalable Bayesian Topic Model for Multiplexed Imaging Analysis.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironments, disease progression, various tissue types
main_goals: Introduce SpatialTopic, a scalable Bayesian topic model for decoding spatial tissue architecture across multiplexed images. Address challenges in cellular neighborhood analysis, such as computational demands and integrative analysis. Demonstrate its high scalability, precision, and interpretability through comparisons with existing methods.

title: Vispro improves imaging analysis for Visium spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Develop Vispro, an end-to-end automated image processing tool for 10x Visium data, addressing challenges like fiducial markers and background regions. Demonstrate that Vispro improves the quality of ST images and enhances the performance of downstream analyses such as segmentation and registration.

title: Spatial proteomics identifies JAKi as treatment for a lethal skin disease.
biological_context: Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), a lethal skin disease
main_goals: To systematically map molecular changes associated with Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) using deep visual proteomics to identify potential druggable targets. The study aimed to uncover key pathogenic drivers and demonstrate the potential of targeted JAK inhibitors as a curative therapy for TEN.

title: snPATHO-seq, a versatile FFPE single-nucleus RNA sequencing method to unlock pathology archives.
main_goals: Introduce snPATHO-seq, a novel method for obtaining high-quality single-nucleus RNA sequencing data from FFPE samples. Benchmark its performance against existing methods and demonstrate its robustness across various FFPE tissue types. Highlight its potential for multi-modal analysis when combined with spatial transcriptomics technologies.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of a parasitic flatworm provides a molecular map of drug targets and drug resistance genes.
main_goals: Provide a spatial gene expression atlas for the parasitic flatworm Fasciola hepatica, identify tissue-specific gene expression patterns, and leverage this atlas to pinpoint genes of medical importance, including potential drug targets and resistance factors.

title: DGSIST: Clustering spatial transcriptome data based on deep graph structure Infomax.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Batch Correction']
main_goals: The paper proposes the DGSI model and develops the DGSIST framework for unsupervised cell clustering in spatial transcriptomics data. DGSIST integrates DGSI, SVD, and k-means++ to fully leverage spatial and gene expression information. The goal is to accurately identify cell types and spatial domains, outperform existing methods, and handle batch effects.

title: SELF-Former: multi-scale gene filtration transformer for single-cell spatial reconstruction.
main_goals: Develop SELF-Former, a transformer-based framework for spatial reconstruction of scRNA-seq data into ST data. The method uses multi-scale gene representation learning, spatial correlation constraints, and a novel gene filtration module. It aims to accurately map gene expression to spatial context and mitigate batch effects.

title: Impact of local sports policies in the prevalence of cardiovascular disease: An assessment with spatial data analysis.
main_goals: To empirically assess the statistical relationship between the financial effort of Portuguese municipalities in the implementation of sports policies and the prevalence of cardiovascular diseases. The study aims to validate the impact of local sports policies on CVD mortality rates using spatial data analysis.

title: Enhancing Coffee Agroforestry Systems Suitability Using Geospatial Analysis and Sentinel Satellite Data in Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia.
main_goals: This research aimed to map the coffee coverage and identify land suitability for coffee plantations using remote sensing, GIS, and the Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP) in the Gedeo zone, Southern Ethiopia. The study identified and mapped coffee coverage from Sentinel-1 data and performed multi-criteria analysis using AHP based on environmental and socioeconomic factors. The goal is to provide spatial details for selecting optimal coffee farming locations.

title: A UAV Thermal Imaging Format Conversion System and Its Application in Mosaic Surface Microthermal Environment Analysis.
main_goals: Develop a format conversion system (ThermoSwitcher) for DJI thermal JPG images to Geotiff format. Apply this system to facilitate image stitching and analyze surface microthermal environments, demonstrating its utility for preprocessing and research.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling of Human Saphenous Vein Exposed to Ex Vivo Arterial Haemodynamics-Implications for Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Patency and Vein Graft Disease.
biological_context: Human saphenous vein undergoing ex vivo arterial haemodynamic stimulation, relevant to vein graft disease
main_goals: To analyze the spatial transcriptomic profile of human saphenous vein exposed to ex vivo arterial hemodynamics using Visium technology. The study aims to identify differentially expressed genes and pathways involved in the early stages of vein graft disease.

title: Interpretable spatially aware dimension reduction of spatial transcriptomics with STAMP.
biological_context: Lung cancer, Mouse embryonic development, Liver
covered_analysis_steps: ['Dimension Reduction', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: Introduce STAMP, an interpretable spatially aware dimension reduction method for spatial transcriptomics built on a deep generative model. The method aims to uncover biologically relevant low-dimensional spatial topics and associated gene modules. STAMP is demonstrated on various data types, including single/multiple sections and time-series data, showing its ability to identify biological domains and cell states.

title: Liver Macrophage Diversity in Health and Disease.
biological_context: Liver macrophages in health and disease, including acute liver injury, chronic liver diseases, and hepatocellular carcinoma
main_goals: Review the heterogeneity and multifaceted functions of hepatic macrophages in liver health and disease, including acute liver injury, chronic liver diseases, and hepatocellular carcinoma. Highlight insights gained from single-cell and spatial omics technologies regarding macrophage diversity and plasticity and discuss potential therapeutic implications.

title: Comparison of deep and conventional machine learning models for prediction of one supply chain management distribution cost.
main_goals: The paper aims to predict supply chain management distribution cost (SCMDC) using various machine learning algorithms including RF, SVM, MLP, DT, and CNN. It compares their performance using RMSE and R2 metrics. The goal is to identify the most accurate model for SCMDC prediction.

title: Dual decoding of cell types and gene expression in spatial transcriptomics with PANDA.
main_goals: Introduce PANDA, a novel method for concurrent deconvolution of spatial transcriptomics data into both cell type proportions and cell-type-specific gene expression. PANDA uses spot-adaptive cell type signatures and integrates archetypal analysis to capture within-cell-type heterogeneity.

title: A microfluidic system for the cultivation of cyanobacteria with precise light intensity and CO<sub>2</sub> control: enabling growth data acquisition at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: To present a microfluidic cultivation platform enabling precise analysis of cyanobacterial growth with spatio-temporal resolution and single-cell resolution data acquisition. The platform allows precise control of light and CO2, minimizes self-shading, and uses automated microscopy and deep-learning segmentation for high-throughput analysis. The goal is to provide comprehensive and precise growth data for cyanobacteria under defined conditions.

title: Breast Cancer Disseminated Tumor Cells: Do They Stay and Fight or Run and Hide?
biological_context: Breast Cancer Disseminated Tumor Cells and Dormancy
main_goals: This paper discusses the process of breast cancer early dissemination and dormancy, highlighting the role of the immune system. It specifically focuses on recent findings by Bushnell and colleagues regarding NK-cell-mediated immunity and resistance mechanisms in disseminated tumor cells. The paper suggests the need for further mechanistic studies on immune regulation of dormancy.

title: The spatial impact of a Western diet in enriching Galectin-1-regulated Rho, ECM, and SASP signaling in a novel MASH-HCC mouse model.
biological_context: MASH-associated Hepatocellular carcinoma (MASH-HCC) in mouse model and humans
main_goals: Investigate the spatial impact of a Western diet on Galectin-1 signaling and related pathways (Rho, ECM, SASP) during MASH-HCC progression using a novel mouse model. Explore the effects of modulating Gal-1 expression on these processes in different spatial locations within the liver/tumor.

title: A method for predicting remaining useful life using enhanced Savitzky-Golay filter and improved deep learning framework.
main_goals: The paper presents a method for predicting remaining useful life (RUL) using multivariate sensor data. It introduces an improved Savitzky-Golay filter for data preprocessing and a deep learning framework integrating CNN and LSTM to capture spatial and temporal features for prediction.

title: Gene expression prediction from histology images via hypergraph neural networks.
biological_context: Disease samples, including cancers and tumor disease
main_goals: To propose a novel hypergraph neural network model, HGGEP, for predicting gene expression from histology images. The model aims to better capture cell morphological information and utilize multi-latent stage features, addressing limitations of existing methods.

title: Spatial and Single-Cell Transcriptomics Reveals the Regional Division of the Spatial Structure of MASH Fibrosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Differential Expression', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To map the spatial distribution of MASH fibrosis in the liver and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study characterizes gene expression, cell subpopulation composition, and cell trajectory in MASH fibrosis using integrated spatial and single-cell transcriptomics.

title: Statistical batch-aware embedded integration, dimension reduction, and alignment for spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human and mouse brain, skin, and liver
covered_analysis_steps: ['Batch Correction', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Propose a hierarchical hidden Markov random field model STADIA to jointly address batch effects, extract common biological patterns, and identify spatial domains in multi-slice spatial transcriptomics data. Demonstrate its effectiveness and superiority compared to other methods.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Signatures of Early Acute T Cell-mediated Rejection in Kidney Transplants.
biological_context: Kidney transplant rejection (Acute T cell-mediated rejection, Borderline TCMR)
main_goals: Analyze spatial transcriptomic signatures in kidney transplant biopsies during early acute TCMR. Identify regional differences (glomerulus vs. interstitium) in transcriptional profiles. Investigate the potential involvement of innate immunity in rejection, contrary to a T cell-centric view.

title: A hybrid capsule attention-based convolutional bi-GRU method for multi-class mental task classification based brain-computer Interface.
biological_context: Human mental task classification for Brain-Computer Interface
main_goals: Introduce a hybrid capsule attention-based convolutional bi-GRU method for multi-class mental task classification using EEG data. The method involves pre-processing, feature extraction using spectrally adaptive common spatial pattern, deep feature extraction and classification using the hybrid model, and parameter tuning with dung beetle optimization.

title: Cell-cell interactions in the heart: advanced cardiac models and omics technologies.
main_goals: Provide an overview of cell-cell interactions (CCIs) in normal and diseased hearts. Highlight cutting-edge methods and technologies, such as 3D co-culture and spatial omics, used to study CCIs. Summarize the therapeutic applications of CCI research for cardiovascular diseases.

title: Spatial multiomics atlas reveals smooth muscle phenotypic transformation and metabolic reprogramming in diabetic macroangiopathy.
biological_context: Diabetic macroangiopathy in human anterior tibial artery
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Network analysis', 'Enrichment Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To construct a spatial multiomics map of the anterior tibial artery in diabetic patients. To characterize vascular calcification and reveal smooth muscle cell phenotypic transformation trends and their transcriptional driving network. To identify activated metabolic pathways and key genes involved in diabetic vascular metabolic reprogramming using combined transcriptome and metabolome data.

title: Investigation of human aging at the single-cell level.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell genomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'single-cell epigenomics', 'single-cell proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'mass spectrometry']
main_goals: This review discusses the application of single-cell sequencing technologies (genomics, transcriptomics, epigenomics, proteomics) in human aging research. It covers multi-omics integration, spatial transcriptomics, and mass spectrometry integration. The paper aims to highlight findings like aging biomarkers, pathways, novel cell subpopulations, tissue-specific aging, and aging-related diseases, and mentions relevant databases.

title: Lazy Resampling: Fast and information preserving preprocessing for deep learning.
main_goals: Introduce Lazy Resampling, a software that rephrases spatial preprocessing operations as a graphics pipeline. This reduces resampling steps, preserves information, simplifies pipeline design (making operations non-destructive), and improves deep learning training outcomes, particularly for semantic segmentation in medical imaging.

title: Advancements in Single-Cell RNA Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics for Central Nervous System Disease.
main_goals: This review surveys single-cell RNA sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics studies on CNS diseases. It highlights how these technologies provide novel perspectives for treating and diagnosing CNS diseases by identifying new cell types/subtypes, proposing mechanisms, uncovering targets, and identifying biomarkers.

title: SpatialDeX Is a Reference-Free Method for Cell-Type Deconvolution of Spatial Transcriptomics Data in Solid Tumors.
main_goals: Develop SpatialDeX, a reference-free regression model for cell-type deconvolution in tumor spatial transcriptomics data. Validate its performance against existing methods using simulated and experimental data. Apply SpatialDeX for pan-cancer clustering analysis to identify distinct tumor progression mechanisms.

title: Theoretical modeling and parameter identification of balanced armature loudspeakers.
main_goals: This study proposes a model using the equivalent circuit method (ECM) for balanced armature loudspeakers (BALs) and establishes a time-domain identification algorithm to identify necessary parameters based on the proposed ECM model. The paper validates the model and identification method by comparing experimental and numerical results for two different BALs.

title: Resting natural killer cells promote the progress of colon cancer liver metastasis by elevating tumor-derived stem cell factor.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate the clinical relevance and cellular roles of natural killer (NK) cells in colon cancer liver metastasis (CCLM) using integrated multi-omics datasets. The study aimed to characterize NK cell subsets in the tumor microenvironment and reveal their impact on tumor progression.

title: The neuroendocrine transition in prostate cancer is dynamic and dependent on ASCL1.
main_goals: Develop an in vivo platform to study the neuroendocrine transition in prostate cancer. Identify the origin of neuroendocrine prostate cancer cells and reveal the dynamic role of ASCL1 in this process, highlighting the importance of therapy timing.

title: IL-12/IL-23 Blockade Reveals Patterns of Asynchronous Inflammation in Pyoderma Gangrenosum.
main_goals: To investigate patterns of asynchronous inflammation in Pyoderma Gangrenosum using spatial transcriptomics. The study explores how IL-12/IL-23 blockade affects these patterns, focusing on features like Tertiary lymphoid structures and B cells within the tissue.

title: Imaging Mass Cytometry in Psoriatic Disease Reveals Immune Profile Heterogeneity in Skin and Synovial Tissue.
biological_context: Psoriatic disease, Psoriasis, Psoriatic arthritis, Skin, Synovial tissue
main_goals: To characterize structural and immune cell populations in psoriatic skin and synovial tissue using Imaging Mass Cytometry. The study aimed to identify immune cell differences, spatial relationships, and interpatient heterogeneity in patients with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis. It applied IMC and standard analysis steps like segmentation, clustering, and neighborhood analysis.

title: The activity of tertiary lymphoid structures in high grade serous ovarian cancer is governed by site, stroma, and cellular interactions.
main_goals: To understand antitumor immunity, specifically tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs), across different sites in high grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) using spatial analyses. The study aims to characterize differences in TLS development and activity across tumor sites, identify a prognostic spatial TLS signature, and investigate the role of stroma and mesenchymal stem cells in regulating TLS formation and function.

title: Sphingosine 1-phosphate receptor 2 in keratinocytes plays a key role in reducing inflammation in psoriasis.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the role of S1PR2 in keratinocytes in psoriasis using genetic mouse models and spatial transcriptomics. It concludes that S1PR2 in keratinocytes down-regulates inflammation by inhibiting Th17 cell recruitment and suggests stimulating S1PR2 as a potential therapeutic approach for psoriasis.

title: Integrating Metabolic RNA Labeling-Based Time-Resolved Single-Cell RNA Sequencing with Spatial Transcriptomics for Spatiotemporal Transcriptomic Analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To demonstrate that integrating time-resolved scRNA-seq with spatial transcriptomics is a new paradigm for spatiotemporal transcriptomic analysis. To apply this integrated approach to profile transcriptional dynamics in GBM, identify mesenchymal transition pathways, and reveal spatial interactions contributing to this process.

title: Discovery of prognostic lncRNAs in colorectal cancer using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Utilize spatial transcriptomics to identify lncRNAs associated with malignant regions in colorectal cancer. Validate these findings using public data and RNA-FISH. Propose identified lncRNAs (LINC01978, PLAC4, LINC01303) as potential early biomarkers for metastatic disease.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics of bladder Ewing sarcoma.
biological_context: Bladder Ewing sarcoma/primitive neuroectodermal tumor (bladder ES/PNET)
main_goals: To investigate the pathogenesis of bladder Ewing sarcoma/primitive neuroectodermal tumor (ES/PNET) using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify key cell types, signaling pathways, and potential therapeutic targets in this rare and malignant tumor.

title: Spatial multi-omics reveal intratumoral humoral immunity niches associated with tertiary lymphoid structures in pancreatic cancer immunotherapy pathologic responders.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'BCR profiling', 'multi-modal spatial profiling']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate a spatial multi-omics atlas of PDAC treated with immunotherapy to characterize intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) niches and their spatial relationships. The study used machine learning on spatial transcriptomics and proteomics data to identify TLS-associated features linked to treatment response and survival, revealing insights into TLS maturation, humoral immunity, and stromal remodeling.

title: Multimodal Spatial Profiling Reveals Immune Suppression and Microenvironment Remodeling in Fallopian Tube Precursors to High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma.
biological_context: Human High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma (HGSOC) development from fallopian tube (FT) precursors
main_goals: To understand the molecular changes that occur as fallopian tube precancerous lesions progress to HGSOC by integrating high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify immune modulating mechanisms, microenvironment remodeling, and potential biomarkers/targets at different disease stages.

title: ELLA: Modeling Subcellular Spatial Variation of Gene Expression within Cells in High-Resolution Spatial Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Subcellular spatial variation within cells, cell cycle
main_goals: Introduce a computational method (ELLA) for modeling subcellular spatial variation of gene expression within cells in high-resolution spatial transcriptomics. Detect genes with subcellular spatial variation, characterize their patterns, and associate them with biological features. Validate ELLA's performance through simulations and applications.

title: Deconvolving organogenesis in space and time via spatial transcriptomics in thick tissues.
main_goals: Develop 3DEEP, a tissue clearing and spatial transcriptomic strategy for analyzing thick tissues. Apply 3DEEP to characterize hair follicle organogenesis in 4D (space and inferred time) from a single time point, revealing molecular stages and structural dynamics.

title: Absent, but not glucocorticoid-modulated, corticotropin-releasing hormone (Crh) regulates anxiety-like behaviors in mice.
main_goals: Investigate how manipulating PVH Crh expression through genetic deletion, primary adrenal insufficiency, or glucocorticoid treatment affects anxiety-like behaviors in mice. Found that only extreme Crh deficiency reduced anxiety, suggesting glucocorticoid-regulated Crh modulation may not influence anxiety.

title: INSPIRE: interpretable, flexible and spatially-aware integration of multiple spatial transcriptomics datasets from diverse sources.
biological_context: Human cortex, mouse brain, mouse hippocampus, mouse embryo development, spatiotemporal organogenesis
covered_analysis_steps: ['Batch Correction', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Visualization']
main_goals: Develop INSPIRE, a deep learning method using GNNs and adversarial learning for spatially-aware integration of multiple spatial transcriptomics datasets from diverse sources. Uncover interpretable spatial factors and gene programs via NMF. Demonstrate superior performance in identifying biological signals, integrating across technologies, and building 3D models.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals modulation of transcriptional networks across brain regions after auditory threat conditioning.
biological_context: Mouse brain function in auditory threat conditioning, fear, and anxiety
main_goals: To investigate genome-wide transcriptional changes and transcriptional network alterations across multiple brain regions in mice after auditory threat conditioning using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify key brain regions and network interactions involved in fear and anxiety.

title: BDNF augmentation reverses cranial radiation therapy-induced cognitive decline and neurodegenerative consequences.
biological_context: Radiation-induced cognitive dysfunction in mouse brain
main_goals: To evaluate the efficacy of riluzole (RZ) in mitigating radiation-induced cognitive dysfunction (RICD) in a mouse model. The study found that RZ reversed cognitive decline, preserved synaptic integrity and neuronal plasticity, and reduced neuroinflammation, correlating with increased BDNF levels.

title: Practical guidelines for cell segmentation models under optical aberrations in microscopy.
main_goals: Evaluate cell image segmentation model robustness under optical aberrations from fluorescence and bright field microscopy. Provide practical usage recommendations and guidelines for models like Cellpose 2.0 and Mask R-CNN. Propose the Point Spread Function Image Label Classification Model (PLCM) to identify aberration types and amplitudes.

title: Spatial analyses revealed S100P + TFF1 + tumor cells in spread through air spaces samples correlated with undesirable therapy response in non-small cell lung cancer.
main_goals: To use spatial analysis on non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) samples with and without Spread through air spaces (STAS) to characterize the STAS phenotype and identify associated biomarkers. The study investigated the heterogeneity of STAS tumor cells, identifying a S100P+TFF1+ subtype and correlating its presence with patient survival, therapy response to EGFR-TKI and immunotherapy, and specific signaling pathways like TGFb.

title: Dual spatial host-bacterial gene expression in Mycobacterium abscessus respiratory infections.
biological_context: Mycobacterium abscessus respiratory infection in mouse lung
main_goals: To demonstrate the potential of using customized bacterial probes with spatial transcriptomics technology to simultaneously analyze host and bacterial gene expression in FFPE tissues. The study applied this to a mouse model of Mycobacterium abscessus respiratory infection, finding correlations between bacterial gene expression, abundance, and host oxidative stress.

title: Deep learning pipeline for automated cell profiling from cyclic imaging.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: Introduce CycloNET, a computational pipeline for automated cell profiling from cyclic imaging data. The pipeline handles pre-processing, registration, segmentation, and single-cell profile generation using a deep learning network. It aims to provide a rapid and efficient tool for analyzing large-scale cyclic imaging datasets at single-cell resolution.

title: The contribution of the sphingosine 1-phosphate signaling pathway to chronic kidney diseases: recent findings and new perspectives.
main_goals: This review analyzes recent findings on sphingosine 1-phosphate (S1P) signaling in chronic kidney disease (CKD) pathogenesis and renal fibrosis across various CKD types. It discusses therapeutic potential of S1P modulation, S1P as a biomarker, and the role of advanced technologies like spatial transcriptomics in understanding S1P's function in kidney compartments.

title: Disruption of cellular plasticity by repeat RNAs in human pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: Investigate the role of repeat RNAs in human PDAC using spatial molecular imaging at single-cell resolution. Correlate repeat RNA expression with alterations in epithelial and fibroblast states, explore cell-cell communication via extracellular vesicles, and identify distinct innate immune signaling mechanisms driving cell-context-specific viral-like responses that modulate cellular plasticity.

title: Spatial metabolomics to discover hypertrophic scar relevant metabolic alterations and potential therapeutic strategies: A preliminary study.
biological_context: Hypertrophic scar and surrounding normal skin tissues
main_goals: Use spatial metabolomics (MALDI-MSI) to map metabolite distribution in hypertrophic scar and surrounding normal skin tissues. Identify altered metabolites and associated pathways. Evaluate potential therapeutic effects of selected metabolites on hypertrophic scar fibroblasts.

title: Introducing FISCAS, a Tool for the Effective Generation of Single Cell MALDI-MSI Data.
biological_context: THP-1 cells during stimulated differentiation into macrophages
main_goals: Introduce FISCAS, a tool integrating fluorescence microscopy and MALDI-MSI for automated single-cell data generation. Demonstrate its effectiveness in studying THP-1 cell differentiation, revealing molecular heterogeneity and identifying potential markers.

title: Spatially Informed Graph Structure Learning Extracts Insights from Spatial Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human breast cancer, human, animals, mice, prefrontal cortex
main_goals: Introduce STAGUE, an innovative framework for spatial transcriptomics that learns a cell graph structure and embedding. Improve spatial clustering accuracy and facilitate the discovery of novel and biologically relevant cell-cell interactions.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Unravel the Tissue Complexity of Oral Pathogenesis.
biological_context: Oral and craniofacial development and pathogenesis (including cancer, Sjögren's disease, periodontitis)
main_goals: Review the workflows and analysis methods for spatial transcriptomics. Showcase how recent studies have applied spatial transcriptomics to understand the development and pathogenesis of various oral and craniofacial tissues and diseases. Highlight biological insights gained from these applications.

title: Improved cell-type identification and comprehensive mapping of regulatory features with spatial epigenomics 96-channel microfluidic platform.
main_goals: Introduce and evaluate a new 96-channel microfluidic platform for spatial epigenomic profiling (spatial-ATAC-seq). Demonstrate its improved precision for cell typing and regulatory element identification compared to a previous 50-channel platform. Apply the technology to map cell types and regulatory features within brain structures.

title: CH6824025, Potent and Selective Discoidin Domain Receptor 1 Inhibitor, Reduces Kidney Fibrosis in Unilateral Ureteral Obstruction Mice.
biological_context: Kidney fibrosis in unilateral ureteral obstruction (UUO) mice
main_goals: This paper investigates the effects of the DDR1 inhibitor CH6824025 on kidney fibrosis in UUO mice. It uses Visium spatial transcriptomics to analyze changes in gene expression in the kidney. The study aims to show that CH6824025 reduces fibrosis and inflammation, potentially by inhibiting cell migration and improving mitochondrial function.

title: SpotGF: Denoising spatially resolved transcriptomics data using an optimal transport-based gene filtering algorithm.
