main_goals: Develop an algorithm (SpotGF) for denoising spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) data using optimal transport. The goal is to filter spatial noise while preserving raw data and improving downstream analyses like cell clustering and cell type annotation.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing identifies a subtype of FN1 + tumor-associated macrophages associated with glioma recurrence and as a biomarker for immunotherapy.
main_goals: Identify a subtype of tumor-associated macrophages (FN1+ TAMs) associated with glioma recurrence using multi-omics data. Investigate their role in prognosis, microenvironment regulation, and potential as immunotherapy biomarkers. Provide a public web resource for exploring glioma immune microenvironment.

title: Multiplexed, image-based pooled screens in primary cells and tissues with PerturbView.
biological_context: Induced pluripotent stem cell-derived neurons, primary immune cells, tumor tissue sections, primary bone marrow-derived macrophages, mouse xenograft model
data_modalities_used: ['image-based phenotypes', 'in situ sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed imaging', 'Optical pooled screening']
main_goals: Develop PerturbView, a novel optical pooled screening (OPS) technology that enables highly multiplexed image-based screens in diverse systems including primary cells and tissues. Demonstrate its application to study signaling pathways and its combination with spatial transcriptomics. Broaden the scope of OPS applications.

title: Quantitative and spatially resolved detection of multiplexed microRNA from plant tissue via hybridization to hydrogel-bound DNA probes in nanoliter well arrays.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel method for quantitative and spatially resolved detection of multiplexed microRNA directly from plant tissue. The method utilizes hybridization to hydrogel-bound DNA probes in nanoliter well arrays. It demonstrates the platform's capability by analyzing endogenous microRNA in Arabidopsis thaliana, validated with non-spatial assays, aiming to expand spatial omics tools for plants.

title: Machine-learning-guided quantitative delineation of cell morphological features and responses to nanomaterials.
main_goals: Develop a label-free microscopy and machine learning pipeline for quantitative delineation of cell morphological features and responses to external stimuli like nanomaterials. The method involves pixel classification, cell segmentation, feature extraction, and analysis using PCA and k-means clustering to identify cell heterogeneity and treatment responses.

title: Imaging spatial transcriptomics reveals molecular patterns of vulnerability to pathology in a transgenic α-synucleinopathy model.
main_goals: Identify neuronal subtypes vulnerable to α-synuclein pathology in a transgenic mouse model using imaging spatial transcriptomics. Investigate the transcriptional underpinnings of this vulnerability, highlighting *Plk2* and *hSNCA* expression. Perform differential expression analysis to reveal downstream gene expression changes.

title: Mapping epidermal and dermal cellular senescence in human skin aging.
biological_context: Human skin aging and cellular senescence
main_goals: This paper investigates epidermal and dermal cellular senescence in human skin aging using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. It compares senescence burden in photoaging vs chronological aging, curates a skin-specific senescence gene set (SenSkin™), and links senescent cell types (melanocytes, fibroblasts) to specific age-related skin dysfunctions (pigmentation, collagen loss).

title: Endothelial pyroptosis-driven microglial activation in choroid plexus mediates neuronal apoptosis in hemorrhagic stroke rats.
main_goals: To identify the cellular origins and mechanisms of cytokine-driven inflammation following hemorrhagic stroke (ICH) in rats using Luminex, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to link endothelial pyroptosis to microglial activation and subsequent neuronal apoptosis in the choroid plexus.

title: Spatial multi-omics in whole skeletal muscle reveals complex tissue architecture.
data_modalities_used: ['Single-nucleus transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial metabolomics', 'RNA tomography', 'mass spectrometry imaging', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence staining']
main_goals: To elucidate the full tissue architecture of whole skeletal muscle by combining spatial transcriptomics (RNA tomography) and mass spectrometry imaging. The study aimed to map the spatial organization of gene expression, metabolism, and lipids and validate findings with immunofluorescence, revealing unexpected regional heterogeneity.

title: Imputing spatial transcriptomics through gene network constructed from protein language model.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: Present stImpute, a method for imputing missing genes in spatial transcriptomics using reference scRNA-seq and a gene network derived from protein language models. The method aims to improve imputation accuracy and cell population identification compared to existing approaches.

title: An initial game-theoretic assessment of enhanced tissue preparation and imaging protocols for improved deep learning inference of spatial transcriptomics from tissue morphology.
main_goals: Develop and assess an enhanced tissue preparation and imaging protocol for improved deep learning inference of spatial transcriptomics from morphology. Compare the performance and cost-effectiveness of models trained on data from the enhanced protocol versus traditional methods using a game-theoretic approach.

title: Multi-omics analysis unveils the predictive value of IGF2BP3/SPHK1 signaling in cancer stem cells for prognosis and immunotherapeutic response in muscle-invasive bladder cancer.
main_goals: To identify immunotherapy-related cancer stem cell-like populations predictive of prognosis and immunotherapy response in muscle-invasive bladder cancer using multi-omics data, including spatial methods. The study investigates the IGF2BP3/SPHK1 signaling pathway and the spatial relationships between specific cancer cells and immune cells. It aims to develop a predictive signature for immunotherapy response.

title: Embryonic development grand challenge: crosslinking advances.
main_goals: This perspective paper outlines the major challenges facing the field of embryonic development research. It discusses recent advances like temporo-spatial transcriptomics and stem cell-based models, highlights the need for interdisciplinary collaboration and open data access, and touches upon humanitarian and ethical implications including the reduction of animal experimentation.

title: Exploring public cancer gene expression signatures across bulk, single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data with signifinder Bioconductor package.
main_goals: Introduce signifinder, a new R Bioconductor package, to collect and use cancer transcriptional signatures across bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics data. The tool aims to streamline signature application and analysis of tumor heterogeneity and characteristics across modalities.

title: vSPACE: exploring virtual spatial representation of articular chondrocytes at the single-cell level.
main_goals: Introducing vSPACE, a web-based tool for visualizing zonal gene expression patterns in human articular chondrocytes from scRNA-seq data by creating a virtual spatial representation. It aims to emulate spatial transcriptomics concepts for single-cell data.

title: SpaGRA: Graph augmentation facilitates domain identification for spatially resolved transcriptomics.
biological_context: Mouse hypothalamus, Mouse embryos (heart development), Cancer-associated fibroblasts (Visium HD data)
main_goals: Propose SpaGRA, a novel method for automatic multi-relationship construction based on graph augmentation for spatial domain identification in SRT data. Improve accuracy by incorporating biological interactions and using multi-view relationships for negative sampling. Apply SpaGRA to analyze spatial structures in diverse SRT datasets.

title: A Comprehensive Spatially Resolved Metabolomics Dataset for Lampreys.
main_goals: Present a comprehensive tissue-wide spatial metabolomics dataset for lampreys analyzed using LC-MS. Provide this validated dataset and an associated database as a valuable resource for lamprey research and a benchmark for evaluating new algorithms and software tools for spatial metabolomics.

title: MobileNet-V2: An Enhanced Skin Disease Classification by Attention and Multi-Scale Features.
main_goals: Introduce a novel deep learning model combining MobileNet-V2, attention mechanisms, and multi-scale features for skin disease classification. Demonstrate its enhanced performance compared to baseline models using diverse image datasets.

title: Spatially exploring RNA biology in archival formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissues.
biological_context: Human lymphomas and clinical tumor FFPE tissues
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Splicing Analysis', 'Spatial Variant Analysis', 'Spatial microRNA Analysis']
main_goals: Introduce Patho-DBiT, a new method for spatial whole transcriptome sequencing in FFPE tissues. Demonstrate its capability to spatially profile diverse RNA species, including gene expression, splicing isoforms, RNA variants, and microRNAs. Apply the method to clinical tumor FFPE tissues to study region-specific RNA biology and clonal architecture.

title: Damping excessive viral-induced IFN-γ rescues the impaired anti-Aspergillus host immune response in influenza-associated pulmonary aspergillosis.
biological_context: Influenza-associated pulmonary aspergillosis (IAPA) immunopathogenesis in a mouse model
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'histopathology', 'immunofluorescence', 'micro-computed tomography (μCT)', 'bioluminescence imaging (BLI)', 'high parameter immunophenotyping', 'live imaging']
main_goals: To unravel the immunopathogenesis of Influenza-associated pulmonary aspergillosis (IAPA) using a murine model. The study aims to identify mechanisms by which influenza predisposes to Aspergillus superinfection and develop potential adjunctive therapies. Findings highlight excessive viral-induced IFN-γ as a major driver of immune dysfunction.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of the Respiratory System.
biological_context: Respiratory System (including lung development, COVID-19, lung cancer, fibrosis)
main_goals: Review commonly used spatial analysis workflows, highlight recent developments in machine learning and artificial intelligence for interpreting spatial data, and showcase applications of spatially resolved transcriptomics in the respiratory system (health and disease).

title: From single-cell to spatial transcriptomics: decoding the glioma stem cell niche and its clinical implications.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Regulatory Network Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Machine Learning']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize glioma stem cells (GSCs), analyze their spatial interactions within the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, and develop a prognostic signature. Key findings include the identification of a distinct GSC population, their proximity and interaction with MDSCs via MIF signaling, and the development of a robust 26-gene GSC signature (GSCS), with TUBA1C identified as a key gene validated functionally.

title: Comprehensive analysis of bulk, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics revealed IER3 for predicting malignant progression and immunotherapy efficacy in glioma.
main_goals: The paper aimed to comprehensively analyze the role of IER3 in glioma using bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics data, alongside experimental assays. It identified IER3 as a biomarker for predicting malignant progression, prognosis, and response to different therapies.

title: In Situ Isotope Tracing at Single-Cell Resolution Using Mass Spectrometry Imaging.
main_goals: Describes a method (workflow) to set up in situ stable isotope tracing followed by mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) for performing dynamic metabolomics at single-cell resolution.

title: Mechanism exploration and model construction for small cell transformation in EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinomas.
biological_context: EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinomas and small cell transformation
main_goals: To explore molecular mechanisms of small cell transformation in EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinomas using multi-omics data, identify differences between transformed and primary SCLC, and construct a predictive model for transformation.

title: When is prostate cancer really cancer?
main_goals: This paper summarizes key discussion points from an international symposium addressing whether Grade Group 1 prostate cancer should continue to be labeled 'cancer'. It considers evidence from autopsy studies, metastatic potential, diagnostic pathways, spatial transcriptomics findings, and patient perspectives. The ultimate goal is to reduce prostate cancer mortality while minimizing harms from overdiagnosis and overtreatment.

title: Characterization of regeneration initiating cells during Xenopus laevis tail regeneration.
main_goals: This paper aims to identify and characterize the cells initiating regeneration during Xenopus laevis tail regeneration shortly after injury. Using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, the authors discovered transient regeneration initiating cells (RICs) derived from basal epidermal cells, which modify the extracellular matrix and are crucial for successful regeneration.

title: Deciphering the role of LGALS2: insights into tertiary lymphoid structure-associated dendritic cell activation and immunotherapeutic potential in breast cancer patients.
main_goals: The paper aims to identify key markers within tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in breast cancer (BRCA) using integrated omics analysis. It identifies LGALS2, investigates its role in TLS-associated dendritic cell (DC) activation and the tumor microenvironment (TME) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, and validates its association with survival and immune response, highlighting its potential as a therapeutic target and biomarker.

title: A multiscale approach to understanding the shared blue-orange flower color polymorphism in two Lysimachia species.
biological_context: Flower color polymorphism in Lysimachia species
main_goals: Investigate the shared blue-orange flower color polymorphism in two Lysimachia species. Determine the biochemical and genetic basis using spectroscopy, biochemistry, and transcriptomics. Analyze climate niches and propose an evolutionary origin (ancestral polymorphism) for the shared trait.

title: SPP1+ macrophages in HR+ breast cancer are associated with tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes.
main_goals: To explore the role of SPP1+ macrophages in different breast cancer subtypes based on TIL levels. The study used single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to identify characteristics of SPP1+ macrophages and their spatial relationship and interactions with T-cells, particularly in TIL-high HR+ breast cancer.

title: Spatial proteomics and transcriptomics of the maternal-fetal interface in placenta accreta spectrum.
biological_context: Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) at the maternal-fetal interface
main_goals: This study investigated alterations at the fetal-maternal interface in severe Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. It aimed to identify molecular and cellular changes associated with deep myometrial invasion, focusing on immune cells, gene expression, protein profiles, and ligand-receptor interactions.

title: Identifying High Recurrence Risk in Breast Carcinoma Patients Through Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis.
main_goals: To identify distinct genetic features associated with high Oncotype DX Recurrence Score in breast carcinoma patients using spatially resolved transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare gene expression profiles and spatially resolved transcriptional activities between high and non-high recurrence risk groups.

title: TAJ-Net: a two-stage clustered cell segmentation network with adaptive joint learning of spatial and spectral information.
main_goals: To propose a two-stage 3D adaptive joint training framework (TAJ-Net) for segmenting and classifying clustered cells in hyperspectral tissue images, leveraging spatial and spectral information. It aims to address challenges like annotation errors and cluttered backgrounds by segmenting then classifying, and removing noisy samples.

title: Unraveling the role of ADAMs in clinical heterogeneity and the immune microenvironment of hepatocellular carcinoma: insights from single-cell, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA sequencing.
main_goals: To investigate the role of ADAM family genes in the clinical heterogeneity and immune microenvironment of hepatocellular carcinoma using multi-omics data. The study also aimed to develop and validate a prognostic model for HCC based on ADAM family genes.

title: Radiation immunodynamics in patients with glioblastoma receiving chemoradiation.
main_goals: To identify peripheral immunologic effects of standard adjuvant chemoradiotherapy in glioblastoma patients, focusing on key immune populations like myeloid-derived suppressor cells and CD8+ T lymphocytes. The study investigates the association of these changes with survival and links peripheral blood findings to baseline tumor tissue characteristics using spatial proteomics.

title: Multiplexed spatial mapping of chromatin features, transcriptome, and proteins in tissues.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial histone modifications', 'spatial open chromatin', 'spatial whole transcriptome', 'spatial protein panel']
main_goals: Develop a multi-modal spatial technology called spatial-Mux-seq to simultaneously profile five different molecular modalities (histone modifications, open chromatin, transcriptome, and proteins) in tissues. Apply the technology to mouse embryo and brain to demonstrate its capability in discriminating cell types/states and investigating spatiotemporal relationships and gene regulatory networks.

title: Craters on the melanoma surface facilitate tumor-immune interactions and demonstrate pathologic response to checkpoint blockade in humans.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To identify spatial domains (craters) on melanoma surfaces that facilitate immune response during immunotherapy, characterize their molecular and cellular composition (rich in B2M/antigen recognition molecules, harbor CD8+ T cells), and evaluate their potential as a diagnostic tool for predicting response to ICB therapy in humans.

title: Cross-expression analysis reveals patterns of coordinated gene expression in spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: Introduce cross-expression, a novel framework for discovering gene pairs that coordinate expression between neighboring cells in spatial transcriptomics. Use this framework to recover ligand-receptor pairs, identify anatomical regions, and find gene modules. Provide an R package for this analysis.

title: CelloType: A Unified Model for Segmentation and Classification of Tissue Images.
main_goals: This paper introduces CelloType, an end-to-end model for cell segmentation and classification in biomedical microscopy images. It leverages multi-task learning and Transformer-based deep learning to simultaneously improve both tasks. CelloType demonstrates superior performance compared to existing methods and enables multi-scale segmentation and classification of cellular and non-cellular elements in tissue.

title: Spatial microenvironments tune immune response dynamics in the Drosophila larval fat body.
biological_context: Drosophila larval fat body immune response
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial microenvironments that tune immune response dynamics in the Drosophila larval fat body. It establishes live light sheet fluorescence microscopy of whole larvae to capture immune responses at single-cell resolution and uses spatial transcriptomics to identify immune microenvironments.

title: Flexible and robust cell type annotation for highly multiplexed tissue images.
main_goals: This paper introduces RIBCA, a tool for automated, unbiased, and fine-grained cell type annotation in highly multiplexed tissue images. It aims to overcome limitations of existing methods by not requiring additional model training or human intervention and working with diverse antibody panels. The tool has been validated on millions of cells across numerous human tissues.

title: MAPK/ERK signaling in gliomas modulates interferon responses, T cell recruitment, microglia phenotype, and immune checkpoint blockade efficacy.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of MAPK/ERK signaling in modulating interferon responses, T cell recruitment, microglia phenotype, and immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) efficacy in glioblastoma. It aims to elucidate the mechanistic underpinnings of immunotherapy resistance and identify the MAPK/ERK pathway as a potential target for enhancing ICB treatment in glioblastoma.

title: Dissecting the immune infiltrate of primary luminal B-like breast carcinomas in relation to age.
biological_context: Luminal B-like breast carcinomas in relation to age
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of aging on the immune landscape of luminal breast cancer. Using multiplex immunohistochemistry, it characterizes the age-related dynamics of immune cells and checkpoint molecules within the tumor microenvironment of treatment-naïve patients. The findings reveal a decline in immune cell abundance and changes in immune checkpoint expression with aging.

title: Hypoxia induces ROS-resistant memory upon reoxygenation in vivo promoting metastasis in part via MUC1-C.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo models', 'in vitro models', 'tumor biopsies', 'patient-derived xenograft models']
main_goals: This study investigates how hypoxia in solid tumors influences metastasis, identifying post-hypoxic cells that retain hypoxia-inducible gene expression. It demonstrates that MUC1-C plays a crucial role in ROS resistance in these cells, and therapeutically targeting MUC1-C reduces hypoxia-driven metastasis.

title: Exploring natural product biosynthesis in plants with mass spectrometry imaging.
main_goals: To raise awareness of the importance of Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) for exploring natural product biosynthesis in plants. The paper advocates for further exploitation of spatial information from MSI to establish metabolite-gene expression relationships, highlighting its potential beyond simple distribution visualization.

title: Crosstalk of T cells within the ovarian cancer microenvironment.
main_goals: This review presents emerging evidence on the cellular crosstalk regulating T cell distribution within the ovarian cancer microenvironment. It highlights the need to understand key cellular networks impacting T cell infiltration and captures emergent methodologies and computational techniques for dissecting cell-cell crosstalk. The review also discusses innovative ex vivo models for mapping and perturbing cellular communications to enhance T cell infiltration.

title: Spatial metabolomics, LC-MS and RNA-Seq reveal the effect of red and white muscle on rabbit meat flavor.
biological_context: Rabbit meat quality and flavor, focusing on differences between red and white muscle fibers.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the differences in meat quality and flavor between red and white muscle fibers in rabbits. It utilizes spatial metabolomics, LC-MS, and RNA-Seq to explore the molecular mechanisms underlying these differences and to determine the impact of myofiber composition on meat characteristics.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal tumor microenvironment and SLCO2A1 correlated with tumor suppression in hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Immune Infiltration Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate tumor microenvironment and identify tumor suppressor genes in hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma (HSCC) using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to analyze cell distribution, signaling pathways, and immune infiltration, highlighting the role of SLCO2A1 as a potential tumor suppressor.

title: Unlocking the potential of large-scale 3D imaging with tissue clearing techniques.
main_goals: This paper reviews the potential of large-scale 3D imaging enabled by tissue clearing techniques and light-sheet fluorescence microscopy (LSFM). It highlights applications in neuroscience, cancer research, and histopathology, discussing how this technology allows imaging of entire organs or bodies at multiple scales and can facilitate spatial omics. The review also touches upon emerging technologies to address limitations in molecular information acquisition.

title: Multiplex Microscopy Assay for Assessment of Therapeutic and Serum Antibodies against Emerging Pathogens.
main_goals: The study developed an automated multiplex microscopy assay coupled with machine learning for antibody detection against emerging pathogens. The system utilizes barcoded cell lines expressing distinct viral antigens and fluorescent proteins with unique subcellular localization for cell classification. It was successfully applied to quantify immunoreactivity against SARS-CoV-2 variants and monoclonal antibodies, demonstrating rapid adaptability.

title: Electroencephalography Neurofeedback Training with Focus on the State of Attention: An Investigation Using Source Localization and Effective Connectivity.
main_goals: This study investigates the effectiveness of EEG neurofeedback training on attention by comparing cortical electrical activity between low and high difficulty groups using source localization and effective connectivity. It aims to identify brain regions and directional information flow related to maintaining attention during demanding tasks.

title: Metabolite Profiling of Hydroponic Lettuce Roots Affected by Nutrient Solution Flow: Insights from Comprehensive Analysis Using Widely Targeted Metabolomics and MALDI Mass Spectrometry Imaging Approaches.
biological_context: Hydroponic lettuce roots affected by nutrient solution flow
main_goals: To clarify how nutrient solution flow affects hydroponic lettuce root morphology and growth by applying untargeted metabolomics and MALDI mass spectrometry imaging. The study aims to understand the adaptive biological responses triggered by mechanical stimulus and identify key metabolites and metabolic pathways involved.

title: Single-cell sequencing to multi-omics: technologies and applications.
main_goals: This paper reviews traditional single-cell sequencing technologies and outlines the latest advancements in single-cell multi-omics. It summarizes the current status and challenges of applying these technologies to biological research and clinical applications, and discusses limitations and potential strategies to address them.

title: Spatial multiplexed immunofluorescence analysis reveals coordinated cellular networks associated with overall survival in metastatic osteosarcoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to spatially characterize the immune tumor microenvironment of metastatic osteosarcoma lung specimens. It sought to identify coordinated cellular networks associated with overall survival. The findings describe cellular interactions and neighborhoods linked to patient survival and suggest potential immunotherapeutic strategies.

title: Potential crosstalk between Naïve CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells and SPP1<sup>+</sup> Macrophages is associated with clinical outcome and therapeutic response in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Prognostic prediction']
main_goals: This study investigated intercellular crosstalk between Naïve CD4+ T cells and SPP1+ Macrophages in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The researchers developed a prognostic score (TMPS) based on this crosstalk to predict clinical outcomes and therapeutic responses in HCC patients. The TMPS demonstrated good performance across independent cohorts and could guide clinical decision-making.

title: Enhancing Spatial Domain Identification in Spatially Resolved Transcriptomics Using Graph Convolutional Networks With Adaptively Feature-Spatial Balance and Contrastive Learning.
main_goals: The paper proposes SpaGCAC, a novel model that enhances spatial domain identification in spatially resolved transcriptomics. It utilizes an adaptive feature-spatial balanced graph convolutional network (AFSBGCN) to balance spot characteristics and spatial structure, and employs contrastive learning for local topology and probability distribution. The method demonstrates superior performance compared to existing methods on DLPFC datasets.

title: Local volume concentration, packing domains, and scaling properties of chromatin.
main_goals: This paper proposes the Self Returning Excluded Volume (SR-EV) model, a stochastic model for chromatin structure. The model aims to generate conformationally defined domains observed in single-cell imaging and capture overall chromatin organization as a corrugated system. It demonstrates robust agreement with experimental results concerning volume concentration, contact probability, domain characterization, and scaling behavior.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Profiling Reveals Curcumin Induces Metabolic Reprogramming in Three-Dimensional Tumor Spheroids.
main_goals: To investigate the antitumor metabolic alteration caused by curcumin in a 3D tumor spheroids model using mass spectrometry imaging. The study aimed to reveal the impact of curcumin on tumor cell growth, proliferation, and the overall metabolic profile, as well as characterize curcumin's metabolic processes and identify remodeled metabolic pathways.

title: Natural hydrogen gas and engineered microalgae prevent acute lung injury in sepsis.
main_goals: This paper aims to integrate hydrogen gas and engineered microalgae as a novel nano-system (DQB@C) for treating sepsis-related acute lung injury. They utilized multi-omics and spatial transcriptomics to identify therapeutic targets and pathways, and developed a bio-carrier nano-system for improved hydrogen delivery and efficacy. The study demonstrates DQB@C's potential in reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, and organ damage in sepsis models.

title: Recovering single-cell expression profiles from spatial transcriptomics with scResolve.
biological_context: human breast cancer, human lung disease
main_goals: scResolve is a novel method for recovering single-cell expression profiles from spatial transcriptomics measurements at multi-cellular resolution. It accurately restores expression profiles of individual cells at their locations and enables cell-type-specific differential gene expression analysis and identification of rare cell populations.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of acute kidney injury.
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of spatial transcriptomics to study acute kidney injury (AKI). It discusses how spatial transcriptomics can provide insights into the cellular heterogeneity and spatial organization of the kidney during AKI, and how these findings can inform potential therapeutic strategies. The review highlights the current state of the field and future directions.

title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human fetal blood in Down syndrome.
biological_context: Human fetal blood in Down syndrome
main_goals: This study aimed to understand dysregulated hematopoiesis in Down syndrome by integrating multi-omic single-cell data from human fetal liver and bone marrow. It identified that Down syndrome HSCs are primed to differentiate, restructured regulatory interactions, and observed increased mitochondrial mass and oxidative stress.

title: Disease-associated oligodendroglia: a putative nexus in neurodegeneration.
main_goals: This paper proposes that disease-associated oligodendroglia are a key nexus in neurodegeneration. It highlights their role in modulating neuroinflammation, particularly in multiple sclerosis, and suggests them as potential pharmacological targets.

title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Tunnels Invasive Transcriptional Signature.
main_goals: This paper investigates the invasive transcriptional signature of Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS) tunnels. It aims to understand the molecular mechanisms driving this specific feature of the disease.

title: Enhancing EEG data quality and precision for cloud-based clinical applications: an evaluation of the SLOG framework.
main_goals: This paper introduces the Second Layer Inspection for EOG (SLOG) framework, an auxiliary algorithm designed to improve the accuracy of EOG artifact rejection in EEG data. SLOG aims to re-examine marked EOG artifacts using spatial and temporal patterns to prevent the mistaken elimination of EEG-related activity, thereby enhancing EEG data quality for cloud-based clinical applications.

title: FixNCut: A Practical Guide to Sample Preservation by Reversible Fixation for Single Cell Assays.
main_goals: Presents an optimized and robust practical guide to the FixNCut protocol, a reversible fixation strategy for sample preservation. This method decouples tissue or cell harvesting from downstream single-cell assays, enabling flexible and decentralized workflows. It aims to preserve cellular and molecular structures for various single-cell genomic assays while minimizing artifacts.

title: Subcellular Level Spatial Transcriptomics with PHOTON.
biological_context: Granulosa cells in the ovary, nucleolus, stress granule
main_goals: Presents PHOTON, a method combining high-resolution imaging and sequencing for subcellular spatial transcriptome profiling. Demonstrates its capability to capture transcriptomes within specific cell types and subcellular compartments, revealing the role of m6A modification in stress granule partitioning.

title: Characterizing cell-type spatial relationships across length scales in spatially resolved omics data.
data_modalities_used: ['spatially resolved omics', 'simulated datasets', 'real SRO datasets', 'diverse tissues', 'diverse SRO technologies']
main_goals: The paper introduces CRAWDAD, an open-source R package, for quantifying multi-scale cell-type spatial relationships in spatially resolved omics data. It demonstrates the package's utility in recapitulating expected relationships, evaluating against other methods, and comparing spatial relationships across samples. The goal is to provide quantitative metrics for identifying, characterizing, and comparing cell-type spatial relationships.

title: Uncovering Plaque-Glia Niches in Human Alzheimer's Disease Brains Using Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study applies spatial transcriptomics and immunohistochemistry to human Alzheimer's disease brains to investigate the interaction between amyloid-beta plaques and surrounding glial cells. It reveals distinct transcriptomic profiles in plaque-glia niches, linking Aβ levels to neuronal loss and glial activation to inflammation and neurodegeneration. The findings provide insights into glial responses to Aβ and lay the groundwork for future pathology genomics studies.

title: Dysfunctional β-cell longevity in diabetes relies on energy conservation and positive epistasis.
biological_context: Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) and pancreatic beta-cell function
main_goals: This study investigates the role of dysfunctional, long-lived beta-cells in type 2 diabetes. It explores how PFKFB3 contributes to their survival and dysfunction by analyzing transcriptional profiles from human T2D pancreata and mouse models. The findings suggest that PFKFB3 promotes the survival of 'loser' beta-cells through positive epistasis and that inhibiting PFKFB3 can restore glucose tolerance.

title: Spatial Isoforms Reveal the Mechanisms of Metastasis.
biological_context: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) with lymph node metastasis
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial isoform transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing', 'human solid tumors', 'lymph nodes']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of spatial isoforms and CD8+ T cells in lymph node metastasis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It identifies C1QC+ TAMs and CD74 isoforms as key contributors to chemoresistance and metastasis, suggesting CD74 isoforms as potential therapeutic targets.

title: At the Interface of Tumor-Associated Macrophages and Fibroblasts: Immune-Suppressive Networks and Emerging Exploitable Targets.
main_goals: This review delves into the latest discoveries elucidating the biology of TAM and CAF crosstalk within the tumor microenvironment (TME) of solid cancers. It examines the complexity of these interactions, with a particular focus on ligand-receptor interactions and clinically significant targets for novel therapeutic strategies. The paper highlights advancements in single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics that have enhanced comprehension of signaling dynamics between TAMs and CAFs.

title: Region of interest localization, tissue storage time, and antibody binding density-a technical note on the GeoMx® Digital Spatial Profiler.
biological_context: Prostate cancer and renal cell carcinoma
covered_analysis_steps: ['Antibody binding density assessment', 'Spatial protein expression analysis']
main_goals: This technical note assesses the influence of region of interest selection, tissue fixation, and storage time on the antibody binding density (ABD) using the NanoString GeoMx® DSP platform. It investigates whether regional differences in fixation affect ABD and examines the effect of tissue storage time. The findings highlight that while the platform is robust for spatial biology, tissue storage time should be considered during data interpretation.

title: UQCRB and LBH are correlated with Gleason score progression in prostate cancer: Spatial transcriptomics and experimental validation.
main_goals: This study applies Visium spatial transcriptomics to prostate cancer tissues to understand Gleason score progression. It identifies UQCRB and LBH as key genes involved in this progression, with their knockdown suppressing cancer cell proliferation and invasion. The findings are validated with TCGA data and experimental methods.

title: AFSC: A self-supervised augmentation-free spatial clustering method based on contrastive learning for identifying spatial domains.
main_goals: This paper proposes AFSC, a self-supervised spatial clustering method based on contrastive learning for identifying spatial domains. It integrates spatial information and gene expression to learn latent representations without data augmentation. The method enables clustering and contrastive learning to be trained together and shows good performance on multiple spatial transcriptomics datasets for downstream tasks.

title: Are we there yet? Exploring astrocyte heterogeneity one cell at a time.
biological_context: Central nervous system (brain and spinal cord)
data_modalities_used: ['sequencing-based single cell assays', 'spatial genomics', 'single cell RNA-sequencing']
main_goals: This review discusses recent studies on astrocyte biology and heterogeneity, driven by single-cell sequencing advances. It aims to explore the understanding of astrocyte biology and heterogeneity, as well as the limitations and future utility of sequencing-based single-cell and spatial genomics methods.

title: Proteome-Scale Tissue Mapping Using Mass Spectrometry Based on Label-Free and Multiplexed Workflows.
main_goals: Benchmarking three protein quantification methods (label-free, TMT-MS2, TMT-MS3) for proteome-scale tissue mapping. The study aims to identify challenges in protein coverage and analytical throughput and evaluate their performance in terms of coverage, dynamic range, throughput, and robustness for biomarker identification and spatial coexpression analysis.

title: Investigating the mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations in Parkinson's disease using spatial transcriptomics techniques.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease (PD) pathogenesis and mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: To investigate the mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations in Parkinson's disease using spatial transcriptomic sequencing in an MPTP-induced mouse model. The study aims to provide insights into the pathological changes at specific brain regions and their association with neuronal damage and disease progression.

title: Spatial proteomics: unveiling the multidimensional landscape of protein localization in human diseases.
biological_context: Human diseases (cancer, neurological disorders, cardiovascular diseases, autoimmune diseases)
main_goals: To summarize the fundamental concepts and characteristics of tissue-level spatial proteomics, its research progress in common human diseases, and anticipate its future development trends. The aim is to highlight the significant impact of spatial proteomics on understanding disease pathogenesis, advancing diagnostic methods, and developing potential therapeutic targets.

title: Spatial analysis reveals targetable macrophage-mediated mechanisms of immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma minimal residual disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper identifies targetable macrophage-mediated mechanisms of immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma minimal residual disease (MRD). It reveals that PD-L1+ M2-like macrophages interact with stem-like tumor cells, correlating with T cell exhaustion and poor survival. The study demonstrates that combined blockade of Pdl1 and Tgfβ can eliminate residual tumor cells by modulating macrophages and recruiting CD8+ T cells.

title: Advances in spatial proteomics: Mapping proteome architecture from protein complexes to subcellular localizations.
main_goals: This paper reviews current complementary approaches for determining the subcellular organization of the proteome, discussing their scale, resolution, and caveats. It also looks at emerging technologies for a more comprehensive understanding of protein isoforms and their functional roles in cell biology and disease.

title: Linking transcriptome and morphology in bone cells at cellular resolution with generative AI.
data_modalities_used: ['histological images', 'single-cell molecular data', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This paper summarizes the progress and prospects of generative AI applied to large-scale, complex biological datasets, particularly focusing on their potential applications to bone research. It highlights three key AI applications: predicting cell differentiation dynamics, linking molecular and morphological features, and predicting cellular responses to perturbations. The paper also outlines critical issues and future directions necessary for realizing the potential of generative AI for bone biology.

title: Detecting anomalous anatomic regions in spatial transcriptomics with STANDS.
biological_context: Anomalous tissue domains (ATDs) in multi-sample spatial transcriptomics (ST) data for disease characterization.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Alignment of spatial domains', 'Subtyping of spatial domains']
main_goals: Introduce STANDS, a framework using Generative Adversarial Networks for de novo detection, alignment, and subtyping of anomalous tissue domains (ATDs) in multi-sample spatial transcriptomics. STANDS leverages multimodal-learning, transfer-learning, and style-transfer to address challenges in unalignable ATDs, multimodal information utilization, and data scarcity. It demonstrates superiority in identifying common and individual-specific ATDs and dissecting them into biologically distinct subdomains.

title: Inter-organ cross-talk in human cancer cachexia revealed by spatial metabolomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Metabolomics', 'Component analysis', 'Pathway enrichment analysis', 'Correlation network analysis', 'Machine learning']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular inter-organ cross-talk in human cancer cachexia using spatial metabolomics. The researchers investigated metabolic alterations in various organs and serum of cachectic vs. control patients and developed machine learning classifiers for diagnostic purposes.

title: Classification of land lot shapes in real estate sector using a convolutional neural network.
main_goals: This study aims to classify land lot shapes automatically using a convolutional neural network (Xception). The developed approach is expected to enable rapid and accurate classification of various lot shapes, quantifying shape regularity.

title: Imaging immunometabolism in situ in live animals.
data_modalities_used: ['in vitro studies', 'ex vivo studies', 'Raman microscopy', 'autofluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy']
main_goals: This review aims to analyze currently available imaging-based technologies and explore emerging methods like Raman and autofluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy for analyzing dynamic intracellular metabolism at the single-cell level within the natural context of biological processes. It emphasizes the necessity of investigating cellular metabolism in its native microenvironment to understand cell-intrinsic mechanisms and tissue-level regulation.

title: Deciphering breast cancer dynamics: insights from single-cell and spatial profiling in the multi-omics era.
main_goals: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the historical development of single-cell sequencing (SCS) and highlights recent advancements in utilizing SCS and spatial omics for breast cancer research. It aims to offer valuable references for future advancements in basic research, clinical diagnosis, and treatment of breast cancer.

title: Search and match across spatial omics samples at single-cell resolution.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial-to-spatial searching and matching', 'Reconstruction of spatially resolved single-cell multi-omic profiles', 'Spatially resolved differential analysis', 'Single-cell relative translational efficiency profiling']
main_goals: Introduces CAST, a deep graph neural network-based method for cross-sample alignment of spatial omics data at the single-cell level. CAST enables searching, matching, and visualizing similarities and differences of molecular features across multiple samples and technologies. It further allows for spatially resolved differential analysis and translational efficiency profiling.

title: Multi-omics integration for both single-cell and spatially resolved data based on dual-path graph attention auto-encoder.
main_goals: Propose a multi-omics integration method, SSGATE, based on a dual-path graph attention auto-encoder. SSGATE can process both single-cell and spatially resolved data by constructing neighborhood graphs based on expression profiles or spatial coordinates. It aims to improve upon existing methods by better integrating transcriptomics and proteomics data, demonstrating superior performance and robustness.

title: Combined single cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals hedgehog pathway-related genes as potential therapeutic targets for cervical cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates hedgehog pathway-related genes as potential therapeutic targets for cervical cancer. It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify myofibroblasts with enriched hedgehog pathway activity and explores the role of MYH9 in these cells, linking MYH9-positive myofibroblasts to patient prognosis and immunotherapeutic efficacy.

title: Measurement of adhesion and traction of cells at high yield reveals an energetic ratchet operating during nephron condensation.
biological_context: Mouse embryonic kidney development and canine kidney epithelial cell signaling
main_goals: The paper introduces MATCHY, a high-throughput method for measuring cell adhesion and traction, coupled with downstream immunofluorescence. It aims to bridge the gap between gene expression data and physical morphogenesis by providing quantitative biophysical information. MATCHY is designed for complex cell mixtures and enables detailed biophysical atlasing of developing tissues.

title: Basal-to-inflammatory transition and tumor resistance via crosstalk with a pro-inflammatory stromal niche.
biological_context: Carcinoma, specifically basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma transition
main_goals: This paper identifies a new tumor state, the 'basal-to-inflammatory transition,' which is enriched in inflammation and therapy resistance. It details how this transition is driven by TREM1 myeloid cells and their cytokines, leading to reduced sensitivity to treatment. The study aims to deepen understanding of tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and nominate this state as a targetable entity.

title: Manganese exposure leads to depressive-like behavior through disruption of the Gln-Glu-GABA metabolic cycle.
biological_context: Manganese exposure induced depressive-like behavior and cognitive dysfunction in mice
main_goals: Investigate the relationship between manganese exposure and depression, and the underlying mechanisms. The study found that manganese exposure leads to depressive-like behavior and cognitive impairment in mice by disrupting the Gln-Glu-GABA metabolic cycle through downregulation of GAD1 in astrocytes.

title: ADAMTS12 promotes fibrosis by restructuring extracellular matrix to enable activation of injury-responsive fibroblasts.
main_goals: This paper identifies ADAMTS12 as a key factor promoting fibrosis by restructuring the extracellular matrix. It demonstrates that ADAMTS12 enables the activation and migration of injury-responsive fibroblasts, which are characterized by aberrant JAK/STAT signaling. The study uses in vivo knockout models and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate this mechanism.

title: The burgeoning spatial multi-omics in human gastrointestinal cancers.
biological_context: Human gastrointestinal cancers (esophageal cancer, gastric cancer, and colorectal cancer)
main_goals: To provide a comprehensive overview of spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and spatial metabolomics technologies and their applications in esophageal cancer, gastric cancer, and colorectal cancer. The objective is to foster research and implementation of spatial multi-omics technology in digestive tumor diseases and provide new technical insights for molecular biology researchers.

title: Technologies for Decoding Cancer Metabolism with Spatial Resolution.
main_goals: This paper reviews three emerging metabolomic technologies: spatial metabolomics, single-cell metabolomics, and organellar metabolomics. It discusses how these technologies, alongside established omics methods, can advance the understanding of cancer metabolism.

title: k* Distribution: Evaluating the Latent Space of Deep Neural Networks Using Local Neighborhood Analysis.
main_goals: Introduces the k* distribution and its corresponding visualization technique to evaluate the latent space of deep neural networks using local neighborhood analysis. This method aims to preserve the structure of sample distributions for individual classes, facilitating comparison and understanding of how classes are processed by neural networks. The study identifies three distinct distributions (fractured, overlapped, clustered) and demonstrates the applicability across different network architectures, layers, transformations, and data splits.

title: Large-volume fully automated cell reconstruction generates a cell atlas of plant tissues.
biological_context: Poplar (P. simonii Carr. and P. canadensis Moench.) seeds and developing shoot apical meristem
main_goals: Established Large-Volume Fully Automated Cell Reconstruction (LVACR) framework for 3D cytological features and cellular connectivity in centimeter-scale plant organs. Demonstrated its efficiency in cell segmentation and aggregation using light sheet fluorescence microscopy. Generated cell atlases of different plant tissues, revealing differences in cell clusters and shapes, and conserved cellular connectivity.

title: Image Analysis Protocol for DNA/RNA/Immunofluorescence (IF)-seqFISH Data.
main_goals: This paper details a comprehensive step-by-step protocol for image analysis of DNA/RNA/Immunofluorescence (IF)-seqFISH data. It covers image preprocessing, spot detection, and data visualization, enabling detailed observations of transcription machinery within cells and tissues at the single-allele level. The associated Jupyter Notebook codes are made available on GitHub for practical application.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Analyses Implicate Formation of the Immunosuppressive Microenvironment during Breast Tumor Progression.
biological_context: Breast cancer progression (ductal carcinoma in situ to invasive ductal carcinoma)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Single-Cell Analysis', 'Spatial Analysis', 'Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate the formation of an immunosuppressive microenvironment during breast tumor progression by analyzing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data from ductal carcinoma in situ and invasive ductal carcinoma samples. The study reveals tumor cell malignancy, T cell exhaustion, and the role of coinhibitory ligands in creating an immunosuppressive landscape.

title: A conserved cell-type gradient across the human mediodorsal and paraventricular thalamus.
biological_context: Human mediodorsal and paraventricular thalamus, cognition, mental illness
main_goals: To define the cellular composition of the mediodorsal thalamus (MD) and adjacent midline nuclei using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified a conserved excitatory neuron gradient and explored its relationship with human brain evolution and genetic risk for psychiatric disorders.

title: Ultrack: pushing the limits of cell tracking across biological scales.
biological_context: embryo development in zebrafish, fruit fly, and nematode, as well as general cellular imaging
data_modalities_used: ['light-sheet microscopy', 'multi-channel time-lapse recordings', 'label-free cellular imaging', 'histology images']
main_goals: To introduce Ultrack, a versatile and scalable cell-tracking method that addresses challenges in complex tissues by considering candidate segmentations from multiple algorithms. The method aims to improve accuracy and robustness in tracking cells across various biological scales and imaging conditions. It also proposes a validation approach using dual-channel sparse labeling for high-fidelity ground truth generation.

title: Gene interactions analysis of brain spatial transcriptome for Alzheimer's disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Ligand-receptor communication', 'Transcription factor regulatory network', 'Spot-specific network', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to analyze gene interactions in the brain spatial transcriptome for Alzheimer's disease (AD) by examining ligand-receptor communication, transcription factor regulatory networks, and spot-specific networks. The goal is to reveal the dependence and dynamics of gene associations/interactions on spatial regions and pathological status during amyloid-β accumulation. The findings are validated using independent datasets from mouse models and human data.

title: MONDEP: A unified SpatioTemporal MONitoring Framework for National DEPression Forecasting.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data Pre-processing', 'Exploratory Data Analysis', 'Model Training and Testing']
main_goals: To propose a SpatioTemporal Monitoring Framework for National Depression Forecasting (MONDEP) that utilizes machine learning and deep learning to predict depression profiles at district and national levels using multivariate time series. The framework consists of data pre-processing, exploratory data analysis, and model training/testing modules. The study aims to improve depression management and mental health service policy.

title: Instance segmentation of cells and nuclei from multi-organ cross-protocol microscopic images.
biological_context: Cell biology, microscopic imaging of cells and nuclei across various organs.
main_goals: To propose a computational model for instance segmentation of cells and nuclei from microscopic images using a combination of YOLOv9-E, SAM, and image processing techniques. The goal is to overcome challenges like variations in morphology, noise, and overlapping cells, providing a reliable assistive tool for cell biology experts.

title: Metabolic reprogramming by mutant GNAS creates an actionable dependency in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms of the pancreas.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMNs) of the pancreas, a precursor to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 screen', 'histology images']
main_goals: To unveil the consequences of mutant GnasR201C expression on phenotype, transcriptomic profile, and genomic dependencies in IPMNs. The study identified that KrasG12D and GnasR201C co-expression leads to gastric pyloric metaplasia and a dependency on glycolysis for cell survival, suggesting a potential therapeutic target.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis: Maternal Obesity Impairs Myogenic Cell Migration and Differentiation during Embryonic Limb Development.
biological_context: Maternal obesity impairs embryonic limb development and muscle formation by affecting myogenic cell migration and differentiation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Signal Transduction']
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of maternal obesity on myogenic cell migration and differentiation during embryonic limb development using spatial transcriptomics. The findings indicate that maternal obesity impedes these processes, contributing to impaired fetal muscle development and altered offspring muscle function.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Identifies Cellular and Molecular Characteristics of Scleroderma Skin Lesions: Pilot Study in Juvenile Scleroderma.
data_modalities_used: ['Visium CytAssist spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'histopathological slides', 'gene expression analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Type Composition Estimation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study utilized spatial transcriptomics to investigate the cellular and molecular characteristics of skin lesions in juvenile scleroderma patients. The goals were to identify spatial domains, estimate cell type composition by integrating with scRNA-seq, and delineate immune infiltrates to enhance understanding of the disease pathogenesis. The findings demonstrated the biological relevance of spatial transcriptomics in this context.

title: Scoping Review: Methods and Applications of Spatial Transcriptomics in Tumor Research.
main_goals: This scoping study reviews the challenges and practical applications of spatial transcriptomics in cancer research, summarizing current methods, trends, and data analysis techniques. It highlights Visium as the leading platform and SCTransform from Seurat as a preferred normalization method. The review aims to improve reproducibility by recommending greater transparency in sharing analysis methods.

title: Single-cell, single-nucleus and xenium-based spatial transcriptomics analyses reveal inflammatory activation and altered cell interactions in the hippocampus in mice with temporal lobe epilepsy.
biological_context: Temporal lobe epilepsy in mice hippocampus
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'Xenium-based spatial transcriptomics', 'sequencing']
main_goals: To establish a high-resolution single-cell transcriptomic atlas of the hippocampus in mice with temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) using single-cell RNA sequencing, single-nucleus RNA sequencing, and Xenium-based spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to reveal potential intrinsic mechanisms driving TLE-associated inflammatory activation and altered cell interactions.

title: Identification of microenvironment features associated with primary resistance to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 + antiangiogenesis in gastric cancer through spatial transcriptomics and plasma proteomics.
main_goals: To identify microenvironment features associated with primary resistance to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 and antiangiogenesis in gastric cancer. The study investigated mechanisms of inherent resistance by analyzing tumor microenvironment and plasma proteomics in patients treated with regorafenib and avelumab.

title: Analyzing submicron spatial transcriptomics data at their original resolution.
main_goals: This paper introduces a method to analyze submicron spatial transcriptomics data at their original resolution, enabling more precise biological interpretations of gene expression patterns within cellular structures. It addresses the challenges of analyzing high-resolution spatial transcriptomics data, offering a framework for deeper insights into tissue organization and cellular function.

title: Analysis of the spatio-temporal distribution of Chinese professional football clubs and influential factors based on empirical evidence of clubs.
main_goals: This paper analyzes the spatio-temporal distribution and migration patterns of Chinese professional football clubs from 1994 to 2021. It uses GIS spatial analysis and exploratory spatial data analysis to investigate the influence of regional economic, demographic, and sports industry development levels on these patterns. The study identifies key factors affecting club distribution and migration over time.

title: Current computational methods for spatial transcriptomics in cancer biology.
main_goals: This paper reviews current computational methods for spatial transcriptomics in cancer biology. It highlights the importance of spatial information lost in single-cell dissociation and how spatial transcriptomics, coupled with mathematical and statistical methods, can address this for understanding cellular behavior in the tumor microenvironment.

title: Data enhancement in the age of spatial biology.
biological_context: Cancer biology, including complex diseases like cancer.
main_goals: This review discusses computational approaches for integrating spatial transcriptomics with other data types. It aims to illuminate key challenges and outline current algorithmic solutions to enhance understanding of cancer biology.

title: Crosstalk between tumor and microenvironment: Insights from spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This review provides a perspective on factors driving cancer heterogeneity, tumor evolution, and clonal states. It briefly describes spatial transcriptomic technologies and summarizes recent literature on the dynamical interactions between tumor states, cell-to-cell communication, and remodeling of the local microenvironment.

title: Applications of spatial transcriptomics and artificial intelligence to develop integrated management of pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of pancreatic cancer, describes how spatial transcriptomics and artificial intelligence have been used to study it, and provides examples of how integrating these tools can help physicians manage pancreatic cancer in a more personalized approach.

title: Deep learning-based multimodal spatial transcriptomics analysis for cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This chapter explores the integration of deep learning (DL) with multimodal spatial transcriptomics (ST) to advance cancer diagnostics, treatment planning, and precision medicine. It discusses how DL models and multimodal data analysis offer comprehensive and actionable insights for cancer diagnosis and treatment, highlighting their transformative potential in cancer research and clinical practice.

title: Spatial omics advances for in situ RNA biology.
biological_context: embryonic development, neurobiology, and disease pathology
data_modalities_used: ['cell fractionation', 'in situ labeling', 'proximity labeling', 'imaging', 'spatially indexed next-generation sequencing (NGS)', 'computational modeling', 'RNA', 'multimodal biomolecules']
main_goals: This review explores past studies in subcellular, cellular, and tissue-level spatial RNA biology driven by diverse methodologies. It highlights recent advances enabling near-genome-scale profiling of RNA and multimodal biomolecules at high spatial resolution. The paper aims to reveal the complexity and heterogeneity of spatial RNA biology with subcellular resolution.

title: Geographical characteristics and influencing factors of the health level of older adults in the Yangtze River Economic Belt, China, from 2010 to 2020.
biological_context: Health level of older adults in the Yangtze River Economic Belt, China
main_goals: To analyze the spatiotemporal pattern and influencing factors of the health level of older adults in the Yangtze River Economic Belt (YREB) from 2010 to 2020 using various statistical and spatial analysis methods. The study aims to provide insights for improving the health of older adults in the region and promoting healthy aging.

title: Spatial multi-omics analysis of the microenvironment in traumatic spinal cord injury: a narrative review.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This review systematically surveys the progress of spatial multi-omics techniques in understanding the microenvironment after traumatic spinal cord injury (tSCI). It discusses changes in the immune microenvironment and explores potential future therapeutic strategies.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tumor-derived SPP1 induces fibroblast chemotaxis and activation in the hepatocellular carcinoma microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of SPP1 secreted by tumor cells in activating hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) and inducing their differentiation into cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) within the hepatocellular carcinoma microenvironment. It identifies the SPP1-CD44 signaling axis as a key mechanism driving this interaction and suggests targeting this pathway for therapeutic benefit.

title: A graph self-supervised residual learning framework for domain identification and data integration of spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics', 'Batch Correction']
main_goals: The paper proposes ResST, a graph self-supervised residual learning framework for spatial transcriptomics data. ResST aims to accurately identify spatial domains and integrate multi-sample ST datasets by capturing relationships between cells and correcting batch effects.

title: From genes to geography: Mapping allergic disease landscapes with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to map allergic disease landscapes using spatial transcriptomics. It focuses on applying existing spatial transcriptomics technologies like GeoMx and Visium to understand allergic asthma and atopic dermatitis.

title: Hepatic stellate cells promote hepatocellular carcinoma development by regulating histone lactylation: Novel insights from single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analyses.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic data', 'Western blot', 'Real-time reverse transcription PCR', 'Cell Counting Kit 8 (CCK8) assay']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential expression Analysis', 'Survival Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to evaluate the cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It investigated the role of hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) in HCC development by regulating histone lactylation. The findings highlight the pivotal role of HSCs in HCC pathogenesis through this mechanism.

title: VISION - an open-source software for automated multi-dimensional image analysis of cellular biophysics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Image Processing', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spectral Analysis', 'Biophysical Parameter Calculation', '3D Mapping', 'Temporal Mapping']
main_goals: This paper introduces VISION, an open-source Python software for automated multi-dimensional image analysis of cellular biophysics. It enhances spectral image processing with advanced single-cell segmentation and allows user-defined mathematical operations on spectra to calculate biophysical parameters. VISION enables 3D and temporal mapping of properties like membrane fluidity and mitochondrial potential.

title: PoweREST: Statistical Power Estimation for Spatial Transcriptomics Experiments to Detect Differentially Expressed Genes Between Two Conditions.
main_goals: This paper introduces PoweREST, a tool for statistical power estimation for spatial transcriptomics experiments to detect differentially expressed genes between two conditions. It supports power calculation both before experiments and after preliminary data collection, and includes a user-friendly web application for interactive use.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome assays reveal heterogeneity in gliomas through stress responses and pathway alterations.
biological_context: Glioma heterogeneity, specifically in high- and low-grade gliomas, with a focus on oxidative stress responses in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs).
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA-seq analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'pathway analysis', 'gene regulatory network inference (SCENIC)']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the impact of oxidative stress response genes in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs) within gliomas using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified distinct pathway activations and metabolic shifts in high- and low-grade gliomas under oxidative stress, highlighting the role of the AP1 transcription factor in promoting tumor cell survival and proliferation in high-grade gliomas.

title: The added value of diffusion tensor imaging with systematic bias correction for the assessment of liver morphology and physiology.
main_goals: This work presents a preprocessing pipeline for enhanced magnetic field gradient non-uniformity calibration and analysis of systematic bias removal in Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) of the human liver. The pipeline includes denoising, B1 correction, rigid body registration, and magnetic field gradient non-uniformity correction using the B-matrix spatial distribution (BSD) method. The study demonstrates the significant impact of these corrections on DTI metrics like mean diffusivity (MD) and fractional anisotropy (FA).

title: Spatial resolved transcriptomics reveals distinct cross-talk between cancer cells and tumor-associated macrophages in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study applies spatial transcriptomics and digital spatial profiling to characterize the tumor microenvironment of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA). It reveals spatial heterogeneities driven by physical proximity and identifies a cross-talk mechanism where TFF3 secreted by cancer cells reprograms macrophages to a tumor-promoting, immune-suppressive state.

title: Full-length target sequences of GeoMx digital spatial profiling probes reveal that gene-promiscuity predicts probe sensitivity to EDTA tissue decalcification.
main_goals: This paper investigates the impact of EDTA tissue decalcification on GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiling probe counts. It reveals that probe gene-promiscuity, determined by full-length target sequences, predicts sensitivity to EDTA incubation, which can lead to apparent overexpression after normalization. The study aims to improve the understanding and mitigation of this technical artifact in spatial transcriptomics.

title: Touching the Ground: Evaluating the Effectiveness of Data Physicalizations for Spatial Data Analysis Tasks.
main_goals: This paper presents a study comparing human performance in 3D spatial data analysis tasks across physical and digital visualization modalities. The goal was to evaluate the effectiveness of data physicalizations for spatial data analysis compared to digital alternatives.

title: Understanding Learning from EEG Data: Combining Machine Learning and Feature Engineering Based on Hidden Markov Models and Mixed Models.
main_goals: This paper proposes using hidden Markov and linear mixed effects models to extract features from EEG data. The goal is to analyze the performance of machine learning methods on classifying learner and non-learner participants based on engineered features from frontal theta EEG data during a spatial navigation task. The study also examines the impact of different standardization methods on classification performance.

title: Modulation of blood-tumor barrier transcriptional programs improves intra-tumoral drug delivery and potentiates chemotherapy in GBM.
main_goals: This study identifies a 12-gene signature associated with the blood-tumor barrier (BTB) in Glioblastoma (GBM). It demonstrates that the indirubin-derivative, 6-bromoindirubin acetoxime (BIA), can modulate these BTB genes, leading to improved delivery of chemotherapeutics like cisplatin and potentiating its efficacy. The research supports the development of BIA for improved GBM treatment.

title: MorphLink: Bridging Cell Morphological Behaviors and Molecular Dynamics in Multi-modal Spatial Omics.
data_modalities_used: ['multi-modal spatial omics', 'morphological features', 'molecular measurements', 'transcriptomic heterogeneity', 'immune diversity']
covered_analysis_steps: ['identifying disease-related morphological-molecular interplays', 'linking interpretable morphological features with molecular measurements', 'depicting cellular behaviors driving transcriptomic heterogeneity', 'analyzing immune diversity across tissue regions', 'integrative spatial omics data analysis across samples, cohorts, and modalities']
main_goals: To provide a framework for systematically identifying disease-related morphological-molecular interplays in multi-modal spatial omics data. MorphLink aims to link interpretable morphological features with molecular measurements to understand cellular behaviors driving heterogeneity and immune diversity in diseased tissues. It is designed to be scalable and robust against batch effects for efficient integrative analysis.

title: Effects of connectivity hyperalignment (CHA) on estimated brain network properties: from coarse-scale to fine-scale.
main_goals: This study aims to determine how connectivity hyperalignment (CHA), an analytic approach for handling functional misalignment, can change estimated functional brain network topologies at various spatial scales. The findings highlight the role of CHA in improving inter-subject similarities while retaining individual-specific information at finer spatial granularities.

title: Spatial characterization and stratification of colorectal adenomas by deep visual proteomics.
main_goals: This paper aimed to establish a molecular feature-based risk allocation framework for colorectal adenomas using Deep Visual Proteomics (DVP). DVP combines AI, microdissection, and mass spectrometry to characterize cellular heterogeneity and identify protein markers linked to recurrence and metabolic shifts. The study sought to refine early detection and personalize patient management strategies.

title: Combined single cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals cellular heterogeneity of hedgehog pathway in gastric cancer.
main_goals: This study combines single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the hedgehog pathway in gastric cancer. It identifies fibroblasts with enriched hedgehog pathway activity and highlights the role of CCND1 in their development and association with tumor progression, immune response, and chemotherapeutic efficacy.

title: Glioblastoma cells increase expression of notch signaling and synaptic genes within infiltrated brain tissue.
main_goals: This study characterizes the gene expression landscape of glioblastoma cells within infiltrated brain tissue using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies increased expression of neurodevelopmental and glial differentiation genes in these cells, suggesting new therapeutic targets for recurrent tumors after surgical resection.

title: Microbiota-induced S100A11-RAGE axis underlies immune evasion in right-sided colon adenomas and is a therapeutic target to boost anti-PD1 efficacy.
main_goals: To characterize differences between left-sided and right-sided colon adenomas, identify the microbiota-induced S100A11-RAGE axis underlying immune evasion in right-sided adenomas, and demonstrate its potential as a therapeutic target to enhance anti-PD1 efficacy.

title: Development of an algorithm for analysis of routes: Case studies using novice and older drivers.
main_goals: This paper presents a new GPS data-based algorithm to analyze the uniqueness of driving routes. The algorithm assesses driving route diversity and familiarity, producing measures that correlate with driving behavior and psychological/physical outcomes in novice and older drivers.

title: Bin2cell reconstructs cells from high resolution Visium HD data.
biological_context: Mouse brain and human colorectal cancer
main_goals: Bin2cell reconstructs cells from high-resolution Visium HD data by leveraging morphology image segmentation and gene expression information. It aims to improve downstream analysis compared to default lower-resolution binning. The tool operates efficiently and is compatible with established Python single-cell and spatial transcriptomics software.

title: UnDRground Tubes: Exploring Spatial Data with Multidimensional Projections and Set Visualization.
