main_goals: To overcome challenges in analyzing large kinetic MALDI-MSI datasets and improve SIL metabolite identification. A bioinformatics pipeline was developed for spatial alignment, dimensionality reduction, and metabolite annotation coupled with pathway enrichment. This pipeline aims to enable rapid characterization of spatio-temporal metabolic patterns from tissues.

title: Spatio-temporal learning and explaining for dynamic functional connectivity analysis: Application to depression.
main_goals: The study proposes a spatio-temporal learning and explaining framework for dynamic functional connectivity (dFC) analysis to identify Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) from resting-state fMRI data. It develops a stacking neural network model combining a spatial encoder and a temporal encoder, and uses a two-stage explanation method (LRP and attention) to identify disorder-relevant patterns in dFCs.

title: CCL19-producing fibroblasts promote tertiary lymphoid structure formation enhancing anti-tumor IgG response in colorectal cancer liver metastasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It reveals that CCL19-producing fibroblasts promote TLS formation, which in turn enhances anti-tumor IgG responses. The findings suggest a therapeutic strategy using CCL19 to restrict CRLM.

title: Integrated analysis of spatial transcriptomics and CT phenotypes for unveiling the novel molecular characteristics of recurrent and non-recurrent high-grade serous ovarian cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'CT phenotypes', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: To integrate spatial transcriptomics and CT phenotypes to identify molecular characteristics of recurrent and non-recurrent high-grade serous ovarian cancer. The study aimed to uncover novel diagnostic and therapeutic targets by correlating spatial gene expression patterns with CT imaging features, contributing to personalized medicine approaches.

title: Divergent venom effectors correlate with ecological niche in neuropteran predators.
biological_context: Neuropteran predators (antlion Euroleon nostras and lacewing Chrysoperla carnea) and their venom systems
main_goals: This study investigated the venom systems in two neuropteran predators occupying distinct ecological niches (antlion Euroleon nostras and lacewing Chrysoperla carnea) using spatial transcriptomics, proteomics, morphological analysis, and bioassays. The aim was to understand how venom composition correlates with ecological niche and to identify the origin of venom proteins. The findings highlight the molecular evolution of venom as a key adaptation for antlions.

title: The neocortical infrastructure for language involves region-specific patterns of laminar gene expression.
biological_context: Human language network in the neocortex
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell expression data', 'postmortem cortical tissue samples']
main_goals: The study identified region-specific patterns of laminar gene expression in the human neocortex's language network. It found 56 genes with differential laminar expression between frontal and temporal language cortex, which are associated with structural connectivity and language-related disorders.

title: Dual mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics to investigate the metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride.
biological_context: Kidney metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride
main_goals: This study uses integrated mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics to investigate the metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride. It aims to identify the region-specific accumulation of nitidine chloride in the kidney, map its localization within renal tubules, and identify endogenous metabolites associated with chronic exposure to understand the underlying mechanisms of nephrotoxicity.

title: Prediction of PM<sub>2.5</sub> concentration based on a CNN-LSTM neural network algorithm.
main_goals: The paper introduces and validates a CNN-LSTM deep learning model for predicting PM2.5 concentration. It aims to capture temporal and spatial features of PM2.5 data, outperforming individual CNN and LSTM models.

title: Enhancing spatio-temporal environmental analyses: A machine learning superpixel-based approach.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel machine learning approach using superpixel segmentation for dense geospatial time series data. This method aims to reduce data dimensionality while preserving information, thereby enhancing data accuracy and environmental analyses. It also facilitates pixel aggregation for similar land-cover classifications and improves pixel clustering based on time series.

title: Anti-seasonal flooding drives substantial alterations in riparian plant diversity and niche characteristics in a unique hydro-fluctuation zone.
biological_context: Riparian ecosystems in the Three Gorges Reservoir, China
main_goals: To reveal the utilization of limited resources and mechanisms of inter-specific competition and species co-existence of plant communities under different hydro-fluctuation zones (HFZs) in the Three Gorges Reservoir, by investigating the effects of hydrological alterations on plant diversity and niche characteristics. The study found that anti-seasonal flooding reduced plant species richness and functional diversity, favoring annuals and flood-tolerant herbs. Hydrological alterations were identified as the paramount driver of vegetation distribution.

title: Applications of Single-Cell Omics Technologies for Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell-Based Cardiovascular Research.
biological_context: Cardiovascular research, specifically focusing on induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) for cardiac biology and disease.
main_goals: This review synthesizes insights from single-cell omics technologies, particularly single-cell RNA sequencing, in the context of induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) for cardiovascular research. It aims to deepen the understanding of cardiac biology and disease by elucidating molecular intricacies and exploring the potential of emerging paradigms like single-cell/spatial omics for revealing spatial organization within cardiac tissues.

title: Application of spatial omics in gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Biomarker Identification', 'Therapeutic Target Identification']
main_goals: This review discusses recent advances in spatial omics technology for gastric cancer research. It highlights applications in the tumor microenvironment, tumor heterogeneity, genesis and development mechanisms, and the identification of potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets. The review also emphasizes spatial omics' potential in precision medicine, summarizes challenges and future directions, and aims to improve patient outcomes.

title: Precise detection of cell-type-specific domains in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper proposes De-spot, a computational method that synthesizes segmentation and deconvolution to generate cell-type patterns. It aims to detect cell-type-specific domains, especially those with low-proportion cell types, and display them intuitively. De-spot was experimentally validated to discover co-localizations in tumor microenvironments that were obscured by previous methods.

title: Discovery and generalization of tissue structures from spatial omics data.
biological_context: Diabetic kidney disease, skin disorder, and neoplastic diseases
main_goals: The paper presents spatial cellular graph partitioning (SCGP), a flexible method for unsupervised annotation of tissue structures. It also introduces SCGP-Extension, a pipeline that generalizes reference tissue structure labels to unseen samples. The method demonstrates reliable partitioning and accurate identification of expertly annotated structures, providing disease-relevant insights.

title: Rose or Red, but Still under Threat: Comparing Microplastics Ingestion between Two Sympatric Marine Crustacean Species (Aristaeomorpha foliacea and Parapenaeus longirostris).
biological_context: Marine crustaceans (Aristaeomorpha foliacea and Parapenaeus longirostris)
main_goals: This study investigates microplastics (MPs) ingestion in two marine crustacean species, Aristaeomorpha foliacea and Parapenaeus longirostris, caught in the Central Tyrrhenian Sea. It uses gastrointestinal tract analysis and stable isotope analysis to understand the relationship between MPs pollution and the species' ecology, trophic position, and niche width. The research aims to provide insights into how MPs enter marine trophic webs.

title: Benchmarking clustering, alignment, and integration methods for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study systematically benchmarks state-of-the-art clustering, alignment, and integration methods for spatial transcriptomics data. It analyzes the strengths and weaknesses of various algorithms using diverse quantitative and qualitative metrics on real and simulated datasets. The goal is to provide comprehensive recommendations for method selection and guide future development.

title: Single-nucleus chromatin accessibility and transcriptomic map of breast tissues of women of diverse genetic ancestry.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-type classification', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Integration with spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To develop a comprehensive chromatin accessibility and gene expression atlas of the breast tissue using single-nucleus analysis. The study aims to classify cell types, establish relationships between chromatin accessibility and gene expression, and investigate genetic ancestry-dependent variability in breast biology. It also explores differences between lobular and ductal epithelial cells and age-associated changes.

title: Unlocking the power of spatial omics with AI.
main_goals: This paper discusses the potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to enhance spatial omics technologies. It highlights how AI can facilitate the integration of complex spatial omics datasets and accelerate the discovery of new biomedical insights by unlocking the full power of these technologies.

title: A robust poly-reference frequency-domain identification method to extract dynamic properties from vibration data.
main_goals: The paper proposes a robust and accurate frequency-domain modal model for extracting dynamic properties from vibration data. The method is designed to overcome limitations of existing techniques when applied to noise-contaminated data. Its performance is assessed through various metrics and application examples, showing improved identification results compared to state-of-the-art methods.

title: Spatial proteomic profiling elucidates immune determinants of neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study integrates clinical outcomes with spatial proteomic profiling using Imaging Mass Cytometry (IMC) to understand the immune microenvironment dynamics in response to neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It identifies spatial features predictive of therapeutic outcomes and uses machine learning to develop predictive models for drug response.

title: Proximity analysis of native proteomes reveals phenotypic modifiers in a mouse model of autism and related neurodevelopmental conditions.
biological_context: Mouse model of autism spectrum disorder and related neurodevelopmental conditions
main_goals: Develops a genome-editing-mediated approach for proximity-based endogenous proteomics in the mouse brain to identify spatial proteomes. This enables the discovery of protein interactions relevant to autism and related neurodevelopmental conditions, providing new avenues for genetic risk prioritization and understanding cellular drivers.

title: Integrative single-cell RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics analyses reveal diverse apoptosis-related gene expression profiles in EGFR-mutated lung cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'scRNA-seq analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of apoptosis-related genes in EGFR-mutated lung cancer, particularly in the context of acquired resistance to TKIs. It utilizes scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to profile gene expression changes and identifies BCL2L1/BCL-XL as a key survival factor, with genetic and pharmacological inhibition showing promise in overcoming resistance.

title: The effects of age and dysfunction on meibomian gland population dynamics.
biological_context: Meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD) and aging in mice
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: To use single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to probe changes in cell composition, differentiation, and gene expression associated with age-related gland atrophy and altered meibum quality in mice. The study aimed to identify mechanisms controlling meibomian gland function and dysfunction.

title: Spatial transcriptomic characterization of pathologic niches in IPF.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To bridge the gap in understanding IPF by providing spatial context to scRNA-seq data. The study aimed to identify disease-associated niches with unique cellular compositions and localizations in IPF lung tissue, facilitating the identification of drug targets and the development of in vitro models.

title: Single-cell sequencing combined with spatial transcriptomics reveals that the IRF7 gene in M1 macrophages inhibits the occurrence of pancreatic cancer by regulating lipid metabolism-related mechanisms.
main_goals: This study investigates the inhibitory role of IRF7 in M1 macrophages on pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PAAD) by regulating lipid metabolism. It explores the transfer of RPS18 via exosomes from M1 macrophages to PAAD cells, affecting ILF3 expression. The research also assesses the impact of IRF7/RPS18 on PAAD cell behavior and tumor formation in vivo.

title: SpatialCTD: A Large-Scale Tumor Microenvironment Spatial Transcriptomic Dataset to Evaluate Cell Type Deconvolution for Immuno-Oncology.
biological_context: Human tumor microenvironment across lung, kidney, and liver.
main_goals: To address limitations in existing cell type deconvolution benchmark datasets for human immuno-oncology by introducing a large-scale dataset (SpatialCTD) and a novel graph neural network-based deconvolution method (GNNDeconvolver). The study aims to provide a more realistic reference for deconvolution and demonstrate the superiority of GNNDeconvolver.

title: The multiverse of data preprocessing and analysis in graph-based fMRI: A systematic literature review of analytical choices fed into a decision support tool for informed analysis.
main_goals: This paper conducted a systematic literature review to identify analytical decisions in functional neuroimaging data preprocessing and analysis. It found a large number of different analytical choices, with controversial steps like scrubbing and global signal regression. The authors developed a decision support application called METEOR to facilitate robustness analysis.

title: PanIN and CAF transitions in pancreatic carcinogenesis revealed with spatial data integration.
biological_context: Pancreatic carcinogenesis, specifically premalignant pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasias (PanINs) and their transition to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).
data_modalities_used: ['whole transcriptome FFPE spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell high-dimensional imaging proteomics', 'single-cell high-dimensional imaging transcriptomics', 'HE-stained images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Transfer learning']
main_goals: This study introduces and applies a new imaging, spatial transcriptomics, and single-cell RNA-sequencing integration pipeline to characterize neoplastic cell state transitions during pancreatic carcinogenesis. The pipeline enables the study of premalignant PanIN lesions and maps cellular phenotypes relative to single-cell PDAC datasets. It allows for the deciphering of spatiotemporal dynamics of carcinogenesis with broad applicability across cancer types.

title: Contrasting demographic history and mutational load in three threatened whitebark pines (Pinus subsect. Gerardianae): implications for conservation.
biological_context: Three threatened whitebark pines (Pinus bungeana, P. gerardiana, and P. squamata) with different endangered statuses.
data_modalities_used: ['population transcriptome sequencing', 'whole chloroplast genomes', 'mitochondrial DNA markers', 'niche analysis']
main_goals: This paper analyzes the demographic history and mutational load of three threatened whitebark pines to understand their adaptive potential and inform conservation. It investigates the impact of past climate and geological changes on these species, revealing contrasting patterns of population size fluctuations and genetic load accumulation. The findings highlight differences in mutational patterns, particularly the accumulation of homozygous-derived variants, and predict future distribution changes for Pinus bungeana.

title: Psoriatic arthritis subtypes are phenocopied in humanized mice.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of CD8+ T cells in psoriatic arthritis (PsA) using a humanized mouse model. The study aims to understand PsA pathogenesis, improve personalized therapies, and identify new therapeutic targets by recapitulating disease phenotypes in mice.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Ferroptosis as The Most Enriched Programmed Cell Death Process in Hemorrhage Stroke-induced Oligodendrocyte-mediated White Matter Injury.
main_goals: This study used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate programmed cell death (PCD) in rat brains after hemorrhagic stroke. It identified ferroptosis as the primary PCD process affecting oligodendrocytes, occurring early post-ICH, and revealed a microglial LCN2/CSF1/CSF1R pathway mediating this ferroptosis, suggesting therapeutic targets.

title: A spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To reconstruct a comprehensive spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine using spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization. The study aims to describe zonated expression and cell type representation, characterize cell migration and function, and identify unique anatomical features like serrated and branched villi.

title: Age-related epithelial defects limit thymic function and regeneration.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Segmentation']
main_goals: This study investigates age-related changes in thymic epithelial cells (TECs) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, lineage-tracing, and advanced imaging. It identifies atypical TEC states (aaTECs) that accumulate with age, impair thymic function, and hinder regeneration after injury. These findings highlight a mechanism of thymic involution linked to immune aging.

title: The unveiled mosaic of intra-tumor heterogeneity in ovarian cancer through spatial transcriptomic technologies: A systematic review.
main_goals: This paper provides a systematic review of how spatial transcriptomic technologies have advanced the understanding of intra-tumor heterogeneity in ovarian cancer. It highlights the importance of spatial contextualization for understanding tumor microenvironment composition, chemoresistance mechanisms, and therapy response, ultimately aiming to improve therapeutic approaches for this disease.

title: Nova-ST: Nano-patterned ultra-dense platform for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper presents Nova-ST, a novel nano-patterned ultra-dense platform for spatial transcriptomics derived from barcoded Illumina sequencing flow cells. Nova-ST aims to enable customized, low-cost, flexible, and high-resolution spatial profiling of large tissue sections. It demonstrates significantly higher sensitivity and reduced cost compared to existing methods when benchmarked on mouse brain sections.

title: Computational Strategies and Algorithms for Inferring Cellular Composition of Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
main_goals: This review aims to summarize recent progress in estimating cellular proportions for each spatial spot and prospect future directions in the field of inferring cellular composition from spatial transcriptomics data.

title: The moderating effect of access to food facilities and recreational activity space on mHealth multiple health behavior change intervention.
main_goals: To evaluate whether neighborhood social and built environment moderates response to a mobile health multiple health behavior change intervention. The study used spatial data analysis to assess the relationship between residential proximity to facilities and intervention outcomes.

title: SIRV: spatial inference of RNA velocity at the single-cell resolution.
biological_context: developing mouse brain, mouse organogenesis, developing chicken heart, human osteosarcoma cells
main_goals: SIRV infers spatial RNA velocities at single-cell resolution by enriching spatial transcriptomics data with reference scRNA-seq data. It reveals spatial differentiation patterns not identifiable with scRNA-seq alone. The method has been applied to developing mouse brain and organogenesis data, and validated on chicken heart and human osteosarcoma cells.

title: A single-cell transcriptomic map of the developing Atoh1 lineage identifies neural fate decisions and neuronal diversity in the hindbrain.
main_goals: This paper analyzes single-cell RNA sequencing and ATOH1 DNA binding in developing mouse hindbrain Atoh1 lineage neurons to identify neural fate decisions and neuronal diversity. It aims to provide markers for specific brainstem nuclei and insights into progenitor heterogeneity and migration. The study also identifies a population of proliferating unipolar brush cell progenitors.

title: Desorption Electrospray Ionization Cyclic Ion Mobility-Mass Spectrometry Imaging for Traumatic Brain Injury Spatial Metabolomics.
biological_context: Traumatic brain injury (TBI) in rat brains
main_goals: To evaluate the depth and quality of information yielded by DESI cIM MSI for traumatic brain injury spatial metabolomics. The study aimed to assess how increasing ion mobility passes improves resolution of isobaric lipids and enables recognition of multiply charged phosphoinositide species. It also aimed to identify metabolic alterations in TBI, such as changes in phosphoinositides, NAD, and other adenine metabolites.

title: Multiplexed spatial transcriptomics methods and the application of expansion microscopy.
data_modalities_used: ['in situ sequencing', 'in situ hybridization', 'next-generation sequencing', 'expansion microscopy', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This review elaborates on in situ sequencing (ISS), in situ hybridization (ISH), and next-generation sequencing (NGS)-based spatial transcriptomic protocols. It also discusses how the performance of these techniques can be extended by their combination with expansion microscopy (ExM). The paper highlights the broader implications of transcriptomics in biology and medicine.

title: FInCH: FIJI plugin for automated and scalable whole-image analysis of protein expression and cell morphology.
biological_context: Beak tissues of a wild passerine bird
main_goals: Introduces FInCH, a Python-based Fiji plugin for automated, whole-slide measurement of protein expression and cell morphology. It enables scalable data collection from cell-level to tissue-scale, accounting for structural transformations and slide positioning. The plugin facilitates comprehensive analysis of multiple transcription factors and cellular morphology across large datasets.

title: STdGCN: spatial transcriptomic cell-type deconvolution using graph convolutional networks.
biological_context: Human breast cancer, Human heart tissue development
main_goals: To present STdGCN, a graph convolutional network model for cell-type deconvolution in spatial transcriptomic data, leveraging scRNA-seq as a reference. STdGCN incorporates both expression profiles and spatial localization for improved deconvolution performance compared to existing state-of-the-art models. The method is demonstrated to aid in tumor microenvironment analysis and understanding tissue development.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics reveals distinct patterns of dysregulation in non-neuronal and neuronal cells induced by the Trem2<sup>R47H</sup> Alzheimer's risk gene mutation.
main_goals: This study analyzes the impact of the Trem2(R47H) mutation on specific cell types in mouse brain regions using MERFISH spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify plaque and mutation-induced transcriptomic dysregulation in glial and neuronal cells, investigating inflammatory responses and BDNF signaling.

title: DepoScope: Accurate phage depolymerase annotation and domain delineation using large language models.
main_goals: DepoScope is a machine learning tool designed for accurate phage depolymerase annotation and domain delineation. It combines a fine-tuned ESM-2 model with a convolutional neural network to precisely identify depolymerase sequences and their enzymatic domains. This approach aims to enhance the understanding of phage-host interactions by improving depolymerase functional identification.

title: Enhanced microglial dynamics and a paucity of tau seeding in the amyloid plaque microenvironment contribute to cognitive resilience in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study investigated postmortem brains of asymptomatic Alzheimer's disease (AsymAD) subjects to understand resilience mechanisms. It found that AsymAD cases exhibit enhanced microglial dynamics and reduced tau seeding activity in the amyloid plaque microenvironment compared to AD brains. These findings suggest potential protective mechanisms against AD pathology.

title: Dynamic development of microglia and macrophages after spinal cord injury.
main_goals: This study uses single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the distinct evolutionary paths of microglia and macrophages following spinal cord injury. The findings highlight differences in their activation states, communication with other cells, and potential neuroprotective pathways, which were validated by in vivo experiments.

title: Spatial immune landscapes of SARS-CoV-2 gastrointestinal infection: macrophages contribute to local tissue inflammation and gastrointestinal symptoms.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study investigated the spatial immune landscapes in the gastrointestinal tract of COVID-19 patients with gastrointestinal symptoms. It aimed to identify immune cell subgroups and their spatial distribution, correlating these findings with clinical symptoms and gene expression patterns. The research highlights the role of macrophages in local tissue inflammation and potential molecular targets for COVID-19-related gastrointestinal symptoms.

title: Open-source, high-throughput targeted in situ transcriptomics for developmental and tissue biology.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Probe design', 'Image processing', 'Data extraction', 'Cell segmentation', 'Clustering', 'Annotation of cell types']
main_goals: To propose a sensitive, open-source, simple, and flexible method for generating in situ expression maps of hundreds of genes. The method uses direct ligation of padlock probes on mRNAs, coupled with rolling circle amplification and hybridization-based in situ combinatorial barcoding. It also provides an end-to-end computational workflow for data analysis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals organized and distinct immune activation in cutaneous granulomatous disorders.
biological_context: Cutaneous granulomatous disorders (cutaneous sarcoidosis, granuloma annulare, necrobiosis lipoidica, necrobiotic xanthogranuloma)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To understand spatial gene expression characteristics in noninfectious cutaneous granulomatous disorders by performing spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare patterns of immune activation and extracellular matrix alteration in a spatially resolved fashion, revealing distinct and organized immune activation patterns that correlate with hallmark histologic changes.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics: Integrating Morphology and Molecular Mechanisms of Kidney Diseases.
main_goals: This review describes the main spatial transcriptomics technologies and computational analysis methods for data interpretation and visualization. It illustrates their scientific and potential medical interest in the context of kidney disease and discusses future perspectives and challenges.

title: Histopathologic Analysis of Human Kidney Spatial Transcriptomics Data: Toward Precision Pathology.
biological_context: Human kidney diseases, specifically chronic kidney disease, and healthy human kidney tissue.
main_goals: This study demonstrates a morphology-based approach for interpreting spatial transcriptomics data in human kidney samples. It shows the feasibility of aligning computational clusters with histopathologic features, leading to a better understanding of chronic kidney disease mechanisms at cellular and molecular levels. The developed method allows for projection of pathology-based clusters onto new slides, serving as a reference for future molecular microscopy and precision pathology in nephrology.

title: Single-cell tumor heterogeneity landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma: unraveling the pro-metastatic subtype and its interaction loop with fibroblasts.
main_goals: The study aimed to establish a heterogeneity landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) malignant cells by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It identified three tumor cell subtypes, with a pro-metastatic subtype (S100A6+) playing a crucial role in metastasis. The research also uncovered a positive feedback loop between tumor cells and fibroblasts mediated by specific interactions, suggesting this as a potential anti-metastatic strategy.

title: Spatial transcriptome reveals the region-specific genes and pathways regulated by Satb2 in neocortical development.
main_goals: This study investigated the region-specific gene regulation by Satb2 in neocortical development using spatial transcriptomics and immuno-staining. It aimed to identify genes and pathways dysregulated in Satb2 knockout mice across different neocortical regions (VZ/SVZ, IZ, CP). The findings reveal Satb2's role in regulating neural precursor proliferation, neuronal differentiation, migration, and lineage-specific gene expression.

title: Safety and reactogenicity of a controlled human infection model of sand fly-transmitted cutaneous leishmaniasis.
biological_context: Cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by Leishmania major
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To establish a controlled human infection model (CHIM) of sand fly-transmitted cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL) and to provide a comprehensive map of immune cell distribution and cytokine/chemokine expression in human CL lesions. The study aimed to demonstrate the effectiveness of lesion development and safety of the CHIM and to offer opportunities for vaccine candidate selection and understanding immune-mediated pathology.

title: A model for inversion of hyperspectral characteristics of phosphate content in mural plaster based on fractional-order differential algorithm.
biological_context: Mural plaster of the Dunhuang paintings
main_goals: This study proposes a method combining Fractional Order Differentiation (FOD) and Partial Least Squares Regression (PLSR) to accurately invert the phosphate content in mural plaster. The FOD method is used for preprocessing spectral data to capture fine spectral differences, while PLSR models spectral bands for precise phosphate prediction. The developed FOD-based model achieves a maximum R^2 value of 0.861 for inversion.

title: Transcriptional regulation of the postnatal cardiac conduction system heterogeneity.
main_goals: This study demonstrates the transcriptomic landscape of the postnatal mouse cardiac conduction system at single-cell resolution with spatial information. It uncovers region-specific markers and gene regulatory networks contributing to the system's heterogeneity. The findings are supported by experimental validation using neonatal myocytes and genomic assays.

title: Tissue characterization at an enhanced resolution across spatial omics platforms with deep generative model.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data quality enhancement', 'Spatial resolution enhancement', 'Omics profile inference', 'Multiomics enhancement']
main_goals: soScope is a unified generative framework to enhance data quality and spatial resolution for molecular profiles from diverse spatial technologies. It jointly infers omics profiles at enhanced resolutions by aggregating multimodal tissue information and utilizing omics-specific modeling. The framework has been evaluated on multiple spatial omics platforms and demonstrated improvements in identifying biological architectures and correcting technical biases.

title: Enhanced MALDI-2 Sensitivity with Reflecting Post-Ionization Laser for High-Resolution MS Imaging Combined with Real-Time Microscope Imaging.
main_goals: This paper presents an enhancement to MALDI-2 sensitivity, termed MALDI-2+, by using a reflecting post-ionization laser. The improved sensitivity enables higher spatial resolution MS imaging, facilitated by a T-shaped ion guide for perpendicular laser incidence. The system also allows for real-time microscope imaging registered with MSI.

title: A low level of tumor necrosis factor α in tumor microenvironment maintains the self-renewal of glioma stem cells by Vasorin-mediated glycolysis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'immunoblotting', 'sphere formation assay', 'extreme limiting dilution', 'gene expression analysis', 'Mass spectrometry', 'RNA-sequencing detection', 'qRT-RNA', 'immunofluorescence', 'immunohistochemistry', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'in vitro models', 'in vivo models']
main_goals: This study explores the role of tumor necrosis factor α (TNFα) in the tumor microenvironment of glioma, specifically its effect on glioma stem cell (GSC) self-renewal and its correlation with patient prognosis. It investigates the mechanism by which a low level of TNFα, mediated by Vasorin (VASN), promotes GSC self-renewal through glycolysis, leading to inhibited TNFα secretion by tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs). The findings suggest that targeting VASN and TNFα could be a therapeutic strategy for glioblastoma.

title: Annotation and automated segmentation of single-molecule localisation microscopy data.
biological_context: The study uses SMLM data derived from dSTORM images of sectioned cell pellets, stained for membrane proteins EGFR and EREG.
main_goals: The paper describes a pipeline for annotating SMLM data by comparing membrane and cell segmentation approaches. It evaluates Otsu thresholding and machine learning models, finding that a retrained Cellpose model performed best for membrane segmentation, enabling downstream cluster analysis of membrane versus cell interior localisations.

title: A methodological approach for enhancing visualization of country data representation in the presence of significant spatial disparity.
main_goals: The paper presents an algorithm called FLEMUSA to address spatial disparity in global data representation using world maps. It aims to improve visualization by excluding countries without data, scaling magnitudes, focusing on regional analysis, and using logarithmic scales for bubble maps. The approach includes interactive 2D and 3D representations with open-source Python code.

title: Short-term wind farm cluster power point-interval prediction based on graph spatio-temporal features and S-Stacking combined reconstruction.
main_goals: This paper proposes a new method for short-term wind farm cluster power point-interval prediction. It utilizes a decomposition-aggregation strategy, spatial feature extraction, and a Stacking model with parallel sub-learners to improve accuracy and reliability. The method aims to reduce uncertainty and risk in power system operation by capturing spatial characteristics of wind farm clusters.

title: 12-Lipoxygenase inhibition delays onset of autoimmune diabetes in human gene replacement mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the therapeutic potential of targeting 12-lipoxygenase (12-LOX) in a mouse model of autoimmune diabetes. It demonstrates that a 12-LOX inhibitor (VLX-1005) delays diabetes onset and alters the immune microenvironment of islets and macrophages. The study also highlights the utility of a human gene replacement mouse model for evaluating LOX inhibitors.

title: aKNNO: single-cell and spatial transcriptomics clustering with an optimized adaptive k-nearest neighbor graph.
main_goals: Develop aKNNO, a novel method for clustering single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. aKNNO utilizes an optimized adaptive k-nearest neighbor graph to simultaneously identify abundant and rare cell types. Benchmarking shows aKNNO outperforms existing methods in accuracy for both cell types.

title: Coupling Microdroplet-Based Sample Preparation, Multiplexed Isobaric Labeling, and Nanoflow Peptide Fractionation for Deep Proteome Profiling of the Tissue Microenvironment.
main_goals: To develop and demonstrate a deep spatial proteomics platform by integrating laser capture microdissection with microdroplet-based sample processing (microPOTS), multiplexed isobaric labeling, and nanoflow peptide fractionation. The platform aims to maximize proteome coverage from limited tissue samples for cell-type-specific analysis and overcome limitations of existing spatial proteomics technologies.

title: An App for Navigating Patient Transportation and Acute Stroke Care in Northwestern Ontario Using Machine Learning: Retrospective Study.
main_goals: To develop a mobile app using machine learning to assist healthcare providers in Northwestern Ontario with determining the best transfer options for patients with stroke. The app aims to improve the efficiency of care access by considering factors like patient location, treatment options, and imaging availability.

title: Predicting nickel concentration in soil using fractional-order derivative and visible-near-infrared spectroscopy indices.
biological_context: Soil pollution, specifically nickel concentration in soil.
main_goals: This paper proposes a method to predict nickel concentration in soil using fractional-order derivative (FOD) and spectral indices applied to Visible-Near-Infrared (Vis-NIR) spectroscopy. The method aims to improve the correlation between spectral data and heavy metal concentration by addressing issues like baseline drift and overlapping peaks, thereby enhancing the accuracy of soil pollution estimation.

title: Comparison of T1-weighted landmark placement and ROI transfer onto diffusion-weighted EPI sequences for targeted tractography tasks in the optic nerve.
data_modalities_used: ['Diffusion Tensor Imaging', 'Echo-Planar Imaging', 'Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'T1-weighted MRI']
main_goals: The study compares different methods for placing anatomical landmarks (ROIs) on diffusion-weighted images for optic nerve tractography. It investigates the feasibility of transferring expert-placed, high-resolution T1-weighted ROI data onto lower spatial resolution diffusion-weighted images and evaluates the impact on tractography success rates.

title: Integrated multi-omics profiling landscape of organising pneumonia.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'Visium CytAssist spatial transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolomics', 'mass spectrometry', 'Mice']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of lipid metabolism reprogramming in organizing pneumonia (OP), focusing on inflammation and fibrosis. It utilized multi-omics profiling to analyze tissues and a mouse model, identifying key genes and pathways involved in OP pathogenesis. The findings reveal a significant association between OP and lipid metabolism reprogramming, contributing to the understanding of OP mechanisms.

title: Precise Identification of Glioblastoma Micro-Infiltration at Cellular Resolution by Raman Spectroscopy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study demonstrates that Raman spectroscopy can precisely identify glioblastoma (GBM) micro-infiltration at cellular resolution in clinical specimens. It leverages spectral differences in biochemical metabolites to differentiate between infiltrative lesions and normal brain tissue. The developed approach, combined with machine learning, shows high accuracy and can detect even very low concentrations of cancer cells, potentially guiding complete tumor resection.

title: LEAFY and WAPO1 jointly regulate spikelet number per spike and floret development in wheat.
biological_context: Wheat inflorescence development, spikelet number per spike, and floret development.
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of LEAFY and WAPO1 transcription factors in regulating spikelet number per spike and floret development in wheat. It demonstrates their physical and genetic interaction and their influence on the transition of the inflorescence meristem to a terminal spikelet. The research also highlights genetic interactions with VRN1 and FUL2, providing insights into the genetic network governing this important agronomic trait.

title: Label-Free Single-Cell Cancer Classification from the Spatial Distribution of Adhesion Contact Kinetics.
biological_context: Cancer diagnostics and potentially other applications like immune therapy and regenerative medicine, utilizing various cancer cell types.
main_goals: The study introduces a label-free single-cell classification methodology that combines phase-contrast microscopy for spatial resolution and resonant waveguide grating biosensors for adhesion kinetic recording. It aims to provide a simple, non-invasive, and rapid tool for cell identification and separation, achieving nearly 95% classification performance in a proof-of-concept study.

title: Biallelic null variants in PNPLA8 cause microcephaly by reducing the number of basal radial glia.
biological_context: Human brain development, microcephaly, neurological disorders
data_modalities_used: ['cerebral organoids', 'induced pluripotent stem cells', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study identifies biallelic null variants in PNPLA8 as a cause of microcephaly by reducing the number of basal radial glia. It characterizes the phenotypic spectrum of PNPLA8-related neurological diseases and investigates the underlying mechanisms using cerebral organoids and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest PNPLA8 is crucial for phospholipid synthesis and basal radial glia production in human brain development.

title: Elucidating the multifaceted role of MGAT1 in hepatocellular carcinoma: integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal novel therapeutic insights.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of glycosyltransferase-associated genes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) pathogenesis and the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify novel biomarkers and immunotherapeutic targets, particularly focusing on MGAT1.

title: Mapping the molecular landscape of Lotus japonicus nodule organogenesis through spatiotemporal transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper utilized spatial transcriptomics to map the molecular landscape of Lotus japonicus nodule organogenesis. It identified developmental trajectories of infection and peripheral zones, revealing biological processes and gene sets for symbiosis and material exchange. The study highlights LjNLP3 as a transcription factor orchestrating nodule maturation.

title: Whole brain alignment of spatial transcriptomics between humans and mice with BrainAlign.
biological_context: Whole brain alignment of spatial transcriptomics between humans and mice.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The study introduces BrainAlign, a self-supervised learning approach using a heterogeneous graph neural network for whole-brain alignment of spatial transcriptomics between humans and mice. It aims to reveal conserved brain regions and facilitate the detection of homologous regions by integrating cross-species spots into a shared embedding space. The method also demonstrates the preservation of relative positions of homologous regions in a unified spatial structural domain.

title: Advances in targeting cancer-associated fibroblasts through single-cell spatial transcriptomic sequencing.
main_goals: This review summarizes recent literature on targeting cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) by reviewing advancements in using spatial transcriptomics combined with single-cell RNA sequencing. It discusses how these multiomics analyses address the lack of spatial landscape information for CAFs and their role in drug resistance, angiogenesis, metabolic reprogramming, and metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptome and single-cell reveal the role of nucleotide metabolism in colorectal cancer progression and tumor microenvironment.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer progression and tumor microenvironment
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Prognosis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of nucleotide metabolism in colorectal cancer (CRC) progression by integrating spatial transcriptomics and single-cell data. It identified two tumor cell subtypes (NUhighepi and NUlowepi) based on nucleotide metabolism and analyzed their interactions with the tumor microenvironment, particularly fibroblasts. The study also identified NME1 as a key gene inhibiting metastasis and developed a prognostic model (NRS) for predicting survival and immune therapy response.

title: CTHRC1<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts and SPP1<sup>+</sup> macrophages synergistically contribute to pro-tumorigenic tumor microenvironment in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study leverages single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify cellular populations and interactions within the pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) tumor microenvironment. It demonstrates that SPP1+APOE+ TAMs and CTHRC1+GREM1+ myCAFs synergistically promote an immune-suppressive TME through ECM deposition and EMT, highlighting their crosstalk as a potential therapeutic target.

title: C. auris and neighborhood socioeconomic vulnerability in the state of Maryland from 2019 to 2022.
biological_context: Candida auris infections in skilled nursing facilities
main_goals: To characterize the emergence of Candida auris in Maryland from 2019 to 2022, focusing on socioeconomic vulnerability and infection prevention opportunities in skilled nursing facilities. The study compared neighborhood socioeconomic characteristics using the social vulnerability index (SVI) and the area deprivation index (ADI) for facilities with and without C. auris transmission outbreaks.

title: An interpretable Bayesian clustering approach with feature selection for analyzing spatially resolved transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Proposes a zero-inflated negative binomial mixture model with feature selection and a Markov random field prior for interpretable spatial clustering of spatially resolved transcriptomics data. Aims to improve clustering accuracy and provide insights through discriminating genes.

title: Spatial metabolomics method to reveal the differences in chemical composition of raw and honey-fried Stemona tuberosa Lour. by using UPLC-Orbitrap Fusion MS and desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging.
biological_context: Stemona tuberosa Lour. (ST) and honey-fried Stemona tuberosa Lour. (HST)
main_goals: This work aimed to analyze the variations in chemical constituents of Stemona tuberosa Lour. before and after honey-frying and to study the distribution of differential markers in the roots. The study utilized UPLC-Orbitrap Fusion MS and DESI-MSI to provide a rapid and effective visualization method for metabolite identification and spatial distribution.

title: Unraveling the dynamics of myometrial remodeling: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in term pregnancy.
main_goals: To unravel the dynamics of myometrial remodeling during term pregnancy by employing single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to provide insights into the cellular and molecular changes that occur in the myometrium at the end of pregnancy.

title: Applying Spatial Metabolomics To Investigate Age- and Drug-Induced Neurochemical Changes.
biological_context: Mouse brain aging and drug effects
main_goals: This paper investigates age- and drug-induced neurochemical changes in the mouse brain using spatial metabolomics. It reports significant, age-dependent alterations in brain lipids, particularly sulfatides and lysophosphatidic acids. The study also examined the effects of tacrine, an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor, on glutamine/glutamate ratios.

title: High CIB1 expression in colorectal cancer liver metastases correlates with worse survival and the replacement histopathological growth pattern.
data_modalities_used: ['proteomic analysis', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial RNA-sequencing', 'bulk sequencing', 'formal-fixed paraffin-embedded immunohistochemical stainings']
main_goals: This study investigates the correlation between CIB1 expression and patient survival and histopathological growth patterns in colorectal cancer liver metastases. It found that high CIB1 expression is associated with worse survival and the aggressive replacement growth pattern. The findings suggest CIB1 may be a novel marker for stratifying these metastases.

title: Molecular analysis of human tick-bitten skin yields signatures associated with distinct spatial and temporal trajectories - A proof-of-concept study.
main_goals: To uncover molecular mechanisms in tick-bitten skin samples using spatial transcriptomics, revealing perturbations in keratinization and immune system regulation. The study highlights the temporal nature of the host response and offers promise for biomarker discovery for prognosis and therapy.

title: Characterization of Multicellular Niches Supporting Hematopoietic Stem Cells Within Distinct Zones.
biological_context: Fetal liver and adult bone marrow hematopoietic stem cell niches
main_goals: This study investigated the fetal liver as a primary hematopoietic site using spatial transcriptomics to reveal two distinct niches: the portal-vessel (PV) niche and the sinusoidal niche. It also identified two similar zones in adult bone marrow: the trabecular bone area (TBA) and central marrow (CM). The research characterizes the multicellular components and their roles in supporting HSCs with different cycling states.

title: SmartImpute: A Targeted Imputation Framework for Single-cell Transcriptome Data.
biological_context: head and neck squamous cell carcinoma and human bone marrow
main_goals: SmartImpute is a targeted imputation framework for single-cell RNA sequencing data. It focuses on marker genes to improve biological relevance and computational efficiency while minimizing over-imputation and preserving biologically relevant zeros. The framework aims to enhance cell type annotation and clustering accuracy.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics and Single-Nucleus Multi-omics Analysis Revealing the Impact of High Maternal Folic Acid Supplementation on Offspring Brain Development.
biological_context: Offspring brain development under high maternal folic acid supplementation
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of high maternal folic acid supplementation on offspring brain development using a mouse model. It employs spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus multi-omics to reveal affected gene pathways, identify vulnerable cell types, and understand the molecular mechanisms underlying these effects.

title: Identification of spatial homogeneous regions in tissues with concordex.
main_goals: This paper introduces concordex, a tool for identifying spatial homogeneous regions (SHRs) in tissues based on spatial transcriptomics data. The method relies on k-nearest-neighbor (kNN) graph analysis and is demonstrated to be efficient and effective across various tissue types. Concordex can also analyze non-spatial transcriptomics data to assess the concordance between cell partitions and transcriptomic similarity.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomic profiling and modeling of mouse brain at single-cell resolution reveals cell proximity effects of aging and rejuvenation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To generate spatiotemporal data at single-cell resolution for the mouse brain across lifespan and develop machine learning models ('spatial aging clocks') to reveal cell proximity effects during aging and rejuvenation. The study identifies spatial transcriptomic fingerprints of aging and rejuvenation, and investigates the mediators of these proximity effects. It aims to provide tools for scalable assessment of intervention efficacy and studying cell-cell interactions.

title: POSTN<sup>+</sup> cancer-associated fibroblasts determine the efficacy of immunotherapy in hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subsets that determine immunotherapy efficacy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It investigated the role of POSTN+ CAFs in creating an immunosuppressive microenvironment by recruiting SPP1+ macrophages via IL-6/STAT3 signaling, which hinders T-cell infiltration and reduces immunotherapy response.

title: A convolutional neural networks method for tropospheric ozone vertical distribution retrieval from Multi-AXis Differential Optical Absorption Spectroscopy measurements.
main_goals: The paper proposes a Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) method to retrieve the vertical distribution of tropospheric ozone from Multi-AXis Differential Optical Absorption Spectroscopy (MAX-DOAS) measurements. It addresses stratospheric ozone interference by using a hybrid feature screening model and a CNN architecture trained on reanalysis data. The method demonstrates improved accuracy in ozone profile retrieval.

title: A self-supervised embedding of cell migration features for behavior discovery over cell populations.
biological_context: Inflammation due to infarct, focusing on neutrophil migration within blood vessels.
main_goals: This paper introduces a self-supervised learning approach to discover cell migration behaviors in immunology scenarios. It utilizes a recurrent neural network with a multi-task contrastive loss to generate embeddings that capture temporal consistency and hierarchical structures. The method aims to improve the separability of cell behaviors and enable prediction of therapy effectiveness.

title: Submandibular gland tissue RNAseq and spatial transcriptome analyses in IgG4-related disease.
main_goals: To identify genes that could provide clues leading to the discovery of drugs to treat IgG4-related disease (IgG4-RD). This study integrated bulk RNAseq and Visium spatial transcriptome analysis of submandibular gland tissue to identify pathogenic genes expressed in tertiary lymphoid tissues. The analysis aimed to pinpoint key genes, such as CDK1, potentially involved in the pathogenesis of IgG4-RD.

title: VisualZoneR: A computational protocol to identify compartmental zones from single-cell spatial transcriptomics using R.
main_goals: The paper presents VisualZoneR, an R-based protocol to identify compartmental zones from single-cell spatial transcriptomics data. It details steps for zone identification in tissues like liver, measuring transcriptomic changes, integrating samples, and grouping spots based on proximity to boundaries.

title: Multi-Scale Spatial Attention-Based Multi-Channel 2D Convolutional Network for Soil Property Prediction.
main_goals: Propose a convolutional neural network model with multi-scale spatial attention for high-precision soil property prediction from VNIR spectroscopy. The model utilizes 2D multi-channel inputs generated by the Gramian Angular Field (GAF) method and enhances feature extraction for improved prediction accuracy.

title: Study on the Anti-Inflammatory Mechanism of Coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum Based on Spatial Metabolomics Combined with Network Pharmacology.
biological_context: Anti-inflammatory mechanism of coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum root
main_goals: To visually study the spatial distribution and anti-inflammatory mechanism of coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum root using MALDI-TOF-MSI combined with network pharmacology. The study aimed to determine tissue localization and mechanism of action, identifying key targets and involved biological pathways for coumarins.

title: Mass Spectrometry Imaging Combined with Sparse Autoencoder Method Reveals Altered Phosphorylcholine Distribution in Imipramine Treated Wild-Type Mice Brains.
main_goals: To use AP-MALDI-MSI combined with dimensionality reduction methods to examine the distribution and impact of imipramine on endogenous metabolites in mouse brains. The study aimed to identify markers distinguishing control from treated mice and analyze the distribution changes of identified markers. It revealed a significant decrease in phosphorylcholine in imipramine-treated mice brains.

title: West Nile Virus-Induced Expression of Senescent Gene Lgals3bp Regulates Microglial Phenotype within Cerebral Cortex.
biological_context: West Nile Virus (WNV) encephalitis in mice, focusing on microglial phenotype and neuroinflammation during aging and infection.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry', 'Phenotype Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between West Nile Virus (WNV) infection and microglial senescence. It characterizes microglial gene signatures, focusing on the role of LGALS3BP in regulating neuroinflammation and microglial phenotype in WNV-infected and aged mice. The findings suggest LGALS3BP as a potential target for mitigating neuroinflammation.

title: Single-cell omics: experimental workflow, data analyses and applications.
main_goals: This paper comprehensively summarizes recent advances in single-cell omics technologies, focusing on methodology. It aims to guide researchers in selecting appropriate methods for single-cell sequencing and related data analysis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling Reveals Gene Expression Characteristics in Lymph Node-positive Breast Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to compare the spatially resolved transcriptomic profiles between node-positive and negative breast carcinomas to identify gene expression differences associated with lymph node metastasis. It highlights significant differences in transcriptional activities, underscoring the need for personalized treatment strategies.

title: Preexisting Skin-Resident CD8 and γδ T-cell Circuits Mediate Immune Response in Merkel Cell Carcinoma and Predict Immunotherapy Efficacy.
main_goals: This study investigates immune circuits in Merkel cell carcinoma (MCC) and identifies biomarkers for predicting response to immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) therapy. It utilizes multimodal data including spatial transcriptomics to reveal that preexisting tissue-resident CD8 and γδ T cells mediate immune response and predict immunotherapy efficacy. The findings highlight these T cell populations as potential therapeutic targets for MCC.

title: Reducing Manual Annotation Costs for Cell Segmentation by Upgrading Low-Quality Annotations.
main_goals: To reduce the manual annotation costs for cell segmentation by upgrading low-quality annotations. The method uses a small well-annotated dataset to train a CNN that enhances lower-quality annotations, improving the performance of cell segmentation networks trained on augmented datasets.

title: Understanding testicular single cell transcriptional atlas: from developmental complications to male infertility.
biological_context: Male reproductive health, spermatogenesis, male infertility
main_goals: This review discusses the advantages of single-cell RNA-sequencing (Sc-RNA-seq) over bulk RNA-seq for testicular tissues. It highlights cellular heterogeneity, spatial transcriptomics, dynamic gene expression, and cell-to-cell interactions within the testes. The review summarizes key findings from single-cell transcriptomic studies that shed light on developmental mechanisms implicated in testicular disorders and male infertility.

title: Spatial transcriptomic profiling of isolated microregions in tissue sections utilizing laser-induced forward transfer.
main_goals: Presents a laser-induced forward transfer (LIFT)-based method combined with a full-length mRNA-sequencing protocol (LIFT-seq) for profiling region-specific tissues. LIFT-seq can reliably and sensitively detect and display gene expression from microregions of interest and identify region-specific marker genes in the mouse cortex and hippocampus.

title: A Fast-Tracking Sample Preparation Protocol for Proteomics of Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded Tumor Tissues.
main_goals: The paper presents a fast-tracking sample preparation protocol for proteomics of formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissues. It benchmarks a new kit-based EasyPep method against a modified filter-aided sample preparation strategy. The aim is to enable more effective proteomics on archived FFPE samples, particularly for small or precious samples, and to support spatial proteomics applications.

title: SpatialQC: automated quality control for spatial transcriptome data.
main_goals: SpatialQC is introduced as a one-stop quality control (QC) pipeline for spatial transcriptomics data. It generates comprehensive QC reports and produces clean data interactively. The pipeline is designed to be widely applicable to various spatial transcriptomic techniques.

title: Detection and margin assessment of thyroid carcinoma with microscopic hyperspectral imaging using transformer networks.
main_goals: To highlight the increased accuracy and sensitivity of detecting the margin of thyroid carcinoma in H&E-stained histological slides using HSI and data augmentation methods, by modifying the TimeSformer network architecture. The study compares its performance against ConvNext and ViT networks on RGB images.

title: Analyses of combined Merkel cell carcinomas with neuroblastic components suggests that loss of T antigen expression in Merkel cell carcinoma may result in cell cycle arrest and neuroblastic transdifferentiation.
biological_context: Merkel cell carcinoma with neuroblastic components
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'immunohistochemistry', 'transcriptomics', 'whole exome sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'DNA methylation profiling']
main_goals: To describe and characterize two additional combined Merkel cell carcinomas with neuroblastic differentiation. The study aimed to provide comprehensive morphologic, immunohistochemical, transcriptomic, genetic, and epigenetic characterization, suggesting that loss of T antigen expression in Merkel cell carcinoma may lead to cell cycle arrest and neuroblastic transdifferentiation.

title: Single-cell multi-omic and spatial profiling of human kidneys implicates the fibrotic microenvironment in kidney disease progression.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell spatial-RNA expression', 'single-nuclear spatial-RNA expression', 'spot-level spatial-RNA expression (Visium)', 'single-cell resolution spatial-RNA expression (CosMx)', 'single-nuclear open chromatin']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive spatially resolved molecular roadmap of the human kidney and the fibrotic process in kidney disease. It identifies distinct microenvironments, including a fibrotic one, and demonstrates its utility in classifying kidneys and offering improved prognosis. The findings highlight the clinical utility of spatial transcriptomics.

title: Spatial resolution of the head and neck cancer tumor microenvironment to identify tumor and stromal features associated with therapy response.
biological_context: Head and Neck Cancer (HNC) tumor microenvironment
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study applied spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to characterize the head and neck cancer tumor microenvironment (TME) and identify features associated with therapy response. It aimed to discover biological differences in the TME that predict immunotherapy response. The findings demonstrate how spatial profiling can reveal novel alterations in the HNC TME contributing to therapy sensitivity and resistance.

title: Genomic and cell-specific regulation of benzylisoquinoline alkaloid biosynthesis in opium poppy.
biological_context: Opium poppy (Papaver somniferum) benzylisoquinoline alkaloid (BIA) biosynthesis
main_goals: This review highlights recent advances in genome sequencing and single cell and spatial transcriptomics to improve the understanding of the genomic and cell-specific regulation of BIA biosynthesis in opium poppy. It aims to provide knowledge vital for opium poppy genetic improvement and metabolic engineering efforts targeting alkaloid yield and composition modulation.

title: Decoding the muscle transcriptome of patients with late-onset Pompe disease reveals markers of disease progression.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'snRNA-seq analysis', 'Histology Image Analysis']
main_goals: To uncover changes in gene expression profiles in LOPD muscle using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and GeoMx spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare the transcriptome of control myofibers with non-vacuolated and vacuolated myofibers from LOPD patients, identifying early metabolic abnormalities and markers of disease progression.

title: A high-resolution 7 Tesla resting-state fMRI dataset optimized for studying the subcortex.
main_goals: This paper presents a high-resolution 7 Tesla resting-state fMRI dataset optimized for studying the subcortex. The dataset was acquired from 56 healthy adults with advanced whole-brain imaging techniques and includes concurrent physiological measures for noise correction. The data is formatted to BIDS and preprocessed with fMRIPrep to facilitate research on subcortical brain activity.

title: Sensitive Multiplexed MicroRNA Spatial Profiling and Data Classification Framework Applied to Murine Breast Tumors.
data_modalities_used: ['formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue sections', 'in situ detection of miRNAs']
main_goals: This paper presents a sensitive methodology that simultaneously quantitates and spatially detects seven miRNAs in situ on FFPE tissue sections. The method utilizes rolling circle amplification (RCA) in conjunction with a dual scanning approach in nanoliter well arrays with embedded hydrogel posts. This approach enables the detection of miRNAs across a large dynamic range and a low limit of detection, and it was applied to murine breast tumors to showcase the gained information.

title: Spatial omics technologies for understanding molecular status associated with cancer progression.
main_goals: This paper reviews the latest spatial analytical technologies that allow omics feature characterization to retain spatial and histopathological information in cancer tissues. It discusses key papers elucidating the utility of spatial analysis, introduces several spatial omics platforms, and highlights efforts to investigate molecular events associated with cancer progression. The authors also discuss future challenges in analyzing multiomics data combined with morphology and location to understand intratumor heterogeneity and improve therapeutic resistance and patient stratification.

title: Spatial molecular profiling of mixed invasive ductal and lobular breast cancers reveals heterogeneity in intrinsic molecular subtypes, oncogenic signatures, and mutations.
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial molecular profiling of mixed invasive ductal and lobular breast cancers (MDLC). It reveals significant differences between ductal and lobular tumor regions in terms of intrinsic subtype heterogeneity, oncogenic signatures, and mutations, highlighting intraregional heterogeneity. The findings suggest that this heterogeneity may lead to prognostic uncertainty and therapeutic dilemmas.

title: IMmuneCite: an integrated workflow for analysis of immune enriched spatial proteomic data.
biological_context: human liver samples, murine liver tissue, clinical liver transplantation, murine hepatocellular carcinoma
main_goals: IMmuneCite is a computational framework for comprehensive image pre-processing and single-cell dataset creation for spatial proteomics data, specifically focused on defining complex immune landscapes. It facilitates the identification of discrete immune cell phenotypes and reduces nonbiological cell clusters. The framework is versatile across antibody panels and species, enabling deep characterization of immune microenvironments.

title: Interneuron diversity in the human dorsal striatum.
biological_context: Human dorsal striatum (caudate nucleus and putamen) interneuron diversity
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To elucidate the diversity and abundance of interneuron populations and their inherent transcriptional structure in the human dorsal striatum. The study proposes a comprehensive taxonomy of striatal interneurons with eight main classes and fourteen subclasses, detailing their transcriptomic identity and spatial expression profiles. It also delineates correspondences with previous classifications and highlights differences between caudate nucleus and putamen.

title: MetalinksDB: a flexible and contextualizable resource of metabolite-protein interactions.
main_goals: MetalinksDB is a flexible and contextualizable resource of metabolite-protein interactions, leveraging knowledge-graph infrastructure. It aims to be significantly larger than existing resources and tailorable to specific biological contexts, facilitating the discovery of metabolite-mediated intercellular signaling processes. The paper demonstrates its utility in renal cancer and acute kidney injury.

title: Spatial proteomics of human diabetic kidney disease, from health to class III.
main_goals: To analyze the spatial proteomics of human diabetic kidney disease (DKD) from health to class III using the Spatial TissuE Proteomics (STEP) pipeline. The study aimed to reveal alterations in protein expression, cellular phenotypic composition, and microenvironment structure associated with DKD progression.

title: A deep learning-based toolkit for 3D nuclei segmentation and quantitative analysis in cellular and tissue context.
biological_context: Plant cell nuclei segmentation and analysis in 3D digital organs, specifically mentioning ovule tissues and development.
main_goals: The paper presents computational tools for accurate 3D nuclei segmentation in various 3D digital organs. It introduces an approach for ground truth generation and iterative training of segmentation models applied to CellPose, PlantSeg, and StarDist. The work also advances MorphoGraphX by linking nuclei to cells and includes a proofreading tool for cell segmentation.

title: Gene representation bias in spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Sparsity analysis', 'Gene detection bias analysis', 'Motif enrichment analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to identify genes that are frequently under-detected in Visium spatial transcriptomics compared to bulk RNA-seq and investigate the underlying reasons. The study found that genes with poly (T) motifs in their sequence are enriched among under-detected genes, suggesting a potential mechanism related to hairpin formation and library preparation capture.

title: Mass spectrometry imaging for spatially resolved multi-omics molecular mapping.
main_goals: This review provides a systematic survey of Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) techniques for spatially resolved multi-omics analysis. It elucidates MSI principles, capabilities, limitations, and advancements in molecular sensitivity and specificity. The review also depicts the integration of MSI-based spatial metabolomics, lipidomics, and proteomics, and offers future trajectory insights.

title: Genome-wide identification of gene families related to miRNA biogenesis in Mangifera indica L. and their possible role during heat stress.
biological_context: Mangifera indica (Mango) response to postharvest heat water treatment
main_goals: This paper aims to identify gene families related to miRNA biogenesis in Mangifera indica and investigate their potential role during heat stress. It analyzes the mango genome to find genes like DCL, AGO, HYL1, SE, HEN1, HST, and HSP90, examining their gene structure, domains, phylogenetics, and cis-regulatory elements. The study also looks at gene expression patterns after heat treatment to understand the early involvement of miRNAs in stress response.

title: Identification of tumor-specific T cell signature predicting cancer immunotherapy response in bladder cancer by multi-omics analysis and experimental verification.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'TCR sequencing', 'TCGA', 'GEO', 'Western blot', 'multicolor immunofluorescence', 'qRT-PCR', 'flow cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study aimed to identify a tumor-specific T cell signature that can predict immunotherapy response in bladder cancer. They developed a five-gene signature (TstcSig) and validated its clinical relevance and correlation with immune characteristics. The signature showed better predictive performance compared to existing T cell signatures and was experimentally verified.

title: High-resolution diffusion magnetic resonance imaging and spatial-transcriptomic in developing mouse brain.
data_modalities_used: ['Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'Diffusion Tensor Imaging', 'Diffusion Kurtosis Imaging', 'NODDI', 'Spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study used high-resolution dMRI (DTI, DKI, NODDI) to investigate microstructural changes in the developing mouse brain. It integrated these MRI metrics with spatial transcriptomics, using the Allen Developing Mouse Brain Atlas. The research aimed to demonstrate correlations between gene expression and dMRI metrics, highlighting genotype-phenotype correlations at the molecular level.

title: Molecular and immune pathobiology of human angiosarcoma.
main_goals: This review examines the molecular and immune landscape of angiosarcoma in association with its aetiology, anatomical sites, prognosis and therapeutic options. It summarizes current efforts to characterize angiosarcoma subtypes based on molecular and immune profiling and highlights promising technologies such as single-cell spatial "omics" for further understanding.

title: LeishGEM: genome-wide deletion mutant fitness and protein localisations in Leishmania.
main_goals: LeishGEM is a genome-wide functional annotation community resource for Leishmania mexicana. It measures deletion mutant growth in vitro and in vivo and determines protein localization. The resource aims to enable data-driven identification of the mechanisms for Leishmania parasitism.

title: Distinctive Phenotypic and Microenvironmental Characteristics of Neuroendocrine Carcinoma and Adenocarcinoma Components in Gastric Mixed Adenoneuroendocrine Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to conduct an in-depth examination of gene expression and microenvironmental profiles of gastric neuroendocrine carcinoma (NEC) and mixed adeno-NEC (MANEC). It compared the epithelial and stromal components of different tumor types to identify distinct characteristics. The findings provide a validation dataset for future studies on MANEC management.

title: A spatiotemporal molecular atlas of mouse spinal cord injury identifies a distinct astrocyte subpopulation and therapeutic potential of IGFBP2.
main_goals: This study aims to resolve the spatiotemporal organization and cell-cell communication in injured mouse spinal cords. It identifies a distinct astrocyte subpopulation (Astro-GMii) and investigates the therapeutic potential of IGFBP2 for spinal cord injury.

title: Comparative analyses of adsorbed circulating proteins in the PMMA and PES hemodiafilters in patients on predilution online hemodiafiltration.
biological_context: Patients with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) undergoing predilution online hemodiafiltration
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze directly the adsorbed proteins in polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) and polyethersulfone (PES) membranes in patients on predilution online hemodiafiltration (OL-HDF). The research compared the adsorption profiles of these membranes to understand their potential role in modifying inflammatory dysregulation in ESKD patients.

title: spatiAlign: an unsupervised contrastive learning model for data integration of spatially resolved transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data Integration', 'Batch Correction', 'Spatial Clustering', 'Differential Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: spatiAlign is an unsupervised contrastive learning model designed for integrating multiple spatially resolved transcriptomics datasets.
