It addresses challenges in batch effect removal by utilizing gene expression and spatial location, enabling joint downstream analysis in both low-dimensional embeddings and the reconstructed full expression space.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of gastric cancer brain metastasis reveals atypical vasculature strategies with supportive immune profiles.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'digital spatial profiling', 'bulk transcriptomic data', 'in vivo single-cell transcriptomic data', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the spatial interactions among different cell components, especially the vasculature system and the brain microenvironment of GCBM patients using digital spatial profiling. The study mapped the orchestrated spatial characteristics of tumor and immunological compositions that support conventional and atypical vascularization strategies in GCBM. The data provided molecular insights for more effective combinations of anti-vascular and immune therapies.

title: A novel Slide-seq based image processing software to identify gene expression at the single cell level.
biological_context: Chronic inflammatory diseases such as arthritis
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel image processing software specifically designed for the Slide-seq method. The software enables the identification of gene expression at the single-cell level using data from Slide-seq. A key feature is its ability to use an inexpensive epifluorescence microscope instead of a confocal microscope.

title: FUSION: A web-based application for in-depth exploration of multi-omics data with brightfield histology.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Visualization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: FUSION is a web-based tool designed for in-depth exploration of multi-omics data integrated with brightfield histology images. It provides visualization and analytical tools, including deep learning algorithms, to analyze spatial omics datasets and their associated histology. The tool enables end-to-end analysis of functional tissue units (FTUs) by aggregating molecular data, allowing for the identification of spatial linkages between quantitative pathomics, image characteristics, and spatial omics.

title: Spatial proteomic profiling of tumor and stromal compartments in non-small-cell lung cancer identifies signatures associated with overall survival.
main_goals: This study aimed to uncover tumor and stromal signatures associated with overall survival in non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC) by profiling 78 proteins across different compartments of resected NSCLC tissues. The spatial proteomic data was used to identify protein signatures in tumor and stromal compartments that correlate with patient survival.

title: SANTO: a coarse-to-fine alignment and stitching method for spatial omics.
main_goals: Propose SANTO, a coarse-to-fine method for alignment and stitching of spatial omics slices. SANTO aims to overcome limitations of existing methods in terms of time consumption and accuracy for large-scale datasets. It enables cross-platform, 3D-to-3D, and cross-modality alignment.

title: Solving water scarcity challenges in arid regions: A novel approach employing human-based meta-heuristics and machine learning algorithm for groundwater potential mapping.
main_goals: This study presents a novel approach to groundwater potential mapping (GPM) in arid regions by enhancing the Random Forest (RF) algorithm with human-based metaheuristic algorithms (ICA, TLBO, SBO). The research aims to improve the precision of GPM for addressing water scarcity challenges. The developed models were rigorously evaluated using statistical analyses.

title: Integrated transcriptomics of human blood vessels defines a spatially controlled niche for early mesenchymal progenitor cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study characterizes the phenotype, potential, and microanatomic distribution of human perivascular progenitor cells using spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It identifies heterogeneity between arterial and venous perivascular layers and delineates the tunica adventitia into inner and outer layers. The research infers a hierarchy of mesenchymal progenitors based on CD201 expression and its downstream effects on Wnt signaling and cell behavior.

title: Inactivated cGAS-STING Signaling Facilitates Endocrine Resistance by Forming a Positive Feedback Loop with AKT Kinase in ER+HER2- Breast Cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the mechanisms behind endocrine resistance in ER+HER2- breast cancer. It identifies the cGAS-STING pathway and its inactivation by hyperactivated AKT1 as key players forming a positive feedback loop that promotes resistance. The study proposes a therapeutic strategy combining an AKT1 inhibitor with a STING agonist to overcome this resistance.

title: Coupling efficiency and spatial dynamic evolution of urban water-energy-food in China-A case of evidence from 94 cities.
main_goals: This paper quantifies and interprets the water-energy-food (WEF) nexus in 94 cities of the Yellow River Basin, China, from 2011 to 2020. It uses DEA and ESDA models to analyze WEF coupling efficiency and spatial dynamics, identifying that the energy subsystem constrains WEF development and the food subsystem regulates it. The study also discusses policy recommendations for improving WEF coupling efficiency.

title: DCX knockout ferret reveals a neurogenic mechanism in cortical development.
biological_context: Cortical development in ferrets, focusing on lissencephaly
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'snRNA-seq analysis', 'Neuronal lamination analysis']
main_goals: Establish DCX knockout ferrets as a model for lissencephaly, revealing the roles of DCX in neural progenitor cell proliferation and radial glial fiber extension. Provide a detailed atlas of the lissencephalic cortex using snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to illustrate disrupted neuronal lamination and cell interactions.

title: Multi-modal mass spectrometry imaging of a single tissue section.
main_goals: This minireview provides an overview of multimodal MSI on a single tissue section, focusing on MALDI-MSI for spatial multi-omic investigations. It aims to elucidate biological states and activities comprehensively and inspire new approaches in the field.

title: Anatomy-aware and acquisition-agnostic joint registration with SynthMorph.
main_goals: SynthMorph is a deep learning tool for joint affine-deformable registration of brain images. It aims to be fast, symmetric, diffeomorphic, anatomy-aware, and acquisition-agnostic. The framework leverages synthesized label maps for robust performance across unseen acquisition specifics and optimizes spatial overlap of anatomical labels.

title: A novel optimization-assisted multi-scale and dilated adaptive hybrid deep learning network with feature fusion for event detection from social media.
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel event detection approach from social media data using a deep learning network called MDA-HDL. The network incorporates BERT and TF-IDF for feature extraction and is optimized by the Improved Gannet Optimization Algorithm (IGOA). The goal is to enhance the efficacy of event detection by considering temporal and spatial resolutions.

title: Deep learning-based cell segmentation for rapid optical cytopathology of thyroid cancer.
main_goals: This paper presents a deep learning-based cell segmentation method using a 2D U-Net convolutional neural network to automate the analysis of fluorescence polarization (Fpol) imaging of methylene blue (MB) for thyroid cancer detection. The automated method significantly reduces analysis time and is shown to be comparable to manual processing in terms of Fpol values, making the quantitative diagnosis clinically feasible.

title: Unraveling Spatial Domain Characterization in Spatially Resolved Transcriptomics with Robust Graph Contrastive Clustering.
main_goals: The paper introduces stDGCC, a deep graph contrastive clustering framework to accurately uncover spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data. It explicitly models spatial information and gene expression profiles using a spatially informed graph node embedding model and self-supervised contrastive learning. The framework achieves joint optimization of feature learning and topology structure preservation through simultaneous optimization of contrastive learning, reconstruction, and KL divergence losses.

title: A one-stop shop for 3D spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper reviews the advancements in 3D spatial transcriptomics, providing a comprehensive overview of existing technologies and methods. It aims to serve as a central resource for researchers working in this rapidly evolving field.

title: Novel insights into paclitaxel's role on tumor-associated macrophages in enhancing PD-1 blockade in breast cancer treatment.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'in vitro experiments', 'in vivo murine model']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms by which paclitaxel (PTX) enhances PD-1 blockade efficacy in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) treatment. It demonstrates that PTX activates toll-like receptor 4 (TLR4) signaling in tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs), improving their antigen presentation and boosting CD8+ T cell responses. The findings highlight the immunomodulatory role of PTX in TNBC and the potential of targeting TAMs' antigen presentation.

title: Feasibility study to unveil the potential: considerations of constrained spherical deconvolution tractography with unsedated neonatal diffusion brain MRI data.
main_goals: The study assesses the feasibility of constrained spherical deconvolution (CSD) tractography for reconstructing crossing fiber bundles in unsedated neonatal diffusion MRI data. It investigates the impact of spatial/angular resolution and processing settings on tractography and derived quantitative measures, comparing CSD with Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI).

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals influence of microenvironment on intrinsic fates in melanoma therapy resistance.
main_goals: This study investigates the influence of the tumor microenvironment on intrinsic cell fates in melanoma therapy resistance. It uses spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to reveal shared intrinsic resistance programs across different melanoma cell lines and their association with immune signatures in patient samples. The research demonstrates that therapy-resistant fates coexist with distinct immune microenvironments and can be influenced by tissue features.

title: GeneSurfer Enables Transcriptome-wide Exploration and Functional Annotation of Gene Co-expression Modules in 3D Spatial Transcriptomics Data.
main_goals: GeneSurfer is presented as an interactive interface for exploring localized transcriptome-wide gene co-expression patterns in 3D spatial transcriptomics data. It enables transcriptome-wide gene filtering, clustering based on spatial local co-expression, 3D rendering of average expression, and on-the-fly Gene Ontology annotation. The tool facilitates investigation of individual genes or co-expressed gene sets in the spatial domain.

title: Multi-sample non-negative spatial factorization.
main_goals: The paper introduces multi-sample non-negative spatial factorization (mNSF), an alignment-free framework extending single-sample spatial factorization (NSF) to multi-sample spatial transcriptomics data. It incorporates sample-specific spatial correlation modeling and extracts low-dimensional representations. The method aims to identify true factors, shared anatomical regions, and region-specific biological functions.

title: spatialGE: A user-friendly web application to democratize spatial transcriptomics analysis.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment of melanoma brain metastasis and Merkel cell carcinoma
covered_analysis_steps: ['Quality Control', 'Normalization', 'Domain Detection', 'Phenotyping', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Comparative Analysis']
main_goals: To provide a user-friendly web application (spatialGE) that simplifies the analysis of spatial transcriptomics data for users without programming expertise. The application guides users through various analysis pipelines, enabling identification of spatial gene expression patterns and enrichments.

title: The mechano-chemical circuit in fibroblasts and dendritic cells drives basal cell proliferation in psoriasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of dermal fibroblasts in psoriasis by identifying a mechano-chemical signaling pathway. It found that signals from dendritic cells enhance dermal stiffness, promoting epidermal cell hyperproliferation. The research used single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and other techniques to uncover a DC-fibroblast-epidermis communication axis involving LGALS9 and CD44.

title: Exercise training and cold exposure trigger distinct molecular adaptations to inguinal white adipose tissue.
biological_context: Inguinal white adipose tissue adaptations to exercise training and cold exposure
main_goals: This study investigated the molecular adaptations in inguinal white adipose tissue (iWAT) induced by exercise training and cold exposure. It determined the impact of exercise-trained and cold-exposed iWAT on systemic glucose metabolism and analyzed the iWAT proteome and secretome. The findings highlight distinct mechanisms by which these interventions influence metabolic health.

title: Signal drift in diffusion MRI of the brain: effects on intravoxel incoherent motion parameter estimates.
biological_context: Brain imaging in healthy human subjects
main_goals: This study evaluates the impact of signal drift on Diffusion MRI (dMRI) parameter estimates, specifically for Intravoxel Incoherent Motion (IVIM) protocols. It assesses the effectiveness of different temporal polynomial correction methods and demonstrates how acquisition order can influence results in the presence of signal drift.

title: Early human fetal lung atlas reveals the temporal dynamics of epithelial cell plasticity.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell Lineage', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Developmental']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive single-cell atlas of the developing human lung, detailing the temporal dynamics of epithelial cell plasticity and lineage development. It identifies progenitor cells expressing CFTR and maps their differentiation into specialized cell types, revealing temporal regulation of signaling pathways. Additionally, it benchmarks pluripotent stem cell-derived fetal lung models against native tissue development.

title: Unraveling the molecular architecture of autoimmune thyroid diseases at spatial resolution.
biological_context: Autoimmune thyroid diseases (Graves' disease, Hashimoto's thyroiditis)
main_goals: To unravel the molecular architecture of autoimmune thyroid diseases at spatial resolution using spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies damaged antigen-presenting thyroid follicular cells and distinct fibroblast subpopulations, including ADIRF+ myofibroblasts enriched in Graves' disease and inflammatory fibroblasts in Hashimoto's thyroiditis, as well as increased fenestrated PLVAP+ vessels in AITD.

title: FDI: A MATLAB tool for computing the fractal dimension index of sources reconstructed from EEG data.
main_goals: The paper introduces FDI, an open-source MATLAB software for measuring the fractal dimension index (FDI) of sources reconstructed from EEG data. It aims to provide a standardized and accessible implementation of FDI, leveraging GPU parallelism for efficient processing of large-scale EEG data and demonstrating its utility in neuroimaging studies.

title: Quantification and Profiling of Early and Late Differentiation Stage T Cells in Mantle Cell Lymphoma Reveals Immunotherapeutic Targets in Subsets of Patients.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Protein Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The study aimed to understand immune regulation in Mantle Cell Lymphoma (MCL) by combining image analysis and spatial omics to profile T cells at different differentiation stages. It identified potential immunotherapeutic targets by analyzing T-cell infiltration and immune suppressive markers in MCL patient tissues.

title: Alpha-Synuclein Interaction with UBL3 Is Upregulated by Microsomal Glutathione S-Transferase 3, Leading to Increased Extracellular Transport of the Alpha-Synuclein under Oxidative Stress.
main_goals: To investigate how MGST3 regulates the interaction between alpha-synuclein and UBL3 and its role in extracellular transport of alpha-synuclein under oxidative stress. The study found that MGST3 upregulates the interaction between alpha-synuclein and UBL3, promoting intracellular alpha-synuclein to extracellular transport, particularly under oxidative stress.

title: Enhanced In Situ Spatial Proteomics by Effective Combination of MALDI Imaging and LC-MS/MS.
biological_context: Mouse brain, specifically the hippocampus (dentate gyrus and cornu ammonis)
main_goals: The paper presents a combined experimental and computational approach to enhance in situ spatial proteomics. It aims to improve the resolution and speed of analysis by integrating MALDI imaging and LC-MS/MS, enabling more comprehensive investigation of molecular heterogeneity within tissues.

title: A dual-mode, image-enhanced, miniaturized microscopy system for incubator-compatible monitoring of live cells.
main_goals: This paper presents a dual-mode, image-enhanced, miniaturized microscopy system (MiniCube) for live cell monitoring inside incubators. It enables both bright field and fluorescence imaging with high spatial and temporal resolution. The system also incorporates a data analysis pipeline for automatic cell segmentation, image enhancement, and uses a deep learning algorithm for improved signal-to-noise ratio.

title: Molecular and cellular mechanisms of teneurin signaling in synaptic partner matching.
biological_context: Drosophila brain development, specifically synaptic partner matching in the olfactory circuit
data_modalities_used: ['in situ proximity labeling', 'genetic interaction studies', 'quantitative partner matching assays', 'single-axon resolution imaging']
main_goals: This study elucidates the molecular and cellular mechanisms by which teneurins mediate synaptic partner matching in the Drosophila brain. It identifies a specific signaling pathway involving teneurin binding to a RhoGAP, leading to Rac1 activation and subsequent stabilization of axon branches. The research utilizes proximity labeling and genetic interaction studies to reveal how teneurin signaling locally affects F-actin levels and promotes precise synaptic connections.

title: Opportunities and Challenges in Advancing Plant Research with Single-cell Omics.
main_goals: This review outlines advancements in single-cell omics technologies for plant research, discusses their implications, future applications, and the challenges posed by plant cell structure. It highlights the increasing use of transcriptomics, epigenomics, proteomics, metabolomics, and spatial transcriptomics in plant science to reveal intricate biological relationships at the single-cell level.

title: The architecture of silk-secreting organs during the final larval stage of silkworms revealed by single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Silk glands of mulberry silkworms during the final larval stage
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell communication analysis', 'Gene expression profiling', 'Spatial gene expression analysis', 'Transcriptional regulation analysis']
main_goals: To systematically map the cellular and spatial composition of silkworm silk glands using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to profile cell types, cell state dynamics, identify regulatory networks, and elucidate the role of the ecdysone receptor in silk protein synthesis and endoreplication.

title: Deciphering the spatiotemporal transcriptional landscape of intestinal diseases (Review).
main_goals: This review summarizes the application of spatial transcriptomics (ST) in gastrointestinal diseases. It highlights how ST allows for the dissection of enzymatic processes and interactions between multiple cells, genes, proteins, and signals within the intestine, addressing the complexity of the intestinal mucosa and its role in disease mechanisms.

title: Deep learning for quantifying spatial patterning and formation process of early differentiated human-induced pluripotent stem cells with micropattern images.
biological_context: Early differentiation stage of human-induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs)
main_goals: The study proposes a deep learning method to quantify the spatial patterning of germ layers in early differentiated hiPSCs using micropattern images. It develops U-net structures for segmenting hiPSCs and extraembryonic regions, and an algorithm to extract germ layer regions based on fluorescence intensity comparisons. The method aims to quantify pluripotency by analyzing cell numbers, areas, and distributions on micropatterns and to reveal the formation process of hiPSCs and germ layers.

title: Mitophagy and clear cell renal cell carcinoma: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Prognostic Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study analyzes mitophagy in ccRCC using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to reveal the role of mitophagy in tumor cell metabolism, development, and survival, identifying key mitophagy cell populations and prognostic genes. The study highlights the importance of the UBB gene in ccRCC progression.

title: The evaluation and optimization of the agricultural sustainable development based on a data-driven approach: A case from Northern Anhui.
main_goals: This study introduces a data-centric methodological framework for evaluating and optimizing agricultural sustainability. It articulates an evaluative schema and employs entropy evaluation methods and exploratory spatial data analysis techniques. The research validates its approach using a case study from Northern Anhui, providing insights for policymakers.

title: The CEBPB<sup>+</sup> glioblastoma subcluster specifically drives the formation of M2 tumor-associated macrophages to promote malignancy growth.
main_goals: This study investigated the interaction between a specific glioblastoma (GBM) cell subcluster (GBM cluster 6) and M2 tumor-associated macrophages (M2 TAMs) within the GBM microenvironment. It revealed that the CEBPB transcriptional network in GBM subcluster 6 drives the formation and polarization of M2 TAMs via molecules like MCP1 and the SPP1-Integrin αvβ1-Akt signaling pathway. The findings offer insights into controlling GBM progression by understanding these cellular interactions.

title: Mass spectrometry-based proteomics for advancing solid organ transplantation research.
main_goals: This paper reviews the use of mass spectrometry-based proteomics, particularly 'top-down' proteomics, for advancing solid organ transplantation research. It highlights the challenges in SOT, the importance of proteoforms as biomarkers and therapeutic targets, and the potential of integrating new technologies for future breakthroughs.

title: Single-cell and spatial omics: exploring hypothalamic heterogeneity.
main_goals: This review highlights the applicative value of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in exploring the complex molecular-genetic diversity of hypothalamic cell types, driven by recent high-throughput achievements. It discusses the evolution of these technologies and their ability to comprehend spatiotemporal patterns of transcriptional diversity.

title: Spatial and trend analysis of gestational syphilis cases in Brazil from 2011 to 2020: an ecological study.
main_goals: To analyze the rate of gestational syphilis based on temporal trends and spatial distribution in Brazil. The study aimed to identify spatial clusters of gestational syphilis across Brazilian municipalities and assess its trend over 11 years. The findings highlight syphilis as a significant public health problem requiring urgent preventive and control measures.

title: The future of plant diversity within a Mediterranean endemism centre: Modelling the synergistic effects of climate and land-use change in Peloponnese, Greece.
biological_context: Endemic vascular flora of Peloponnese, Greece
data_modalities_used: ['species distribution modelling', 'land-use/land-cover change data', 'climate change scenarios']
main_goals: To analyze the synergistic impacts of climate and land-use change on the endemic vascular flora of Peloponnese, Greece, focusing on range contractions, altitudinal shifts, and habitat fragmentation. The study aims to identify endemism hotspots and inform conservation strategies for endangered endemic flora.

title: Unraveling plant-microbe symbioses using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper discusses the advantages of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics for studying plant-microbe symbioses. It highlights key recent studies that utilize these technologies and considers the remaining limitations, particularly in capturing both plant and microbial transcripts simultaneously.

title: Pooled prevalence, spatial variation and associated factors of HIV testing uptake among multiple sexual partners in Sub Saharan Africa: Spatial and multilevel analysis.
biological_context: HIV testing uptake among multiple sexual partners
main_goals: To assess the pooled prevalence, spatial variation, and determinants of HIV testing uptake among multiple sexual partners in Sub-Saharan Africa. The study identified individual and community-level factors affecting uptake and found lower prevalence than global targets.

title: Spatial transcriptomics implicates impaired BMP signaling in NF1 fracture pseudarthrosis in murine and patient tissues.
main_goals: To perform spatial transcriptomics on normal and NF1-deficient fracture healing models (murine and human) to define molecular signatures and identify mechanisms underlying NF1 pseudarthrosis. The study aims to demonstrate the feasibility of delineating tissue-specific heterogeneity in fracture healing and provide in situ molecular evidence of impaired BMP signaling in NF1 pseudarthrosis.

title: Advances in mass spectrometry imaging for plant metabolomics-Expanding the analytical toolbox.
main_goals: This perspective provides a contemporary overview of emergent Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI) techniques used in plant sciences, focusing on recent methodological breakthroughs. It outlines opportunities and challenges in plant metabolomics using MSI and envisions the future contributions of MSI technologies to plant science.

title: Sustained generation of neurons destined for neocortex with oxidative metabolic upregulation upon filamin abrogation.
biological_context: Mouse brain development, specifically neocortex generation
main_goals: This paper investigates the sustained generation of neurons resembling upper layer neocortical neurons in the adult mouse V-SVZ. It links this neurogenesis to oxidative metabolic upregulation, increased mitochondrial biogenesis, and vascular abundance, suggesting potential therapeutic avenues for enhancing neurogenesis.

title: Identification and characterization of a new species of Taxus - Taxus qinlingensis by multiple taxonomic methods.
data_modalities_used: ['leaf phenotype comparison', 'DNA barcoding', 'leaf anatomy', 'phylogenetic analysis', 'niche analysis']
main_goals: To identify and characterize a new species of Taxus, Taxus qinlingensis, from the Qinling Mountains using multiple taxonomic methods including leaf morphology, DNA barcoding, and niche analysis. The study aims to resolve taxonomic controversies within the genus and inform conservation strategies.

title: Expression of novel androgen receptors in three GnRH neuron subtypes in the cichlid brain.
biological_context: Androgenic control of GnRH neurons in the cichlid brain (A. burtoni)
main_goals: This paper investigates the expression of two androgen receptor paralogs (ar1 and ar2) in three subtypes of GnRH neurons in the cichlid brain using a combination of immunohistochemistry, HCR, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand the differential control of these neurons by androgenic signaling based on AR expression patterns.

title: Emerging roles for stromal cells in bone metastasis.
main_goals: This paper reviews the emerging roles of stromal cells, particularly Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs), in bone metastasis. It highlights their interactions with metastatic cancer cells in the bone microenvironment, influencing cancer cell survival, dormancy, metabolic demands, and immune responses. The review also points to the importance of MSC tissue source and aging, and suggests that combining these factors with technologies like spatial transcriptomics will advance understanding of stroma-cancer crosstalk and identify therapeutic targets.

title: Using adjusted local assortativity with Molecular Pixelation unveils colocalization of membrane proteins with immunological significance.
biological_context: T cell uropod formation and B-cell line treatment with rituximab
main_goals: The paper introduces an adapted local assortativity method for analyzing Molecular Pixelation (MPX) data to capture spatial relationships of membrane proteins. It allows for pairwise and higher-order colocalization analysis, demonstrating its utility in understanding T cell uropod formation and rituximab's effect on CD20 polarity in B-cells.

title: Unbiasedly decoding the tumor microenvironment with single-cell multiomics analysis in pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This paper summarizes recent research on the pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) tumor microenvironment (TME) using single-cell multiomics analysis. It focuses on the functions and potential classification bases of cellular components within the TME. The authors look forward to integrating single-cell multiomics data and retrospectively reusing bulk sequencing data to provide new insights.

title: Whole Tissue Imaging of Cellular Boundaries at Sub-Micron Resolutions for Automatic Cell Segmentation: Applications in Epithelial Bending of Ectodermal Appendages.
biological_context: Ectodermal appendages (mandibles, dental lamina, dermal denticles)
main_goals: Introduce a method to preserve cell boundary markers after tissue clearing, enabling sub-micron resolution imaging. This allows for automatic segmentation of individual cells within entire 3D tissues and quantification of cellular properties during organ morphogenesis.

title: Positionally distinct interferon stimulated dermal immune acting fibroblasts promote neutrophil recruitment in Sweet's syndrome.
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular landscape of Sweet's syndrome by identifying positionally distinct fibroblasts that contribute to neutrophil recruitment, mediated by interferon signaling. It defines the immune-acting fibroblasts and their role in the disease pathogenesis.

title: STAN, a computational framework for inferring spatially informed transcription factor activity.
biological_context: Lymph node, breast cancer, and glioblastoma
main_goals: STAN is a computational framework that predicts spot-specific, spatially informed transcription factor activities by integrating TF-target gene priors, mRNA expression, spatial coordinates, and morphological features. It aims to leverage spatial transcriptomics data to systematically estimate TF activity governing cell identity. The framework can identify TFs associated with specific cell types, spatial domains, pathological regions, and ligand-receptor pairs.

title: Highly Multiplexed Spatial Transcriptomics in Bacteria.
biological_context: E. coli response to carbon starvation, gut commensal B. thetaiotaomicron adaptation to mammalian colon
main_goals: The paper introduces bacterial-MERFISH, a method combining volumetric expansion with multiplexed error robust fluorescence in situ hybridization (MERFISH) to enable high-throughput, spatially resolved profiling of thousands of operons within individual bacteria. This method aims to overcome the challenge of massive bacterial mRNA density for image-based transcriptomics. It allows for detailed dissection of bacterial responses to environmental changes and mapping of subcellular RNA organization.

title: Medulloblastoma Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Tumor Microenvironment Heterogeneity with High-Density Progenitor Cell Regions Correlating with High-Risk Disease.
main_goals: This study performed spatial transcriptomic sequencing on pediatric medulloblastoma samples to reveal inter- and intra-tumoral heterogeneity within the tumor microenvironment. It identified dense regions of quiescent progenitor-like MB cells enriched in high-risk disease and increased stromal components following relapse, highlighting potential therapeutic targets.

title: Spatial Deconvolution of Cell Types and Cell States at Scale Utilizing TACIT.
main_goals: Developed TACIT, an unsupervised algorithm for cell annotation using predefined signatures. TACIT aims to address the challenges of cell type and state identification in spatial biology by being scalable and generalizable. The method was validated on multiple datasets and niches, outperforming existing unsupervised methods.

title: Anti-CTLA-4 m2a Antibody Exacerbates Cardiac Injury in Experimental Autoimmune Myocarditis Mice By Promoting Ccl5-Neutrophil Infiltration.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To decipher how anti-CTLA-4 m2a antibody aggravates cardiac injury in experimental autoimmune myocarditis (EAM) mice. The study found that the antibody increases Cxcl1, promoting neutrophil infiltration and Ccl5-neutrophil subpopulation activity, which in turn drives M1 macrophage polarization and exacerbates cardiac injury. The findings suggest targeting neutrophils, Cxcl1, or Cxcr2 could be a strategy for preventing ICIs-associated myocarditis.

title: Detection of allele-specific expression in spatial transcriptomics with spASE.
main_goals: Introduce spASE, a computational framework for detecting and estimating spatial allele-specific expression (ASE). The framework addresses challenges like cell type mixtures and low signal-to-noise ratio using a hierarchical model with additive mixtures of spatial smoothing splines. The method is applied to mouse cerebellum and hippocampus data to provide new insights into spatial and cell type-specific ASE.

title: Panpipes: a pipeline for multiomic single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data analysis.
main_goals: Panpipes is a set of computational workflows designed to automate multimodal single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses. It incorporates Python-based tools for quality control, preprocessing, integration, clustering, and reference mapping, enabling systematic joint evaluation of different modalities.

title: Predicting intercellular communication based on metabolite-related ligand-receptor interactions with MRCLinkdb.
main_goals: The paper introduces the MRCLinkdb database and algorithm to predict intercellular communication based on metabolite-related ligand-receptor interactions. It addresses the gap in existing resources by including non-protein molecules in ligand-receptor interactions and provides a web server for analysis, complementing existing ligand-receptor databases.

title: Advancing sequencing-based spatial transcriptomics with a comprehensive benchmarking study.
main_goals: This paper provides a comprehensive benchmarking study to advance sequencing-based spatial transcriptomics. It aims to evaluate and compare existing methods to guide future development and application in the field.

title: Evaluation of Cellpose segmentation with sequential thresholding for instance segmentation of cytoplasms within autofluorescence images.
main_goals: The paper presents and evaluates a cytoplasm segmentation method (CPPA) for autofluorescence images of NAD(P)H. CPPA utilizes Cellpose for initial cell segmentation and a sequential thresholding approach with post-processing for accurate cytoplasmic segmentation. The method is validated on different T cell types and MCF7 cells.

title: Effect of Bioactive Black Phosphorus Nanomaterials on Cancer-Associated Fibroblast Heterogeneity in Pancreatic Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study investigates the effect of bioactive black phosphorus nanomaterials on cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in pancreatic cancer using spatial transcriptomics. It demonstrates that bioactive BP suppresses CAF activation and reduces the abundance of inflammatory and myofibroblastic CAFs, suggesting its potential as a PDAC treatment.

title: Accurately deciphering spatial domains for spatially resolved transcriptomics with stCluster.
main_goals: Introduce stCluster, a novel method integrating graph contrastive learning and multi-task learning to refine representations of spatial transcriptomic data. The goal is to improve the accuracy of spatial domain identification by capturing complex relationships between gene expression and spatial organization. The method is benchmarked against state-of-the-art methods and shown to effectively denoise spatial gene expression patterns and enhance spatial trajectory inference.

title: Electromagnetic Field-Assisted Frozen Tissue Planarization Enhances MALDI-MSI in Plant Spatial Omics.
main_goals: Develops a novel technique called electromagnetic field-assisted frozen tissue planarization (EMFAFTP) to address challenges in longitudinal sectioning of irregularly shaped plant tissues for MALDI-MSI. The technique uses electromagnets to non-destructively planarize frozen tissues, enabling enhanced molecular profiling of secondary metabolites, amino acids, lipids, and proteins. This method aims to advance MALDI-MSI capabilities in plant spatial omics.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis to unveil heterogeneity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate heterogeneity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). It aims to understand the cellular diversity, microenvironment, and identify biomarkers associated with prognosis, with a focus on CHODL's role in metastasis and tumor proliferation.

title: Global trends of single cell sequence associated in cancer from 2011 to 2024: A bibliometric analysis.
main_goals: This paper performs a bibliometric analysis of global trends in single-cell sequencing associated with cancer from 2011 to 2024. It identifies hotspots, features of scientific output, and frontiers in the field, including key journals, keywords, affiliations, and countries. The study highlights the significant role of single-cell sequencing in tumor diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis analysis.

title: Increased prevalence of hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal state and enhanced phenotypic heterogeneity in basal breast cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and luminal-basal plasticity in basal breast cancer. It utilizes multi-modal transcriptomic data to identify associations and employs mathematical modeling to understand the underlying mechanisms of phenotypic heterogeneity, aiming to provide a framework for characterizing and restricting it.

title: Deciphering brain cellular and behavioral mechanisms: Insights from single-cell and spatial RNA sequencing.
biological_context: Brain research, neurodevelopment, cognition, behavior, sleep-wake cycles, neuronal cell positioning
main_goals: This review provides an overview of single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics principles, their challenges, and applications in brain research. It outlines promising future directions for integrating these techniques with various neuroscience fields to understand cellular and behavioral mechanisms.

title: HEARTSVG: a fast and accurate method for identifying spatially variable genes in large-scale spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: HEARTSVG is a novel, distribution-free, test-based method for fast and accurate identification of spatially variable genes in large-scale spatial transcriptomic data. It demonstrates superior performance in simulations and real-world applications, identifying more biologically significant SVGs. The method also facilitates the discovery of spatial domains within tumors.

title: Single-Cell Transcriptome Analysis Reveals 2 Subtypes of Tumor Cells of Sclerosing Pneumocytoma With Distinct Molecular Features and Clinical Implications.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'microarray-based spatial transcriptomic analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Single-Cell Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular features of PSP tumor cells using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified two distinct subtypes of tumor cells (MEDP cells and AT2Cs) with different biological characteristics and spatial distribution, providing insights into the histology and biological behaviors of PSP.

title: Pixel-wise segmentation of cells in digitized Pap smear images.
main_goals: The paper describes the creation of the APACS23 dataset, which contains approximately 37,000 manually segmented cells from Pap smear images. This dataset is intended to facilitate the training of AI-based systems for cell segmentation, particularly for recognizing cervical cancer, and to serve as a benchmark for scientific investigations or challenges.

title: Multiplexed imaging to reveal tissue dendritic cell spatial localisation and function.
biological_context: Immune surveillance within tissues, focusing on dendritic cells
main_goals: This review provides a concise overview of multiplex imaging methodologies and their application in identifying dendritic cells to delineate their tissue-specific functions. It aims to aid newcomers in navigating this field by emphasizing the spatial and functional landscape of DCs.

title: Development of human pancreatic cancer avatars as a model for dynamic immune landscape profiling and personalized therapy.
main_goals: Development of human pancreatic cancer avatars to profile the dynamic immune landscape and assess personalized therapy. These avatars maintain tumor microenvironment stability, enabling spatial and temporal analysis of immune cell populations and response to treatments like gemcitabine.

title: [Research progress of deep learning applications in mass spectrometry imaging data analysis].
main_goals: This paper reviews the current research status, application progress, and challenges of deep learning in mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data analysis. It focuses on four core stages: data preprocessing, image reconstruction, cluster analysis, and multimodal fusion. The review also illustrates the application of DL and MSI in tumor diagnosis and subtype classification and discusses future development trends.

title: Systematic comparison of sequencing-based spatial transcriptomic methods.
main_goals: This study systematically compares 11 sequencing-based spatial transcriptomic methods using reference tissues. It highlights molecular diffusion as a variable parameter affecting effective resolution and notes the unique ability of sST to capture patterned rare cell states. The research aims to assist biologists in platform selection and foster consensus on evaluation standards.

title: Application of spatial-omics to the classification of kidney biopsy samples in transplantation.
main_goals: To explore the application of spatial-omics, particularly mass spectrometry imaging, for the classification of kidney biopsy samples in transplantation. The paper highlights the potential of spatial-omics to provide new insights into the pathophysiology of allograft failure, identify novel therapeutic targets, and develop tailored immunotherapeutic interventions by overcoming limitations of current diagnostic methods.

title: Knockout of cryptochrome 1 disrupts circadian rhythm and photoperiodic diapause induction in the silkworm, Bombyx mori.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of cryptochrome 1 (cry1) in the silkworm, Bombyx mori. It demonstrates that cry1 knockout disrupts circadian rhythm and photoperiodic diapause induction, suggesting its function as a photoreceptor in photoperiodism and a link between photic information and the circadian clock.

title: Accurate classification of glomerular diseases by hyperspectral imaging and transformer.
main_goals: The study introduces a Convolutional Neural Networks-Vision Transformer (CVT) model that fuses spectral and spatial data for accurate classification of glomerular diseases. The model utilizes Gramian Angular Field (GAF) for unified representation and achieves a 94% accuracy, surpassing traditional methods relying solely on spectral features.

title: Multispectral label-free in vivo cellular imaging of human retinal pigment epithelium using adaptive optics fluorescence lifetime ophthalmoscopy improves feasibility for low emission analysis and increases sensitivity for detecting changes with age and eccentricity.
main_goals: This paper introduces and validates multispectral adaptive optics fluorescence lifetime ophthalmoscopy (AOFLIO) for label-free cellular imaging of the human retinal pigment epithelium (RPE). The method aims to improve feasibility for low emission analysis and increase sensitivity for detecting age- and eccentricity-related changes in RPE by analyzing autofluorescence from lipofuscin, melanin, and melanolipofuscin.

title: SlowMoMan: a web app for discovery of important features along user-drawn trajectories in 2D embeddings.
main_goals: The paper presents SlowMoMan, a web application that allows users to draw paths on 2D embeddings of high-dimensional data. The tool back-projects these paths to the original high-dimensional space to identify and rank features that are discriminative along the drawn trajectories. It aims to help users understand patterns in embeddings by relating them back to original data features.

title: Integrating single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate a specialized subpopulation of astrocytes, microglia and vascular cells in brains of mouse model of lipopolysaccharide-induced sepsis-associated encephalopathy.
biological_context: Sepsis-associated encephalopathy (SAE) in a mouse model
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the cellular and molecular alterations in the brains of a mouse model with sepsis-associated encephalopathy (SAE) using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and Stereo-seq. The research identified a specialized subpopulation of astrocytes, microglia, and vascular cells (V1A2M2 niche) and their associated ligand-receptor pairs, suggesting a role in SAE pathogenesis or mortality observed in Anxa1 knockout mice.

title: ezSingleCell: an integrated one-stop single-cell and spatial omics analysis platform for bench scientists.
main_goals: ezSingleCell is an interactive and easy-to-use application for analyzing various single-cell and spatial omics data types without requiring prior programming knowledge. It combines publicly available methods for in-depth data analysis, integration, and interactive visualization. The platform offers a streamlined interface and is available as a web application or an installable software package.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and bulk RNA-seq: predicting gene expression with enhanced resolution through graph attention networks.
biological_context: Breast cancer research, tumor heterogeneity, patient samples
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Prediction of tissue type (tumor/non-tumor)']
main_goals: To develop a novel approach (STGAT) using Graph Attention Networks to estimate gene expression at near-cell resolution from WSI and bulk RNA-seq data. The method aims to predict tumor/non-tumor status and improve the accuracy of molecular signatures for sub-type and tumor stage prediction in patient samples lacking spatial transcriptomics.

title: Points2Regions: Fast, interactive clustering of imaging-based spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: This paper introduces Points2Regions, a computational tool for identifying regions with similar mRNA compositions in imaging-based spatial transcriptomics data. It achieves fast and efficient region discovery across multiple scales through rapid feature extraction by rasterizing points onto a pyramidal grid and efficient clustering. The tool is available as a Python package integrated into TissUUmaps and a Napari plugin, facilitating interactive clustering and visualization.

title: Identification of Hypoxia-ALCAM<sup>high</sup> Macrophage- Exhausted T Cell Axis in Tumor Microenvironment Remodeling for Immunotherapy Resistance.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment remodeling for immunotherapy resistance in cancer
main_goals: This study integrates bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics to characterize the hypoxia-associated intercellular communication hub involving malignant cells, ALCAMhigh macrophages, and exhausted CD8+ T cells at the tumor boundary. It reveals that hypoxia promotes ALCAM expression in macrophages, which in turn drives T cell exhaustion, leading to immunotherapy resistance. The findings highlight a novel ALCAMhigh macrophage-exhausted T cell axis as a target for overcoming hypoxia-induced resistance in cancers.

title: Mapping the complexity and diversity of tertiary lymphoid structures in primary and peritoneal metastatic gastric cancer.
main_goals: To map the complexity and diversity of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in primary and peritoneal metastatic gastric cancer. The study investigates how immune cell composition and function of TLSs differ based on tumor location and the tumor immune environment, associating immature TLSs in peritoneal metastases with poor prognosis and lack of response to immune checkpoint blockade.

title: CP-Net: Instance-aware part segmentation network for biological cell parsing.
main_goals: The paper introduces CP-Net, an instance-aware part segmentation network for biological cell parsing, specifically for human sperm cells. It addresses the challenge of distinguishing individual cells and segmenting subcellular structures within them. The method aims for accurate instance-level cell parsing, handling irregular cell shapes and segmenting tiny subcellular structures effectively.

title: Spatial heterogeneity and functional zonation of living tissues and organs in situ.
main_goals: This paper outlines the spatial differences in the immune system within each zone of organs. It highlights how spatial heterogeneity in nutrient and oxygen supply leads to functional zonation. The advancements in intravital imaging and transcriptomics technologies are facilitating a deeper understanding of these zonation phenomena and their impact on organ immunity.

title: The effect of elimination of gibbs ringing, noise and systematic errors on the DTI metrics and tractography in a rat brain.
main_goals: The paper investigates the impact of eliminating Gibbs ringing, noise, and systematic errors on DTI metrics and tractography in a rat brain. It tests denoising and Gibbs ringing removal methods combined with the B matrix spatial distribution (BSD) method for magnetic field gradient calibration. The proposed preprocessing pipeline and BSD method aim to correct systematic biases in DTI data, particularly for high-resolution scans.

title: Abnormal metabolism in melanocytes participates in the activation of dendritic cell in halo nevus.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to understand halo nevus. It identifies abnormal metabolism, specifically uridine diphosphate glucose (UDP-G), in melanocytes and its role in activating dendritic cells (DCs). The findings suggest that melanocyte-derived UDP-G contributes to DC activation and the immune response in halo nevus, potentially offering insights into related conditions like vitiligo.

title: A Spatial Omnibus Test (SPOT) for Spatial Proteomic Data.
main_goals: The paper proposes a Spatial Omnibus Test (SPOT) to analyze spatial proteomic data across a range of radii, aggregating results to characterize the association between spatial summaries and patient outcomes. SPOT aims to address the challenge of pre-specifying an optimal radius for clustering analysis. Simulations verify SPOT's type I error control and demonstrate its potential for increased power compared to alternatives.

title: Patho-transcriptomic analysis of invasive mucinous adenocarcinoma of the lung (IMA): comparison with lung adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features (SRCC).
biological_context: Invasive mucinous adenocarcinoma of the lung (IMA) and lung adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features (SRCC)
main_goals: To analyze IMA and compare it with SRCC using spatial transcriptomics, identify distinct cell clusters and gene expression patterns, and investigate downstream targets of transcription factors HNF4A and SPDEF, revealing targetable tumor cell types.

title: Loss of cell junctional components and matrix alterations drive cell desquamation and fibrotic changes in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.
main_goals: This study investigates the histopathological abnormalities in distal bronchioles of IPF patients, focusing on epithelial desquamation. It uses spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to reveal downregulated cell junctional components, upregulated EMT signatures, and dysregulated basement membrane matrix, contributing to epithelial detachment and fibrotic changes. The research highlights the disruption of matrix-cell junctional regulation as a key mechanism in IPF pathogenesis.

title: Ehmt2 inactivation in pancreatic epithelial cells shapes the transcriptional landscape and inflammation response of the whole pancreas.
biological_context: Pancreatic inflammation and injury response modulated by EHMT2 gene inactivation in exocrine cells
main_goals: This study elucidates the role of EHMT2 in maintaining pancreatic transcriptional landscape and protecting against inflammation. It investigates how EHMT2 inactivation in pancreatic epithelial cells affects the overall organ's response to injury and inflammation, revealing insights into molecular and cellular mechanisms involved in inflammatory pancreatic diseases.

title: Decoding heterogeneous and coordinated tissue architecture in glioblastoma using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To decode heterogeneous and coordinated tissue architecture in glioblastoma using spatial transcriptomics. The study investigates gene expression heterogeneity, identifies enriched tissue stem cell signatures in specific regions, and links upregulated genes to ECM-receptor interaction, proteoglycans, VEGF, and ANGPT signaling pathways. It also examines the spatial relevance of glycogen metabolism, oxidative phosphorylation, and creatine metabolism signatures.

title: A novel temporal-frequency combination pattern optimization approach based on information fusion for motor imagery BCIs.
main_goals: To propose and validate the Information Fusion for Optimizing Temporal-Frequency Combination Pattern (IFTFCP) algorithm to enhance raw feature optimization for motor imagery (MI) Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCIs). The algorithm aims to refine EEG features by combining temporal and frequency domain processing with joint feature selection and fusion methods for improved classification performance.

title: Integrated-omics profiling unveils the disparities of host defense to ECM scaffolds during wound healing in aged individuals.
biological_context: Wound healing in aged mice using ECM scaffolds
main_goals: To explore the mechanisms underlying the age-related disparity in host defense to ECM scaffolds during wound healing. The study identified dysfunctional Spp1+ macrophages in aged mice that impede the type II immune response, inhibiting epidermal cell and fibroblast repair. Findings aim to inform the development of precision-based biomaterials for aged individuals.

title: Unfolding the mysteries of heterogeneity from a high-resolution perspective: integration analysis of single-cell multi-omics and spatial omics revealed functionally heterogeneous cancer cells in ccRCC.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study integrates single-cell multi-omics and spatial omics data to analyze intra-tumor heterogeneity in ccRCC. It classifies cancer cells into meta programs and investigates their spatial distribution, clinical prognostic values, regulatory networks, and therapeutic sensitivities. The findings aim to inform the design of rational therapeutic strategies for ccRCC.

title: CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells display a spectrum of recall dynamics during re-infection with malaria parasites.
biological_context: Re-infection with malaria parasites in mice, focusing on CD4+ T cell responses
main_goals: This paper examines antigen-experienced CD4+ T cells during re-infection with malaria parasites in mice. It utilizes scRNA-seq/TCR-seq and spatial transcriptomics to characterize the diverse recall dynamics of different CD4+ T cell subsets, revealing varying responses and identifying graphical user interfaces for studying gene expression dynamics and clonal relationships.

title: Autofluorescence lifetime flow cytometry with time-correlated single photon counting.
biological_context: Jurkat T cells, human T cells, adult mouse neural stem cells
main_goals: The paper presents a fluorescence lifetime-sensitive flow cytometer utilizing time-correlated single-photon counting (TCSPC). This system offers higher throughput and real-time analysis for label-free sensing of cellular metabolism and function compared to traditional FLIM microscopy.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in pancreatic cancer: Advances, prospects and challenges.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of recent studies implementing spatial transcriptomics in pancreatic cancer research. It highlights the technology's instrumental role in investigating heterogeneity and functions of tumor cells, stromal cells, and immune cells. The review also prospected clinical application scenarios, technical limitations, and challenges of spatial transcriptomics in pancreatic cancer.

title: Glycolysis in hepatic stellate cells coordinates fibrogenic extracellular vesicle release spatially to amplify liver fibrosis.
main_goals: This paper demonstrates that glycolysis in hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) amplifies liver fibrosis by promoting fibrogenic extracellular vesicle (EV) release in the pericentral zone. It shows that inhibiting HSC glycolysis reduces liver fibrosis and abrogates the upregulation of EV-related pathways in the pericentral zone. Mechanistically, glycolysis enhances EV release by upregulating EV-related genes via histone modifications.

title: A Singular-Value-Based Map to Highlight Abnormal Regions Associated With Atrial Fibrillation Using High-Resolution Electrograms and Multi-Lead ECG.
main_goals: The paper proposes a singular-value-based map to highlight abnormal regions associated with Atrial Fibrillation (AF) using high-resolution electrograms and multi-lead ECG. This method focuses on complementary properties of atrial potential waveforms, specifically spatial variations in morphology, described by changes in singular values. The goal is to provide a non-parametric indicator for detecting and evaluating AF, potentially identifying electropathological regions without estimating local activation time.

title: Aging- and alcohol-associated spatial transcriptomic signature in mouse acute pancreatitis reveals heterogeneity of inflammation and potential pathogenic factors.
biological_context: Alcohol-associated acute pancreatitis in aging mice
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate aging- and alcohol-associated spatial transcriptomic signatures in mouse acute pancreatitis by establishing an aging AAP mouse model and applying Visium spatial transcriptomics. It revealed spatial heterogeneity of inflammatory processes and identified differentially expressed genes and pathways in aging versus young AAP mice.

title: Adaptive digital tissue deconvolution.
main_goals: ADTD estimates cellular proportions of pre-selected cell types along with unknown background contributions. It adapts prototypic reference profiles to the molecular environment, improving cell-type specific gene regulation inference from bulk transcriptomics data. ADTD is demonstrated to improve existing approaches for estimating cellular compositions and provides insights into cell-type specific molecular differences in breast cancer subtypes.

title: GraphCompass: spatial metrics for differential analyses of cell organization across conditions.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell resolved transcriptomics', 'MIBI-TOF', '10× Genomics Visium', 'Stereo-seq']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: GraphCompass provides a comprehensive set of omics-adapted graph analysis methods to quantitatively evaluate and compare the spatial arrangement of cells across diverse biological conditions. It builds upon the Squidpy toolbox and enables cross-condition analyses at the level of individual cell types, niches, and samples, with custom visualization functions.

title: A count-based model for delineating cell-cell interactions in spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper introduces Copulacci, a count-based model using a Gaussian copula to infer cell-cell interactions from spatial transcriptomics data, especially when transcript counts are low. It outperforms existing correlation-based methods on simulated and real data by discovering biologically meaningful, lowly expressed interactions.

title: SPRITE: improving spatial gene expression imputation with gene and cell networks.
main_goals: SPRITE is introduced as a meta-algorithm to improve spatial gene expression imputation by leveraging gene and cell networks. It processes predictions from existing methods by propagating information across gene correlation networks and spatial neighborhood graphs, leading to improved clustering, visualization, and classification of cells.

title: Integrating Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics to Uncover and Elucidate GP73-Mediated Pro-Angiogenic Regulatory Networks in Hepatocellular Carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aimed to characterize the hypervascular nature of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified a GP73-mediated pro-angiogenic regulatory network involving interactions with vascular endothelial cells and elucidated its role in tumor vascular development. The study also investigated the mechanistic basis of this network and its clinical relevance for anti-angiogenic therapy response in HCC.

title: ScType enables fast and accurate cell type identification from spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper introduces scType, a marker-based cell annotation method for spatial transcriptomics data that does not require deconvolution or large reference atlases. It aims to enable ultra-fast and accurate identification of abundant cell types from high-resolution spatial transcriptomics assays.

title: ST-CellSeg: Cell segmentation for imaging-based spatial transcriptomics using multi-scale manifold learning.
main_goals: This study proposes ST-CellSeg, an image-based machine learning method for spatial transcriptomics cell segmentation. It novelly utilizes multi-scale manifold learning to address challenges with varying cell shapes. The method constructs a spatial transcriptomic manifold and determines low-dimensional spatial probability distributions for segmentation, outperforming baseline models.

title: Transcriptomic Approaches to Cardiomyocyte-Biomaterial Interactions: A Review.
main_goals: This review focuses on transcriptomic approaches to understand cardiomyocyte-biomaterial interactions, highlighting the role of emerging technologies like single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It discusses challenges and opportunities in utilizing these techniques for biomaterial design, cardiac disease treatment, and drug testing, aiming to deepen the understanding of these complex interactions.

title: Spatial transcriptomics combined with single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveals glial cell heterogeneity in the human spinal cord.
main_goals: To map the cellular and molecular heterogeneity of astrocytes, microglia, and oligodendrocytes in the human spinal cord using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study also compares these findings with mouse models and investigates sex differences in gene expression within human spinal cord glial cells.

title: Heterogeneity of mature oligodendrocytes in the central nervous system.
biological_context: Mature oligodendrocytes in the central nervous system
main_goals: This paper reviews the heterogeneity of mature oligodendrocytes in the central nervous system, detailing historical and modern findings on their regional, morphological, and functional diversity. It highlights the impact of age and disease on oligodendrocyte variation and suggests future research directions using advanced techniques to understand this heterogeneity for therapeutic development.

title: [An identification method of chromatin topological associated domains based on spatial density clustering].
main_goals: To design and implement a new method for identifying topologically associated domains (TADs) based on spatial density clustering of Hi-C data. The method aims to improve accuracy and reduce sensitivity to parameters compared to existing methods, with TAD boundaries enriched by ChIP-seq factors.

title: Advances in Single-Cell Transcriptome Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptome Sequencing in Plants.
main_goals: This article provides an overview of the research progress in plant single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, as well as their applications and challenges in plants. It also proposes prospects for the development of these techniques.

title: Extracellular Microenvironment Alterations in Ductal Carcinoma In Situ and Invasive Breast Cancer Pathologies by Multiplexed Spatial Proteomics.
biological_context: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) and invasive breast cancer (IBC)
main_goals: This study investigated alterations in the extracellular microenvironment of Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS) and Invasive Breast Cancer (IBC) using multiplexed spatial proteomics. It aimed to differentiate between these pathologies based on their ECM proteomes and understand the spatial regulation of these changes, revealing insights into the invasive cancer field effect.

title: The Advancement and Application of the Single-Cell Transcriptome in Biological and Medical Research.
main_goals: To review the development and applications of single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) technology in biological and medical research. It summarizes the analytical process, integration with other omics, and identifies shortcomings and future developments.

title: Accurate Identification of Spatial Domain by Incorporating Global Spatial Proximity and Local Expression Proximity.
main_goals: Proposes SECE, a deep learning-based method to capture both local and global relationships among spots for accurate spatial domain identification. SECE aggregates information using expression similarity and spatial similarity. It was benchmarked against eight state-of-the-art methods and consistently outperformed them.

title: ConvLSNet: A lightweight architecture based on ConvLSTM model for the classification of pulmonary conditions using multichannel lung sound recordings.
main_goals: This paper develops ConvLSNet, a novel architecture based on ConvLSTM and LSTM layers for the classification of pulmonary conditions using multichannel lung sound recordings. The model aims to accurately diagnose respiratory pathologies without extensive preprocessing. It achieves high classification accuracy and imposes a low computational cost compared to other architectures.

title: Integration of transcriptomics and spatial biology analyses reveals Galactomyces ferment filtrate promotes epidermal interconnectivity via induction of keratinocyte differentiation, proliferation and cellular bioenergetics.
biological_context: Human skin epidermal biology and homeostasis
main_goals: This study evaluates the impact of Galactomyces Ferment Filtrate (GFF) on epidermal differentiation and response to oxidative stress using transcriptomics and spatial biology. The research investigates GFF's effects on keratinocyte differentiation, proliferation, cell adhesion, and cellular bioenergetics, highlighting its role in promoting epidermal interconnectivity.

title: Long-Term Follow-up of Levonorgestrel Intrauterine Device for Atypical Hyperplasia and Early Endometrial Cancer Reveals Relapse Characterized by Immune Exhaustion.
biological_context: Endometrial atypical hyperplasia (AH) and endometrioid endometrial cancer (EEC)
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the long-term follow-up of patients treated with levonorgestrel intrauterine device (LIUD) for atypical hyperplasia (AH) and early endometrial cancer (EEC). It sought to identify clinical factors associated with relapse and explore molecular mechanisms, particularly immune responses and exhaustion, at the time of relapse using spatial transcriptomics.

title: The Application Potential of Artificial Intelligence and Numerical Simulation in the Research and Formulation Design of Drilling Fluid Gel Performance.
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of artificial intelligence and numerical simulation techniques in the research and formulation design of drilling fluid gel performance. It analyzes current issues and proposes development directions to improve the application of these technologies.

title: A Semiparametric Bayesian Approach to Heterogeneous Spatial Autoregressive Models.
main_goals: This paper proposes a Bayesian estimation method for heterogeneous semiparametric spatial autoregressive models. It develops an efficient Markov chain Monte Carlo sampling algorithm using Gibbs sampler and Metropolis-Hastings to estimate model parameters. The method aims to handle heteroscedasticity in spatial data analysis.

title: Deep learning-based localization algorithms on fluorescence human brain 3D reconstruction: a comparative study using stereology as a reference.
main_goals: This paper empirically evaluates three deep learning-based localization algorithms (StarDist, CellPose, and BCFind-v2) for human brain 3D reconstruction. The comparison uses a stereological design as a reference and focuses on a portion of Broca's area. The goal is to help users select appropriate techniques based on research objectives by comparing correctness, computational efficiency, and human annotation effort.

title: Background removal for debiasing computer-aided cytological diagnosis.
main_goals: This paper proposes a deep learning approach using a U-Net-based model for cell segmentation and background removal in cytology images. The method aims to address background bias caused by slide deterioration, enabling more accurate computer-aided cytological diagnosis without requiring cell annotations.

title: Microscale is key to model current and future Maritime Antarctic vegetation.
biological_context: Maritime Antarctic vegetation, focusing on lichens, bryophytes, and two vascular plant species in response to climate change.
main_goals: To quantify the importance of abiotic and biotic microscale conditions in determining the spatial cover patterns of major vegetation functional types (lichens, vascular plants, and bryophytes) in Maritime Antarctica. The study aims to understand how these microscale factors influence vegetation distribution and to inform ecological models for predicting climate change effects.

title: Open-ST: High-resolution spatial transcriptomics in 3D.
biological_context: Mouse brain, primary head-and-neck tumors, patient-matched healthy/metastatic lymph nodes
covered_analysis_steps: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'subcellular resolution transcript capture', '3D reconstruction', 'cell type identification', 'spatial gene expression analysis', 'cell-cell communication analysis']
main_goals: To introduce Open-ST, an open-source experimental and computational resource for high-resolution, cost-efficient, and 3D-scalable spatial transcriptomics. It aims to study the molecular organization of tissues in 2D and 3D, capturing transcripts at subcellular resolution and reconstructing cell types and spatial organization in various biological samples.

title: Analysis of the chemical constituents and their metabolites in Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. via UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS and AFADESI-MSI techniques.
data_modalities_used: ['UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS', 'AFADESI-MSI', 'rat plasma', 'rat serum', 'kidney tissue homogenate']
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze the chemical constituents and their metabolites in Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. using UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS and AFADESI-MSI techniques. It sought to identify beneficial ingredients absorbed in rat plasma and visualize compound distribution in kidney tissue to provide theoretical support for the application of Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. in kidney disease treatment.

title: CellsFromSpace: a fast, accurate, and reference-free tool to deconvolve and annotate spatially distributed omics data.
main_goals: Introduces CellsFromSpace, a reference-free tool based on independent component analysis (ICA) for deconvolving and annotating spatially distributed omics data. It handles various commercial technologies, enables noise reduction, subset analysis, and provides a user-friendly interface for interpretation.

title: Deciphering the molecular landscape of human peripheral nerves: implications for diabetic peripheral neuropathy.
main_goals: To gain deep mechanistic insight into diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) using bulk and spatial RNA sequencing on human peripheral nerves. The study identified key pathway differences, distinct immunological features in sural nerves, and shifts in endothelial and immune cells associated with severe axonal loss. It also highlighted perturbed RNA transport in sensory axons as a potential contributor to DPN.

title: Cellpose as a reliable method for single-cell segmentation of autofluorescence microscopy images.
biological_context: Autofluorescence microscopy imaging of NAD(P)H in PANC-1 cells treated with metabolic inhibitors and patient-derived cancer organoids treated with chemotherapies.
data_modalities_used: ['autofluorescence microscopy', 'multiphoton intensity images', 'fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy (FLIM)']
main_goals: This study validates Cellpose as a reliable method for single-cell segmentation of autofluorescence microscopy images. It demonstrates Cellpose's ability to provide reproducible and accurate segmentation for NAD(P)H imaging, maintaining functional cellular information capture.

title: Spatial Single-cell Analysis Decodes Cortical Layer and Area Specification.
main_goals: To examine the molecular, cellular, and cytoarchitectural development of human fetal cortex with spatially resolved single-cell resolution using MERFISH. The study uncovers an early establishment of the six-layer structure and identifies sharp molecular borders between visual cortices, challenging existing notions of arealization.

title: Identification of a gene expression signature of vascular invasion and recurrence in stage I lung adenocarcinoma via bulk and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a gene expression signature of vascular invasion (VI) in stage I lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and develop a transcriptomic predictor for VI. The research utilized bulk and spatial transcriptomics to understand molecular and microenvironment features associated with angioinvasive LUAD. The findings suggest that VI-associated gene expression changes are detectable and can predict VI, potentially enabling tailored management strategies.

title: Inferring single-cell spatial gene expression with tissue morphology via explainable deep learning.
biological_context: Human breast cancer and whole mouse pup
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Developed SPiRiT, a vision transformer (ViT) framework to map histological signatures to spatial single-cell transcriptomic signatures. SPiRiT predicts single-cell spatial gene expression using matched histopathological image tiles, outperforming existing methods. Model interpretation identifies high-attention areas corresponding to specific cell types and their marker genes.

title: Enhanced Cell Tracking Using A GAN-based Super-Resolution Video-to-Video Time-Lapse Microscopy Generative Model.
biological_context: Cellular dynamics and tracking in time-lapse microscopy
main_goals: The paper proposes tGAN, a GAN-based time-lapse microscopy generator to enhance the quality and diversity of synthetic annotated time-lapse microscopy data. The model features a dual-resolution architecture to synthesize low and high-resolution images. The goal is to decrease dependency on manual annotation for improving cell tracking precision.

title: Genome-wide mining and characterization of MATE transporters in Coriandrum sativum L.
main_goals: This paper focuses on the genome-wide mining and characterization of MATE transporters in Coriandrum sativum L. The researchers identified and described 91 MATE proteins, classified them phylogenetically, and predicted their functions. The findings aim to provide insights into stress responses and secondary metabolite transport in coriander.

title: scHolography: a computational method for single-cell spatial neighborhood reconstruction and analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Neighborhood Reconstruction', '3D tissue visualization', 'Cell-Cell Communication Analysis']
main_goals: scHolography is a machine learning-based method to reconstruct single-cell spatial neighborhoods and enable 3D tissue visualization using spatial and single-cell RNA sequencing data.
