title: Cross-domain information fusion for enhanced cell population delineation in single-cell spatial-omics data.
main_goals: This work introduces Cell Spatio- and Neighborhood-informed Annotation and Patterning (CellSNAP), a self-supervised computational method for enhanced cell population delineation in single-cell spatial-omics data. CellSNAP fuses molecular profiles, cell positions, and tissue images to learn representation vectors for each cell. This integration aims to uncover functionally stratified cell populations by considering spatial contexts at cellular and tissue levels.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Identifies Epithelium-Macrophage Crosstalk in Endometriotic Lesions.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify cell type-specific gene expression changes in superficial peritoneal endometriotic lesions and elucidate the crosstalk among the stroma, epithelium, and macrophages compared to patient-matched eutopic endometrium. Spatial transcriptomics highlighted increased signaling between the lesion epithelium and macrophages, emphasizing the role of the epithelium in driving lesion inflammation.

title: Autofluorescence lifetime flow cytometry with time-correlated single photon counting.
biological_context: Jurkat T cells, primary human T cells, primary adult mouse neural stem cells
covered_analysis_steps: ['Autofluorescence lifetime analysis', 'Single-cell classification', 'Real-time analysis of single-cell function and metabolism']
main_goals: This paper presents a fluorescence lifetime-sensitive flow cytometer using TCSPC for real-time single-cell analysis. The system offers high throughput, low cost, and sensitivity to metabolic changes by measuring autofluorescence lifetimes, providing a label-free method for studying cell function.

title: SpatialPrompt: spatially aware scalable and accurate tool for spot deconvolution and domain identification in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: SpatialPrompt is a new tool for spot deconvolution and domain identification in spatial transcriptomics. It integrates gene expression, spatial location, and scRNA-seq data, using non-negative ridge regression and graph neural networks. It aims to be accurate and scalable, outperforming existing methods and achieving rapid execution on large datasets.

title: Spatial transcriptomic brain imaging reveals the effects of immunomodulation therapy on specific regional brain cells in a mouse dementia model.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell state annotation', 'Cell type decomposition']
main_goals: The paper describes a workflow and a custom application named STquantool for analyzing spatial transcriptomic data. This approach includes neuroanatomical region segmentation, gene combination establishment, and brain cell signature review. The ultimate goal is to interpret the real action of drug candidates by simultaneously investigating transcript dynamics for AD therapeutics development.

title: Examining the Effects of Nutrient Supplementation on Metabolic Pathways via Mitochondrial Ferredoxin in Aging Ovaries.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'human ovarian pathology', 'clinical biopsy data']
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of nutrient supplementation on metabolic pathways via mitochondrial ferredoxin in aging ovaries. Using multi-omics analysis, it identified a decline in FDX1 expression with ovarian aging. A clinical trial demonstrated that nutrient supplementation (DHEA, ubiquinol CoQ10, Cleo-20 T3) significantly elevated FDX1 levels, suggesting a potential for improving oocyte quality in aging women.

title: Structural and Organizational Strategies of Locomotor Modules during Landing in Patients with Chronic Ankle Instability.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore muscle synergies during landing in patients with chronic ankle instability (CAI) to understand motor control strategies. It identified muscle synergies using non-negative matrix factorization and analyzed their structural and organizational strategies, finding comparable modular frameworks between CAI patients and healthy controls, with specific amplitude adjustments in certain muscles.

title: A unified dataset for pre-processed climate indicators weighted by gridded economic activity.
main_goals: This paper introduces a unified dataset for pre-processed climate indicators weighted by gridded economic activity. They process and spatially aggregate climate data globally for countries and regions, using proxies of economic activity for weighting. The goal is to provide data for environmental and economic research and to validate it against leading climate impact studies.

title: Heterogeneity in Liver Cancer Immune Microenvironment: Emerging Single-Cell and Spatial Perspectives.
main_goals: This paper reviews the cellular landscape of the liver tumor immune microenvironment (TIME) from single-cell and spatial perspectives. It discusses cellular interaction networks regulating immune responses and highlights challenges and opportunities for biomarker discovery, patient stratification, and combination immunotherapies.

title: Spotless, a reproducible pipeline for benchmarking cell type deconvolution in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper benchmarks 11 cell type deconvolution methods for spatial transcriptomics. It introduces a simulation engine, synthspot, and a reproducible Nextflow pipeline called spotless for benchmarking. The study evaluates methods on performance, stability, and scalability using silver and gold standards.

title: Desorption Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry Imaging Techniques Depict a Reprogramming of Energy and Purine Metabolism in the Core Brain Regions of Chronic Social Defeat Stress Mice.
biological_context: Mouse brain in chronic social defeat stress model, associated with depression
main_goals: Develop and apply DESI-MSI to detect metabolites in mouse brain tissue, classifying brain regions and identifying metabolic changes in a chronic social defeat stress model. The study found significant alterations in energy and purine metabolism in specific brain regions.

title: Novel Feature Generation for Classification of Motor Activity from Functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy Signals Using Machine Learning.
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel feature generation framework by fusing wavelet features, Hilbert, symlet, and Hjorth parameters to improve the classification accuracy of motor activities (mental drawing and spatial navigation) from fNIRS signals. The framework includes preprocessing with independent component analysis and uses binary classifiers with various machine learning algorithms. The goal is to achieve higher classification accuracies compared to existing methods.

title: Spatial Multi-Omics in Alzheimer's Disease: A Multi-Dimensional Approach to Understanding Pathology and Progression.
main_goals: This article focuses on the latest advancements in spatial multi-omics technology, compares various techniques, and provides an overview of current spatial omics-based research results in Alzheimer's Disease. It highlights the role of these technologies in facilitating new discoveries and advancing translational AD research.

title: A Spatial Transcriptomics Browser for Discovering Gene Expression Landscapes across Microscopic Tissue Sections.
biological_context: Intra-tumoral heterogeneity of melanoma and microarchitecture of the mouse brain
covered_analysis_steps: ['Visualization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: Developed the ST browser web tool for interactive discovery of spatial transcriptomics data. The tool focuses on single gene expression, functional gene sets, and spatial patterns of cell-cell interactions. It uniquely applies self-organizing map (SOM) machine learning to generate high-resolution gene expression landscapes for downstream analysis.

title: MNMST: topology of cell networks leverages identification of spatial domains from spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: This paper introduces MNMST, a multi-layer network model for identifying spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data using joint learning. The method leverages the topological structure of cell networks for precise characterization and discrimination of spatial domains, outperforming existing methods. It also offers an effective strategy for integrative analysis of spatial transcriptomics data from various platforms.

title: Dependency-aware deep generative models for multitasking analysis of spatial omics data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['dimensionality reduction', 'visualization', 'clustering', 'batch integration', 'denoising', 'differential expression', 'spatial interpolation', 'resolution enhancement', 'identification of spatially variable genes']
main_goals: The paper proposes spaVAE, a dependency-aware deep generative spatial variational autoencoder model for analyzing spatial omics data. It probabilistically characterizes count data while capturing spatial correlations through a hybrid embedding. The model aims to facilitate various analytical tasks essential for spatial omics data, including dimensionality reduction, clustering, denoising, and identification of spatially variable genes, and has been extended for ATAC-seq and multi-omics data.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis of non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma and squamous-cell carcinoma)
main_goals: This study analyzes approximately 900,000 cells from treatment-naive non-small cell lung cancer patients using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to understand the tumor microenvironment, particularly the role of myeloid cells and immune cell interactions. Key findings include an inverse relationship between anti-inflammatory macrophages and cytotoxic immune cells, differences in immune checkpoint inhibitor co-expression between cancer subtypes, and evidence of macrophage transcriptional reprogramming.

title: Complete spatially resolved gene expression is not necessary for identifying spatial domains.
data_modalities_used: ['spatially resolved transcriptomics', 'binarized spatially resolved gene expression']
main_goals: This paper introduces BINARY, a graph convolutional network with an attention and positive emphasis mechanism, that accurately delineates spatial domains using exclusively binarized spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) data. BINARY outperforms existing methods across various SRT data types while using significantly less input information, suggesting that precise gene expression quantification may not always be essential.

title: Single-cell multiomics profiling reveals heterogeneous transcriptional programs and microenvironment in DSRCTs.
main_goals: This study profiled DSRCTs using single-cell multi-omics to reveal heterogeneous transcriptional programs and microenvironment components. It identified distinct tumor cell subpopulations and investigated the role of the EWSR1::WT1 oncogenic driver and tumor microenvironment in shaping these states. The findings highlight an epithelial signature associated with improved patient survival.

title: Cyto R-CNN and CytoNuke Dataset: Towards reliable whole-cell segmentation in bright-field histological images.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: The paper introduces a novel network architecture, Cyto R-CNN, for accurate whole-cell segmentation in bright-field histological images. It also presents the CytoNuke dataset to facilitate the development of such models. The proposed method demonstrates superior performance in segmentation accuracy and cell feature measurement compared to existing algorithms.

title: Molecular cascades and cell type-specific signatures in ASD revealed by single-cell genomics.
biological_context: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in the human brain
main_goals: To examine cell composition and transcriptomics in postmortem brains of autistic individuals using deep single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq), snATAC-seq, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify dysregulation of cell type-specific gene regulatory networks (GRNs) and connect these alterations to genetic susceptibility in ASD.

title: MTCSNet: One-Stage Learning and Two-Point Labeling are Sufficient for Cell Segmentation.
biological_context: Cell segmentation in various medical imaging modalities (pathological, brightfield, fluorescent, phase-contrast, differential interference contrast)
data_modalities_used: ['pathological images', 'brightfield images', 'fluorescent images', 'phase-contrast images', 'differential interference contrast images']
main_goals: Proposes MTCSNet, a weakly-supervised cell segmentation method using two-point labeling (centroid and boundary point) and five auxiliary tasks in a single-stage training manner. Demonstrates that this approach is sufficient for cell segmentation, outperforming state-of-the-art weakly-supervised methods on multi-modal medical image datasets.

title: Molecular and cellular neurocardiology in heart disease.
main_goals: This paper updates and builds on previous work concerning the molecular and cellular basis of cardiac neurobiology of heart disease. It focuses on recent findings in cardiac autonomic development, intracellular pathways, and neuroplasticity, highlighting unanswered questions and areas of controversy. The authors also discuss opportunities for understanding sympathetic impairment using patient-specific stem cells and the role of novel imaging and spatial transcriptomics in target discovery for cardiac dysautonomia.

title: Low-Temperature Plasma Pretreatment Enhanced Cholesterol Detection in Brain by Desorption Electrospray Ionization-Mass Spectrometry Imaging.
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel method using low-temperature plasma (LTP) pretreatment to enhance cholesterol detection in brain tissue using Desorption Electrospray Ionization-Mass Spectrometry Imaging (DESI-MSI). The LTP pretreatment significantly increases the ionization efficiency of cholesterol, allowing for more accurate and sensitive detection and mapping of its distribution within the brain.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial analysis reveals MUC1-mediated cellular crosstalk in mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrated single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to profile the mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma tumor microenvironment. It identified key intercellular interactions, including MUC1+ malignant cells with ZEB1+ endothelial cells, and found that FGF7+/THBS1+ myofibroblasts and MS4A4A+ macrophages play roles in the immunosuppressive TME. The research aims to provide insights into MCA progression, potential prognostic biomarkers, and therapeutic strategies.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics reveals a dystrophic trajectory following a developmental bifurcation of myoblast cell fates in facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study uses MERFISH spatial transcriptomics to profile RNA transcripts in differentiating myoblasts from control and FSHD samples. It reveals a dystrophic trajectory following a developmental bifurcation of myoblast cell fates, identifying FSHD-induced transcriptomic alterations linked to DUX4 activity.

title: Transcriptomic and spatial dissection of human ex vivo right atrial tissue reveals proinflammatory microvascular changes in ischemic heart disease.
biological_context: Ischemic heart disease and heart failure
main_goals: To dissect gene expression changes in human ex vivo right atrial tissue and pericardial fluid in ischemic heart disease and heart failure using single-nuclei RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to reveal inflammatory microvascular dysfunction and changes in right atrial tissue composition as diseases progress, potentially identifying mechanisms promoting severe disease.

title: A practical guide to spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To provide an updated review of spatial transcriptomic technologies, with a focus on commercially available platforms accessible to new users. The paper aims to serve as a guiding resource by presenting fundamental principles, discussing data analysis challenges, offering experimental insights, and providing a guide for method selection and a forward-looking perspective.

title: Multiplexed in situ RNA imaging by combFISH.
main_goals: This paper presents a cyclic combinatorial fluorescent in situ hybridization (combFISH) assay for multiplexed detection of RNA in cell cultures and tissues. The method uses cyclic interrogation of barcode sequences on rolling circle amplicons with combinatorial detection probes, eliminating sequencing-by-ligation chemistry. It aims to provide a straightforward approach for high-throughput spatial gene expression profiling.

title: Automated segmentation and recognition of C. elegans whole-body cells.
main_goals: The paper introduces a new pipeline, Automated Segmentation and Recognition (ASR), for marker-free segmentation and recognition of whole-body cells in C. elegans. It proposes a novel displacement vector field based deep learning model for segmentation and utilizes statistical priors for recognition. The ASR pipeline demonstrates success in segmenting and recognizing C. elegans cells and shows applicability to other cell types.

title: Cellular diversity through space and time: adding new dimensions to GBM therapeutic development.
main_goals: This review discusses advancements in understanding spatiotemporal diversity in GBM, focusing on the influence of hypoxia and immune cell interactions. It highlights the potential of high-resolution spatially resolved methodologies and clinical attempts to target these mechanisms.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics: A Powerful Tool in Disease Understanding and Drug Discovery.
main_goals: This article introduces the analytical strategies of spatial transcriptomics and reviews its applications in novel target discovery and drug mechanism unravelling. It discusses current challenges and issues in the research field.

title: Spatially resolved cell atlas of the teleost telencephalon and deep homology of the vertebrate forebrain.
main_goals: To generate a spatially-resolved transcriptional atlas of the teleost telencephalon and compare its cell-types and anatomical regions with other vertebrates to gain insights into the organization and evolution of the vertebrate forebrain.

title: Metabolic coordination between skin epithelium and type 17 immunity sustains chronic skin inflammation.
data_modalities_used: ['immunofluorescence', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'ex vivo human psoriatic lesions', 'murine model of skin inflammation']
main_goals: This paper investigates the metabolic coordination between skin epithelium and type 17 immunity in sustaining chronic skin inflammation. It reveals that HIF1α, downstream of IL-17 signaling, drives psoriatic epithelial remodeling and that glycolysis fuels epithelial pathology and enhances γδ T17 cell responses via lactate production. The findings identify a metabolic hierarchy coordinating inflammatory disease.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals gene interactions and signaling pathway dynamics in rat embryos with anorectal malformation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Gene Regulatory Networks']
main_goals: To investigate gene interactions and signaling pathway dynamics in rat embryos with anorectal malformation using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to capture location-specific information in the embryonic cloaca region and understand the molecular mechanisms underlying ARM development.

title: Characteristics of lipid metabolism after treatment of colon cancer mice with American ginseng vesicles.
main_goals: To provide a theoretical basis for tumor initiation and development by measuring the spatial distribution of lipids and metabolites in intestinal tissue. The study compiled lipid profiles in colon cancer mouse tumor tissue using spatial metabolomics and compared changes in lipid distribution after treatment with American Ginseng vesicles.

title: Spatially Resolved Single-Cell Omics: Methods, Challenges, and Future Perspectives.
data_modalities_used: ['next-generation sequencing-based assays', 'in situ hybridization', 'in situ sequencing', 'spatial proteomics', 'transcriptomics', 'proteomics']
main_goals: This review summarizes currently available spatial omics techniques and computational strategies. It highlights their advantages and limitations and discusses their future prospects. The paper emphasizes the need for AI/ML strategies to analyze and translate complex spatial omics data.

title: Identification of ligand and receptor interactions in CKD and MASH through the integration of single cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) and Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To identify ligand-receptor interactions in CKD and MASH by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to provide a comprehensive analysis of cell-specific L-R interactions to gain insights into signaling pathways and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Methods to Enable Spatial Transcriptomics of Bone Tissues.
biological_context: Bone osteosarcoma and lung metastasis of bone osteosarcoma
main_goals: This paper describes a method to enable spatial transcriptomics of bone tissues, overcoming challenges related to RNA preservation and tissue morphology during processing of hard tissues. The method involves decalcification to obtain high-quality tissue sections with preserved morphological details while avoiding RNA degradation, and also provides guidelines for previously paraffin-embedded samples.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic profiling of placental development in dairy cow.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper employed Stereo-seq to map spatial gene expression patterns in the cow placenta at different gestational stages. It aimed to understand the molecular and cellular interactions between trophoblast cells and their niches, and the mechanisms governing trophoblast differentiation and functionalization, identifying key transcription factors and genes involved.

title: Beyond the Granuloma: New Insights into Cardiac Sarcoidosis Using Spatial Proteomics.
data_modalities_used: ['archival human cardiac tissue samples', 'high-plex spatial protein analysis']
main_goals: To study the immunologic, fibrotic, and metabolic landscape of cardiac sarcoidosis using spatial proteomics on archival human tissue. The study also aimed to develop a predictive model to discriminate between control and sarcoidosis tissue, even without overt histologic inflammation.

title: Data-driven fine-grained region discovery in the mouse brain with transformers.
main_goals: The paper introduces CellTransformer, a novel encoder-decoder architecture and workflow for self-supervised spatial domain detection in large-scale spatial transcriptomics datasets. This method enables scalable analysis of multimillion cell datasets, integrating cells across tissue sections and identifying both known and novel tissue domains with high spatial coherence. It advances the state of the art by providing a performant solution for detecting fine-grained tissue domains.

title: Universal consensus 3D segmentation of cells from 2D segmented stacks.
biological_context: Cellular imaging for microscopy-based biological studies
main_goals: The paper introduces u-Segment3D, a toolbox for 2D-to-3D cell segmentation. It translates and enhances 2D instance segmentations to a 3D consensus instance segmentation without requiring training data. The method is demonstrated to be compatible with any 2D method generating pixel-based instance cell masks and is competitive with native 3D segmentation.

title: Quinolinic acid links kidney injury to brain toxicity.
biological_context: Kidney failure and its neurological consequences
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial metabolomics analysis', 'Bulk metabolomics analysis', 'Pathway enrichment analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between kidney dysfunction and neurological impairment by analyzing the metabolic alterations in mouse models of kidney failure and in patients with advanced CKD. It identifies the kynurenine pathway, particularly quinolinic acid, as a key mediator connecting kidney decline to brain toxicity and systemic inflammation.

title: scBSP: A fast and accurate tool for identifying spatially variable genes from spatial transcriptomic data.
main_goals: This paper introduces scBSP, an open-source, versatile, and user-friendly package designed for identifying spatially variable genes in large-scale spatial transcriptomics. It implements sparse matrix operations to significantly increase computational efficiency in terms of time and memory usage, enabling fast and accurate identification of spatially variable genes on high-definition spatial transcriptomics data.

title: Control of goal-directed and inflexible actions by dorsal striatal melanocortin systems, in coordination with the central nucleus of the amygdala.
biological_context: Mouse brain function, specifically goal-directed and inflexible actions controlled by melanocortin systems and amygdala
main_goals: The study investigates the role of melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in dopamine D1 receptor-containing striatal neurons for controlling action flexibility. It found that MC4R suppresses immediate-early gene levels and flexible goal seeking in the dorsomedial striatum and complements this function in the dorsolateral striatum by suppressing habit-like behavior.

title: Discrete placental gene expression signatures accompany diabetic disease classifications during pregnancy.
biological_context: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) during pregnancy
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To investigate whether subtypes of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDMA1 and GDMA2) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) during pregnancy are associated with distinct gene expression profiles in specific placental cell populations and microenvironments. The study aimed to combine RNA-sequencing, single-cell RNA-sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to reveal these disease gene signatures at high resolution.

title: Spatial metabolomics using mass-spectrometry imaging to decipher the impact of high red meat diet on the colon metabolome in rat.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer, Colonic epithelium metabolism affected by diet
main_goals: To investigate the metabolic impact of a high red meat diet on the rat colonic epithelium using Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI). The study aimed to analyze metabolite changes and their spatial distribution within the epithelial substructure to understand the effects of diet on colon metabolism and potentially identify biomarkers related to increased oxidative stress.

title: IGF2BP3 promotes glutamine metabolism of endometriosis by interacting with UCA1 to enhances the mRNA stability of GLS1.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Gene Expression Regulation']
main_goals: This study aimed to examine the influence of IGF2BP3 on endometriosis and elucidate its underlying molecular mechanism. It investigated the interaction of IGF2BP3 with UCA1 to enhance GLS1 mRNA stability and glutamine metabolism in endometriosis. The findings highlight IGF2BP3 as a potential therapeutic target for endometriosis.

title: Integrative molecular and spatial analysis reveals evolutionary dynamics and tumor-immune interplay of in situ and invasive acral melanoma.
main_goals: This paper characterizes the evolutionary dynamics and tumor-immune interplay during the progression of acral melanoma from in situ to invasive stages. It reveals distinct patterns of regional expansion in invasive acral melanoma and identifies aggressive subsets associated with specific macrophage subtypes and EMT. The study also proposes adnexal involvement and APOE/CD163 as predictive and prognostic biomarkers.

title: Adult Hippocampal Neurogenesis in the Human Brain: Updates, Challenges, and Perspectives.
main_goals: This paper reviews the current state of research on adult hippocampal neurogenesis in the human brain. It emphasizes the challenges and limitations associated with using immunohistochemistry and next-generation sequencing technologies for its study.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal metastasis mechanism and microenvironment remodeling of lymph node in osteosarcoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanism of lymph node metastasis in osteosarcoma and the remodeling of the metastatic lymph node microenvironment. It identifies a novel signaling axis (ETS2/IBSP) potentially promoting metastasis and elucidates how osteosarcoma cells reshape the lymph node microenvironment through interactions with various cell types.

title: Spatial transition tensor of single cells.
biological_context: Epithelial-mesenchymal transitions, blood development, mouse brain development, chicken heart development
main_goals: The paper presents spatial transition tensor (STT), a method that uses messenger RNA splicing and spatial transcriptomes to characterize multistability in space and reconstruct cell-state-specific dynamics and spatial state transitions. STT learns a four-dimensional transition tensor and uses spatial-constrained random walk to describe dynamics via short-time local tensor streamlines and long-time transition paths. It aims to provide a consistent multiscale description of single-cell transcriptome data.

title: DomainFit: Identification of protein domains in cryo-EM maps at intermediate resolution using AlphaFold2-predicted models.
main_goals: DomainFit is a program for semi-automated domain-level protein identification from cryo-EM maps, particularly at resolutions lower than 4 Å. It fits domains from AlphaFold2-predicted models into cryo-EM maps to identify protein candidates. The paper demonstrates its use in identifying microtubule inner proteins in Tetrahymena thermophila.

title: Modeling blood-brain barrier formation and cerebral cavernous malformations in human PSC-derived organoids.
biological_context: Human blood-brain barrier formation and cerebral cavernous malformations
main_goals: The paper reports the construction of human blood-brain barrier (hBBB) assembloids from human pluripotent stem cell-derived organoids. These assembloids successfully mimic hBBB development and function, and are used to model cerebral cavernous malformations (CCMs), revealing CCM-related molecular and cellular alterations.

title: Accurate single-molecule spot detection for image-based spatial transcriptomics with weakly supervised deep learning.
main_goals: Presents Polaris, an analysis pipeline for image-based spatial transcriptomics that combines deep learning for cell segmentation and spot detection with a probabilistic gene decoder for accurate single-cell gene expression quantification. It aims to provide a unifying, turnkey solution for MERFISH, seqFISH, and ISS experiments.

title: How spatial omics approaches can be used to map the biological impacts of stress in psychiatric disorders: a perspective, overview and technical guide.
main_goals: To provide a perspective on how spatial omics approaches can map the biological impacts of stress in psychiatric disorders. The paper aims to offer a technical guide for researchers and identify future directions using multi-omics technology in stress research.

title: Optimizing deep learning-based segmentation of densely packed cells using cell surface markers.
biological_context: Human herpes simplex virus (HSV) infection and immune reaction in skin tissue
main_goals: This paper compares the performance of 18 deep learning-based cell segmentation models on immunofluorescence images of skin tissue from human HSV infection. It further trains and tunes the most successful models to improve segmentation accuracy. The goal is to identify the best performing model for dense cell segmentation in challenging biological samples.

title: BANKSY: scalable cell typing and domain segmentation for spatial omics.
main_goals: BANKSY is presented as a scalable computational method for cell typing and domain segmentation in spatial omics data. It aims to provide efficient and accurate analysis for these complex datasets.

title: Cell-mediated cytotoxicity within CSF and brain parenchyma in spinal muscular atrophy unaltered by nusinersen treatment.
biological_context: spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) and its treatment with nusinersen
main_goals: To longitudinally investigate the effects of SMA and nusinersen treatment on local immune responses in the CSF and brain parenchyma. The study aimed to elucidate the role of cell-mediated cytotoxicity in SMA pathogenesis and identify it as a potential therapeutic target.

title: IL-12/IL23 blockade reveals patterns of asynchronous inflammation in pyoderma gangrenosum.
main_goals: To elucidate the dysregulated immune landscape of Pyoderma Gangrenosum (PG) and identify lesional skin changes associated with IL-12/IL-23 blockade. The study used spatial transcriptomics and comparative computation analysis on biopsies from PG patients before and after ustekinumab treatment, revealing complex inflammatory patterns including B cell infiltration and tertiary lymphoid structures.

title: Systematic dissection of tumor-normal single-cell ecosystems across a thousand tumors of 30 cancer types.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment across 30 cancer types and adjacent/healthy normal tissues
main_goals: To comprehensively investigate tumor-normal ecosystems, this study performs an integrative analysis of single-cell transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomics, TCGA data, and bulk tumors across a thousand tumors and multiple cancer types. It defines cell states, identifies hallmark gene signatures, characterizes fibroblast distinctions, and reveals interferon-enriched community states and their rewiring and response to immunotherapy.

title: Differential gene expression analysis of spatial transcriptomic experiments using spatial mixed models.
main_goals: This study proposes and validates the use of spatial linear mixed models with spatial correlation structures for differential gene expression analysis in spatial transcriptomics data. The authors demonstrate that these models effectively account for spatial autocorrelation and reduce type-I error inflation compared to non-spatial approaches.

title: Double-negative B cells and DNASE1L3 colocalise with microbiota in gut-associated lymphoid tissue.
biological_context: Intestinal homeostasis and immune response to gut microbiota
main_goals: This paper identifies the double negative 2 subset of B cells and their interaction with dendritic cells in the subepithelial dome of gut-associated lymphoid tissue. It proposes that fundamental features of autoimmune diseases are microbiota-associated components of normal intestinal immunity.

title: Tracking in situ checkpoint inhibitor-bound target T cells in patients with checkpoint-induced colitis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper tracks checkpoint inhibitor (CPI)-bound T cells in patients with CPI-induced colitis using multimodal single-cell and subcellular spatial transcriptomics. It investigates the cellular origins and spatial organization of these cells and their relationship with tissue inflammation and epithelial damage, aiming to inform preventive strategies.

title: Dissecting microenvironment in cystadenomas and hepatic cysts based on single nucleus RNA-sequencing data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Tumor Microenvironment Analysis', 'Pseudotime trajectory analysis', 'Copy number variation inference']
main_goals: To understand the differences in the microenvironment between cystadenomas and hepatic cysts using single-nucleus RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptome sequencing. The study aimed to reveal transcriptome signatures and regulators of immune and stromal cells, identify malignant degrees of hepatic stellate cells, and explore dynamic transformations of hepatocytes. It also investigated immune infiltration and T-cell regulatory mechanisms in cystadenomas.

title: HAMMF: Hierarchical attention-based multi-task and multi-modal fusion model for computer-aided diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: Proposes a Hierarchical Attention-based Multi-task Multi-modal Fusion model (HAMMF) for Alzheimer's disease diagnosis. The model integrates MRI and PET data using attention mechanisms and multi-task learning for classification and regression. It aims to improve diagnosis accuracy and efficiency by capturing fine-grained pathological features.

title: EfficientTrain++: Generalized Curriculum Learning for Efficient Visual Backbone Training.
main_goals: The paper proposes EfficientTrain++, a generalized curriculum learning approach to accelerate visual backbone training. It reformulates curriculum learning as a soft-selection function that progressively exposes harder patterns within each example, achieved through Fourier spectrum cropping and data augmentation modulation. The method significantly reduces training time for various popular models without sacrificing accuracy.

title: Non-Contact Blood Pressure Estimation From Radar Signals by a Stacked Deformable Convolution Network.
main_goals: This paper introduces a contactless blood pressure monitoring approach using radar signals and a novel deep learning network (RSD-Net). The RSD-Net integrates deformable convolutions and attention mechanisms to extract features and estimate continuous blood pressure. The method is validated on a dataset from healthy individuals under various conditions, demonstrating promising accuracy.

title: Single nucleus and spatial transcriptomic profiling of healthy human hamstring tendon.
main_goals: To determine the transcriptomes and location of all cell types in healthy hamstring tendon using single nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified 12 distinct cell types, including novel ones for tendons, and analyzed their location and transcriptional networks, highlighting the central role of fibroblasts in tendon homeostasis.

title: Neighborhood based computational approaches for the prediction of lncRNA-disease associations.
main_goals: The paper proposes novel computational approaches, NGH and CF, and their combination (NGH-CF) for predicting lncRNA-disease associations using tripartite graphs. The methods leverage neighborhood analysis and collaborative filtering to identify promising lncRNA candidates for experimental verification, outperforming existing methods.

title: Mapping dynamic molecular changes in hippocampal subregions after traumatic brain injury through spatial proteomics.
biological_context: Traumatic brain injury (TBI) in mouse hippocampus
main_goals: This study uses spatial proteomics to map dynamic molecular changes in hippocampal subregions after traumatic brain injury (TBI) at acute and subacute phases. It aims to identify subregion-specific vulnerabilities and potential recovery mechanisms.

title: Local gun violence, mental health, and sleep: A neighborhood analysis in one hundred US Cities.
biological_context: Community gun violence, mental health, and sleep patterns at a neighborhood level in US cities.
data_modalities_used: ['neighborhood covariates', 'demographic composition', 'population density', 'proximity to trauma centers']
main_goals: This study examines the associations between community gun violence, insufficient sleep, and poor mental health across neighborhoods in the United States. It highlights a complex interplay between community violence, sleep, and mental health, underlining the importance of reducing community violence for addressing health disparities.

title: Deep Learning for Cell Migration in Nonwoven Materials and Evaluating Gene Transfer Effects following AAV6-ND4 Transduction.
biological_context: LHON fibroblasts in an artificial 3D environment after adeno-associated virus transduction
main_goals: This study uses deep learning to analyze cell settlement, migration, homing, and proliferation of LHON fibroblasts in a 3D artificial environment after AAV6-ND4 transduction. The research aims to demonstrate the restoration of normal cell phenotype after gene manipulation and to model tissue formation for drug testing and disease study, inspired by biomimicry principles.

title: Deep Learning-Based Classification and Semantic Segmentation of Lung Tuberculosis Lesions in Chest X-ray Images.
biological_context: Lung tuberculosis lesions in chest X-ray images
main_goals: The study presents a deep learning network-based approach for detecting and semantically segmenting tuberculosis lesions in chest X-ray images. It optimizes and compares U-Net, Attention U-Net, U-Net++, Attention U-Net++, and PSP Attention U-Net++ models, and uses ensemble approaches to improve results. The goal is to assist clinicians in TB lesion examination.

title: Multiplex Digital Spatial Profiling in Breast Cancer Research: State-of-the-Art Technologies and Applications across the Translational Science Spectrum.
main_goals: This review highlights the potential of Multiplex Digital Spatial Profiling (MDSP) to revolutionize clinical applications in breast cancer research, ranging from risk assessment and diagnostics to prognostics, patient monitoring, and treatment customization. It discusses major MDSP techniques, their applications, and integration into clinical practice, addressing both potential and limitations. The review emphasizes the transformative potential of MDSP in reshaping the landscape of breast cancer research and treatment.

title: Multi-omics study on the molecular mechanism of anlotinib in regulating tumor metabolism.
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular mechanisms of anlotinib in regulating tumor metabolism by analyzing metabolite distribution and expression levels using spatial metabolomics. It integrates transcriptomics and proteomics to identify key metabolic pathways modulated by anlotinib, aiming to discover potential metabolic biomarkers for treatment.

title: Bayesian hidden mark interaction model for detecting spatially variable genes in imaging-based spatially resolved transcriptomics data.
main_goals: Develop a generalized energy-based Bayesian framework with a geostatistical mark interaction model for detecting spatially variable genes in imaging-based SRT data with irregular cell distributions. The method uses a zero-inflated negative binomial mixture model for count data and auxiliary variable MCMC for posterior sampling.

title: Validation of an organ mapping antibody panel for cyclical immunofluorescence microscopy on normal human kidneys.
data_modalities_used: ['immunofluorescence microscopy', 'cyclical IF (CyCIF)', 'multiplexed IF microscopy', 'whole slide images']
main_goals: The paper validates an organ mapping antibody panel for cyclical immunofluorescence microscopy on human kidneys. It aims to provide a standardized method for identifying 18 cell types and 5 extracellular matrix compartments in 2D and 3D CyCIF. The developed methods are accessible without programming experience and can enable integration with other high-dimensional molecular imaging modalities.

title: Molecular pixelation: spatial proteomics of single cells by sequencing.
biological_context: Immune cell dynamics, specifically T-cells stimulated by chemokines.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: Introduces Molecular Pixelation (MPX), an optics-free, DNA sequence-based method for spatial proteomics of single cells. MPX uses DNA-based molecular pixels to infer the relative locations of antibody-oligonucleotide conjugates, enabling the construction of spatially resolved proteomic networks. This allows for the identification of spatial organization patterns of proteins on cells, aiding in defining cell states.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in health and disease.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of current and emerging spatial transcriptomic methods, their applications in nephrology and other fields, and remaining challenges for the field.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis of human adrenal aging.
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the mechanisms linking functional and structural alterations of the human adrenal cortex during aging. Researchers conducted single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analysis of the aged human adrenal cortex. The findings suggest layer-specific alterations in signaling pathways and highlight the role of macrophages in age-related inflammation and senescence.

title: Bioengineered vascular grafts with a pathogenic TGFBR1 variant model aneurysm formation in vivo and reveal underlying collagen defects.
biological_context: Thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) formation in a humanized animal model.
main_goals: To establish a functional human thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) model in an animal host using bioengineered vascular grafts (BVGs) derived from gene-edited induced pluripotent stem cells. The study aimed to reveal underlying collagen defects contributing to TAA formation. The developed BVG model demonstrated disease pathology and provided insights into molecular mechanisms.

title: Advancements in artificial intelligence for pelvic floor ultrasound analysis.
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of AI to pelvic floor ultrasound analysis. It highlights advancements in automatic measurement of the angle of progress (AOP), automatic segmentation of the levator hiatus (LH), and automatic identification of the levator ani muscle (LAM). The aim is to demonstrate the value and progress of AI in this field.

title: Modulation of the tumor microenvironment and mechanism of immunotherapy-based drug resistance in breast cancer.
main_goals: This review highlights the role of stromal cells in modulating the breast tumor microenvironment, including the involvement of CAF-TAM interaction, alteration of tumor metabolism leading to immunotherapy failure, and other latest strategies, including high throughput genomic screening, single-cell and spatial omics techniques for identifying tumor immune genes regulating immunotherapy response. It emphasizes therapeutic approaches to overcome breast cancer immune resistance through CAF reprogramming, modulation of TAM polarization, tumor metabolism, and genomic alterations.

title: Mapping the cellular biogeography of human bone marrow niches using single-cell transcriptomics and proteomic imaging.
biological_context: Human bone marrow hematopoiesis and acute myeloid leukemia
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To map the cellular biogeography of human bone marrow niches using single-cell transcriptomics and proteomic imaging. The study discovered transcriptionally distinct subtypes of non-hematopoietic cells, predicted hematopoietic-non-hematopoietic interactions, and linked cellular signaling with spatial proximity. It revealed specific microenvironmental neighborhoods for early myelopoiesis and HSPCs, and identified mesenchymal stromal cell expansion in AML patients.

title: Deciphering novel TCF4-driven mechanisms underlying a common triplet repeat expansion-mediated disease.
data_modalities_used: ['long-read sequencing', 'short-read sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'exome data', 'primary patient-derived corneal endothelial cells (CECs)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Alternative Splicing', 'Differential Gene Expression', 'Differential Exon Usage', 'Pathway Enrichment', 'Spatial Transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study aims to decipher novel TCF4-driven mechanisms underlying Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD) by analyzing patient-derived corneal endothelial cells. It investigates expansion-specific transcriptomic biomarkers using various sequencing techniques and identifies TCF4 isoform ratio skewing and potential TCF4 variants independent of CTG18.1 expansions as pathogenic mechanisms.

title: Characterizing Spatially Continuous Variations in Tissue Microenvironment through Niche Trajectory Analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper introduces ONTraC, a strategy that constructs niche trajectories using a graph neural network-based modeling framework. It aims to provide a computational method for analyzing spatially continuous variations in tissue microenvironment, outperforming existing methods in benchmark analyses. The application of ONTraC to spatial transcriptomics datasets successfully recapitulated anatomical structures and identified microenvironment-dependent changes in gene regulatory networks and cell-cell interactions.

title: An integrated single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics atlas reveals the molecular landscape of the human hippocampus.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To define molecular profiles for hippocampal cell types and spatial domains using integrated snRNA-seq and spatially-resolved transcriptomics data from human donors. The study aims to characterize the molecular landscape, identify cell-type-specific gene expression patterns, and understand their spatial organization within the hippocampus. The data is made accessible through interactive web applications.

title: How Mycobacterium tuberculosis builds a home: Single-cell analysis reveals M. tuberculosis ESX-1-mediated accumulation of anti-inflammatory macrophages in infected mouse lungs.
biological_context: Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in mouse lungs
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Mycobacterium tuberculosis's ESX-1 secretion system in recruiting and differentiating immune cells within infected mouse lungs. Using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, the authors found that ESX-1 is crucial for attracting diverse mononuclear phagocyte subsets with high bacterial burden and inducing an anti-inflammatory signature in these cells.

title: Tissue and cellular spatiotemporal dynamics in colon aging.
main_goals: Developed a computational framework, cSplotch, to learn a hierarchical Bayesian model of spatially resolved cellular expression associated with age, tissue region, and sex. The framework leverages histological features to share information across tissue samples and data modalities. It enabled the identification of cellular and molecular gradients and multicellular programs associated with aging in the colon.

title: Cell Simulation as Cell Segmentation.
biological_context: Renal cell carcinoma, tumor infiltrating immune cells (neutrophils, T cells)
main_goals: To adopt methods from ab initio cell simulation for rapid, morphologically plausible cell segmentation in spatial transcriptomics data. The method aims to preserve cell type heterogeneity and improve accuracy compared to existing methods, particularly for challenging cell types like tumor-infiltrating immune cells.

title: Deep Learning-Based Cell Tracking in Deforming Organs and Moving Animals.
biological_context: Cellular dynamics in moving animals and deforming organs, such as the brain and heart.
main_goals: To address the challenges of cell tracking in deforming organs and moving animals by introducing a deep learning-based method. The paper provides a detailed protocol for data preparation, cell segmentation, and tracking using the 3DeeCellTracker software to enable deeper insights into organ dynamics and biological processes.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate the crosstalk between cancer-associated fibroblasts and cancer cells in hepatocellular carcinoma with spleen-deficiency syndrome.
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the intercellular crosstalk in HCC with spleen deficiency syndrome (SDS) by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It revealed that platelet-derived growth factor (PDGF) signaling between cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and cancer cells is enhanced in HCC-SDS, leading to ECM remodeling and TGF-β pathway activation. The findings suggest that CAFs physically surround cancer cells, potentially forming a barrier to immune cell infiltration under SDS.

title: A contrastive learning approach to integrate spatial transcriptomics and histological images.
biological_context: Human brains, chicken hearts, breast tumors, and human lungs
covered_analysis_steps: ['Data integration', 'Spatial domain identification', 'Tissue architecture identification', 'Data representation']
main_goals: The paper introduces ConGcR, a contrastive learning-based model to integrate gene expression, spatial location, and tissue morphology. It utilizes graph convolution and ResNet for encoders and enhances the model with a graph auto-encoder (ConGaR) for better spatially embedded representations. The models aim to improve tissue architecture identification accuracy and provide valuable data representation for spatial transcriptome analyses.

title: Continuous distribution of cancer cells in the cell cycle unveiled by AI-segmented imaging of 37,000 HeLa FUCCI cells.
main_goals: This study presents an automated imaging pipeline utilizing the Cellpose algorithm for precise cell segmentation and measurement of fluorescent cellular intensities. The pipeline enables high-throughput and accurate measurement of cellular fluorescence for cell cycle analysis of thousands of cells, with potential applications in developmental and cancer biology. It also provides a method to automatically build ground truth datasets for training and testing AI cell classification.

title: Enhanced cell segmentation with limited training datasets using cycle generative adversarial networks.
main_goals: To enhance cell segmentation models trained with limited annotated datasets using a CycleGAN-based architecture (cGAN-Seg). This approach generates synthetic annotated images to increase training data variability and improve the predictive accuracy and generalization of segmentation models. The method significantly improves performance over conventional training techniques.

title: Revealing cell-cell communication pathways with their spatially coupled gene programs.
main_goals: The paper proposes a new method called Intercellular Gene Association Network (IGAN) to infer cell-cell communication (CCC) pathways using spatial transcriptomics. IGAN estimates gene associations between adjacent cells, enabling exploration of upstream/downstream pathways of ligands/receptors and providing a panoramic cell-interaction-pathway graph. It can also measure CCC activity at single-cell resolution and discover spatial heterogeneity.

title: A Hitchhiker's guide to high-dimensional tissue imaging with multiplexed ion beam imaging.
data_modalities_used: ['Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded (FFPE) tissues', 'multiplexed ion beam imaging', 'spatial proteomics', 'protein markers']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Antigen retrieval', 'Metal isotope-conjugated antibody staining', 'Imaging', 'Data processing', 'Data analysis']
main_goals: This paper describes an optimized workflow for high-plex analysis of FFPE tissues using Multiplexed Ion Beam Imaging (MIBI). The workflow covers antigen retrieval, antibody staining, MIBI instrument imaging, and subsequent data processing and analysis. It aims to enable a deeper understanding of tissue microenvironments in disease contexts by relating individual cell phenotypes to their higher-order roles.

title: ALOX15<sup>+</sup> M2 macrophages contribute to epithelial remodeling in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps.
biological_context: Eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps (eCRSwNP)
data_modalities_used: ['digital spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell sequencing', 'Hematoxylin and eosin staining', 'immunohistochemical staining', 'immunofluorescence staining']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of ALOX15+ M2 macrophages in epithelial remodeling in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps (eCRSwNP). It found that ALOX15+ M2 macrophages are specifically increased in eCRSwNP and contribute to epithelial remodeling by producing chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 13.

title: SC-Track: a robust cell-tracking algorithm for generating accurate single-cell lineages from diverse cell segmentations.
main_goals: SC-Track is a novel algorithm that robustly tracks cells and generates accurate single-cell lineages from diverse cell segmentations, including noisy ones produced by deep learning models. It employs a hierarchical probabilistic cascade model and can improve cell classification accuracy.

title: Opening the Black Box: Spatial Transcriptomics and the Relevance of Artificial Intelligence-Detected Prognostic Regions in High-Grade Serous Carcinoma.
biological_context: High-grade serous carcinoma of the ovary (HGSC)
main_goals: This study applies spatially resolved transcriptomics to profile AI-identified tumor regions in high-grade serous carcinoma of the ovary (HGSC). The goal is to identify molecular features associated with patient outcome by comparing transcriptomic profiles of AI-defined regions with background tumor regions. The findings aim to demonstrate that AI-guided spatial transcriptomic analysis can improve the recognition of biologically relevant features for patient outcomes.

title: Sexual violence against children and adolescents in Paraná State: geospatial analysis and main socioeconomic indicators.
biological_context: Child and adolescent sexual violence in Paraná State, Brazil
data_modalities_used: ['secondary data from Notifiable Diseases Information System (SINAN)']
main_goals: To compare information on child sexual violence with social and economic data in the state of Paraná, Brazil. The study aims to provide data that can promote a broader understanding of the distribution of sexual violence and the state and associated variations, expecting to improve care for victims and assist in strategic planning for prevention.

title: AnnoSpat annotates cell types and quantifies cellular arrangements from spatial proteomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell Type Annotation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: Develop AnnoSpat, a computational tool using neural networks and point process algorithms to automatically identify cell types and quantify cell-cell proximity relationships from spatial proteomic data. The tool aims to address challenges in annotating cell types and quantifying localization in atlas-scale datasets. It demonstrates higher performance compared to alternatives and recapitulates known islet pathobiology in type 1 diabetes.

title: SpatialCells: automated profiling of tumor microenvironments with spatially resolved multiplexed single-cell data.
main_goals: Introduces SpatialCells, an open-source software package for automated region-based exploratory analysis and comprehensive characterization of tumor microenvironments using multiplexed single-cell data. It streamlines feature extraction and processing of millions of cells, facilitating subsequent association analyses and machine learning predictions.

title: Harnessing TME depicted by histological images to improve cancer prognosis through a deep learning system.
covered_analysis_steps: ['gene expression prediction', 'prognosis prediction', 'spatial gene expression analysis']
main_goals: Develop a deep learning system to predict spatial gene expression from histological images and improve cancer prognosis prediction. The system uses an integrated graph and image deep learning (IGI-DL) model for gene expression prediction and a survival model based on predicted spatial gene expression for prognosis.

title: Exploring kidney allograft rejection: A proof-of-concept study using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study explores the potential of spatial transcriptomics to study kidney allograft rejection by mapping gene expression patterns in different pathologic states. It reveals distinct immune cell signatures and their spatial organization, and demonstrates differential spatial enrichment of rejection-associated gene expression patterns in renal allograft biopsies.

title: Unraveling molecular advancements in chordoma tumorigenesis and treatment response: a review of scientific discoveries and clinical implications.
main_goals: To dissect landmark studies exploring the molecular pathogenesis of chordoma, incorporating ongoing clinical trials and emerging technologies. The aim is to summarize recent advancements in understanding chordoma pathogenesis and how neurosurgical care may be augmented by improvements in adjunctive treatments.

title: Single-cell transcriptomics: background, technologies, applications, and challenges.
main_goals: This review presents the latest advancements in single-cell transcriptomics technologies. It covers single-cell transcriptomics approaches, workflows, and statistical approaches to data processing, as well as potential advances, applications, opportunities, and challenges. The review also provides an overview of entry points for spatial transcriptomics and multi-omics.

title: [Identifying spatial domains from spatial transcriptome by graph attention network].
main_goals: This paper proposes a deep learning approach based on graph attention networks for clustering spatial transcriptome data. The method enhances the data, extracts features using graph attention networks, and clusters using the Leiden algorithm. It aims to effectively cluster spatial transcriptome data and identify different spatial domains.

title: scRNA-seq characterizing the heterogeneity of fibroblasts in breast cancer reveals a novel subtype SFRP4<sup>+</sup> CAF that inhibits migration and predicts prognosis.
main_goals: This study characterized the heterogeneity of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in breast cancer using scRNA-seq. It identified a novel SFRP4+ CAF subtype that inhibits cancer cell migration and EMT by modulating the WNT signaling pathway. The SFRP4+ CAF subtype also serves as a potential prognostic biomarker for breast cancer patients.

title: Efficacy Assessment of Cerebral Perfusion Augmentation through Functional Connectivity in an Acute Canine Stroke Model.
main_goals: This study evaluates the effects of cerebral perfusion augmentation therapy (norepinephrine and hydralazine) on resting-state functional connectivity in an acute canine stroke model. It investigates whether the therapy can maintain functional connectivity in specific resting-state networks post-stroke and assesses functional connectivity as a potential endpoint for stroke intervention efficacy.

title: Nursing students' perspectives on being work-ready with electronic medical records: Intersections of rurality and health workforce capacity.
main_goals: To explore nursing students' views on being prepared for using electronic medical records during clinical placement, focusing on the need for eMR training in undergraduate nursing curricula and identifying factors influencing student preparedness and confidence.

title: Unlocking Skin's Symphony: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveal the Harmonious Interplay among Diverse Cell Populations.
main_goals: This paper aims to reveal the harmonious interplay among diverse cell populations in human skin by leveraging single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It explores the complex cellular ecosystem and gene expression patterns within the skin.

title: scBOL: a universal cell type identification framework for single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper proposes scBOL, a universal cell type identification framework for single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It addresses the challenge of novel cell types and the neglect of spatial organization in existing methods. scBOL uses bipartite prototype alignment to identify common cell types, mine anchor cells, and strengthen inter-cluster separability and intra-cluster compactness.

title: CPPLS-MLP: a method for constructing cell-cell communication networks and identifying related highly variable genes based on single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper proposes CPPLS-MLP, a method to construct cell-cell communication networks and identify highly variable genes (HVGs) related to intercellular communication using single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to analyze the impact of cell communication on HVG expression and demonstrates superior performance compared to the CCPLS method.

title: Three-dimensional domain identification in a single hexagonal manganite nanocrystal.
main_goals: This paper presents a multi-peak Bragg coherent x-ray diffraction imaging determination of the domain structure in single YMnO3 nanocrystals. It resolves ferroelectric domains and confirms atomic displacements along the c-axis. The findings correlate with atomistic simulations, supporting a Mexican hat symmetry model for domain formation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics unravels palmitoylation and zonation-dependent gene regulation by AEG-1 in mouse liver.
biological_context: Obesity-induced metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in mouse liver.
main_goals: To elucidate how palmitoylation influences AEG-1-mediated gene regulation in regard to hepatic zonation using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify zone-specific differential gene expression in AEG-1 mutant mice compared to wild-type, potentially contributing to metabolic dysfunction and dysregulated drug metabolism leading to MASH and HCC.

title: Upregulation of EMR1 (ADGRE1) by Tumor-Associated Macrophages Promotes Colon Cancer Progression by Activating the JAK2/STAT1,3 Signaling Pathway in Tumor Cells.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro coculture of CC cells with macrophages']
main_goals: This study explores the role of EMR1 and its signaling interactions with macrophages in colon cancer progression. It investigates how TAMs induce EMR1 expression in colon cancer cells, which in turn activates JAK2/STAT1,3 signaling, promoting proliferation, migration, and motility, and reducing apoptosis. The findings suggest clinical significance for EMR1 in colon cancer progression and potential interventions.

title: Role of Tumor-Associated Macrophages in Cervical Cancer: Integrating Classical Perspectives with Recent Technological Advances.
main_goals: This review aims to provide an overview of TAMs in cervical cancer, covering their origins, phenotypes, and impact on cancer progression. It also discusses TAM-targeted therapeutic approaches and advocates for integrating advanced research methodologies like single-cell and spatial RNA sequencing for personalized immunotherapy strategies.

title: GTADC: A Graph-Based Method for Inferring Cell Spatial Distribution in Cancer Tissues.
main_goals: Proposes a graph-based deep learning method (GTADC) to infer cell spatial distribution in cancer tissues by integrating spatial transcriptomics and scRNA-seq data. GTADC uses Silhouette scores for precise gene selection and leverages graph structure to capture spatial relationships, aiming for accurate reconstruction of cellular spatial composition and early detection of cancer cell regions.

title: Open-Set Recognition of Individual Cows Based on Spatial Feature Transformation and Metric Learning.
main_goals: This study proposes an open-set method for individual cow recognition based on spatial feature transformation and metric learning. It aims to address issues with diverse orientation distributions and partial body visibility in overhead images, leading to improved recognition accuracy.

title: Research on the innovative application of Shen Embroidery cultural heritage based on convolutional neural network.
main_goals: This paper introduces innovative research on Shen Embroidery using convolutional neural networks to protect intangible cultural heritage. It fine-tunes the MobileNet V1 network with Spatial Pyramid Pooling for feature fusion. The improved network achieved high recognition accuracy, providing technical support for the intelligent development of cultural heritage.

title: Single-cell analyses reveal transient retinal progenitor cells in the ciliary margin of developing human retina.
main_goals: This paper provides a comprehensive single-cell characterization of transcriptional and chromatin accessibility changes during human retinal development. It demonstrates the transient presence of early retinal progenitors in the ciliary margin zone and identifies key transcription factors involved in their regulation. The findings offer insights into the processes underlying retinal progenitor cell specification and differentiation.

title: Analysis of synthetic cellular barcodes in the genome and transcriptome with BARtab and bartools.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Extraction of lineage barcodes', 'Quality control of lineage barcodes', 'Analysis of lineage barcodes', 'Visualization of lineage barcodes']
main_goals: This paper presents BARtab, a Nextflow pipeline, and bartools, an R package, designed as an integrated end-to-end toolkit for cellular barcoding analysis. These tools simplify the extraction, quality control, analysis, and visualization of lineage barcodes from various transcriptomics experiments. Their utility is demonstrated through exemplar bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics data.

title: Targeting PDGF signaling of cancer-associated fibroblasts blocks feedback activation of HIF-1α and tumor progression of clear cell ovarian cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms underlying chemoresistance in ovarian clear cell carcinoma (OCCC). It identifies cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their interaction with OCCC cells, mediated by PDGF signaling, as crucial for chemoresistance and tumor progression by influencing HIF-1α activity. The paper also demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting CAFs with ripretinib in combination with chemotherapy.

title: Molecular stratification of the human fetal vaginal epithelium by spatial transcriptome analysis.
main_goals: To perform a spatial transcriptomic analysis within the human fetal vaginal wall to categorize the epithelium into distinct zones, identify unique transcriptomic signatures and markers, and understand the differentiation trajectory and biological processes within these zones, particularly the basal zone. The research aims to provide a molecular atlas of the human vaginal epithelium with potential applications in vaginal reconstruction and drug delivery.

title: Pan-cancer analysis implicates novel insights of lactate metabolism into immunotherapy response prediction and survival prognostication.
biological_context: Pan-cancer analysis of tumor cells and immune microenvironment in relation to immunotherapy response and survival prognostication.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the role of lactate metabolism (LM) in predicting immunotherapy response and patient survival. It develops a novel LM-related signature (LM.SIG) using scRNA-seq data, validates its predictive capacity using machine learning across multiple cancer datasets, and identifies LDHA as a key biomarker for immunotherapy response and survival, further validated through experimental studies.

title: Joint Bayesian estimation of cell dependence and gene associations in spatially resolved transcriptomic data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Gene co-expression network']
main_goals: This paper proposes a joint Bayesian approach to simultaneously estimate gene correlations and spatial cell correlations in spatially resolved transcriptomic data. The method aims to preserve the inherent dependency structure among genes at any spatial location, providing data summaries for downstream analyses and elucidating gene co-expression networks and spatial clustering patterns.

title: Cross-modality mapping using image varifolds to align tissue-scale atlases to molecular-scale measures with application to 2D brain sections.
main_goals: This paper proposes a method to build correspondences between molecular-scale transcriptomics and tissue-scale atlases. It represents spatial transcriptomics data as generalized functions and maps them to low-dimensional atlas ontologies by modeling regions as homogeneous random fields. The method simultaneously solves for geodesic diffeomorphisms and latent feature densities to integrate diverse molecular and cellular datasets.

title: Precision medicine in colorectal cancer: Leveraging multi-omics, spatial omics, and artificial intelligence.
main_goals: This review highlights the integration of multi-omics, spatial omics, and artificial intelligence (AI) in advancing precision medicine for Colorectal Cancer (CRC). It discusses how these technologies can uncover molecular mechanisms, provide insights into spatial heterogeneity, and enhance diagnosis and prognosis, aiming to overcome challenges in CRC treatment.

title: Establishment of a cholangiocarcinoma risk evaluation model based on mucin expression levels.
main_goals: To investigate the functions of mucins on the progression of Cholangiocarcinoma (CCA) and to establish a risk evaluation formula for stratifying CCA patients. The study elucidated functional mechanisms of mucins in CCA development and provided tools for risk stratification.

title: Classifying cell cycle states and a quiescent-like G0 state using single-cell transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human neural stem cells and generalization across various cell types from all three germ layers.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell cycle classification', 'Regression of cell cycle expression patterns']
main_goals: The paper introduces ccAFv2, a high-resolution classifier for six cell cycle states and a quiescent-like G0 state using single-cell transcriptomics. It demonstrates ccAFv2's enhanced accuracy, flexibility, and adaptability across various cell types, species, and data types, providing methods to remove cell cycle effects from data.

title: Spatiotemporal proteomic profiling of cellular responses to NLRP3 agonists.
main_goals: This paper maps subcellular proteome changes in response to NLRP3 inflammasome agonists, identifying disruptions in retrograde trafficking pathways. It also characterizes NLRP3 trafficking during activation using temporal proximity proteomics, supporting a model of recruitment to endosomes. The findings aim to provide granularity to understanding NLRP3 activation and serve as a resource for cell biological research.

title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveal distinct immune-infiltrating phenotypes and macrophage-tumor interaction axes among different lineages of pituitary neuroendocrine tumors.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'multiplexed quantitative immunofluorescence (QIF)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Phenotype Analysis', 'Tumor Microenvironment Analysis']
main_goals: To analyze the heterogeneity, spatial distribution, and clinical significance of macrophages in PitNETs using various techniques, revealing distinct immune microenvironment subtypes and macrophage-tumor interaction axes among different lineages. The study aims to provide insights into the control of the tumor immune microenvironment affecting PitNET development and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: [Spatial transcriptomics techniques and its applications in plant research].
main_goals: This review explores the application of spatial transcriptomics (ST) technology in plants. It covers the development of ST technology, its current applications in studying plant cell growth, differentiation, identification, and stress resistance, and proposes future research directions, including the integration of ST with other omics technologies.

title: Innovative interpretable AI-guided water quality evaluation with risk adversarial analysis in river streams considering spatial-temporal effects.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Feature selection', 'Machine learning prediction', 'Monte-Carlo simulation risk assessment', 'SHAP analysis']
main_goals: This study introduces a novel AI-guided approach for evaluating river water quality. It utilizes machine learning (specifically Light Gradient Boosting) combined with feature selection and Monte-Carlo simulations for risk assessment and interpretation using SHAP analysis. The aim is to provide tailored strategies and early warning systems for water quality management.

title: Probabilistic U-Net model observer for the DDC method in CT scan protocol optimization.
main_goals: This paper proposes a probabilistic U-Net model observer for the Difference-Detailed Curve (DDC) method in CT scan protocol optimization. It aims to address the labor-intensive nature and variability of human observer studies by developing a machine learning-based approach. The framework allows for well-calibrated probabilistic predictions and quantification of observer variability, enabling prediction of the DDC distribution.

title: 3D reconstruction of a gastrulating human embryo.
main_goals: To construct a 3D model of a Carnegie stage 8 human embryo using high-resolution spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies cell subtypes, characterizes lineage trajectories, and maps regional signaling centers and activities during gastrulation.

title: Spatial Dissection of the Immune Landscape of Solid Tumors to Advance Precision Medicine.
main_goals: This review highlights recent advancements in spatial transcriptomics and proteomics profiling technologies and their applications for dissecting the immune cell composition in solid malignancies. The aim is to improve prognosis, predict therapy response, and direct cancer patients to more tailored treatments, furthering basic research and precision medicine.
