main_goals: This paper proposes a method for extracting high-precision tree parameters from Fokienia hodginsii plantations using airborne LiDAR data. The method involves data pre-processing, ground filtering, individual tree segmentation, and parameter extraction, utilizing algorithms like Cloth Simulation Filter (CSF), Delaunay triangulation, Inverse Distance Weighted, watershed algorithm, and point cloud distance clustering. The study evaluates the accuracy of different resolutions and thresholds for segmentation and parameter extraction, achieving high accuracy for tree height and crown diameter.

title: Spatial Mass Cytometry-Based Single-Cell Imaging Reveals a Disrupted Epithelial-Immune Axis in Prurigo Nodularis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study uses spatial imaging mass cytometry to characterize the spatial organization of the cutaneous infiltrate in prurigo nodularis (PN). It identifies disrupted epithelial-immune axis and highlights phosphorylated extracellular signal-regulated kinase-positive CD14+ macrophages as contributors to itch in PN.

title: SARS-CoV-2 infection modifies the transcriptome of the megakaryocytes in the bone marrow.
biological_context: SARS-CoV-2 infection in mice, focusing on bone marrow megakaryocytes
main_goals: The study investigated whether SARS-CoV-2 infection affects the transcriptome of bone marrow megakaryocytes. Using spatial transcriptomics and machine learning, the researchers aimed to identify transcriptional changes in megakaryocytes based on their proximity to bone marrow sinusoids and in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection and systemic inflammation. The goal was to understand the impact of COVID-19 pathogenesis on these cells.

title: Emerging measurements for tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in breast cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['histology', 'immunohistochemistry', 'computer tissue imaging', 'flow cytometry', 'multi-omics', 'RNA sequencing', 'single-cell analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Histology evaluation', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'Computer tissue imaging', 'Flow cytometry sorting', 'Multi-omics analyses', 'Immune signatures', 'Deconvolution tools', 'Single-cell analysis', 'Spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This review outlines evaluation methods for tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) in breast cancer, from conventional pathological approaches to newer technologies like AI-driven imaging, flow cytometry, multi-omics, single-cell analysis, and spatial transcriptomics. It highlights the need for these advanced methods due to the heterogeneity of TILs and the complexity of the tumor microenvironment, especially in the context of immune checkpoint inhibitors.

title: Spatial omics techniques and data analysis for cancer immunotherapy applications.
main_goals: This review discusses technological advances in spatial profiling of cancer, focusing on its application to cancer immunotherapy. It covers profiling beyond the central dogma and addresses challenges and the future of spatial data analysis and interpretation.

title: Mapping functional to morphological variation reveals the basis of regional extracellular matrix subversion and nerve invasion in pancreatic cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Ex vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the gene expression programs that underpin intratumor morphological variation in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC). It identifies three major morphological and functional variants co-existing in PDAC, associated with distinct extracellular matrix organization and linked to neural invasion. The research provides evidence for dynamic transitions between these variants influenced by the extracellular matrix.

title: Digital pathology and spatial omics in steatohepatitis: Clinical applications and discovery potentials.
biological_context: Steatohepatitis (including metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease, alcohol-associated liver disease)
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'digital pathology', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'linear microscopy', 'nonlinear microscopy', 'histological sections']
main_goals: This paper reviews the utility of digital pathology augmented with AI for histological interpretation of steatohepatitis. It also discusses the spatial omics landscape, including spatial transcriptomics and proteomics, and their applications in steatohepatitis. The review highlights the power of multimodal integration of digital pathology with spatial biology and discusses current knowledge gaps and future research areas.

title: Three-dimensional topology-based analysis segments volumetric and spatiotemporal fluorescence microscopy.
main_goals: This paper introduces a 3D segmentation algorithm using persistent homology, a technique borrowed from topological data analysis, to identify variations in image intensity. The algorithm is adapted for both 3D volumetric and spatiotemporal fluorescence microscopy data. It aims to provide sensitive and specific results for segmenting biological structures, regardless of shape, and to enable cell lineage tracking and replication frequency analysis.

title: Extended correlation functions for spatial analysis of multiplex imaging data.
main_goals: This paper extends the cross-pair correlation function (cross-PCF) to address limitations in analyzing multiplex imaging data. The proposed extensions include topographical correlation maps for local clustering, neighbourhood correlation functions for colocalization of multiple cell types, and weighted-PCFs for continuous cell labels. These methods aim to provide more detailed spatial analysis of multiplexed histology.

title: Starfysh integrates spatial transcriptomic and histologic data to reveal heterogeneous tumor-immune hubs.
biological_context: Breast cancer (estrogen receptor-positive, triple-negative, and metaplastic)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Starfysh integrates spatial transcriptomic and histologic data to characterize tissue-specific cell states without a single-cell reference. It enables comparison of spatial hubs across tissues and improved characterization of spatial dynamics using histology images.

title: An Automated and Fast Sample Preparation Workflow for Laser Microdissection Guided Ultrasensitive Proteomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces an automated and fast sample preparation workflow for laser microdissection (LMD) guided ultrasensitive proteomics. This workflow is designed to process low-input archival tissue samples, enabling spatial proteomics on a large scale. It integrates LMD collection with lysis, de-crosslinking, and tryptic digestion, followed by seamless clean-up for LC-MS analysis.

title: RNA-seq transcriptome and pathway analysis of the medicinal mushroom Lignosus tigris (Polyporaceae) offer insights into its bioactive compounds with anticancer and antioxidant potential.
main_goals: To investigate the gene expression profile of Ligno TG-K via de novo RNA-seq and pathway analysis, identify highly expressed genes encoding compounds contributing to its cytotoxic and antioxidant properties, and perform a comparative transcriptomics analysis between Ligno TG-K and L. rhinocerus TM02®.

title: Transcriptomic, epigenomic, and spatial metabolomic cell profiling redefines regional human kidney anatomy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolomics Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to create a large-scale multimodal atlas of the human kidney, integrating transcriptomic, epigenomic, and spatial metabolomic data to redefine its regional anatomy. It identified cell-type specific signatures based on location and explored metabolic dysregulation in disease, highlighting PLEKHA1 as a potential marker for proximal tubule differentiation.

title: Climbing into their Skin to Understand Contextual Protein-Protein Associations and Localizations: Functional Investigations in Transgenic Live Model Organisms.
main_goals: The paper discusses methods to profile local proteomes in live organisms, focusing on chemical biology regimens using reactive biotin species. It also explores adding new dimensions by releasing less reactive electrophiles to probe protein function and locale simultaneously.

title: Super-resolution of Retinal Optical Coherence Tomography Images Using Statistical Modeling.
main_goals: To address the super-resolution problem of retinal OCT images using a statistical modeling approach. The method involves fitting a Weibull mixture model, applying Gaussian transform and spatially constraint Gaussian mixture model for noise reduction, and using expected patch log-likelihood with MAP estimator for super-resolution. The goal is to improve image quality and suppress noise.

title: Cell segmentation in images without structural fluorescent labels.
biological_context: Cell segmentation in high-content screening (HCS) assays for drug mechanism of action studies.
main_goals: To present a segmentation workflow that overcomes the dependency on structural fluorescent labels for image segmentation in high-content screening. The method fine-tunes pre-trained generalist cell segmentation models for individual fluorescent labels and aggregates the results, freeing up microscopy channels for biologically relevant labels. This approach aims to improve performance and robustness, maximizing the biological information content of HCS assays.

title: scGREAT: Transformer-based deep-language model for gene regulatory network inference from single-cell transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Regulatory Network Inference']
main_goals: scGREAT is a transformer-based deep-language model designed to infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from single-cell transcriptomics. It aims to overcome computational limitations and simplistic assumptions of existing methods by learning gene embeddings through a transformer engine. The framework was demonstrated to outperform contemporary methods and provide valuable gene regulation insights.

title: Deciphering the spatiotemporal transcriptional and chromatin accessibility of human retinal organoid development at the single-cell level.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper presents a single-cell spatiotemporal transcriptome of human retinal organoid development by combining single cell RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to recapitulate key events of retinogenesis and reveal cell-type specific transcription factor binding motifs on accessible chromatin.

title: YAP induces a neonatal-like pro-renewal niche in the adult heart.
main_goals: This study investigates how YAP activation induces a neonatal-like pro-renewal niche in adult mouse hearts post-myocardial infarction. It reveals a cellular triad involving cardiomyocytes, fibroblasts, and macrophages, orchestrated by C3a signaling, that is crucial for heart regeneration.

title: Molecular analysis of the extracellular microenvironment: from form to function.
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'spatial biology', 'spatial omics', 'proteomics', 'extracellular matrix proteome']
main_goals: This review provides a comprehensive overview of the analytical challenges involved in spatially profiling the extracellular matrix proteome. It details the process of synthesizing ECM structure, the inherent chemical complexity, and current chromatographic and spatial techniques addressing these challenges. The review also discusses multimodal multiplexing capabilities with cellular populations for a holistic view of disease processes.

title: SpatialData: an open and universal data framework for spatial omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Data integration', 'Spatial annotations', 'Cross-modal aggregation and analysis', 'Alignment to common coordinate systems']
main_goals: Introduces SpatialData, an open and universal data framework for spatial omics. It establishes a unified file format, lazy data representation, and transformation/alignment capabilities. The framework aims to facilitate spatial annotations and cross-modal aggregation for complex analyses.

title: Down to the coronary arteries: When spatial multiomics open up a narrow path.
main_goals: This paper discusses the application of spatial multiomics to study coronary arteries, particularly in the context of heart transplantation. It highlights the challenges and opportunities in using these advanced techniques to understand conditions like antibody-mediated rejection (AMR), cardiac allograft vasculopathy (CAV), and donor-specific antibodies (DSA). The focus is on how spatial multiomics can provide insights into the complex biological processes occurring at the cellular and tissue level in these critical vessels.

title: TENET: Triple-enhancement based graph neural network for cell-cell interaction network reconstruction from spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper proposes TENET, a novel triple-enhancement based Graph Neural Network for reconstructing cell-cell interaction (CCI) networks from spatial transcriptomics data. TENET addresses challenges of sparse connections and noise in existing methods by employing progressive enhancement mechanisms. The method demonstrates significant improvements in accuracy compared to state-of-the-art approaches.

title: FASN-mediated fatty acid biosynthesis remodels immune environment in Clonorchis sinensis infection-related intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'whole-exome sequencing', 'RNA sequencing', 'metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro co-culture system', 'mouse model']
main_goals: This study investigates the clinical impact and molecular characteristics of Clonorchis sinensis (C. sinensis) infection-related intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA). It reveals that C. sinensis infection is associated with worse prognosis and immunotherapy response due to FASN-mediated fatty acid biosynthesis, which remodels the immune microenvironment. The paper proposes that combining FASN inhibitors with immunotherapy could be a promising treatment strategy.

title: CellViT: Vision Transformers for precise cell segmentation and classification.
biological_context: Hematoxylin and eosin-stained (H&E) tissue images for cell nuclei segmentation and classification.
main_goals: This paper introduces CellViT, a novel deep learning architecture based on Vision Transformer for automated instance segmentation of cell nuclei in digitized tissue samples. It addresses challenges in nuclei segmentation in H&E-stained images by leveraging large-scale pre-training. The method achieves state-of-the-art performance on the PanNuke dataset.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblast spatial heterogeneity and EMILIN1 expression in the tumor microenvironment modulate TGF-β activity and CD8+ T-cell infiltration in breast cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'immunohistochemistry analysis', 'histological images']
main_goals: This study investigated the spatial heterogeneity of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in the breast tumor microenvironment. It explored the relationship between CAF populations, TGF-β signaling, and CD8+ T-cell infiltration, identifying EMILIN1 as a key modulator of T-cell recruitment and patient prognosis.

title: DANCE: a deep learning library and benchmark platform for single-cell analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell type annotation', 'Cell type deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Gene imputation', 'Multimodality integration', 'Single-cell spatial analysis', 'Spatial domain identification']
main_goals: DANCE is presented as a benchmark platform and library for single-cell analysis. It provides access to and evaluation of computational methods across various tasks and datasets. The platform supports deep learning architectures and tools to facilitate researcher model development.

title: Multi-slice spatial transcriptome domain analysis with SpaDo.
main_goals: The paper introduces SpaDo, a tool for multi-slice spatial domain analysis. It includes modules for domain detection, reference-based annotation, and clustering at both single-cell and spot resolutions. The tool's effectiveness is demonstrated across various datasets from different sequencing platforms.

title: Designing Oligonucleotide-Based FISH Probe Sets with PaintSHOP.
main_goals: This paper describes the use of PaintSHOP, a user-friendly, web-based platform for the design of sets of oligo-based FISH probes. PaintSHOP hosts pre-discovered probes and provides tools to add functional sequences, facilitating experiments like massively multiplexed imaging spatial transcriptomics and spatial genomics.

title: Single-Molecule Fluorescent In Situ Hybridization (smFISH) for RNA Detection in the Fungal Pathogen Candida albicans.
biological_context: Candida albicans fungal pathogen morphology switching
main_goals: This paper describes and optimizes a single-molecule fluorescent in situ hybridization (smFISH) protocol for Candida albicans. The protocol allows for the quantification of absolute mRNA counts in morphologically intact cells, enabling the study of differential gene expression in various cell types and conditions. The aim is to provide a detailed, reproducible approach for molecular characterization of this fungal pathogen.

title: Modulation of hippocampal protein expression by a brain penetrant biologic TNF-α inhibitor in the 3xTg Alzheimer's disease mice.
main_goals: This study investigated the effects of a brain-penetrant biologic TNF-α inhibitor (TfRMAb-TNFR) on protein expression in the hippocampus of 3xTg-AD mice. The researchers used spatial proteomics to identify differentially expressed proteins and understand the mechanism of action of the inhibitor, which appeared to be largely microglia-centric.

title: PhagoStat a scalable and interpretable end to end framework for efficient quantification of cell phagocytosis in neurodegenerative disease studies.
biological_context: Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) and general neurodegenerative diseases
data_modalities_used: ['time-lapse phase-contrast video microscopy', 'microglial cell phagocytosis dataset']
main_goals: This paper introduces PhagoStat, an end-to-end, scalable, and interpretable framework for quantifying cell phagocytosis in neurodegenerative disease studies using time-lapse phase-contrast microscopy. It incorporates explainable deep learning modules for improved interpretability and efficiency, and it has been validated on public benchmarks with state-of-the-art performance. The framework and an associated dataset are released as open-source to advance research in neurodegenerative diseases.

title: Integrated single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptome sequencing and bulk RNA sequencing highlights the molecular characteristics of parthanatos in gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate the molecular characteristics of parthanatos in gastric cancer by integrating single-cell, spatial transcriptome, and bulk RNA sequencing. It identified cell types in the GC microenvironment, revealed elevated parthanatos pathway scores across multiple cell types in GC tissues, and characterized the spatial distribution of parthanatos signaling. The integration of parthanatos signaling with clinical indicators allowed for the creation of novel survival prediction models.

title: Proteome-scale tissue mapping using mass spectrometry based on label-free and multiplexed workflows.
main_goals: The paper benchmarks three protein quantification methods (label-free, TMT-MS2, TMT-MS3) for proteome-scale tissue mapping. It evaluates their performance in protein coverage, quantification dynamic range, and throughput, demonstrating their utility in identifying cell-type-specific markers and hidden protein patterns in pancreatic islets.

title: A longitudinal single-cell and spatial multiomic atlas of pediatric high-grade glioma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'ATAC sequencing', 'whole-genome sequencing', 'CODEX spatial proteomics', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: This study aimed to create a longitudinal multiomic atlas of pediatric high-grade glioma (pHGG) to understand its evolution during treatment. It profiles pHGG patients using various omics techniques to capture tumor microenvironment changes and identifies key transcriptional regulators and potential therapeutic targets, highlighting differences from adult glioma.

title: Large-scale single-cell profiling of stem cells uncovers redundant regulators of shoot development and yield trait variation.
biological_context: Plant shoot stem cells, maize and arabidopsis development, yield trait variation
main_goals: This study used large-scale single-cell profiling of stem cells from maize and arabidopsis to identify conserved and novel regulators of shoot development and yield trait variation. It aimed to improve crop engineering by uncovering regulators expressed in stem cells.

title: Differentiation signals induce APOBEC3A expression via GRHL3 in squamous epithelia and squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: squamous epithelia and squamous cell carcinoma
main_goals: This study investigates the expression of APOBEC3A and APOBEC3B in healthy and malignant mucosal epithelia. It reveals that APOBEC3A expression is largely confined to terminally differentiating cells and is dependent on GRHL3, while APOBEC3B is expressed in mitotic keratinocytes. In squamous cell carcinoma, expanded GRHL3 expression leads to APOBEC3A expression in proliferating cells, suggesting a mechanism for acquired mutagenic activity in tumors.

title: A Spatial Multi-Modal Dissection of Host-Microbiome Interactions within the Colitis Tissue Microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Proteomics Analysis', 'Spatial Glycomics Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces MicroCart, a framework for simultaneous in situ probing of host features and its microbiome across multiple spatial modalities. It enables deep investigation of the intricate interplay between the host tissue and its microbiome with spatial multiomics. The framework was demonstrated by investigating alterations in gut host and microbiome components in a murine model of colitis.

title: Semi-supervised generative adversarial learning for denoising adaptive optics retinal images.
main_goals: This paper introduces denoiseGAN, a novel semi-supervised generative adversarial network for denoising adaptive optics (AO) retinal images. It aims to improve image quality by addressing noise sources like blur, motion artifacts, and electronic noise, outperforming traditional methods and enhancing downstream analysis like cell segmentation. The method also offers improved computational efficiency for potential real-time applications.

title: Emerging tools for uncovering genetic and transcriptomic heterogeneities in bacteria.
main_goals: This review highlights recently developed single-cell techniques based on advanced sequencing and microscopy technologies for studying bacterial heterogeneities. It discusses their working principles and the types of problems they are best positioned to address. These emerging tools offer complementary views of heterogeneities, enabling mechanistic dissections and interventions.

title: Integrating single-cell transcriptomics with cellular phenotypes: cell morphology, Ca<sup>2+</sup> imaging and electrophysiology.
biological_context: Brain, pancreatic islets, and retina (tissues with excitable cell-types)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-type classification', 'Linking transcriptomic data to cellular function', 'Phenotypical characterization', 'Morphological analysis', 'Calcium signaling analysis', 'Electrophysiological analysis']
main_goals: The paper reviews recent technological advancements in integrating single-cell transcriptomics with cellular phenotypes like morphology, calcium signaling, and electrophysiology. It discusses critical factors for phenotypical characterization and highlights applications in various tissues. The potential of combining functional phenotyping with spatial transcriptomics and future perspectives, including increased accessibility, is also explored.

title: Spatiotemporal metabolic responses to water deficit stress in distinct leaf cell-types of poplar.
biological_context: Poplar leaf cell-type responses to water deficit stress
main_goals: This study investigated the spatiotemporal metabolic responses of palisade and vascular cells in poplar leaves under water deficit stress using MALDI-MSI. It identified cell-type specific metabolic shifts and highlighted the value of MSI in complementing whole-tissue metabolomics for a deeper understanding of plant stress responses.

title: Targeting ESE3/EHF With Nifurtimox Inhibits CXCR2<sup>+</sup> Neutrophil Infiltration and Overcomes Pancreatic Cancer Resistance to Chemotherapy and Immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['genomic single nucleotide polymorphism sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed immunohistochemistry', 'flow cytometry', 'multiplexed cytokines assays', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation assays', 'KPC mice', 'CD45.1+ BALB/C nude mice', 'CD34+ humanized mice', 'cell line', 'tumor samples']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Immunotherapy Response Prediction', 'Chemotherapy Resistance Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of EHF in pancreatic cancer, particularly its impact on CXCR2+ neutrophil infiltration and resistance to chemotherapy and immunotherapy. It identified Nifurtimox as a potential therapeutic agent that targets EHF, leading to reduced neutrophil infiltration and improved treatment outcomes. The study also highlighted the importance of the CXCL1-CXCR2 pathway and the JAK1/STAT1 signaling in mediating these effects.

title: Machine learning based endothelial cell image analysis of patients undergoing descemet membrane endothelial keratoplasty surgery.
biological_context: Corneal endothelium of patients undergoing Descemet's membrane endothelial keratoplasty (DMEK) surgery
data_modalities_used: ['corneal endothelial cell images', 'in vivo confocal microscopy']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell location determination', 'Cell density calculation', 'Cell hexagonality calculation']
main_goals: The study developed a machine learning approach using AlexNet and R-CNN for analyzing postoperative corneal endothelial cell images. The aim was to automate the detection, segmentation, and determination of endothelial cell polygonal structures to calculate density and hexagonality rates in DMEK patients. The method aims to reliably replace manual detection.

title: Highly sensitive spatial transcriptomics using FISHnCHIPs of multiple co-expressed genes.
biological_context: mouse kidney, mouse brain, human colorectal cancer
main_goals: FISHnCHIPs is presented as a novel method for highly sensitive in situ profiling of cell types and gene expression programs. It enables simultaneous imaging of multiple co-expressed genes with increased sensitivity compared to single-gene FISH. The method demonstrates high-speed, large field-of-view profiling and application to different tissue types, including cancer biopsies.

title: BetaBuddy: An automated end-to-end computer vision pipeline for analysis of calcium fluorescence dynamics in β-cells.
main_goals: To create an automated end-to-end computer vision pipeline (BetaBuddy) for analyzing calcium fluorescence dynamics in β-cells. The pipeline uses deep learning to segment and track thousands of cells, reducing manual effort, time, and bias, while improving accuracy and enabling the isolation of specific calcium spiking patterns.

title: Comparative neuroimaging of sex differences in human and mouse brain anatomy.
biological_context: Comparative neuroanatomy of sex differences in human and mouse brains.
main_goals: To conduct the first comparative neuroimaging study of sex-specific neuroanatomy in human and mouse brains. The study aims to understand the translational value of mouse models for sex differences in the human brain and the conservation of sex differences in brain volume across mammals, incorporating gene expression data to explain cross-species congruence.

title: Mast cell activation disrupts interactions between endothelial cells and pericytes during early life allergic asthma.
biological_context: Early life allergic asthma in mice and humans
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of allergic asthma on the pulmonary microcirculation during early life. It reports that exposure to house dust mite extract disrupts endothelial cell/pericyte interactions, driven by mast cell proteases. The research also suggests intense vascular stress and remodeling in pediatric asthmatic endobronchial biopsies.

title: Spaco: A comprehensive tool for coloring spatial data at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: Spaco is introduced as a tool for spatially aware colorization of spatial transcriptomics data. It utilizes a Degree of Interlacement metric and an adaptive palette selection approach to improve visual clarity and capture spatial relationships between cell types, outperforming existing solutions in benchmarks. The tool supports color vision deficiency and is available in Python and R.

title: Visualization and quality control tools for large-scale multiplex tissue analysis in TissUUmaps3.
main_goals: This paper presents three plugins for TissUUmaps3 to enhance visualization and quality control in large-scale multiplex tissue analysis. These plugins address cell staining quality, interactive cell classification evaluation, and cell type interaction review, aiming to improve the accuracy and trustworthiness of automated tissue analysis workflows.

title: Exploring EEG-based motor imagery decoding: a dual approach using spatial features and spectro-spatial Deep Learning model IFNet.
main_goals: This study proposes a novel dual approach for decoding motor imagery (MI) from EEG signals. The first approach investigates the efficacy of Common Spatial Patterns (CSP) filter and Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) classifier. The second approach explores the potential of a spectro-spatial Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) combined with filter banks for enhanced performance.

title: Comprehensive transcriptional atlas of human adenomyosis deciphered by the integration of single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aimed to map transcriptional alterations in human adenomyosis lesions, eutopic endometrium, and the endometrial-myometrial junction using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial profiling. It identified unique cell subpopulations within lesions, characterized endothelial cell heterogeneity and angiogenic signaling, and revealed differences in cell-cell communication pathways between ectopic and eutopic endometrium. The findings are intended to guide the development of precise diagnostic and therapeutic strategies for adenomyosis.

title: High-content method for mechanosignaling studies using IsoStretcher technology and quantitative Ca<sup>2+</sup> imaging applied to Piezo1 in cardiac HL-1 cells.
biological_context: Cardiovascular system, specifically cardiac cells (murine HL-1 cell line) and their response to mechanical stimulation, with implications for heart failure.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'quantitative analysis', 'automated image registration', 'cell segmentation and analysis', 'automated classification of single-cell responses']
main_goals: To present a novel, high-content method for studying mechanosignaling in adherent cardiac cells. This method combines IsoStretcher technology for controlled mechanical stretch with quantitative Ca2+ imaging and automated analysis for unbiased population-based responses.

title: Integration Analysis of Single-Cell Multi-Omics Reveals Prostate Cancer Heterogeneity.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrates single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk ATAC-sequence to analyze prostate cancer heterogeneity. It identifies a stemness subset of club cells enriched after therapy and a reduction in CD8+CXCR6+ T cells in malignant PCa. The research also examines cellular diversity, cell-cell communication, and macrophage/neutrophil states, linking the immunosuppressive microenvironment to Tregs induced by FAP+ fibroblasts, with potential implications for diagnosis and therapy.

title: Adaptive activation Functions with Deep Kronecker Neural Network optimized with Bear Smell Search Algorithm for preventing MANET Cyber security attacks.
main_goals: This paper proposes a novel method, ADKNN-BSSA-CSMANET, for preventing MANET cyber security attacks. The method combines adaptive activation functions with a Deep Kronecker Neural Network optimized by the Bear Smell Search Algorithm. It utilizes crypto hash signatures, biometric data, and packet analysis with adaptive density-based spatial clustering and geodesic filtering.

title: Molecular, Metabolic, and Subcellular Mapping of the Tumor Immune Microenvironment via 3D Targeted and Non-Targeted Multiplex Multi-Omics Analyses.
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'glycans', 'metabolites', 'peptides', 'Stereo-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'seqIF', 'IHC proteomics', 'histology images', 'multiplexed imaging']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: Developed a pipeline integrating multiplex spatially resolved multi-omics platforms (mass spectrometry imaging, Stereo-seq, seqIF) to map the 3D tumor immune microenvironment (TIME) at single-cell resolution. This pipeline identifies crosstalk signaling networks among cell types and the ECM, and constructs 3D spatial maps revealing cell identity, activation, and energized status. The goal is to provide insights into spatial cell heterogeneity and identify novel predictive biomarkers and therapeutic targets.

title: The HIF-1α/PLOD2 axis integrates extracellular matrix organization and cell metabolism leading to aberrant musculoskeletal repair.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of HIF-1α in metabolism-linked extracellular matrix (ECM) organization and cell fate during aberrant musculoskeletal repair, specifically heterotopic ossification (HO). It identifies the HIF-1α/PLOD2/LOX axis as a key regulator of HO formation by influencing collagen organization and cell metabolism in mesenchymal progenitor cells (MPCs). The findings suggest this pathway as a potential therapeutic target for mitigating HO.

title: STCGRU: A hybrid model based on CNN and BiGRU for mild cognitive impairment diagnosis.
main_goals: Propose a hybrid deep learning model (STCGRU) based on CNN and BiGRU for early diagnosis of Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) using EEG data. The model extracts spatial and temporal features from raw EEG to achieve accurate diagnosis.

title: Chronic SIV-Induced neuroinflammation disrupts CCR7+ CD4+ T cell immunosurveillance in the rhesus macaque brain.
biological_context: Rhesus macaque brain during chronic SIV infection
main_goals: To investigate the role of CCR7+ CD4+ T cells in brain immune homeostasis and their disruption during chronic SIV infection. The study aimed to characterize these cells using multi-omics approaches and to understand the consequences of their depletion on neuroinflammation.

title: High-field downfield MR spectroscopic imaging in the human brain.
biological_context: Human brain metabolism and neuropathological disorders
data_modalities_used: ['Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy', 'MR spectroscopic imaging']
main_goals: To investigate the feasibility of downfield MR spectroscopic imaging (DF-MRSI) in the human brain at 7T, implementing and testing a 7T DF-MRSI pulse sequence. The study aimed to spatially map exchangeable protons in the human brain at high resolution and with near whole-brain coverage in acceptable scan times.

title: Prediction of potential distributions of Morina kokonorica and Morina chinensis in China.
biological_context: Distribution and potential suitable habitats of Morina kokonorica and Morina chinensis in China.
main_goals: To simulate past, current, and future potentially suitable habitats of Morina kokonorica and Morina chinensis using the MaxEnt model. The study aims to understand the response patterns of these species to environmental change and promote their protection.

title: Determinants and their spatial heterogeneity of carbon emissions in resource-based cities, China.
main_goals: This study investigates the determinants of carbon emissions and their spatial pattern in 113 resource-based cities in China using exploratory spatial data analysis and Geographical Weighted Regression. It aims to understand the contribution of these cities to national carbon emissions and identify factors influencing them.

title: From local to global gene co-expression estimation using single-cell RNA-seq data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Co-expression Estimation', 'Bifurcating point detection in cell trajectory', 'Spatial transcriptomics structure visualization']
main_goals: This paper introduces a novel univariate dependence measure called averaged Local Density Gap (aLDG) for estimating gene co-expression at the single-cell level. It also proposes a minibatch variant of aLDG that can highlight meaningful local structure changes. Both methods are shown to detect nonlinear and nonmonotone relationships and outperform existing measures in simulations and real data analysis.

title: Spatial Single Cell Profiling Using Imaging Mass Cytometry: Inflammatory Versus Penetrating Crohn's Disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Dimensionality Reduction', 'Cell Type Clustering', 'Cell Frequency Analysis', 'Marker Distribution Analysis', 'Spatial Neighbourhood Analysis']
main_goals: This study presents the first highly multiplexed single-cell analysis of the immune cell compartment of Crohn's disease fistulas and their spatial context. It links immune cell dynamics, particularly MMP9+ neutrophils, to extracellular matrix remodelling in CD fistulas, offering insights into the complex network of cellular interactions and potential therapeutic targets for CD complications.

title: Mapping the metabolic responses to oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy with in vivo spatiotemporal metabolomics.
biological_context: Lung metastases caused by colorectal cancer (CRC) and response to oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'in vivo lung perfusion (IVLP)', 'solid-phase microextraction (SPME) microprobes', 'global metabolite profiling']
main_goals: This study explores the potential of spatial metabolomics for evaluating metabolic phenotypes and therapy outcomes during the local delivery of oxaliplatin to the lung. It identifies toxic doses and investigates lung injury mechanisms by analyzing metabolic alterations. The findings suggest spatial pharmacometabolomics is a promising tool for understanding chemotherapy responses.

title: High-Resolution Spatial Transcriptomic Atlas of Mouse Soleus Muscle: Unveiling Single Cell and Subcellular Heterogeneity in Health and Denervation.
biological_context: Mouse soleus muscle in healthy and denervated states
main_goals: To leverage Seq-Scope technology for high-resolution spatial transcriptomics of mouse soleus muscle in health and denervation. The study aims to reveal single-cell and subcellular heterogeneity, including details of muscle fibers, other cell types, and specific subcellular structures like neuromuscular junctions and hybrid muscle fibers. The findings aim to enhance understanding of muscle cell transcriptome diversity and its response to denervation, providing insights for aging and disease-related muscle decline.

title: NAD <sup>+</sup> activates renal metabolism and protects from chronic kidney disease in a model of Alport syndrome.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single nuclei RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'mouse model', 'biochemical assays', 'imaging techniques']
main_goals: To investigate the mechanism by which NAD+ supplementation protects from chronic kidney disease (CKD) in a mouse model of Alport syndrome. The study aims to identify the specific cell types involved and the metabolic pathways affected. It also seeks to report sex differences at the transcriptional level in this model.

title: General Capillary Endothelial Cells Undergo Reprogramming into Arterial Endothelial Cells in Pulmonary Hypertension through HIF-2α/Notch4 Pathway.
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms underlying pulmonary hypertension (PH), specifically the loss of capillary endothelial cells and formation of obliterative vascular lesions. It demonstrates that lung capillary endothelial cells reprogram into arterial endothelial cells through the HIF-2α/Notch4 pathway during PH development. The findings suggest targeting this transition as a novel therapeutic approach for PAH.

title: Can three-dimensional nitrate structure be reconstructed from surface information with artificial intelligence? - A proof-of-concept study.
biological_context: Upper ocean pelagic ecosystem dynamics and nitrate concentration
data_modalities_used: ['wind vectors', 'wind stress', 'sea surface temperature', 'sea surface chlorophyll-a', 'solar radiation', 'precipitation']
main_goals: The study develops and tests two AI networks (U-net and Earthformer) to reconstruct the 3D structure of nitrate concentration in the Indian Ocean using surface data. It compares their performance and analyzes feature importance to understand dynamic controls on nitrate. The AI-based reconstruction approach is presented as a novel way to study marine environments.

title: Automatic recognition of white blood cell images with memory efficient superpixel metric GNN: SMGNN.
biological_context: White blood cell classification in peripheral blood
main_goals: This paper presents a novel, memory-efficient system for automatic recognition of white blood cells. It introduces a superpixel-based graph neural network (SMGNN) that achieves state-of-the-art segmentation performance with significantly fewer parameters than existing methods. The system demonstrates accuracy and efficiency for hematological laboratories.

title: Precision unveiled: Synergistic genomic landscapes in breast cancer-Integrating single-cell analysis and decoding drug toxicity for elite prognostication and tailored therapeutics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to develop a prognostic staging index for breast cancer patients by integrating T-cell related genes (TRG) and glutamine metabolism (GM). The developed TRG_GM classifier stratifies patients into different groups, illuminating distinct immunological attributes, genetic profiles, and drug responses, thus providing avenues for tailored therapeutic interventions.

title: Potential Role of Lymphocyte CD44 in Determining Treatment Selection Between Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy and Surgery for Early-Stage Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
main_goals: To identify molecular biomarkers using spatial proteomics to optimize treatment selection between stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT) and surgery for early-stage non-small cell lung cancer (ES-NSCLC). The study investigates the role of lymphocyte CD44 expression in predicting treatment efficacy and guiding patient selection.

title: Cellular senescence is associated with the spatial evolution toward a higher metastatic phenotype in colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study explores the dynamic process of colorectal cancer progression, focusing on the evolution toward a more metastatic phenotype. It highlights the spatial correlation of this evolution with tumor cell senescence, identifying two distinct types of senescent cells. The findings suggest that type II senescent cells are associated with local invasion and lymph node metastasis, potentially impacting patient prognosis.

title: Deep learning-based multi-model prediction for disease-free survival status of patients with clear cell renal cell carcinoma after surgery: a multicenter cohort study.
main_goals: The main goal of this study is to develop a multimodel prediction signature (MMPS) for disease-free survival of ccRCC patients after surgery by combining deep learning models based on whole slide images, cell segmentation, and computed tomography images with tumor stage/grade system. The study also aims to verify the prognostic performance of the developed model in independent validation cohorts and compare its performance with single-modality prediction models and current clinical prognostic factors.

title: SpatialView: an interactive web application for visualization of multiple samples in spatial transcriptomics experiments.
main_goals: The paper introduces SpatialView, an open-source web browser-based interactive application for visualizing data and results from multiple 10× Genomics Visium ST experiments. It aims to provide an interactive suite of tools for visualizing ST data and results to overcome the limitations of current ST experiments.

title: Spatial-temporal characteristics and influencing factors of carbon emission in Chengdu-Chongqing area: an urban transportation perspective.
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial-temporal characteristics of carbon emissions in the Chengdu-Chongqing area and the factors affecting them, using ESDA and a spatial regression model combined with the STIRPAT model. It identifies key factors influencing carbon emissions from a transportation perspective.

title: Characterization of Vascular Niche in Systemic Sclerosis by Spatial Proteomics.
main_goals: The main goal of this study was to characterize cellular alterations of the vascular niches of patients with Systemic sclerosis (SSc) by applying spatial proteomic approaches. The study identified a novel population of CD34+;αSMA+;CD31+ VECs increased in SSc and associated with clinical progression of fibrosis.

title: A novel variable neighborhood search approach for cell clustering for spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper introduces a new approach to cell clustering using the Variable Neighborhood Search (VNS) metaheuristic for spatial transcriptomics data. The method clusters cells based on both gene expression and spatial coordinates, extending beyond conventional cell-type clustering to spatial domain clustering. The validation showed superior performance when compared to existing techniques.

title: ScLinear predicts protein abundance at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The paper introduces scLinear, a linear regression-based approach for predicting single-cell protein abundance based on RNA expression. It claims scLinear is more efficient than existing methods without sacrificing accuracy and generalizes well to unseen data. The paper also emphasizes the importance of simpler approaches over complex algorithms.

title: Innovative super-resolution in spatial transcriptomics: a transformer model exploiting histology images and spatial gene expression.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Deconvolution', 'Integration with other omics', 'Single-cell resolution enhancement']
main_goals: The paper introduces TransformerST, a novel, unsupervised Transformer-based model for super-resolution in spatial transcriptomics. It elevates Visium data to single-cell granularity and is adaptable across platforms. The model leverages image-gene co-representation and spatial correlations to reveal tissue subtleties at the single-cell scale.

title: Generating single-cell gene expression profiles for high-resolution spatial transcriptomics based on cell boundary images.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'cell nuclei staining images', 'cell membrane staining images', 'cell wall staining images']
main_goals: The paper introduces an updated version of STCellbin, a software for generating single-cell spatial gene expression profiles from Stereo-seq data. The new version uses cell boundary information from cell membrane/wall staining images to improve cell segmentation and generate more reliable single-cell spatial gene expression profiles. The paper demonstrates that STCellbin outperforms other methods on mouse liver and Arabidopsis seed datasets.

title: SAW: an efficient and accurate data analysis workflow for Stereo-seq spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces Stereo-seq Analysis Workflow (SAW), a high-performance and accurate spatial transcriptomics data analysis workflow for Stereo-seq technology. SAW includes mRNA spatial position reconstruction, genome alignment, gene expression matrix generation, and clustering. It is demonstrated to be faster than an unoptimized workflow.

title: HeLa cell segmentation using digital image processing.
main_goals: This article presents the development of an algorithm utilizing digital image processing to segment the nucleus and shape of HeLa cells from SBF-SEM images. The research aims to segment the cell shape in the image center and accurately identify the nucleus. The developed algorithm is compared to another algorithm using segmentation similarity metrics.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals altered lipid metabolism and inflammation-related gene expression of sebaceous glands in psoriasis and atopic dermatitis.
main_goals: The study investigates the spatial transcriptome of sebaceous glands in psoriasis and atopic dermatitis patients across lesional and non-lesional human skin samples to understand their role in disease development. The study identifies genes related to lipid metabolism and inflammation that are differentially expressed in sebaceous glands in these diseases. The results suggest that sebaceous glands actively and differentially modulate inflammation in a disease-specific manner.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of pemphigus vulgaris and bullous pemphigoid: Insights into pathogenesis and therapy on bullous formation.
main_goals: The study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate the pathogenesis and therapy of bullous formation in pemphigus vulgaris and bullous pemphigoid.

title: Deliverables from Metabolomics in Kidney Disease: Adenine, New Insights, and Implication for Clinical Decision-Making.
main_goals: This review summarizes recent progress in metabolomics in kidney disease, focusing on spatial metabolomics, to enhance understanding of CKD progression, early disease detection, and targeted interventions. It highlights the identification of adenine as a key marker of kidney fibrosis in diabetic kidney disease using bulk and spatial metabolomics.

title: Domain generalization enables general cancer cell annotation in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces Cancer-Finder, a domain generalization-based deep-learning algorithm for identifying malignant cells in single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data. It aims to improve the accuracy and generalization of malignant cell annotation, enabling more consistent and rapid inference from pan-cancer data. The algorithm is tested on clear cell renal cell carcinoma spatial transcriptomic samples to identify malignant spots and a gene signature associated with prognosis.

title: Perturbed liver gene zonation in a mouse model of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis.
main_goals: This study investigates the perturbation of liver gene zonation in a mouse NASH model by combining spatial transcriptomics, bulk RNAseq, and in situ hybridization. It demonstrates the alteration of Wnt signaling in a mouse NASH model, leading to perturbed liver zonation.

title: Multi-omic profiling of follicular lymphoma reveals changes in tissue architecture and enhanced stromal remodeling in high-risk patients.
main_goals: The study examines cell-intrinsic and -extrinsic factors governing progression and therapeutic outcomes in FL patients using a multi-modal strategy. It aims to identify tumor-specific features and microenvironmental patterns enriched in individuals who experience early relapse. The study identifies stromal desmoplasia and changes to the follicular growth pattern present before first progression and first relapse.

title: The cell-type-specific spatial organization of the anterior thalamic nuclei of the mouse brain.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization']
main_goals: The study aims to identify cell-type composition and spatial organization of the anterior thalamic nuclei (ATN) in the mouse brain. It combines single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization to uncover marker genes, molecular pathways, and putative functions of ATN cell types. The study also demonstrates spatial variation and covarying protein products in the ATN.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals prognosis-associated cellular heterogeneity in the papillary thyroid carcinoma microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Gene Ontology enrichment analysis']
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to characterize the spatial location and RNA profiles of PTC-associated cells within tissue sections. The study identifies specific cell types and their spatial distribution, revealing cellular heterogeneity associated with prognosis. Key ligand-receptor interactions involved in PTC cell transition are discovered, and their correlation with reduced relapse-free survival is highlighted.

title: Adjustment of scRNA-seq data to improve cell-type decomposition of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The main goal is to develop an instance-based transfer learning framework to adjust scRNA-seq data by ST data to correctly match cell-type-specific gene expression, thereby improving cell-type decomposition. The study evaluates the effect of raw and adjusted scRNA-seq data on cell-type decomposition by eight leading decomposition methods. The results demonstrate that data adjustment can effectively reduce distribution difference and improve decomposition.

title: JAK/STAT3 represents a therapeutic target for colorectal cancer patients with stromal-rich tumors.
main_goals: This study investigates the effectiveness of inhibiting JAK/STAT3 in diverse CRC models and establishes in which contexts high pathway expression is prognostic. Spatial transcriptomics was used to unravel the underlying biology of aberrant signaling. The study concludes that inhibition of JAK/STAT3 represents a promising therapeutic strategy for patients with stromal-rich CRC tumors.

title: Segmentation, feature extraction and classification of leukocytes leveraging neural networks, a comparative study.
main_goals: The study compares traditional machine learning (K-means clustering) and deep learning (U-Net, U-Net + ResNet18, and U-Net + ResNet34) for cell segmentation. It also compares deep learning approaches (AlexNet, VGG16, and ResNet18) for feature extraction and cell classification of leukocytes. The goal is to evaluate the performance of different machine learning models in leukocyte classification.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of tumour-immune cell interactions in melanoma arising from congenital melanocytic nevus.
biological_context: Melanoma arising from congenital melanocytic nevus (CMN)
main_goals: The study aimed to determine the intratumoral immune landscape of tumor-infiltrating immune cells (TIICs) and tumor cells during invasion and metastasis in melanoma originating from congenital melanocytic nevus (CMN) using spatial transcriptomics. It investigated differential gene expression in melanoma cells and TIICs with increasing invasion depth and compared expression profiles in primary and metastatic lesions.

title: A spatial map of hepatic mitochondria uncovers functional heterogeneity shaped by nutrient-sensing signaling.
main_goals: The study investigates mitochondrial heterogeneity in the liver in the context of liver zonation. It aims to understand how mitochondria sense and integrate nutrient signals to maintain homeostasis by combining intravital microscopy, spatial proteomics, and functional assessment.

title: Harnessing spatial transcriptomics for advancing plant regeneration research.
main_goals: The study utilized spatial transcriptomics to investigate the molecular characteristics of cells during shoot regeneration in tomato callus. It enhances our knowledge of shoot regeneration and demonstrates the potential of spatial transcriptomics in plant biology.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing demonstrates an autosomal dominant Alzheimer's disease profile and possible mechanisms of disease protection.
main_goals: To compare single-nucleus transcriptomes among PSEN1-E280A ADAD carriers, sporadic AD, and controls to identify downstream pathways that distinguish these AD forms in specific cell types. The study also aims to explore possible explanations for protection from AD pathology based on a PSEN1-E280A case with spared neurofibrillary pathology and a homozygous APOE3-Christchurch variant.

title: Principled and interpretable alignability testing and integration of single-cell data.
main_goals: The paper introduces a spectral manifold alignment and inference (SMAI) framework for single-cell data integration. SMAI provides a statistical test to assess the alignability between datasets and aims for structure-preserving integration. The method is validated on real and simulated datasets, demonstrating improved performance and interpretability compared to existing methods.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity in clear cell renal cell carcinoma revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper introduces scMet, a tool to convert bulk RNA-seq data into scRNA-seq data for downstream analysis. It applies this method to clear cell renal cell carcinoma data, integrating single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to reveal metabolic heterogeneity within the tumor microenvironment. The method aims to facilitate the transformation of RNA sequencing datasets from TCGA into scRNA sequencing data.

title: Cellular neighborhood analysis in spatial omics reveals new tissue domains and cell subtypes.
main_goals: The paper analyzes cellular neighborhoods in spatial omics data to reveal new tissue domains and cell subtypes.

title: Transformative Deep Neural Network Approaches in Kidney Ultrasound Segmentation: Empirical Validation with an Annotated Dataset.
main_goals: This study aims to build a novel, well-annotated dataset containing 44,880 US images. In addition, it proposes a novel training scheme that utilizes the encoder and decoder parts of a state-of-the-art segmentation algorithm. The modified encoder-decoder architecture improves pyramid-shaped hole pooling, cascaded multiple-hole convolutions, and batch normalization.

title: A survey on the knowledge and attitudes of pharmacists towards the application of antimicrobial therapeutic drug monitoring and its challenges in Qatar.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify the knowledge gaps, attitudes, and perceived barriers of pharmacists in Qatar towards the application of antimicrobial therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM). The survey was conducted among pharmacists in Hamad Medical Corporation (HMC) hospitals to assess their knowledge, attitudes, and perceived barriers regarding antimicrobial TDM. The results showed a modest level of knowledge and positive attitudes towards TDM among the pharmacists.

title: The Planetary Child Health & Enterics Observatory (Plan-EO): A protocol for an interdisciplinary research initiative and web-based dashboard for mapping enteric infectious diseases and their risk factors and interventions in LMICs.
main_goals: The Plan-EO initiative aims to provide an evidence base for geographically targeting enteropathogen-specific child health interventions. It will produce, curate, and disseminate spatial data products related to enteric pathogen distribution and their environmental and sociodemographic determinants. The project will address knowledge gaps by making and disseminating rigorously obtained, generalizable disease burden estimates.

title: Graph Fourier transform for spatial omics representation and analyses of complex organs.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Type Annotation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Imputation', 'Spatial Variable Gene Prediction']
main_goals: Introduces SpaGFT, a novel Spatial Graph Fourier Transform method for spatial omics data analysis. It provides a unique analytical feature representation and elucidates molecular signatures linked to critical biological processes. The method is shown to outperform existing tools in spatially variable gene prediction and gene expression imputation.

title: MarShie: a clearing protocol for 3D analysis of single cells throughout the bone marrow at subcellular resolution.
main_goals: This paper presents a method called MarShie for 3D analysis of single cells throughout the bone marrow at subcellular resolution. The method stabilizes the marrow and provides subcellular resolution of fluorescent signals throughout the murine femur. It combines a pre-processing algorithm for stripe artifact removal with a machine-learning approach for reliable cell segmentation.

title: scGIST: gene panel design for spatial transcriptomics with prioritized gene sets.
main_goals: The paper proposes scGIST, a constrained feature selection tool for designing spatial transcriptomics panels. It prioritizes user-specified genes without sacrificing cell type detection accuracy. The tool is presented as a valuable addition to the sc-ST algorithmic toolbox, demonstrated with use cases.

title: Applications of single‑cell omics and spatial transcriptomics technologies in gastric cancer (Review).
main_goals: The review provides an overview of single-cell omics and spatial transcriptomics technologies and their applications in gastric cancer research. It discusses multiple single-cell omics and spatial transcriptomics methods and summarizes key findings from previous research on these methods used in gastric cancer.

title: Spatial top-down proteomics for the functional characterization of human kidney.
main_goals: The paper developed an integrated workflow for characterizing proteoforms from human tissue in a spatially resolved manner by coupling laser capture microdissection, nanoliter-scale sample preparation, and mass spectrometry imaging. The workflow was used to identify and spatially characterize proteoforms in human kidney sections. They identified differentially abundant proteoforms between glomeruli and convoluted tubules.

title: Optimized FFNN with multichannel CSP-ICA framework of EEG signal for BCI.
main_goals: The paper proposes an optimized FFNN with a multichannel CSP-ICA framework for EEG signal classification in BCI applications. The framework optimizes signal processing for enhanced EEG signal classification. The proposed models achieve higher classification accuracy compared to existing models.

title: Region-specific cellular and molecular basis of liver regeneration after acute pericentral injury.
biological_context: Liver regeneration after acute pericentral injury
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying liver regeneration after acute pericentral injury. It investigates the roles of different hepatocyte populations, signaling pathways, and immune cells in this process. The findings provide insights into the spatiotemporal dynamics of pericentral regeneration and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Advancing rare cancer research by MALDI mass spectrometry imaging: Applications, challenges, and future perspectives in sarcoma.
main_goals: This review explores the applicability of MALDI imaging in sarcoma research, summarizes MALDI imaging studies in sarcoma, and addresses specific challenges encountered when employing MALDI imaging for sarcomas. It aims to spark collaboration between MALDI imaging researchers and clinical colleagues to deploy the unique capabilities of MALDI imaging in the context of sarcoma.

title: A simulated 'sandbox' for exploring the modifiable areal unit problem in aggregation and disaggregation.
main_goals: The paper presents a spatial testbed of simulated boundary data based on census-based areal units surrounding Guadalajara, Mexico. The aim is to facilitate interrogating the effects of spatial coarseness and zonal configurations on applications such as model training, model prediction, disaggregation, and aggregation processes. They provide pre-processed simulated sets of areal units, meta- and summary data, and a code notebook to alter and/or reproduce these data.

title: CD200<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts form a pro-resolving mesenchymal network in arthritis.
main_goals: The study aims to understand fibroblast phenotype changes during the resolution of inflammation in arthritis. It identifies a phenotypic switch from pro-inflammatory to pro-resolving fibroblasts using positron emission tomography and single-cell RNA sequencing. The study shows CD200+DKK3+ fibroblasts promote resolution of arthritis through CD200-CD200R1 signaling.

title: Digital spatial profiling of segmental outflow regions in trabecular meshwork reveals a role for ADAM15.
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to identify genes associated with high or low outflow regions in the trabecular meshwork. The study identified differentially expressed genes, highlighting ECM/cell adhesion, signal transduction, and transcription as key biological categories. It also validated the differential expression of ADAM15 in high outflow regions.

title: A hybrid thyroid tumor type classification system using feature fusion, multilayer perceptron and bonobo optimization.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel hybrid classification system to identify and classify four different types of thyroid tumors. It uses feature fusion from CapsuleNet and EfficientNetB2, a Multilayer Perceptron Classifier, and Bonobo optimizer to improve classification performance.
data_links_mentioned: ['Digital Database of Thyroid Ultrasound Images through Kaggle repository']

title: Microarray Gene Expression Analysis of Lesional Skin in Canine Pemphigus Foliaceus.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the molecular mechanisms and altered biological pathways in the skin lesions of canine PF patients using RNA microarray analysis.

title: Software Tools for 2D Cell Segmentation.
main_goals: The paper compares the performance of eight cell segmentation tools using three publicly available datasets and common segmentation metrics to evaluate their generality and find the best-performing tool.

title: Application of clustering strategy for automatic segmentation of tissue regions in mass spectrometry imaging.
biological_context: Mouse urinary bladder, human colorectal cancer
main_goals: The paper proposes a computational strategy for automatic tissue segmentation in mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data. It combines t-distributed stochastic neighbor embedding (t-SNE) and hierarchical clustering (HC) and demonstrates its superiority over other algorithms. The study also highlights the importance of the Spatial Aggregation Index (SAI) for evaluating tissue segmentation performance.

title: Single-cell colocalization analysis using a deep generative model.
biological_context: Mouse brain tissues, human squamous cell carcinoma samples, and human lung tissues infected with SARS-CoV-2
main_goals: The paper introduces DeepCOLOR, a computational framework based on a deep generative model for recovering intercellular colocalization networks with single-cell resolution by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomes. It aims to identify cell-cell interaction candidates between colocalized single cells and segregated cell populations. The method shows superior colocalized population detection accuracy compared to existing methods.

title: HVS-Unsup: Unsupervised cervical cell instance segmentation method based on human visual simulation.
main_goals: The paper proposes an unsupervised cervical cell instance segmentation method based on human visual simulation, named HVS-Unsup. It utilizes prior knowledge to generate pseudo labels, designs a Nucleus Enhanced Module (NEM) and a Mask-Assisted Segmentation module (MAS) to address cell overlapping, adhesion, and visually indistinguishable cases. It also introduces a Category-Wise droploss (CW-droploss) to reduce cell omissions in lower-contrast images and employs an iterative self-training strategy to rectify mislabeled instances.

title: Expressway traffic flow prediction based on MF-TAN and STSA.
main_goals: The paper proposes a expressway traffic flow prediction model based on multi-feature spatial-temporal adaptive periodic fused graph convolutional network (MFSTAPFGCN). It aims to improve traffic flow prediction by considering correlation and periodicity among traffic state data and by dynamically modeling the correlation of traffic flow in different time periods. The model captures daily cycle similarity and potential spatial-temporal dependence of traffic flow data.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging, and disease.
biological_context: Mouse brain in health, aging, and Parkinson's disease
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the expression features of dopaminergic neurons and other cell types within their spatial context in healthy, aging, and Parkinson's disease mouse brains. They integrate gene enrichment and genome-wide association study data to identify causative genes for disease investigation. The datasets generated represent a large public resource for the investigation of spatial gene expression in brain cells.

title: BiGATAE: a bipartite graph attention auto-encoder enhancing spatial domain identification from single-slice to multi-slices.
main_goals: The paper introduces BiGATAE, a bipartite graph attention auto-encoder, to enhance spatial transcriptomics data for multi-slice spatial domain identification. It aims to improve the performance of existing single-slice clustering methods by integrating gene expression information from adjacent tissue slices. The results demonstrate that BiGATAE facilitates information transfer across multiple slices and broadens the applicability of pre-existing methods.

title: Immune mapping of human tuberculosis and sarcoidosis lung granulomas.
main_goals: The study compares the immunological microenvironments of granulomas from TB and sarcoidosis patients using in situ sequencing transcriptomic analysis and multiplexed immunolabeling of tissue sections. It identifies the formation of tertiary immune structures as a common feature in granulomas from TB patients but not in sarcoidosis samples.

title: Mapping spatial heterogeneity in gastric cancer microenvironment.
main_goals: This review concentrates on the spatial heterogeneity within the primary lesions and between the primary and metastatic lesions of gastric cancer through the tumor microenvironment heterogeneity including tertiary lymphoid structures. It also outlines the immune phenotype based on spatial distribution and recapitulates the clinical treatment in mediating spatial heterogeneity in gastric cancer.

title: Mass spectrometry imaging-based metabolomics highlights spatial metabolic alterations in three types of liver injuries.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize metabolic profiles and spatial signatures in different liver injuries induced by ethanol, acetaminophen, and thioacetamide in zebrafish using mass spectrometry imaging. It identifies metabolic reprogramming in liver injury regions and highlights potential biomarkers for liver injuries. The study underscores spatial metabolomics as a tool to elucidate pathogenic mechanisms.

title: Spatial and temporal characteristics, spatial clustering and governance strategies for regional development of social enterprises in China.
main_goals: This study analyzes the spatio-temporal pattern, clustering characteristics and impact mechanism of the development of social enterprises in provincial administrative regions in China using exploratory spatial data analysis methods. The research aims to classify provinces and cities based on the TOE framework and identify core driving factors that affect the spatial differentiation of social enterprise development.

title: In situ single-cell profiling sheds light on IFI27 localisation during SARS-CoV-2 infection.
main_goals: The study utilizes single-cell resolved spatial transcriptomics to delineate immune responses during SARS-CoV-2 infection. It identifies M1 macrophages with elevated expression of IFI27 in areas of infection.

title: [Application advances of mass spectrometry imaging technology in environmental pollutants analysis and their toxicity research].
main_goals: This review provides an overview of the principles, characteristics, mass analyzers, and workflows of different MSI techniques and introduces their latest application advances in the analysis of environmental pollutants and their toxic effects. The goal is to highlight the use of MSI technologies in characterizing the spatial distribution of pollutants, assessing their toxic effects, and identifying exposure biomarkers.

title: [Application of multiomics mass spectrometry in the research of chemical exposome].
main_goals: This review summarizes existing exposome-measurement methods, focusing on mass spectrometry (MS)-based methods and multiomics approaches including proteomics, metabolomics, epigenomics, and spatial omics. It highlights the major challenges in achieving chemical exposome measurements.

title: A Review of the Application of Spatial Transcriptomics in Neuroscience.
main_goals: The review investigates common spatial transcriptomic data analysis approaches and data resources, introduces the applications of these approaches in Neuroscience, summarizes the integration of spatial transcriptomics with other technologies in Neuroscience, and discusses the challenges and future research directions of spatial transcriptomics in Neuroscience.

title: Single-cell and spatial multi-omics highlight effects of anti-integrin therapy across cellular compartments in ulcerative colitis.
main_goals: The main goal of this paper is to identify the inflammatory cells that contribute to ulcerative colitis and are affected by Vedolizumab (VDZ). This is achieved through single-cell transcriptomic and proteomic analyses of peripheral blood and colonic biopsies, along with spatial multi-omics of formalin-fixed biopsies. The study aims to reveal the broader effects of VDZ on different cell subsets beyond lymphocyte trafficking.

title: EAGS: efficient and adaptive Gaussian smoothing applied to high-resolved spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper proposes an efficient and adaptive Gaussian smoothing (EAGS) imputation method for high-resolved spatial transcriptomics. It aims to improve the signal-to-noise ratio and data quality by using spatial and expression information to create adaptive weights for smoothing. The method is assessed using simulated and high-resolved ST datasets of mouse brain and olfactory bulb, and compared with other competitive methods.

title: Deciphering spatial domains from spatially resolved transcriptomics with Siamese graph autoencoder.
main_goals: The paper proposes SGAE, a novel framework for spatial domain identification incorporating the Siamese graph autoencoder. SGAE mitigates information correlation at both sample and feature levels, improving representation discrimination. The method is applied to spatial transcriptomics data by constructing a graph based on both gene expression and spatial information, demonstrating enhanced accuracy in identifying 3D Drosophila embryonic structure.

title: Recent advances in spatially variable gene detection in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This article provides a selective review of methods for spatially variable gene (SVG) detection and their practical implementations, offering valuable insights into the current literature in this field.

title: vSPACE: Exploring Virtual Spatial Representation of Articular Chondrocytes at the Single-Cell Level.
main_goals: The paper introduces vSPACE, a new method for virtually representing single-cell RNA sequencing data in 2D space, emulating spatial transcriptomics. This allows for the visualization of gene expression patterns in human articular cartilage, revealing zonal distribution patterns. The discovered patterns are consistent across donors despite clinical variable differences.

title: Spatially Exploring RNA Biology in Archival Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded Tissues.
biological_context: Human tumor FFPE tissues, human lymphomas
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: The paper introduces Patho-DBiT, a spatial transcriptomics method tailored for probing diverse RNA species in clinically archived FFPE samples. It permits spatial co-profiling of gene expression and RNA processing, unveiling region-specific splicing isoforms, and high-sensitivity transcriptomic mapping of clinical tumor FFPE tissues. Patho-DBiT also maps microRNA-mRNA regulatory networks and RNA splicing dynamics, decoding their roles in spatial tumorigenesis trajectory.

title: Measurement of adhesion and traction of cells at high yield (MATCHY) reveals an energetic ratchet driving nephron condensation.
main_goals: The paper presents MATCHY (multiplexed adhesion and traction of cells at high yield), a new method that advances the multiplexing and throughput capabilities of existing traction force and cell-cell adhesion assays. It uses microfabrication and an automated computation scheme with machine learning-driven cell segmentation.
