The method is validated on canine kidney epithelial cells and used to create a biophysical atlas of primary cells dissociated from the mouse embryonic kidney.

title: Spatiotemporal profiling defines persistence and resistance dynamics during targeted treatment of melanoma.
main_goals: The study aims to define state change and lineage selection during melanoma treatment with spatiotemporal resolution, elucidating how choice and timing of therapeutic agents will impact the ability to eradicate resistant clones. They capture clonal lineage evolution during treatment using spatial transcriptomics in patient derived xenograft models. Deep learning analysis of histopathological slides helps identify phenotypically-distinct populations using imaging data alone.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Identified Fatty Acid-binding Proteins Controlling Endothelial Glycolytic and Arterial Programming in Pulmonary Hypertension.
main_goals: This study aimed to understand the cellular and molecular mechanisms of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomic analysis. The study identified that FABP4 and FABP5 are highly induced in endothelial cells of PAH models and patients, contributing to enhanced ECs glycolysis and distal arterial programming, leading to vascular remodeling. Genetic deletion of Fabp4/5 attenuated pulmonary vascular remodeling and prevented right heart failure.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics: Bridging current technologies with long-read sequencing.
main_goals: This review discusses the combination of single-cell, spatial transcriptomics, and long-read sequencing technologies for profiling the genome and transcriptome. It highlights achievements and remaining challenges and opportunities in this area.

title: Common mitochondrial deletions in RNA-Seq: evaluation of bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomic datasets.
main_goals: The paper applies the Splice-Break2 pipeline for quantifying mtDNA deletions in RNA-Seq data. It describes methodological considerations for evaluating common deletions in bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics datasets. It also evaluates the abundance of deletions in different brain regions.

title: Comprehensive phenotypic and genomic characterization of venous malformations.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a possible association between genetic mutations and clinicopathological features in venous malformations. They performed a retrospective clinical, pathological, and genetic study of 114 patients with VMs. Significant genotype-phenotype correlations in clinical and pathological features were observed among the VM genotypes, indicating gene-specific effects.

title: SpatialDDLS: an R package to deconvolute spatial transcriptomics data using neural networks.
main_goals: The paper introduces SpatialDDLS, a fast neural network-based algorithm for cell type deconvolution of spatial transcriptomics data. SpatialDDLS leverages single-cell RNA sequencing data to simulate mixed transcriptional profiles to train a neural network. The method is shown to be an accurate and fast alternative to other state-of-the-art spatial deconvolution methods.

title: Multiscale biochemical mapping of the brain through deep-learning-enhanced high-throughput mass spectrometry.
main_goals: The paper introduces MEISTER, an integrative experimental and computational mass spectrometry framework for brain-wide and single-cell biochemical mapping. It integrates deep-learning-based reconstruction to accelerate high-mass-resolving MS, multimodal registration creating 3D molecular distributions, and a data integration method fitting cell-specific mass spectra to 3D datasets. The workflow aims to establish a blueprint for future development of multiscale technologies for biochemical characterization of the brain.

title: Proteomic and transcriptomic profiling of brainstem, cerebellum and olfactory tissues in early- and late-phase COVID-19.
biological_context: Brainstem, cerebellum and olfactory tissues in early- and late-phase COVID-19
main_goals: The study profiled single-nucleus transcriptomes and proteomes of brainstem tissue from deceased individuals at various stages of COVID-19 to understand the mechanisms contributing to neurological symptoms. It identified an inflammatory type I interferon response in acute COVID-19 and localized patterns of reaction to severe systemic inflammation. The results suggest that local immune reactions, even without virus persistence, may cause functional disturbances contributing to neurological complications of COVID-19.

title: AHRR and SFRP2 in primary versus recurrent high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma and their prognostic implication.
main_goals: The aim of this study was to analyse transcriptomic differences between primary and recurrent high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSOC) to identify prognostic biomarkers. They identified AHRR and SFRP2 as potential biomarkers in HGSOC.

title: Multimodal mass spectrometry imaging identifies cell-type-specific metabolic and lipidomic variation in the mammalian liver.
main_goals: The study aims to capture the transient lipidome/metabolome from cells in a native liver tissue environment using water gas cluster ion beam secondary ion mass spectrometry imaging (GCIB-SIMS) and desorption electrospray ionization (DESI). It aims to characterize the cellular landscape and metabolic states in different liver cell types at single-cell resolution.

title: What's new in single-cell proteomics.
biological_context: Cancer research, biomarker discovery, developmental biology
main_goals: This paper provides a critical review of recent advances in the field of single-cell proteomics (SCP). It highlights advances in experimental design, including label-free and multiplexed methods, optimized sample preparation, and innovations in separation techniques.

title: Biomarkers and prognostic factors of PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor-based therapy in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: The review summarizes the latest advancements in biomarkers and prognostic factors of PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor-based therapy in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma. It covers PD-L1 expression, tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes, genomic characteristics, clinical features, laboratory parameters, imaging techniques, liquid biopsy, and the gut microbiome.

title: A systematic evaluation of computational methods for cell segmentation.
biological_context: Cell nuclei and whole cell segmentation
main_goals: The paper systematically evaluates the performance of 18 segmentation methods for cell nuclei and whole cell segmentation. It identifies factors influencing segmentation performances and provides guidelines for choosing optimal methods. Seggal, an online resource for pre-trained segmentation models, is developed.

title: Piscis: a novel loss estimator of the F1 score enables accurate spot detection in fluorescence microscopy images via deep learning.
biological_context: RNA FISH images representing multiple cell types
main_goals: The paper presents Piscis, a fully automatic deep learning algorithm for spot detection trained using the SmoothF1 loss. This loss function approximates the F1 score to directly penalize false positives and false negatives. Piscis outperforms other state-of-the-art spot detection methods, enabling accurate, high-throughput analysis of RNA FISH-derived imaging data without the need for manual parameter tuning.

title: Chemokine expression profile of an innate granuloma.
biological_context: Chromobacterium violaceum infection in mouse liver
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the chemokines involved in directing immune cells to form granulomas in the liver in response to Chromobacterium violaceum infection, using spatial transcriptomics. It also investigates the role of CCR2 in macrophage recruitment and granuloma formation.

title: PCP Auto Count: A Novel Fiji/ImageJ plug-in for automated quantification of planar cell polarity and cell counting.
biological_context: Mouse inner ear sensory epithelia (cochleae and utricles), Drosophila ommatidia, mouse ependymal cells, and mouse radial progenitors.
main_goals: The paper introduces a Fiji/ImageJ plug-in called PCP Auto Count (PCPA) for automated cell counting and planar cell polarity data collection. PCPA analyzes binary images and identifies "chunks" of white pixels that contain "caves" of infiltrated black pixels. The tool is validated on various tissues and species, demonstrating robust accuracy in cell counting and PCP angle measurements.

title: Technical optimization of spatially resolved single-cell transcriptomic datasets to study clinical liver disease.
main_goals: The study aims to establish important aspects of tissue handling, data processing, and downstream analyses for biobanked liver samples using spatial transcriptomics and snRNAseq. It investigates the impact of tissue preservation on transcriptomic data and compares cell-cell interactions predicted from snRNAseq data with those identified using spatial transcriptomics. The study provides a framework for generating spatially resolved, single cell datasets to study gene expression and cell-cell interactions in clinical liver disease.

title: Myeloid-Mas Signaling Modulates Pathogenic Crosstalk among MYC<sup>+</sup>CD63<sup>+</sup> Endothelial Cells, MMP12<sup>+</sup> Macrophages, and Monocytes in Acetaminophen-Induced Liver Injury.
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the microenvironment in acetaminophen-induced liver injury (AILI) using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and intravital imaging. It identifies reciprocal cellular communication among specific cell types, maintained by enhanced glycolysis and the NF-κB/TNF-α signaling pathway. The study also validates the findings in samples from patients with acute liver failure, demonstrating clinical relevance.

title: Cross comparison representation learning for semi-supervised segmentation of cellular nuclei in immunofluorescence staining.
main_goals: The paper proposes a novel semi-supervised cell segmentation algorithm for immunofluorescence-stained cell image datasets (ISC), utilizing a mean-teacher semi-supervised learning framework. It includes a cross comparison representation learning block to enhance the teacher-student model comparison and suggests a new network, the Multi Pooling Layer Attention Dense Network (MPAD-Net), serving as the backbone of the student model to augment segmentation accuracy.

title: Non-invasive estimation of atrial fibrillation driver position using long-short term memory neural networks and body surface potentials.
main_goals: The paper proposes a method to locate AF drivers as a supervised classification problem using a hybrid convolutional-recurrent network. It utilizes labeled realistic computerized AF models and body surface potentials to train and evaluate the network. The goal is to improve AF diagnosis and treatment by locating AF drivers non-invasively.

title: TISSUE: uncertainty-calibrated prediction of single-cell spatial transcriptomics improves downstream analyses.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces TISSUE, a framework for estimating uncertainty for spatial gene expression predictions. It provides well-calibrated prediction intervals and improves downstream inference tasks such as differential gene expression analysis, clustering, and supervised learning. The method is applied to a MERFISH dataset to identify subtypes within the neural stem cell lineage.

title: Residual ANTXR1+ myofibroblasts after chemotherapy inhibit anti-tumor immunity via YAP1 signaling pathway.
main_goals: The study investigates the impact of chemotherapy on CAF populations in HGSOC. It aims to identify CAF populations affected by chemotherapy and determine their role in anti-tumor immunity. The study demonstrates that ECM-myCAF reduces CD8+ T-cell cytotoxicity through a YAP1-dependent mechanism.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals alterations in perivascular macrophage lipid metabolism in the onset of Wooden Breast myopathy in broiler chickens.
biological_context: Wooden Breast myopathy in broiler chickens
main_goals: This study aims to use spatial transcriptomics to characterize the cell-type-specific expression profile associated with the microscopic features observed in Wooden Breast myopathy. The study identified cell-type-specific gene expression patterns in lipid laden macrophages, unaffected myofibers, myositis and vasculature in broiler chickens.

title: The Fibroblast Landscape in Stomach Carcinogenesis.
main_goals: This review summarizes and discusses efforts to study the fibroblast components in human stomach from normal to metaplasia, dysplasia, and cancer. It highlights the heterogeneity and plasticity of fibroblast populations during stomach carcinogenesis and their contribution to the carcinogenic microenvironment.

title: Cell-Specific Targeting of the Endothelium in the Cardiorenal Syndrome.
main_goals: The paper discusses the role of the vascular endothelium in cardiorenal syndrome and highlights the potential of cell-specific targeting of viral vectors for gene therapy to treat heart and kidney diseases, aiming to improve treatment resistance and reduce residual risk for disease progression.

title: SST-editing: in silico spatial transcriptomic editing at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The paper proposes In Silico Spatial Transcriptomic editing that enables gene expression-guided editing of immunofluorescence images. It trains a GAN-based approach using cell-level spatial transcriptomics data from normal and tumor tissue slides. The goal is to simulate cellular state transitions by feeding edited gene expression levels to trained models, modelling the transition from tumor to normal tissue samples.

title: Tumoral and stromal hMENA isoforms impact tertiary lymphoid structure localization in lung cancer and predict immune checkpoint blockade response in patients with cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates how hMENA isoforms in tumor cells and CAFs relate to TLS presence, localization and impact on patient outcomes and ICB response in NSCLC. Findings indicate that hMENA isoforms in NSCLC cells and CAFs affect TLS regulation, fibronectin production, and CXCL13 secretion. The hMENA isoform pattern, fibronectin, and LTβR expression predict ICB response in tumors with TLS.

title: Identification of the key DNA damage response genes for predicting immunotherapy and chemotherapy efficacy in lung adenocarcinoma based on bulk, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aims to identify key DNA damage response (DDR) genes that predict immunotherapy and chemotherapy efficacy in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD). It utilizes bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics data to isolate EGLN3 as a crucial DDR gene and assess its spatial distribution and association with drug resistance.

title: Spectral Data Processing for Field-Scale Soil Organic Carbon Monitoring.
main_goals: The study aims to evaluate the potential of spectral on-the-go proximal measurements for spatial-temporal soil organic carbon (SOC) monitoring. Partial least squares regression models were built based on the spectral laboratory and field data collected with two spectrometers. Correction of the field data based on the laboratory data was done by testing linear transformation, piecewise direct standardization, and external parameter orthogonalization (EPO).

title: Leveraging Remote Sensing Data for Yield Prediction with Deep Transfer Learning.
biological_context: Soybean yield prediction in US and Argentina
main_goals: This study examines the use of transfer learning for yield prediction, where the data preprocessing towards histograms is unique. It presents a deep transfer learning framework for yield prediction and demonstrates its successful application to transfer knowledge gained from US soybean yield prediction to soybean yield prediction within Argentina. The study improves transfer learning by applying several transfer learning techniques, such as L2-SP, BSS, and layer freezing.

title: vissE: a versatile tool to identify and visualise higher-order molecular phenotypes from functional enrichment analysis.
main_goals: The paper introduces vissE, a network-based analysis and visualisation tool that organises information into semantic categories. It aims to provide a comprehensive view of the biological system and enhance existing gene-set enrichment and pathway analysis workflows. VissE's versatility is demonstrated by applying it to bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics data.

title: Normalized Spatial Autocorrelation in Ultrasound B-Mode Imaging for Point-Scatterer Detection.
main_goals: The paper proposes a normalized spatial autocorrelation method (NSACB) for point-scatterer detection in ultrasound B-mode imaging. It aims to address the issues of speckle noise and insufficient spatial resolution. The method is validated through simulations and in vitro experiments, demonstrating improved lateral resolution and reduced sidelobe levels compared to other methods.

title: ggPlantmap: an open-source R package for the creation of informative and quantitative ggplot maps derived from plant images.
main_goals: The paper introduces 'ggPlantmap', an open-source R package for creating ggplot representative maps from plant images. It aims to provide an easy and user-friendly method for plant scientists to visualize their spatial quantitative data and customize eFP-like viewers tailored to their experimental data. The package is built in R and accessible even to users with minimal R programming experience.

title: Harnessing axonal transport to map reward circuitry: Differing brain-wide projections from medial forebrain domains.
main_goals: The paper maps projections of medial forebrain domains by injecting MnCl2 into the anterior cingulate area (ACA) or infralimbic/prelimbic (IL/PL) of medial forebrain and then imaging the projections using manganese-enhanced MRI (MEMRI) and microscopy. The study aims to identify differences in distal accumulation between injection sites, particularly in the hypothalamus.

title: Spatial proteomics of ER tubules reveals CLMN, an ER-actin tether at focal adhesions that promotes cell migration.
main_goals: The paper maps the proteomic landscape of the human ER and nuclear envelope using TurboID-based proximity labeling. It identifies Calmin (CLMN) as an ER-actin tether that localizes to focal adhesions and regulates cell migration. The study describes a non-canonical mechanism by which ER tubules engage actin to regulate cell migration.

title: RECCIPE: A new framework assessing localized cell-cell interaction on gene expression in multicellular ST data.
main_goals: The paper introduces RECCIPE, a new method for identifying cell signaling interactions across multiple cell types in spatial transcriptomic data. RECCIPE integrates gene expression data, spatial information and cell type composition in a multivariate regression framework. The method is shown to achieve high accuracy in simulated datasets and provides new biological insights from real data obtained from a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease (AD).

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal neuron-astrocyte synergy in long-term memory.
biological_context: Mouse brain long-term memory formation in the basolateral amygdala
main_goals: The main goal was to illuminate the cellular and molecular architecture of the role of the basolateral amygdala in long-term memory using spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify memory-specific transcriptional signatures in subpopulations of neurons and astrocytes and to determine how neurons interact with astrocytes to encode long-term memory.

title: Unveiling inflammatory and prehypertrophic cell populations as key contributors to knee cartilage degeneration in osteoarthritis using multi-omics data integration.
biological_context: Osteoarthritis in human knee articular cartilage
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemistry staining', 'quantitative real-time PCR', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'genome-wide association studies']
main_goals: The study aims to identify and characterize OA-critical cell populations in human knee articular cartilage using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified novel chondrocyte populations and marker genes and validated them with other omics data. It also highlights specific cell populations as potential therapeutic targets and suggests their potential for patient stratification in clinical trials.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals that PTPRG activates the m<sup>6</sup>A methyltransferase VIRMA to block mitophagy-mediated neuronal death in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the mechanism of neuronal death in Alzheimer's disease by using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. It identifies that microglia subpopulation Mic_PTPRG can communicate with neurons and cause them to express PTPRG, which activates the m<sup>6</sup>A methyltransferase VIRMA to block mitophagy-mediated neuronal death.

title: The cycling and aging mouse female reproductive tract at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The study systematically characterized morphological and gene expression changes occurring in the mouse female reproductive tract during the estrous cycle, decidualization, and aging using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals the role of fibroblasts in FRT remodeling and suggests a model wherein recurrent FRT remodeling leads to fibrosis and chronic inflammation during aging. The study provides detail into how estrus, pregnancy, and aging shape the organs of the female reproductive tract.

title: Integrating spatial and single-cell transcriptomics to characterize the molecular and cellular architecture of the ischemic mouse brain.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the molecular and spatial characteristics of nonneuronal cells and interactions between cell types in the ischemic brain. It uses spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to identify gene expression profiles and cell communication pathways in the peri-infarct area of a murine stroke model. The study identifies Lgals9 as a potential treatment target.

title: Spatially contrastive variational autoencoder for deciphering tissue heterogeneity from spatially resolved transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper presents a novel contrastive learning framework, SPAtially Contrastive variational AutoEncoder (SpaCAE), for fine-grained tissue structure detection from spatially resolved transcriptomics data. SpaCAE contrasts transcriptomic signals of each spot and its spatial neighbors to achieve this goal. The method also provides a graph deconvolutional decoder to address the smoothing effect of local spatial structure on expression's self-supervised learning.

title: PI3K/mTOR is a therapeutically targetable genetic dependency in diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma.
main_goals: The study identifies a therapeutic combinational strategy for DIPG by targeting the PI3K/mTOR pathway and overcoming resistance mechanisms. It uses paxalisib in combination with metformin and enzastaurin to extend survival in orthotopic models. Spatial transcriptomics and ATAC-Seq were used to assess therapeutic adaptation, identifying changes in myelination and tumor immune microenvironment crosstalk.

title: Resolving the heterogeneous tumour microenvironment in cardiac myxoma through single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Visium CytAssist spatial transcriptomic (ST) assays']
main_goals: The study aims to dissect the tumor microenvironment (TME) in cardiac myxoma (CM) at single-cell and spatial resolution using single-cell transcriptomic sequencing and spatial transcriptomic assays. The goals include understanding the differentiation of myxoma tumor cells and advancing the understanding of the TME in CM to promote the development of medical therapies.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals heterogeneity of histological subtypes between lepidic and acinar lung adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the heterogeneity of histological subtypes in early-stage lung adenocarcinoma using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. They identified signature gene profiles for lepidic and acinar subtypes and investigated the relationship between CD8+ T cells and PD-L1 expression in tumor endothelial cells.

title: Spatial and single-cell analyses uncover links between ALKBH1 and tumor-associated macrophages in gastric cancer.
main_goals: This study explores the clinical and pathological relevance of ALKBH1 in gastric cancer, its impact on the tumor immune microenvironment, and its potential for precision oncology. They identified ALKBH1 as a potential diagnostic biomarker, linked elevated ALKBH1 expression to macrophage infiltration, and correlated ALKBH1 inactivation with sensitivity to small-molecule drugs.

title: Unsupervised machine learning combined with 4D scanning transmission electron microscopy for bimodal nanostructural analysis.
main_goals: The paper combines unsupervised machine learning techniques with 4D-STEM for crystal structure analysis at nanometer resolution. It develops software scripts for data preprocessing, NMF, and hierarchical clustering, incorporating knowledge of electron diffraction and STEM imaging. The method is applied to analyze high-pressure-annealed metallic glass, revealing an amorphous matrix and crystalline precipitates.

title: Multiplex protein imaging in tumour biology.
main_goals: This review discusses the use of multiplex protein imaging methods to study tumour biology, ongoing attempts to combine these approaches with other forms of spatial omics, and highlights challenges in the field.

title: The Web-Based Portal SpatialTME Integrates Histological Images with Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics to Explore the Tumor Microenvironment.
main_goals: The paper presents a computational pipeline to analyze spatial transcriptomics data, delineate the spatial structure of the tumor microenvironment, and construct a user-friendly database called SpatialTME. The pipeline performs differential gene expression analysis, cellular deconvolution, cell type-specific gene expression profiling, and cell-cell interaction analysis. The SpatialTME database provides search, visualization, and downloadable results for exploring the tumor microenvironment.

title: Biomarker Identification in Liver Cancers Using Desorption Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry (DESI-MS) Imaging: An Approach for Spatially Resolved Metabolomics.
main_goals: The paper describes a detailed protocol for using DESI-MS imaging on liver cancer samples to distinguish malignant lesions from adjacent normal liver tissue. The goal is to identify new biomarkers of malignancy using spatially resolved metabolomics.

title: A Galectin-9-Driven CD11c<sup>high</sup> Decidual Macrophage Subset Suppresses Uterine Vascular Remodeling in Preeclampsia.
main_goals: The study aims to identify immune cell subsets associated with preeclampsia and determine the underlying regulatory mechanisms of a CD11c<sup>high</sup> subpopulation of decidual macrophages (dMφ) in preeclampsia. It also aims to determine the value of circulating galectin-9 in predicting preeclampsia.

title: Characterization of the Nucleus Pulposus Progenitor Cells via Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aimed to generate a spatially resolved transcriptional atlas of the mouse intervertebral disc (IVD) using the 10x Genomics Visium platform. The atlas was used to characterize nucleus pulposus progenitor cells (NPPCs) and their spatial distribution within the IVD. The study also aimed to validate or refute previous findings regarding specific NPPC markers like Tie2.

title: Expanding the coverage of spatial proteomics: a machine learning approach.
main_goals: The paper presents an efficient machine learning method to choose a minimal predictive subset of markers that allows the prediction of full images for a much larger set of markers in spatial proteomics. It demonstrates that the approach outperforms previous methods for predicting cell-level protein composition and selects a marker set enabling prediction of a larger set than could be measured concurrently.

title: CIRI-Deep Enables Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Circular RNAs with Deep Learning.
main_goals: The paper presents CIRI-deep, a deep learning model for predicting circRNA regulation on diverse RNA-seq data, including single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data. CIRI-deep enables various circRNA analyses, such as cluster- or region-specific circRNA detection, BSJ ratio map visualization, and trans and cis feature importance evaluation. The adaptability of CIRI-deep extends to all major types of RNA-seq datasets, broadening the horizons of circRNA research.

title: Machine learning enables non-Gaussian investigation of changes to peripheral nerves related to electrical stimulation.
main_goals: This study uses machine learning to analyze histological samples of the sciatic nerve in rats after electrical stimulation. They use convolutional neural networks and support vector machines for cell segmentation and analysis. The study highlights the efficacy of machine learning in nerve measurement and identifies anatomical changes even at safe stimulation levels.

title: An atlas of cells in the human tonsil.
main_goals: The study generated an atlas of the human tonsil composed of >556,000 cells profiled across five different data modalities. It identified 121 cell types and states, defined developmental trajectories, and enabled an understanding of the functional units of the tonsil. The atlas was used to annotate cells from B cell-derived mantle cell lymphomas, linking transcriptional heterogeneity to normal B cell differentiation states of the human tonsil.

title: Spatial metabolome of biosynthesis and metabolism in Cyclocarya paliurus leaves.
main_goals: The study aims to obtain the spatial distribution information of metabolites in the leaves of Cyclocarya paliurus using DESI-MSI and non-targeted metabolomics. It analyzes the changes of metabolites in C. paliurus and identifies the main pathways for biosynthesis of flavonoid precursor.

title: Toolkit for mapping the clonal landscape of tumor-infiltrating B cells.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of existing and future techniques for comprehensive analysis of clonal B cell populations in the tumor microenvironment. It summarizes current applications for B cell studies and proposes promising future directions in advancing B cells exploration, focusing on single-cell and spatial omics methods, B cell specificity identification, and deep B cell receptor repertoire profiling.

title: Spatial Pathomics Toolkit for Quantitative Analysis of Podocyte Nuclei with Histology and Spatial Transcriptomics Data in Renal Pathology.
main_goals: This paper introduces the Spatial Pathomics Toolkit (SPT) for quantitative analysis of podocyte nuclei with histology and spatial transcriptomics data. The toolkit enables precise identification of podocyte nuclei, extracts a comprehensive array of quantitative features, and facilitates robust statistical analyses. The SPT's ability to unravel spatial information inherent to podocyte distribution is demonstrated, shedding light on spatial patterns associated with glomerular injury.

title: Eosinophils Instance Object Segmentation on Whole Slide Imaging Using Multi-label Circle Representation.
main_goals: The paper proposes a multi-label CircleSnake model for instance segmentation of eosinophils. It extends the original CircleSnake model to handle multi-label scenarios. The model is compared to Mask R-CNN and DeepSnake, showing improved average precision.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Identifies LPC(18:0) and LPA(18:1) in Advanced Atheroma With Translation to Plasma for Cardiovascular Risk Estimation.
biological_context: Atherosclerosis development in murine and human aortas and human plasma.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify specific metabolic changes in plaque, media, adventitia, and cardiac tissue between control and atherosclerotic murine aortas in a spatially resolved manner. Second, it assessed the translatability of these changes to human tissue and plasma for cardiovascular risk estimation. The study identified plaque-progression lipids LPC(18:0) and LPA(18:1) in human plasma, which reflect cardiovascular risk.

title: Spatial normalization for voxel-based lesion symptom mapping: impact of registration approaches.
main_goals: The paper compares four registration approaches (affine, nonlinear, nonlinear with cost function masking, and enantiomorphic registration) commonly used in voxel-based lesion symptom mapping (VLSM) pipelines. The evaluation is based on the analysis of statistical relations of brain voxels and regions with follow-up modified Rankin Scale (mRS) values in stroke patients. The study investigates the impact of these different registration methods on downstream VLSM statistics.

title: Editorial: Single-cell and spatial-omics in delineating immune-related diseases.
main_goals: The paper is an editorial focused on single-cell and spatial-omics in delineating immune-related diseases.

title: Effect of aging on the human myometrium at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The study aims to construct a cellular atlas of the aging myometrium and investigate the changes in cell subpopulations, gene expression, and cell-to-cell communication associated with aging. The findings contribute to a better understanding of the complications faced by older individuals during pregnancy and labor.

title: Unveiling the hidden role of disulfidptosis in kidney renal clear cell carcinoma: a prognostic signature for personalized treatment.
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate disulfidptosis-related biomarkers for KIRC prognosis prediction and individualized treatment. A DRPS prognostic model with four features (CHAC1, COL7A1, FOXM1, SHOX2) was constructed and validated. The model was used to explore tumor immune microenvironment, genetic drivers, drug sensitivity, and immunotherapy response according to DRPS risk stratification.

title: Placenta accreta spectrum disorder at single-cell resolution: a loss of boundary limits in the decidua and endothelium.
main_goals: The study aimed to gain insights into placenta accreta spectrum disorder by using single-cell and spatially resolved transcriptomics to characterize cellular heterogeneity at the maternal-fetal interface. The research identified transcriptional and protein changes in the stroma that shift the etiologic explanation away from invasive trophoblast to loss of boundary limits in the decidua.

title: Caveats in Interpretation of Molecular Diagnostics in Heart Allografts.
main_goals: This paper reviews the limitations and caveats of using molecular diagnostics to distinguish between injury, T cell-mediated rejection, or antibody-mediated rejection in heart allograft biopsies. It highlights discrepancies between molecular diagnostic classifications and histologic diagnoses, and calls for better molecular methods and more rigorous validation studies, ideally incorporating spatial transcriptomics.

title: A call for a unified and multimodal definition of cellular identity in the enteric nervous system.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential Gene Expression', 'Co-expression Analysis', 'Correlation Analysis', 'Data Integration', 'Label Transfer', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The paper compares different approaches for analyzing ENS datasets, highlighting discrepancies and emphasizing the need for multimodal validation. It calls for incorporating innovative technologies like multiplexed imaging, electrophysiology, spatial transcriptomics, and comprehensive profiling of other omics layers to achieve a comprehensive understanding of enteric neuron identity.

title: Copper drives remodeling of metabolic state and progression of clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
main_goals: The paper investigates the role of copper in metabolic remodeling and progression of clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC). It establishes that copper drives coordinated metabolic changes in bioenergy, biosynthesis, and redox homeostasis, promoting tumor growth and progression. The study also identifies novel vulnerabilities with potential for therapeutic interventions in ccRCC.

title: Applicability of Spatial Technology in Cancer Research.
main_goals: This review explores spatial mapping technologies in cancer research, highlighting their crucial role in understanding the complexities of the tumor microenvironment (TME). It examines cutting-edge spatial mapping technologies, categorizing them into capture-, imaging-, and antibody-based approaches, and discusses their advantages and disadvantages.

title: Mapping cancer biology in space: applications and perspectives on spatial omics for oncology.
main_goals: This review addresses spatial technologies that delineate the omics profile in a spatial context, novel findings discovered via spatial technologies in oncology, and suggests perspectives regarding therapeutic approaches and further technological developments.

title: Translatome profiling reveals Itih4 as a novel smooth muscle cell-specific gene in atherosclerosis.
main_goals: The main goal was to profile smooth muscle cell (SMC)-specific gene expression directly from tissue in the context of atherosclerosis using translating ribosome affinity purification sequencing (TRAP-seq). They identified Itih4 as a novel SMC-expressed gene in atherosclerotic plaques. The study generated an SMC-specific TRAP mouse line to study atherosclerosis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveal a transcriptomic atlas of adult human spinal cord.
main_goals: The study aimed to classify spinal cord neurons into subclusters, determine their spatial distribution, and compare the human findings with mouse data. It also explored sex differences in spinal neuronal subclusters and examined interactions between DRG and spinal cord neuronal subclusters. The results provide a resource for future research on spinal cord physiology and diseases.

title: Mosaic loss of Y chromosome is associated with aging and epithelial injury in chronic kidney disease.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the presence and impact of mosaic loss of Y chromosome (LOY) in the kidney in the context of aging and chronic kidney disease. It utilizes single-cell RNA and ATAC sequencing, as well as spatial transcriptomics, to link LOY with epithelial injury, pro-inflammatory profiles, and future kidney function decline. The study also hypothesizes LOY as a marker of increased DNA damage and cellular senescence in other tissues.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals that metabolic characteristics define the tumor immunosuppression microenvironment via iCAF transformation in oral squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aims to clarify the relationship between different metabolic regions and the tumor immune microenvironment in OSCC using single cell and spatial transcriptomics. It delineates the coordinate work axis of epithelial cells-iCAFs-Tregs in OSCC and highlights potential targets for therapy. The study found that fibroblasts transform into iCAFs in hypermetabolic regions, leading to Treg infiltration and increased TGF-β secretion, promoting an immunosuppressive microenvironment.

title: Imaging and spatial omics of kidney injury: significance, challenges, advances and perspectives.
main_goals: This review discusses recent advances in renal imaging and omics studies for understanding kidney injury. It highlights the challenges in creating a comprehensive cellular and molecular atlas and the progress being made in various directions, including constructing a high-resolution structural atlas and systematic spatially resolved molecular atlas. The review emphasizes the need for multimodal integration technologies of imaging and omics to systematically describe nephropathy mechanisms.

title: Molecular features of luminal breast cancer defined through spatial and single-cell transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aimed to profile spatially resolved cell populations within estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer patient-derived xenografts (PDXs) using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. They investigated the role of these populations in estrogen-dependent tumor growth and assessed the translational implications by analyzing clinical outcomes in publicly available cohorts. The study identified a proliferative cell population as a causative feature of luminal B breast cancer, contributing to its aggressive behaviors.

title: Protocol for acquiring high-quality fresh mouse lung spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper presents a protocol for acquiring high-quality fresh mouse lung spatial transcriptomics data. It describes steps for lung perfusion, acquiring frozen slices, collecting cDNA from lung sections, and data analysis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics in a Case of Follicular Thyroid Carcinoma Reveals Clone-Specific Dysregulation of Genes Regulating Extracellular Matrix in the Invading Front.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Evolutionary Tree Reconstruction']
main_goals: The main goal of this study is to detail the spatial transcriptional landscape of an FTC and compare the invasive front with the central core tumor areas. It aims to identify the molecular signals orchestrating the tumor's ability to invade the capsule and blood vessels. The study also reconstructs the evolutionary tree to identify the invasive clones.

title: SPANN: annotating single-cell resolution spatial transcriptome data with scRNA-seq data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-type annotation']
main_goals: The paper proposes SPANN, an annotation method for spatial transcriptome data, to transfer cell-type labels from scRNA-seq data and discover novel cells from spatial data. SPANN detects novel cells while maintaining high annotation accuracy and finds a mapping between spatial transcriptome samples and RNA data prototypes for cell-type-level alignment. Comprehensive experiments demonstrate SPANN's capabilities in annotating known cell types and discovering novel cell states.

title: Glomerular spatial transcriptomics of IgA nephropathy according to the presence of mesangial proliferation.
main_goals: The study investigates gene expression profiles of IgAN glomeruli based on the presence of mesangial proliferation using spatial transcriptomic profiling. It aims to identify differentially expressed genes between different IgAN subtypes and controls. The results may contribute to understanding structure-specific pathophysiology and molecular changes in IgAN.

title: Gene panel selection for targeted spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces gpsFISH, a computational method for gene selection in targeted spatial transcriptomics. It optimizes the detection of known cell types by modeling and adjusting for platform effects, outperforming existing methods. The method also incorporates cell type hierarchies and custom gene preferences.

title: Tumor necrosis factor-related apoptosis-inducing ligand (TRAIL) deletion in myeloid cells augments cholestatic liver injury.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of TRAIL from myeloid cells in cholestatic liver injury in mice. The main finding is that TRAIL from myeloid cells restrains a subset of ductular reactive cells, limiting liver inflammation and fibrosis. The study suggests that reprogramming macrophages to express TRAIL may be beneficial in cholestasis.

title: Contrastive learning-based histopathological features infer molecular subtypes and clinical outcomes of breast cancer from unannotated whole slide images.
main_goals: This paper proposes a weakly supervised contrastive learning framework to predict molecular subtypes and clinical outcomes in breast cancer. The framework pretrains on unlabeled patches from whole slide images, extracts patch-level features, and aggregates them using a gated attention mechanism. The model's predictive power is validated across multiple breast cancer cohorts for gene expression, molecular subtypes, recurrence events, and drug responses.

title: MyoV: a deep learning-based tool for the automated quantification of muscle fibers.
biological_context: Muscle fiber analysis in biomedical research and meat production
main_goals: The paper introduces MyoV, an automated image segmentation and quantification tool for muscle fibers. It utilizes deep learning with convolutional neural networks and a residual network and feature pyramid network as the backbone. The tool is designed to process muscle fibers with different sizes and ages, surpassing manual methods and other algorithms.

title: scCorrector: a robust method for integrating multi-study single-cell data.
main_goals: The paper proposes scCorrector, a variational autoencoder-based model, to integrate single-cell data from different studies into a common space using Study Specific Adaptive Normalization. It achieves competitive and robust performance compared to state-of-the-art methods under various circumstances and transfers information between different studies by integrating single-cell data and spatial data. scCorrector can efficiently integrate multi-study single-cell datasets, thereby providing broad opportunities to tackle challenges emerging from noisy resources.

title: In situ tissue profile of rat trigeminal nerve in trigeminal neuralgia using spatial transcriptome sequencing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Dimension Reduction', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The goal of this study was to investigate the interactions between different types of cells in TN, particularly the impact and intrinsic mechanism of demyelination on the trigeminal ganglion, and to identify new important target genes and regulatory pathways in TN. This study provides spatial transcriptomics sequencing data on TN, reveals new markers, and redefines the relationship between the ganglion and myelin sheath.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity affects trastuzumab response and survival in HER2-positive advanced gastric cancer.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the impact of metabolic heterogeneity on trastuzumab treatment efficacy in HER2-positive advanced gastric cancer. The work reveals that tumor metabolic heterogeneity is associated with prognosis and trastuzumab response based on tissue metabolomics.

title: Integration tools for scRNA-seq data and spatial transcriptomics sequencing data.
main_goals: This review article presents a compilation of 19 integration methods for scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to serve as a comprehensive reference for researchers to select suitable integration methods for their specific research inquiries. The article classifies the methods into two main groups and emphasizes the incorporation of High Variance Genes in annotating various technologies.

title: Clinically relevant molecular hallmarks of PFA ependymomas display intratumoral heterogeneity and correlate with tumor morphology.
biological_context: Posterior fossa type A (PF-EPN-A, PFA) ependymoma
main_goals: The study aimed to determine molecular differences in morphologically different areas of PF-EPN-A ependymomas and to understand their clinical significance. The study revealed intratumoral heterogeneity with clinical implications.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of the mouse brain following chronic social defeat stress.
biological_context: Mouse brain following chronic social defeat stress
main_goals: This study aims to comprehensively compare the transcriptional changes in multiple brain regions following chronic social defeat stress (CSDS) using spatial transcriptomics (ST). The study identified gene synchrony changes in different brain regions, the impact of CSDS on inhibitory neurons and synaptic functions, and the pronounced transcriptional changes in specific brain regions (Hippocampus, Isocortex, and Amygdala) associated with depressive psychiatric disorders. The research provides insights into CSDS susceptibility at the ST level.

title: Urban water and electricity demand data for understanding climate change impacts on the water-energy nexus.
main_goals: The paper presents a dataset containing over a decade of monthly water and electricity consumption data for 46 major US cities, along with pre-processed climate data. This dataset is intended for studies on the relationship between the water-electricity demand nexus and local climate, and to evaluate the possible impacts of climate change on this nexus.

title: Targeting stroma and tumor, silencing galectin 1 treats orthotopic mouse hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: This study examines inhibiting galectin 1 (Gal1) as a treatment option for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The study demonstrates that Gal1 silencing has a promising potential for HCC treatment by inhibiting matrix formation and recognition of foreign antigen in CD45+ cell-enriched areas located at tumor-margin. It also increases immune cells and expands cytotoxic T cells within the tumor.

title: Spatial characterization of interface dermatitis in cutaneous lupus reveals novel chemokine ligand-receptor pairs that drive disease.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'digital spatial profiling (DSP)', 'Olink targeted proteomics']
main_goals: The study examines chemokine ligand-receptor pairs to understand the immunopathogenesis of cutaneous lupus erythematosus (CLE). Spatial transcriptomics and spatial proteomics were used to examine discreet locations within the tissue and map a pathway from keratinocyte injury to lymphocyte recruitment in CLE.

title: SORBET: Automated cell-neighborhood analysis of spatial transcriptomics or proteomics for interpretable sample classification via GNN.
biological_context: Response to immunotherapy, across different disease processes
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The paper introduces SORBET, a deep learning framework that leverages graph neural networks (GNN) for analyzing spatially resolved transcriptomics or proteomics data. SORBET predicts tissue phenotypes, such as response to immunotherapy, across different disease processes and technologies. The method facilitates understanding of the spatially-resolved biological mechanisms underlying the inferred phenotypes.

title: A spatial cell atlas of neuroblastoma reveals developmental, epigenetic and spatial axis of tumor heterogeneity.
data_modalities_used: ['sc/snRNA-seq', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'whole exome sequencing', 'DNA methylation profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: The study generates a comprehensive cell atlas of neuroblastoma tumors to characterize inter- and intra-tumoral heterogeneity. It integrates multiple omics datasets to identify malignant cell states, spatial compartmentalization, and signaling patterns. The atlas is shared through the Human Tumor Atlas Network Data Commons.

title: Aberrant activation of wound healing programs within the metastatic niche facilitates lung colonization by osteosarcoma cells.
main_goals: The purpose of this study is to identify metastasis-specific therapeutic vulnerabilities by delineating the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying osteosarcoma lung metastatic niche formation. The study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to characterize molecular changes induced within lung tissues by disseminated osteosarcoma cells and evaluate the ability of nintedanib to impair metastasis progression.

title: Spatially Resolved Transcriptomic Signatures of Hippocampal Subregions and Arc-Expressing Ensembles in Active Place Avoidance Memory.
main_goals: To measure gene expression changes in the dorsal hippocampus following the recall of active place avoidance (APA) memory using bulk RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify regionalized transcriptomic profiles and distinct IEG expressing spatial transcriptomic spots supporting APA memory recall.

title: U<sup>2</sup>-Net and ResNet50-Based Automatic Pipeline for Bacterial Colony Counting.
main_goals: The paper introduces an automatic pipeline for bacterial colony counting using image preprocessing, U2-Net segmentation, and ResNet50-based counting. The system includes an LED backlighting illumination platform and a novel image preprocessing algorithm. It aims to achieve high automation and accuracy in recognizing and counting single and multi-colony targets.

title: Active Compounds of Panax ginseng in the Improvement of Alzheimer's Disease and Application of Spatial Metabolomics.
main_goals: This paper reviews the composition of Panax ginseng, its mechanism of action, and its clinical application in improving Alzheimer's disease. It discusses the key molecular mechanisms and signaling pathways involved and the application of spatial metabolomics techniques.

title: Deciphering the Immune Microenvironment at the Forefront of Tumor Aggressiveness by Constructing a Regulatory Network with Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Data.
main_goals: This study develops a software pipeline (cIGRN) for constructing intercellular gene regulatory networks (IGRNs) by analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. The pipeline aims to reduce errors generated by single-cell communication analysis and increase the confidence of selected cell communication signals. The authors demonstrate the workflow on ER+ breast cancer, revealing signaling between malignant tumor cells and immune cells and identifying potential biomarkers.

title: Mapping three-dimensional intratumor proteomic heterogeneity in uterine serous carcinoma by multiregion microsampling.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'mass spectrometry', 'reverse phase protein arrays', 'RNA-sequencing', 'laser microdissection']
main_goals: The goal of this study was to provide a deeper view of the tumor microenvironment of uterine serous carcinoma through multi-region microsampling and quantitative proteomics. The study identified extensive three-dimensional heterogeneity within the USC tumor microenvironment, with disease-relevant biomarkers present in both the tumor and the stroma. These data underscore the critical need for upfront enrichment of cellular subpopulations from tissue specimens for spatial proteogenomic analysis.

title: An error correction strategy for image reconstruction by DNA sequencing microscopy.
main_goals: The paper introduces a method to correct errors in adjacency data arising from DNA microscopy, specifically addressing spurious crosslinks and fused nodes. The method leverages the principle that spatially close molecules should be connected to detect and correct errors, improving the accuracy of spatial reconstructions with lower data loss. The method is validated on simulated and experimental data.

title: A spatiotemporal molecular atlas of the ovulating mouse ovary.
biological_context: Mouse ovarian follicle maturation and ovulation
main_goals: This study uses spatiotemporal transcriptomics to map cell type- and ovulation stage-specific molecular programs during follicle maturation and ovulation in mice. It aims to provide insights into the cellular and molecular processes that regulate ovarian follicle maturation and ovulation. The ultimate goal is to advance therapeutic strategies in reproductive medicine.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis drives PET imaging of tight junction protein expression in pancreatic cancer theranostics.
main_goals: The study aims to identify and validate pancreatic cancer surface receptor targets for molecular imaging and theranostics using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The findings suggest claudin-4 as a potential theranostic target and develop a peptide-based molecular imaging agent targeting claudin-4.

title: Multi-Omics Reveals the Role of Osteopontin/Secreted Phosphoprotein 1 in Regulating Ovarian Aging.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the role of SPP1 in ovarian aging using multi-omics data analysis. It identifies SPP1 as a potential gene related to ovarian aging through spatial transcriptomic and single-cell RNA-sequencing analyses. The study also reveals associations between SPP1 and ITGAV, ITGB1, CD44, MMP3, and FN1.

title: Multi-omics data integration shines a light on the renal medulla.
main_goals: The paper highlights the use of multi-omics data integration to build a reference set of medullary tissue marker genes to define the medullary role in kidney function. It exemplifies the strength and utility of multi-omic data integration for characterizing molecular programs in the renal medulla.

title: Spatial transcriptomics data and analytical methods: An updated perspective.
main_goals: This review discusses spatial transcriptomics (ST) databases and deep-learning-based models for spatial transcriptome data analyses. It highlights their roles and future perspectives in biomedical applications. The review emphasizes the ongoing need to enhance these models for increased biological relevance.

title: Assembling spatial clustering framework for heterogeneous spatial transcriptomics data with GRAPHDeep.
main_goals: The paper presents GRAPHDeep, a spatial clustering framework for heterogeneous spatial transcriptomics data. It integrates graph deep learning modules and graph neural networks to find the most appropriate combination for each dataset. The method is compared with state-of-the-art algorithms to demonstrate its effectiveness.

title: Automatic 3D cell segmentation of fruit parenchyma tissue from X-ray micro CT images using deep learning.
biological_context: Apple and pear fruit parenchyma tissue
main_goals: The paper introduces a deep learning-based method for automatic 3D cell segmentation of fruit parenchyma tissue from X-ray micro-CT images. The model was trained and tested on apple and pear fruit tissue, demonstrating improved segmentation accuracy compared to a benchmark method. The proposed method aims to enable automatic quantification of 3D cell morphology from micro-CT data.

title: Deep spatial proteomics reveals region-specific features of severe COVID-19-related pulmonary injury.
main_goals: The study aims to generate a region-resolved proteomic atlas of hallmark pathological pulmonary structures in severe COVID-19-related lung injury. This is achieved by integrating histological examination, laser microdissection, and ultrasensitive proteomics to identify pathway dysregulations and region-specific enrichment of functional markers.

title: Spatial multi-omics: novel tools to study the complexity of cardiovascular diseases.
main_goals: This review focuses on recent advancements in spatial multi-omics technologies and data analysis approaches, highlighting strengths and weaknesses of various computational pipelines. It discusses advancements in both low- and high-resolution methods and their applications in cardiovascular disease research. The review aims to enhance translational cardiovascular research by facilitating the discovery of new findings.

title: The diversification of methods for studying cell-cell interactions and communication.
main_goals: This review explores recent progress in cell-cell interaction research and highlights the diversification of the next generation of tools. It emphasizes the rich ecosystem of tools for different applications and the invaluable discoveries they are enabling.

title: PROST: quantitative identification of spatially variable genes and domain detection in spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper introduces PROST, a framework for quantitative recognition of spatial transcriptomic patterns. It consists of quantitatively characterizing spatial variations in gene expression patterns through the PROST Index and unsupervised clustering of spatial domains via a self-attention mechanism. The framework aims to improve SVG identification and domain segmentation.

title: Artificial intelligence-based analysis of tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte spatial distribution for colorectal cancer prognosis.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate CD3 CT prognostic ability in patients with CRC by using AI technology to quantify the spatial distribution of CD3 + and CD8 + T cells. The fully automated deep learning-based workflow was devised to facilitate tissue segmentation and T-cells quantification in whole-slide images (WSIs). CD3 CT was confirmed as a stage-independent predictor for overall survival in CRC patients.

title: Study on the white frost formation mechanism during storage of Phyllanthus emblica Linn. fruit based on component analysis and spatial metabolomics.
main_goals: This study aims to reveal the material basis and formation mechanism of white frost on the surface of Phyllanthus emblica Linn. fruit (PEF) using component analysis and spatial metabolomics. The relationship between the surface white frost and the quality of PEF medicinal materials is investigated, providing valuable information for quality evaluation.

title: Energy preservation for skeletal muscles: Shenqi Fuzheng injection prevents tissue wasting and restores bioenergetic profiles in a mouse model of chemotherapy-induced cachexia.
data_modalities_used: ['transcriptomics', 'spatial metabolomics', 'gas chromatography-mass spectrometry', 'transmission electron microscopy', 'Seahorse live-cell metabolic analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of Shenqi Fuzheng injection (SQ) on muscle energy metabolism in a mouse model of chemotherapy-induced cachexia (CIC). It integrates transcriptomics, spatial metabolomics, gas chromatography-mass spectrometry, transmission electron microscopy, and Seahorse live-cell metabolic analysis to reveal the changes in genes and pathways related to energy metabolism. The study highlights SQ as a promising strategy for CIC management, emphasizing its ability to harmonize the homeostasis of the muscle bioenergetic profile.

title: Enhancing soil texture classification with multivariate scattering correction and residual neural networks using visible near-infrared spectra.
main_goals: The paper introduces a novel 11-class soil texture classification strategy combining Multiplicative Scatter Correction (MSC) with Residual Network (ResNet) models. The strategy is evaluated on the LUCAS dataset and demonstrates high classification accuracy. The paper also investigates the potential benefit of pre-categorization based on land cover type in enhancing accuracy.

title: Deciphering head and neck cancer microenvironment: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals human papillomavirus-associated differences.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: The study aimed to characterize the molecular features of primary and lymph node metastatic HNSCC tumors based on HPV status using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified HPV-associated differences in cellular composition and molecular alterations, focusing on PKM2 and the EPHA2 pathway.

title: Integrative analysis of disulfidptosis and immune microenvironment in hepatocellular carcinoma: a putative model and immunotherapeutic strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the landscape of disulfidptosis and the immune microenvironment of HCC cells by integrating bulk RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and single-cell RNA sequencing. The authors developed a novel model to predict the prognosis of patients with HCC based on disulfidptosis. They also explored possible targets for HCC treatment.

title: Investigative needle core biopsies for multi-omics in Glioblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial-transcriptomics', 'metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'phosphoproteomics', 'T-cell clonotype analysis', 'MHC Class I immunopeptidomics']
main_goals: The study investigates the feasibility and utility of using stereotactic needle core biopsies to generate multi-omics data for understanding the tumor microenvironment in glioblastoma patients. It aims to assess the quality of data obtained from these biopsies and evaluate their potential for evaluating treatment responses and understanding disease processes.

title: Decoding mTOR signalling heterogeneity in the tumour microenvironment using multiplexed imaging and graph convolutional networks.
main_goals: This study investigates mTOR signalling heterogeneity in colorectal tumours using multiplexed imaging and graph convolutional networks. It aims to understand how complex mTOR signalling in different tissue compartments influences patient prognosis. The study identifies predictive features of mTOR activity in immune cells and validates observations using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Assessment of mental workload across cognitive tasks using a passive brain-computer interface based on mean negative theta-band amplitudes.
main_goals: The paper introduces a novel algorithm to extract frontal theta oscillations from EEG recordings to detect mental workload across different cognitive tasks. It compares the performance of the proposed algorithm with a previous approach based on Filter Bank Common Spatial Patterns.

title: A Spatiotemporal Deep Learning Framework for Scalp EEG-Based Automated Pain Assessment in Children.
main_goals: The paper proposes a spatiotemporal deep learning framework (STPA-Net) for scalp EEG-based automated pain assessment in children. It integrates spatial and temporal information using a transformer-based network. The proposed method achieves superior performance with a subject-independent accuracy of 87.83% for pain recognition.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic and Metabolomic Landscapes of Oral Submucous Fibrosis-Derived Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma and its Tumor Microenvironment.
biological_context: Oral Submucous Fibrosis-Derived Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma and its Tumor Microenvironment
main_goals: The study aims to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying the malignant transformation of OSCC from OSF by integrating spatial transcriptomics (ST) and spatial metabolomics (SM). It investigates the spatial location of cancer cells, fibroblasts, and immune cells, as well as the transcriptomic and metabolomic landscapes in OSF-derived OSCC tissues. The study also aims to reveal metabolic reprogramming and cell-cell interactions in the tumor microenvironment.

title: Multiomics characterization of pyroptosis in the tumor microenvironment and therapeutic relevance in metastatic melanoma.
main_goals: The paper presents a computational model (PScore) to assess pyroptosis status in melanoma samples. It investigates the prognostic power of PScore and its potential as a predictive marker of immunotherapy efficacy. The study also explores the association of PScore with tumor microenvironment characteristics, mutation status, and therapeutic efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade.

title: Decoder-seq enhances mRNA capture efficiency in spatial RNA sequencing.
biological_context: Mouse olfactory bulb, mouse hippocampus, human renal cell carcinoma
main_goals: The paper introduces Decoder-seq, a dendrimeric DNA coordinate barcoding design for spatial RNA sequencing, which offers both high sensitivity and high resolution. It improves the detection of lowly expressed olfactory receptor genes in mouse olfactory bulbs and enables the construction of a spatial single-cell atlas of the mouse hippocampus. The method is also applied to dissect the heterogeneous tumor microenvironment in human renal cell carcinomas.

title: Understanding Spondyloarthritis Pathogenesis: The Promise of Single-Cell Profiling.
data_modalities_used: ['RNA-seq', 'single-cell profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'cytometry', 'fluorescent flow cytometry', 'mass cytometry', 'image-based cytometry', 'imaging mass cytometry', 'single-cell TCR-seq']
main_goals: This review outlines recent advancements and emerging trends in single-cell profiling studies in spondyloarthritis. It discusses the application of sequencing-based approaches for quantifying RNA, protein, or epigenetic modifications at single-cell resolution, as well as the use of fluorescent flow cytometry, mass cytometry, and image-based cytometry. It also addresses the challenges and future directions of single-cell profiling in spondyloarthritis research.

title: Spatial transcriptomic interrogation of the tumour-stroma boundary in a 3D engineered model of ameloblastoma.
biological_context: Ameloblastoma (benign epithelial tumour of the jawbone)
main_goals: This study investigates the stromal-specific effect on tumour behavior in a 3D engineered model of ameloblastoma using spatial transcriptomics. The study demonstrates that different stromal components (bone stroma vs. gingival fibroblast stroma) induce distinct gene expression changes in ameloblastoma cells, affecting oncogene expression and matrix remodeling, respectively. The findings highlight the importance of biologically relevant stroma in engineered tumour models.

title: Integration of Pan-Cancer Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Stromal Cell Features and Therapeutic Targets in Tumor Microenvironment.
main_goals: This study performs a pan-cancer analysis of stromal cells using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to uncover distinct features of stromal subsets. It identifies functional modules, spatial locations, and clinical and therapeutic relevance of these subsets across cancer types, aiming to provide a systematic view of heterogeneous stromal populations and suggest future therapeutic avenues.

title: Evaluating spatially variable gene detection methods for spatial transcriptomics data.
main_goals: The paper systematically evaluates a panel of popular SVG detection methods on spatial transcriptomics datasets. It addresses questions including whether different methods select a similar set of SVGs, how reliable is the reported statistical significance, how accurate and robust is each method, and how well the selected SVGs perform in downstream applications.

title: Identifying Spatial Co-occurrence in Healthy and InflAmed tissues (ISCHIA).
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The paper introduces ISCHIA, a computational framework for analyzing spatial co-occurrence of cell types and transcript species within spots in spatial transcriptomics data. It aims to reconstruct cellular networks by leveraging the inherent proximity of transcriptomes captured on spots. The framework is applied to analyze a Visium dataset of human ulcerative colitis patients, uncovering inflammation-induced cellular networks and ligand-receptor interactions.

title: Next-generation deconvolution of transcriptomic data to investigate the tumor microenvironment.
main_goals: This review describes state-of-the-art deconvolution methods (first-generation, second-generation, and spatial) for investigating the tumor microenvironment, discussing their strengths and limitations. It concludes with an outlook on the challenges that need to be overcome to unlock the full potential of next-generation deconvolution for oncology and the life sciences.

title: Single-cell multi-omics in the study of digestive system cancers.
main_goals: This article comprehensively reviews the advances of single-cell omics technology in the study of digestive system tumors. It analyzes and summarizes research cases, providing vital details on sequencing platforms, sample information, sampling methods, and key findings. The review also summarizes commonly used SCS platforms and their features, as well as the advantages of multi-omics technologies in combination and the development trends and prospects of the application of single-cell multi-omics technology in digestive system cancer research are prospected.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in endocrine research.
main_goals: This review provides an overview of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics technologies and discusses their strengths and limitations. It also summarizes the potential future applications of these technologies in the study of endocrine organs and their disorders.

title: Profibrotic Subsets of SPP1<sup>+</sup> Macrophages and POSTN<sup>+</sup> Fibroblasts Contribute to Fibrotic Scarring in Acne Keloidalis.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence staining', 'biopsy']
main_goals: To investigate the pathogenesis of acne keloidalis by applying bulk RNA sequencing, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to occipital scalp biopsy specimens of lesional and adjacent no-lesional skin in patients with clinically active disease. The study aimed to identify key cell populations and communication pathways involved in the fibrotic scarring process.

title: Mapping the single cell spatial immune landscapes of the melanoma microenvironment.
main_goals: This review summarizes the use of spatial imaging technologies to study the melanoma tumor microenvironment. It highlights the importance of spatial relationships between cells and their impact on immunotherapy responses. It also discusses the potential of these technologies for biomarker discovery and therapeutic development.

title: Biomarker discovery in acetaminophen hepatotoxicity: leveraging single-cell transcriptomics and mechanistic insight.
main_goals: This review discusses the use of omics approaches, including single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, for identifying novel biomarkers in acetaminophen-induced acute liver failure. It also relates mechanistic investigations in mouse models to the human APAP overdose pathophysiology to understand the progression of events and evaluate new biomarkers.

title: Unsupervised spatially embedded deep representation of spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper presents SEDR, a deep autoencoder coupled with a masked self-supervised learning mechanism, to construct a low-dimensional latent representation of gene expression and embed it with spatial information. SEDR achieved higher clustering performance and better scalability than existing methods. It can also impute and denoise gene expression.

title: Niche-DE: niche-differential gene expression analysis in spatial transcriptomics data identifies context-dependent cell-cell interactions.
main_goals: The paper proposes a new statistical procedure called niche-differential expression (niche-DE) analysis to identify cell-type-specific niche-associated genes. It also develops niche-LR, a method to reveal ligand-receptor signaling mechanisms that underlie niche-differential gene expression patterns. The methods are applicable to various spatial transcriptomics data resolutions.

title: Three-Dimensional Residual Neural Architecture Search for Ultrasonic Defect Detection.
main_goals: This study presents a deep-learning methodology using 3-D convolutional neural networks to detect defects in carbon fiber-reinforced polymer composites through volumetric ultrasonic testing data. A neural architecture search from a modified 3-D residual neural network search space was performed. Domain-specific augmentation methods were incorporated during training.

title: A guidebook of spatial transcriptomic technologies, data resources and analysis approaches.
main_goals: This review elaborates on the development of spatial transcriptomic technologies, marshals computational approaches to analyze spatial transcriptomic data, and discusses the potential of spatial multimodal omics for application in tumor tissue. It aims to guide current and future research on spatial transcriptomics by providing an overview of technologies, data resources, and analysis approaches.

title: HAMSAB diet ameliorates dysfunctional signaling in pancreatic islets in autoimmune diabetes.
biological_context: Autoimmune diabetes (Type 1 Diabetes) in NOD mice
main_goals: The study investigates the effects of a dietary supplement (HAMSAB) on pancreatic islets in non-obese diabetic (NOD) mice and patients with established T1D. Single-cell RNA sequencing was used to analyze islet cells from NOD mice fed an HAMSAB or control diet. The study aims to understand how HAMSAB affects immune-infiltrated islet cells and glucose homeostasis.

title: Leveraging spatial omics for the development of precision sarcoma treatments.
main_goals: This opinion article discusses advances in understanding the tumor microenvironment (TME) enabled by spatial omics technologies and explores how these technologies might advance the development of precision treatments for sarcoma, especially pediatric sarcoma. It focuses on the potential of spatial omics to improve treatment strategies for this rare and heterogeneous cancer.

title: Sfrp1 inhibits lung fibroblast invasion during transition to injury-induced myofibroblasts.
biological_context: Mouse lung regeneration, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed immunostainings', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'cell differentiation assays', 'invasion assays']
main_goals: The study reveals the convergence of spatially and transcriptionally distinct fibroblast lineages into transcriptionally uniform myofibroblasts and identifies SFRP1 as a modulator of TGFβ1-driven fibroblast phenotypes in fibrogenesis. It investigates fibroblast fates during mouse lung regeneration and validates findings in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis patient tissues.

title: Deep learning based automated left ventricle segmentation and flow quantification in 4D flow cardiac MRI.
main_goals: The paper develops and evaluates deep learning-based methods for left ventricle (LV) segmentation from 4D flow MRI. It compares five deep learning approaches and proposes feature fusion methods to integrate magnitude and velocity images. The goal is to achieve accurate automated LV segmentation and quantification of volumetric and hemodynamic LV parameters without requiring additional cine MRI acquisition.

title: Update on Biomarkers in Renal Cell Carcinoma.
main_goals: The review discusses the current state of biomarker research in renal cell carcinoma, focusing on the need for predictive biomarkers for immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy. It mentions the limitations of tumor-intrinsic features and highlights promising avenues like the microbiome, radiomics, and spatial transcriptomics.
